Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Theresa P
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a long weekend stay with my fiance. This was my first stay in this hotel, but not my first stay in Las Vegas. The price was right for our four night stay. I read several reviews stating issue with smokey rooms. I did not find that to be the case in our room. I loved the spaciousness of the rooms and the bathroom was very nice with a seperate vanity and sink outside of the bathroom. Was able to do my primping while my fiance showered and used the vanity in the bathroom. The one item that I was not crazy about was the shower head and the spray, but just a matter of preference. The hotel is off of the strip, but they do provide a free shuttle. It is within walking distance of the Palms Hotel and next door to the Gold Coast hotel. The table limits are cheaper at the Gold Coast (found a $3 min roulette table). The pool area was nice but if you are not out there by 10-11a then the chairs are few and far between. This should be no surprise as is the case with most hotel pools. Overall, I enjoyed our accomodations and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel staff nice & rooms comfy but old”
Reviews.Author: Gigi99762
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at the Rio All Suite Hotel from Feb 14-18, 2012. Check in staff was awesome, friendly and gave us a room with the view of the Palms. we checked in quickly, rode the elevator to our floor, walked a few hundred thousand miles (lol) to our suite. Smelled clean as soon as we opened the door. The bed was fluffy, checked under the sheets and mattress to see if there were any unwelcome guests, luckily none were found. Their was a separate vanity area with a sink, which my hubby was happy I had my own space and he had his own sink and space in the the bathroom. There was a fridge and a coffee pot, I think the coffee pods were 4 bucks a pop so we declined. There was also a fully stocked fridge under the TV in the stand that had beer and liquor, which we did try some, but the ones we took were never re-stocked. Housekeeping was good. There was a small etched window to the shower from the wall by the bed. That was funny and different. We tried to watch the show in the sky on a Thursday, but it never did start, we had drinks while we waited for a couple hours. The short entertainment we did see was the cocktail servers on the floor would get on this scary small stage and either sing or dance. The outfits were really skimpy and kind of outdated. I played video poker while the hubby played cards. He didn't have much luck there and played for about 4 hours. He said the pit boss was always going over to this native guy and giving him a hard time when the white guys were starting everything. Poor guy, got the short end of the stick. The guy was saying, I'm just trying to play poker and these guys don't want me here. Anyways, hubby didn't like the the unfairness, so he quit playing. We took the free shuttle to Harrah's/Bally's and would walk the strip during the day. When we would get back the Rio casino would be lound and crowded. Seemed to be a popular place at night although it was off the strip. The ATM's were out of service a lot of the times. Bartenders were attentive and always asking if I needed another drink. Dim Sum was the bet restaurant to eat at. The others were okay, but a little dry for me. Oh Yah, the Italian place was also wonderful. Yummy food. Tried Truffle fries for the first time. :) After playing many hours and spending a lot of money, at the end of the stay, the comps weren't that good. Here's to hoping we get offers for a free stay, probably won't go back if we don't.

Reviews.Title: “Facelift time?”
Reviews.Author: marinadelrey11
Reviews.Content: Good prices - and you know why right away! The whole interior of the rooms need a major facelift... haven't seen the old box TV in a while and the old shower brass doors didn't slide very well... sqeeeeked so loud every time you went in and out! The whole decor is 80s... I do have to comment that the beds were extremely comfy and the rooms were very clean! That's a definite plus! I would stay here again in a pinch! At least I know what to expect!

Reviews.Title: “Rio, love it”
Reviews.Author: jriceyork
Reviews.Content: We stay at Rio almost every time we visit las vegas, First hotel we stayed at and we got our heart. Clean and spacious rooms. Can not say enough. We enjoy it very much. We at our reception on top of the building outside voodoo lounge, you can see all of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Hotel & Suites”
Reviews.Author: Mike G
Reviews.Content: The suites at the Rio are pretty nice, although how much time do you actually spend in your room while in Vegas? The hotel overall is average, one thing that bothered me greatly was the amount of cigarrette smoke everywhere...I expect it in the casino, but even the hallways to the rooms seemed to reek of cigarrette smoke...definitely a turnoff.

Reviews.Title: “Fair and Fun!”
Reviews.Author: Brian P
Reviews.Content: The room size and cleanliness is one of the best values in Las Vegas! It's clean, roomy and comfortable. The casino atmosphere is festive and dealers are friendly. Also, don't skip the seafood buffet!!! $40 per person and all you can eat crab, lobster, shrimp, oysters, sushi and a variety of other foods and desserts. Well worth the price. Voodoo club is fun, but a little "dated". Great patio views of the strip. Voodoo restraunt is nice, but a little pricey for the quality of food that ultimately gets presented. The hotel is not directly on the strip, but traveling around town by taxi anyway makes it so there is little difference in intra-city travel.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, Uninspired and Smokey”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily154933
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio to attend a business show there in February 2012. I was grossed out right away when we entered the lobby to check in - so smokey it was nauseating. I realize that all Vegas hotels have the smokey casinos right in the lobby to lure the gamblers in, but this hotel must have a really sub-par air exchange system, since it was the smokiest one we encountered out of many hotels we visited in Vegas. Got up to the room - and here were the two good points - the room was nice & big - space for a desk & 2 chairs, a couch and coffee table, 2 big beds. Also, the view over the strip was really pretty. Okay, back to the bad points. The windows wouldn't open, and even though we were on the 20th floor, the smell of smoke was constantly drifting up from the casino - often cigar smoke, which is the worst of all. Not possible to make coffee in your room unless you spring for the K-cups, which cost $8 for 3...so you have to trek down to the smokey lobby to get coffee and breakfast from Starbuck's. Noise level in the rooms was okay - had noisy partiers next door one night, but after that it was fine. Also, almost every restaurant in the hotel opened off the smokey lobby with no dividing doors, so they were also filled with smoke. The hotel was supposed to have a "Rio de Janeiro" theme, but it was pretty lackluster. The free show wasn't even on when it was supposed to be, so that was also a letdown. Overall, this hotel was a big letdown. It was obvious that they cared more about getting people to gamble than about the health and happiness levels of their guests. Don't stay here, try another place, like the Paris Hotel (classy, not too smokey and right in the middle of the strip). Overall, I would never go back to this hotel - I'd rather stay somewhere where they care about my comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome break”
Reviews.Author: son063
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic,and we throughly enjoyed our stay.They met all our needs.The view was fantastic from our room.The room was cleaned daily clean bedding.The gentleman upgraded us when we checked it.

Reviews.Title: “Las Vegas for family vacation-who knew!”
Reviews.Author: travelfuntimes1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel. Price was very good. We were there for spring break with our sons. It is not directly on the strip but it suited our purpose. We rented a car for the week and were able to park there free. No resort fees but had to pay for internet. For the price we paid, we had 2 adjoining rooms and lots of space. Very clean rooms and pools were open for latter half of the week. We did the $44, 24 hour buffet. Well worth it if you know you are going to be in LV for consecutive 24 hours. We did this once only as we were coming and going. We went to Zion national park. Fantastic & spectacular views of the canyon! We also went horse back riding at Mount Charleston trail rides. Thoroughly enjoyed that. Who said vegas is only fun for the adults. Parking is free at all the major hotels. We saw Illusions-magic show and Le Reve. Fantastic and spectacular! Highly recommend both shows.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: msevans32
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio before and really enjoy the convenience of being off the strip and the refrigerators in the room. My only complaint was that I NEVER had any luck at this casino and the machines were super tight. We stayed in the Masquerade Tower in room 32022 – We had a view of the strip and I-15. It wasn’t as nice as a view of the pool but the room was clean and the beds are comfortable. The room is dated but for 4-days comp who cares. Rose at the VIP check was awesome. On our first night we ate breakfast at the buffet which cost us $35 for two. The employee’s were ALL wonderful from the cocktail servers, housekeeping, keno and total rewards associates. I will stay here again but I won’t be gambling at any Harrah’s properties. My husband had good luck at the Wynn.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Shankarii
Reviews.Content: My friends and I had a trip down to Vegas. Rio was the only hotel available as they had the marathon that weekend. Was a decent hotel, friendly casino staff and bar staff. The check in was smooth, rooms were of course old with CRT TVs. But the view was excellent. Clos to the Strip and the shuttles were frequent. Will definately return. Travelled Dec 2011 with friends

Reviews.Title: “Decent casino, but lacking a bit.”
Reviews.Author: TraveLatino
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights for a conference. I was actually impressed with how nice the room was for such an "old" hotel. From what I heard, they renovated a few years ago. However, I had other colleagues that stated their rooms had ancient furniture... so maybe only a partial renovation (??) Since we were there for business, it was tough to have much time for running off to the strip and that's when you realize how much is lacking around you. No shops, very few restaurant choices, not enough tables. There is a shuttle that will take you to either Bally's or Harrahs on the strip, so if you're there for pleasure, there's no need to walk to the strip. However, even with the limite slection, we never had a shortage of where to have drinks. The Voodoo Lounge is a very fun place to wind down. The iBar (or circle bar - as we deemed it) offers a great place to have a mellow drink. One of the most beautiful cocktail waitresses I saw (Jackie) worked there. Make sure you stop in and say hello. She's a sweetheart. It's random, but while in the casino you'll notice that waitresses and waiters will jump up on stages throughout the casino and dance and/or sing. Overall, it's a decent place to stay in Vegas if you don't mind being off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie T
Reviews.Content: Got back 2 days ago and had a great time. After reading some of the reviews I was a bit concerned about staying here. The only problem is if there are noisy people wandering the halls late at night you will hear them. We used the in room checkout and it was great. Room was always clean when we came back. Didn't win anything but had a lot of fun. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “worst managed place on the strip”
Reviews.Author: scott m
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 1 week. first night security busted into the room while we were sleeping.they said we are not supposed to be here. they asked for id and questioned us for 10 minutes like we were criminals. went to management the next morning he could care less.he just laughed.stay far away from the rio.the manager of this hotel should be fired he has not one idea about customer service. i will tell all 3200 stores in email that i work for not to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Changes”
Reviews.Author: wheeler7252
Reviews.Content: Just got back form the Rio, and it's been a while since we've stayed there. There used to be a parade in the sky, but it never happened for the 4 days we were there. They did have girls dancing on the tables. Also, the seafood buffet has changed. Food was ok, nothing special or worth $19 per person . Some of the reviews were accurate when saying the carpet not being clean, towels were dingy, and the TV was outdated. You do need a car, as we were never in one place. When we drove up, the first thing we noticed was that the lights on the buildings were not luminated. Some we not lit. That should have given us an idea of what o expect.

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest Staff in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: Jacob S
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Vegas at the beginning of this month, and I can't say enough how nice everybody was. The shuttle drivers that take you back and forth to the strip were fantastic and friendly, the girls who worked in the gift shop practically knew us by the time we left, and the dealers and bartenders, for the most part, were a lot of fun. I love that the cocktail servers sing and dance, the food is great, and the rooms are huge. We were on the city side in the Ipanema tower. I loved being off the Strip because it felt like we were "coming home" every night from all the chaos of the Strip. I highly recommend the Rio, and with the convenience of the free shuttle service to Bally's and Harrah's and the views and friendly staff, I can't imagine having a better experience for a relaxing trip. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: chryslerlovr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for three nights..most reviews complain about being off the strip..however i dont...we have two teens so being off the strip was not a big deal...the only small complaint is that there is not enough to do for minors....overall it was an awesome stay and looking forward to our next stay! Oh! The kids love the buffet they say it was awesome...better if you get the 24 hr pass and bring your own kerige coffee too expensive..we got that tip from another review....

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Tricia T
Reviews.Content: This was a great Hotel! It's off strip (which also means it's ATM's only charge you $4.99 not the $18.99 that on strip hotels charge when you withdrawl $$$). The rooms are huge ~ and clean. Even though there are a few tell-tale signs that it's an older hotel, it still feels fresh. The service is outstanding in the Casino. You hardly ever have to wait for a drink, The servers laugh & joke & tease. They are awesome! Tip them well ~ they deserve it ;) The seafood buffet was spectacular. As was their "Carnival Bufffet". They also have a great breakfast restaurant. Highly recommend the Rio French Toast! And they are helpful! I had a package delivered to the hotel that didn't arrive untli after I left, and the hotel did everything they could to help me out. There is a free shuttle to the strip ~ don't forget to tip the driver (it's Vegas ~ you tip everyone at least $1). It was also nice to have a KEURIG in the room (run to target & buy some K-cups) as well as a fridge. Enjoy! I know I did!!

Reviews.Title: “Rio seldom disappoints”
Reviews.Author: txidaho88
Reviews.Content: Located off the strip at I-15 and Flamingo Across the freeway from Caesars Palace the Rio is a huge entertainment complex. I have stayed at The Rio 4 times while in Vegas. There are very cute waitresses and fun bartenders everythere throughout the property. The checkin has always run smoothly. The casino seems to always have something going on . Singers, Chippendale strippers signing autographs, etc. etc. From The the Show in the Sky to the Sexy Voodoo Beach, this place is fun! The I-Bar located right at front doors has awesome martini's and beautiful women in thongs serving them up to you! It can be hit or miss with the crowd. For dining options we have tried several. First the famous Village Seafood buffet. WOW!! From cut up lobster to prime rib its amazing. Be starving when you arrive! Its pricey at around $39 but its worth every penny. The World Buffet is very good as well and there are numerous coupons for it. The All American Bar and Grille is ok, nothing great, a bit pricey I feel for what we got. Then there is Cafe Martoranos.....Very pricey Italian food, but it is fantastic. The meatballs are to die for!! And the veal !! Perfecto!! But my favorite restaurant is the Voodoo Steakhouse. Located 50 floors up with fantastic views, its over the top outstanding. The bayou seafood platter appetizer is awesome. The scallops, the Tomahawk Ribeye, the dry aged NY...Its all well prepared but can be very pricey . Plan on $100-120 PP minimum with wine. After dinner at the steakhouse head up the staircase to dance the night away at Rio's Voodoo Rooftop Nightclub. The views are amazing. You can sneak up there for sunset as well and its well worth it. If you want to save money on drinks buy a witch doctor! They cost about $30 and you drink one or two of those and your night is set!! There are plenty of VIP seats and this place is generally fairly lax on the seatting issues. If your early enough you can find places inside to set down without bottle service, which is an exception for most of the popular nightlife spots. The Rio's sportsbook is just average, while the casino floor is full of energy! I love the dealers and staff at the Rio! Very friendly , nice, and fun!! Also to get to Vegas strip you can drive,take a cab, walk (17-18 minutes) or take the free shuttle which comes about every 30 minutes . I hope this gave everyone some type of info on this cool place and good luck at the tables next visit to Sin City!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: gretel2381
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio March 11-15, 2012. I was in town for a conference and this was the first year it was being held at the Rio after being at the Hilton for several years. Overall I had a good experience. The staff at the registration and concierge desks were very friendly and helpful, and the housekeepers always said hi as we passed them in the hallway. The first night I called down to ask for another set of towels to be brought up, and housekeeping brought 4 sets so I didn't have to worry about asking for more the next night. We stayed in the Ipanema Tower and our room was very clean and spacious. This hotel is off the strip which is nice if you want to get a good night's sleep. The restaurants in the hotel are pricey, so we walked across the street to the Gold Coast and had their buffet for $8.99. Of course, smoking is allowed in the casino lobby and coming from a non-smoking state, this was a bit of a shock to me. The conference center was also a loooong walk from the elevators but I definitely got my workout in and the conference facilities were wonderful. Overall, a good time.

Reviews.Title: “The RIO was awesome”
Reviews.Author: idohair4u
Reviews.Content: I checked in on March 8th 2012. It was for a Convention, with a few days before for some fun vegas time, I found the staff to be awesome and helpful. The room was awesome! I loved the floor to ceiling windows, the beds were adequate and pillows just ok, but the room was HUGE! it has a fridge which was great for my bottled water and juice, and an honor bar, which we did not use. The shower was just OK, out shower sprayed water all over the floor, but we had to trial and error to make this not happen. our room in the Impanema Tower had a Keurig. I knew this ahead of time so i brought my own K cups instead of getting the 3 cups for $8 in the honor bar The housekeeping staff was great, Room service fast. The gaming areas were alot of fun, energy abound there for sure. the resutrants were all good, and lots to choose from, I LOVED the seafood buffet and sao paulo cafe was awesome for breakfast. The KJ Dim Sum was a great place for late night chinese food and the staff were very knowledgeable and fun. The spa was my first "spa" experience and i found it great. the service was great and staff very friendly, as were the rest of the patrons there. went to the pool 2 times just to check it out, wish I had more time to spend there, it was lovely, with the sand beach and waterfall. I also found the banquet staff to be courteous, fun AMAZING! I cant wait to go back to the Rio next year

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: tesa_jones
Reviews.Content: I was in town for my Bday. I originally booked a regular room for 4, but we were upgraded to a penthouse suite at check-in. The hotel said that it was fully booked with long stays, and since we were only there for one night, we got a complimentary upgrade. That was really cool and totally made our day. We were done checking in around 3.30pm, but when we went upstairs, the room was still being cleaned. We had to wait about 40 min before we could settle in. The room was very spacious, and the veiw was fantastic. We were also glad to find some TV channels from back home, and that was a nice surprise. This property is older and of course the decor shows that. Our room is generally very clean, but the casino and the rest of the first floor can be a lot cleaner and presentable. Staffs weren't really friendly, but not rude either.

Reviews.Title: “Bathroom in Need of Deep Cleaning.”
Reviews.Author: SalvadorDaliFan
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd time staying at the Rio. The customer service is very good. The room was very large. The bed was comfortable. The bathroom definately needed some work. There was black mold all around the shower, and it definately needed a deep clean. The wallpaper was coming off the wall in a few places also. They also need an inexpensive food court. The general store is the best I've seen at a hotel. Anything you forgot can be found at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Not the fanciest but good value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: IMarriedBob
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights. The restaurants, bars and casinos are all good and varied. We had no wait for check in nor out -- so it obviously depends on when you check in and out; we checked in Thursday afternoon and out Sunday morning. It is smoky but they'll are. It's not horrible and fir the difference in price, you can generally stand it for a few days (I thought Caesars was Much worse and Paris wasn't smoky at all.) the rooms are clean and average. Nothing fancy. Big. Very big. Good bed, sheets and towels. A bit noisy with highway traffic. Complaint: 2 bars of soap (for 2 sinks and a shower) -- it's a small thing but it's always the litte things that are annoying! (Take note Harrahs.) also, the shower head was something else. It's an oxygenated water saver and get ready to be pelted. If you demand a great shower, this isn't your place. If you just want to take a quick shower, you won't mind. Again, not fabulous or fancy but expected quality for what you pay . The pool looks spectacular! Wish it was warmer when we were there. The casino had several bars (party and quiet) so always somewhere to get a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good or Clean!”
Reviews.Author: JulieBasurto
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to staying at the Rio. When my husband and I checked in to the room, it looked very dirty and a large white stain was on the pillow on the bed. The sofa looked like someone had a fight with it and also needed to be cleaned. Also, drunk people walking the halls yelling at each other. When we called the front desk to ask for another room the agent told us that they were sold out and would not move us which I understand, but there was no apologize or service recovery. We asked for a full refund and checked out at 3 am. The front desk did give us all our money back, but didn't care to keep our business, so we took our business to the Renaissance and we were very happy with the service and the clean room and it was about the same price per night. I think the Rio is becoming very run down and the management needs to step up and get the lights on their signs fixed, but I guess a clean room is a hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: tiffany r
Reviews.Content: Our stay was from the 4th to 7th march.We were greeted by a fantastic gentleman who upgrated our room to the 20th floor with a good view.At night you could see nearly the whole city.The room was daily cleaned by a lovely woman called Maria.This hotel is very classly and busy.The bonus was two free shuttle going frm 10.am to 1'am to be dropped off in different places.The drivers were very happy ,and full of jokes.All in all I will recommend this hotel to family and friends.Once again thank you to the gentleman who made our stay enjoyable

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, large spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: DJFiggy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close enough to the Strip, but not on it. Because of this, it's easy to access to the highway and not in the middle of traffic. Stayed at this hotel many times but was not too happy the last couple of times. The rooms are large and very spacious. Great modern feel to them. Our hotel had a strong cigarette smell even though they front desk guaranteed that it was non-smoking. The odor was so strong it triggered my allergies! They were accommodating and moved us. The next room had trails of dirt and mud going all around the room! As if the wheels on the luggage had oil or something gross and was pulled along over the carpet. Not good. My child's socks were black on the bottom from walking accross the floor. So we moved once more. The LAST room was alright. Not the cleanest. This was very, very disappointing as my mother always stays at this hotel and just loves it. I'm a local and wanted a staycation. Pool is very nice and the hotel has lots of entertainment on site. Other than that, it's a good room if you get a good deal on it. Love the size and location if you don't want to be in the hustle and bustle of the Strip. Getting a good room is hit or miss nowadays. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lisalev
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio for 4 nights - 2/28 - 3/3/2012. I was there for a conference. I was very impressed with the size of the room. Very clean! The conference facilities were also very nice. My only complaint about my stay is that the conference was literally over a half mile from the elevator!! It was a huge trek to get there, and if I forgot something, well, I had to go back. And I don't mind walking! Still, it was an inconvenience. But aside from adding moving sidewalks, not sure what they could do about it. The price was very reasonable, I suppose from not being on the strip. I used the shuttle service quite a bit. The shuttle drivers were always friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio has really gone down hill.”
Reviews.Author: Mike M
Reviews.Content: It's hard to believe that I used to stay here quite frequently on business. I actually had VIP status. The Rio has really gone down hill. Smoke filled room and asked for non smoking. Domestic disturbance next door at 7:00AM they were fighting and breaking up the furniture. I had to call security. I went down to change rooms and I had to get it approved by a manager first. Nothing was available until that night. My associates were on another floor, dirty room, there was a SOCK left on their floor from the people before! They had to call security twice, once for the young adults smoking and partying in the hall outside their room and then for the family that was next door to them, kids slamming their doors and running through the hallways after 12:00PM. It's time to move on.

Reviews.Title: “Average room quality, but there's a lot of it...”
Reviews.Author: aerojommel
Reviews.Content: Best thing about the rooms at the Rio is the extra space. They advertise that every room is a "suite". I would say that is an extremely loose interpretation of that word. They are around 20%larger than that of the average Las Vegas hotel rooms, though. I loved the view of the north strip from the Masquerade Tower and have a killer video of the lights coming on on the strip. The pool area is awesome, but the water is frigid in the cooler months. Really nice areas to "sleep it off" by the pool if you choose to do so. There are some decent food choices here, also without breaking the piggy bank. Walk to Gold Coast for some decent gambling... there is none to be found at the Rio or Palms. The Penn and Teller show is a great one...must see it if you're staying there.(go to goldstar.com for best deal) Rooms in both towers are now showing their age. It is a far cry from the nice new Hyatts or Marriotts that many of you frequent. However, if you normally prefer the Holiday Inn for your travels, you will be ecstatic about your room, food choice, etc at this property. The thing we liked best about the Rio is how accessible it is with a rental car. It is a great base of operations for our Vegas trips. It's two blocks west of the center of the strip...just a few blocks away from Orleans, Palms, Ceasars, Mirage, Bally's, Paris, Gold Coast, etc..., and is also right on Flamingo where the ACE bus runs and there are tons of locals businesses and bars that can help enhance you Vegas experience. You can normally get pretty good pricing through the marketing dpt, and if you get the right price, it's one of the best hotel values out there. There is also VooDoo Lounge on the top floor... if you've never been, go. The Carnival World buffet is good on a BOGO - do not pay full price... the seafood buffet is still the best in Vegas but is significantly less impressive as it was a few years ago. IMO, they destroyed the show in the sky to the point where most do not watch the thing.(used to be one of the cool free things you could do... now it's more of a production show on the casino floor)

Reviews.Title: “Rio--”
Reviews.Author: Connie H
Reviews.Content: My husband had a convention at the Rio last week. The rooms are large and nicely decorated. Thank goodness because I was stuck in my room a lot. It was extremely windy and I could not go out and walk around as I had planned to do while hubby worked. The eateries were all expensive within the hotel unless you want to eat Burger King every day. I don't gamble so that was not an option. The pool was closed. The best part about our experience was the Penn & Teller show. We signed up for their rewards card and got a 2 for 1 for the show and I would have paid full price. Fabulous show!! Gotta go see it when you go to Vegas. The famous buffet was pricey...$29.99 for dinner per person..No thanks. Had friends that went to the breakfast buffet and said it was no great shakes. Nice rooms if you plan to spend a lot of time in them.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Safe Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ken j
Reviews.Content: Stayed over this past weekend 3/9/12, worst service at the front desk very slow, gang shooting at the resort, who new that they opened a hip hop night club, I spoke with workers at the resort, nothing but trouble since the club has opened, This was my last stay at this resort, it use to be one of my favorite places to stay not any more. not a nice place any more, had a good time at the rest of Harrahs prpoerties felt safe at those not at the RIO

Reviews.Title: “Not a happy customer”
Reviews.Author: George A
Reviews.Content: Where do I start... The Buffet, well how do I say this..We found a COCKROACH in the menudo!!!!! It doesn't matter how good everything else was, this brings it all to a big fat ZERO. The only reason I am leaving a poor & not terrible rating is the room was really nice. We brought this up to the chef & never even received am apology or refund! Someone please correct me if I am wrong, but if there is one roach, there is probably tens of thousands? I mentioned to a supervisor (Mr. Yoon I think) at the front desk & he told me to go to complain to the manager at the restaurant, yes he passed the buck! Never offered us refund! Poor customer service & very discussing experience to say the least. To make matters worse, they had a gang shooting in the parking level where our car was parked in which two gang members were shot by other gang members which cause the entire 4th level of the parking structure to be closed for 14 hours on Sunday morning. This was never mentioned to us when we checked out, they instead let us check out & carry all our luggage to the parking lot where we were told we couldn't leave for 8 hours. After googling the internet to find out more about this incident & instead found out this is not the first time this has occurred! Too put icing on my cake, they chartged me for beverages taken from my room which I never touched. They never even offered any type of appology or compensation! Too bad, I actually enjoyed the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Can't keep it in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: teetime_ATL
Reviews.Content: I recently enjoyed a stay at Rio All Suites hotel in Vegas. It was worth the price, quick check-in and the shuttle to the strip offered two drop off locations (Harrah's & Bally's). Variety of food choices and the room was clean. I asked for the new tower based on other reviews and we were not disappointed. I recommend this location for the budget conscience traveler without compromising service or expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great room for the price”
Reviews.Author: kev8971
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel, $52 for a high floor suite in the masquerade tower? Hard to complain. Painless check in/out was helpful too. Definetly check out the voodoo lounge for some pictures/drinks, go early, theres no-one there.

Reviews.Title: “4 nights in Rio”
Reviews.Author: MillsInc
Reviews.Content: We just got back thursday night.....so in regards to the location....yes it is not walkable....but the shuttle leaves every half an hour and the times are from 10am to 1am. They have 2 drop points...harrahs and Paris Paris......so this isnt a problem. The rooms......huge! and yes the carpet is dated....but again...no issues The casino.....not bad at all....a little smoky for my wife and it was weird seeing people walking dogs in a casino (a first for me) but I never heard any barking. we saw Penn and Teller......its an hour and a half long and quite entertaining if your a poker player then it can be tough at times getting to play due to most people leaving for the strip......so I just played a lot on the strip. food.....very tasty buffets both deserve to be in the top 10 list.....and they are. but for breakfast..... walk across to the Gold Coast for their breakfast buffet its 5.99 with a players card.....its not busy and the food is great.....a great tip from other trip advsors. The first shuttle doesnt leave until 10am anyways. lasting words/tips..... its $8 for 3 keurig cups of coffee!!....bring your own. taxi cost to the airport from the hotel was $16...but $23 from the airport to the hotel...hence it depends when u leave. get to the shuttles before it is supposed to leave.....because once it is full...they leave. for example 11:20 and 3:50.

Reviews.Title: “NO SURPRISES...UNFORTUNATELY”
Reviews.Author: CWTraveler42
Reviews.Content: All of the reviews I had read about the Rio were pretty much spot-on. The first room we were given had not been cleaned after the previous occupant checked out (unmade bed, towels and food everywhere!). We called the front desk and were told we would have to come back to be checked into another room, so we hauled all of our stuff back down, across the casino, to the desk,and were checked into another room....but NOT ONCE recieved any apology for our inconvenience,even when we pointed it out very politely. Our new room was clean, but when we went to bed found a 12-inch rip in the bottom sheet that could not possibly been missed when the maid made the bed. It was replaced the next day when we asked, and we had no other issues with housekeeping. Had decent restaurants, we ate at San Paulo for breakfast every AM, VooDoo Steak was expensive but delicious food and great service, Seafood buffet also expensive, good service but not much atmosphere (so noisy you could hardly have a conversation), All-American had decent food, but skip the $8 milkshakes-they suck! The shuttle service to the Strip is free and efficient, but sould like to see it run a little more frequently. h

Reviews.Title: “The buffet at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: Silva A
Reviews.Content: The food Variety at the Rio Buffet is amazing ! The quality is super good and the price is cheap compared to the diversity of the food stations . Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Smoked out”
Reviews.Author: Monica J
Reviews.Content: If you are a non-smoker you will not want to stay here. I left yesterday and my nose is still on fire from the second hand smoke. I would expect to have smoking on the casino floor, but not in the hallway by the elevator on the 16 th floor. The smell easily drifts under the doorway to rooms. My room service dishes were not removed by the maid, guess they were not obvious enough despite the fact I told her they were from the day before. Downside is also not close enough to walk to the strip, taxi or shuttle is required. The breakfast buffet was the only positive for me, albeit pricey but it is Vegas after all. Next time I will stay at a non smoking hotel on the strip and visit the casino when I want to gamble...and hey Vegas not everyone smokes ever consider a nonsmoking casino where patrons don't die from second hand smoke? Plus Internet charges daily per device per room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!”
Reviews.Author: Peggy B
Reviews.Content: THis was my first time to Vegas and I was a little worried after having read all the reviews about dirty rooms, outdated furniture etc. I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was immaculate, the furnishings were new, the staff was very friendly at every encounter, and the beds were the best I have ever slept in. The view of the strip was outstanding - and there was something for everyone on the casino floor. Yea, not flat screen TV's. Who would whine about that? Are you in Vegas to watch TV? We stayed in the Masquerade tower...try to get a room up higher. Parking was easy, Show in the sky was fun...shopping was very reasonable. My only complaint was the crowd that came for the late night Crown Theatre lounge. They were rude, and pushed their way down the hallways like they owned the place. The gang cops monitoring the casino floor was a little distressing. Management, take note of the reviews in this regard. It might turn some patrons off. Overall, I loved staying at the Rio. Had a wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: PBK1
Reviews.Content: This is one of the better casinos I've visited in Vegas, friendly dealers and waitresses and plenty of entertainment and restaurant options on site. It is off the strip, but there's a free shuttle bus to Harrah's and Bally's that runs till 1am so it's not that inconvenient if you have plans somewhere on the strip. The rooms themselves are a bit outdated and need a good deep cleaning. The rates are a little lower than most of the strip hotels so it ends up being a good value, but housekeeping really needs to do a better job.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: NateS-DC
Reviews.Content: I visited the Rio in early March 2012 for 3 nights; this was my second visit to this resort. They do have an excellent pool area which includes a sand beach, but it was way to cold this time to visit. The room I stayed in was in the Masquerade tower (the tall tower), and it looked like it had been recently renovated. It was nice: comfortable king bed, nice sectional sofa, a minibar in the main room and then a mini-fridge for my use near the bathroom. The television was circa the late 1990s, but I really didn't go to Vegas to watch TV in my room, so no bother. The Rio also provided an in-room safe (which is nice to have in Vegas). The bathroom was very well lit with two sinks and new granite countertops. Check-in on a Wednesday night took me 30-45 minutes, and that was around 9:00pm. Around midnight there was still a line, so beware of this. The rooms in the Rio have floor-to-ceiling windows. This can be great if you like a view of the mountains or the Strip. It can be bad if you're overlooking a parking garage or air conditioning units. Fortunately I was high enough where I got a mixed view of Strip, mountains, and air conditioning units! The casino is really big and you can lose your money here just as well as anywhere else. Gaming minimums were around $10 on the weeknights and went up on the weekend. Plenty of tables and tons of slots. The Rio also has two of the better buffets with their Carnival and seafood buffets. Huge selection and good quality all around. There are also a number of other restaurants and bars for any budget. It's pretty self-contained here so you'd never have to leave. You can walk to the Strip from here, but it's about 15 minutes on sidewalks that are on major roadways. You can also take the free shuttle, but that runs once every 30 minutes and can fill up quickly. Last thing, they have a "new" Irish pub that I was looking to try. Found out that it's only open on Fridays and Saturdays. When we went on Friday night we looked at the taps to see that they were out of Bass and Harp. Further, while a great cover band was playing, there was not an Irish tune to be heard. Maybe this is Vegas' interpretation of an Irish pub, but I call this a regular bar. No worries, though, for there were plenty of other options.

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: JimDebH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for five nights in February and overall the experience was pleasant. Check in at the hotel went smoothly however at times I did see long lineups when other people were arriving. The staff at the hotel are very pleasant and professional. The rooms are large and kept clean. Unfortunately the pool was not open, it looked like it would be a great place when open. We are not gamblers so we didn't hang around the hotel that much. It is a short shuttle ride to the strip, or you can walk in about twenty minutes to the Bellagio and Caesars palace. The restaurants in the hotel were pricey I felt. Also they wanted to charge a 20 dollar cover charge to go up to the 51st floor lounge, where they overcharge for drinks. I think they could eliminate that and also provide free wifi service. Not a bad hotel for Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and run down”
Reviews.Author: Lee B
Reviews.Content: I spent 4 days there this past week and it wasn't very nice. The room was filthy. The dust and dirt between the bed and night stand was so thick you could not see the carpet. Around all the base boards the carpets had not been cleaned in along time. The place was run down old. The Televisions are old not HD and some channels did not work. Food and service was very good. Casino was old and very smokey. The staff was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I had anticipated!”
Reviews.Author: VegasPhanatik
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at Rio All Suites Hotel and it was amazing! We stayed in a Deluxe King Bed room in the Ipanema and it was so spacious. I absolutely loved the vanity area with its own stool and great lighting which is very important to me. The TV was a little outdated with minimal channels but we that didnt bother us much. Although this hotel is located off The Strip, it's not that far of a drive and they also offer a shuttle to take u to their sister properties. The one negative thing about the room was the shower. It seemed to take quite a while for the water to get hot but once it did, it was very hot. The room also came with a Keuring Coffeemaker where u can purchase the coffee pods from the mini fridge for $8 for 3 pods. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. I had no problem falling asleep at night. The Show in the Sky was also amazing! Great entertainment not to mention that it was free. I am definitely looking forward to visiting Rio again!

Reviews.Title: “2nd time at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: casper80236
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we stayed at the Rio. We checked in around 5pm and there was maybe 2 people in front of it, so it went quickly. The young lady was very efficient and helpful. This time we were in the Ipanema tower, which I preferred over the other 'tall' tower that has the nightclub on top of it. Let me preface this by saying, my husband and I are in our 40's and have been to Las Vegas several times. We're not really into night clubbing or 'partying' like that. We like to gamble, go to a show, enjoy ourselves....but are pretty low key. If you're looking for exciting night life, or high end(high cost) rooms, then the Rio is not for you. The Rio is showing it's age, but the rooms are clean and I found the our room extremely quiet (room #904) with a beautiful view of the mountains. The TV's have seen better days - but are you really in Vegas to watch TV? We also rented a car this time and our room was close to the parking garage and parking was not an issue. We were always able to find a space even late on Friday and Saturday.

Reviews.Title: “never againnnnnnnnnnnnnnnn”
Reviews.Author: kim g
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the rio. I have been here many times to gamble & also for the buffet. The casino part is actually pretty nice, girl dancing & singing every hour or so. Buffet is amazing. But when I first checked in and saw our room i was in awe... Seriously?! Yea the rooms are spacious, BUT OUTDATED. I felt like i was in the Motel 6, or even worst. There was a huge crack on the ceiling right abouve or bed. floors felt dirty, tv was SO small and NOT flat screen. Just not a nice room what so ever. Id rather pay 10$ more. stay at the luxor or smething. Seriously do NOT stay at the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmtthws
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here before and I wasn't dissapointed this time either. It's very good value and although just off the strip we had absolutely no difficulties with the excellent shuttle service to Ballys or Hurrah's. The Hotel and Casino staff were all very polite and professional with one exception, (there's always one isn't there), but the rest of the staff more than made up for it. I love this Hotel, BIG rooms, clean, friendly and exciting. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Updating But Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jpvbc808
Reviews.Content: The Rio could use an overhaul but the rooms are comfortable with lots of space for two. We checked in after 10pm and did not have a line up. The service at the registration desk was very good and though we were booked for a basic room, which usually does not have a view, we asked for and got a view room in the Masquerade Tower. The Rio has large floors, so I recommend asking for a room near the elevators, but far away enough that isn't a high traffic area. Room attendants were very courteous and the room was always clean. The free shuttle to the strip is convenient though they fill up on the return depending on the time of day you go.The only issue we had was that our key cards timed out after 3AM, two nights in a row. Not what you hope for after a night out and it is a long walk from the Masquerade Tower to the front desk. They could not explain what happened, gave us a second set of keys which did not work and finally had to let us in. The next morning, the keys worked fine.

Reviews.Title: “our fav. las vegas hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mountiamsandcanyons
Reviews.Content: This hotel is an all suit property located just one block west of the strip on flamingo road. The big plus here is the size on the room. each has a large open space with floor to ceiling windows.The bath area comes with an additional sink and sitting area that is very helpful for two or more to get ready with. Beds are comfortable ,the ac system works well ,shades and curtins keep the sun out well. tv and mini fridge ad to the room as well. Hairdryer,iron,mirrors,and safe are all in the bath area closet with clothes hanger and luggage rack. We liked the large open space here and always came back to a clean fresh room at days end. The hotel --- This large 2 building property has two parking garage spaces that make it easy to get into the hotel unlike most of the mega resorts on the strip. Inside the hotel its like mardi grass a new orleans feel with a full blown show in sky complete with floats suspended from the cieling music and dance (mostly adult orientated) I would not advise to bring small children here or vegas all together for that matter. Everyone likes to get the free necklace they through from the floats (just wave your hands). The bar tenders put on a juggling show from time to time. Entertainment -- The rio has of course casino and showrooms at our visit pen and teller in one room and chipendales in another. There are two nightclubs here one on the top of the building voodoo lounge and the other on the main floor. IN the masquarade village ther is a two story shopping arcade with some 15 stores to go through. Food-- I think the hotel has a very good selection of on site choices to eat. there are two buffets including an all seafood one. The world buffet is one the best in town. (see other review) A deli , seafood restuarant.an italian restaurant,some bars,and a quick bagel stand or two. pool-- We stopped in for a peak but is was closed during our stay. All i can say is it looks nice even has a beach. Service -- Everyone we encounter was helpful , every request we made was met. overall -- I liked this place because it gives you best of both worlds it has all the excitement you could want, then has a peace and quiet away from the strip also. Parking is easy,the room size is great (and for the same cost as a regular room elcewhere) The entertainment is great, The food is top rate.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Price”
Reviews.Author: 1gaterlo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in February for our anniversary. When we checked in, we had requested an upgrade and for 15 dollars a night they said they would. We were given a room on the 6th floor of the Impanema tower. Nice room, not a great view. Every staff member we met was professional and nice, including security, housekeeping and front desk staff. We were given an early check in and late check out for no extra cost. Shuttles ran frequently to the strip. Buffet was excellent. Show in the sky is fun. We did not win anything on the slots, but didn't care because they brought free drinks frequently. (Lol) if we do go back to Vegas, we would probably stay on the strip (the Flamingo is centrally located and nice). We saw Penn and Teller and it was amazing. The fountains at the Bellagio are incredible at night. We ate at Olives at the Bellagio and were seated on the patio that has a front row seat to the fountains. Beautiful! Highlight of our trip. The pools at the Rio are not open in the winter, which was a bummer since it was 75 when we were there and it would have been nice to relax in the sun. All in all, the Rio was alright, but wont stay there again. Just prefer the convenience of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to Smokeville!!”
Reviews.Author: Ouch999
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for 3 days. I booked a non-smoking suite but as I walked into the ROOM, it reeked of smoke. And it was indeed a room -NOT a suite as advertised.So the toilet area is partitioned off with fancy lighting but that does not a "suite" make. The entire atmosphere throughout the hotel was smoky, my eyes burned and I had difficulty breathing for the entire stay. When I flushed the toilet I had to jiggle the handle for the water to stop running and the sound of the running water was incredibly loud! Housekeeping told me that they do not change the sheets unless it was "really visibly dirty". To top off my stay, the line up to check-out was unbelievable. If you do not want to miss your flight, check out from 9 a.m instead of 11 a.m. I would never again stay in this hotel. If you are a smoker who likes a party atmosphere especially at night, doesn't mind sleeping on dirty sheets for the duration of your stay, and in no rush to catch a plane when you leave, then Rio is for you. If you are a business traveler, or someone who has kids with you on your trip, likes fresh bed linen, fresh air, a functional toilet and a smoke free place to rest your head at night, stay away from this hell hole. Go to the closest Motel 6 and protect your health!

Reviews.Title: “10 day stay!”
Reviews.Author: 40years1970
Reviews.Content: Check in quick. Very large, clean rooms with fridge and free safety deposit boxes. Found all the staff very friendly, just walking by and a "good morning or good afternoon" by all. We were there for 10 days and the pool was closed even to sunbathe, which was disappointing as the weather was very nice. Didn't find any place to enjoy the sun, had to go to Caesars to enjoy the pool one day. Self parking was probably the best at large Vegas hotels, close and easy to find a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 is cleaner and better!!”
Reviews.Author: rnd1234
Reviews.Content: Mold everywhere!!! Shoty work, I would rather sleep in a trash can full of crap. I did talk to a worker hanging wallpaper. I asked him about the place. His response was this place is run down and the ceo would rather fill his pockets than repair the place the right way. He also recomended to stay at a mgm property. What does this tell you??

Reviews.Title: “Feeling scared to walk down the halls!”
Reviews.Author: Jaimebella
Reviews.Content: Went to Vegas this weekend to celebrate a birthday! We reserved over 8 seperate rooms since their was a group of 20 people! During the day everything was great it was a very normal Vegas crowd! It was the complete opposite in the evening! It felt very unsafe; full of what seemed to be gangsters & thugs! Their were extremely intoxicated people who were harassing the patrons of hotel! You know there's going to be trouble when you have las Vegas pOlice in casino. Rio opened up a dance club which I believe brings in this type of clientele! Stayed here before & have never felt unsafe!

Reviews.Title: “Great Mid-week value off Strip”
Reviews.Author: jerseyjoenorthernNJ
Reviews.Content: Very large suite room with all the necessary amnenties, go afew dollars higher than basic rate and get a very nice upgrade. Got my best quote on hotel's site instead of ususal on-line travel sites. You really need a car if you plan to visit other LV sites/hotels, few good sideways in area.Casino is quite nice and way above average than other bargin hotels in LV area. Caution, hotel is very expensive on weekends but is a very good value mid-week. They didn't add any surcharges to bill, but always ask, as more LV hotels are doing this.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio needs to hire some people”
Reviews.Author: funkstone
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 3 nights at the Rio, in the Ipamema Tower. On the plus side, the rooms were large, with a small fridge to store food. Unfortunately, they do not provide any coffee pots (like all the other Las Vegas casino hotels - this gets you down into the casino faster). Oddly enough, I kept hearing the Ipanema Tower had been recently remodeled. But our room still had an old, squishy couch and an old 37" tube TV. I guess I have just come to expect flat screen TV's in decent hotels. The shower spray was good, but the tub would not drain. Finally, the checkout procedure at the front desk was ridiculous. We would have checked out via the TV system, but we found a bunch of overbilling errors. That gave us the 'opportunity' to stand in the checkout line for over 40 minutes. There were only 3 people ahead of us, too. For some reason, the hotel knows that people are going to be checking out between 11am and 3pm, yet they only had one person behind the desk processing checkouts. You could tell that this poor girl was stressed out, and it turned out to be her day off, too. She corrected our bill, but it took over an hour. By the time we were done, the line behind us has grown to 15-20 people. At the pace they were moving, we projected that she had at least 9 hours of work. In summary, I think Caesars needs to hire a few people for this aging casino. The room rates are very good (approx $55/night), but maybe they could charge a little more to provide better service.

Reviews.Title: “it was ok.”
Reviews.Author: wicked33
Reviews.Content: Just got back from vegas trip with family, all of us being adults. All 12 of us stayed at the rio. check in was very fast and the line was short, room was clean and big, bed was very comfortable. As many reviews have said furniture and tv are very dated but i'm not picky as long as i can sleep, and i slept very well when i did sleep. My main issues with the rio are that it's off the strip. They do have a shuttle to the strip but it's just not the same you kind of lose some steam by the time you wait for the shuttle and finally get there. Being off the strip like they are i felt they would try a little harder to please you but didn't really get that. The table minimums for craps and blackjack are 15 dollars when you could find a spot open to play, and the slots there were the tightest of everywhere we played. I wouldn't recommend the rio with so many other options in vegas.I've stayed at Ballys and circus circus and liked both better. Next trip i'll stay downtown love the bands and the energy there, also a lot more cocktail waitresses came around with a lot better drinks.

Reviews.Title: “February at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: TomHall
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day vacation in Las Vegas at the Rio. They comped all 5 days. Our room was on the 16th floor in the Ipanema tower and I would recommend it any time. The room was very clean, spacious and we had a great view. We were asked before we left for Vegas if we wanted to upgrade from a standard suite to the one on 16 and Im glad we did. Ive stayed in the other tower and in the standard suites and they are not close to being as nice. My problem with the Rio is that there are very few options besides gambling. The Voodoo Lounge is great if youre a 20 something and like today's brand of heavy beat music. Ive moved past it. Its a fantastic view but once the music starts I have to go. The Casino bar was lively at time and Dom the bartender was very hospitable. But there needs to be more options. I hate that you need to take a cab everywhere too. I guess you get what you pay for. The buffets are still very good and the gambling is lively as well. Next time in Vegas Ill be staying at Planet Hollywood though.

Reviews.Title: “Dump...never again!”
Reviews.Author: MusicCity024
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here in a masquerade suite and, other than the room being fairly clean, the hotel is a dump. Items broken in my suite...phone in LR, coffee maker, whirlpool tub, TV remote would not turn on TV in LR, phone jack wires in LR floor were separated. Bath essentials were cheap and overall customer service was well below average for any vegas resorts I have visited. Buffet is a step above an average cafeteria and a carafe of coffee to the room is $12 + numerous fees. Insane. The hotel needs a serious overhaul from top to bottom.

Reviews.Title: “Great trip to Vegas”
Reviews.Author: HONG W
Reviews.Content: Rio hotel is very good and clean to stay the people work there is very nice and friendly the hotel is very clean from the floor ,hallway and the room is very nice , the only bad things is the check in system is the worst it is not very well running and this is on Monday so just think what would be like on the weekend. The check in area is not very good for handicap customer it should be more better then the way it is been done. I would go back to the hotel and stay there again,but I do hope they will improve on the system when check in the handicap customer.The staff is very helpful and understand .

Reviews.Title: “Big suites are "sweet!" at Rio”
Reviews.Author: abqtravelermta
Reviews.Content: The best part about Rio – the rooms! They are HUGE! One website says that the “Standard Suites” (the most basic suite) measure in at 600 square feet and I’m inclined to believe that. Yes, the furnishings and décor are a bit tired but my suite did have one of those increasingly-common big “L”-shaped sectionals, and it was very comfy – a great place to read or watch TV. The suite was clean upon arrival except for A) an errant sunflower seed shell and B) a straight pin that, fortunately, I did not step on. Great bathrooms with separate dressing/vanity area offering sink, plenty of counter space, lighted magnifying mirror (ladies will appreciate that), mirrored closet, built-in bureau and – nice touch – a mini-refrigerator. (The overpriced “refreshment center” – aka “mini-bar” – is in the living room/bedroom.) Separate compartment with another sink, commode and tub/shower. (Beware the “jet propulsion” flushing mechanism on the toilet!) Gilchrist & Soames bathroom amenities which smelled oh so nice. My room did not have the coffee maker that others have mentioned. Wall-to-wall and floor-to-ceiling windows with good strip views. I was on the south side of Masquerade Tower so, even in February, it got a little “toasty” in the afternoon, but the curtains did a great job of blocking out light. (Good thing, too, as my room was also quite close to the giant “Rio” lighted sign.) A/C worked well. Housekeeping did an excellent job. The staff members with whom I interacted were quite pleasant and very professional, especially front desk staff and valet drivers. (The valet booth attendant – where one picks up their car – was indifferent at best.) I didn’t gamble or drink and I didn’t eat at any of the myriad restaurants or see any shows so I’m not qualified to comment on those. The elevators to the Masquerade Tower are hard to find and the path from the front desk or self-parking (aka the parking garage) is rather convoluted but that is true of any casino/hotel so no surprises there. Rio is off-strip but not by much; they offer a free shuttle, though. For my needs I found the location convenient. NO RESORT FEES! That is one of the reasons why I selected Rio. I was in line 25 minutes to check in but I learned that’s short in the grand scheme of things. The TV check-out feature wouldn’t work but a quick phone call to guest services and it was all taken care of and I was outta there without having to stop at the front desk. To have a room that large for $59 a night (my nightly average) made it a great, great value. Is Rio a great hotel? I’d say no. But it is a good one and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a try”
Reviews.Author: TravMuch
Reviews.Content: This was a little far off the strip, but I have enjoyed their buffet in the past so I decided to gie it a try as a hotel. My room was very large and super clearn. The carpet and furniture were well-worn but it was clean. I was irritated that the coffeemaker was one of the new one cup kinds and they charged $8 for 3 packets! Since I had my car, I picked some up at a local grocery. I was at the hotel and casino for 4 days over a busy holiday weekend and never heard commotion from any of the other rooms! Pease and quiet! Great. Maid service was great. And I found a great route to the Mirage parking lot off Spring Mountain that didn't require driving on the strip at all. Overall, a great location for a low key holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michael K
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled into thinking that NO RESORT FEE's is great. They get that back in the form of extra's (internet $14 a day) All in all this is an ok hotel. The rooms are spacious and clean, the beds are very high (my wife had trouble as she had hurt her hip). We stayed in the Masqerade Tower on the 18th floor. I thought at night the lorries kept rumbling by, then I realised it was the lift that goes up the outside of the building (all night) so make sure you are not near that on check in. The "Show in the sky" is the free show in the Rio. It's ok, bit too cheesy for my taste and wow was it loud. I suggest you take ear defenders if you want to watch this one. They have a great "Rockeoke" where a band plays the songs and the guests sing, worth a look. The "All American Grill" is good value for money and serves great food. The buffet was not all I had heard and I thought was a bit pricey. We ate at Harrahs for nearly half the price and it was as good. If it is a Suite Hotel you are looking for then try the "HArd Rock" I stayed there for 2 nights and it was way way better. That said the Rio is ok. Get the shuttle to the strip the walk is longer than it looks. lol

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: Steffenino
Reviews.Content: Nice stay at this hotel. Room was large and looked recently redone. Great large bathrooms with separate sinks in the dressing area and in the bath area. Keurig Coffee maker required that you purchase the cup for $8 from the mini bar. Room was clean and bed was comfortable. Service was average. Casino was average and we enjoyed the Show in the Sky. Nice pool, but we didn't use it as it was really cold this weekend. Shuttle was convenient to the strip and the wait was usually short. Buffet was great with lots of options and a great price for what you get. Other restaurants and food concessions provide many alternatives for dining. My one big complaint was that the floors in the elevator area were never vacuumed the 3 days that we were there. There were cigarette butts on the floor the whole time we were there and accumulated during the time of our visit. Housekeeping was in the halls all morning and afternoon, as to why this was neglected is a mystery with housekeepers on every floor for hours every day. All in all and not a bad stay. I don't think I would recommend this to others, but might stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Gone to the Dogs”
Reviews.Author: saltman
Reviews.Content: Spent one week at Rio, from 2/11 to 2/18. We have stayed at many Casinos but this was the first time here, check in was easy every thing was fine, the room was very nice with a view of the pool and strip. The casino was clean and the employees were very nice, the slots played with us and the table games were a lot of fun, there was a fashion convention going on and added to the class of the place with many great dressed woman around all week. But what a shock to run into people walking through out the place with there dogs on a leash! One man was walking two big old bull dogs? It might be me but when I go on vacation and spend lots of hard earned money I do not want to stay some were that has pets in the same place? To bad as we liked the place and enjoyed the Buzio's and VooDoo Restaurants, but will stay somewere else next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: guv249
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice. The check in line was not bad. The rooms are big and bathroom area as a sink inside and outside for the bathing area so two people can get ready nicely. The bad part of the room is the tv is still a old tub TV. and it changed from color to black and white sometimes. They tried fixing it but no luck. They do have a free shuttle over to the strip which was handy.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Rio save $?”
Reviews.Author: stellaNJ
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rio 3x due to a convention on site. I pay $89 for a large suite. While it is the best location for the convention, it is not the best hotel for the strip. You will have to take a cab to the strip (there is a free shuttle) and back. The casino is very smokey. The restaurants are ok. I have eaten multiple times at the world Buffet, Buizo's Seafood and Gaylord Indian. I would eat there again. If there are more than 3 of you and you will share the room and cab fees, then this is an option. The rooms were clean, products ok and casino fine. The spa is not great but the prices reflect that. I have not had time to visit the pool, but it looks fun. No free coffee in the suite but there is a refrigerator separate from the mini bar.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: tinamaui
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Rio Hotel in Las Vegas while attending a convention. We first were put into a room that had a bad smell and was very noisy right near the outdoor machines, then we complained and they gave us a great room on the 17th floor, very nice. The staff is very friendly and we were treated very well. We did not eat at the hotel because the restaurants did not look to be what we wanted. They need more seating in the convention area, not enough chairs to sit in anywhere. I'll go back because the price is right and all in all a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A bit tired off strip hotel.”
Reviews.Author: OBD2142
Reviews.Content: If you have business at the rio convention center this hotel is very convenient. I had heard this hotel was recently renovated. My room was worn and with scratched up furniture. Although this hotel has a 4 star rating there are almost no amenities. There is a coffee pot in the room you cannot use. In order to do so you must order the coffee from room service. I recommend you bring your own products to this hotel. you are given a shampoo and conditioner combination, lotion and soap. These are all heavily perfumed. One bright light is the Sports Deli. This food concession is one of the best w/ very reasonable prices. The rooms are large & not particularly attractive. Good water pressure & plenty of hot water on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is the place to be!”
Reviews.Author: VegasBlondie
Reviews.Content: Best part of this hotel is that it's an all suite hotel so all the rooms are big even the basic so as a tip for like young groups you can totally fit air beds :) room was nice and amazing view anywhere, bed was big, had comfier ones but it was fine!!!! T\Actually had drawers and a big closet in the bathroom! Drawers in a bathroom hellllllo!!!!!!!! Has a coffee machone but its keurig so ovbiously pay for those or um bring your own! Staff was definitely friendly which is a plus, they do put a $100 hold on your card that comes back like a week later which kinda sucks oh well and no coupon book at check in. Tons of bars and dining and entertainment so you could spend your whole time there easily, pool is awesome and the steakhouse at the top! And dont miss their inside parade, free beads!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Air Canada Vacation”
Reviews.Author: KsW_MD
Reviews.Content: Attended a Conference at Cesar's Palace but decided to get a package deal through Air Canada which included air from Victoria BC + 7 nights at Rio - total just over $1200 for two, which is pretty amazing. Cesar's Palace, conference rate $195 + tax, is a 20-25 min walk from Rio or you can take the free shuttle from Rio to Bally's and walk over the street to Cesar's P. Check-in at Rio good. However, we couldn't get a room with a "proper" refrigerator. All rooms have a fridge, but none have a freezing compartment which we needed for medical purposes. Were offered a room upgrade (at an extra $150 per night which would have been almost expensive as the whole vacation for my wife and me!), but the front desk staff member couldn’t be sure whether a real fridge was in the expensive suite. We were on the brink of moving out when one of the security staff who was trying to help in this situation, suggested getting a real fridge form the Cabana area of the Hotel. Viola! 10 mins later a proper fridge! Room comfortable. Older style TV. New fangled expensive in-room coffee ($2 each sachet). Lots to do within the entertainment part of the Hotel. Attended a show of Motown music – Marvelletes, Platters and Coasters – excellent. We had a 2 for 1 voucher which made the cost palatable ($72 total). Had dinner at the Grill which made an excellent burger. SBux on hand and always buzzing; their fruit flans are $5 and well worth it! Parking free, safe, and about 1/3 mile walk to our room in Ipanema Tower. Wifi extra/expensive. Maid service came mid afternoons, which was too late for our liking, but my wife called for earlier service and this worked out. Check-out by TV effortless. Took in the USA Sevens international rugby tournament and, if you are a rugby fan, it’s truly memorable. In fact we timed our visit to Vegas this year to accommodate the Conference + the rugby! Rio is good value, with a few caveats.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: MrEdO
Reviews.Content: Big old room with a big old TV. Room needed to be renovated. The Casino reeked of cigarette smoke! Free shuttle bus to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “I feel guilty writing this because we love the Rio but there's some disturbing things...”
Reviews.Author: gms208
Reviews.Content: Been staying at the Rio for years, (approx. 5 times) we love the staff there, they always go out of their way to make you feel like you're genuinely welcome. Unfortunately on our last visit we we troubled to find some disturbing things happening there. First of all the property is beginning to need some investment from Harrah's. We've always accepted that the property is older and shows some age but has always been very clean & well maintained and we overlooked some of the signs of age, "character marks", because of the quality of the experience the staff gave us. Check in was easy & quick, as Total Rewards Members they always take great care of us. A couple of minor maintenance issues, the deadbolt on the door would inadvertently lock when we closed the door as we left the room, requiring maintenance to come up and let us back in our room. Maintenance had to come up to let us in our room immediately after we checked in. We started manually holding in the deadbolt as the door closed behind us and this solved the problem. Additionally, the AC in our room was not operating and our room was borderline hot, luckily the weather wasnt hot yet but the room was still uncomfortably warm. The biggest issue we encountered was criminal activity in the Masquerade Casino Friday & Saturday evenings/early AM's as the Crown Nightclub was emptying. This club seems to cater to the locals and I think the management has inadvertently attracted a local criminal element. We saw drug deals being done in the casino and I overheard gang/criminal discussions along with drug usage in the restroom. Management has put added security in the area knowing that there are issues but seems ineffective in dealing with the problems. My wife was not comfortable in this part of the casino either Friday or Saturday nights. All that being said, we still love the staff at the property and feel a little guilty posting a negative review about the Rio, but thought it was necessary information to pass along.

Reviews.Title: “Just ask Eddie”
Reviews.Author: LarrySchroeder
Reviews.Content: The pools at the Rio in Las Vegas are fantastic ! ! Five Stars ! ! ! ! ! If you need any help at poolside just ask EDDIE head of security poolside , he will help you with anything you need ! ( to a degree that is ). Thank-you Eddie. From Marilyn & Larry Schroeder

Reviews.Title: “return to Rio”
Reviews.Author: MoBlu
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for the second time last week. It was much better this time around although arriving on a Tuesday may have helped. The check in line was short and they honored my request for a room with a better view. The room was beautiful albeit showing it's age (stains on the carpet, a little rust around the bottom of the bath doorjamb). It was clean and the bed was comfortable. They were running a promotion called "buffet of buffets" which I thought was included with the room but it wasn't. For $44.00 you got a 24 hour pass to the Carnival Buffet at the Rio or any of their sister properties (Caesar's Flamingo, Paris, and a few more). It was definitely worth it. Everyone I interacted with including the houskeepers, slot attendants, and dealers were all very friendly. The gambling however was not great but it wasn't great at any of the other hotels I visited either. So, I would definitely give the Rio another chance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: bobhiker
Reviews.Content: We arrived at RIO the day after Super Bowl for a three-night stay in the Ipanema Tower. Check-in was smooth with about a 10 minute wait in line before being served. The registration clerk was friendly and paid close attention to filling our special requests. Since we are bugs on cleanliness (no pun intended), the condition of the room was our main concern and it was very clean, not a speck of dust. The room was large (600’) with two queen beds, full sofa, coffee table, 32”TV, and writing desk. Beds were very comfortable and room was quiet. There was a separate area with a closet, safe, sink, refrigerator, and large counter space. A door from there opened to a smaller room that contained a full size tub, shower, toilet and another sink. The shower was strong and drained quickly. The only negative was the hot water in the shower lasted just a couple minutes. When first turned on it was very hot and needed to be turned down, but soon turned cool. The deals available on the RIO web site made it a great bargain, and there were NO resort or any mandatory fees. If you had been to this hotel several years ago you may recall a small window in the wall of the shower so a lady could peer into the main room while showering. Of course being a gentleman, one would never peer back. Those windows are long gone. Gambling was OK, and we were able to play quite a bit without losing the kids college funds. While gambling on the machines, drinks were offered often and the time between ordering/receiving was only 3 or 4 minutes. Alas those poor young ladies who deliver the drinks must not be paid well because none of them seemed able to afford many clothes. Again, being a gentleman, one could not stare. With one exception everyone in the hotel was outstanding. The one exception was a security guard sitting at his station in the casino. When I approached to ask a question he greeted me with “What do you want?” Located a half mile or so from the strip was not a problem as the free shuttle ran every 20-30 minutes to Harrah’s on the strip. Currently the evening free show in the sky is running Thursday through Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Workout!”
Reviews.Author: Bpluth
Reviews.Content: I was here on business and stayed at the hotel for four nights. My company isn't willing to pay $22 for me to go on a 40 minute run. I can't justify spending $22 per day for my workout. I worked long days and wouldn't have time to really enjoy it for more than an hour. So, I didn't get my workout in because it isn't really situated in a place where I felt comfortable going out for a run outside. A couple months ago I was at the Cosmopolitan which I would give 5 stars and even their fee for fitness was less. The rooms are large and if you are in the updated wing (which we were) it doesn't feel like you are stuck entirely in the 19th century.
