I like that their rooms are large and we had a great view of the strip. Because the Rio is off strip you get to see the city and are not blinded by it:) They do have the #1 rated buffet in Vegas. That was fabulous. I will say the food was very good every day. With 12 restaurants we ate at the hotel a majority of the time. The Italian restaurant was very good but the portions were very SMALL. The Chicken Parmesan didn't even come with a portion of pasta...just the chicken BUT it was phenomenal! Melted in my mouth...yum! As for the gambling, it was fair. Could get on a craps or blackjack table for $5-10. The "dancers" standing above the slot machines dancing I could have done without.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent yet inexpensive - great way to experience Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: john S
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very large and confortable. The staff was always helpful and friendly. Check-in and check-out was quick and smooth. It is off the strip but don't think that is a problem. There are two free shuttles running every fifteen minutes. The view of the strip from the wall of windows of our room was great. The free show in the sky Thursday through Saturday is a must see. It is one of the few Vegas hotels which does NOT charge a resort fee so the price you see online is the price you pay - No surprises at check-out. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the Rio is a great place”
Reviews.Author: scuba-chuck
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Rio for many years. The rooms are BIG and very nice. The pool is nice, although they do tend to play the music there too loud. The casino is fun, with a good mix of slots and tables. Restaurants are good. Buffet's are really good. Since they are not right on the strip, they do offer shuttle service (free) to the strip. Plus, they are right across the street from the Gold Coast Hotel, which has a very cheap buffet and a different selection of food. I recommend the Rio..!!

Reviews.Title: “its not all that.”
Reviews.Author: Shaun M
Reviews.Content: rooms are nice and big, but when we got in are room we went to use the mini bar and found it nearly emptie and all the beer that was in there was dated NOV,8TH 2010!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! so i called to have it restocked and it took them over a day to do it. i had to call twice. Check in people at the desk were snobby. just cause we dont gamble thousands of dollars shouldnt mean we are treated like peasents.

Reviews.Title: “Complimentary stays with Rewards Card”
Reviews.Author: goddesskitten
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed complimentary for a few days. Becoming a Total Rewards Member/ Card Holder has provided a very cheap almost free stay. There is an 11 dollar charge for telephone registration fee. Always a staple hotel for us in Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Avoid like the plague!”
Reviews.Author: Travellerb9
Reviews.Content: Prostitutes in the hall ways propositioning you, trailer trash everywhere! Just awful, awful, awful. And they rip you off on things like wifi where they charge per device not per room! AVOID!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of amenities for the value”
Reviews.Author: Wade L
Reviews.Content: Casinos in Vegas are alot alike starting with the main lobby to the elevators. I'm not a big fan of casinos but I was here for a convention and having booked early I got a great price especially for a suite. The halls to the rooms were dirty though - the maid service was pretty lax on my floor but the suite was surprisingly clean comparatively. The suite was huge and had a full wall of windows that over looked the pool area and had a great view of the city. I never ate at the hotel, the buffets are all alike as well. The day I actually spent in the pool area with my wife was fun but the music was incredibly loud. There was a carnival going on in back so the parking was horrible. All in all the price is the only thing that would get me back there.

Reviews.Title: “Have plans to travel to Las Vegas in the near future?”
Reviews.Author: DiamondCrown
Reviews.Content: Well, whatever you do or wherever you stay, DO NOT STAY AT THE RIO!!!!!!!!!!! The buffet there is wonderful, but the Rio is NOT meant for lodging. Stayed there for an impromptu night in a suite that on first appearance would look wonderful. I had a dinosaur Zenith television facing nowhere in particular - with NO premium channels or a swivel to turn the ginormous thing; a FILTHY green carpet that looked like it was NEVER cleaned... and you'd wanna throw away your slippers after walking on it rather than have to pack them back into your suitcase; sofa was so gross looking that I didn't dare to sit on it; a mini bar that charges you just for picking the item up, looking at it and putting it back (but I did get that $40 extra dollar charge removed from my account)... Had a non-smoking suite, but cigarette smell periodically comes blowing through the vents. OH, and I can't forget the bugs. Something bit me and I was referred to SECURITY to handle the bug problem... (for real... security). I was sent to go wait in my room for "someone" to come see me, and after 45 minutes of a no-show, I called them to see what the delay was. The not so polite guy (who spoke like a wannabe mob boss) said it made no sense coming to check for bugs because there would be no way to see them, and then wanted to know if I wanted him to send EMT to deal with the bites... uhggggggg. Thankfully I had a first aide kit in my pocketbook the contained Hydro-cortisone cream. I endured listening to the street traffic ALLLL night long, along with the train, and it didn't matter that I was very high up. The windows are NOT sound proof. Speaking of the windows, there is this protectant shield on the windows that distorts your view and makes you feel like you're looking through someone else's prescription glasses. Overall, nice view though. I can't forget about check out... Talk about a line from HELL, with a scant staff. No simple express check out. Your alternative to standing on the long line is to do a video check out on your television and wait for them to MAIL you your statement. Now if you go and stay there after reading this, you deserve what you get. FYI - I am a Travel Agent. A stay at the Motel 6 on Tropicana and Las Vegas Blvd beats a stay at the Rio on any day. Just HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Rate for a Suite”
Reviews.Author: watrskiergurl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great if you want to be a little ways off the strip. Its quieter. The pools are good including a salt pool with sand. The Buffetts are what this hotel is all about. SO MANY CHOICES AND SUCH GREAT FOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms great hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Valerie1948
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a four night stay Jan. 29th-Feb. 2nd. We arrived at midnight on the 29th so check in was a breeze. Asked for a room in the Ipenema Tower and got it. The room was a suite as this is an all suite hotel. Large bedroom, sofa and dressing area, separate from the bathroom and shower. Skip the pods of coffee ($8.00 for 3 pods) as it was just terrible. Strong and the dairy creamer provided inside the box of coffee pods just didn't do it. There are, I believe 2 starbucks on the premises. Gambling was ok. I am a video poker player and got a lot of play time while sitting at the bar closest to the cafe. I guess the best review is whether or not you would stay there again and I definitely would. I did not eat at any of the restaurants there. Well, not quite. I did eat at the chinese restaurant fast food place. (name escapes me.)which was excellent. My husband had duck which was succulent and tender. I had a huge soup bowl that I couldn't finish. Great for lunch. We did eat at Mon Ami Gabi at the Paris Hotel. I go there for their mussels. Sad to say, was disappointed as they were just ok this time around. I highly recommend the accomodations at the Rio. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Just Off Strip, but GREAT value!”
Reviews.Author: dave k
Reviews.Content: Rio is a huge complex that has convention area, large casino/gaming area/several pools and various restaurants on site. I was there for a four day convention and had a great stay. If one is in Vegas to gamble and be entertained, Rio is a pretty good deal. Live (free) shows in the casino happen nightly with overhead Mardi Gras parades (floats and beads included!) passing overhead...is pretty impressive. The gym on site does cost $22/day (i recommend the 3 day package for $53) but is WELL worth it! Sauna, whirlpool, steam room, full gym facilities, and attendants waiting on your every need are at the ready. Keep in mind---their large Pools aren't heated so arent open in winter months. Be sure to ask for an upgraded room with Strip view for just $20/more per night if you're in the Mascarade Tower. The standard rooms, while large, aren't upgraded and have a view of the desert/mountains. Free shuttle to the strip every 30 minutes, so don't spend the $ on a cab! Overall, a pretty good stay

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: ARMONTUSCANI513
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to the rio for six nights as a birthday trip. The room was large with plenty of room to move around, the buffet and restaurants are good food with good service the table games are fun the slots pay ok. The parking could be better! still enjoyed our stay very much and would definetly return to the rio.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: laur3njayn3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in May 2011 after receiving a fantastic deal through our Harrahs reward card - basically for the price we had it was almost free for 4 nights so couldn't not afford to try it. To be honest we were not too sure about the hotel as it was on the strip but with the regular free shuttle service to Paris or Harrahs it was no issue at all. The buses were running regularly - say 2 buses every 15/30 minutes. The last bus was 1am, if you wanted to stay out later you could either get a taxi or just walk. Fantastic sized rooms - it was a suite. Think thats standard with the Rio? It was clean, modern and we had a lovely view - we could see all the pools and the strip. The pools were great - about 3/4 of them. Plenty of space/room and great music. On the weekend it was a little busy but we eventually managed to get a sunbed. We ate at the pool bar which was good - nachos :) One night we went to the Rio's voodoo lounge on the 51st floor!! We tried one of the famous witchdoctor cocktails - wow!! it was lovely, slightly strong and was smoking with the dry ice.... cost $30 but it was a huge glass - me and my partner shared one. We then stood in the outside area with fantastic views of the strip. For the right price as its not on the strip we would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “The Good, the bad and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: ming9898
Reviews.Content: First the good. No resort fees! Large suite-like rooms and very pretty cocktail waitresses. The bad- difficult parking unless you're a Diamond level player or guest. Long lines to check in and equally long at the buffet(also remedied if you're a Diamond level guest). The Ugly - There is a coffee pot in the suite, with no coffee. If you want coffee packets you must go downstairs and buy them)3 for $8.95! No free wifi, they want $14.95 per day!!! I think this is where they get even for not charging resort fees. But the absolute worse is that every morning around 04:00am and also at other various times, if your room faces the Strip or north and south you'll hear loud and continious blaring of train horns every Day! So if a hotel fails at it's most basic requirement of providing a nights rest it does not deserve to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good”
Reviews.Author: mckevin32
Reviews.Content: On check-in the desk tried to give us a standard room even though we paid for premium. When I protested she gave us the room type we paid for but moved us to the older Masquerade tower, and I was too tired to argue further. Aside from that the rooms are HUGE and come with refrigerators. Everything was clean and worked well. Staff was generally very friendly and helpful. The bathroom is nicely set up with sinks both inside the room and another just outside the bath for make-up and such. The bed in our room was awesome! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some rumors true but rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: fancher04
Reviews.Content: The main thing I had heard about Rio is that it's full of hookers. Yes, quite a few do come out at night but nowadays you find a lot of that in several of the hotels. We overheard the security telling someone that had complained about them that every night they get detained and then they just pay a fee and come back. If you can overlook that, I actually was very happy with the room and the service we received from the front desk. The rooms were huge and one of them even had an extra sink (bar type sink) on the side of the sitting area. There were also 2 other sinks, one right outside of the bathroom and one inside. This made getting ready quite easy as that room had 3 girls in it. I was not as impressed with the Seafood buffet that is offered at the Rio. It's maybe just a tiny bit more extravagant than the regular buffet but the supposed lobsters they offer were more like langoustines. There was a new Dim Sung restaurant that seemed kind of nice. For less expensive meals there's also a Burger King on the premises.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Rio, There are things you should know!”
Reviews.Author: vegas8
Reviews.Content: stayed 9/21-9/24 20011. I loved the room compared to the Delux room at Flamingo(I usually stay there) or the standard room at Ballys. It was not a true Suite, but was large, with a seating area, make up area, and a fridge. We had no complaints about the room. The staff was great. The problem is, that you are not on the strip(we knew that going in) They offer a free shuttle but it did not start until 10:30 am. The Rio does not have a 24 hr coffee shop. If you are from the east and wake up at 4am vegas time, you are stuck until the buffet opens at 8:30. We walked to the Gold Coast next door and they didn't have a breakfast place until after 6. The Rio BlackJack rules also suck. The Gold Coast has great rules, but again its a walk to get there. If you have never been to vegas, and didn't know your way around this could be a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Booked on Hotwire”
Reviews.Author: downey
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 rooms on Hotwire for $38 per night (that's all there worth). Check in was reasonably quick despite 2 of the girls leaving just as I got to the front of the line. The rooms are big but dated, old CRT's with limited channels. $14 day for really slow wifi. Older bathtubs, one of the rooms had an avocado green tub. Old couches and chairs. Coffee, first time I've seen this: You have to buy individual packages from the mini bar for $8 (for 3 packs) then make your own coffee. $22 taxi from the airport. This place has seen better days, at least I didn't get stiffed with a "resort charge". I won't be buying on Hotwire again as I don't want to get stuck with this lemon. Two things were good the beds were comfy and the towels were of decent quality and fairly new. They made up for that with really cheap toiletries and toilet paper.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: Autumndeere
Reviews.Content: We had a comped room at the Rio (had never stayed there before). Beautiful room, comfy bed, awesome view, great staff. What more can you ask? We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “$5 to print boarding pass”
Reviews.Author: viv1271
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful king suite overlooking the pool area. The hotel seems much cleaner since we were there a few years back. The food in the Great American Bar & Grill was very good as was the service. The only drawback was the $5 minimum fee to use the computer to print your boarding pass. FYI my husband went to the concierge and paid $1 to get the boarding passes printed. It takes a few minutes longer but saves a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Deal”
Reviews.Author: kidvallian
Reviews.Content: This property was comped so what can I really say. Big rooms, nice sized bathtub and shower. The carpeting is needing replacement, and come on, no flat screen. I could by the Television on Craigslist for 20 dollars. The beds are very conch. Definately stay there, but won't play there.......

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but shower cold!!!”
Reviews.Author: Fzedlach
Reviews.Content: Self-parking is free and close, which was appreciated. I arrived at the check-in counter to find no line, and a friendly staff member to check me in. The room was very nice and spacious, and overlooked the strip. While it would not have been good for watching TV, as the TV was to the side of the bed, that wasn't an issue for me anyway. The room was clean, and the bed comfortable. The downside of the stay was the shower. It took, probably without exaggeration, about 10 minutes for the shower to at least become lukewarm. I was about half-way, up, so I'd hate to see how long it takes higher up. I'd return here though without question.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, good service, off the strip but free shuttle”
Reviews.Author: TrainingPro
Reviews.Content: Found Rio rooms to be gigantic compared to most Vegas rooms. 2 queen beds, nice lounge chair w ottoman, couch, coffee table, desk, chair and hutch for TV in main room. Nice long granite counter top w sink, kurieg coffee maker, then door to toilet and shower. Plenty of room for 2 friends to share room. Attended a conference and as usual in these places, just getting to conf side of hotel was my daily exercise. Facilities very nice and service from IT TEAM to help speakers set up was great. Food adequate but packed at lunchtime when conferences broke around noon. Lines sometime 30 people deep. All in all decent place with free shuttle to strip.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: gumball1963
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a guys long weekend. Had a comped Queen suite. I did not expect much so the room was better than expected. Large room. Had a newer couch and chair. Yes no HD tv,but I left the room by 8 AM and did not return until bedtime. Room was clean . Don't be afraid to stay. If you want better pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: the_beach_911
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Rio at the beginning of January for a couple nights. Received a GREAT rate directly from their website (always book directly!) Free valet service was great and the valet and bell staff are quick and courteous. Even all of the housekeepers say hello to you in the hallway. No resort fees as this is a Caesar's property and that's a plus. If you do want to use the gym you do have to pay a daily fee, but we were in vacation, and this is Vegas, the gym can wait. Check-in was quick and easy. The room was spacious, clean, and had a large vanity area for multiple people to get ready. The only thing I didn't like was the old tube TV. It just kind of ruined the atmosphere, but we weren't really in the room a lot so it didn't matter much. It is off the strip, but not by much, and the free shuttle to the strip every 15 minutes was convenient and always on time. The casino isn't very large compared to casinos on the strip, but it's Vegas, another casino is just down the block. Just because you stay off the strip doesn't mean you won't get the on-strip experience. You just have to do your homework and plan your trip right. The Rio helped us have a great Las Vegas stay at a tremendous value.

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip Lodging”
Reviews.Author: Holly_Jocoy
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Rio for about nine years now; enjoying each stay. Sometimes for business, in recent years for leisure. Most recently, spouse took me and his mom and her husband out for a holiday getaway. We enjoyed a few things together, meals mainly, and came together to share things we had done apart from each other... What movies we saw, what exhibits and shows we went to, or wanted to go to. It was a good place for two forty-somethings and a sixty-something to gather, spring from.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable pit stop”
Reviews.Author: Beyond_all_Borders
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night, as I needed to change to a less expensive hotel after an exhausting business convention. Picked up this suite (they're all suites) for $22 before taxes. For what it was worth it was exactly what I needed. Picked up dinner from the convenient store on the casino level and enjoyed my night relaxing in the room. On a side note, I've been to the Rio before and enjoyed the casino and the Carnival World Buffet. I'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back! Terrible service policy!”
Reviews.Author: Nate B
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Rio for 5 days during the 2012 CES convention. While the room was large and fairly clean, it was old. The TV was a monstrous antique that almost seemed to fall out of the cabinet. But the WORST thing was the service upon leaving. DON'T DO ANY DRY CLEANING THERE! We spent a lot of money at the hotel, but when we went to claim that our friend's new shirt had been damaged in the hotel's dry cleaning service, the service desk gave us the runaround. Called the manager and he basically said his hands were tied. We'd have to go through the claims department but only after spending 20 minutes with security taking a statement and taking a photo (that not even the claims department could see clearly enough). Then, after waiting two weeks, we found out that the claims department was still investigating and wasn't sure, based on the photo, if what we had claimed were true, that the ink from the shirt had bled into 4-5 spots. My friend had dry cleaned it to avoid this in the first place. It was a $100 shirt, and after dropping a lot of money at the casino, he's still waiting to be reimbursed after 2 weeks. So easy to take our money, but their policy for reimbursing for their own mistake is slower than you can imagine! I can't recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe we got lucky, but a great experience”
Reviews.Author: too_few_trips_1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Rio for one night to extend a long weekend in Las Vegas. We had visited previously to visit the wine bar (not for a stay) and had a sense of the property. So, we had modest expectations for the room, but the price was right. All of that said, we were very pleased with our experience. For whatever reason, we were placed on the elite floor of the Ipanema Tower. The room was very modern and spacious. We had a view of the Strip. In addition to the usual amenities, the room included a jacuzzi tub, a DVD player, and a CD receiver. All very nice. Needless to say, though, I can't really say what the average room is like. I do have some minor complaints, but these pale in comparison to the positives of our experience. There were, for example, no instructions for either the DVD player or the tub and neither was intuitive. We ordered from room service and all of the food seemed very salty. For room service, though, the price was very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Management Claims "Not Responsible for Actions of those Staying in Our Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: dcdjshaw
Reviews.Content: Friday night party down the hall started at 2 a.m. Overlooked it, though made sleep difficult. Saturday night, party was going strong at 11 pm including boom box and many, many partiers - spilling out into the hallway. 1 a.m phonecall to front desk resulted in boom box being turned down just below heart thumping levels. 1:30 a.m phone call resulted in boombox being turned off and drunken loud guests moving to hallway to yell thier displeasure for several hours. Front desk at 7 am claimed partiers had been evicted - though the room was still occupied. Request to move to another room resulted in being told there were none available. Conversation with daytime manager resulted in being told "we are not responsible for the actions of those staying in our hotel" and confirmation that the partiers had not checked out or "been evicted" as the morning manager claimed. Definately do not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Was much better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Fitzmaster
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 6 nights at the Rio. It was my first time in Vegas and was attending a conference and decided to stay a few extra days. HINT: Make sure you get a Total Rewards Card even if you don't gamble as there are lots of coupons and discounts in all the Ceaser Entertainment resorts. Check-In: The only really poor experience was check-in. It was slow (5 people at the front desk and only 2 taking customers) and then the clerk I got somehow forgot how to smile -- she was very grumpy and not a great first impression of the hotel. Other than that I was very pleased. Room and Parking: I was on 12th floor and room was big, clean and beds were great. I was in the smaller tower facing the Gold Coast casino. The thing that suprised me the most was how quiet it was. I didn't hear people in the other rooms, doors banging, traffic, people in hallway (and no I wasn't drinking!). And I am very easily annoyed by these things so I was very happy. Lots of drawer space and hangers, closet space, the separate vanity area with a sink is good. I'll try and post a picture of the hotel room shortly. Lots of self-parking available. HINT: Park on the 4th floor of the Masquerade Parkade and you have the overpass to the casino. Food: I was very much looking forward to the Seafood Buffet but on day 2 I went to Carnival Buffet and was pleased. They had mounds of snowcrab and shrimp and many other fish entrees. Not to mention Italian, Mexican, Carving Stations, etc. etc. etc. HINT: Go to the 1/2 price ticket booths on the strip and for $2 you can get 25% off which is cheaper than just using your total rewards card. The I went and looked at the Seafood Buffet and honestly don't feel that it is worth the extra $10 so I never went. The Carnival buffet lines start to get long at around 5:00 pm so if you want to go in and out fast -- go early. I never really saw the line at the Seafood one get anywhere near as long as the Carnival. The Deli by the sports bar has farily decent and inexpensive burgers (much cheaper than room service). The Voodoo Steakhouse was very good as well. MAKE SURE you spend some time out on the balcony as it's on the 50th floor and the view is amazing. Rest of the time I ate out or at the conference (which had surprisingly good food). ANOTHER HINT: You can bring your own instant coffee (eg. I brought some Tim Horton's French Vanilla Cappacino with me) and use the machine to make the hot water (or you can make tea same way). Its a lot cheaper than buying the K-cups or Starbucks. Only problem is the sink is alllllll they way on the other side of the room so that can be annoying if you want to make several cups. MORE HINTS: DO NOT taking anything out of the bar fridge to take a look at it. The items that are taking out are tracked by a one way barcode scanner (only on the way out, not on the way in) so even if you take something out and then replace it, you will still be charged. Other reviewers seem to be upset that there is no flat screen TV but not sure why. The TV's worked great, although there are limited number of channels (so if you're planning to be in your room watching TV or are looking to watch your favorite TV series, you will be disappointed. Entertainment/Casino: Went to see Penn and Teller. Again, purchased my tickets at the 1/2 price booth the day of. They said it was for mezzanine or balcony only but when I got my tickets at the box office I ended up in the 7th row front and centre. They fill up the orchestra section first so they don't have to open up the other sections. HINT: Pick-up your tickets from the box office earlier in the day so you don't have to wait in any big line-ups and you wll get better seats. Drinks at the shows were more expensive and a bottle of water was $2 so unless you absolulety can't go without a drink for 2 hours, wait till you get out to the Casino. HINT: Penn and Teller run out of the theater after their show NOT to get away, but to position themselves in the hallway as you exit so you can come up and speak with them and take pictures. They will stay as long as people are there so that's great fan appreciation. Class act guys! The show in the sky was good. If you don't get any beads (or don't want to hope you get one), they have free pictures with a couple of the performers and will give you beads when you get it taken. ANOTHER HINT: If you're in the casino for more than 1 show, stay by the bar (near the BK end) and get a prime spot to watch the flair bartender who performs after the show in the sky. The "bar dancers" were kinda cheesy but the drink service was extremely fast and efficient. The waiters was always friendly. One takes your drink order on a tablet and then someone else brings it to you within 5 minutes. The slots were tight (at least for me) for most of the trip until the last night when I won all my money back. Sat by someone who won $4500 on Keno machine and saw lots of people hit the 1000 coins on the Wheel of Fortune game. They only have two 25 cent Progressive Wheel slots and they were often taken so that was a bit of a bummer (but the jackpot didn't go while I was there so I guess that saved me some money!). All in all I thought the resort was great. I only paid $420 for 6 nights (taxes included) with an additional $50 for internet. Internet was not wireless but I only worked at the desk so it was no problem. It was very fast and no issues with connections or service. I would have liked to have used the gym but I would not pay $17 a day for that priviledge. Shopping and Transportation: Eventhough I had a car, I still took the shuttle to the strip one evening so I didn't have to contend with the traffic and parking. The shuttle was fast and efficient and it's easier to catch the one to Bally's rather than Harrah's (and they are only two blocks away from each other). Not a great selection of shops but they had all the required spandex and sequence that seems to be a pre-requisite in Vegas! Too bad I'm a little too old and a little to large to fit into it (although that didn't seem to stop others -- tee hee). Sorry for being long winded but hope that you get some value in the review. My 4 stars might be someone elses 3 or 5 so that's why I try and provide some details for other to use. If you have any other questions, don't hesitate to message me and I'll get back to you asap.

Reviews.Title: “First stay”
Reviews.Author: Tim J
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Rio,not first visit to Vegas though.It was great from the begining friendly valet,bell service,fast check in,room was super very spacious (windows needed cleaned but no big deal) room kept neat and clean daily not constantly bothered by people wanting to get you to do show et c for visiting whatever they are trying to sell you less noise than stripeasy to get to strip if you want to,Casino service is fast with new way they do it rshowone person takes order and then within few minutes server shows up.Will stay here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “very nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the rio Suites for 3 nights. Walked in - Checked in. The room was fabulous - clean, large and very comfortable. Loved the bed and the way the bathroom is set up is great. The room decor was updated . Had a view of Vegas and the mountains,very quite. Have been to Las Vegas many other times, this will be where I stay from now on. Never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: JoeRFreitas
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a business trip in 2009. Fantastic view from the Voodo Lounge, a bar with an open space that allows you to have an espectacular view of LV at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: glee07
Reviews.Content: We loved it. Gorgeous suite with a fab view. The rooftop restaurant is good. Would love to return at some point.

Reviews.Title: “My last review of the Rio”
Reviews.Author: garnetca
Reviews.Content: The is my last review of the Rio as I won't be going back there. Ive been a Diamond player for years. My last stay started out with a great looking room, comfortable bed. The problem was it overlooked the train yard, highway and a major road that runs from the Palms to Caesars. All night my room shook, sirens blared and trucks roared by on the highway. I got zero sleep. I was at the VIP area at 8am in the morning when they opened and asked to be moved to another room. There was none clean, so I waited. And waited. And waited. Finally at 1:30 they still didn't have one to move me too. 2 more hours at least. I ended up checking out and going to another non-Harrahs hotel. They never even asked my why I was checking out early. So, this is my swan song review of the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “5 Nights at The Rio”
Reviews.Author: Elaine H
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in we were very impressed with the beautiful suites... they were tremendous. The check in and check out process was very pleasant and all the employees there were great from the cocktail waitresses in the casinos to the housekeeping staff, the wait staff in the buffet and the reception area... all were very professional. Although I think next time I would prefer staying "on the strip" as we have done in the past, the shuttle bus the Rio runs to Harrah's and Bally's was a very efficient method of getting back and forth. The Carnival Buffet at the Rio was great. We had previously stayed at the Bellaggio and The Monte Carlo and I have to say the variety and quality of the food at the buffet at the Rio was exceptional and very reasonably priced. It is very popular as you could tell from the long, long lines there ... better to eat an early dinner (around 4:00). All in all I would recommend the Rio to anyone looking for large, comfortable and clean suites and if you don't mind staying "off the strip" this is a terrific option.

Reviews.Title: “good time at the rio”
Reviews.Author: dayzeemae23
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at the Rio. Great drink service, check in under 20 minutes, spacious rooms, free shuttle to the strip, comfy beds and the staff was very accomodating. Only gripes: the room could have been a little cleaner, the tub didn't drain very well, and it was a little way from the strip. All in all, it was a great stay and we would totally stay here again. Tip: Bring your own K-Cups for the coffee maker- it will save you big bucks. Also, they charge a $200 deposit cash or credit to stay here. Ours was immediately put back on our card upon departure.

Reviews.Title: “Nickel & Dime...”
Reviews.Author: YorkRegionYnot
Reviews.Content: Room is clean and reasonably priced. But shower water was not warm enough, fluctuating with temperature. Very uncomfortable the first night. What surprised us the most is they even charge you for using the coffee machine with coffee packages in the room. They also cleverly display on your desk telling you internet is available, but once you log on, you are told that one day plan is about $14. Those two things were thrown right onto your face when you got in. We immediately felt a bit frustrated and lost the appetite. A matter of principle. Don't understand why a hotel like this would nickel and dime like that. I know some downtown hotels catering business travelers in large cities do that, but it is Vegas, for Pete's sake. Room was spacious, but what is the use? Like most of the people, we only slept there. Also it is off Strip, that means you will have to take a shuttle to Harrah's or Bally, to get to the Strip. It costs more from and to the airport. We actually took local bus from airport. It is route 109, connecting to 202 (ask bus driver for directions). One way fare is $3 per person, beat $7-8/person by shuttle bus, or $18-22 by taxi. Next time we will stay at a hotel along the Strip with hot shower water, free internet and in-room coffee machine. A matter of principle.

Reviews.Title: “I have traveled a lot”
Reviews.Author: carol b
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for the Bee keeper's conf. of America. The Trip of stay at the RIO was to close to trip to New Orleans ! I have NO idea if the hotel employees have any type of salary or if they live on tips ? You should always have $10-$15 in Ones to cover a day in hotel. 3 Months ago made reservations for a king bed. Paid off full total of bill two weeks ahead. ( yes we have it ). Called that morning before flight to arrive between 7-8pm ( yes we have it) NO WE CANT HOLD A RESERVATION ! Moved the next day at 5pm to what was reserved.--Thanks Charles---------- So the machines are tight-Tight-Tight- Even on Friday the 13th Tight. Try one at a time -get some back- 2x and 3x NO GO ! If you want a free drink ? 3 min-- is really 10 min. Save the dollar tip and get one for $5. at thed bar-- You can loose a $20 just for waiting. REALLY ? Have some fun !!! My guy was Bummed about the poker tables so costly -- He sat and watched TV in the room .GO do stuff January 2012 -not a great time. Think I'll try again with the Indians !!!! OH !! If your up for the walk -- Take the shuttle to Harras and walk the 5+ miles to the Golden Nugget. Lots of veiw just by walking to call it a REAL tri[p ! Stop and grab a Cigar ! Then save $30 for your taxi back to the RIO !!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Marcasso
Reviews.Content: I met the family in Las Vegas for a nephew's wedding. The rooms are huge. My room was especially large I think because it was next to the elevator. I visited the other rooms and they were big too, just not as big as mine. The only reason I gave 4 stars was because I felt the bed could be more comfortable. I had a wet bar and two sinks. There is a window looking out of the wall of the shower into the bedroom area which was a bit weird...i had a room like that in Paris France once. The weekends are obviously more expensive, but wow...only $39 for sunday night and monday night :) The car valet was always fast. The maids cleaned well. The gambling downstairs was good for me only one day. The casino has a good energy going for it I'll say that. I've been to lots of casinos and this one always has a good atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Exciting!!”
Reviews.Author: sdecker77145
Reviews.Content: We started staying at the Rio in Vegas 9 years ago. We have since stayed at Paris and Caesar's on the strip and always go back to the Rio. The free shuttle service runs all day lon about every 15 minutes that takes us to many places on the strip so we do not feel isolated from the strip at all. The Rio is always clean, beautiful and exciting! All of the rooms are suites, so you always feel special. The daily Masquerade Show in the Sky is fantastic and the "Bevertainers" are such an original idea---folks who serve you drinks, then get on stage to sing and dance throughout the whole casino periodically. Customer service is beyond excellent and the restaurant selections are all fabulous and satisfying. The Voodoo lounge-outside facing the strip on the 51st floor-is a wonderful experience and alot of fun-even for older adults!!! We just keep going back because we always have the best overall experiences of Vegas at the Rio!!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious”
Reviews.Author: Geo60
Reviews.Content: It's not on the strip, but so close that it's actually better, less hectic, still very convenient & competitively price. Super clean updated room was BIG. Desk, sofa, easy chair and room to spare. Efficient desk, friendly staff. Parking deck is a short walk. Was surprisingly good actually (wow!).

Reviews.Title: “Super great property 5 stars in my book!”
Reviews.Author: Mperry888
Reviews.Content: Great price booked on Rio's website. Room was large and comfortable. Clean and nice In the casino the drinks were always right there when you needed one. They use IPads to take your order. We will be back in Sept! Thanks Rio you were the bomb.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the rate for sure”
Reviews.Author: tominiowa
Reviews.Content: I got a super rate of $20/night.. We worth it. The room is older and the shower was a cobimenation shower/tub. I much prefer shower only. Actually had hotter water and more pressure at the Fitzgeralds down town. The regular buffet was nice but getting pricey. Just how much food do you need to choose from? Here there is endless amounts and variety. Thumbs up to what I think it the best valet in town. Nice bartenders near the seafood buffet and the show in sky is worth the free price. Would I stay again, Sure at the right rate.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vegas hotel”
Reviews.Author: WiscDoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio when in Vegas in December 2011 to run the Rock 'n Roll half marathon. We were in a room in the Masquerade Tower. Rooms seem a little dated, but they are huge and the beds are very comfortable. Smelled cigarette smoke coming from the room next door, even though we were on a non-smoking floor. Having the fridge was great to keep pre-race drinks and food chilled. It was also nice to have a sink inside and outside the bathroom, and there is plenty of counter space available. The location was a bit too far from the half marathon start at Mandalay Bay, which I knew based on previous trips to Vegas. We just got a good rate we couldn't pass up that weekend. Overall, no complaints about the Rio!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mm404
Reviews.Content: Stayed ihere in january 2010. i'm a little behind on my reviews. we stayed here entirely on the basis that the rooms were comped from the harrahs reward program. we go to a.c. on occasion. good value, good buffet. room was big and clean. check in was easy and we were able to check in very early. shuttle was easy and never had to wait too long, however i prefer to stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Quick Getaway”
Reviews.Author: russ6212
Reviews.Content: Just returned from my quick getaway from the Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino. And let me tell you that this is the first time every since I have been going to Las Vegas staying in a hotel not on the strip. First the Studio Suite I had was great, King Size Bed, Desk, Chair, and Sofa not to mention Mini Bar which I did not use, a refrigerator, safe, ect. The room had lots of room to move around. The casino was nice and big with lots to do. The food was great with the Carnival Buffet & The Seafood Buffet on the other side. If you want to go to the Las Vegas Strip you can just go outside and catch 1 of 2 shuttles every 1/2 hour and you can go to either Bally/Paris or to Harris Las Vegas Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid VooDoo Lounge”
Reviews.Author: R M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were looking forward to doing a little dancing, and the VooDoo Lounge had bee a favorite in the past. After paying a $20/person cover, we found the roof-level lounge populated with about 5 ladies and about 30 single men. The downstairs area of the formerly two-level lounge was closed off. Although there was a DJ playing music, there was no dance floor and one of the ladies was dancing on a raised and lit table, one of two places that seemed available for dancing. The roof-top area outside had a second bar, but it was far two cold and windy for patrons, and two people behind the bar were bundled up and huddled with notjhing to do. The part of the loung that was operating feautrued about a dozen seating areas, but all but two were roped off, with security guards ensuring nobody could sit in them unless thay paid for "bottle service", meaning there was absolutely no place to sit down unless you paid another $100 over your $40 (for two) cover charge. We took 10 minutes to buy two drinks, look out on the roof, and try to sit down, then left. The elevator down doesn't take you back to the second-floor entrance, so we had to walk through the casino, up the second level, and then back to the VooDoo entrance, where we were told the cover was non-refundable. After some dispute, and a call to the lounge manager, they relented and provided the refund. It's no mystery why this place is dying. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Buffet, but. . . .”
Reviews.Author: Dleg4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for a 3-day conference. All rooms are suites & very roomy. Very friendly staff. The food provided for our conference meals was amazing. Plentiful buffet meals set up in our general session meeting halls. The staff did a great job while serving 100's of people. Also, the World Buffet is very nice (so many foods to choose from). A few room complaints: 1) no flat-screen t.v. /picture on old set very bad, 2) my friend's room often did not have hot water, and 3) staff needs to pick up hallway room service leftovers in a more timely manner. Often, the hallways were littered with trays, dishes, etc. that took a very long time to be picked up. One beer bottle stood outside the same room for two whole days!

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Great staff”
Reviews.Author: DorothyMacaw
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 day stay at the Rio. January 09 to January 14. From the time I entered the hotel until the time I left the staff provided excellent service. The check-in was fast, efficient and friendly. I was given a room in the Masquerade tower (which I assume is the older one) on the 31st floor. The view faced the pool and had a reasonable nice view of the northern part of the strip. What I found odd was the mini bar and big block of a television were place smack dab in the middle of the window. It really blocked a potentially very nice view. The room was clean and housekeeping did a nice job during my stay. The room was vacuumed daily and of course the the bed was remade and the bathroom cleaned daily. I honestly didn't spend all the much time in the room. Daylight I was at a convention and the evenings were taken up with shows and dinners. Except for changing clothes and sleeping I was gone. I found the room just fine for that, especially at the price. The other tower might be a better choice for the next trip due to the Voodoo lounge being right below the tower and the thumping bass of the music might bother some of the lighter sleepers. The staff is outstanding. I never felt any indifference from anyone. I dided at the Sao Paulo for breakfast several times. My food was always made as I had ordered and arrived quickly. The barkeeps at the main bar were great about keeping the glasses full and the ash trays clean as well as offering the occasional (when asked) tip on the video poker games. I found the valet parking to be no different that any other hotel on the strip and better than a couple I used (Caesers comes to mind in the poor category). The attendants took the car off my hands quickly and the pick up was just as efficient. It was always first come first served and always an offer of directions or help by the staff. All in all I think the Rio is a good choice and I would certainly recommend it to friends visiting Las Vegas in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms but a Little Cheesy”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynGarcon
Reviews.Content: The Rio has huge rooms, of that there is no question. My suite was enormous, in fact, it was so huge it felt a little empty. The room had a (very comfortable) bed, a couple of night tables, a couch, a coffee table, and a lot of empty space. I'm not complaining, but it did feel a little weird. The place is also a little old-school Vegas cheesy, with decidedly 80's style decor in the rooms, and flashy neon strewn all over the lobby and casino area. My check-in and check-out were very quick although I could see how it could be slow at peak times with such a relatively small staff working the front desk. Finally, the Rio is not on the strip, so if you want to do Vegas beyond the Rio it's not the most convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: Wheelsman
Reviews.Content: I had an allergic reaction from being bitten by bed bugs after staying here. I wish I would have read the posts from others before I stayed here.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and delicious buffet”
Reviews.Content: We go to Las Vegas several times a year and usually stay at the Rio. The rooms are large and there are vanity sinks in both the bathroom and dressing area. Furnishings are showing a little wear, but it always seems clean. If you are there at a busy time, the check-in can take a while, but they have video check-out. Many rooms have nice views of the strip. The beds are very comfortable and linens are plush. If you belong to the players club, you can get very good prices - we even often get free rooms, even though we don't gamble very much. There is no "resort fee" associated with your stay, and there is a free shuttle to take you to the strip. The Carnival World Buffet has been our favorite place to eat for many years. The fresh-cooked Mongolian Barbecue is great. The casino gets a little smokey, especially on the weekends, but the non-smoking rooms smell fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, spacious room if you can make it past the hallway smoking....”
Reviews.Author: Jonagold4
Reviews.Content: As with all VEGAS hotels, if you can walk to the end of the corridor comfortably, and that can be a long walk from elevators, it will be less likely for you to disturbed at night by inconsiderate, loud a/o drunk guest ambling along. I don't understand why there is not a no-smoking floor. Smokers congregate near the elevator areas, at least for the Ipanema Tower. Also, the casino's ventilation system didn't seem adequate and the smokiness pervaded all the restaurants open to the casino floor, except Buzios, nice and quiet. Food was okay, not exceptional and there are reduced prices for Players Club members. So, get a card! The pool was closed (January) and didn't find the gym. Check in around 10 pm was lenghty with only a few desk personnel and a long line, Be patient. Check out was via phone. Bell desk was prompt in getting luggage to and from room and valet parking was fairly quick. The parking garage that was most convenient to hotel is off of Valley View Drive. Otherwise, if you enter and go right, you hit the Masquerade garage which puts you into the Masquerade area. They now do a burlesque show- six male and female dancers plus some really good male and female singers who sing to canned music, four or five times a night. Best viewing is from one of the second floor curved balconies opp. the stage. Most importantly, as the Rio lets the world know, there is no 'resort fee' which at other hotels can easily be $15 a day. So, this makes for a good value and you are on Flamingo, near the Palms and Goldcoast plus near the 1-15 on ramps to take you further north or south on the strip....The coffee machine in the room is a Kerug. So, bring your own with you and not pay $8 for a package of three in the gift shop. I actually had most of my meals at the Tuscany coffee shop down the road

Reviews.Title: “Good value but a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: GuyWhoTravelsALot
Reviews.Content: Rio has an attractive casino, lots of restaurants and bars, and very friendly staff. The rooms, mine at least, was really showing its age. It was clean but the sink was cracked and the carpet was fully depreciated. Even though I was on a non-smoking floor in a non-smoking room, there were still ashtrays around and the room smelled of smoke. Like many Vegas hotels is a hike form the front desk to the room. A good 10 minutes in my case. I wouldn't balk at going back to Rio but I also wouldn't actively seek it out. Final suggestion: skip Rio's Voodoo steak joint.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel Off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: cmang17
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very roomy and a good price. The service was also good, the room was in good condition and it was kept clean. The Rio is not on the strip and if it is your first time visiting Vegas and wanna be close to everything then this is not the place for you. If you have been to Vegas a few times before and just need a decent room then this is a very good place. They have a shuttle to take you back and forth to the middle of the strip which is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “RIO Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MJC134
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RIO 1/7/12 - 1/10/12. Check in was smooth and quick. Our room was older but it was clean. Everyday it was cleaned and fresh towels and house keeping did a nice job. Yes, the room needs updates, but it's Vegas, how much time did we spend in the room? Maybe 5 hours a day. The cocktail waitresses were using what looked to be IPADs at nights to take the drink orders and then another person would come over to the tables with the drinks. The drinks were coming very quickly, seems like a very efficient system there testing. Spent a ton of time at the Sportsbook. Decent deal on Buckets of Beer and enjoyed the food that was available right next to the sportsbook. Ate at All American Grill once, not bad. Had a dinner at the Voo Doo Steak House and had a great time. A little pricey, but the view was worth it. Overall, this was our second year in a row at the RIO for Wild Card Weekend and they took care of us. Yes, I will the corporation would invest some serious money and update the rooms, there not perfect but they were clean and the staff was great. A special shout out to the girls doing the massages at the Sportsbook...absolutely love having that service while I'm watching football. That is priceless.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great location”
Reviews.Author: Latinhunny33
Reviews.Content: Although we waited 30+ minutes to check in, we had an enjoyable 2 night stay. Rooms could use a little updating but were very spacious and the beds were clean & comfortable. Parking garage is a plus since your car won't be roasting in the Vegas sun but it was still quite a hike. Some amazing views from our room, and you're right off the Strip. Not too far from anything. Food at Voodoo was delicious & the views can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “OK..for off strip”
Reviews.Author: christy8_77
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas. Casino is dated but still kinda neat. NOT for children. The dancers in the nighttime show are dressed in lingerie. Room was HUGE..twice the size of other hotel rooms with floor to ceiling windows. Room was clean and linens were nice..bathroom tile in shower was very dated and needed replaced. Starbucks in hotel which was very convenient. Service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back!”
Reviews.Author: msuzannehogan
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time! This is the fifth time staying at the Rio since 2001. Things have change. The show only goes Thursday thru Saturday and nots so many people! Still the rooms are large and the staff very nice and helpful. I stayed in the Masquerade tower for the first time and loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Good price/value”
Reviews.Author: auggiemctavish
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night and got a good mid week price. I was upgraded to the top floor of the Ipanema Tower- 20th floor. Had to use a key card, not sure why. Looks like the lounge and extras have been taken away. Room was very nice the only was that it was a smoking room. Didn't realize it at first but sure did at 5 in the morning. I would stay here again if I was by myself, don't think Mrs. McTavish would be too thrilled.

Reviews.Title: “No resort fees but plenty of other charges.”
Reviews.Author: John Ross E
Reviews.Content: This is one of the eight Caesar's Entertainment properties in the Las Vegas market that is marketed with no resort fees as a bonus. This is not a plus at all unless you just want a roof over your head and no amenities. The available amenities are the same as the resort fee hotels with one big difference. Each item is a separate charge, and the charge for just one of these, Internet access wired, not wireless, is $14.95 daily and is as much as the resort fee at other non Caesars properties. MGM Mirage properties typically charge a resort fee of $16.95, but this fee includes wired and wireless internet access, daily newspapers, unlimited fitness center access as long as you're a guest, in room bottles of water, and more.In addition, I've compared rates between the two different hotels, resort fee and no resort fee, and the average nightly rates are typically more at the no resort fees hotels. You have to ask yourself, what are you really saving? I don't think you should have to compromise quality and value just because you don't like the name of a charge. If you don't care about any of the things I mentioned, feel free to check into a no resort fee property, but don't expect much of anything.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Costs”
Reviews.Author: happybeach2003
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at Rio because the rates were great. We got there and we had a 13.95 internet fee each day and we had to buy a 3 pack of k-cups for $8 if we wanted coffee in the room. Not a big deal, but as we looked at it, we could have stayed on the strip for a little bit more especially, if you take a cab at all. Rooms were nice, but looking a bit worn. We bought the room upgrade. It was as far from the elevator that you can get and the room was not redone like the front desk told us. It was very worn. Beds were below average, too. Food was average on the main floor restaurants. My advice is not to stay here if you can get into another Las Vegas Strip casino/hotel. It is handier and more is included. Beware that this hotel is part of the Caesar's group which includes Imperial Palace, Bally's, Harrah's and Caesar's Palace. Hidden costs live there!

Reviews.Title: “Rio rooms are very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Cecilel
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas after spending 2 nights at the Rio All-Suites Hotel and Casino. The check in process was very easy and speedy. The room type we requested was assigned on the 6th floor. We could have paid an additional $20 per night and would be assigned higher up and with a view. We decided to stick to the 6th floor as we knew we would not be in our room that much! The room was very large with a sitting area, King bed, very large bathroom and two dressing counters, one in the bathtub area with the toilet (could close the door) and the other counter in the bath area with the closet. The room as very clean and well designed. The bed was very comfortable with extra pillows. The TV was not a flat screen and hopefully they will up date that soon. The large couch made up into a bed for additional person in the room. It was large enough for a family of four and I would suggest the hotel for a family with children. The buffet was very good. We purchased the $44.95 Buffet program ( total rewards rate) on the first evening that we arrived. This gave us 7 buffets during a 24hr period. We used dinner for the first night and the next day had breakfast, lunch and dinner. We enjoyed eating at the buffet at Planet Hollywood and the Rio. Caesars was closed for repairs, which was a disappointment, will be open by Oct 2012. Flamingo buffet was terrible. Check out the Harrahs Total Reward Program for details and hotels included. The Casino at Rio was clean with pleasant employees and a good selection of casino games. We did not try any of the other restaurants in the hotel, however, next door at Gold Coast, is the TGI Fridays. Rio offered shuttle service to the strip from early morning until 1am. Great service to use. Parking Free at the Rio and other Harrah properties in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “A 4 star experience for a 2 star price”
Reviews.Author: jabmoore
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Rio although I go to Vegas 4-5 times a year. This trip was unplanned and I simply booked the least expensive room I could find for a quick trip. I was very happy with the Rio. The room was beautiful, the bed amazingly comfortable and the bathroom was excellent (plenty of towels, water pressure and lighting) Will definitely stay here again. Also, loved the American Bar & Grill at the hotel, please see separate review.

Reviews.Title: “PARTY PARTY PARTY”
Reviews.Author: travelprincess27
Reviews.Content: Great fun, had read some bad reviews prior to our trip - but as far as I was concerned it was perfect. Yes it is a conference Hotel, but they are so large the conferences do not take over the Hotel. Room clean, housekeeping perfect, noise level good - no complaints.......Certainly party central at the weekends, but all great fun and if you cant avoid then join in. All in all great Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Nightmare!!!”
Reviews.Author: jessica w
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married December 25, 2011 and decided to stay at the Rio again. We stayed there earlier in the year for my daughter's birthday. Unfortunately, I was hospitalized immediately preceding our check-in and required a disabled guest room. They were more than accommodating for the exception of their staff refusing to provide me with a wheelchair escort to my room. No, they only offered wheelchairs for rent which meant we had to pay for the wheelchair for our entire stay. The room was beautiful and very large. However, the day we were to check out, my toddler son woke up with what appeared to be bites all over his baby body. Initially thinking they were bed bug bites, we called Security to check it out and file a report. In the mean time, we gave my son another bath (the first bath being the night before check out) to try to calm the spreading marks all over him. By the time Security arrived to our room, the marks were spreading very quickly. We rushed to check out and take him to the doctor as these red marks were now very rapidly spreading. It was very scary to watch. Security seemed unconcerned. He was diagnosed with a viral infection that he must've contracted from the bath tub in the hotel room and only further aggravated the situation when we gave him the second bath. I heard from their Risk Management department some time later, who also seemed unconcerned. I expressed my worry that this would happen to someone else who tried to use the bathtubs and even sent the attached pictures to them, but their stance did not change. They were only focused on whether or not I would be pursuing legal recourse. Ridiculous!! So as local honeymooners in las vegas and management in this industry, we had our pick of hotels to utilize for our honeymoon. We decided to stay with the Rio again, because the room was so beautiful when we stayed with them before. Boy did we pick the wrong place!! In my wedding dress and high heels, my mother and I were waiting in line to check in Christmas evening and I found a shawl that someone lost on the floor. I picked it up and when we approached the front desk, I turned it into the clerk "Gena" who was checking us in. She in turn, tries to send me across the casino to Security in my wedding gown to turn it in to them. I refused of course and told her I was here to check in and was only turning the shawl into an employee as a good Samaritan. "Gena" clearly didn't want to do her job, as she initiated our interaction with just waving us over from the line, no introduction, no greeting, no smile. From there on out, "Gena's" interaction only went downhill. When she asked for my credit card for incidentals, I was informed of a $100 per night hold that would be put on my credit card = total $400 hold. I told her that was unacceptable and she said that because I had a debit/credit card that's the policy. So why isn't this disclosed at the time of reservation? She was willing to reduce the amount of holding, but that was still unacceptable in my eyes. I believe she was being discriminatory because of the previous interaction. My mother provided her credit card (no debit option at all) and no "hold" was placed on her credit card at all. The clerk just beside her was exceptional with his customer service skills. He exuded personality and meeting the needs of the guests he was checking in. It was disappointing having to deal with "Gena" as my check in clerk, but watch him next to us doing everything correctly. I asked "Gena" for the Front Desk Manager's card as I had a feeling this would not be the end of it and it wasn't. My husband and I drove my mother back home and when we returned to the Rio with our luggage, we walked into a totally different world than what we stayed in previously. The room was extremely run down, wall paper peeling off the walls, extremely small, dated decor. Motel 6 would've been more prepared for our honeymoon than what this place was. Because we disclosed we were on our honeymoon at the time of the reservations, they promised us an upgrade with a view. We got a view alright, of the next tower over. I called the hotel manager and asked they he change our room. He put us in a room that was even worse than the first one. The second room had wall paper peeling off, stains on the couch and the vinyl layer on the desk was peeling off! Same horrible decor. This time when we called down to the front desk manager, we asked for a disable guest room. We switched towers and finally put into a descent room. This entire process took hours and we did not finally get to sleep after our long day until late at night. In the meantime, we desperately needed to get out of our formal attire. The Front desk manager, while accommodated our requests was less than excited to hear from us and seemed completely detached. Customer service trash! The next morning, we woke up to what we thought were gun shots going off in the room. There was a window washer banging around on the window for hours! Never received notification from the front desk staff that this would be going on, so it was quite alarming. I'm sure the window washer got the peek of his dreams while I was walking around naked in my room trying to find clothes to put on. It finally stopped for a while and we were grateful, but when it started up again a while later, we had enough! We called down and spoke with a new front desk manager. Instead of hearing us out, he just wanted to talk over me and throw comps our way, (this by the way, is the same treatment we got from everyone at the front desk). Why they don't understand the concept of just treating the customers right the first time and you won't have to give out comps to make the problems (the customers) go away, I don't know. The comps are nice, but really not required. Just fair treatment from the staff from the get-go is all we expect. Nevertheless, we were assured the window washers wouldn't be waking us up anymore. The room service had descent food, for the exception of the hair on my orange juice glass. We enjoyed it. The employees that we came in contact with were just as disappointed in the establishment as we were. The second day, housekeeping tried to enter our room and that's when we found out that we were marked as already vacant, when we were staying for four days and certainly hadn't checked out. They suggested we call the front desk manager (AGAIN!) to straighten this matter out. Indeed, they had us as checked out and didn't even have us registered to the correct room. They still had us registered to the first crappy room they tried to put us in. Unbelievable! Once again, talking down to me and my husband and throwing comps around. New room keys were to be brought up to our room, but were never delivered. Our room keys continued to work, so we carried about our business. Third day, keys didn't work. Had to wait in line at the front desk late at night for new keys. Got tired of waiting so I called the front desk manager again as we waited. This time it was yet another new manager. He tried to give us the run around again and as I spoke to him on the phone, he told me they couldn't give us new keys to OUR room!! I asked that he come out to speak to me. He said he didn't realize I was waiting in line and he thought we were calling from our room. How can I be calling from my room if I'm in line to get new keys because I can't get in my room??!! Secondly, caller ID!!! When he came out front, he must've gotten a case of amnesia, because suddenly he was unfamiliar with whom he was speaking to and with what type of activity there was on our account. So, he made us wait a while longer while he went into the back to check our account AGAIN and then finally provided new keys to us after bantering with us. What is so difficult about giving us keys for the room we've stayed in for three nights already? Oh that's right; they STILL had us registered to the first room! Amazing. Honestly, we won't even get into the disastrous bar & grill meal experience or the safe assist experience where we were suddenly locked out of our own safe too! Why isn't there a cafe on this property? Lastly, the cocktail waitress outfits were nothing less of OFFENSIVE! They trotted around in black sheer lace that only slightly covered their breasts and thin strip of the same material around their bottoms. The only thing under the sheer lace was a black thong. How is this supposed to make the women feel who are visiting the Rio property, especially with their new husbands?! If we wanted to be in the atmosphere of a strip club, we would've booked our room at one. We tried to lodge a formal complaint while we were there, but alas, no one would take our complaint. Tried to do it on the website, but it was not user friendly, it was next to impossible. It would've been nice to do it directly from the internet in our room, but jokes on us, you have to pay for internet. Oh yeah, and coffee! There is no complimentary coffee in the rooms, you even have to pay for that. There really should be more accessible parking as well. Every time we wanted to go somewhere, it was a hike just to get back to our car. Couldn't valet because it was always a mess getting through the Porte Cochere. No traffic control at all and no one out there telling the vehicles to keep moving. Stay away from the rio unless you're the type that gets off on being treated badly and being issued comps unnecessarily.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel offering VFM”
Reviews.Author: united01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio in December 2011 & found the standard of accomodation far exceeded my expectations for the cost per night (about $30 including $9 allowance per day at Starbucks). The rooms are spacious, come with a fridge, free to use safe, sitting area, kitchen facilities and are immaculately clean. On arrival I was allocated a room that was very comfortable but unfortunately suffered from noise as result of being next to the lift shaft. I raised this with reception & my room was changed efficiently & effectively in no time at all. Over the 6 days I stayed I had no cause to raise any further issues as my room was kept immaculately throughout. The RIO runs a frequent shuttle bus to the HARRAH or BALLYS hotel on the strip (every 15 mins) therefore there is no need to worry that it isnt on the strip & in any event it is only a 15 minute walk to the BALLY and 20 mins to HARRAH which are centre strip if you prefer to walk. The hotel offers a full extensive range of eating establishments bars gambling areas & shows as do almost all Vegas hotels but nevertheless the RIO is as good as any for little cost & importantly there is no significant resort fee to surprise you at the end of your stay at The RIO as it is 1 of a handful of hotels that are against this concept & rightly so. If I returned to Vegas I would definately stay at The RIO again without hesitation given the VFM offered.

Reviews.Title: “Rio - best value suites in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: theUSAFox
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and have small refrigs. The RIO is our first choice for our many Vegas outings. The RIO buffet is outrageously good..so we always make at least 2 visits there per trip. Parking is easy and they have shuttles all day to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Suites & Casino”
Reviews.Author: RainyEscape
Reviews.Content: Happy New Year! A group of 4 stayed at the Rio which is just off the strip on Dec 29-Jan 1 2012 we had a great experience. The city was packed 300,000 people and the energy was fantastic. This was our 3rd time to Vegas and while the hotel is not on the strip there were a lot of advantages and some disadvantages. Personally I liked the locations because it wasn't over crowded. The Service was great from the time we stepped onto the property. The registration desk was well staffed so there was not a long line up. We booked a room that was a perfect size for the 4 of us - would have been nice if we were able to get an upgrade. Great Things: 1. Free shuttle to downtown 2. Great room size 3. Customer service 4. Lots of Games and Definitely recommend getting the rewards card 5. Cute shops on site that were not over priced and good variety 6. Clubs were great and so was the entertainment 7. Awesome slushy drinks (the ones with the long tube and alcohol - cheap refills at a bunch of locations) Downside: 1. Price at the restaurants were high breakfast for 4 was $90 we had the average continental breakfast. 2. Some Cabs varied in price to get to the strip 3. Price for the room at the Hotel at that time was very expensive $$$$600 plus 4. We couldn't see the fireworks unless you went upstairs to the Voodoo bar but tickets were really expensive. 5. The pillows and bed were ok - not the fluffy ones that you would see at the higher end chains. We booked through Allegiant Air and got great deals on shows, Must see the Blue Man Group. Overall we would go back probably not during the New Years but we might if the price was better or we could use our Rewards card.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: BOLOTRAVEL
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms, in town for the Las Vegas Bowl. We were in the older suites, but they were large and clean. TV was a bit outdated, but comfortable beds, nice couch, chairs, and desk. Bathroom was clean and spacious. The best thing I liked was the excellent customer service, including check in, food service, lounges, gaming tables, and waitstaff. Great value. Plenty of parking. Easy to get to the Strip. Definitely will stay at the Rio again.

Reviews.Title: “Rio: A Little Too Racy For Me”
Reviews.Author: jmb994
Reviews.Content: The Rio is like the tale of 2 hotels, at least according to the rooms I stayed in. Our first night, we were unable to get the room with a strip view, as reserved. So, for one night we were put on a lower floor of the Masquerade Tower. It was clean, but it was ugly. It reminded me of a larger version of the old Binnions rooms..very bad, outdated, large holes in the carpet, burned places in the bathroom counter, window view of industrial equipment..bad. Next night we were moved to the Ipanema Tower, and it was like a different world: wonderful view, updated, larger room, and a comfy bed. In no way elegant, but at least up to a spacious Holiday Inn type room. Unlike other posters, I did not find the casino smoky. But there was obviously a profession being practiced. I sat near the elevator playing slots, and the same skimpily dressed women would go upstairs with a guy, then return, and a bit later go up with a different guy, on and on. Even my husband noticed this going on, and he was sitting at the table games. It was not very subtle, and hotel employees did nothing to stop these activities. In a dozen Vegas trips over the years, I've never seen this so blatantly exhibited. Also, the dancers on the tables, and the show in the air with barely dressed dancers was a bit much. The music was way too loud for my tastes. Because of this, there seemed a coarseness at the Rio that I never noticed in my former stays. As to the internet availability, at least in early December it was available free at the Starbucks. That was really convenient. As to the slots, they were not terrible, but I saw no big winners. At check-in, there was a long line, and not enough clerks, but staff were polite and helpful. I did overhear a loud argument in another line, where a guest was upset about not getting the smoking room he had reserved. Our clerk commented that the Rio had decided to only have one smoking floor, so, this sort of disappointment, at check-in, by smoking guests was common. We had Sunday brunch at the buffet, and though a little pricey, was very tasty. On the whole, the value was good, staff helpful, but the coarseness, and the chance I could end up in the Masquerade tower again will likely keep me from going back.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: happytraveler32172
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! Room was huge, view was great, beds were comfortable, and I loved the updated modern decor. Casino was very nice and had an awesome little restaurant called the sports grill - I had a great chicken caesar salad there which was huge (couldn't finish it all) and the prices were very reasonable. They also have a Mardi-Gras theme show in the Carnival Court every hour which is a must-see - very festive, and they even throw out beads like at a real Mardi Gras. Location is great, only a short mile drive or walk to the strip - they even offer a regular shuttle to and from the strip which was a great convenience. We went to the breakfast buffet which seemed to stretch endlessly - unfortunately I was full before I could try everything I wanted to, lol. All in all, I had a very pleasant trip to the Rio and cannot think of a single complaint during my entire stay. I will definitly be booking my stay at this hotel during my next trip to Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “PET FRIENDLY? WISH I HAD TAKEN PHOTOS OF PET ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: lotus2s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rio in the Masquerade Tower because the 4th floor of that tower is the only place in Rio where pets are allowed. I felt like we were in a total dive. The hallway had spots that were very dirty and the room was a disaster. Patches of carpet were missing from the floor, there were stains, and the room was small. We had previously stayed in the Ipanema Tower (without our pet) and the rooms were very clean, nice, and large. The pet-friendly room had an odd window from the bathtub/shower to the bedroom so that when the light was on it went directly into the bedroom. Very strange. Rio advertised that the pet would be given a treat, and a food/water bowl. Our room came with neither. The waiver that was required for a pet stay was unbelievable. It was about 10 (yes, ten) pages long. We had just checked out of a hotel in Scottsdale and there was no waiver at all to sign. The pet area was a very long walk from the room to the elevator to the main level of the casino, out the back door and by the pool. There were "paw" prints to lead the way - that was nice, but a bit too far to walk late at night - and there is not a grassy area anywhere to be found. Would I stay at Rio in the pet friendly room again? NO WAY! The Ipanema Tower is fine - and I would stay there, but NEVER again in the Masquerade Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: Susan W
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for 4 nights 18 -22 Dec as a last minute get away. Room was very spacious and updated and had a great view of the Strip. Too bad there was no coffee machine in the room though. Not a lot of choice for breakfast if you were up early and didn't want the over priced buffet. We ate at Starbucks every morning, which was fine.There is a free shuttle to the Strip that goes every half hour but didn't start til 10 so too late for breakfast on the Strip. This was the only drawback from being off the strip.
