We didn't go to the buffet in the evening as locals are given half price coupons and the line up was huge,probably not like that at the weekends when the casino is fuller! The Irish bar was closed while we were there so the guys had to drink bottled beer but enjoyed the Newcastle Brown Ale!! Our friends ate at the Voodoo Steak Restaurant and said it was excellent. We went to the Gold Coast Casino across the road to the Cortez Lounge and had an amazing prime rib dinner for $15.00 and couldn't finish or meal it was so big. A lot of places we split a meal as the portions are so large down there.The hotel was good value for the money and was clean, comfortable and the staff were very helpful.The rooms were very quiet too. The casino was busy and when we did sit to play the slots we were offered drinks promptly.

Reviews.Title: “standard Vegas”
Reviews.Author: powdahsdad
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 2 nights at the Rio and it was pretty standard Vegas. The girl at check in was very nice I requested a room in the updated Impanada tower as suggested by other reviews and she was very accommodating. The room was very large but I would not consider it a suite. The furnishings were ok etc. nothing to special. I liked that Starbucks was right at the base of the elevators! I was very excited to receive a 24 hours free buffet pass with my room which was good at any of the Harrah's properties! I love the Rio buffet but it can be a bit overwhelming! I also tried the Paris buffet and it was very good not so large. Over all I am very satisfied with The Rio and considering the prices I will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: iheartbball
Reviews.Content: We were not treated with the best service by the vallet or bellhops. I think it might be because we piled out of our minivan with 4 kids and 3 adults. We didn't look like high rollers! The told us we could only use a cart if we get a bellhop to carry our luggage. Then said they don't mind taking our bags, but it would be at least 45 minutes before our bags were delivered. The check in process was slow, but the gentleman checking us in was very friendly. He made up for the guys outside! The rooms are huge! We should have only gotten one for our family, but we got two. The rate was $39 online. We had connecting rooms and one of our kids closed the connecting door. We couldn't get into our second room. We called the front desk and security arrived within 5 minutes to fix it. The rooms were clean and comfortable. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Never go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: plata1
Reviews.Content: Horrible service! Dirty! Opon arrival, we noticed the sign about the free show being cancelled from Dec 22 to Dec 24....so we asked if they're going to have it on dec 25. Well, the show is cancelled until Dec 29! They don't care to remove or correct the sign....No apology....Their room was very dirty, too. If you really want to stay in the reasonal priced casino hotel, I recommend Flamingo. Flamingo is also very dirty looking hotel, but the location is at least much better than Rio. Next time, I will just stay at La Quinta or something.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Vegas - Again”
Reviews.Author: frankieb6024
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Vegas many times, and decided to stay at the Rio this time. The price of the room was great and the size of the rooms were even better. The check in was a bit hectic due to a very long line. Management came out and took care of that situation very quickly, so that was very nice to see. Our room was not ready yet so we were able to grab lunch in the casino which was fantastic. The rooms are huge with great views of either the mountains or the stip, we had a mountain view. Very comfortable bed and as mentioned, large room to do whatever we wanted in. The pools were good, but they werent all open at the same time, which made for it to be a bit crowded a couple of days. BRING SUN SCREEN!!!! The pools are in the sun all day long so unless you want to burn, be set with the lotion. Great prices on the buckets of beer by the pool as well. The shuttle was a great feature to and from all the Harrah's properties, unless of course you just missed it and had to wait the 30 minutes until the next one. I would stay here again if I had to.

Reviews.Title: “Thief in room. Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: thundercyclone
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for the Christmas and got our electronic items stolen from our hotel room while we were out. For the value of items we were stolen from, we can stay at a much better hotel. We had been staying at different hotels and nothing like this happened before. Take your own risk if you want to stay there. Poor security. Everyone can go to different floors without proof of staying.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: SBII
Reviews.Content: Very nice casino and excellent rooms. The hotel had easy access to restaurants and the bus line to go to other casinos (IF DESIRED). We ate and amused ourselves at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NICE OPTION OFF THE STRIP”
Reviews.Author: nicolawca
Reviews.Content: I agree with the positive reviews regarding how clean and nice the renovated rooms are. Stayed for two weekend nights for less than $100 total. The $20 charge for the renovated room was worth the extra charge. Only complaints; No pool, but hey, its the winter. Business center closed. The minimum cost to print one page e-mail on their computer kiosks is $5. Internet is over $13/day. This time we did not eat on site. But their buffet has been nice in the past. I'd stay here and avoid the hectic nature of the strip hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kkjbb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio from Thursday to Monday, and it was really nice. The rooms are very spacious, and they were always cleaned and fresh towels were always there. The casino was a fun place and they also provide shuttles that take you to other Harrah casino's which is a nice feature. We ate at the breakfast restaurant (can't remember the name) and it was very good. We ate lunch at the American Grill (I think that was the name) and it was also very good, although a little pricey. If you sit at the bar and pay $20.00 to play video poker you get free drinks, otherwise beer was $5.00. So it was worth it to us to play the machine, because we walked away winners!!!! We would diffently stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms good gaming not so much”
Reviews.Author: ilolyn
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and big. Great view of the strip. The only bad thing was the gaming. Slots are very tight and table games had high min. ($15). I didn't do much gambling.

Reviews.Title: “SPACIOUS rooms and great FREE shows”
Reviews.Author: James_n_Company
Reviews.Content: I went to help a friend celebrate her 21st birthday in September. After much research we decided on the Rio. We had a wonderful time. The hotel overall had a great mix of both modern decor (with the main entrance and e-bar, restaurants and pool) as well as comfortable old cascino feel (without feeling old and decrepid). Very tidy. Very accomodating. All special requests were met expeditiously. I LOVED how much space was in our room. More than enough. We enjoyed the Sky show, which was free and very sexy. Loved the shopping IN the hotel more than anywhere else in Vegas. I would stay there again. Though the only down side is the pool hours are at the whim of the workers and it closes RIDICULOUSLY early. It took us 3 days to finally get to the pool. We were pretty hot walking down to the main floor and past all the slots in our trunks only to look at the sign saying the pool was open and being told we couldn't swim. Still the pool, when we got there, was a blast.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise...”
Reviews.Author: AlanB_in_the_OC
Reviews.Content: After reading a few reviews I was concerned about the reservation that I made. So there wasn't a coffee maker in the room. Quite honestly I really don't like the coffee that those things make anyway. There was a Starbucks not too far of a stroll from our room. The hotel is undergoing some rennovations with a few of the restaurants within the hotel being closed. Our room was spacious and clean. My wife's comment was that the room was great after inspection the tub/shower and seeing that everything was sparkling clean. We had gotten a special deal to stay $21 per night. It was well worth that. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly. We had a fabulous time.

Reviews.Title: “Just the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: MeuterMedia
Reviews.Content: We had a special offer ($35 per night) for one of the suites and we received another upgrade at the time of check in. Lucky us (the place was packed). The suite we had was very good, but still noice from the hallway door slamming and early bathroom activities next and above our suite. Since the Rio is "on the wrong side" of the strip, all activities are done by car or at the hotel. We arrived sunday evening and all the tables where very busy, so not much gaming action that night. I like the new "drinks" service - I-pad waiter takes the order and a waiter/waitress comes with the ready made drinks from the bar (one way trip and fast). Buffet is overpriced, my "locals" deal didn't count since i don't have a Nevada ID (but i own a house in the city of summerlin next door). (Very good low cost buffet at the Red Rock Casino 15 min drive or the South Point Casino also only 15 min drive) The Check in coupons had absolutely no value to us. And lots of other charges if you want to use any of the things offered at the hotel. My recommendation, sleep well for a low price and drive to another location for fun. They offer a bus shuttle to the strip if you don't have a car. MeuterMedia

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: 1037thebeat
Reviews.Content: The check in wait time took 30 minutes. The buffet is over price other that, ok spot. Workers are nice.

Reviews.Title: “Off the strip...is just that”
Reviews.Author: wheretogonext1
Reviews.Content: Rio has larger rooms than those typically found on the strip...and the Seafood Buffet is decent. However, if you have stayed here once, you have stayed here enough. The boredom of the same hotel day in and day out sets in and it gets monotonous. I stay here often on business, since I like the quiet, but if you are looking for a true Vegas experience, this is not it.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: Happyone69
Reviews.Content: Loved the big rooms, great pools, lots shopping in hotel, awesome prices!

Reviews.Title: “Rio All-Suite - Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Magmomsal
Reviews.Content: Caught a FABULOUS deal mid-week, $21 per night. I was leery, but the room was great. The shower was hot, hot, hot, nice fridge for leftovers and cocktails, bought our own keurig cups at Smith's to save the 3/$8 mini bar cost for in room coffee (it was yummy), beds comfortable, lighted makeup mirror, floor to ceiling windows, plenty of elevators. On the down side, we were at the absolute end of the hall from said elevators, our fault? we checked in at 10 am, it's what was clean. This being the week before Christmas and the town was empty of people ~ One LOOOONGGG walk after being out and about all day. The staff was pleasant, valet attentive and helpful regarding directions. Would recommend the Rio for those that don't want the Strip or Downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Great view”
Reviews.Author: Teresa S
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the RIO. My husband and I go every December for our birthday. The room was very spacious with a beautiful view of the strip and the mountains. A little out dated but very comfortable. Small coffee pot in the room with a fridge. The casino is very lively and the show in the sky was fun. The food is a little expensive for us especially the buffets. The shuttles were perfect for going to the strip and you can walk to the Gold Coast next door. Loved the RIO and will definately return. Fast courteous service in every area. Bloody Marys are great!

Reviews.Title: “RIO SMIO”
Reviews.Author: mike_kwiatkowski
Reviews.Content: Waited in line 45 minutes to check-in to the beginning of my night mare. Front desk staffed by recent high school grads and not yet trained on customer satisfaction. Had to move the first night since my room at the end of the hall way didn't have hot water. The head board literally had high heel penetrations which Made me wonder what really happens in Vegas. Couldn't move me immediately because the system was down so had to wait until 4 PM. Moved me to a renovated room with worn carpeting, and a CRT TV. Wallpaper patched and overall not very nice. When they said renovated, did they mean since the 60's when Vegas was still family owned? Couldn't checkout because the system was down. What a hell hole! Never, never, never stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Stay some place else”
Reviews.Author: BillHeald
Reviews.Content: I was at a convention so I did not have a real choice of hotel for this trip. The only good part was the room size and the confortable bed. The bad was we were offered a discount on the Wi-fi (ONLY $9.00 OER DAY), I can stay at a Confort Inn and get free Wi-fi. I woul have expected equal or better from the Rio. The ugly, no in room coffee in our room. Some rooms had single cup coffee makers, but you had to buy the coffee from the mini-bar @ $8 for 3 cups. Again I get free in room coffee at Confort Inn and even some Motel 6. The business center and the computer terminals were all fee based, again these are complimentary at most other hotels including Confort Inns.

Reviews.Title: “We had a GREAT time at the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: CentralABFamily
Reviews.Content: My wife and thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Rio and would stay here again. We traveled at the end of October to attend a conference and selected the Rio because it was the host hotel for the conference. When we arrived, we were upgraded to a Masquerade suite. It was the largest room we have ever stayed in and it had a beautiful view. We ate at McFadden's and the Carnival World Buffet and were satisfied with our meals. We definitely enjoyed the pool and the iBar, too. We found the service at this property to be extremely professional and courteous. I am not sure how we qualified for the upgrade, but I'm not complaining!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty. Would never stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: Filonia
Reviews.Content: There was a conference for work at this hotel and since I had never stayed here, I decided to give it a try. Let me just say it was a huge mistake. First off, the hotel is filthy. When I checked in to my room, there was a dirty band-aid on the floor and lots of hair in the tub and sink. Even after it was "cleaned", the band-aid was still there. There are only about two outlets in the room, so it was very inconvenient for work purposes. I paid $6.95 for less than ten minutes of internet access (just to print a boarding pass) and after trying three of the restaurants, I can say that calling the food mediocre is more than a compliment. Front desk staff was decent. The hotel is off the strip, but since I was there for work, location was not a huge issue. The day I checked out was the best day of the trip and the only bonus I can think of is that I managed to get out of there without catching some horrible disease. If cleanliness is an issue for you, you do not want to stay here. If you enjoy being able to sleep without the worry of taking home bedbugs, I would suggest you stay somewhere else. I felt the need for a shot of penicillin when I left here.

Reviews.Title: “Poor place to stay”
Reviews.Author: taffy_on_the_road
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for a big business convention. The convention centre was ok but a very long walk from the hotel rooms in the Ipenema Tower. The smell of stale cigarette smoke hit you from the moment you entered the hotel and meant you had to inhale 'bad air'. The air conditioning in the rooms wasn't working properly and despite turning the temperature up to 80 deg F the rooms were freezing cold and a cold draft was felt at floor level even with the air con off. I had to run a hot bath to warm up one morning and several others complained of the same problem. There was no tea making facility in the rooms only expensive sachet coffee. No free internet. The dining experience was also poor and the seafood restaraunt on the ground floor pretty average. Would also warn anyone with young children that close to the lobby there were female dancers who did nothing but make this place look sleazy. Sorry but not much positive to say.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, real modern and nice with a view of the pools....”
Reviews.Author: Californiagirl1964
Reviews.Content: First time in Las Vegas, and I picked a great hotel. Theres a huge vanity and sink outside the bathroom and another one inside the shower area. Hugh closet with mirrors to check your outfits, fridge, safe, coffeemaker, but later found out the coffee was in the mini bar for $8 to make coffee in the keurig coffeemaker, so I skipped that one. You could have fit 5 people in the room, had a table and 2 chairs, couch, coffee table, chair, nice, modern and real clean.....Was the best deal I ever had for a hotel....Loved it!!!!!! Would go back again and stay longer.......

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: Diosa18
Reviews.Content: Here for a conference. It was a long walk from the room to the conference facilities. Unfortunately, the wi-fi we paid for did not/does not reach in to the conference rooms, so don't pay for it. The hotel was very quick to refund us and still let us log on in our room, so no complaints on the service. We liked taking a little walk over to the strip for entertainment, but if you have trouble walking, it wouldn't be a good choice. The do have a shuttle, but we never took it. The casino was busy but not overcrowded. The floor show was a little cheesy, but what isn't in Las Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Return to Rio Fine”
Reviews.Author: bama39
Reviews.Content: we have stayed here before and went for slot turnament. we asked to be close to elevator at reservation time and got the very first room out the elevator door, very pleased as their halls are very long. stayed three nights and all was very good and my only complaint is they do not have a cafe for food open 24/7. We are not buffet nuts so do not bother with that and other places mostly higher end $$$$. They just put in a gourmet burgerking but still not a cafe type and served food also.. guess the world going to fast food or gourmet. Last time there the cashier line so long in the casino and no line at all this time!!! good improvement!!! We were very happy with our stay and will go back to the rio or Harrah's on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room large spacious clean........(and im picky..)”
Reviews.Author: selbert
Reviews.Content: liked the room it was larger then average size we stayed for 4 days had a great time in the casino as well as checking out the strip....loved the casino restaurant/sports bar downstairs food was good especially the buffalo wings my son ordered them every nite...the room's decor was re-done and the bathroom , carpets etc were clean,,,,i did not feel uncomfortable...room had a beautiful view too... well be back..

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly”
Reviews.Author: CharlieSanAntonioTX
Reviews.Content: I took a shuttle on 12-7-2011 from Balley's to The Rio to eat at the buffet which I heard was one of the best in Vegas and I was not dissappointed. Starting with the gal who charges up at the front, they were very professional, efficient and friendly. My server Ofelia from Texas had one of the biggest smiles and friendliest dispositions I have ever seen and I don't say that very often. When I go to buffets I usually grab a little of the most appetizing fare and fill myself up that way. Here though, there was just too much to do that so I left many of the selections untasted so I will have to come back just to try them. In a day and age when smiles, service, and quality are just words, this place was on the top of their game on this day. I must return to this place.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, spacious, awesome relaxing place to unwind in vegas.”
Reviews.Author: davida70
Reviews.Content: Great deals for a fab place to telax in vegas. Pool..suite..view..has it all.

Reviews.Title: “Good off strip alternative”
Reviews.Author: RonMc1958
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large and clean, but they could use new tv's and the lodgenet tv service is useless. I found it impossible to get any local tv channels due to the lodgenet tv service they use. I have never seen this service at any other Harrah's/Caesar's property and it would have made my stay better if I had not seen it here. I found the food to be good at the places I ate there and the parking is close. If you have time Penn and Teller are well worth the money and it is one of the few shows in Las Vegas that is clean family entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out”
Reviews.Author: DavidPortland
Reviews.Content: This is a nice facility located off the Strip. It brags that it has no resort fee and that is correct. However, it costs $8 to use the in-room coffee maker, it's $22 for use of the fitness center and there is a charge for using the computers in the business center to print your boarding pass.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Suite Hotel / Resort”
Reviews.Author: uncle-eric
Reviews.Content: Ran across this property in my continuing search for suites priced under 100 USD. Midweek Sept 2011 around 70/night not including breakfast. Apparently this is a Caesar's property. We booked a standard suite and got a top floor room with excellent views. Floor to ceiling windows, marble granite fixtures, HD TV, excellent linens / bedding, all rounded out for a very nice room although not a a suite in the sense of having a separate bedroom. Incidentally, photos on their website don't do justice compared to what we got. Sorry but I didn't get photos. Overall very pleased, although we couldn't stay in a casino resort for very long. Two nights was about enough passing through the casino. The only drawback for some folks would be that it's not on the strip, but we had a rental car and while walking back and forth to the parking lot noticed they had plenty of shuttles to other Caesar's properties with a shaded fan cooled area to wait. Happy Traveling

Reviews.Title: “Needs A Makeover...badly”
Reviews.Author: raff622
Reviews.Content: and so did the old Stardust(and look what happened to that). At least there, the seedy factor was enhanced with class. Here its just seedy. Enough about that. We stayed here during Thanksgiving week. The rooms were a comp, so that was nice. I have no issues with the staff(genuinely helpful) or the dining options(good), but with a couple of things within the operation. The facility is worn down. Carpets, both in public areas and the rooms are dirty. In our room, which was large comfortable and generally nice,(everything worked) the rug over by the a/c unit was soaked because of a leak somewhere in the unit. Also, everything here has a price on it. At check in we were offered a choice of room upgrades(they have a book) at various price points. Complimentary coffee in the room....forget it....3 cups $8.USD...you want to print your boarding pass or use the internet....its gonna cost ya too!!!. The pool....closed for the season, but you are welcomed to go over to Caesars(we didn't). You would think, as tight as the casino was, they could throw you a bone somewhere along the line. Getting beyond my concerns, it was just an average stay. Go there if you must, but there are nicer choices in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “RUN DOWN HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Raidersh8ter
Reviews.Content: stayed here after getting free rooms as part of my total rewards program.. Disappointed hotel is off the strip and place has to be one of the oldest in Vegas.. There was one elevator working, ac didnt work.. Would not stay again. Only thing that might make me step back in this hotel is the Buffett.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay off the main strip”
Reviews.Author: nurserehab
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for the convention I was attending. The rooms were clean but not as up to date as some of the other hotels on the strip. The staff were friendly and helpful. The restaurants in the hotel were very good, especially the seafood buffet. The hotel is off the strip but you can hop on the free shuttle to Ballys and walk from there. There is entertainment at night. If your not looking for the higher priced hotels this place was quite adequate for the conference price and our needs, since in Las Vegas your out all night sightseeing and not spending all your time in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been 100%”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra K
Reviews.Content: What I enjoyed about the hotel was the room was very nice. The room was clean and large and had a Fridge for food, the shower was nice, and the view was awesome. What I really disliked about the hotel was that the pool was closed. We stayed at the hotel near the end of November during the US thanks giving weeekend and every day we were there the outside high was like 26 degrees centigrade. It would have been awesome and relaxing to be able to us the pool and the hot tub. Also disappointed that the hotel feels it necissary to charge for Wi-Fi at a cost of $13.95 for 24hrs and you have to stay in your room to us it or $22.95 if you want to go to the casino. ( being from Canada the cell phone costs on the smart phone while in the USA are a fortune if you use so it would be nice if wi-fi was free). So our holiday would have been awsesome if the pool was open. Next time I will book at a hotel that has the pool open.

Reviews.Title: “Nice off strip property”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: First time stay at this property. Was checked in by "natalie" who was pleasant, kind, efficient and professional. Stayed in strip view Ipanema tower. Dont understand other reviewers complaints. great value for price, decent food with assortment of types and price levels. Friendly professional housekeeping, and employees. Locals; 25% off food, and Caesars owned shops. 50% off buffet. If you are going to be in vegas for a while you can get a seasonal drivers license. Food: discount for Total rewards card holders and points earned on purchases.

Reviews.Title: “Not on the strip, but who needs that insanity?”
Reviews.Author: HulaM11
Reviews.Content: Rio wasn't on the strip, but on this being my first trip to Vegas, I wanted more than less. The strip is always buzzing and you can hardly step out of your hotel before you get whisked up in the sheep that are pedestrians in Vegas. Clean, spacious and accommodating staff is what made Rio the difference. Only seafood buffet in Vegas! Worth every cent... Regular shuttles to and from the strip and reasonable rates. It's Vegas...who really cares WHERE you stay...

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad, and the ugly”
Reviews.Author: ;uvstogo
Reviews.Content: Made our first trip to Vegas in a couple of years and decided to stay at the Rio and see Penn and Teller with their package deal. At check in we decided to upgrade to a 1600 sq. ft. suite as it was our anniversary. The room was huge! Lights were burned out in the entry way and stains on the carpet upon entry. Ok, let that slide. Huge jacuzzi tub - great! Fire it up! Water smells just like a swimming pool coming out of the tap and no robe to put on when you get out. Called the front desk, robes sent up, but was informed that only the VIP suites get robes - huh?? $500 a night and no robes! I then noticed that all the amenities that you expect in an upscale room were absent. 2 small generic shampoos, one small lotion, nothing to remind you that you had paid big money for this room. Very comfortable bed, nice linens. 180 degree view of Vegas was very cool. One cheesy pod style coffee pot with 1 reg and 1 decaf pod - another call to housekeeping to bring more coffee. Again was told that only the upscale rooms even have coffee makers in them anymore - they have been removed all together from all the other rooms - got my one cup of coffee, sat down to watch the morning news - remote did not work on the vintage tv - I guess someone forgot to turn the antenna the right direction because I had volume but a snowstorm for a picture. Safe was not operational. The ugly- we were offered a spa pass which did not materialize, when we asked by phone we were told that the clerk that offered it was not "authorized" to do that - we also paid for the package online and upon check in were told that we would have to pay again for the tickets only to have it taken back off the bill. Hubby decided to pay the manager a visit and received a whole different story making us very leery of any transaction witht the hotel from that point on. The Penn and Teller show was very entertaining but lasted under two hours. The highlight was the Voodoo Restaurant - fantastic service and the best steak I've had in years - the view from the restaurant and the patio is amazing. You do recieve a discount if you eat there the same night you attend Penn and Teller and you can go to the voodoo lounge with no cover charge. Been there, done that, and once is enough!

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, pleasantly surprised.”
Reviews.Author: Cathy F
Reviews.Content: Before I start this out, I would just like to warn you. There are hidden fees absolutely everywhere. If you look under the TV in the cabinet, don't touch anything unless you would like to eat it and pay for it as well. Besides that, the room was a nice, comfortable place to stay. They had a great night show when my husband and I were there, but that's because it was Christmas time.

Reviews.Title: “Views!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yukon0
Reviews.Content: My husband booked a special suite for our last night in Vegas. We had a twelfth floor corner suite. The views were amazing. The place was huge. The master bath was to die for. The suite had a living room, dining room and master bedroom. It was set up for a couple but floor space you could sleep twenty!!! Wall to wall windows in the whole place. What a treat. The decor was a little outdated but very clean. A must at least once.

Reviews.Title: “The property is showing its age”
Reviews.Author: The_Crazy_Brazilian
Reviews.Content: On its prime, the Rio was one of the top properties in Las Vegas. However, its current owner (Caesar's Entertainment) has neglected the property: peeling painting, old analogical TV sets, no more in-room coffee makers, etc. Recently, they started trying to market the property as a "local's casino", but when you compare their odds and the price of their restaurants to other gambling halls focused on the local residents you see that this would be a hard mission. However, their average room has over 540 sq feet, the mattresses are comfy and they still offer a fridge in addition to the minibar. Furthermore, if you are a Total Rewards Member, chances are that you will get a great rate or even a comped room (I am a low level Gold and always get up to 5 week nights comped).

Reviews.Title: “decent hotel but far from the strip”
Reviews.Author: d_basuMumbai
Reviews.Content: the hotel is actually further from the strip than i initially anticipated..but they have a good shuttle service to the strip every half hour or so..rooms are just like any other vegas hotel...the nightclub wasnt the best but it offers wat i think is one of the best views anyone can get of the entire vegas strip...there were a couple of shows but nothing spectacular..all in all a good choice for people who want to be a little far from all the noise and din in the strip

Reviews.Title: “Meh (yup, meh.)”
Reviews.Author: Diosa B
Reviews.Content: I travel to Vegas twice a month for work and this trip will mark my fourth or fifth where I've stayed at the Rio. Yes, I'm actually writing this review from my room in the Ipanema tower on the Rio's questionably slow internet connection (more on that later). Before I even start, let me give you one tip if you do stay at the Rio: make *sure* you get a room in the Ipanema tower-- this is the renovated tower where the rooms are fresh and clean. Once (yes, just once) I made the mistake of not requesting this tower and I felt like the elevator was really a time machine that took me back to 1963 (the room was smokey and so out-of-date that it looks like it'd fit in better downtown). Let's make this easy: The pros: *Cheap. The Rio has *great* deals, particularly if you go through their website or Kayak (Kayak is a fab way to compare all the sales and offers in one handy place). Sign up for the Rio email list and you'll get good deals. I think this time I'm paying $30 or something. *Clean. Even the old tower is clean enough, it's just sorely out of date. The new rooms though? Well, despite the giant, thick, old school tvs (this stands out in Vegas where every hotel-- even the cheapy ones-- has flat screens), the rooms are modern, comfortable, and very clean. *Friendly. The staff is definitely friendly. The front desk staff is always cheerful and seemingly pretty genuine (which I think we all know isn't exactly the status quo in the hotel industry--- not that I can blame them). *Room service. The room service selection is pretty delicious, quick, and the servers are friendly enough. You're still paying room service Vegas prices, but nothing exorbitant. And now, the cons: *Check in times. Good LORD. Since I'm in town so frequently, I get that these hotels can get awfully busy-- really, I do. But one Sunday (so, not even a Friday night) I waited over an *hour* at check in here. I asked the agent if that's normal and he sighed, saying, "Yeah, it gets real bad on Sundays. If you come back again, I suggest coming later in the evening on a Sunday to check in." Ever since then, I've taken his advice and it's been fine, but definitely beware. *Did I mention the other tower's rooms? Someone else described them as "the rooms that time forgot" and that seems pretty on point. *The non front desk service. My room this go around has a non functioning tv (which is not terribly surprising, given that the TV appears to be about a decade old). When I turn the thing on, it's on channel 62 and the remote wont change it. In fact, the actual tv itself has no "channel" button (it's broken off). I called house keeping (per the phone menu's directions) and they said they'd report it to maintenance. It's now been almost two hours. Since I've called, I've ordered, received, eaten, and put away my room service dinner. I just called again, asking if they plan to come (since I want to go to bed soon) and the woman snapped at me to, "Give it a few minutes-- sometimes it takes 30 minutes." I explained it's been two hours and she said, "Fine. I'll call them again. Thank you." And yeah. My TV still isn't working. *The internet. The TV wouldn't be so bad if I could stream videos or something on the internet (like any modern internet connection would allow), but their internet connection is incredibly, painfully slow. We're talking 5+ minutes to load a low quality, 10 minute Youtube video. It's not just crappy wifi, either-- I'm actually connected to their wired line! To top it off, this isn't free internet (which, even if terrible I'd soldier through because- hey! It's free!)-- no no, this slow thing costs $14 a day! Just for fun (since I have no other entertainment in the room), I ran an internet speed test. At the Rio Hotel in Las Vegas, NV, $14 a day gets you a blazingly fast .77 mbps download speed. *The Valet. So, most people don't realize that just about every valet in the city of Las Vegas is free. Really! Just be sure to tip. That said, the valet here at the Rio is perhaps the most disorganized I've ever seen-- they have such an odd way of stacking the cars that you usually end up waiting an eternity just to drop your car off. I know what you're thinking: "What the heck is wrong with you? You got screaming deal for the hotel room, what did you expect to happen?" Here's the thing: in Vegas, rooms are a dime a dozen. Good rooms. Cheap rooms. Nice rooms. I've stayed everywhere from the Plaza (never, ever again) to a penthouse at the Cosmopolitan (free upgrade. . please, please again) and the one thing these places have in common is that they are all screamin' deals. Ask any Vegas regular and they'll tell you that here, cheap doesn't necessarily mean low quality (and that's a GREAT thing for most travelers). So, my hope is that somebody at the Rio reads this and works on these short comings. This actually is a nice, off strip property, but the failings are definitely starting to outweigh the positives. By the way: it's now been 30 more minutes and no one has come to fix the TV. Still.

Reviews.Title: “I guess you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: caligirl618
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in so. cal and we go to Vegas two times per year. We decided on Rio because we received and offer in the mail for a free room for two nights. This included pet stay rooms so we decided to bring our small dachshund and have Thanksgiving at this hotel. The good- We ate at the Seafood Buffet and the The Carnival World buffet. The seafood was good, not great, too expensive for the quality. Carnival buffet was delicious! Well worth the 90 minute line on Thanksgiving. I had a 50 minute swedish massage at the Rio spa, and my theripist Kelly was excellent. The spa attendent was great too. The spa is a little small but very clean and a nice atmostphere. We did minimal gambling and the casino seems fine. The bell desk and valet were polite and efficiant. The awful-We stayed in the masquerade tower and our room was disgustining!! It reeked like smoke, when we tried to call to find out if it was a smoking room they said "No, but people do what they want". Everything was broken. PHONE, MINI BAR, SAFE, SINK! Gehetto tv with no channels. The beds were so hard and uncomfortable we were waking up all night. The decor was old, nasty and outdated. The pet stay rooms claim they come with dog bowls, a mat, poop bags and treats. This is posted on the Rio website. There were no pet features to speak of. It was very difficult to get a comfortable temperature in the room, the theormostat did not seem to function properly. There are only half windows, they are not floor to ceiling as the website claims, so there is no balcony and you cannot open windows. The shower was old and icky, I've witnessed better bathrooms at the motel 6. Even the kleenex and toliet paper is the cheap rough kind. The woman who checked us in seemed very young or new to the job. She made us wait fifteen minutes for her to find pet stay forms and seem to be very confused in providing us with any information on where anything was. Although some of the Rio's amenities were nice, I am so turned off by our icky room we will never stay here again. Comped room not worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Older”
Reviews.Author: RDibbxsh
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for 3 nights for a girl's softball tournament in mid November. Our room was near the top and had a great view to the northwest, looking at the mountains. We stayed in the older wings of the hotel. Rooms are older, but ours was in good shape. Beds were comfortable. We are non-smokers and it is definitely more smokey then the newer hotels. Our non-smoking room was fine, but corridors have moderate smoke odor. In reading reviews, room burglaries were an issue, but no one in our group experienced any problems. we did lock up everything in the smaller safe.

Reviews.Title: “Had a blast”
Reviews.Author: Misha24
Reviews.Content: I love this casino, it is never a dull moment! The shows are very entertaining and FREE! We stayed in a Huge room for half the cost thanks to our total reward card!

Reviews.Title: “RIO stay was great!”
Reviews.Author: NancyH357
Reviews.Content: Stayed Nov 13-16 and t was great! The rooms are very large. Has 2 bathroon areas. One sink, toilet and shower and one with sink closet and fridge. Has a sofa, end tables, desk, and TV and stand with another stocked fridge if you want to buy the expenisve treats. The room was very clean and comfortable. The furniture is outdated but still nice. View was great since one wall is all glass. elevators were quick and centrally located. I did eat at the American buger place and the food was very good and fair prices. I even won 100.00 playing VP while eating at at the bar. Staff were frindley to us and check in was quick and polite. drinks are strng and free while playing at the VP bars (did not play anywhere else). Waitress staff are barely covered in lingere but still tastfull. They dance and sing from time to time. Overall this is one of the best casinos and hotels in this area of the strip. Free shuttle from the casinso to the strip at Bally's or Harrahs. Are were comp'ed because of our play. we has 2 for one sow tickets and 10 bucks off any eatery there. I would highly recommend this casnio and hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: DianaWestminster_CA
Reviews.Content: The name tells it all. These are suites! A huge bedroom with a large enough area for a couch and coffee table, plus a TV hutch and a table and chairs. What I liked best is that there was a sink and mirror in the bathroom, then another sink and mirror outside in the closet area (which is also huge). We had a "standard" room which means the view isn't the best. But you could have fooled me! We could see Treasure Island to the left, and other casinos in the distance. Our room overlooked the pool down below which was just lovely to view at night. It was far enough from the strip (about a mile and a half) so that it was quiet. We went for our 12th anniversary midweek on a Monday and only paid $50 through expedia.com. My only complaint is that they raised the Carnival World MORNING Buffet from $15.99 to $18.99. This was a Tuesday morning! It has everything you could ever want for brunch but if you aren't a huge breakfast eater (I'm not), it's not worth the money. The room was clean, the towels were thick, bed was comfortable. Yes, we will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “"Non-smokers beware"”
Reviews.Author: Tndist
Reviews.Content: A recent conference in Las Vegas required a stay at the Rio. The Rio has been around for a while and needs a complete makeover. The rooms are spacious but, worn. The staff was polite and professional. Unfortunately, the cigarette/cigar smoke was unbearable. Once you stepped out of your room you sacrificed clean air. They need a ventilation system update or prohibit smoking outside of the casino area. There should also be non-smoking routes established for access to the convention center. Even smokers were overwhelmed by the smoke.The food in the restaurants was good but, common and overpriced. Food provided to conference participants was mediocre at best.

Reviews.Title: “Just fine for the Price!”
Reviews.Author: savvykat74
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 4 nights at the Rio while attending a conference (work paid for the room). Check in around 4pm was quick - only 5 minutes or so. My room was on the 10th floor Masquerade Tower. I know that reviews can go either way, so I was ready to see what I had for 4 days. The room was large - and as other reviews have said - more like an oversized hotel room and not a true "suite". But did I care? Not really. My room was immediately off of the elevator and there was NOT any noise the entire time. If anything, it was super convenient! Room tour: Everything was clean. Was the carpet a little warn, sure. Was the curtains/decor something I would have in my own house, no. Had the sofa seen better days, you bet. Do I really care?? Not really. Other reviews said that there was a coffee pot in the room. I had a fridge, but no coffee. I promptly called Housekeeping to bring up a couple of extra pillows and extra hangers - the 4 in the closet are never enough.. She arrived quicky with 2 extra pillows and about 15 hangers - score! She definately got a tip! I would have slept good the first night except for 2 things. There are train tracks that run along the East side of the hotel and there were freight trains it seemed like every hour on the hour. Secondly, there is a lighted switch on the wall next to the bed - i assume so you can see the light switch in the dark. I like it QUIET and DARK when I sleep. Well, there were no more trains after that night and a piece of paper and scotch tape took care of the lighted switch. The hotel was fairly easy to navigate - especially for having to find the conference rooms. During my stay, I ate at Burger King (chicken sandwich), Sao Paulo Cafe, the ice cream place by the main entrance and Carnival World Buffet. SOOOO upset that Village Seafood Buffet was undergoing repairs or something and wasn't going to be opened back up until the weekend. Carnival was good - but I was expecting it to be awesome- as it's touted to be "one of the best." It was fine - but not one of the best. I checked out from my room on the TV - easy enough. Overall, for the price I paid, (free, courtesy of work) I have no complaints. I prefer to stay on the strip. It was a PIA to have to catch the shuttle - and if you missed it, you were stuck until the next one.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Get Away”
Reviews.Author: sled_head67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riofor the first time because of the deal. We paid $25/night. For that price it was an excelent value. The front desk staff were nothing special. Could even be considered sort of rude. The room was big and open but this property is getting tired. Mini fridge was nice. Glad we did not pay $100/night as that definitely would not be worth it, We rented a car so being off the strip was not such a big deal. Lots of free parking but can be a little confusing trying to park close to your tower. All in all I enjoyed staying at the rio for the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: kkroe77
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio due to its all suites and less expensive rates. The rooms were very large and comfortable. The Hotel itself is not as elaborate as many on the strip, however it was clean and nice. Though we frequented this hotel in February, the pools were closed, we toured the pool area and had it been nice, it was have been a nice enough pool area. Really, this hotel is nothing fancy, but again, nice enough. It is about a 15-20 minute walk to the strip, coming out at ceasars palace area, so pretty central. There are many many frequent shuttles to the strip, generally around the Harrahs hotel. Clean shuttle buses, that are free. I would not stay at the Rio again, ONLY because its location off the strip. Even with the shuttles, I still found it to be an annoyance. If you do not mind the distance, it was a nice enough hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place but Hidden Charges”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinVagabond
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, but beware of hidden charges. They not only charge for all local calls made from your room, but they also charge you for calling 800 toll-free numbers - outrageous! If you as much as pick up and look at anything in your in-room "mini-bar", even if you put it back without using it, it senses that you removed it and bills your room for the item. I was able to get the 800-number charges and un-used snack charges removed from my bill with a stern call to the manager at the front desk. There is a coffee maker in your room, but it is a Keurig-type that uses the little single-serving "K-cups" - and you must BUY the coffee from your mini-bar at $8 for 3 cups of coffee - again, outrageous! The cheapest motel I've ever stayed in at least has free in-room coffee. Then there is the in-room Internet service (which sometimes was unusably slow) which is $13.95/day - but it showed up on my bill as $10/day. The moral with this place is you should check your hotel bill the night before you check out using the option to view it on the TV in your room to be sure there are no surprise charges at check out. You can actually check out on the TV, skip the line at the front desk, and if you want a printed receipt call them the next day and they will email you one immediately. This hotel is on the west side of the freeway, so not much very close to walk to. On the positive side, the rooms were clean, the staff was friendly and they even gave me an early check-in at 12:30PM. Self-parking is free in the structure behind the hotel. Be sure to check out the coupons that come in the little folder with your room key card - there are deals for bargains at the other Caesar's-owned hotels, like 2-for-1 to go up the Eiffel Tower at Paris Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Got Back”
Reviews.Author: JDspooner
Reviews.Content: Returned from the Rio yesterday. Our second trip this year. Stayed on the 36th floor of the Masquerade Tower. Huge room (with coffee pot). As usual, the room was spotless, but there was only one small chair at the desk. With all that space they could add a table with 4 chairs for dining in room. The employees were polite, and service was very good.

Reviews.Title: “The room that time forgot”
Reviews.Author: ajlbb
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 4th floor of the Masquerade tower, aptly named because it is best viewed through a tight mask. I should have asked for a different room, but we arrived after midnight and didn't notice how terrible our room was until the next morning when we actually tried to use its amenities. The shower pull on the tub distributed only about a third of the water to the actual shower head, so you washed in a trickle while water poured out of the bath tap. I called housekeeping but couldn't determine if they did anything. I would have loved to test other reviewers' claims of mini bar charges, but ours was totally empty. No coffee machine either. No little book with hotel information. Did they have a fitness center? I'm still not sure. No explanation of how to connect to the Wi-Fi. I know they design it so you want to be in the (smoky) casino and not the room, but does that mean I can't have a bath mat? Or general cleanliness? Looking at traveler pics, it's clear there were plenty of nicer rooms in this hotel. I would give them a lower rating, except my experience seems par for Vegas. If this is how it's going to be, I'd rather stay on the Strip next time, if only for more dining options. There is a free shuttle to the Strip but many of our meals were between conference sessions, so didn't have time to get over and back. Only fair to say what was good. The bed was comfortable. And the conference area was nice. Much nicer than the room.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: BermudaRick
Reviews.Content: Very friendly dealer l,low table limits a variety ofentertainment and a great seafood restaurant. Felt very comfortable and found the layout great as in some casinos it is easy to get lost .

Reviews.Title: “The SPA at Rio”
Reviews.Author: sspc
Reviews.Content: I went to the Spa at the Rio yesterday and I was very pleasantly surprised. It's very small but well appointed. The thing that impressed me the most is they offered crudite most spas just offer fruit so to have sliced veggies was a treat. Also, shockingly they had an alkaline water system. This is pretty advanced stuff. Most people don't even know what that is. It's the best water for promoting good health. Finally, because I went after 5pm, I was charged half to use the facility. The best $11.00 I ever spent.

Reviews.Title: “AWFUL!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Patty E
Reviews.Content: On Wed Oct. 26th, we spent over $200.00 in the gift shops in the Rio. In fact it is the only place where we bought gifts while in Vegas for 4 days. We went in primarily for just a World Series of Poker baseball cap ($19.99). We ended up buying a $42.00 betty boop handbag, 4 animal hats for the kids ($19.99 each) and 4 cigarette lighters ($7.99 each). And before we left town we went back and bought 4 coffee mugs and a shot glass before we left town. You don't test drive gifts like this you expect everything to fit and work properly. When we got home 2 weeks later and gave the lighters to our friends they didn't work. I called the Rio,. by the way finding a direct phone number to the hotel was difficult. I was past from one person to another, probably took 20 min. to 30 min. I told my story to everyone that answered and was transferred from reservation clerk to concierge, to property manager, to a manager that was supposed to be in charge of the gift shops. He asked me what would make me happy about this whole situation, I said lighters that work. He told me he would personally take care of this that same day. But after about an hour he called me back and told me that that particular gift shop is controlled by a subcontractor that leases the shop from the Rio. Oh Wow! Everything they sell has the Rio's name on it. It's in the Rio too. But I was assured that someone from that shop would call me. That was Nov 11th. Still haven't heard a thing from anyone at the Rio or the shop. I guess the saying, "What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas," is totally true. It's just 4 cigarette lighters to the Rio but it's $33.96 to me. And the friends that we got those gifts for think we brought them cheesey lighters they can't use. We could have bought them all a Bic lighter that works. Thought it would be a cool place to stay next time but no way now, they aren't getting another dime from me. The Elams, Bilings, MT, 406.591.4896

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Tippet
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a stay at the Rio and I was very pleased with the experience. I booked through a third party(airline)package. I called the Rio the morning of my reservation and requested a room in the Ipanema tower part of the hotel. When I arrived they gave me room 1508 with a nice view of the western mountains.The hotel staff were very nice and being a non-smoker I appreciated that I could not smell smoke in the casino/lobby areas.If you have not been to Vegas in awhile be prepared for the high cost of food.I had a burger and two beers in the All-American Grill for $29.00.Breakfast in the Sao Paulo Cafe was $19.80($3.50 for a cup of coffee!)Sports Deli dinner for $21.00. A beer from the bar is $6.00. To print your boarding pass is now $5.00 at the kiosks in the hotel! Enjoyed my stay at the Rio!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Suite Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: chief55
Reviews.Content: We enjoy staying at the RIO! We have been to Vegas numerous times and like visiting the strip, but also enjoy being a little bit away from it. The rooms are spacious and the bathroom is convenient for two people getting ready to go out. The beds and pillows are comfortable. The casino is expensive for table games, but it is a lively place. The restaurants are high priced without any deals. The heated pool is the only one I swim in, but all pools are very nice. I will definitely stay here again if the room rate is right.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT FOR A CONFERENCE”
Reviews.Author: PROF_CONSULTANT
Reviews.Content: Went to a conference at the RIO and was impressed with everything from the room to the food at the conference. The room was spacious and had a great view. All the catered food was top-notch. It is not that far off the strip and we actually walked to Caesars. There is also a shuttle every 30 minutes to Ballys, so there is no problem in getting to the strip if you think you are stranded at the RIO - you aren't. They had some great restaurants at the RIO as well (Buzio's as well as the Carnival Buffet)

Reviews.Title: “Two great days at the RIO”
Reviews.Author: nmfallguy
Reviews.Content: I just spent the last week in Vegas,stayed at the rio for two nights.Upon check in The front end staff up graded my room all I had to do was ask.The World Series of Poker was in its final two days so the casino was very busy,the shocking thing to me was the fact I was on a comp.Every other casino I contacted was either booked or over priced. If you have a players card use it call all the casinos dont give up,do some research,Vegas has some great deals all you have to do is find them. I have another review to write on Harrahs another comp. 5 days in vegas total hote bill 00.00,Thanks for reading hope you have a great time and lots of luck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, comfortable suites, a great location...”
Reviews.Author: Nance5612
Reviews.Content: This current year we have had several stays at the Rio Suites. It is off the strip, which we like there are awesome perks to staying off the strip. The views are great, you can see so much of the strip from the rooms. They free shuttle service to take you to several of their sister hotels on the strip, that run continually from morning to very late at night. Parking has easy access to the hotel. The suites are spacious and give you some comforts of home, small living room area, a mini fridge, and coffee maker. If you want the best views, request upper floor with pool or strip views in the Mascarade wing. Their pools are very nice, though they tend to be cold. We took advantage of the option to use the pool at Paris a few times, their pool is heated. The dining options are plentiful and offer a wide variety of menus. Treat yourself to a romantic evening at the top of the RIO at the VooDoo restaurant and night club, it is worth the money. I have 29 years of travel experience and have stayed at many other hotels on the strip, but like going to the RIO for the suites and the comforts they offer.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: suefromsa123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the RIO before, probably 5 years ago and there have been some subtle changes. It is not bad for the price I paid, but there are some little things that bothered me. I had to put a $50 a day deposit on my room in addition to the stated price, which I was unaware of when I made my reservation. Also, there is a coffee maker in the room, but if you want to make coffee it costs $3 for a package of coffee grounds. Minor, but annoying there was a dirty tissue in the middle of the hallway from the time I arrived Saturday evening until the time I left on Tuesday. I would think housekeeping would pick the litter up off the hallway. Also, a piece of bedding (more decorative than functional) was folded and placed at the bottom of my bed. When I unfolded it, it was filthy. I can only speculate what the dried white substance was...eeeew. I think I will stay downtown next time, as the RIO is out of the way and everywhere you need to go you should take a cab if you do not have a car rental. The most annoying thing to me was the fact that in the casino they only had two Wheel of Fortune quarter machines. What's up with that? Also, the buffet is great but I made the mistake of going for breakfast on a Sunday morning which cost about $27 each. With the tip I ended up spending $70 for breakfast. Needless to say we had McD's for dinner. I would recommend joining the players club and paying about $45 for a 24 hour pass to all the buffet's affiliated with RIO, there are several. I did not know this an no one told me. So do a little research before you go. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: “No Worse Than Any Other”
Reviews.Author: RossPhx
Reviews.Content: What’s the difference between a Las Vegas resort and a Motel 6? You don’t have to wait in line 20 minutes to check in to a Motel 6. But since most Las Vegas places give you the unwelcome treatment, don’t let that keep you from staying here. I stayed at the Rio to avoid Strip traffic, while visiting friends who live in the northwest part of town. Even around the Rio, traffic is miserable. Access is possible off Flamingo, but if you park in the garage east of the hotel, it’s a long walk to the front desk, and good luck trying to find your way back to Flamingo when you leave. In daylight I found the parking garage on the west side of the hotel/casino. Even though I paid an online discounted rate, I had a great view of the Strip from the 11th floor. The curtains kept out the light, so I could sleep late. The bed was not the traditional “hard as a board” found in most Las Vegas accommodations. It was actually comfortable, and so were the pillows. There were two sinks, a large tub with shower, and just one bar of soap. I think Motel 6 gives you two. There is also a coffee maker, but the premium ground coffee costs $8 in the minibar. I took it out to look at how much it weighed, figuring it was slightly more expensive than saffron. Maybe that’s why the $8 charge showed up on my bill when I tried to do the video checkout. They must have scales, or surveillance cameras, in that minibar. No problem, it was just a 15-minute wait to check out at the front desk. I asked about one bar of soap. They said I could have had more if I had asked. Maybe the last guest came back to the room before I arrived, took some coffee and soap, and left the dirty washcloth draped over the shower curtain bar. Or maybe the housekeeper just missed it. There wasn’t a shower mat, either. Maybe that’s what the dirty washcloth is for. There are more elevators than in most large hotels, and they run frequently. I’ll stay there again, if the price is right. The Rio is no worse than any other place in town.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: aamartin20
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for a conference - had to take shuttles to and from the strip (which meant waiting in line for more than 30 minutes at times). Service was terrible - and nothing was free - had to pay to use the internet and to go to the fitness center. A truly disspointing hotel in comparison to those on the strip - plus - there was an odd smell throughout the hotel - bad flower fragrance trying to cover up cigarette smoke.

Reviews.Title: “RIO needs a re-do”
Reviews.Author: edmonddergen
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff and service were outstanding. The large rooms are clean. Bath rooms are well maintained. Some rooms feature two complete vanity areas; one inside the bath and one just outside. Most rooms have refrigerators. In house entertainment was "fair." There are several excellent restraunts; and several average ones. Food and beverage prices are exorbitant. (However, that is now typical of all Las Vegas upgrade establishments.) Guest room configurations facilitate a comfortable stay. Linen and terry are excellent quality. Beds are comfortable. Bed pillows are conformed for comfort. The hotel needs a complete refurbishment. Throughout the house carpeting is clean; but, worn and shabby. (The hotel industry rule has always been that carpet should be replaced every seven, and not more than ten years.) Case goods are second rate and "tired." Headboards are fifties inelegant. TV sets are out of date. They desprately need a decorator. Rooms feature room wide, floor to ceiling windows which furnish a spectacular view of Las Vegas; partucularly at night. However, in the day time it appears that those windows are not washed often enough. Further, complaints were heard about the odd effects caused by the tinting on some of the windows. Taxi service is probably better in Las Vegas than any other town in the Nation. And you should plan on using one to make your way to the other hotels and shows on the strip. Even though it's only a few blocks, it's an awkward long walk from the Rio. Never the less, especially if you can get a deal on the room rate, you will enjoy your stay at the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “For Us, The Best Place”
Reviews.Author: ACMan53
Reviews.Content: Just return from a three day week-end trip and will go back. What I don't like about Vegas is the strip...to congested and too many people. The Rio has a laid back feel to it, eveyone is very friendly and not so crowded. The rooms are still comfortable, especially the bed (a flat screen TV would be nice). But over-all it still is a great destination, especially if you don't like the big "Superstore-Type" Casinos

Reviews.Title: “huge rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mariette B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio on October 30th, 2011. The room cost $68 and they upgraded me for free. The suite had a bar, living room, dining room, 2 bathrooms, 2 showers, a jacuzzi, a hot tub room with massage table, a kitchen and a bedroom. The furniture was somewhat worn but everything was extremely clean. Though it was very noisy when I checked in, it was quiet by the time I went to bed. It had wall to wall windows with a great view. I would definitely go back and look forward to taking my family next time.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Las Vegas - ok but there is better”
Reviews.Author: jayjay5577
Reviews.Content: I usually stay a Total Rewards properties to accumulate points and get free rooms etc. And I thought I would try the Rio based on a recommendation from a friend. Well that friend was wrong. It was too cold to go to the pool. I won't hold that against the Rio. The pool area did look decent. The rooms were big and clean. the hallway decor and carpet looked dark and dirty. The Voodoo Steakhouse was mediocre. The carnival buffet didn't stand out as being amazing like I thought it would be. It seemed just as good as any other buffet. Maybe the seafood buffet was better but I didn't get a chance to eat there. The Voodoo Lounge has a great view but I stayed about 15 minutes because I was more focused on gambling than drinking at a bar. The whole vibe was not as classy as other properties like Caesars. Yes Caesars is more upscale and on the strip but when in Rome...If you want a less expensive hotel but willing to deal w lower quality ambiance, food,accommodations then the rio is for you. Party on! But if your goal is to be in a nice room, nice ambience, nice decor, quality food then don't go to the Rio. You will be disappointed. I will not be going back. There are so many other options if you can spend a little more.

Reviews.Title: “nice suites, fun environment ..”
Reviews.Author: VickiSecrets
Reviews.Content: everything you need including a shuttle to the strip! great restaraunts, chippendales, casino and bars.. was there mid week and still a ton of fun!

Reviews.Title: “Pet Stay expanded to 5th Floor of Masquerade Tower now”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachCitiesUSA
Reviews.Content: Second comp-ed visit to the Rio this year. Check in was a breeze. Of course we brought the dog to the front desk for approval but still the desk clerk forgot the pet waiver paper work and we didn't get the bowls and dog treat package. We came prepared so that was not a problem for us. We took an odd numbered room on the 5th floor overlooking the casino roof. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable and the rest of furnishing were in decent condition... but the bath tub drain was closed and dripping water had accumulated a few inches deep in the tub. I just opened the drain and closed the valve, problem solved. More "problems", the door lock was broken and would not work. A call to maintenance and the lock was replaced. There was no clock in the room and a call down to the front desk to request a wake up call resulted in an interminable hold so I gave up on that. There was no coffee maker in the room but there was a mini fridge which we did use. There was no DND or Dog In Room signs to hang on the door so the maid came in while I was napping the next afternoon. Not a problem, the dog alerted me and I just asked the room maid for fresh towels but she insisted on cleaning the bath so I let her. Very friendly lady. I left her a nice tip. The room was comped and we ate off of TR points so it was a free trip minus travel and the bad luck in the casino this time. I did breakfast solo at Carnival World Buffet @ $16 plus tip. Nice selection and good food. I give breakfast a "B". We did the Village Seafood Buffet @ $80 for two plus $6 for one beer plus tip. The "waiter" was attentive. The food was not great but "good" enough, another "B". The only cash involved besides gambling was the tips for breakfast at Carnival World buffet, dinner at Seafood Village Buffet and for the maid. We didn't leave the property until check out two days later so being off the Strip wasn't a factor. The dog relief area at Rio is the nicest of the Ceasars properties, we'll be back again. Highly recommended even with the flaws, especially for four legged fur child "parents". On a non-TR basis I don't know but I don't understand why anyone pays for rooms in Las Vegas, anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Not a friendly place”
Reviews.Author: Manik M
Reviews.Content: I visited the Rio Hotel and Casino but most of the employees were unfriendly and disrespectful to me. Specially the keno department was awful. I asked a question about Keno Game and the way she answered was very disrespectful and gave me a feeling that she does not care.

Reviews.Title: “BEST VALUE IN VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: rnphatpat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Vegas OCT 2011 stayed at the Rio could have stayed at any of Harrah"s properties, again I chose the RIO. I LUV the large spacious rooms the atmousphere and the gaming. After reading some of the negative reviews I felt I needed to set the record straight. For those of you who want coffee in the room do what I did invest in a personel travel coffee maker, bring your own coffee/tea . Skip room service I discovered the sports bar located across from Ipanema towers the food is made to order, fresh, hot and ,almost half the price of room service and THE ALL AMERICAN GRILL. You can get food to go as well if you prefer to dine in your room or you can dine in sports bar lots of seating, close to casino floor well ventilated. These rooms come with fridges a lot of hotels charge $ 10/25 dollars a day. NO IT NOT 5 STARS BUT YOU ARE NOT paying 5 STAR prices but you get a lot bang for your buck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, big rooms with a non-stop carnival atmosphere downstairs.”
Reviews.Author: Shaka_Frank
Reviews.Content: This was a first time staying at the Rio. We were stunned how big the room was compared to what we came from downtown. Both of our nights (Sunday and Monday) were comp'd through the Total Rewards program, so it was heavenly having this much room for nothing. They get you back in the casino, however. The Rio is big. I don't know if we were in the oldest or newest tower (the Ipanema Tower), but the room amenities were four star as far as we were concerned. The suite was big, the beds were comfortable, the bathroom was big (separate vanities) and there was a good selection of channels on the TV. The maid staff was very helpful. An especially nice touch was the blackout drapes. Daytime could be made into midnight in the room if needed for sleep. Rio self-parking is a hike from the front desk or room elevators. Use valet if you don't want a long, winding walk through the casino areas. The check-in line was long even though this was not a peak period. I heard a lot of grumbling. Check-out can be done on the room TV or over the phone, though. Valet was a little slow except when we did final checkout at mid-night. The casino areas at the Rio are a continous madhouse, noisy and a little rowdy. Being Halloween night, they were also a freak show. But, it was fun. And, that's the whole point of staying at the Rio, continuous Carnival and let your hair down. I'd go back, especially for a comp'd room.

Reviews.Title: “Getting long in the tooth”
Reviews.Author: JeanAlspaugh
Reviews.Content: Second time stayng at the Rio. Two years ago, we really enjoyed our stay. Not so this time. The check-in process was horrible. Finally get our room, but not the room we asked for. In our room, the safe was broken, the make-up mirror was broken and the carpet was repaired with electrical tape. While I could deal with most of that for the price, except for the safe. When I called facilities, they told me I should have been told that upon check-in. While there are nice service people there (I did like the spa), in general, the service was a bit lacking as well. And, the pool closed on the Sunday before Halloween when it was 80 degrees out? The real kicker was the lack of response to my complaints from management. Too many hotels in Vegas to settle for sub-par.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room”
Reviews.Author: ArmyNurseElPaso_TX
Reviews.Content: Huge room. Came with a coffee pot, but they charge you for the coffee - ridiculous! Good conference facilities, but a loooong walk to get there.

Reviews.Title: “rio was well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: bigredapple
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Hotel was more than adequate The check-in was fast and asking for a specific room was not a hassle We arrived 4 hours ahead of check-in so the bell hops took care of our luggage for us, no problem When we finally got to our room we were very suprised at how large the rooms were They were very clean and the beds were comfortable The casino was fairly large and there were quite a few shops to spend your money at There were lots of shows taking place in the theatre and the disco on the roof top was going all night There was really no need to leave the hotel except for the food prices The only negative about the hotel was the price of the buffets We ate all our meals next door at the Gold Coast hotel and casino a 2 minute walk from the Rio A real deal for thier buffet Over all the Rio was well worth the money We are planning another trip back

Reviews.Title: “Best kept secret off the strip!”
Reviews.Author: NickChick
Reviews.Content: We love the view and convenience of this hotel. Request the Masquerade Suite on 53rd Floor. We honeymooned here and come back every anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Not My Favorite Hotel In Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rleland
Reviews.Content: In Vegas for girls softball showcase. No registration parking unless you're using valet. Self-parking is very far from rooms. Long haul with luggage. Rooms large, but outdated for today's standard in hotels. Room looked old and felt dirty. Opened drawer next to sofa and found open bag of tortilla chips, napkins, and a dirty steak knife. Also noticed used plastic cup under table. TV is outdated tube type in cabinet. Hard to watch TV from beds. Not too many channels either. A/C didn't really work. Had to keep adjusting temperature control. Stayed in Impanema Tower on west side. Nice view of casino roof and parking structures. Hotel/casino is pretty racey for kids and older teenage girls. Near nude dancers in open areas.Desk staff didn't ask me how my stay was until I was walking away at check-out. I said not too good, won't stay here again. He said, "ok, sorry." Off the Vegas Strip, but very easy to access. Not a lot of plus for this hotel. I will not stay at the Rio again. Too many better choices in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed this time...”
Reviews.Author: LuvsDogsNJ
Reviews.Content: Last year I wrote that this was the best hotel I've stayed at ever...well not so much this time. I stayed at the Rio for 4 nights Oct 20-24th. The room though still large, was missing the living room style chair, the couch looked like it was from the Salvation Army--we were so skeeved by it, we covered it with a sheet before sitting on it. I paid for a third person, but had to constantly ask for moret owels, toiletries, etc. Note- no one checked our passes when we went to the pool, so no need to pay out for additional people in your room, they sleep 4 anyway-why is it that we had to pay for a third person, an 18 yr old at that. I had the Wet 'n Wild plan...2 free drinks per person at the pool. What a fiasco---my sister was the other person- the bartender would not accept her hotel ID; I had to go to the front desk and work it out where there was a blank reservation. I must say that Walter / NY at the front desk was very customer focused, others at the front could not care less. Even with all that, I still got charged, I found out when I went to check on via the tv. So back down to the front desk ! I was there for a conference, and the conference center was great, good food, clean, well organized, so they get points for that. Overall, if you are looking for "fancy" don't come here. If you are looking for cheap ( though when I went it was almost $200/nt so check the price calendar before you book), not so crowded, the waitresses do come by with free drinks often---then the Rio is ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: rporter8555
Reviews.Content: We booked our room at the Rio through Southwest Airlines about 3 months ago and got a great price, could be before convention goers ran the prices up. We got a room on 10th floor of Ipanema Tower at the end of the hall, farthest away from the elevator so it was very quiet. The room was very large and comfortable. Large bathroom, very comfortable bed, very clean. Only disappointment was that the coffee had to be purchased through the minibar (opted instead for Starbucks located adjacent to the ground floor elevator lobby). Water pressure in the shower was better than expected for a large hotel. We recommend eating at All American Grille, good steaks, ribs, and if you are wanting a great lunch, try the chili. The free shuttle to the strip only runs every half hour, and had more travelers than room on the buses, so we resigned ourselves to taxi for every trip (not such a bad thing since we were not interested in waiting for a shuttle run schedule anyway). Slot play at the Rio was good to me, hit a top-five jackpot on penny machine and in the west side of the casino they had most of the newer machines. Rio has some of the best and most attentive comp drink service (and I-Candy) in Vegas. Recommend walking next door to the Gold Coast for good slots action.

Reviews.Title: “With the the other choices in Vegas, I would stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Rockinjla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio due to a business meeting. I had never been to Rio all my times to Vegas for work for pleasure and was interested in checking out the hotel. I knew it wasn't going to be good when I say fake flowers decorating the outside of the property. First, this is one of the smokiest casinos I have ever been in. And I have been in many of them in Las Vegas. My clothes and hair would reek by the time I got back to my room at the end of each day passing through the casino to the meeting rooms. Second my room... it wasn't a "suite". It was a large room that was nothing fancy. In fact, I don't think my room had been redecorated since the early 90s when the hotel was built. The room was not dirty, just worn and very outdated. I was paying a rate of $160 + tax / night for the room and there is NO WAY this room was worth $160 + tax / night. Maybe $80 + tax/ night. In fact one day, my room was never cleaned. See pictures below for what I mean by outdated. Third, the staff. Check was very efficient and the front desk lady was very nice and one of the poker dealers was really fun to talk to. Other than that, would give the rest of the staff a big ole F. Examples, I had to wait almost 15 min (there was no in front of me) for the concierge. She was on the phone the whole time. No one else was there and to be honest, she didn't know much about the property or y options for a private room at one of the "resorts" restaurants. The pool person. I walked down to the pool drinking a Diet Coke. The pool "guard" told me I could not take the Diet Coke into the pool. I was like why? I just opened it. She said I could not bring outside food into the pool. I was like really? She told me to throw it out.
