I had already paid $3 for a 12 oz bottle of diet coke so I just went back to my room to put it up there. When I went back to the pool the same pool guard was there and she demanded to search my bag. I was livid. How dare a 20 some year old want to look in my beach bag (all that was in there was a Nook, sunscreen, room key, and my phone). That whole scene left a really bad impression. And I could not see a sign posted that said no outside food. If it was there, it was small. The Rio was running a fundraiser where people could repeal down the side of the building... well that happened to be right in front of my room. I walked in, started to change and there was a person hanging in front of my window. Scared me to death. I called the front desk, spoke to the manager and asked why people were not given warning of this whose rooms would be affected and he had no answer. He then proceeded to tell me that at 8 am on Saturday morning they would be doing an opening ceremony on the roof (under my windows). I was like really? On a Saturday AM? He told me he would put a $30 credit towards breakfast... but it never happened. And the last example was the service we had at the seafood restaurant. It was decorated nicely and some of the food was OK, but the service was horrible. It took forever for our plates to be cleared, the server never came by to check on how everything was, and we would have to flag him down for additional drinks, etc. Forth, you are really removed from all the action of the strip. A cab ride to the closest CVS (by Aria) was $11 one way. I did not like being that far from the strip. Lets just say, if you are going to Vegas, I would stay far away from this place. It's not worth it with so many other really nice casinos on the strip that offer a much higher level of service and MUCH nicer, more modern rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Passed its prime”
Reviews.Author: S35flyer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Vegas hotels, Caesars, mirage, MGM, on and on. This was first time at the Rio and the last. The rooms are worn, the people not the happiest Ive seen and the prices are outrageous for the smallest of items, 12 bucks for 2 light beers? Tried to have lunch and every rest. In the hotel had lines and waits up to 45 mins. It's pretty clear they have cut everything to the bone, and that's how it felt. A dying hotel waiting to implode.

Reviews.Title: “here's my money”
Reviews.Author: msdebagain
Reviews.Content: While the room was great LOOKING, but there were some issues. The toilet just would not flush. I called the operator, and she said that they were low water flushing toilets. Since we have one at home, i told her that it was not flushing correctly. She said she was sorry but thats the way it worked. We just went to the bathroom downstairs at the casino since we were on our way to a gathering. also, ice machine not working on 3,4th and 5th floors. Reported, but never fixed while we were there. Upon checkin, the clerk told us we had to put 100 dollars on our card as a deposit, but that we would get it back upon checkout. The money was taken out of my account, the day we checked OUT of the hotel. When i called about it from home, i was told it takes 10 days to put it back in our account. The only reason we stayed there was the inexpensive rate, and no resort fee. won't make that mistake again when we go in February

Reviews.Title: “Convention at Rio”
Reviews.Author: doxieladytitusville
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a convention. Nice large rooms, Coffee maker, but coffee has to be purchased elsewhere for $8 for 3 packets. Food is overpriced, but the food provided at the convention was excellent. All vegatarian and vegan. Good choices and very creative.

Reviews.Title: “This is one of the best values for what you get in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: FrntDskManager
Reviews.Content: My buddies and I have made three straight January Vegas roadtrips, and each time, we've spent some or all of our nights at the Rio. I've seen some of the reviews on here, and here's my take: If you are expecting five stars, it's not here. I've stayed at the Venetian, and that's five stars. I also paid five times as much there to experience that. If you are coming to Vegas and planning on spending time in your room instead of experiencing Vegas, then yes, there is plenty of hotels that might work better. But if you are coming to Vegas to have a place to crash with plenty of room to spread out in for a good price, this is it. You can walk to the strip (1/2 mile away) or take one of the shuttles that goes to the Harrah's properties. Use the $20 trick - put a $20 bill between your license and your credit card when you check in and ask for any upgrades they may have available - and they've always hooked us up with a great view of the strip on a high floor. If I have the option, I will always want to stay here when in Vegas because I want to use the majority of the money I'm bringing on things other than hotel room costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: cbtime1999
Reviews.Content: The Rio is one of the best hotels that i have ever stayed in while visiting Vegas. The hotel has many clubs, great food, friendly staff and the Penthouse Suites are out of this world. I lost a few hundred dollar's in the casino but the ambiance of my room made that lost easier to bare.

Reviews.Title: “Stay on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: pleos2
Reviews.Content: The RIO idea of an "ALL SUITE Property" is sadly mistaken. Our room was nothing more than an oversized regular hotel room. A SUITE has a kitchenette, living room, seperate bedroom and nice size bathroom. You have to pay $8.00 for coffee maker supplies in the room. Don't open the HIDDEN "wet bar", which is under the tv or you will be charged for it. The Show in The Sky was chopped down from the last time we were there. Pools were nice. The World Buffet was nothing to rave about. It seemed the same things repeated periodically as you walked the line. The staff was WONDERFUL!!! Friendly and accomodating! The casino...same typical games as all the other Vegas Casinos.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rio!”
Reviews.Author: Jade-Stamford
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing stay at Rio's where, courtesy of the Management, 3 out of 4 of our rooms were upgraded to fabulous spacious suites. Check in was slow but well worth it with these upgrades! The pool areas were delightful and spacious, plenty of sunloungers not all cramped together. Drinks were surprisingly expensive at the beach bar though! The Carnival World Buffet was excellent both for evening meal and for breakfast - great variety of foods from around the world. Shops and casino were good. Disappointing that the Show in the Sky was not on when we were staying there. Shuttle service to the Strip was good - we didn't have to wait long in either direction. Bought a "Buffet of Buffets Pass" on the first evening that was valid for 24 hours and gave the choice of dining in 6 other hotels in addition to Rios - excellent value for money at $49 + tax.

Reviews.Title: “As expected....”
Reviews.Author: pron6miller
Reviews.Content: I stayed 10/21-23 - the room was not a suite, but was larger than average, clean, with all the usual amenities. The dealers in the casino had an excellent personality and the spa was OUTSTANDING, definitely go there - mention spafinder.com and they give you 30+% discounts. The vibe at the pool was more relaxed than the pools on the strip, so if you're looking for a party, I would go elsewhere, but if you want to relax, this works.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: dwluvsvegas
Reviews.Content: We go to Vegas twice a year. This time we split our week - 3 nights at th Rio and 4 nights at Harrah's. Wish we would have stayed the whole week at the Rio. We arrived on a Sat. at 6:00 pm. Only one person in line. Check in was great-very nice gentleman checked us in. We had a room right against the elevator so it was extra roomy. Sure, the room is showing it's age but we were comped so I actually think I got more than I paid for. We had a room on the 36th floor of the Masquerade Tower. Great view - wall to wall windows. Free coffee - even though I always bring our own kettle anyway. Casino is smokey in the lowered ceiling part. We saw the Show in the Sky Sat. night. It was entertaining. We don't like the crowds on the strip so this is a great alternative. Bed was comfy. We didin't hear any noise from the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms; but challenging to get to.”
Reviews.Author: ShagOhio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night this October and one night last November. Both times we traveled in from a vacation in Utah and were flying out of Vegas. Got good deals on the Rio website. The room rate was great and the room was great. However, getting to the room in the Masquerade tower was a challenge. I guess they assume all guests will do valet parking but if you park your car yourself in the garage, you have to take an elevator up to the walkway that goes into the casino. Then you walk through the casino to get another elevator down to the casino floor. Then you have to get to another bank of elevators to get to the floor of your room. I won't stay here again for this reason. Plus every restaurant is very pricey. Last year, they automatically upgraded our room. That was great - it was a room that had a TV in the bathroom mirror! But again, getting to the room is inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: js945
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights at the Rio, and I was shocked of how fun it actually was! LOCATION: It's located off the strip next to the Gold Coast and down the street from the Palms. Depending on which casino you want to go to, it's a $7-$12 taxi ride to the strip. You don't want to walk, trust me. *My fare to the airport (20 min. ride) was $17, but there IS a shuttle service that costs $7, but you need to make reservations at least a few hours in advance, and the shuttle leaves 3 hours before your flight (40 min. - 50 min. ride). LOCATION RATING: 3.5/5. CASINO: Typical slots/video poker. I didn't play the machines very much because I know the chances of winning on slots is slim to none. The minimum on the table games was $10. If you don't feel like spending that much, go across the street to Gold Coast where the tables are $5 minimums (I won $100 on a craps table there). The staff at the casino was pleasant, and the men wore football jerseys on Sunday, which I thought was cool. I think once every hour, a dancer would get up on these mini stages around the casino and dance/sing for 5-10 minutes. At night, the Rio Sky Show in Masquerade Village is great! Lots of singing, dancing, and removal of clothing (not talking strip club style, but they got down to a corset and panties; and for you ladies, the men took their shirts off). CASINO RATING: 4.5/5. SHOWS: The only two shows that I was aware of was Penn & Teller and Chipendales...didn't attend either. Thus, no rating here. HOTEL ROOM: Even though the Rio advertises "all suites," the room seemed fairly basic. Two beds, fridge, ironing board/iron, in room safe. The only things that made it stand out was a sofa and a booze/snacks fridge (which is really expensive, as expected) under the TV. The TV wasn't even flat screen. I was in the Stratosphere on my last trip to Vegas, and even it had a flat screen. Room was very clean and the halls were quiet. Housekeeping was very nice and met my needs. There was one thing that really stood out and that I find extremely odd, there is a small window between the shower and the room. It is a glass window with a design, but what's the point? So we can all be peeping toms? ROOM RATING: 4/5. POOL: I didn't get to use the pool, but it looked very nice. Though a bit smaller than I expected, there was a huge rock pile in the middle with multiple waterfalls. This rate is based on what I saw. POOL RATING: 3.5/5. FOOD CHOICES: I ate at McFaddens and one of the sports bars (don't remember the name, but the servers all wore referee shirts). McFaddens is an Irish Pub style restaurant with great food and good beer. They even had a beer pong tournament (new cups used every game). At the sports bar, I had a cajun chicken quesadilla, which was quite good. There are two different buffets. One is a Seafood Buffet and the other is your typical buffet. Didn't eat at either of them. There is an upscale Wine Bar and a fine dining Italian restarant in Masquerade Village. Didn't eat at either. For chain properties, there is Burger King and Startbucks. FOOD CHOICES RATING: 3.5/5 OVERALL RATING: 4/5.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: G W
Reviews.Content: The Rio is a not a bad value but only at the right price. Rooms are fairly large and are nice relative to some of their competitors. The fact is though that the casino being off the strip is more of a hassle than we originally anticipated and to get us back the Rio will have to offer quite a deal. One real negative for me was that they do not offer anything under a $15 blackjack table. Surprising when you consider that they ought to be trying to entice gambling customers to a casino that is out of the way. We left the casino each night to find $5 tables.

Reviews.Title: “Masquerade Suites Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: bcwi
Reviews.Content: I stayed midweek for 2 nights at the Rio and scored a Masquerade Suite for 1/2 price from the Rio website. I paid 125 and 140 for 2 nights. Well worth it. I was in the Masquerade tower which is the newer tower, and couldn't have been more pleased. I was unhappy at check in, as I had requested a strip view which they said was not available. When I got to my suite on the 18th floor, I still had a strip view from both sides of the suite. The suites are a 180 degree view, so I could see from Mandalay Bay to the Cosmopolitan from the dining area, and from the bedroom I could see from the Stratosphere to Caesars. Plus I had a pool view, could see the mountains, The Palms Casino, and The Orleans casino. There were 26 floor to ceiling windows in the suite. It was truly an incredible view. The bed was extremely comfortable, the suite was clean and I was truly impressed. My only complaint about the suite is the showerhead. It is the worst shower I have ever been in. Why did they set up awesome suites, to only skimp on the showerhead? Dumb. The suite I was in did not have flat planel tv's, but that doesn't matter to me. I'm not in Vegas to watch TV. The 2 tv's that were in the room were large and had good pictures. There was 3 separate thermostats so the temperature was very comfortable. There was a coffee maker (1 cup) and a refrig, no microwave. There is a nice 1/2 bath. The casino was ok, seemed to lack the hustling bustling feel of many casinos. The only 2 restaurants I ate at were the San Paulo cafe for breakfast and the All American Grille for lunch. The grille had great food, a liitle pricey, but the chicken sandwich and fries ($12) was so huge you could split with someone and be totally satisfied. Most people were taking doggy bags from the restaurant. The cafe was so-so. I walked over to the Gold Coast the 2nd day for their $4.99 breaksfast special. I would definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “How much time do you plan to spend in your room in Las Vegas?????”
Reviews.Author: gr8passage
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on here about Vegas hotel rooms, and then I think: how much time are you really in the room? With all the casinos, shows, restaurants, etc., we are usually only in our room upon waking up and going to bed! So, with that in mind, all that is really important is a clean, comfortable, quiet place to sleep. The Rio filled two of those three adequately especially considering the discounted rate we got via a "connection". These are not truly suites, as others have mentioned, but rather very large hotel rooms. It's more space than two people need, and would probably be a bit crowded with four. Bathroom is very small, and it's annoying to have a window in the shower which lets the bathroom light into the sleeping area if someone gets up before sunrise to take a shower! The dressing area with vanity, second sink, large closet and dresser area plus refrigerator is a bonus. There is also an in-room safe. I imagine desperate college kids could comfortably sleep ten to twelve people in this room utilizing sofa, bed, and floor space! The surface areas of the room were clean, but I don't think the housekeeping staff understands the concept of vacuuming around the edges or underneath anything. There is a gross collection of dust and dirt along the walls and large pieces of furniture, and a piece of paper from a prior guest lay crumpled under our bed for the entire stay. Several of the pillow cases were threadbare, and when I called to ask for four more pillows (I need to have my feet elevated for medical reasons), I was told they would only deliver two. This is an older hotel; I am sure it was lovely when new. Now it needs a freshening up. Lots of stains on the carpet, and walls need a fresh coat of paint. It didn't feel gross, however, and the bed was relatively comfortable. We were on the 23rd floor in the Masquerade Tower overlooking in the pool. It wasn't noisy, but it would have been if someone had been next door as there was an adjoining door. We asked to be in a quiet location at the end of the hall away from elevators and ice machines. Our room was next to both! Elevators are set back in, however, so it wasn't noisy. We did get music noise one night although I have no idea from where. The casino is very loud and smoky. There is poor communication between the casinos Total Rewards program and the hotel. We were told we'd get a discount on various things which did not materialize. More alarming was the fact that we were told we were already "in the system" because we had stayed at a sister hotel earlier this year which was absolutely not true! Consequently, they would not offer my husband any of the new enrollees perks as they said he already had a card (which he didn't). The Vodoo Restaurant on the top floor has a patio with an unequaled view. Make sure you go up there to see it! The prices are very high, and it reminded me of Ruth'sChris. Everything is ala carte. Waiter screwed up one order in our party, and there was nothing done to compensate us for having to wait another 20 minutes for the correct order to come up. I think they just reheated some of the food the rest of us had ordered that was ready on time. The steak, however, was very tasty. Three drinks, four appetizers, four entrees, and one shared dessert = $330 plus gratuity. For this kind of money, try Sinatra's. The good news was we didn't need to leave the hotel to go to dinner. The buffet breakfast at the hotel was pricey, and we walked across the street to the Gold Coast for a fabulous breakfast buffet at half the price. There was also self-parking readily available in the lot across from the hotel for our rental car so no problem with that. Valet parking required waiting too long for the car to be delivered when we requested it so we just used the self-parking lot. We did not use the shuttle. Staff at the hotel was, for the most part, for friendly and pleasant. At one point one of our party walked by a casino drink server and asked for a water from her tray. He was told "they are for the gamblers". As we walked off, a management person walked up next to us and handed us a water telling us he was sorry it had not been given to us! I imagine the server got a reprimand. We are talking four oz. bottles of water here!! So, all and all, it was an OK experience. Not sure we would stay there again, but it served our needs for this trip.

Reviews.Title: “If mediocrity is what you like, you'll love this place.”
Reviews.Author: MythicalBeast
Reviews.Content: Sited a 45 minute walk from the main attractions on The Strip, Rio allows its patrons to escape by providing a free shuttle twice an hour. The lobby is a noisy pandemonium of screaming slot machines and scantily covered cocktail waitresses, but our check-in was surprisingly efficient and friendly. Ther hotel provides no free internet access and no WiFi, and no bath-robes in the bedrooms, and no price list in the mini-bar, but the bedrooms are clean and comfortable and with a bit of practice one learns to work the showers. Although called "suites" the bedrooms are just a little larger than usual in a good hotel and there is an oddly lascivious peep-hole between the shower and the bedroom. If gambling is your thing there is plenty of it. There are twelve restaurants but we found only two to our taste. One can sunbathe under real palm trees on the artificial beach where they serve great rum cocktails. The convention centre is a really long walk from the main hotel - too long for the old or breathless! There's nothing wrong with this hotel if you like to be far from the action and the quality - and the staff were uniformly friendly and trying to be helpful.

Reviews.Title: “All-suites is a great idea”
Reviews.Author: rondi3
Reviews.Content: Did I mention that a suite is better than a room? The extra space makes a big improvement to your comfort. The decor is modern and very well done. You still have to pay extar for internet access, but they gave us rooms with views of the strip for no extra $. The Rio is a large complex of two towers, separated by a long casino floor. It's about a 10-minute walk from end to end. The casino is noisy and lively, with several overhead dance events on balconies and catwalks. They try to set up a Mardi Gras atmosphere. It has a good selection of restaurants, but the really good ones (Italian and Indian) are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, does the job, no frills (deluxe standard suite)”
Reviews.Author: RogerDonoghue
Reviews.Content: Checkin was efficient, though no one to take you to your room. The room is fine. Great view, slightly grubby, but then it is a smoking room. The coffee machine is poor, the bathroom cramped, and in my mind, a suite has a separate living room, not just a sofa and table in the bedroom, but hey, it was super cheap mid week. At weekend rates i would have been unhappy. The atmosphere in the casino is dated and lacking glamour. There is a shuttle service to the main strip but you can wait up to 20 mins which kind of spoils the Vegas experience. We ended up taking ten buck taxis to the strip. No big deal. Internet is 13 bucks a day. Overall. Adequate ( this review is for a standard deluxe double "suite")

Reviews.Title: “Unimpressed”
Reviews.Author: mizkittey
Reviews.Content: Don't bother paying for an "upgraded strip view" - not worth the extra money. Room was sized nicely, had a refrigerator in the room which is not typically found in Vegas rooms. There was also a coffee maker, but you had to purchase the coffee pods from the mini bar for $8 each!! There are too many choices in Vegas to settle for this hotel. FYI - they do have a shuttle that runs through the day that will take you to the strip, so that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: OCguy58
Reviews.Content: Just spent nights at the property in the Masquerade Tower and it wasnt bad.Room was clean and great view from the 14th floor. TV is a bit old but are u in vegas to watch tv? Casino over in the older area was smoky, but slot area over in the masquerade area was fine. Wouls stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Where is the complaint box?”
Reviews.Author: Zender33
Reviews.Content: The third time was not the charm, and I didn't go by choice, but that's where the convention booked. The rooms are spacious but not much else to say that's close to a compliment. My room was dirty, with stains that have been there for ages. The tube TV drifts in and out, and if you open their refrigerator, they hit you up with automatic useage fees even if you take nothing out. Coffee in the room is $18 for 5-cups. That just seems like excessive to me. Ha. My bill at check-out had $44 in fees they claim they are going to erase but couldn't because the system was down when I checked out. Unimpressed with the whole experience. I would never voluntarily book a room here. Never.

Reviews.Title: “DO not stay here”
Reviews.Author: lduffy12
Reviews.Content: Reently stayed for 4 nights because I had a medical conference at this hotel. The room was $200/night-deal for conference members! Everytime we turned around we were having to spend more money. There was no coffee pot in the room and the desk told me, none came with the room. The fitness center charged $22/day to use it, WiFi in the room was $14/day and to use the WiFi throughout the hotel was $22/day! The hotel is literally crammed with slot machines with almost no hallways on the main level so that you can't walk without navigating the machines. We went over to the Bellagio-which was actually less expensive-and the difference was immediately noticable. The noise level was far less, wide walkways and although a casino, still acccommodating folks who were trying to get to the lobby or a restaurant! Wish my organization had booked there!

Reviews.Title: “Great time at the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: Mahoho
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth stay at the Rio and we will definitely return. The staff are always so nice and willing to please. The rooms are showing some wear, but we always found them clean and the beds comfy. I do miss the lighted makeup mirrors they used to provide! The free shuttle to the other hotels was convenient and appreciated. The seafood buffet is the best in Vegas! We also purchased the 24 buffet pass to try some other buffets, we decided the Rio has the best regular buffet in the city also! What a selection! We found the pool area the be clean and well kept too.

Reviews.Title: “No Room Choice”
Reviews.Author: TLBTraveler
Reviews.Content: I used a discount travel site to book my room and because of that I was not offered a room or tower choice eventough I checked in early afternoon. My room faced the street and the noise was very bad and made sleep difficult,

Reviews.Title: “Great for groups that love a party atmosphere.... not so good if you don't!”
Reviews.Author: EnglishRusty
Reviews.Content: We picked the Rio because we wanted to be slighly off-strip, somewhere to escape when it got all too much... Positives first. The hotel staff were never ever anything but friendly. Leanne on the check-in was particualrly helpful and nothing was too much trouble to ensure our (two-week) stay was hassle free... The hotel was also very, very clean. From the public areas, to the pool, to the rooms, I never once saw anything out of place. The roomkeeping staff were always very attentive, polite and I always came back to the room knowing it would be immaculate. Negatives. The pool area is only for people that want to soak up the party atmosphere. ALL OF THE TIME. I have been to nightclubs where the music is played at less volume. In fact, all nightclubs play their music lower than this. If I were working at the Rio I'd demand hearing tests. There is zero point thinking that you will be able to relax by the pools, even the one you have to pay at (but only if you are male. Go figure). Thats not to say the pools aren't very clean and that the food is actually very reasonably priced and of a high standard. But it is just too noisy. And then there are the guests - average age I guess about 25-30. Typically male. Typically very loud. I never ceased to be amazed why it was necessary for them to shout at the person next to them when just talking would have sufficed.... The hotel is also a bit regimented about searching bags to enter the pool area. You have to show your card to prove you are staying there - so why are you penalised for taking water etc. outside?! They force you to buy theirs outside (as opposed to that you have just bought inside!!!). Finally, in this day and age, can't wireless be free. It is a little petty to charge for something that is freely available in lots of other places inc. the Starbucks downstairs. One final note is that you have to stay in the Masquarade Tower. We heard of others who said the other Tower was very dated. Our rooms weren't our taste, but they had been recently refreshed and were not 'tired'... Overall summary. Nice hotel, but probably not for families!

Reviews.Title: “Best Room in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: LLion
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Las Vegas on business and once for personal reasons over 30 times. I have to say that the Rio had the very best room I have stayed in and a real bargain comparatively speaking. My reservations were made online without any difficulty whatsoever. My check-in was very smooth and the individual checking me in was not only efficient buy highly cordial as well. The room was simply the best I have stayed in while in Las Vegas. I have stayed in hotels at triple the price and had suites that were decidedly less impressive. The major difference in the Rio was that I did not have a personal fax machine in the room. Otherwise, I much preferred the decor and space of the Rio. The Rio seems to have a special more vibrant ambiance that most of the other casino/hotels in Las Vegas. It is a bit hard to describe but suffice to say that there has been a nice attempt to capture the feeling of the city of Rio de Janeiro, a city I have visited several times in the past. There is constant entertainment wherever you go. I did not have a chance to use the pool or any of the other amenities of the hotel so I have no comment although they appeared to be excellent as well. The location is just off the Strip a slight disadvantage. However, there are shuttles every half hour to Harrah's as well as the Bally hotels on the Strip, Las Vegas Blvd. I have walked the distance and it appeared to be closer than it actually was, taking about 30 minutes to walk to the Flamingo hotel on the Strip. A taxi ride to the Flamingo takes about 5 minutes and costs about $9 including tip. The much lower price more than compensates for the geographic disadvantage. I plan to stay at the Rio again the next time I visit Las Vegas. I quite enjoyed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip-off joint!”
Reviews.Author: SamanthaJonesTO
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here for a conference. Got in late Wednesday night, leaving tomorrow morning (Oct 13-15). The good: there's no shortage of gambling here. I don't gamble, so I can't comment on the quality. Rooms are HUGE. Pool area is nice, but noisy. The bad: I stayed in the Masquerade tower, 12th floor. Despite being a "non-smoking room," the place stunk horribly like cigarette smoke. I think the whole hotel smells like this, but it seems to be concentrated in the carpets and linens of the suites. Fourteen bucks a day for internet. A bottle of water from the vending machine costs $2.50. At Starbucks downstairs it costs $3.75. All of that is bad enough, but predictable I suppose. But then I tried to use the fitness room this morning. They charge $22 per day to use it!! I've been to a lot of hotels, and I've never EVER been charged to use the fitness room. I got a manicure and massage at the spa. Although the spa itself is lovely, again, it is a rip off. $125 for a 50 minute massage (back home I get just as good a massage $85 for 60 minutes). Then, on top of THAT, the front desk girl told me there is an $18 surcharge, which is supposed to cover tip as well... but when I signed the bill, the surcharge was $22.50! Grrr.... Service seemed okay to me. Check in was a bit brusque, and she certainly didn't inform me about any extra charges. It was like, 'here's your key' and get out of my face. Room service took 40 minutes (at a non-peak hour) which they told me up front, but at least the food was hot when it arrived. The San Paulo cafe has huge breakfasts, served piping hot, but again, prices are exorbitant. I will not be returning to this hotel. Or to Las Vegas, for that matter. It's too expensive and showy for my liking.

Reviews.Title: “OK for conventioneers and serious gamblers, only”
Reviews.Author: FolsomGal
Reviews.Content: None of the usual amenities I am used to. No fitness center, no optional microwave (although there is a refrigerator), no in room coffee pot. Room was fair but TV was ancient ang the color kept slipping. Just the minimum of channels. The biggest problem is the Rio is seriously understaffed, from the long lines at check-in, to the too few restaurants with minimum 30 minute waits, and forget it should you need any assistance-I went down and got our bags because the wait was 45 minutes for a bellhop. Too few shuttles to the Strip. I could go on and on. If you must stay here, book on their website and watch their rate calendar. Unless you have to stay here for a conference, only reason would be a really inexpensive rate.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms are so spacious!”
Reviews.Author: kayjen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Masquerade Tower and were extrememly pleased with the room -- it was very clean, spacious, bed was comfy, nice refrigerator to keep our drinks cold, smoke FREE, AC worked properly. The front desk was very courteous during check in/check out. The room was very large -- you would pay so much more at other hotels in LV for a room this size. The second day we were there, we returned to our room to find housekeeping cleaning it. The housekeeper would not let us in untll we gave her our keycard so she could verify that it was indeed our room. We were pleased that she did this for security purposes. Otherwise, anyone could walk in an opened hotel room!!! This made us feel very secured for the rest of our stay. The RIO provides FREE shuttle service to several affiliated hotels. The RIO is off the strip and away from other hotels. We took the shuttle to Harrah"s, Bally's, and Paris Hotel. It worked out great. The bus drivers were very courteous, with a great sense of humor! We ate at the Carnival buffet which is located in the Rio. It was the best buffet we have had in LV. Get there early or you will have to wait in a long line! The selection of food will surely satisfy everyone's appetite. We felt we needed roller blades to skate from one end of the buffet line to the other. Yes, the selection of food was that large. It's definitely worth a visit! Would we come back to the RIO? Definitely! It's a great place to stay for young families. Since the rooms are so spacious, there is room for the little ones to run around. Yes, the rooms have the old fashioned TVs (no flat screens) but no big deal. The TV is on a swivel so you can turn it if you are watching TV on the couch or in bed.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Irish Bar within the hotel”
Reviews.Author: VFWorcs
Reviews.Content: Whilst visiting this hotel we saw a show - the Rat Pack - this was really good but short in length and be warned that is was $5 for a small water - so take one in your bag! For some reason they don't allocate seats when you buy your ticket so you have to queue to get in for about 45 - 60 mins and this takes the shine off the overall experience. We made the mistake of going to Mc Fadden's Irish bar within the hotel for a quick meal and drink. There is absolutely nothing Irish about the place but the food was ok. The bar maid however was extremely rude and the waitress short changed me, so I would not recommend this place to others. It was a shame as my previous visit to Rio and especially the Gaylord Restaurant was really enjoyable but I don't think I'll go there again.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints here!”
Reviews.Author: msevans32
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rio 09/25 to 09/28. Sunday check in was not too bad. We checked in around 7:30am and were told there were no rooms available. I left my cell phone and it was 2 ½ to 3 hours later when I got the call. I checked in at VIP check in. The staff there was very nice and I was offered some bottled water. I decided to leave a $200 cash deposit since I had read previous reviews that there were problems getting credit back from a credit card deposit. No problems getting my cash when checking out. We had a non smoking room stayed on the 31st floor with a view of the strip and pool. We could barley hear the music from the pool. Our room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable. We had breakfast at the buffet and paid $8 extra for 2 mimosas. For a great breakfast I would recommend going to the Egg & I on Sahara Blvd. You won’t be disappointed. I visited the $10 store at the Rio and bought a wallet but most of the stuff there is junk. The slots were tight and I had better luck at the Orleans’s. At the Rio, we saw several cocktail waitresses who go up & performed on small stages throughout the casino. They are actually really good singers. There was not a sky show performance during our stay. The drink service was steady but the drinks were watered-down if you are getting them free on the casino floor. We love staying at the Rio because it is easy to get to where you need to go & has less traffic than being on the strip. I also love that they have a refrigerator in the room. I am hoping to plan another trip here very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't expect more. It's not fair to the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Softwall
Reviews.Content: Poor management. Who would close the pool at 3pm on a major convention arrival date to support a 300 person private party? I guess the other 2000 guests don't count. The RIO management does this. You get what you pay for and sometimes much less. Thanks again Harrars group. Please get the word out on the type of service to expect from this company.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms off the strip”
Reviews.Author: spanky132
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers great rooms (suites) that are spacious, clean, and have refrigerators (somewhat rare in Vegas). The down side is you are one mile from the strip, so unless you have a car, cab fare will probably offset the Rios usually great room rates. Within walking distance is the Gold Coast and the Palms Casinos. The pool area is spacious and clean. DIning options have improved on the low end, they just added a BK, the other options are all good , but pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Suite 1200”
Reviews.Author: Azvegas
Reviews.Content: upgrade to 1200sqft suite with bar/dining area, proper living room, separate bedroom, 1.5 baths. Even if it is a bit dated in style, very comfortable and rooomy, thanks Rio for a taste of rolling large. Even though suite directed toward Flamingo West, views extended about 280 degrees back to both north and south Strip. Rio is reliable comfort with Palms and Gold Coast nearby. Shuttle to Harrahs or Ballys.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: clint c
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived there for a honeymoon stay in October 2011. Upon checking in, staff informed me that they "overbooked" and we would have to stay a night at Caesars. Though they told me they would pay for one night at Caesars, we would have to return after one night. I explained to them that it was late and wanted to stay at the Rio. The staff finally was able to find a room but it was not the room I RESERVED five months before. The staff told me that under the fine print, they do not guarantee room types and my suite was transformed to a basic room. I was furious. I spoke to manager "Susan" and asked her if I could get a night comped or even a free buffet pass...anything at all. "Susan" stated they we would get nothing and acted as though she didn't care at all about customer service. Finally, we checked into our room and turned on the TV and found that the hotel had a FIRE on that date and had to close two floors! So now they are liars. They didnt overbook, they had a fire and couldnt even tell their customers what really happened. The sofa had stains on it and the carpet did as well. There were bathroom lights missing and the main door latch was broken off the frame. DO NOT STAY THERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average room but showing its age”
Reviews.Author: samix760
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the masquerade tower, which hasn't been remodeled yet. Rooms are good size but very dated. Bed was uncomfortable. Smoke smell is very strong throughout the tower. You don't go to Vegas to sit in your room all night, so it worked out. Maybe the remodeled tower is nicer. Overall an average experience. If you do stay there check out the American bar and grille, had an excellent steak dinner there. Thought the buffet was underwhelming.

Reviews.Title: “Super!”
Reviews.Author: redrose451
Reviews.Content: First time in Vegas staying off-strip! We'd consider The Rio, again. We always have a car, so location is not a big issue. We liked the casino and the rooms were comfy and roomy. Service was first class, too.

Reviews.Title: “too big too smokey”
Reviews.Author: roadcyclist
Reviews.Content: This property is too big and like many of the Vegas hotels too much smoke in the casino area.

Reviews.Title: “Where do I start? :<”
Reviews.Author: Scotor
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say, I was 'comped' at this hotel for a night using Total Rewards so I am not here because I paid a ridiculous amount of money and decided to use Trip Advisor to get back at the hotel. It cost me $0 to stay instead of $13.95 (for wifi) for the night. I checked in on Saturday, October 1, 2011. Upon arriving via Gray Line Shuttle (another negative review I fear), I stood in a check-in line that sprawled throughout the lobby (well, from the front door). After 30 minutes of waiting, I got my room key card and made my way to the Ipanema Tower. Upon opening the door, I was greeted by a repetitive, make that incessant bassy 'thump' or 'thud' as you will. As I later suspected, it was reverberation from the pool area. I discovered this Sunday morning when I went down to see the 'beach/pool' area. While the pools and mini-beach are a very nice area, the fact that 1. this massive speaker system is playing this music (and I use that term music very loosely) and 2. the speaker / music are located in very close proximity to the kids' shallow pool area, seemed a bit odd. When I complained in passing to the young female pool attendant, she replied that a lot of people have said the same thing but that a 'few' people like the music. I made the same comment to the check-out person a few hours later (the t.v. check-out function was inoperable at the time and I had to stand in line for 20 minutes). She also told me that people complain about it and said that next time, I could get a room that faces the opposite direction. I told her it is the combination of the music and reverberation and therefore not enjoyable to lie out by the pool or be in my room and feel/hear the incessant thumping. But enough about that. Random notes included the fact there was no ice coming from the ice machine in the area I was staying in the Ipanema Tower. One would think somebody would have noticed at some point, but alas, no one did. My room featured a table lamp between the double beds which had a broken fixture. The bulb was at a 60 degree angle. I took a picture to show the lady at the front desk. My room also featured a used cleaning towel on the cabinet below the safe in the closet. I showed her that picture as well. Another feature was the 1970s (maybe 1980s?) Zenith television with the Cathode Ray Tube. Some of you may remember the old famous Zenith slogan: "The Quality Goes In Before The Name Goes On". Well, the t.v. could have used a bit more of an updated quality. While no one goes to Vegas to watch t.v., it would have been nice to have one that wasn't quite so old - say 30 - 40 years out of date! At midnight (yes I was in bed at midnight), the radio alarm clock went off. Either the last guest wanted to get a bit of shut-eye before partying hard the previous night, or someone thought it might be amusing to set the alarm for the next unsuspecting guest. NOTE to hotel housekeeping staff: Please ensure the alarm is not on when you do your room clean-up and room clean-up means picking up your cleaning towels. Do a room sweep like guests do before they check-out. :) Now about that wifi ... The $13.95 cost of wifi for 24 hours isn't unreasonable for a hotel in Las Vegas, but it should work! Having to find a Starbucks or other such locale in order to have consistent wifi service when paying $13.95 does not sit well with me. And despite being 'warned' that you are paying for service that may not be consistent, I would venture to guess that most of us would expect to get value for money and be able to take advantage of something that most of us consider commonplace in our own homes. To her credit, the desk clerk reversed the wifi fee, thus the $0 balance. Was the Rio awful? No. But attention to detail by the housekeeping staff and hotel management using common sense about the type of music at poolside and how it affects all guests, would go a long way in ensuring a comfortable stay. Also, be aware that for most people, getting to the Rio requires a taxi ride from partner hotels located on the Strip. And you cannot bring your luggage (even carry-on) on the shuttle - this is great business for the taxi industry! Hmmm.... I wonder if it was deliberate? Nah.... :)

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: lick007
Reviews.Content: stayed there in july for 4 days, one of our favur spots. was very busy as there was a convention on. the music in the pool area was too loud. room are good size. the hotel can sometimes be noisey and they decided to used a hammer drill at midnight fixing something in the buffet area, bad mistake as people called and called the front desk

Reviews.Title: “Not sure that this is a 4”
Reviews.Author: Franki00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for 3 nights in August. I would not rate it as a 4 star maybe a 3. The rooms are nice, very big, nice feature is the fridge - it is small but does the job. Our bathroom had a drip coming from the ceiling which took all day to determine they could not fix. They did offer to move us to another room around 4:00 pm but by then we only had one day left and had plans for the evening so decided to just stay in the room and leave towels on the floor to avoid slipping in the water. I personally find it a bit isolated from the rest of Vegas and don't always find the shuttles to be convenient to take to get to the strip but a cab is an alternative. Have always found the front end staff to be courteous and we are always greeted with a smile. Lots of places to eat in the hotel - love their buffet out of all of Harrahs (Caesars) properties. Lots of variety but best of all it tastes good and I'm not a buffet person. The pool area is nice, I never find that we have to search for a chair like at other hotels. The room was always clean and done by the time we got back to the room. Extra towels or other incidentals were always provided if we left a note. Overall, not a bad place to stay - I think the rooms are perfect for a family. Enough space that you would not be getting into each others way.

Reviews.Title: “One Of the Best Midweek "Off the Strip" Hotels in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: sittyslickers
Reviews.Content: I guess a 2500 unit hotel is a complex operation, so reviews will be mixed, based on law of averages alone. We simply loved the Rio. Through vegas.com, we booked a midweek special (Wed.Thurs) of a paltry $39.00 per night for a King Suite. We were delighted.Checking in at 2AM, we were given a room on the quiet "card access only" 39th floor of the Masquerade Tower. The room was much larger than expected, beautifully furnished and squeaky clean.The entire exterior wall is a panorama of all glass, affording stunning views, both day and night. The King bed was extremely comfortable. Lighting controls were all dimmable, offering romantic options. Room has a refrigerator for personal use, a nice feature. Room service was reasonably Vegas priced and the food was expertly prepared and of the highest quality. Service was quick, friendly and polite. The only thing that dated this 20+ year old property was the TV, which was a 27inch tube set, but that did not bother us one bit, considering the million dollar view behind it. Why 4 stars instead of 5? Just a few minor things: 1) no free internet- internet access is 13 bucks a day. 2) sneaky honor bar-sensors detect any movement inside. If you open it, you will be charged for ANY item, even if you just examine it and put it back. 3) due to the legendary buffet and nightly headline shows,parking is difficult in the early to mid- late evening. Plan your car trips accordingly. These things aside, two nights at the Rio for a tad over 80 bucks is quite a bargain. We would definitely stay there again, without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “No the best, but good enough, and better than most at this price”
Reviews.Author: NightBreed01
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to Las Vegas so I wasnt sure what to expect. The Rio is away from the strip but they provide a free shuttle service. I was in Vegas on business and do not gamble, a strange combination I know! Never the less heres my review. The check in process was painfully slow, i got there on a Friday and it took the best part of an hour. My room, whilst not ultra modern or beautifully decorated was very large, had a lovely king size bed, nice bathroom etc and was kept clean. The Casino was just a casino to me, but was a lot better than The Flamingo (see my review) Everything seemed quite new, well maintained, and the staff were quite helpful etc. The Hotels restaurants were nice, the service and the food was good, in fact I ate all of my meals there. So all in all I enjoyed my stay there and would recommend it to anyone on a budget, my room averaged $85 per night throughout my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Sad, in a way...but good value”
Reviews.Author: mikebern
Reviews.Content: I remember coming here when this was a real high-end option...one of the first off-strip hotels marketing all-suites luxury to an upscale crowd and locals...had one of the first real 'fine-dining' restaurants in Vegas...and for years, the hottest bar. Now there's a Burger King when you walk in and a Martarano's (ugh!)...and although this may seem mean the clientele has been similarly downgraded. Think Jersey Shore...at best... But, the room was beautiful and huge and though few amenities, it was great value for less than $60 a night. Also, the pool is open quite late compared to other hotels in the area (I've complained about other places closing up early especially during the week, so it's important to give kudos where they're deserved.) The only thing odd is that the pool faces East (the West exposure is blocked by the hotel) so it loses the sun pretty early. When it's 120o out, that could be nice, but you're really not gonna get any sun here after 5 p.m. or so.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: BoozehagGreenBay_WI
Reviews.Content: A week ago, 7 of us girls stayed at the Rio Las Vegas for my 40th birthday! I couldn't have been happier with where we stayed! My first time off the Strip and I would go back to the RIO again for sure. When we checked in at VIP, they were able to upgrade us into a 14 Sq Ft Fat Tuesday Suite on the 39th floor, with an adjoining King Suite. We had two full baths, 1 half bath, a Master King BR, with a 300 sq ft bathroom and walk in closets! It was the ideal place for 7 girls to stay. Our living room and view was amazing! It was quiet, and the service was superb! It was a very cheap 3 night stay for the 7 of us, and I thank Lou and I believe Scott for the wonderful upgrade we were given for very little additional costs. I would recommend the RIO to anyone! Food was great, pool was a blast, and the shuttles or cabs, were not much of a wait at all. Thanks again! Laura - Green Bay, WI

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay again”
Reviews.Author: crwinter1
Reviews.Content: Okay, so we booked our room here because my husband had a conference at the hotel. We paid $115 per night on Thurs-Sat nights. We were in the Impana (not sure of spelling) tower. The hotel itself was okay. Be sure to read all my comments, not just the positives because the negatives might change your mind as to whether or not you chose this hotel.. Positives... *easy to get to hotel (we had a rental car so getting around made it easy) *large room *nice size bathroom with two sinks, one in toilet/shower area and a separate one outside of toilet area *impana tower was the quiet area of hotel *a/c in room worked well *your room key allowed you to visit the pools at the other Cesars properties *refridgerator in room worked okay Negatives.... *couch was totally shot, can't sit on it without falling towards middle, had to use desk chair to sit in *1 of the queen beds had the same problem, with two adults in bed I found myself encroaching on husbands side... bed was shot.... *shower head needs replacing, water was spraying in wrong directions *tile in shower had mildew in the grout (disgusting!!!) *fabric headboards at bed were stained from peoples bodies leaning up against it *they charged $8 for 3 coffee Keurig cups *tube tv (no it was not an LCD or flat screen) was in a horrible location. It was on the wall along the bed. You could open the armoire and pull the tv out a bit and turn it somewhat towards the beds. *carpet had stains everywhere *broken tile on baseboard in bathroom area- clearly needs fixing and housekeeping left it like that the entire 3 nights we stayed... *expect to drop a boat load of money on food and drinks at the hotel *the spa at the hotel wanted a minimum of $35.00 for a pedicure! (minimum I mind you..) So, I skipped it and picked up all my necessities at Target to give myself a quick pedi for less than $10.00. Restaurants.. there is a variety. We only ate once at the pub/brewery that is right outside the Mascarade part of the casino. All the other restaurants in the hotel seemed way to pricey. I ate out at the Fashion Show Mall where they have a huge food court. Food was way more affordable there and I also found a Carl's Jr. on Flamingo where I ate at a couple of times. My husband was provided breakfast and lunches each day through the hotel and said the food was good. They were served mexican food one day at lunch and italan food the next day for lunch. Okay, I think I've basically covered it... Bottom line, we won't stay there ever again... If you do, here are a few recommendations... There is a Target store about 3 miles down the road on Flamingo. Go over there and buy a package of 18 Keurig cups for $12.00. Also pick up some snacks and drinks while you are there so you don't have to spend so much money on food and drinks... There is a dollar tree store in the same parking lot. I stopped in there and picked up utensils and other cheap stuff like that for our room. I never did actually go into the pool area, just quickly checked it out. The music was loud like I had read in prior reviews. Glad we ended up in a room on the Impana tower which put us away from the blaring music.

Reviews.Title: “old hotel that needs renovation!”
Reviews.Author: kevin z
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its low price and i got what i paid for it. The rio needs to be renovated to keep up with all the strip hotels. The rooms are about 20 years out-dated. The casino area and rooms had a overbearing smell of cigarette smoke.At least the staff at the rio were friendly. Lines were long to check-in for a weekday. Stay away from the wyndom time-share vultures.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Rio if you like frat houses”
Reviews.Author: Tom S
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a convention which was located at this hotel. I decided to stay here mainly because it was convenient, and the room photos looked really good. Well, I was frustrated to find out that simple internet access cost $13.99/night, and the fitness center was $22.99. I refused to pay either one, so used my Blackberry for internet, and went to the fitness center at UNLV for $10/day. ( The facilities at UNLV were far superior, and they had a real pool!) The first night I was at the Rio, I was awakened by hotel fire alarm going off about 1:00 am which blares over the phone speaker. I suspected it was caused by some partier somewhere in the hotel and wasn't too concerned, then buried my head in my pillows to muffle the noise.. Eventually, the announcement came that it was a false alarm, and they were "invesigating the cause". The minor frustrations aside, I woke up the next morning, got ready and started to head down to the convention...only to find some guy passed-out on the floor - right in front of my door! I thought he was dead. His glazed eyes were partially open, but I saw (heard) he was breathing, then just got really angry. Some woman who looked to be a security person was pacing around, and told me she thought the guy belonged in my room...so didn't do anything. As I was running late, I went to my meeting, but came back to the conceirge desk an hour later and complained to the woman there. She seemed apologetic, but didn't offer to move me to a different room, or anything. I wanted to leave, but only continued to stay there because of the convenience. Long story short, if you want a place that is restful and sane, the Rio is NOT for you. If however, you wish to relive your college frat days, then this is the place for you. Apparently, you don't even need to pay for a room either - any ol' horizontal space seems to work as a bed! Absolutely will NEVER stay there again! You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by the 4 star rating!”
Reviews.Author: fashionchic7
Reviews.Content: I checked in at 6pm on 8/22 (so not incredibly late) and the RIO only had rooms available in their Masquerade tower. The only rooms available were either smoking with a king size bed or two double beds non-smoking. I booked a king size non-smoking room but said I would deal with two double beds as long as I could get non-smoking. The Masquerade tower is code for "we haven't remodeled these rooms EVER." This tower is where they put very young adults or tired travelers who don't know any better. I walked into a filthy room straight out of the 80's. I can handle an "old" room but not one that is filthy dirty. I called the front desk and they blatantly said, "you checked into that room and now it is yours. We have no other availability and it will have to do because there is nothing we can do about it. We will send housekeeping to your room and you can show them what you are talking about." Housekeeping came and I literally watched them attempt to vacuum with something that wouldn't pick up a piece of lint if you paid it. The vacuum was straight from the 80's as well. After the second call to the front desk telling them I would not sleep in this room for the next four nights they basically said too bad and they would send the head of housekeeping up this time. Another housekeeper came up and was very sweet and tried her best with the tools she had. At least she eventually had my revolting lampshade replaced (see pic). I travel every month for business and I have stayed at this hotel before but never again! I had no idea how fortunate I was during my previous visit to stay in the "normal" tower. That tower name is called Impanada or something like that. BTW, the front desk manager (a young man) was the most worthless individual I have ever dealt with at a hotel and should be fired. He was so rude even after I spoke with him face-to-face. I will never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I don't know what others are talking about!”
Reviews.Author: RoseC49
Reviews.Content: I had read reviews about the Rio before going and they were mostly unfavorable, so I didn't want to stay there, but our conference was there and nothing was available nearby, so we booked there. It is a great hotel! The room was very clean and the bed very comfortable.Bathroom was small, but ample. The pool area was beautiful except for competing stereo systems belting out loud music. Did not like that. We had a beautiful view from our room. The restaurants were very pricey which was disappointing, but the food at The Carnival World buffet was very good. And cheaper food could be found across the street at the Gold Coast. Alcohol was outrageously priced at the Rio. $7 for one beer! I took the shuttle to Harrah's and it was very convenient and on time. Plenty of shows at the Rio too. Penn and Teller is worth the time. Skip the Rat Pack unless you can get cheap tickets. It is way over priced. Chippendales are there as well, but my husband didn't want to go.;) I did not look forward to going on this trip based on what I read about the Rio, but it was one of the best places I've ever stayed!

Reviews.Title: “Leaves a lot to be desired”
Reviews.Author: Jazzie503
Reviews.Content: I called the day prior to my flight to inform the front desk that my family of 5, including a 6 month old, would be arriving around 10pm. We reserved and paid for a high floor with a view, and they confirmed the room. Well, when we got to the hotel, they said the rooms were not available, therefore, we had to settle for an ADA disability room on the 4th floor. Our view was of the loading dock and garbage pick up. Our rooms were supposed to be non-smoking, but we could smell cigarette smoke. We could also hear the trucks coming and going all day/night... very loud. The TV did not work even after many calls, was never repaired or replaced. The cleaning staff did not clean well, did not replace glasses and toiletries. We asked the concierge info about Hoover Dam and was told we could tour the Dam and visitor center at no cost if we did not want to take the tour. When we got there we were informed that there is a cost for the visitor center. The hotel restaurant staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We thought our acccomodations were very good at the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: TopekaDucky
Reviews.Content: We've been to Las Vegas many times but never chose to stay at the Rio mostly because we don't care for the casino. We think the sound is too loud, we haven't enjoyed the Show in the Sky since it was changed several years ago, and I've seen the Chippendales (Mr. Ducky doesn't care to) LOL Anyway I checked our CET comps a couple months ago and realized we could get comped rooms there that included a Saturday night stay (our first weekend comp we've received), so for a couple nights decided we could make it work since it was free. We didn't arrive until after 4pm, and there was no line so check-in was simple and quick. I didn't ask for an upgrade since I've been told here on the TA forum that all rooms are suites so decided to just hope for the best. I'd been told that the Masquerade tower was newer, but the Ipanema tower was more recently renovated, so we were glad to be told that we had been assigned to the Ipanema Tower. I'd also been told the Maquerade Tower rooms could sometimes have noise from the pool and nightclub areas. The room was clean and view was toward the Wynn and downtown so at kind of an angle but was great for us since we don't have mountains at home and also enjoy that view in Vegas. There was a nice shower and the water pressure was the best we've ever had in a hotel anywhere. There was a sink in the separate room with the toilet and shower, and there was a sink and dressing area outside along with a nice large closet with mirror sliding doors and safe inside along with the fridge. There was a Keurig coffee maker but unless you bring your own K-cups, you will pay $12.00 for 3 if I remember correctly (or it may have been for 4). There was a nice sized couch and coffee table, sitting bench at the foot of the bed, writing desk and 2 chairs, 2 nightstands, and as mentioned above that bed was very comfortable. We never watch TV when we are in Vegas so can't remember if it was a tube or flat screen, but it was in an Armoire piece of furniture. The air quality in the room was great, and there was good insulation between the rooms. Our neighbors decided they had to crank the music up and party at about 2:30am, so after a call to the front desk and quick action by security, we didn't have a problem with noise the remainder of our stay. I always recommend a person stay on the strip for a first Las Vegas visit, but the Rio offers a change of pace and different option for those of us who have been there before and are looking for something off-strip. Or if the rate is better at the Rio than on strip, it is really worth considering since the rooms are large being suites, and there are shuttles to transfer people to the strip. It also sits across to the east from the Gold Coast and Palms. The Gold Coast also has shuttle service to it's sister property, the Orleans and to the strip. So even if a person doesn't have a rental car, there is transportation to other Vegas locations. I would recommend the Rio to anyone looking for a nice sized room, comfortable bed, and I didn't even mention the buffet (it's large) or other dining or entertainment choices. Visit the Rio website since the information is pretty detailed, or you can feel free to send a message to me if you have further questions about this property.

Reviews.Title: “I was very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: e10750law
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting to be overly impressed with the Rio All Suites hotel but i was. I just stayed one night before moving on to Utah. All of this for $49 per night plus tax. I booked a few month's ago through their web site. I was worried about bedbugs before I arrived but the room was very clean and there was a quite a lot of tile on the vestibule entrance and the washroom and separate vanity room. Everything was up to date. There were plenty of space in th room plus a rack to put a bag on. Normally the shower in a hotel provides low pressure water but it was strong and plentiful. The room was in the Ippanema tower and close to the casino and restaurants. I saw Penn & Teller and they were great that I also booked online a few weeks ago through Vegas.com. My seat was in the front center 3 rows back. The theater probably seats 1,000. For breakfast i ate in a restaurant down the aisle towards the Penn & Teller theater Good food. .

Reviews.Title: “Everything was good but the room...”
Reviews.Author: JamieAkron
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Oct of 2010, the casino and clubs were great, the pool was cold and unimpressive, the rooms were old and outdated. I guess I expected more from the Rio then what I recieved. The people were great there though.

Reviews.Title: “It is what you make it.”
Reviews.Author: Debimlee
Reviews.Content: Las Vegas isn't my bag, Baby. But I had a Conference at the Rio, and the Convention rooms, far removed from the dinging bells and half naked young ladies dancing on the tables in the Casino, were quiet, well equipped and perfect for our needs. Our room was bigger than most apartments. The beds were very comfortable. The bathroom was great, with an outside vanity and extra sink for convenience. The safe, dresser and closet were perfectly located and convenient. We could hear a bit of noise from neighbors, but not enough to complain about. There is a fridge, but no microwave. The rooms were clean, and the house keeping staff very friendly. There's no "cheap" food at the Rio, unless you want Burger King which is located upstairs among the retail stores. The All American Cafe was our best bet as we didn't want to pay $30 -$40 for one of the fabulous Buffets on the premisis. They are good, I just can't eat enough to make it worth while. We signed up for a free "rewards" card which gave us $5.00 gambling money and discounts on dinner. The Cobb Salad with grilled Salmon for about $17.00 was very good at the All American Cafe. Don't miss the nightly "Mardi Gras" and be sure to get your "beads" (no exposures needed). Chippendales Theater is at the Rio, and there is also a Chippendales store if you want to take home a souvenier.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and spacious”
Reviews.Author: Crasewu
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Rio every time I visited LV for the past three years. Well maintained. Clean and spacious. Free shuttles to the Strip. Great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but ...”
Reviews.Author: MGlide
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many, many times but never stayed at the Rio. We had some comp nights available so we used them at the Rio. I have to say that the rooms were everything advertised. I loved them. BUT - the service was poor. It was clear that the owners (not Harrahs but another unknown company) has drastically cut staff. I waited over 20 minutes to check in while only half of the check in stations were staffed. I waited another 20 minutes for my luggage to get to the room after waiting 5 minutes on hold to tell someone I was in my room. Then repeated the process when we left. While I loved the place I will not be staying there again unless they improve their service. There are simply too many options that provide the service expected.

Reviews.Title: “A Wake Up Call”
Reviews.Author: Imua50
Reviews.Content: If you are headed to the Rio Resort Casino and Hotel in Las Vegas you might want to know that housekeeping service is regulated by your Do Not Disturb sign on your door. On the first day after we arrived at the Rio we left our room at 10:27am and removed our "DND" sign from our room door, when we got back to our room at 6pm we noticed our room was not cleaned and our message light was blinking on our room phone. The Voice mail stated that due to the fact that our "Do Not Disturb" sign was on our room door maid service was not performed and if we wish for service to call Housekeeping. I called Housekeeping and spoke with the manager on duty. The Manager stated that a Housekeeping Supervisor walks the Casino Guest Room Floors at 8am each morning taking down room numbers of customers with their "DND" signs still out on the door and place them on a list for no Housekeeping service needed. I told the manager that it is our practice that we leave our room each day where ever we stay at Caesars properties prior to 10:30am each morning and get our room serviced. She then told me she would place a note on our room to get serviced each morning after 10:30am. I warn you when you check in you will need to ask the desk, call VIP service or Housekeeping and find out what the policy is if you leave the room after 8am in the morning and removing the "DND" sign from your room door. We also had only one trash can in our room when we checked in the standard issue is three, the shower head on the shower needs an upgrade and the floor lamp had an electrical cord unplugged due to the fact the floor lamp had no on and off switch. The Buffet is the best in town. The gaming floor is very noisy and crowded in the late afternoon and evening hours. The Valet is fast and professionally ran. Try to reserve a room away from the Railroad tracks side of the Tower. The TV in the room is the old CRT 30" that is old and fuzzy in it's presentation. A large Flat Screen would be the best solution. You will survive if you know when to get up to remove your "Do Not Disturb" sign from your door prior to 8am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Don't even remember our room.”
Reviews.Author: Juanki_Lemonn
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a couple of friends to experience Las Vegas. I remember our room vaguely. It was lacking lights but very spacious. Everything was basic. The best thing about staying here would be the casino (the house always wins but I went home with an additional $2,000 in my pocket) and the buffet! Crabs, lobsters and corndogs were the only things on my plate. I would love to go back for the casino and buffet but the rooms didn't leave a mark.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: DB629
Reviews.Content: I stayed back in March, during the week of St Patty's Day. At first I was skeptical, as it was off the strip and I was concerned about the availability of the shuttle, and since it was very warm during the week of our stay, I was hoping the pool would be open. We had a very early flight but had no problem checking in early. The room was large and had a fridge which I always like. There was a couch and table for a nice alternative area to relax in the room. The room was clean throughout our stay. My concern about the shuttle was unfounded.... the shuttles run regularly and we were able to get on the first one every time, and always had a friendly driver. I was disappointed that the pool was not open during my stay but was told that I could use the pool at any of the companion hotels if I wanted to. The food at the restaurants was fine for a quick bite but we usually ate on the strip. I'm not much of a gambler so one of the days I got a massage at the spa which was very nice and relaxing, and reasonably priced. Overall, for the price we paid I was very pleasantly surprised. I usually stay on the strip but I would definitely consider staying here again in the future (esp when the pool is open!!)

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay just off the strip”
Reviews.Author: erg32
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights the end of august. great size rooms. free convenient shuttle every half hour to bally's (on the strip)

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pabloandrosie
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews and almost changed our plans. We stayed at the RIO 4 nights in August. We found it to be very nice. The rooms were better than we expected (large, clean and modern), the restaurants were very good (we ate at Buzio's and the buffet) and the pool was very good. The casino was decent. I saw reviews where people complained about not winning on the slots. It's always nice to win but Vegas was built by giving money away. I wasn't impressed w/the poker room which was too bad since I do play quite a bit of poker when I'm there but it wasn't so bad that it made the stay a negative. The shuttle system worked very well. We found the Rio be to a great value and nice place, we'd stay there again and we have been at lots of other hotels in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to experience Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: CMartell
Reviews.Content: This all suite hotel is a comfortable way to experience Las Vegas. Well managed, comfortable surroundings and friendly staff are all a plus. The suites are roomy and my stays there have always had amazing views of the Strip, where I can enjoy the Las Vegas experience without having to be in it unless I chose to be there. While on the other side of the freeway from the Strip, I prefer having access to the Strip but not have to be "consumed" by the Strip. Staying at the Rio is like having a home to return to when you want quiet and relaxation. The suites have a bar fridge, plus a fridge for personal use. Also, there is a safe in each quarter. The suites have a nice "living" area with sofa easy chair and desk/table and comfortable beds. The three downsides to my experience at the Rio are: the loud and obnoxious music in the pool area is less than relaxing. The high prices for Internet access are not necessary in today's world of technology and are not in keeping with the service oriented atmosphere present elsewhere in the hotel. There is a fee for room service that is not passed on to the staff and, consequently, the room service set up can linger in the hallways for up to 24 hours or more. Again, not in keeping with the rest of the great experience possible at the Rio. I will return to the Rio and recommend it to anyone wanting the Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “RIO lacking”
Reviews.Author: chitopher
Reviews.Content: A multitude of problems. We had bartenders that didn't know how to make drinks. We had a TV that didn't work. We had a broken mirror. The poker room has very few players. The food was waaaay over priced and sub par. The pool area sucked. The hotel staff was nice and tried to make things better, but this just was not the hotel for me. We went for a convention that was taking place there (the convention area is nice) otherwise I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fun excellant stay!”
Reviews.Author: saturngirl426
Reviews.Content: just back from vegas and stayed at the RIO hotel. service and room were excellant! pool, gym and casino were great! shuttle service to the strip was on time! great place to stay for less $.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back hotel/casino... good value.”
Reviews.Author: mtnwomanColorado
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for an upscale hotel, this is not for you. I prefer an affordable, clean, quiet room as I don't spend much time in the room. There is too much to do/see in LV. This is my 3rd time @ the Rio and the room was outdated but spacious, quiet, and fairly clean just like the past 2 visits. I did request a quiet room and noticed I was given one in a different section which was not as travelled as the area I spent my last trip. The room did smell a bit of smoke but with so many smokers in vegas, it must be hard to get rid of the smell. I enjoyed the "Show in the Sky", Buzio's, and the buffet. I like being off the strip because I spend one night dining/gambling downtown & it is easy to take a cab. The shuttle to the strip is also convenient. Taking the shuttle to Bally's, you can hop on the monorail and explore MGM & NY NY. There were some issues with the shuttle service this past weekend due to the slot tournament. You really can't complain because it is free. One thing you learn in LV is patience. Waiting in line is pretty much the standard on a busy weekend. The staff is very friendly and professional. My overall experience was very good. How can you have a bad time in vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Okay stay at Rio”
Reviews.Author: jennyjr
Reviews.Content: Checking in/out was great, staff is very friendly. Elevators and hallways to rooms need a make over (remove wall paper and replace lamps). our room was spacious, it included a desk with 2 chairs, 3 seater sofa (not a sofa bed), a sofa chair, a table and a nice comfortable bed. The bathroom includes a nice size closet about 6 feet wide with a safe and mini fridge, 2 sinks and a regular size bath tub. The hotel is about 5 blocks/10 min walk to the strip. Eventhough shuttle is free to Ballys and Harrahs every 15 min it took for ever to get there. Next visit I would stay on the strip, they would have saved me time to do other things. Voo Doo lounge club located on the roof top was really nice and enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Dont sweat the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: dave3232
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas several times before and visiting the Rio, I was apprehensive the more and more I read the negative reviews on here. To set the record straight, I am a seasoned traveler both domestically and internationally, so I have realistic expectations on hotels. The Rio is a fantastic bargain! Our room was clean and spacious. We were on the 11th floor of the Impanema Tower with a great view of the mountains. When we arrived (approx 2pm) , there was a long line for check in, however the reception desk was adequately staffed and the total wait time was about 10 minutes. The clerk was very nice and upgraded our room upon request. Was the room flawless? No, but there was NOTHING to be fearful of. The only thing that stood out was you could see the seam in the carpet where the two pieces met. Who cares! The television was a 27 in' CRT but its Vegas, are you really in your room to watch TV???? The casino was lively and fun, the "Buffet of Buffets" is a great value if you like buffets (don’t bother going to the IP or PH buffets though....hideous.... The off strip location is really the only detractor for the Rio, however they have shuttles that run until 1am to both Bally’s and Harrah’s on the strip.
