While we were there, the shuttles were consistently full, and they do give priority to their higher category gamblers, which is understandable. Housekeeping was consistent, fresh towels and general room cleaning everyday around 10am. We dined at the VODOO Steakhouse atop the hotel and it was outstanding. It is ala carte so it can be a bit pricey but the view is exquisite. We both had steaks and sides, I had the "witch doctor" and my girlfriend had wine and desert. Our tab was $160....HINT....visit Tix 4 Tonight and for six dollars you get a voucher for 25% off your entire tab. Basically, for six dollars my entire tip was covered......AWESOME! The VODOO lounge is nice as well, it is an outdoor night club. was dead when we visited, but the view was incredible. The pool area is very nice as well....with the beach pool and one other unheated pool, along with a large heated pool, and two large hot tubs. There is a "top optional" pool which requires an admission fee, but there are no kiddos around! There is bar and food service available as well. Security was never an issue; uniformed personnel were consistently patrolling the property. The Rio is a very good hotel whose only real draw back is not being situated on the strip. Its NOT the Bellagio or Wynn, but you aren’t paying crazy nightly rates either. Nothing to do with the Rio, but if you are taking in a show, avoid Hypnotist Unleashed at all costs. We have seen both Anothy Cools and Marc Savard, and loved them both. This show was fradualant, as they coached the participants what to say and do, neither Cools nor Savard would do that, and when THEY gave someone a suggestion it lasted the entire show, the Hypnotist Unleashed guys are frauds!!!! I was on stage, thank god. The "open bar" consisted of rock gut liquor, if you wanted anything else it was premium, since when is Malibu Rum considered premium? The theater on Harden St is a HOLE! Only one video screen was operational during the fake show. These hacks are what you would expect from someone at a state fair!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected class but not everything was great”
Reviews.Author: Penelop111
Reviews.Content: So first off, this hotel is hardly off the Strip, but the shuttles take you there from the airport LAST. It took about 45 minutes to get to the hotel, and it's about five miles away from the airport. The rooms: big, clean, and everything you need. There was an honor bar beneath the TV stand. We had a king bed and sofa in a huge room. For $49. Can't be beat! The staff: completely and totally respectful and courteous. The casino: a little dark, a little dated. I'm not a gambler so I could not care less. The restaurants: The World Buffet: Great for such an awesome amount of food The All American Bar and Grill: We had a fantastic meal the fist night, but subsequent meals were awful. Gaylord Indian Restaurant: this should not be missed. Wonderful decor, attentive staff, and outstanding food Buzio's Seafood Restaurant: Overpriced and sub-par food. Honestly, we could get much better seafood someplace else. The only shining star to this restaurant rests with the small bar before you get into the restaurant, and the outstanding bartender. He was great. McFaddens: Where else can you get cheap beer, cheap service, and cheap food (?) Really loud because the DJ would come on every few minutes and announce the latest cheap beer price. Yuck. Sau Paulo Cafe: Only open for breakfast, but that's until like 2:00 p.m. Good food, nice waiters, and a good alternative to the huge breakfast buffet. By the way, the breakfast buffet is about $20 each. I don't know about you, but there's no way I can eat $20 worth of food for breakfast. Burger King: The meat was grey, the soda was minus the flavor (so we got seltzer water) and it was $10 for a burger and soda ONLY. Starbucks: Okay, so there is a Starbucks AFTER you get to the Sau Paulo Cafe, towards the convention center. This place was FANTASTIC. Open 6:30 a.m. to 1:00 p.m. This place is not a part of the RIO. They have their own bakery and make all their own pastries. There is a smaller Starbucks in the Rio Casino which is highly advertised, but nobody told us about this Starbucks! It's smoke-free and large and wonderful. Cabs and shuttles: We wound up taking mostly cabs because the shuttles would drop us off only at Harrahs and we had to wind up walking to any other hotels. Although the Rio is barely off the Strip, it seemed like it took forever to get to other casinos on the Strip. Entertainment: Jersey Boys at the Palazzo was the most amazing show we have ever seen. Bar none. Terry Fator at the Mirage was also astounding. I would recommend signing up for the message service on your cell phone that list the latest deals. You get text messages about how you can save on things from dinners to drinks to shows. You can do this at the service counter at the Rio. And get a Player's Card for discounts at restaurants. On another note, we had no coffee maker in our room, but others in our party did. (and they were charged for the coffee. FYI: take your own coffee packets). When we called the front desk to complain, we were told that nobody had a coffee maker that enjoyed our price discount. Hmm, others in our party did, at the same price we got. When I mentioned this, management immediately took $15 off our room rate (for one night). Everything in Vegas is expensive. Drinks were $10-$12. Meals were $10 for a hamburger. It used to be that drinks and meals in Vegas were very inexpensive. No more. Shows are from $120 for Jersey Boys to $200 for Celine Dion. It was a great time but we're glad to be back at home!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but in need of some TLC”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravelalot1
Reviews.Content: The Rio I'm sure was a fabulous place when it was first built in 1990 but now she is a lady that is in bad need of a facelift. The check-in process was efficient...I was lucky to beat the rush. The desk staff was courteous and answered all of my questions and made sure that roommate wouldn't have any problems since we didn't arrive at the same time. The rooms are still spacious, but the furnishings look like something from a Magnum PI episode. I paid extra for a "premium" thinking that I would get updated furnishings but it just turned out that "premium" means a view of the strip. Most of the hotels that I have stayed in have flat panel TV's but the Rio is still rockin' gigantic tube TVs. The spa is amazing and I had fun doing Zumba by the pool. Restaurant choices are pretty nice. The all you can eat seafood buffet was nice for what it was....an all you can eat buffet. The McFadden's pub was fun the first night but then the next night it was like hip hop paradise. It would be nice if there was some type of listing of what was going on. Also the drinks where inconsistent one night smooth the next night I'm drinking something that would make me go blind. Blech! Overall this place is pretty fun and I would stay there again. I would give it a higher rating, but hotel really needs a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - a nice mid-tier property!”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: Rio is a very nice property off the strip. Friendly staff and good service with free shuttles that take you from this property to others on the strip. We like the vibe at the Rio and it has a more laid back feel than other places on the strip. Rooms are all good sized and you can upgrade for a bit more $$. On this stay our room was not up to par - looking a bit old and the housekeeping staff needed to do a better preparation and stocking on the bath supplies. We've stayed here before but the bed was the most uncomfortable we've had. Don't bother eating as the Irish Pub in the casino - service is very poor and the food is no better than a school cafeteria. Free parking, but it's a good walk if you are carrying bags. Nice pool with an adults only area if you prefer. For the cost conscious traveler, this is a good property and one we often come back to. If you are looking for luxury, there are much better choices out there.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: fdlt110
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for four nights. We found it to be OK. The room was spacious and was clean. We had a nice view of the mountains from the 18th floor. We had booked a King room but all they had was two Queens. The pool area was very nice. The choices for dining were a bit limited and we found the restaurants to be kind of expensive for what you get. Walked next door to the Gold Coast for breakfast where it was much cheaper. They do have a shuttle to Bally's and Harrah's however at times there were more people waiting than the shuttle could hold so you either had to walk or wait another half hour for the shuttle to return. Will probably stay on the Strip from now on, more choices, easier access to those choices and the newer properties seem to do a better job handling the cigarette smoke in the casino, the RIO was very smokey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but no thanks.”
Reviews.Author: beamer99
Reviews.Content: Thought for a change we would stay here instead of the strip. Found we were always shuttling everywhere. The room was very clean, and big - only complaint - the TV, so outdated!! The picture was awful, they really need to get new TV's. The restaurants were all expensive, so ended up eating breakfast at the Gold Coast, plain, but good and you can't beat the price! We had a really good waitress at "Fridays". Personally I won't stay here again. I found I really do enjoy the strip and all the things to do. The Rio is isolated, except for the Palms across the street, didn't feel that safe walking at night in the area.

Reviews.Title: “A great casual Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: spazzyjanet
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Rio on our first trip to Vegas. The rooms are quite spacious (with great views in many) and large, the dining options are plentiful and the pool area is fantastic. I loved that there were TWO starbucks in the lobby. The only downside was that it was not directly on the strip so you have to shuttle, cab, or walk (25 mins in direct sunlight) to get there. I loved that the hotel was not one of the ritziest because it meant a more laid-back atmosphere. I spent my mornings at the pool, my afternoons gambling and my evenings dining and drinking. I would definitely go back to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: BKtravels
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for the Rio I didn't have really high expectations. I thought besides the complaints about noise and dilapidated rooms that being off-strip would be a big disappointment. but at the price and for as many people as we had with us we decided to go for the cheaper option. It wasn't bad! Regardless of the casino being smoker-friendly the rooms did NOT smell like smoke (and my nose is super-sensitive to smoke). As long as you can make it through the casino area you'll be fine (and all the hotels have casinos I think so it's not like you can avoid it). The room itself was very nice, clean, and BIG. The only think I didn't like was the shower had old tiles with stained grout. It wasn't dirty at all, just unsightly. The other people in our party had their own rooms and some of them had bathrooms that had been redone so I think they're just working on it and will eventually finish them all. Being off-strip was really not an issue. They had a shuttle that ran I think from 10am-1am (don't quote me on that, it says on the website if you want to be sure) and that was very reliable and quick. Really didn't bother me at all as I thought it would. We didn't use the pool because it rained all three days we were there (UNREAL, right?? this was our luck. needless to say we didn't gamble much). The casino itself was nice, nothing out of the ordinary. Nice people working there, everyone was very friendly and accommodating. We went to the buffet which has lots of good food, plenty of options. The lunch buffet doesn't have as good of options as the dinner, thus the price difference. Both good though. If you like buffets you will love this. If you don't like buffets this will probably not change your mind. Overall good experience. Worth the money. Good deal and happy with the stay!

Reviews.Title: “The room was really big and quite--also, not a trace of smoke”
Reviews.Author: sandyhomerun
Reviews.Content: Unlike most casino hotels I've been to in Vegas, the Rio rooms dont have that nasty smokey smell. Plus all the rooms are suites so there is plenty of room with a couch, table and seperated bathroom. I will come back when I go back to Vegas...although I was extremely disappointed with the "world famous buffet"

Reviews.Title: “Nice, big, room. Good, solid and competent”
Reviews.Author: Jacob R
Reviews.Content: The non-luxury room I stayed in was 600 sq feet and it was well appointed, but the TV was an old, tube type. However, I did not come to Las Vegas for television!! The room is kind of noisy in the afternoon, due to loud music being played, but is quiet at other times. I would definitely stay at the Rio again because you really get a lot for your money. The table minimums and tightness of the slots are on par with similar facilities. You should definitely consider the Rio in your travel plans.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxed”
Reviews.Author: Portlobster
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights and had a great time! The VooDoo Lounge was on the roof, with eye popping views on the outdoor deck. Suite was comfortable and large. Food was great! Cannot wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Furniture”
Reviews.Author: 1Sonny
Reviews.Content: Need to update furniture but overall hotel is excellent. Staff very friendly and everything within close range. Did not need to leave for anything.

Reviews.Title: “Rio (Harrahs) understands Customer Service to their regulars !”
Reviews.Author: Dave-Sandy-Parker
Reviews.Content: Usually stay for 3 nights each visit.... 3 times/year. Easy to park (close to the check-in desk, by Vegas standards). Friendly at Check-in. Good, large rooms (with sofa, if you have 3+ people in your group). Great pool areas (we like the sand/beach/waterfall pool, but it is the most crowded with little kids too). We gamble there a little, but I walk to Gold Coast or Palms for cheaper $5 craps. The coffee shop is quite good for breakfast (a little pricey, but worth it). The Carnival Buffet is great with a 2-for-1 coupon - but get there early or wait in line. I prefer the sushi bar, the Prime RIb (dinner), King Crab legs (dinner), and gelato desserts. Bowling is fun (cheaper at Gold Coast, if you don't mind the people there). Just a great place for a relaxing long weekend trip. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the price”
Reviews.Author: Dennis L
Reviews.Content: While having stayed in many of the hotels on the strip in the past, we just needed a place for one night while returning from a back east trip. So we opted for the Rio which offered a great price for a Sunday night stay. Of course the room was very spacious and being on the 18th floor on the strip side we had a wonderful view of Las Vegas at night! The Rio is an older hotel and needs a little grooming, but if you check out the price for a room on the strip, it is a bargain. The casino still looks like casinos of old, very dark, lots of smoke smell and caters to the younger crowd. During the day we thought our neighbors next door or upstairs were playing loud music, but it was coming from the pool area 18 floors below and resonating against the windows of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Change of Pace”
Reviews.Author: sandym2907
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 day stay at the Rio. We received a very good deal and also got 2 nights free, so we decided to give the Rio a try. We have been to Vegas many times and stayed at hotels on the Strip. The Rio is a nice hotel. We stayed in the Ipenima (sp?) tower with a strip view. This was an upgrade that I asked for when we checked into the hotel. The pool area was nice, but the water was really cold. The Rio has a great party atmosphere and definitely a place for adults and not children. The facility is a bit dated, but we still had a great time. Our room was huge and kept very clean. To be honest with you, we really weren't in the room that much. Even though the television was older, we didn't even turn it on. Too much else to see and do! We were surprised to see a Kureug coffee pot in the room! The k-cups were 3/$8 in the mini frig. So I suppose if I knew this ahead of time, I could have brought some k-cups with me! We also signed up for text alerts through the rewards card and received some good deals during our trip. We would stay again at the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “good trip”
Reviews.Author: dch
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a convention-nice room-friendly people-great pool area-liked the shuttle to the strip-voodoo lounge was great-

Reviews.Title: “"They need to fix up this hotel"”
Reviews.Author: senoraflowers
Reviews.Content: The comment I overheard from a member of the housekeeping staff says it best: "They need to fix up this hotel." After receiving a comped room, I paid an extra $10 per night for a room in the Ipanema tower, and if this is upgraded, I probably would have fled from a non-upgraded room. The carpet was frayed. The wallpaper and paint were peeling and stained. I was scared to touch some of the lamps because they looked like they would fall apart. (And speaking of lighting fixtures, why are all of the light shades in the hallway damaged?) The refrigerator wasn't cold. There was a Keurig coffee maker in the room, along with a note saying that I could buy coffee from the minibar for $8. This is my first time in a room with a coffee maker without complimentary coffee. To top it off, there wasn't any coffee in the minibar. I decided to skip the $13.99/day charge for internet access. These Harrah's hotels promote themselves as not having a resort fee, but if I have to pay $13.99/day for internet access and $8 for coffee, I might as well pay a resort fee and have access to a few other amenities (like a gym), as well. The Rio is certainly not the worst hotel I've ever visited, but it is the worst hotel I've visited in Vegas. It's just "blah", and in a city of exciting and fun hotels, that's not good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Same - Not great but good for the money”
Reviews.Author: clfurn
Reviews.Content: Although the place is getting a little old. The rooms were large and comfy. The shuttles get you to and from the strip and very friendly staff. One of the best deals just off the strip with strip shows and casino. Stay at the Rio, you'll like it and with the money you save, you will be able to play a few more hands of black jack!!

Reviews.Title: “Unique property”
Reviews.Author: collegefootballfan
Reviews.Content: If you want to stay off the strip but still have easy access to it, this is your place. All rooms very spacious starting at just under 600 sq ft. Pool area very busy and happening. Very disappointed that they made the best pool into a topless venue. Buffet was okay but not worth the $25 they charge for dinner. I am usually a very patient person but the wait to get into this buffet is horrible. Golden Corral back home moves people through their lines 10 times quicker. When you finally get through and seated you see many empty seats. This is not acceptable. Free shuttle over to the strip is a nice bonus. Stayed in the Masquerade tower this trip and found out that I definitely prefer the older Impanema tower rooms view and room layout better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: casper684
Reviews.Content: Friend gave us 2 free nights and we stayed 2 more! Reserved "non smoking" room but first room they gave us really smelled like smoke. Called front desk and they gave us another room down the hall with no fuss. MUCH NICER though it overlooked pool areas and their speakers are going all day with music. But we're gone during day so not much of a problem unless you wanted to take a nap. HUGE room and comfortable bed. Did miss microwave though but nice to have a fridge :-) I would stay here again. Internet was $13.95 in room and free if you brought your own laptop and went downstairs. Internet computer available downstairs for $5 for 15 or 30 min. I forget BUT connection there was so slow that I was only able to answer 1 email. So went up and got mine. Nice place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Poor choice for a conference”
Reviews.Author: sfairborne2001
Reviews.Content: I was excited about staying at the Rio for a professional conference on 5-7 SEP, because I had not stayed here before. It is not on the Strip, but it does have a free shuttle bus to the Strip, which is convenient. I have stayed at other casinos / hotels not on the strip, and had not previously been disappointed, but I can sum up the Rio in two words: NO FRILLS. The Rio's prime objective is to get the guest out to the casino floor, and if not the casino, then into one of their extremely overpriced restaurants. The Rio is not convenient to anything unless you want to drive; don't know many people who take the free shuttle to the Strip at 6:00 am for breakfast. The room was large and well appointed, but that was the only positive. There was no free in-room coffee, no cable at all - just local channels, a charge to use the gym, a charge for WiFi, overpriced restaurants, the pool closed at 7:00 pm, and to top it off, no amenities provided (water bottles, coffee, juice, etc.) for the over 200 conference attendees (all staying as guests at the hotel). The line for their $43 buffet was at least an hour long every evening, so it was off to the Strip to find something reasonable - not convenient at the end of a long day. In addition, they will put a hold on your credit card of ONE HUNDRED DOLLARS A DAY - more than the room rate charge - just in case you use anything that is free at other hotels. I enjoy my perks because I stay in Vegas at least two months out of every year. Let me assure you that I will not EVER stay at the Rio again. For the price you pay, you can stay much more comfortably at any other casino on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...very nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bamatina1
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this casino were great...very large, spacious and tastefully done. The place is nice because it's off the strip but within easy walking distance. They also have a shuttle that runs to the strip often. Only negative was we had some things shipped for a conference and they lost the shipment...took half a day to find it. It was delivered and signed for but someone misplaced the items. The plus is they didn't charge us for that pickup but they do charge based on weight if you have things shipped to the hotel. They also do not have a one price to eat at the buffet all day...2 years ago we stayed at the MGM Grand and could pay about $30 per person to eat 3 meals at the buffet. Would have been nice if they offered this too.

Reviews.Title: “Love it...very large rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sunnilady
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio several times in the past years. We like it for ths space you have. Most Las Vegas hotel rooms are small. But the Rio is all suites which makes it more comfortable. The rooms are clean and you usually have a great view.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but good for the money.”
Reviews.Author: Assassin8
Reviews.Content: I only stayed at the Rio for two days with my husband. It was a friday and there was no line to checked in and we got an upgrade. We got a room on the 15 floor in the Mascarade tower. It was an older room but had floor to ceiling windows that overlooked the pool and you could see The Palms and mountain landscape. It was beautiful at night! The music from the pool was loud durring the day, but it stopped around 6pm. The service at Rio was overall pretty good. There was very little wait, we got drinks quickly and the staff was friendly. Although this is an older hotel and could use some renovating, it wasn't bad for the price. It is off strip but if you don't mind a cab ride, it's worth a short visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad. Kids loved the pool.”
Reviews.Author: JARPOh
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at Rio. I selected this hotel among the Caesar properties because of the size of a standard suite and the sandy beach pool for kids. So in that regard I was not disappointed. Yes the hotel is a little older. Yes there was a cigarette hole on the sofa. But at least the buffet was still pretty good. When I was in Vegas in July and ate at the Monte Carlo and Planet Hollywood buffets, I was pretty disappointed (considering the cost). I also utilized the free shuttle (even though I had a car). As for being off the Strip, it's not even that far from it and yet it's easier to avoid the traffic by taking the side roads. Also went next door to Gold Coast for breakfast since it's only $6.99 ($5.99 with player's card). After all, it's only breakfast and it was decent. I may come again but already booked Paris for Thanksgiving. Lastly, I was surprised how quiet it was here, comparatively speaking. I guess that's the good thing about older/less popular hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Good room in aging hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mithra
Reviews.Content: If the convention weren't at this hotel I would have stayed elsewhere. However the over 20 year old Rio is showing its age but is till a good value. All the vegas hotel tricks were in play - crappy tv channels to get you out of the room, lousy interent connectivity and they charged outrageously for it. You could see the age of he hotel and surround but not " smell" it which was good. Room wasnt that clean = fungus in the bathroom is typical of this age hotel and we found it. in spades. At any rate it was a huge room and it was good to stretch out. separate fridge for your stuff no microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Never never never again”
Reviews.Author: AssafCohen
Reviews.Content: The worst part at the hotel was the service. They closed the pool every day! for a private event at 4 pm. In august, not having a pool at the afternoon is really bad. We complained the manager about it and not only he said they can do whatever they want with their pool he called security. We cancelled our next 3 nights and moved to another hotel the day after. Not only that, the best pool with the waterfalls is a topless pool only! Men need to pay 20$ to for entry and also must be over 21. I have never run into such bad service in the U.S.A and it really unfortuante the treat we got from the manager. Also, rooms are very big but old, hotel smells from cigarettes, and off the strip. Overall - not recommended. ** Please pay attention that private events in the pool of this hotel happen occaisionally accroding to the hotel stuff!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with convienence to the strip without being on the strip!”
Reviews.Author: travelboy2007
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to stay at the Rio and I can't imagine staying anywhere else in Vegas. Only $80 a night for a suite overlooking the pools and strip can't be beat. Very friendly staff also. The only thing bad I can say about the RIO is they close the pools early every day for special functions and events which is a bummer but I'll live.

Reviews.Title: “WSOP trip”
Reviews.Author: Earl G
Reviews.Content: The suite @ The Rio was very clean, spacious, and gave us a spectacular view of Vegas Lights every night. Staying where we were playing with this hotel was way above and beyond, best buffet in Vegas without a doubt, worth the long wait

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: elaborate65
Reviews.Content: I generally do not write reviews but I thought they deserved one. We have stayed at the Rio about 5 ties before and we had a reduced rate and comp room. Arrived Saturday at about 11:00AM. I had requested a smoking room, but at this time they only had a non-smoking room we could check into immediately - we took it - not smoking not a big deal. The girl at checkin was pleasant and was happy to help us. We waited about 5 minutes in line. We got to our room (15th floor Impanema) and were very pleased. 2 queen beds. Room was clean and I thought it was in pretty good shape, beds very comfortable, bathroom clean and in good working order. We were here for 3 nights and enjoyed ourselves very much. Gambling was ok in the Rio. We also walked accross the street to the Gold Coast to play Bingo, gamble and eat at TGIF's. We will stay at the Rio again when we return to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great suites greater price”
Reviews.Author: Chinableu
Reviews.Content: Lovely hote; great pool(s); Best Seafood buffet in Vegas!!

Reviews.Title: “As advertised - ok but not great, reasonable pricing.."no resort fee" a joke”
Reviews.Author: MrSmart
Reviews.Content: Just stayed in Vegas for a week, and ended up visiting various hotels. I chose the Rio for the first few days because that's where the Star Trek convention was - a wise move - always good to be able to retreat to room. The Rio has everything all the other casinos/hotels do: restaurants, bars, 2 nightclubs, a pool...etc. Nothing is as good as the more famous hotels. The restaurants at Wynn and Caesar's are much better. The Marquee nightclub at the Cosmopolitan is the current hotspot for serious partying. And the Rio room was "ok" - couldn't compare to my friend' s room at the Wynn. The Wynn pool is also much nicer for hanging out. But the room was also $100 cheaper per night than those places. That easily pays for some taxis, drinks, and food. I wouldn't stay here again unless I was attending an event here, but I didn't feel ripped off. I paid less, and got less. The room was clean, there are shuttles both to the airport and to the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Time at the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: World_Travelor_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rio in Las Vegas last weekend. Check in was simple and we got a renovated room in the Impenima tower without having to upgrade. We even got strip and pool view. The pools were great and we didn't find the music to be loud at all. The DJ'S were playing all our favourite songs, so it was a good time. The drinks pool side were very expensive. $20 bucks for a daquari and a beer. Oh well... "When in Vegas" When other people on trip advisor made comments telling you not to play the slots here..... they were right! They don't pay out at all! Save your money and play at another Casino. The shuttle to the stip was very convienient and it always seemed to be at the loading area every time we showed up. It was about a 5-10 minute ride to the strip and it lets you off at Bally's. We didn't go to the World Carnival Buffet as it was $25 bucks a person. So, we had a lot of breakfasts at Sau Paul Cafe, which was about $10-$14 bucks a person and the food was really good. The only bad thing I can say about the Rio is that the air quality in the casino and rooms was terriable! We're non smokers and as soon as we went into the Casino, our eyes were blood shot and we couldn't breath. And our room smelled like smoke as well if we turned off the air conditioning. I'm sure this is due to the age of the hotel as other newer hotels on the strip smelled smoke free and didn't bother us. All in all, the Rio is a good hotel if you can get a renovated room and don't mind taking the shuttle to the strip. For the $340 bucks we paid for air and hotel, it was a great weekend! Oh, one more thing.... it's $26 bucks (plus tip) to take a cab from the airport to the Rio and only $9 bucks a person to take the Show Time Shuttle. We didn't know the shuttle was so cheap unitl we asked one of their drivers. We took the shuttle back to the airport and it was only 25 minutes with other hotel pick ups.

Reviews.Title: “My shoes were stolen from our room. Place smelled of septic. Noisy even on the upper floors. NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Christopher M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIO August 12-15th for my wife to attend her 11th Las Vegas annual Star Trek Convention. We arrived to our room at about 2:30 pm. We quickly checked it out after having been at the hotel for four hours already. My wife thought she smelled something in the room , but I told her it was just the septic smell we had encountered outside and it must be coming in the window vent. We then went to get our luggage. Shortly after unpacking, my wife and I began smelling a septic odor around the bathroom. We tried to rid odor ourselves but could not. We showered and changed from our travel clothes. At that point, I had placed my $120 shoes on the floor at the window to let them "air" and dry in the sunlight. I take great care of all of my shoes and even after 8 months, they were like new because, for the most part, I usually wear work boots or sandals (of course, the first time I travel light, I put on the only other pair I had brought which were sandals). We contacted the front desk about the odor as we left out to eat at their, what was once, great tasting buffet. We decided to play in the casino for a bit after eating. At about 11pm we finally went back to the room but were disappointed to find it now smelled even worse. We were planning on having some more fun but decided to call the front desk again right away to tell them about the odor (we had noticed this smell very strongly outside the hotel also). An engineer came to inspect for the smell complaint within 15 minutes. He said they needed to replace the toilet gasket. He called the desk and told them to move us and a bellhop was there in 5 minutes. We were a little frustrated, annoyed and getting tired. In the rush to pack up and move, I did not realize that someone had earlier closed the curtains in our room. I forgot all about the shoes, if they were even still there. The next morning I went to the pool while my wife attended the convention. At about 3pm, we met up at the room to change for dinner. It was then that we realized my shoes had been left behind in the first room. The front desk had us speak with security staff. We were instructed to meet them outside the original room. We waited for 40 minutes, no-one came. We called security with a hallway phone. They told us they weren't allowed to go in the first room without the new tenants permission (What ?!! The maids can enter!!). WHY DIDN"T THEY COME TELL US AS WE STOOD IN THE HALLWAY FOR 40 MINUTES?!! We checked our room phone when we returned and also found no missed calls. We made approximately 10 attempts to get help from hotel staff and security, including a manager, over the next day and a half. We received no responses at all from security until they took a report at 2pm on Sunday the 14th. At that time, the security member, Larry, seemed more annoyed at taking the report than being interested on how the shoes disappeared. Oh yes, I failed to mention, since no-one would bother to look for the shoes, I and my wife went to the room ourselves. The family was very nice and let me look behind the curtains which were halfway open. There couldn't have been anyone in that room larger than a mens size 8, I am a 13. The Hotel RIO's "Third Party Risk Management" firm, CCMSI, flat out denied the reimbursement claim. It might not be so bad if the circumstances were different. We did not ask for the Hotel RIO to smell like a sewer was running around and through it. A maid had cleaned that room just before we got it. We know because we checked in early and had to call a few times to find out when it was ready. Why didn't she report the smell? We didn't ask to be uprooted from the room hastily. The bellhop was already grabbing bags and garments as I was trying to collect our valuables privately from the safe and my wife was still trying to pack up. They even had the pools area closed for a "private' local radio staion party on Sunday without any prior notification that we could find anywhere. It was only around 110 degrees outside, so it's not like any of the actual paying hotel guests would have liked to use the pools or jacuzzis. You might think a large hotel/casino chain would want to take care of their customers. Actually, when we were moved to the new room, I was told they were taking $30 off of our bill for the inconvenience. When checking out, we had to see a manager because they had failed to apply the $30 credit. Evidently, The RIO doesn't care. They just pass you off like lost luggage. My wife had read many poor reviews for the RIO, along with a few okay ones prior to the convention. With a little apprehension, we decided to stay at the RIO, mainly because it was the convention site. Next time, we'll stay across the street at the Gold Coast. Their food was better and maybe the staff won't steal our shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Great for adults, not so much for families”
Reviews.Author: kozmokr
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there during our family vacation, but moved to another hotel after a couple of nights. The reason - we had kids... As long as you leave your kids at home, its very nice hotel. It's not impressive from the outside like some hotels, but the rooms are amazing. We got the suite, which was very fancy and huge, for a very reasonable price. The location could be better, it's on the edge of the strip, but there are frequent shuttles to other hotels. The hotel is old, and sometimes it shows. a remodeling could help.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad place to stay”
Reviews.Author: trying4win
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas five times in the last eight years and this was the first time we had stayed at a hotel off the strip. The rooms are clean and spacious. The pools were excellent. The food was not that great. We had been to the Vodoo Lounge before but this was the first time we had eaten at the restaurant, which was just okay. I could not believe how dirty the windows were and considering it was known for it's view, we were very disappointed. I don't think we will ever stay at a hotel which is not on the strip again.

Reviews.Title: “some things good, some things bad”
Reviews.Author: Pixiehat
Reviews.Content: I stayed here 7 nights. I loved the 'suite' , Big, roomy, nice view, close to elevator, and, goodie, there was a fridge! (unlike, say, MGM) The shop to buy soft drinks, ice cream, sandwiches, etc seemed cheaper than Strip hotels. I was a bit embartrassed on behalf of the scantily dressed cocktail waitresses - this is their career??!! - The famous buffet was... okay. But I detested being kept a prisoner in the hotel until 10 a.m. when first shuttle departed for The Strip. And you must quadruple check every dealing with concierge. Not once, not twice, not three times, but four times I told her where I wanted a bus to pick me up and she still got it wrong' I was paged for ages at the wrong hotel and if I hadnt taken matters into my own hands would have missed out on my afternoon tour.

Reviews.Title: “Lively and fun”
Reviews.Author: LYNNIE72
Reviews.Content: This hotel is off the strip, but is much more lively than several of those directly on the strip, at least it was was during my stay. There are 2 towers, the Masquerade and the Ipanema. The front desk person shared that the rooms in the Masquerade tower are not yet renovated, while those in the Ipanmea tower are, so we paid the $20 upgrade fee to be moved into the Ipanema tower. There are 2 free shuttles that run every half hour, one will drop you off at Harrah's and the other will drop you off at Bally's. You can be picked up and go back to the Rio by that same means if you like. This was a nice plus to avoid having to pay cab fare to get back to the strip. The only issue is depending on how busy it is when you are there, you may not make the cut to board the shuttle if maximum occupancy is reached before your place in line. Based on the timing of my visit this time, that was not an issue, but I have been in a position before where I could not board because the shuttle was already full, which wa not really a huge deal for me since the shuttle runs regularly. We ate at a few different eateries there, the All American Bar & Grille, the Sports Deli, and the Carnival World Buffet. Food at all establishments was good. There is also a Starbucks for the coffee lovers. There is a spa avaible, which I did not get a chance to visit on this trip, but hope to next time maybe. The room was comfortable and roomy. I did not make use of the mini bar, but a nice variety of items was included. Our room faced the pool and the strip. Loud music began at 10AM in the pool area, which we could clearly hear up in our room on the 11th floor, so if you seek quiet, you maybe should not get a room facing the pool. We weren't in our room all day, so this was not really an issue for us, but depending on your needs it may be something you want to consider. Everything considered, I would stay here again. My experience was enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fun trip to Vegas and the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: Run26miles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rio 8/25-8/29. We arrived at 1AM and were not able to get a king suite as I had reserved. We were placed in a 2 Queen suite in the Ipanema tower. The room was on the 18th floor with a strip view. The room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. The sofa in the room looked OK but sagged a bit in the middle. The bathroom was a bit dated but everything was clean and worked fine. We had a maintenance issue with the lock on the room door (a screw fell out of the lock) and it was fixed promptly. We ate at the Carnival World buffet and the All American Grille while there and both were very good. I was impressed with the selection and quality of food at the Carnival buffet, We had brunch there and it was much better than the buffet at the Palms that we had the day before. The concierge was very helpful. I rented a car on Friday and she directed me to Enterprise instead of the Hertz location in the hotel which saved me about $50. That was much appreciated. I've stayed in many different Vegas hotels over the years and the Rio was a good one. I would put it on par with Harrah's and NY/NY as a great comfort/value combination. The only downside is not being on the strip costs you a bit in taxi fares.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you might think.”
Reviews.Author: islandplace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio the first time quite by happenstance. We usually stay at the Paris but it was sold out and they had a sister hotel "The Rio" available for our dates. It seems to be a bit off the magic of the lights and action but is actually not bad as there is a non stop "Brazillian Carnival" going on at The Rio. lol They have a large van (seats maybe 30) that leaves every 15 minutes from The Rio to The Paris and back. It runs until about 2am I believe. Very easy. All of the rooms are huge! The biggest I have stayed in without being a 2 room suite. Very Clean. Loved the bar and their great drink menu. We are going back in a few weeks for another convention and I cant wait for a "Blackberry & Sage" cocktail. I am not a big drinker but this I am truly looking forward to. The buffet is not bad. We ate at the Indian restaurant and it was very good. I have no problem going back to the Rio w/ rates at $60+. The only thing that could be daunting are the scantily clad ladies who are strategically placed every 15 minutes or so to perform individual dance routines. I'm not a prude but wouldnt see myself in a burlesque show either. This is short of that. Wouldnt take young children there but wouldnt take young kids to a casino anyway unless it was Circus Circus maybe (which I have never been). Great Pool area with water fall. Used the spa once for a ped and it was very good. All in all we really like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Botched Bachelorrette Party”
Reviews.Author: Greyhound661
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rio on a Friday night on the weekend of a big Rave event. My girlfriends and I booked our trip through Allegiant air because of the convenience. The airline did not communicate well with the hotel and they were unable to find our reservations. Instead of trying to help us find our reservations or looking up our names, they said they only found one room for our group of 5 and that we had to find out the correct format of reservation number. I had all of the info that the airline gave us, which was just my confirmation/receipt showing our flight and two rooms, but they would not even try to figure out the issue and were very rude. I had to spend hours on the phone trying to deal with the airline and then the hotel had to fax back and forth with them only to find out that the hotel entered the information under the name of another person in our party, not my name. This issue could have been simply avoided by checking all of our names in the system. We could have been treated courteously. We were treated unfairly and not compensated for our treatment in any way. The airline and hotel were both at fault but we had to miss our show and nightclub reservations and wait hours to get out second room. The rooms are not quite as nice as they seem to be online. The hotel was packed I am not impressed with the Rio in any way. The only good things I can say about the hotel: the beds were comfortable, the adult pool was fairly nice and had good service

Reviews.Title: “Sad smokey old property”
Reviews.Author: gottago33
Reviews.Content: The rooms are bad and need to be renovated. The hotel vent system is terrible, and it smelled like someone was smoking right in my room the whole week. The convention wing has a good layout and seems much better maintained than anything else.

Reviews.Title: “At first glance good value”
Reviews.Author: TravelChel
Reviews.Content: I spent a week at the Rio in August 2011. I chose the hotel as it was the location of my convention. The hotel is off the strip but transport to the Strip is easy via shuttle or taxi. The Rio has good sized rooms, some renovated , some not. There is a significant difference. I changed room and towers (the hotel has 2 towers) during my stay. My original room in the Masquerade Tower was sufficiently in need of renovation that I probably wouldn't have returned to the Rio but a friend helped me arrange a room change and the new room, in the Ipanema Tower was much better. I did see a renovated room in the Masquerade Tower which was good, so just make sure you ask for a renovated room or the Ipanema tower. This is not the Bellagio, so don't expect fancy, but the renovated rooms are quite nice. Be aware that a pool side room will have noise from the disco at the pool during the day (10am - 6pm). A high floor doesn't seem to offer extra insulation from the noise. The room was quiet at night. On room rate alone the Rio appears to be good value however, they charge for everything. My original room didn't have any kind of tea/coffee making facility. The second did have a coffee machine however there was a charge to use it. The internet is expensive (US$14 a day) and only works inside your room. I had some parcels delivered during my stay and had to pay to pick them up. The minimum cost is US$5 but they charge by weight. Mine weighed a couple of kilos and cost US$30. I have never experience this at any other hotel, including the Hilton, Las Vegas which is also off the strip and probably a similar standard of hotel. There are 2 Starbucks and a couple of general stores in the building where you can buy most things you will want including fruit, drinks, cereal, junk food and souvenirs. There is one store at the bottom of each tower and they do not stock all the same products, if you can't find something it is worth wandering over to the other tower. I did use the hairdresser and spa. The spa was a surprise, it was much higher quality than I expected for this level of hotel. I will most likely stay there again, as that is where future conventions are being held and where my friends will stay. I will make sure I am in the Ipanema tower and I might bring a kettle and a tea bag!

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment - Would never return”
Reviews.Author: Aquamagik
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Rio thinking it would be a great stay with a nice pool and a little hike to the strip. We would never return. This is the first review I have ever given and am writing this so other people don't make the same mistake we did. Here is reality at the Rio: 1) We reserved a premium room and were placed into a room with a window view of a garbage heap (Yes.. bags of heaped garbage outside). We had booked 5 months in advance and had to complain to eventually get the room changed. 2) The Rio constantly has its hands in your pocket for things that are common in other hotels to make your stay enjoyable. $8 for a cup of coffee, $25 for a simple meal (one person), $14 for 1 day of internet, $10 for a single drink in the pool (and you can't bring any in.. you are checked at the door), $4 for a bottle of water.. be ready to open your wallet. We walked to the Gold Coast everyday since the buffet was so nice, clean, and reasonable... stay there :)!! 3) We had to call to get our room done after 4:00 one day.. and also had to run and find toilet paper off the maid's cart because it was not changed. 4) We were kicked out of the pool so the management could have a party for their security company.. they actually kicked paying customers out of the pool area (which needs longer hours anyway). People were furious. When people walked to the desk and complained to the management, they said "We reserve the right to close the pool".. LOL.. aren't people paying for this? Can we have our room for free? People were basically bullied by management. I could go on and on. A pool cashier even tried to rip us off for a pair of goggles... LOL .. you had to be there. Anyway, go somewhere else!! And have a great vacation... because time with your family like this is priceless :) :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff! Could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: dnvrjeep
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rio 8/29/11 for 3 nights. Price was nice, room was big, but not without issues. checked in in the afternoon on a Friday, about 10 people in line, which moved pretty fast. First, the ice maker on the 7th floor of Ipanema tower was out, so you had to go to another floor for ice. The in room fridge froze the Pepsi we put in it, and the mini-bar wouldn't keep anything cold. Beds were comfortable and the water pressure in the shower great! I was surprised that some of the towels were torn, at such a nominal cost, I really expect things like that to be replaced at any hotel, irrespective of price point. Some friends were in the Masquerade tower, which seemed much nicer. The elevators for ipanema are vandalized and tacky, We ate in the All American Bar and Grill, food was good, service was spotty. We had drinks at I Bar a few times, and that was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again. Good value for the price.”
Reviews.Author: tdrm
Reviews.Content: We booked 5 nights at the Rio to attend a convention being held there. We got an excellent convention rate. After reading many bad reviews, I was a little worried, but for convenience we really wanted to stay at the hotel where the convention was being held. I called ahead and requested a room in the IP Tower. I had read that those rooms are nicer, and also closer to the convention center. Upon arrival, our room in the IP Tower was waiting for us. We had a lovely pool / strip view, and we were pleasantly surprised with the room. We have stayed at nicer hotels in Vegas, but for twice the price. This one was definitely worth what we paid or more. 5 nights here with absolutely no problems whatsoever. We had a large, clean room with two queen beds, a sofa (which also made out into a bed), coffee table, desk, television, small refrigerator, large closet and dresser, a safe for our valuables, and a wonderful view. We enjoyed the convention facilities at this hotel as well as the rooms. This was a very pleasant experience. Can think of no negatives really. Of course it is not on the strip, but we had a rental car so that did not concern us. We had no problems with parking, we choose self parking and the walk to the parking lot was not bad at all. They do charge about $15 per day for wireless, but we have 3G on the iPad, so that was not a concern to us. We would stay at this hotel again, especially if we attend another convention here.

Reviews.Title: “Seafood buffet, not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: hideyho53
Reviews.Content: Especially if you get a discount ticket from the discount booths on the strip. We paid $29.99 per person, well worth it for all the seafood you can eat!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the rio!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hospitaladmit
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights in aug. in a very nice big room with a king bed that was sooo comfy.we had a great view from the 32nd floor overlooking the pools. We had a better view of the strip than any of the times that we stayed on the strip. the room was amazing and had a coffee maker and a fridge. The casino is very large with everything you could want to play. We rented a car, but the shuttle is there if you need it. we got to see the show in the sky. It is by far the best free show of any casiono in vegas. We didnt eat at the casino, so I cant comment. The staff were nice enough and helpful. The line to check in was fast. Oh, and with all the hotels controlling the temps in the rooms, the rio doesnt do that, we sat the thermostat where we wanted it. We will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “The negatives outweigh the positives.”
Reviews.Author: Kami6
Reviews.Content: On the positive side: spacious rooms, friendly staff, good bed, and great view from the higher floors. We appreciated the express elevator service. But the negatives made our stay miserable. 1) tobacco smoke infiltrated our no-smoking room from next door--we had to stuff a wet towel in the wide crack under the door; 2) the noise from the group next door came right through the adjoining room doors; 3) the 150 decibel speaker systems (plural) playing different music at the pools was intolerable. Why would management place huge speakers on the beach where toddlers were playing at the water's edge, and turn up the volume to a deafening level? The amplification system was over-driven to the point that the distortion was laughable. 4) the fish and chips at the All-American Steakhouse exuded a messy mix of luke-warm water and transparent slime. A second trip from the kitchen succeeded at providing a warmer mix of water and semi-transparent slime. We tried the Italian restaurant, where the volume of the music made any conversation impossible, and other diners had to shout to make themselves heard. With all the noise bouncing off all the hard surfaces in the restaurant, we skipped dessert and rushed back to our room. The chef over-seasoned the salad with pepper, and the pasta dish was overly salted to the point of being inedible. The "number one rated meatball in the country" was a major disappointment in its blandness and fillers.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, poor service, disappointing amenities.”
Reviews.Author: OBD2142
Reviews.Content: In you are with a group of young men looking to crash in a large room in Vegas, this may be the perfect hotel for you. I do not fall into this group. Rio is considered a 4* hotel by various sites. I question this. The amenities are awful. Shampoo/conditioner in one & VERY smelly. Soap and lotion also VERY strong in scent. Believe me, bring your own products. There are now coffee makers in the room but you must pay $8 for the coffee. My first day there my room was not cleaned. When I called guest services, I was told to call housekeeping! The second day I was there, my trash was not emptied. Third day, they cleaned and left me an extra pen! The lamp shades in the hall had been smudges by? drunk patrons and not replaced during my stay. Tip : if you do stay here, the Sports Deli is the best thing going. Good, well priced & available for carry out. I say stay here ONLY for convenience if you're working at Rio 's convention center

Reviews.Title: “So-So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VerySatisfied7
Reviews.Content: I tagged along with my husband for a conference he was attending. They first put us in a room that was really old, stains on the carpet and loveseat, and the shower curtain had black stuff growing on the bottom. We asked for a different room, and were given one exactly the same only several floors higher. I don't think it was housekeeping's fault, as it was clean, just that way from being old and used out. The bed was relly comfy though. Everything was very expensive - drinks, food, etc. There was a coffeepot in the room, but you had to pay for the coffee. I do want to commend the staff. Every person we encountered was very nice and cheerful. We tried to spend some time in the pool area, but had to leave because we thought our eardrums were going to bleed from the volume of the music. The room itself was a good price, but as always, you get what you pay for. We went in August and knew it would be very hot in Vegas. The hotel (and every other casino or restaurant we went to) was extremely cold - take a hoodie with you.

Reviews.Title: “Like No Other Christmas....”
Reviews.Author: miss_minervois
Reviews.Content: Hadn't banked on going to Vegas for Christmas, it was a bit of surprise. I'd never really wanted to go, but I had a great time ! The Rio isn't on the Strip but that didn't bother me at all as the hotel runs a great shuttle service to all the other Harrahs Casinos in town, so getting about was easy. The Seafood Buffet was a stand out dining moment. We had to queue to get in, but it was worth the wait. The World Buffet Christmas Day was awesome, and even the impromptu ( ie we lost track of what time it was ) Christmas eve Chinese take out was fine - and very very generous ! the Casino was friendly even to absolute rubbish beginners like me. The rooms were fabulous - huge and well equipped and ours had a wonderful view looking down the strip. Wouldn't hesitate to go back ; superb value for money proving for once that it's not all location location location.

Reviews.Title: “not great service, but a good to okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: konadog1
Reviews.Content: The room that I stayed in was updated and roomy. It was kept clean and neat. I liked the selection of dining choices, but the staff seemed overwhelmed by the large numbers of people that were attending conventions and vacationing at the hotel. Service times were long and uneven. Food quality was generally very good. I also found the check-in staff somewhat curt and abrupt, but they certainly kept the lines moving so there was very little or no wait times on check-in. The check-in staff also failed to be very helpful regarding restaurant locations, amenities, deals, etc. - but they did keep that line moving. The rooms had pretty good sound insulation too - you don't have a lot of exterior ambient noise at the higher levels. The television was small and an archaic old old model, and the movies and channels were fuzzy and garbled. The in-house entertainment system would re-boot every few minutes - pretty worthless. I never found the fitness center - partially due to my laziness, partially due to the unenthusiastic directions from the hotel staff. The pools were nice, but the restaurant at the pool was open only on one day - not sure why if there were so many guests that the pool service would be closed. This hotel is moderately modern, but the service doesn't compare to older and newer hotels on and off the strip in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise away from the Strip!”
Reviews.Author: Boodashark
Reviews.Content: Stayed four nights. Traveled with spouse and adult daughters (in two rooms). The suite concept is great. First time in a suite at a Caesar's property and will do it again. So nice to have a lot of room to spread out. The Rio casino is really noisy, lots of loud music, probably because there's a lot of entertainment going on most of the time. The drum beat from the pool area is constant during the day, but was not an issue, as we don't sleep in the daytime! Rented a cabana at the pool and had a marvelous server (Marci) who is also a dancer in their Sky Show. She became "family" in a matter of hours and it was neat to see her as a performer, as well. Room was clean (and kept that way by good housekeeping). Wine Cellar was extraordinary. The British bartender was a "luv." The hotel was a nice surprise after reading mixed reviews. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Meh. Ok I guess.”
Reviews.Author: Cloverleaf1978
Reviews.Content: Apparently, I wrote a review of the Rio about six years ago. Many of the things I said then still hold true. We stayed in the Ipanema Tower. It looked pretty much exactly like it did in 2005.... it even had what was the exact same TV (i.e. not a flat screen). The bed was comfortable. The room was large with a couch. The bathroom is fine. Normal sized tub. Big long counter in the dressing room area. The room seemed clean, but dated. Perhaps this tower is last in the line of renovations. The casino seemed dated to me now. It is smoky and dark. The tables were usually pretty open. Really everything in the whole place seemed pretty dated. Whatever show is supposed to go around on the ceiling still didn't work. Every once in awhile a cocktail waitress would climb up on top of a slot machine and do a little choreographed dance or sing a chorus of a song. The All American Bar and Grill was pretty good. Most of the service was attentive. The food was good. Our waiter, the first night, seemed like he was annoyed to be there. He was short with us. We were short on his tip. The Casino Buffet was also pretty good. The food was probably slightly above average buffet food. There was a long line for ice cream. The crab legs were very small. The frozen yogurt/daiquiri place near check in was pretty good. I enjoyed a little fro-yo a couple times actually. The shopping in the Rio is non-existant still. Probably worse than in 2005. Tacky tacky to the max. The pool opens at 9am. I thought this was a little late. There is a nice pool for kids. It has sand like a beach and a zero entry. It is ENTIRELY ruined by the huge speakers they put directly by that pool blaring (and I mean BLARING) pop music. First of all, the music is a bit much for the 9am crowd. Second of all, there is NO WAY I would bring my young children there. I wanted to scoop up every single kid I saw and rush them away to save their hearing. I have young kids now and this would be a deal breaker for me. I mean come on!!! The concert style speakers by the area that the kids play????? Besides the obvious danger to their ears, do you think I might want to talk to my kids in the water??? Other than that the pool area was clean. The concrete is ridiculously hot. Bring sandals. The drinks are delivered promptly. Towels were readily available. Chairs were readily available. Went and saw Penn and Teller. Still a fan. They have gotten a little political in their old age. Sat in the very back of the Mezzanine level. Do not recommend. Too far away to see detail and missed the point of some of the act due to not being able to see clearly. Ask to sit closer on any level. The shuttle bus runs to Harrahs every half hour. It was clean and nice and free. It did stop by some sort of timeshare place to pick people up one time. The Rio is not on the strip so if you want to go anywhere it is going to be a cab or the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Gianr rooms- a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Palmsandbeaches
Reviews.Content: This hotel has huge rooms, including a fridge and dressing room, but no coffee-maker, stangely.The Rio is a little off the strip, but a shuttle runs every half hour. With 2,500 rooms, 15 or so restaurants, four pools (including an adult one), and a half a dozen bars, including a roof top one fifty floors up on an outdoor terrace, the Rio has everything you need for a good time. The price for a four-day package was certainly modest and staff was helpful and attentive. I was miffed that some of our coupons, advertised as part of the package, were not honoured by tour operators, but not enough for it to ruin the experience. We would likely try somewhere else on our next visit to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it”
Reviews.Author: GammaGammaHey
Reviews.Content: I go to Vegas often and try to stay at (and review) a different hotel each time I go. So far I've stayed at the Excalibur (ick!), Monte Carlo, Luxor (tower rooms ONLY), Flamingo (GO rooms are AWESOME!!), and now the Rio. Part of my stay was comped (3 out of the 4 nights we stayed) but that doesn't sway my opinion of the place. Yes, the rooms are BIG. Beds are oh so comfortable. The pillows are lacking but I've had worse. You get 2 fridges in the room (one's a mini-bar but the other is empty for your own stuff). We liked the bathroom. Spacious for 2 people to get ready at one time. The shower/tub combo is average. Tub isn't large enough for the average adult to bathe in (typical). The shower had great water pressure and there was ample space to put your shower necessities which was nice - no fumbling. View was of partial-strip - what I expected. Rooms could use an update. The bench at the end of the bed was a bit crusty - they really need to get rid of these. Having the extra seating in the room (sofa, chair, desk with 2 upright chairs were nice and allowed us to hang in the room at times without feeling cramped). This hotel is not on the strip. No airport/hotel shuttle, which they SHOULD have since they are not a Strip hotel. Cab fare was reasonable from the airport - $25 to get there and around $18 back (I believe there was traffic on the way there). We did use the free hotel shuttle to their strip properties (Ballys and Harrahs) and took a cab back to the hotel (this was because we didn't want to wait in the heat of August for them). The cab back to the hotel ran about $10-$15 (depending where we left from). The casino is okay. We didn't "win" but we did play a LONG time on what we did put in. We didn't fare any better at any of the strip casinos either. Cocktail service at the Rio was AWESOME. We never had any problems or a long wait any of the 4 nights we were there. Yes, the entertainment (show in the sky, the servers who dance/sing) is WAY lame. Felt we were at the America's Got (some) Talent Casino. They really need to stop with the singing and dancing. No one stops and watches it except for the pervy men who gawk at the dancers and then don't tip them when they're finished. I just don't see the point of this. I do have A LOT to say about the food during our stay, but those are separate reviews. Overall, I like the Rio. I will stay again but only if they give me a good deal (future comp?). I'd rather stay on the strip and have the convenience of other restaurants and the option to run to Walgreens for cheap soda and snacks (Rio wanted $3.95!! for a single soda in their store). And, I would be sure to bring my own pillow and pay for an upgraded room with a Jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for; bring your own conditioner and K-cups!”
Reviews.Author: Digoryk
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas many many many times. I've already lost track how many times my 22 month old daughter has been in her short life! We have stayed in lots of different hotels, rated between 3 stars and 5 stars, including Venetian, Palazzo, Planet Hollywood, Paris, Ballys, Harrahs, Caesar's Palace, South Point, Stratosphere, Orleans (I think I missed a few more). This is our second stay at Rio; last time was about 4 years ago. We chose this hotel purely for price; we needed 2 rooms for 2 nights as my mom came along to help with my daughter. The Good: -The price; we got a fabulous deal on the 2 rooms because we have Total Rewards cards (players card---useful for getting comps!) -Based on other reviews we read, we requested rooms in the Ipanema Tower near each other. The rooms were very spacious, clean, and had modern decor. They had to give us rooms that were designed for disabled guests. When I asked what that meant, the lady at check in just said that we would have grab bars in the bathroom. For the most part, that did seem to be the main difference. Also, in the closet, the bar that hangs clothing was low and my mom's room only had a walk in shower with a place to sit inside the shower. Our room had a tub with a fold down bench. Since I'm an Occupational Therapist, I took a quick glance at the equipment and grab bar placement in our room (didn't check out my mom's closely); the equipment seemed nice, and there were more than enough grab bars around the tub area and the toilet. I probably would have moved 1 of the grab bars to be more forward to help with getting up from the toilet, but since there were so many, I think it would do the job. I didn't have a tape measure, but the toilet seemed to be raised, which was good. -We had a great view of the Strip and the pool area! -The elevators always came quickly. We had a 7th floor room in a 20 story tower; we only had a problem getting down on the morning we left because lots of people were probably trying to use the elevators to leave at the same time. The not so good: -We arrive at 11 PM on Thursday night, which is typically not a busy night for Vegas hotels. When we pulled into the valet, there was only 1 bellman working! We had to wait about 10 minutes for the poor overworked man to bring the cart over to get our stuff out of the car. -Although the line was relatively short and there were 4 people working at the front desk, we waiting at least 20 minutes to get to the front of the line and it took at least 10 minutes to get through the check in process. It felt very inefficient. The lady who checked us in was nice and accommodated our requests. -There was a Keurig coffee maker in our room, but no K-cups (the pods containing the grounds that you need to actually make coffee); you could buy 3 K-cups for $8 in the minibar! Had we known about the Keurig, we could have brought our own K-cups from home! Just and FYI, I think every Vegas hotel we've visited has had NO coffee maker in the room; I always figured it was their way of cutting down on cost and encouraging coffee sales in the lobby. -There was no hair conditioner in the room; the shampoo is marked as "conditioning". I have long hair and wasn't happy about this. -Although the decor was nice, the maintenance seemed lacking. There was a big stain on the curtain, the sofa was sagging in the middle, and the hallway outside our room had a strange excessively perfumey smell. Additional comments: -We opted to self-park and move our stuff ourselves when we checked out because we did not want to have to wait for a bellman to assist us; we parked in the Masquerade garage, which turned out to be clear across the casino from the Ipanema Tower. Not a huge deal, but I thought I would mention it. We saw signs in the hotel for another parking garage, the "Carnival", but when we were driving, we could not find it (we could have asked, but did not bother) -My husband thoroughly enjoyed playing in the 9pm Texas Hold Em tournament (he cashed!) and had fun playing a cash game afterwards. I also did well with the slots (I actually don't expect to come home with money, so a good gambling weekend is one in which I come home with most of my bankroll :) ) -The Show in the Sky was just OK; but, hey, it was free and you get what you pay for. -We went to visit the Outlet over by the Silverton Casino, opened fairly recently; just an FYI, a bunch of the stores, like GAP, Ann Taylor LOFT, and Coach are only accessible from the outside, meaning, you have to walk out into the triple digit heat to get to them. The outlets at Primm are all accessible from the inside, making for a better shopping experience in my opinion. Summary: -We would only stay at the Rio again if we could not find a room on the Strip for a good price. There was nothing exceptionally bad about staying here, I just prefer being on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good, Some Not So Much”
Reviews.Author: bluewater1357
Reviews.Content: Beginning with the positive, 100% of the staff at the RIO was helpful, friendly, and professional. Normal check-in is 4PM. I checked with the front desk around 12:30PM; our room was not ready but they registered us anyway and told us to come back at 2 (via the VIP line) to pick up our key. Very nice. The room they checked us into, while prepared well by the maids, had some nasty stains on the carpet and the headboard, and the shower curtain was musty smelling. We complained and were cheerfully given another room more to our satisfaction. Very nice. We were in the older section of the hotel, and like me, it is showing its age; time for some carpet, paint, wallpaper, furniture. We did get a very good deal on the room though, so can’t complain too much. Not a great idea to go to the desert in August to get a sun tan; pretty brutal that southern Nevada sunshine. We did go out to the pool one time for a few hours. We prefer to relax in a quiet atmosphere while at the pool, but with the music screaming, it’s party time at the RIO’s pools; the younger guests had way more fun than us old folks did. The well-known “show in the sky” sure is different these days as well. They still use the carnival floats that hang from the ceiling, transporting bead tossing guests and performers, but that’s where any similarity to the real Rio Carnival ends, as the 9PM stage show was nothing more than a reenactment of a lap dance at a strip club, (not that there is anything wrong with that, it’s just that I really used to enjoy the carnival themed show, and there were young kids in the audience as well). In general, gambling anywhere near the strip aint what it used to be either. Anyone who knows what a full pay video poker machine is, or what the difference between 3/2 and 6/5 black jack is, wouldn’t be caught dead playing in these casinos; Benny Binion would roll over in his grave! And the cost of drinks if you just want to sit at a casino bar and chill for a while…. Outrageous! Having said all this, someone younger and hipper than I may have a markedly different opinion of things at the RIO (and the strip in general); it’s just that I’ve been around long enough to remember how it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but could have been better.”
Reviews.Author: KyleGT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Aug 14-20. Third trip to Vegas, but the first one to the Rio. (Other 2 times we stayed at The Flamingo) I had booked a standard nonsmoking king suite, but upon checking in, they told me they had none left and offered me a nonsmoking queen, or smoking king. I opted for the smoking king, hoping for the best. Funny thing is, a friend of mine who was traveling with us, was behind me in line at check in, and somehow was given a nonsmoking king even though "they had none left". Our room ended up being on the 13th floor (why a casino has a 13th floor baffles me) of the Ipanema tower. The second we got off the elevator, it reeked of cigarette smoke. I have stayed in smoking sections of hotels before, and they have never smelled this bad. Our room was pretty nice for a standard room, with the exception of the cigarette smell. Very nice size for a standard room, probably double the size you would normally see for a standard room. The bathroom/dressing area counter tops, desk, coffee table, and end tables were all granite, which was a nice touch. The carpet was pretty worn, with a seam right through the middle of the room that was fraying. I would have also liked to see more power outlets. There was only 1 outlet available by the desk to plug my phone charger in to. Had to plug the other one in in the bathroom/dressing area. The casino was pretty nice, but pretty dark compared to other casinos. Maybe it's supposed to add to the nightlife vibe of the place.There was a good variety of table games, as well as slots. Most table minimums were $10 or $15. The only way to play blackjack at $5 was on a video blackjack machine, which seats 5 players, like at a regular table and has a video tabletop and virtual dealer on a screen. This was fun, however went by crappy single deck, 6:5 BJ payout rules. There could have been a few more cocktail waitresses on the casino floor as well. Service was kind of slow, but that's to be expected when they are understaffed on waitresses, even when you tip them well. There was a free shuttle that took you up to the strip (either Harrah's or Bally's) and back that ran every half hour, but sometimes left early so we ended up waiting over a half hour a couple times for it if we got to the pickup spot 5 or 10 minutes before the hour. Service stops at 1am, so be prepared to pay for a cab for a ride back from the strip if you plan on partying late elsewhere. And trust me, you will want to take a cab. The walk is a lot longer than you think it is. Ask me how I know. haha The show in the sky was pretty cool, and fairly raunchy. If you bring your kids, you probably don't want to bring them to this, unless you want them to see scantily clad dancers grinding on each other. (I never understood why people bring their kids to Vegas in the first place) After the show, the bartenders at one of the bars right by the show (can't remember the name of it - the circle one near all the shops in the masquerade village) put on a flair show which is pretty cool. You may want to bring your own snacks and bottled water, as everything in the souvenir/convenience store in the hotel is very expensive, as expected. $2.50 for a candy bar and $7 for a 8 pack of 12oz bottles of water? You can get a better deal on water from the people selling bottled water out of coolers on the strip for $1 a bottle (full size bottles too)

Reviews.Title: “Not exactly family friendly”
Reviews.Author: Nat B
Reviews.Content: This isn't the first time i've been to Vegas with my family. But we've always stayed on the strip or in a quieter part of town and the Rio was, well neither. Firstly as a 20 some year old, the hotel atmosphere didn't bother me so much as my parents. Our room which overlooked the pool was extremely loud, as the pool DJ was on pretty much all day. The casino was smokey, more so than others i've been too, and the hotel had dance girls, yes dance girls paid to dance on or near the slots. It was awkward to have stayed there with family. On top of which food, internet, and fitness facilities cost a small fortune. The internet wasn't even very good either, well not nearly as high speed or reliable as it should have been at just under 15 dollars a day. On top of which the free shuttle to the strip only came once every 30 minutes and by that time of the small crowd that was waiting only about half could be ride. What I can say about the rio that is positive, is that it is very spacious. The rooms were nice, good bathroom, clean. From my hotel experience the rio was simply over stretched, overcrowded and while it served it's purpose, I doubt we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Some Good.... Some Bad.....”
Reviews.Author: DayDreaMer875
Reviews.Content: Well...well...well. After reading some of the reviews I was pretty fearful of staying here, but why not if I'm only paying $78.40 for my entire stay of 5 nights, 6 days. Thanks to the Total Rewards card I was able to get such a great deal. I was traveling along with my boyfriend, a birthday present for him, and my cousin w/ her husband, an anniversary trip for them.
