Transportation/Check-In: Each couple arrived at separate times as we were departing from different states. My boyfriend and I got there first and took the shuttle from the airport to the Rio. If that's something that you will do, as opposed to a taxi, it's fairly easy to pay for a ticket either one-way/roundtrip at any of the windows exiting the airport. Total price was $24 roundtrip for the both of us. there was no rush for us, especially since it was my boyfriend's first time in Vegas. I loved the look on his face as we rode past the hotels. When we arrived, you could tell that the hotel from the outside was pretty dated and the windows needed cleaning, but I'm not too picky w/ things like that. Due to where the shuttle drops you off, the entrance into the hotel is by the Carnival Buffet. Once you get over by the casino area you can smell the smoke here and there. Still not an issue. Check-in was fairly easy and a breeze. Although they don't openly tell you (I was informed by a Total Rewards rep), if you are paying w/ a credit card for your room, they hold $100 per day for incidentals and charges, BUT if you don't plan on breaking anything or charging anything to the room then I'd say give them $200 cash as a deposit. This amount is paid on top of what your room costs, but you get the $200 back upon Check-out. Room: We were located in the Ipanema Tower on the 12th floor. Upon entering the room you could tell that the room had been thoroughly cleaned b/c it smelled of clean...if I'm not sounding too crazy. Lol. It was the typical setup for a "suite" room. There was a refrigerator along w/ a small counter space and mirror right by the door. Walking in further there was a sofa w/ a table in front and a standing lamp on the side. There were 2 Queen size beds (as they didn't have the 1 King we requested, but that just gave my boyfriend and I more "playing" room...LOL). A desk w/ a chair and an armoire w/ a TV that needs to be updated, but who cares...Who goes to Vegas to lay in bed and look at TV? The vanity area and bathroom were nice and clean. The one thing that annoyed me was a spot that was in the carpet from what was probably spilled and not cleaned up promptly, but whatever. The beds were SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO comfy! My boyfriend & I slept very well. Strip: Getting to and from the strip was a breeze. If you don't plan on driving, the Rio does have shuttles that run as early as 10am to as late as 1am. There are 2 shuttles. One runs to Bally's and the other runs to Harrah's. Regardless of which shuttle you decide to take, my suggestion is to get to the shuttle ahead of the time you want to get on, at least 10mins before...it gets pretty crowded quickly. Dining: As for the dining...I'd definitely recommend to get the 24hr buffet pass ("Buffet of Buffets"). With this pass you get to go to any of the buffets affiliated w/ the Total Rewards program. Carnival Buffet was good and had a little of everything. The Seafood Buffet was ok...nothing much to rave about, BUT the gelato bar was yummmmmmy!!! I must say my boyfriend & I got multiple cups of different flavors, simply to taste them. LOL... I had read previous reports about a smell coming through the vents of smoked bbq. I figured our visit had been a complete breeze outside of the stain, but on our last night the smell came full fledge through the vents. It wasn't too bothersome if you weren't by the vent, but when and if you were it got pretty nauseating at times. Anything for a free show, located right in the middle of the casino, I was also upset that the Show In The Sky wasn't going to be running while I was there. BUT...I was entertained and did join in w/ the Bevertainers. :) Overall...I didn't have too many complaints about the Rio. It's not a 5 star and if that's what you are looking for, then I say look elsewhere. The Rio is great for resting your head after such a busy and exciting day in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: Michele R
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just spent a long weekend in Vegas. We decided to go to the Rio, Where should I begin... The Rio is nothing like it was 10 yrs ago, they were understaffed, rude, and if you are going to Vegas to be with the beautiful people, look elsewhere. We were so disappointed! The rooms need to be updated & the staff needs a lesson in customer service. They charge for everything, they can't even throw their hotel guests a bone and let them into the nightclub there or free Wii-fi. So, save your money and pay the extra for Ceaser's or the venetian!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed But NOT at the Star Trek Covention!”
Reviews.Author: LifeLongTrekkie
Reviews.Content: We booked way in advance Jin Jan. 2011 and requested a king bed standard suite HA! Suite? Yeah right! And they had to switch us to two queens. The sheets were yellow and looked like they haven't been changed in weeks! We had to ask for more towels and more toilet paper and ash trays; this after I gave the maid a $20 tip! The carpet was old & stained as was the couch. There was something like a child's sticker on the carpet from the time we arrived until we left - 7 nights. Clearly very poor vacuuming. I guess that's why it was a suite; they throw in a crappy couch! We requested a renovated room and they gave us a room that they said was ad upgred which they charged us another $13.00 a day for because we could see the pool and were on the 13th floor? The TV was not a flat screen which they said every SUITE has? Lousy picture on it to boot. We kept on getting messages from the salon on our phone. The first morning we ordered breakfast for two; they messed up that order and it was $62.00!!! On the plus side, the room was spacious. BIG DEAL - not exactly what we would consider a suite! The seafood buffet was horrible! For $40 each we got pieces of lobster that were saturated with MSG! Stay Clear! The regular buffet was ok but the beef was still moving! We wanted to go to the pool Sunday night about 5pm but they closed the pools because they booked it out for a private party? What about the guests??? We never got to the pool! We booked the Rio because of the Star Trek Convention, BUT I had to rent a scooter because the convention center was almost a mile away! Yes it was indoors but still a hike! If you stay here for a convention I hope you like to WALK! The gambling tables were ok, $5 during the day, up to $15 - $25 at night and weekends, but I couldn't hit water if I fell out of a boat at the Rio! The slots were very tight NOT MANY PAYOFFS! The dealers were friendly as they took my money! I hope Creation Entertainment reads this review and cancels next year's Convention at the Rio because I won't attend.

Reviews.Title: “Nice all suite hotel. Only issue is proximity to main strip...”
Reviews.Author: ZenFinder
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Rio suite hotel. The suites have a great design and are spacious and the amenities are excellent as well. I had an issue with the hotel's proximity to the main strip though. I don't enjoy having to drive or take a taxi every time I leave my hotel in Vegas so this was an issue with me. Don't get me wrong, it’s not too far away- just a simple drive. I also wasn't too keen on the entertainment, but the bar was great (flair bartenders!), and overall atmosphere was fun and colorful, as a hotel named Rio should be.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable rooms but will not return.”
Reviews.Author: Cincin
Reviews.Content: We arrived after we picked up our rental car around 9pm. We waited in line at the Rio for about 20 minutes. They were fairly slow at check in. The casino was fairly quiet when we got there and we went to our room on the 17th floor in the Ipanema tower. We had a nice comfortable room with a strip view. It was nice. I cannot complain about the room at all. If I was to stay there for the size of the room, I would definitely stay there again if I got a good deal. But the casino on the other hand, it wasn't busy at all and the slots didn't pay out so it seemed with the little people there. We didn't even attempt the tables because the minimum for blackjack was $25 per hand so we didn't gamble there. We did eat at the carnival buffet once. It was fairly decent. Nothing negative to say about it. All in all it was ok but I wouldn't want to go back merely for the casino reason.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless you are attending a convention here.”
Reviews.Author: Albaniaorbust
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because it we attended a convention here. It was convenient for that but otherwise i wouldn't recommend it. There are plenty of better hotels right on the strip to choose from. The check-in line was long. Once we made it through the line at least the clerk at the desk was pleasant and did her best to keep us near other people we were traveling with. She encouraged us to upgrade our room for an extra $10 a night and when we got to our room we saw that we had a nice view of the strip and we could see planes taking off from the airport. We were happy until we looked at the floor and found pad Thai noodles on the floor and other crumbs around one of the beds. There were also upholstered benches at the foot of the beds which had crumbs and stains on them. I've never encountered this in any hotel I've stayed at. I called the front desk to complain and they promptly sent housekeeping to vacuum. Still, it made me wonder how clean the room really was (especially the bathroom even though it appeared clean) if they didn't bother vacuuming very well. One night some of the elevators stopped working so it took what seemed like 10 minutes to catch an elevator down to the casino.

Reviews.Title: “Worse Than I Expected”
Reviews.Author: konarm
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Rio Aug 12-15 for the Star Trek Convention. The hotel was dark and lacked the electricity of the strip hotels. The dealers were not unfriendly but they certainly did'nt make it fun. We usually stay on the strip at either The Wynn or Bellagio but wanted to be at the host hotel. The room I booked was supposed to have a King Bed. It had two queens. The sink leaked to the point where we had standing water. The TV is NOT a flat screen and had a green picture (which they fixed). The room was spacious and clean. All the hotels on the strip have a resort fee (usually $20/day) which covers internet and health club. At The Rio I paid $13.99/day for internet and $22/day for health club. We did see The Rat Pack and The Platters in The Crowne Theater. Both shows were entertaining and we thoroughly enjoyed them. It rained all day on Saturday therefore we were unable to enjoy the pool. It cleared up on Sunday but they closed the pool at 3 p.m. for a private concert. We ate the buffet for breakfast and enjoyed it although it is $3 more than any breakfast buffet on the strip. The burger bar was good but they lost our order and it took 30 minutes to get our food. The Rio was not lucky for us.The slots were tight and the table minimums were all $10. We lost over $3500 between slots, roulette and craps. The convention center was nice although the restrooms were spaced rather far apart. If the Star Trek Convention is held here in 2012 we will stay on the strip and commute. Something strange going on with the taxi service in Vegas however. We were driven to the wrong location on two separate occasions. Maybe it's a new scam they are running to jack up the fares.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall”
Reviews.Author: LucyLaramie
Reviews.Content: Everybody already knows you have to like Vegas to...well, like Vegas. We are not those people (we were there for an event) but having booked online without seeing the hotel, we were pleased with the room and the service. The room had seen better days (there was a slight wearing in the carpet, the beds were a tad saggy), but the spaciousness, cleanliness and nice view made up for it. The casino seemed to go on forever and the buffet was nice. I have to say, the bartenders were awesome (they did virtual circus acts with bottles and shakers), and the Penn & Teller show within the hotel is terrific. Since we're not veteran Vegas-ers we have nothing to compare this with, but I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice sized rooms but property seemed tired.”
Reviews.Author: JSBarrone
Reviews.Content: Room size was what had always attracted me to this hotel when it first opened and it's still the biggest draw. Very comfortable for a family of 3. But you can hear noise from the room next door. Thankfully, our neighbors were only loud during the day but we wouldn't have been able to sleep in. Really minimal shade by the pool and only 4 cabanas available in the non-adult area for rent. At 105 degrees, we didn't stay out too long by the pool with high winds and no shade. Food quality and variety are good at the World Buffet albeit pricey. $15.99 per person for breakfast is what I expect to pay at a higher end property. We'd hoped to do the Fantasy in the Sky bead throwing only to find out that's only available on the weekends and not mid-week. Casino area is a bit dark and seems very tired. I remember in the past when visiting that the gaming area felt larger and had a better vibe. It just felt old and I definitely saw empty space that had probably had slot machines in the past. Wasn't much fun playing in the casino. Note that if you want a smoking room, the 13th floor of the Ipanema tower (not sure about the Masquerade tower) is where you'll be. Yes. This hotel has a 13th floor. And I heard some people in the elevator complain about their luck playing and staying on that floor. Location of the property isn't a big issue with a shuttle that will take you to Harrahs on the strip. And before I forget, the individual thermostats in the rooms didn't seem to work as my room temp went up 4 degrees one morning while I was downstairs and the rest of the family was stll sleeping. It doesn't sound like a lot till you realize the low was 88 degrees outside! Overall, it was an ok place to stay but I wanted to take my gaming, etc. elsewhere. Good value if you care more about room size and not so much on the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have hated it more!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah W
Reviews.Content: Normally I do not write on these walls but after coming back from this hotel I feel compelled. We arrived on a Sunday nite and got a rooftop view but paid for a strip view room. The next day after waiting in a long line I was transferred to a 5th floor nonsmoking strip view. We complained and did get a $30 credit. But the room we transferred to smelled like an ashtray. We slept in it that nite which was a huge mistake, my sinuses were screaming the next morning. So I called to have the room cleaned. Got back in the afternoon still BAD smoke smell, called again. Housekeeping put a machine in the room for a couple of hours but it still reeked of smoke. Mind you, this was a non smoking room. We stayed in the Masgarade tower. What a dump!! If you like 70's decor this is the hotel for you. The carpet was old and gross, the curtains were old fashioned brown pattern that left huge gaps to let the sun in. The shower had window in it, so that when you turned the bathroom light on in the middle of the nite it shined straight onto the bed. Or you could watch someone taking a shower from the living area. Very creepy. The furniture was complete crap. I never sat at the table or on the couch because it was just disgusting. The light fixtures in the bathroom were the old fashioned rows of big blaring bulbs. That tower is completely run down. The owners of this hotel should be ashamed of themselves. Our friends stayed in the ipanema tower which has been redone in the last few years I would say. Much nicer. Why this hotel would only choose to update 1 of their towers is beyond me. THE biggest dump I ever stayed in. Not worth any amount of money!! Stay at a dump on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Deeply Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: liz_croft
Reviews.Content: Staying here for a Convention, so would expect the price to be high even with a "discount". What I was not expecting was a $13.75 per day charge for internet connection when other MUCH more modestly priced hotels charge nothing. The pool is open until 7 pm - except when the staff choose to close it at 6.30 because it is "quiet". The Rio prides itself on its lack of resort charges. Frankly I would rather pay an upfront charge of $15 or so and have free internet and an open pool and lower room charges. Compare the Excalibur at $39 plus resort fee versus $139/$189 without. Go figure. And the suites are just large rooms - no dividers, no kitchen facilities such as enjoyed at many Holmewood Suites for the same price. And the windows are filthy. The World Buffet, however, IS good value and excellent food.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is one our Fav's!”
Reviews.Author: grizzer_jake
Reviews.Content: Often when we go to Las Vegas, which is usually twice a year, we try and stay at the Rio. We find the rooms very lux, the casino plush and exciting, and the views are really outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit tired, but still a good offstrip value.”
Reviews.Author: Omillett
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this property on and off for about 10 years, and have always thought it was one of the better-kept secrets of Vegas. However, I noted on this last stay that the property is getting a bit dated. On our floor, we saw that the common area carpets were stale & stained, several broken light fixtures, and in our suite, there was a large hole in the wall where it appears that someone had put a fist through. The staff were as usual, very accomodating and professional. Long story short - this is no longer a reasonably priced 4-5 star property. This is now a reasonably priced 3-4 star property, with good amenities, and well-suited to someone who wants to be off-strip and either has their own transport or will use taxis to get around.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: cottontailninja
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio for a quick get-away weekend with a friend. I have not been to Vegas before but my friend has stayed in numerous hotels both on and off the strip. For the price, the hotel was great. The room was spacious and had an extra fridge so we could buy things for breakfast and snacks. The pool area contains four pools, one of which is a topless pool. Although my politics abhors the fact that they charge men $20 to go into this area, it is the nicest of the pools and there was usually noone using this area and you certainly don't have to take your top off. The Crown nightclub was good although don't be fooled by the 'ladies free admission' before 1030pm. They basically get you in line and then hold everyone out until well after 1030pm. I also didn't like that they kept so many people in line when there was clearly tons of room to fill the club. Make sure to check out Voodoo club on the roof and the wine cellar bar in the basement (we didn't discover this until we were leaving). I would definitely recommend renting a car (we paid $100 for four days which is almost what just the airport shuttle might have cost for the two of us). Parking is free at all Vegas casinos and the aircon is awesome in the august heat. We were both very happy with the hotel, the service and the amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cindy B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rio in Las Vegas for a conference. The hotel is Nasty Dirty! The entire place smells like an ashtray and stale booze. First day I was there, I was caught in a black out in the Tower I was staying in. No emergancy lights came on anywhere. I ended up walking down 31 flights of stairs in pitch black with only my cell phone flashlight to see my feet. Had there been a fire there would have been mass pandimonium and many potentially trampled and killed. Hotel management was barely apologetic and semed not to care. Outdated rooms and fixtures. Sheets were scratchy~ YUK!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel/casino has it all in one place!!”
Reviews.Author: CMA67
Reviews.Content: my husband and I stayed here at the Rio for the Def-Con convention that my husband attended. We got to stay in a king-size bed suite and just loved it. There was an error on how long we were staying there when we checked in, but the gal that was checking us in took care of it with no problems at all!! The staff was very accomodating and nice. I was pleasantly surprised when I was gambling at the penny slots to find out that I could get a cocktail for free while gambling, which I did on quite a few occasions and did some good tipping as I went on. The whole hotel/casino has something for everyone, so there is no need to go anywhere else!! I used the spa one day for a pedicure and they were very nice there, I called in the morning, and I had an appointment 2hrs from the time I called which made me very happy!! The restaurants there are very yummy!! We will certainly tell all of our family and friends to stay here at this hotel and we look forward to coming back here again in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Always Comes Through!”
Reviews.Author: cbeeztrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for a friend's 40th birthday weekend. I love that the Rio treats their players so special, offering comp rooms when you play enough on the machines. The rooms are spacious and enough room for 4 girls to get a little crazy. There aren't any additional resort fees added to your bill and everything is very conveniently located in the casino. The buffet is spectacular, probably the best in Vegas. We always stay at the Rio, as they treat us right. You are close to the strip, but far enough off to not get jammed up in traffic. The Rio will always be my top choice and I can't wait to go back. The weekend was super fun, and a great place to turn 40!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Good Staff OK Location”
Reviews.Author: tammynnc
Reviews.Content: I went to Defcon which was thankfully moved over to Rio. Years past it had been held at the Riviera. Bleh... Defcon was a blast as usual, the worlds best cyber criminals rubbing elbows with the worlds top security experts and folks from all the 3 letter agencies all sitting down to break bread together, what a strange and weird world. So, the hotel... nice, not great, but very nice. I had a very large suite with a nice view and the suite itself was VERY large. It is always very difficult to judge Vegas hotels as the normal rules don't apply here. I don't expect 5 star service, I just expect a clean room and pleasant staff which was certainly the norm here. The location is not on the strip but they do have a shuttle which works fine. I don't do Vegas buffets as I think they are overpriced for very mediocre food quality but heard other people say the buffet was pretty good. The pool was pretty and had a nice sand entryway, was pretty cool actually. Overall, the hotel was perfectly fine and if you get a good deal or want a larger suite than you might get at some of the strip hotels this place may be a good fit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice room and view”
Reviews.Author: Norm_Nice_Guy
Reviews.Content: The room was very spacious and had a good view of the Las Vegas Strip Skyline. The bed was comfortable and the room was very clean. Temperature control was excellent and the room was very quiet. The only downside was that although they provided coffee making in the in-room bar, there was no in-room coffee pot.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Fun Casino”
Reviews.Author: big80sfun
Reviews.Content: Another trip to the Rio and loved it. The room was clean, everything worked well (although they could stand to upgrade the TV's), and the bed was amazingly comfy! Stayed in the Impamena Tower on the 15th floor. The casino had many new slot machines and table game minimums were relatively low. Ate at Carnival World Buffet, All-American Bar and Grill and Starbucks--all excellent. The spa was relaxing as always! Rio is always an excellent choice if you like being off the craziness of the Strip, but close enough to go there (free shuttles every 30 minutes).

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: recman12
Reviews.Content: Staff were good. Managers were very poor except for one, she was very helpful. The rest just did not care, would not return my phone calls, just kept on saying sorry but did nothing to help with the problem. Will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit!!!”
Reviews.Author: Granny322
Reviews.Content: At the Rio for a week for an event and for pleasure. Service was great and the accommodations were good. Will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice change from the strip”
Reviews.Author: Nelly17332
Reviews.Content: The Rio is an all Suite hotel. Having stayed there many times they have gone out of their way to make sure that our stay was the very best it could be. Even on the one occasion where there was a mix up with our room they made it right without any arguing or fuss. Put us in an upgraded suite at no extra cost. The only draw back is the main pool area isn't anything special but we often stay there when we go on the off pool season. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. They have recently been renovated with new beds etc so it is very comfortable. Over all an excellent value for the money. It is a ways off the strip so a car is required but we would highly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Really impressed with the hotel staff and the resort”
Reviews.Author: Aubrav
Reviews.Content: My husband, my Mom and I stayed in this hotel for one night specifically to visit Voodoo Lounge, the pool and the Carnival World Buffet all in one sweep. We arrived to check in around 3pm, the check-in line was long but moved quickly. When we got to the receptionist, she was extremely friendly and when I requested a renovated room as advised by the TA members, she gave us a renovated room with a view without really being asked (other than on the request line when I made the reservation which no hotel has ever acknowledged). We were in the Impanema Tower room 1321 and the view was amazing. You could look down into the pool area and you could see the entire strip from Stratosphere to Excalibur. The room was very spacious with warm tones, a gorgeous wall of windows, a fold out sofa, a vanity area outside the bathroom, a refrigerator and a coffee maker. We headed up to VooDoo Lounge around 6:30pm and we were very impressed with the restaurant there. We were just going for drinks and the view and the bartender was so much fun and made a show out of creating the Witchdoctors that we ordered. All in all this hotel was very great, we really have no complaints at all about the service, amenities or atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Tom Tom Drums”
Reviews.Author: Forgottensage
Reviews.Content: The Negs: No in-room coffee: there is a coffee maker but when you look at the big shiny tag it says that you can find the "premimium" coffee packets in the refrigerator & that they come in 3 packs for $8.00 Clogged bathtub Free Tom Tom drums: The sinks drain so slowly that it sounds like someone knocking loudly on your door. After awhile they take on a tom tom drum sound; eventually the second sink will take up a response sound off. (My younger brother was sleeping and so playing the sink drums isn't exactly considerate but I didn't know this would happen). Useless add-on: why do people have to smoke in the hallways? Isn't the casino below good enough? The Poz: Off the main strip Accessible by a very pleasant and empty tunnel bridge that goes over the freeway . . . an easy comfortable walk Fantastic buffet Triple pool area with pumping music and snack shacks Huge room with giant coffee table and large desk - once I put away the ugly magazines and spread out my books, laptop, etc. I felt like I was at home & my brother and I loved all of the space - we definitely weren't in each other's way at all. We were in the older tower but minus the bad sinks and tub, we were very happy and would return again.

Reviews.Title: “A room upgrade surprise!”
Reviews.Author: beach_bum6d9
Reviews.Content: We (my boyfriend and I) arrived in Las Vegas at night, around 8pm and got to our hotel at 9ish, to our surprise they said that our room was not ready. The front desk lady was super apologetic and I decided that this was not going to ruin my vacation, so I made the best of the situation and went over to the gold cost to play some table games. When we came back, around an hour later the front desk lady upgraded us to the top suite with the Jacuzzi tub in the bedroom 2 bathrooms and living room. The room was beautiful with a breathtaking view of the Las Vegas strip and just a great surprise. When we checkout the room and had our luggage arrived 5 mins later. So over all, the inconvenience paid off. The pool was always busy, not a lot of shade, but a great layout with lots of room. We had no problem with the checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms But Well Worn”
Reviews.Author: JaguarVideo
Reviews.Content: When we were there in January, much of the casino was under construction. Maybe a much needed renovation. The place was somewhat old and dirty. We ate at the special seafood buffet. It was OK. The room however was very large and clean with a great view of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great pools, large rooms and good restaurants”
Reviews.Author: Ktgirl
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights the last week in July. We had booked a lower floor room for a total of $127 for the four nights. When we arrived we were offered a $20. a night upgrade for a high floor, renovated room with a pool and strip view. We had arrived at 8 am and waited about 2 hours for our room to be ready. No problem, we just checked our bags with the bellhop and checked out the casino. Our room was on the 14th floor in the Ipenama Tower with a great view however I don't think it had been renovated. There were some stains on the sofa and chair. Older style tv in a cabinet. But the beds were comfortable and the room was very clean. The suites were large with a separate dressing room area. So we had two vanities, mirrors, sinks etc. Great for two ladies getting ready to go out. There was also a safe and fridge in the room. No noise from the halls etc. BUT you could hear the music from the pool which was open 10 am - 7pm. So if you like to take an afternoon nap that could be a problem. There were four pools including one adult pool. (females could be topless) There was a $20 charge for men to enter. They were very careful about checking ID. My friend and I are both in our 50's lol so it was quite amusing. We were old enough to be the employee's mother. The pool area is beautiful the only problem we had was the music was so loud. I like to read and relax at the pool. They did check room keys and bags at the entrance. We did take in bottled water no problem and the check was really just a quick peek. The prices at the bar and grill looked reasonable but we did not eat there. We ate at the Seafood Buffet which was $40 but if you like seafood it is a great value. We also ate at the All American Bar and Grill, we had appetizers and drinks. The portions are quite large and again the food was great. I had signed up for the text notices 227466 and the hotel would send a text each day for a discount or 2 for 1 deal etc. The last am. we ate at the Carnival Buffet. The text gave us the buffet breakfast for $5.99 instead of $15.99. I received other offers but we did not use them. There is a Starbucks, a cafe and McFaddens and maybe other places that I have forgot. We used the free shuttle to the strip several times. It is quick and easy and runs every half hour to either Harrahs or Ballys. It saves you a lot of money on taxis. We also viisted the Gold Coast next door and the Palms is right across the street. We went up to the Voodoo Lounge one night at sunset. What a beautiful view, we did not eat at the restaurant just bought a drink and went out on the patio. There is music and dancing later on but we left before that. The staff we met were all very friendly. Christine at the concierge desk printed our boarding passes for us and was very pleasant and helpful. No charge for this. I would stay here again or perhaps divide my trip a few days here and a couple on the strip. The convenience of the shuttle makes it an easy trip over to eat, gamble or check out other hotels. I hope you find this helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and food”
Reviews.Author: cobwebsinthecloset
Reviews.Content: Rio, although off strip, is easily accessible by the free shuttle bus every half hour to either Ballys or Harrahs. We only stopped here for 1 night enroute to Hawaii, 1 night was not enough! Check in / out was very slow - this was the only minus for this hotel. We were upgraded, the rooms were absolutely unbelievable - the best I've ever seen (jacuzzi bath, huge bed, sofa, coffee maker, shower/sauna) Just amazing! Even the standard rooms were great - very spacious and excellent value. Very quiet on a night for such a lively hotel. The pool and area here is also fantastic - very large space with 3 different pools - all with different features (eg waterfall/ sandy area / kids pool etc) and 3 secluded hot bubble pools. Much better use of sunbeds here, with areas to get into the shade. A very chilled out area. We only ate at the buffet (breakfast and dinner) - this has to be one of the best in Vegas - the Carnival World buffet is unbelievable - massive selection and excellent quality - and breakfast was just as huge! The best selection we saw. A great hotel with lots to do and see (free show in the sky wasnt on when we visited but is supposed to be worth seeing thurs- sat). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: 325irollin
Reviews.Content: The only reason I stayed here instead of Bellagio was because of the WSOP. I got a discount on the room which was nice since the poker tournament buyin was $1,000. The service was good and the room was clean with a good view. The shower was garbage in my bathroom so I took a bath for the first time in 10 years! It was nice overall but I wouldn't stay there again. I took a taxi to Aria and Bellagio for all my gambling fun because the atmosphere is just better at those 2 casinos. The RIO poker room was worse in every way possible compared to Aria and Bellagio. I know I compare everything to those two but it's because they are the best in Vegas and I think if you want to have a great time, you might want to just spend a little more cash! After all, Vegas is all about spending your money on fun and excitement so get your money's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Off the Strip - A restful, fun location.”
Reviews.Author: glmarketingdude
Reviews.Content: The Rio is off the strip, yet with free shuttles still allows the guest the convenience of playing on the strip and then escaping from the madness to a great place to stay. Great food, drink and a super casino to game the night and day away. A great alternative to the more pricey and congested environment of the STRIP.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Rio”
Reviews.Author: Swearingen
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Rio from July 18 - 23. 2011, a Monday - Saturday. This was my second trip at Rio. Rio gets a bad rap as being a run-down, outdated dinosaur. My experiences have been nothing but positive. The basic room is spacious, with a king bed, sofa and coffee table, and a refrigerator in the room (which other hotels charge $20 and up for), The Masquerade Tower does have older CRT TV's; however, that just made it easier to hook up my portable DVD player, which is all I want out of a TV. The housekeeping staff and bell staff were 100% on point. I tned to not have the room made up, but have a small bag of trash left outside the room which was always whisked way without incident or disturbance. Rio has a huge variety of dining options, some of which are actually bargains for Vegas. Once you know the lay of the land, gambling at Rio is very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: ozute
Reviews.Content: The rio is not on the strip so you can't simply stroll to the other strip attractions. On the plus side, the suite we had was large, the air-con worked, and the bed was comfy. There was a large but dodgy CRT TV, and a glass window to look through from the bedroom to the shower cubicle. Speaking of the shower, the shower head was crap, it was like standing under a fire hose at full blast. There is no wifi at the rio, however this casino has the biggest buffet I've ever seen, and it is yummy. Overall, 3/5, because at $40 per night with no compulsory resort fee, it is good value.

Reviews.Title: “The best stay yet!!”
Reviews.Author: leann604
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Rio and were a little leary about staying off strip, but once we checked in we realized we made the right choice! Check in line was a little on the long side but move qiuckly. Only had to wait for about 10 minutes. We got up to our room and were glad we took the $10 upgrade to a higher floor. Great view! The room was huge and the bed was super comfy. Having a fridge and coffe maker made the stay even better! The RIO will be our new Vegas destination. Not being on the strip didn't bother us at all! We used the shuttle a few times and had little to no wait each time. Would highly recommend the Rio to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: DMKArkansas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a comped room for 1 night in June before moving to Planet Hollywood. I loved the spaciousness of the rooms and having a couch in the room. Our bathroom had 2 sinks -- one inside and one outside which was nice when getting ready to go out. I won a little money here on penny slots but nobody else in my party won. We had two rooms and both were clean and comfy. We ate at the buffet that doesn't have lobster. We did have to wait in line an hour to get in. We also ate breakfast the next morning. Both were okay but nothing special. My 14yo daughter and I tried out the pools. The waterslide pool closed early due to the high winds. It was extremely windy! The wind blew over a large baby stroller with the baby in it. Baby was okay and lucky it did not go in the pool. Although heated and in June, the water was cold in both pools that we tried. We had to hang on to everything tightly as if you let go of your towel it would blow away. The wind blew over several lounge chairs also. The pool areas were very nicely landscaped and were very enjoyable. On a future trip, I would rather stay at the Rio for the nice pool area and spacious room than on the strip in a reg. room.

Reviews.Title: “The RIO is great.”
Reviews.Author: Marmar523
Reviews.Content: I just love the RIO. Staff is very friendly and always willing to help you. I've been a solo traveler for two years now and have stayed at the RIO numerous times. I feel safe here. The RIO has great shows and the dining facilities are outstanding. I booked another trip to Vegas in August and will staying at the RIO again. Oh.... the pools are great!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms, good eats ect”
Reviews.Author: Terpsfan72
Reviews.Content: Loved the Rio, huge all suite rooms, I'd say over 600 sq feet. Great view from room as well and all at a great price. Stayed a couple nights before CES started, so price shot up during convention I'm sure, but to pay just a little more than $50 a night for such a great room as a steal. My only complaint was the smell while in casino, couldn't place my finger on it, but a strange oder non the less, but rooms and rest of hotel didn't stink so that was a plus. I'd for sure stay at the Rio again and you have to check out the buffet, one of the best in Vegas IMO.

Reviews.Title: “A Rockin' Time In Rio”
Reviews.Author: conchfritter
Reviews.Content: We (my husband, our 1.5 year old, our almost 3 year old and myself) stayed at the Rio for 7 Nights from the 4th of December 2010 - 11th December 2010. Aside from an unpleasant smell outside of the hotel when we arrived, we were extremely impressed with the Rio. Check-in was a breeze with only a few people in line at the time we arrived (guess it was worth taking forever to clear immigration - due to slow toddlers that wanted to walk and winding up behind an flight that arrived after us). The staff were helpful and offered a free upgrade to a suite on a higher floor. We were given a 2 bedded room in the Ipanema Tower which was the perfect location for a family with small children as it is centrally located within the hotel. The room was slightly outdated with older furniture and an older bathroom suite, but it offered enough storage space for all of our clothes and the 'accessories' that come with toddlers. Our view was of the mountains and The Palms off to one side (or "The Bunny Building" as our son called it every morning). With floor to ceiling windows, the view provided us a little oasis in the midst of all of the bells, whistles and over the top gaudiness that we love about Vegas. It was strange to be able to truly relax while we were in Vegas, but as we were there for a wedding, there were times we needed to rest and recuperate. Housekeeping was extremely friendly and efficient and we had no complaints. Sometimes you could hear people running or laughing loudly in the hallway, but that was mostly during the day and was rare. Come time to sleep you couldn't hear a thing. The dining options were plentiful, though we only ate at the two buffet restaurants or got breakfast bits from the gift shop by the Ipanema elevators. My parents, who were staying at Paris, were jealous that we also had a Starbucks kiosk within the hotel. We were nervous at first about taking children to Las Vegas, but all of the staff in the hotel were wonderful with them. We were immediately made to feel at ease. In the Carnival World Buffet we noticed that there were actually quite a few families at the hotel. Though we can't be certain they were all staying there and not just visiting for brunch. The only downsides would be the mattresses were older so they were not that firm and the room was dated. But it everything worked and although the tv wasn't a flat screen, it was still larger than the one my parents' had at Paris in a much higher grade of suite!! The shuttle was wonderful to have to get to The Strip, though we also took taxis to Paris which were not that bad - if you didn't get stuck in traffic. We were lucky enough to get an outstanding rate due to having Total Rewards cards, so definitely give that a go when booking if you have one. We have 0 points on it and still got an unbeatable deal. Well, actually it was beatable - my parents got their room at Paris for free .. with 0 points! We would gladly stay at the Rio again!

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at The Rio”
Reviews.Author: db98026
Reviews.Content: I can see why there are mixed reviews on the Rio because when I checked in to the Ipanema Tower they gave me a non smoking room after I requested a smoking room and they couldn't move me until the next day.My NON smoking room was on the 12th floor and was great!It was clean and the bathroom was newer and better setup than my SMOKING room on the 13th floor( 1351 )but both rooms were good enough for the price.The smoking room had older carpet with some stains on the carpet but the view was great from both rooms(extra 10 bucks a night)The casino had alot of different games and the cocktail waitresses came by frequently.It is a little off the strip and well worth renting a car if you want to casino hop.( 78.00 total for 4 days at carrentals.com). Skip the buffet if you can travel because it is expensive for what it is.I had breakfast for 17.99!Dinner is closer to 30.00 with tax.The Bar & Grill was good as was the deli.Overall I would probably stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Always a party going on!”
Reviews.Author: 1funsize
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Rio. Our room was nice and maid service was excellent! Although there was alot of garbage and dishes left in hallways. The check in line was very long but check out was very easy. The staff was was very nice and helpful and the food was all fantastic! We loved the upbeat atmosphere of the Rio. The only comlaint was the distance from the parking garage to our room. I guess this is to be expected at a big hotel and casino though. If you don't mind staying off the strip this is a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun casino off the main strip!”
Reviews.Author: Wildkat520
Reviews.Content: I'd say the RIO is the best casino off the main strip. Good size casino area, nice size rooms (suites), typically good service, various nightlife options and one of the best Las Vegas buffets.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard, great price”
Reviews.Author: Boltstress
Reviews.Content: We choose this hotel to save money, it's off the strip but as we had a car it didn't matter. The free shuttle to Caesars, Ballys and Paris also helped. Great pool area, good sized rooms, plenty of restaurants, all combined to make this a great value stay. Only minor concern was noise from the nightclub, not too loud but could be heard into the small hours

Reviews.Title: “The best Suite deal.”
Reviews.Author: Islaverde34
Reviews.Content: We have the opportunity to stay at Cariocas Suite at nine floor, spacious and luxury is amazing, very well cleaned and the super bathroom love it, the bed so soft OMG. Nice to relax at the Jacuzzi after partying all night. Everything looks new (have a coffee maker, fridge), the service was perfect when requesting towels. This for only 100p/n, we will return on Dec hoping find the same deal but anyways staying there again. Great experience we had and with the staff also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: CanTravelLover
Reviews.Content: I would give RIO full 5 points if its location is not off the strip. For those who like to take a small walk or don't mind the hassle of taking the hotel shuttle to the strip, RIO could be a great choice if you have a tight budget. Why Great Value? My husband and I stayed RIO over the weekend. We paid avg 50 bucks per night; but was given a Masquerade Suite (the regular price for this suite ranges from 290 to 800). What can I expect more? The suite is sooooooo spacious and the so well decor. I especially love its master room and the grant bathroom. Unlike other hotels where the use of Jacuzzi is subject to charge, I could use it free of charge in RIO. If we didn't have a tight schedule in Las Vegas, we could have stayed in our suite for two days enjoying the view outside and relaxing. I have to say, because this suite is way too great that our stay in other 4 star hotels in other cities during our trip became so "disastrous". Noisy? Not a case for me. The suite locates at 50th floor in the Masquerade Tower and we were way too far away from the casino. We also felt safe as an access card was required in order to access the floor we stayed. Location: As the hotel is off strip (10 mins walk from Bally), it is a little bit inconvenient for many. But with frequent shuttle service (every 30 mins) to Harrah and Bally, this setback doesn't bother us too much. Service: We most stayed outside the hotel and didn't use the hotel service too much. Not at a good position to comment on this. Tips to book hotels with great value: book with Hotwire.com. Although you don't know what hotel you will be booking in advance, you will be able to find this out if you don't mind doing some research. Check the hotel location from Hotwire and find out the names of the hotels around the location through other travel website. By doing so, you will have an idea what you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “very suprised at the quality of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: drporsche
Reviews.Content: Went to play in a video poker tournamant after a business trip. I came from Mandalay Bay and made a joke that I was slumming it at the Rio. I was very happy with what I found at the Rio. Once I got past the one hour wait to check in. (Harrah's wouldn't it be better to add more people so we can start giving you our money faster?) I had read reviews on this site and specifically asked for a non pool view room. I had a great room. Easy to get to from every where in the hotel. Food was good, lots of choices. They were playing the World Series of Poker and you could go back to the convention center and watch it. I loved that, as I always watch it on tv. Thu - Sun they had the show in the sky. Very Mardi Gras oriented. Such fun and excitement. Vodoo Lounge at the top of the hotel has a beautiful view. Very romantic. The pool and spa are nice. I was so pleasantly suprised about my stay. I would definetly go back. Being off the strip was not so bad, 15 was right there and I just hopped on and got places really quick.

Reviews.Title: “Not my first time, surely not my last..”
Reviews.Author: Mambodaughter
Reviews.Content: Not the most AMAZING option around town but for the price, it's pretty darn good! Sign up for their Total Reward card and get an even deeper discount. Worked a convention at the Venetian recently where the average night price was $280. I stayed at the Rio for 5 nights and my total was less than 1 day at Venetian! Pretty clean, decent games and a good selection buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Fun trip poor nights sleep.”
Reviews.Author: TomHall
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Rio from July 10-14th. It was about as advertised on this site. It was ok...not great....not terrible but just ok. The shower was weak, the bedding was inferior especially the pillows. But, the room was clean, roomy and featured a nice view of the strip. Certainly worth the %60 a night we paid for. Dont expect the Wynn, but its not a Days Inn either. The only real issue I have with it is the location and the fact that the Blackjack games all pay 6:5 odds. If you dont mind paying for the cab fare and you dont mind the less than comfortable bedding stay here by all means. Otherwise, The Wynne may be calling your name.

Reviews.Title: “HEADING BACK FOR THE 4TH TIME IN 2 WEEKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: iprum
Reviews.Content: The Rio is one of the best hotels I've stayed at if you like a family friendly mix with a party atmosphere. I highly recommend this hotel if you are young or old and like to have fun!!!! If you like a stiff more expen$ive, pretentious atmosphere like the Aria, or Belagio, or MGM, this place is NOT for you. Top 5 reasons I prefer the Rio: #1 The View atop the Voo Doo lounge is one of THE best views of the strip as the Rio sits back a few blocks from the strip, and you look at the entire thing from about the 70th floor. #2 The pools are wonderful as well, my personal fave is the beach pool complete with waterfalls. #3 I can't say enough about the staff!!! If you like fast, frequent, and friendly drink service, this place is for you!!!! #4 The restaurants are pretty affordable, offering good buffets, and a great steak restaurant, I recommend the prime rib! and the sports bar has a great hamburger, a really nice BBQ style restaurant a few floors up. #5 The inside casino entertainment complete with live bands, dancertainment, and a bowling alley keep me absorbed on the casino floor whether I'm winning or losing, always having fun!!! A genral party like atmosphere!!! The rooms are very clean, I only wish they had more with coffee makers. Other than that a really great experience, and I can't wait to get back!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: Puma2218
Reviews.Content: we stayed during the world series of poker and I believe this drew a lot of undesirables to the hotel. The hallways were absolutely horrible. Phonebooks were left in the hallways for 2 days. There were crumbs and dirt in the hallways for a night or two. they say no resort fees, but be prepared to pay for everything else then. Wifi, gym, etc... The topless pool was ok, (had to pay during the week). The other pool was filled with kids. Both pools were cold eventhough it was 100 degrees out. Not real enjoyable!!! also becareful which tower you are in the new one or older one. The restaurants and clubs are why we stayed here and we were not disppointed. Cafe Martiromo was great, McFaddens fun, VooDoo lounge lots of fun!!! At $50 a night it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is amazing”
Reviews.Author: DoctorRabbi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazing and one of the best kept secrets in Vegas. The pool area consists of 4 pools with waterfalls and sea sand at one of them. Each hotel suite is unbelievably spacious and larger than the normal. The hotel is kept pretty clean (given that it is older) and since it is off the strip, you get more for your money (they try harder). Each room has a safe (with combo lock that u set up) so u can lock your stuff away. They have a shuttle that runs every half hour to the middle of the strip as well. Food is fantastic (you have to try the buffet - the massive lines are worth the wait).Great free shows (the show in the sky). Ask the front desk for any comps when u r checking in so that u get free stuff and discounts. And, absolutely, go to the Voodoo lounge (nightclub on the top floor). I have been to Vegas maybe 11 times in the past 10 years and this is definitely one of my favorite places to stay. The worst places I have stayed were probably Circus Circus and Excalibur (so you can put this rating in perspective). If they were a one star, this is definitely a 4 (if you look at what u get for your money).

Reviews.Title: “RIO is a NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: BobbbyE
Reviews.Content: RIO is not a 4-star resort/casino. It's more like a NO-star. Our nightmare started when we arrived at the RIO and parked on 2nd floor/Masquerade. The garage was littered with broken glasses, plastic cups, etc. Where's the cleaning staff? When we got to the front desk, we saw 3 agents trying to check-in a long line of irate hotel guests. It took us about 1 hour to check-in. Who is in charge of staff scheduling? Even though I reserved a non-smoking room, we were given a SMOKING room. I immediately asked to be transferred to a non-smoking room. Our non-smoking room was a dump (see pictures, below). Since they forgot to stock it with toilet paper, it took housekeeping service 1 hour to bring me a roll of toilet paper. I'm just glad I didn't have a real emergency. Who is in charge of Housekeeping? Most of RIO staff have NO sense of pride in what they do. Management ignores customer feedback and does not seem to care about any kind of quality standard. Unfortunately, customer service suffers due to lack of management leadership. Very sad.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid, much better value around the corner”
Reviews.Author: Worlde-traveller
Reviews.Content: Hotel in serious need of major upgrade. Cost is not much less than newer, better located properties on the Strip itself. Interior passages look like roach motel - lampshades hanging loose and smashed! Also, seems hotel on serious 'money-grabbing' drive - mini-bar in room, yet they charge $3 per glass to supply you with glasses in room! Come now. TV old, CRT type. WiFi is charged per 24hr, free most other hotels. Linen patched. stained. Room service breakfast routinely quoted 'hour to hour half' for delivery. Rooms overlook ugly roof with AC ducts and smell from them overpowering if 'window vents' are open. Was there for WSOP - probably the only reason this place still exists. Hopefully it will be moved from next year.

Reviews.Title: “Just.............. OK NOT GREAT”
Reviews.Author: SweetBeene
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Rio, bright and early around 7:45 am the 1st FRIENDLY face we encountered was Sandra at the front desk, who was ABSOLUTLY AMAZING!!! her customer service was IMPECCABLE, she was well versed on all things RIO Hotel. Ipanema 674 was our room, this room had a few hiccups when we arrived we noticed our room was not cleaned, we placed a call to housekeeping the supervisor was knocking in 30 sec hahaha not really but it was QUICK, Marina from El Salvador per her name badge, arrived a few moments later, thoes 2 ladies can I just say WOW my room was cleaned LICKETY SPLIT. Marina took care of us the entire week, Marina's service was so OUTSTANDING that we did NOT want to change our room when we began to experience problems with our A/C for fear we would NOT get a housekeeper who was personable, pleasant and took as much pride in their work as Marina, so we endured the stuffy room conditions. We made several maintenance calls the 1st guy was very Curt rude brief in speech and abrupt in manner needless to say A/C was not fixed, I made another call the next day, waited about 30 mins , knock knock opened the door and there stood a middle aged man with a Santa Claus moustache, Martin from maintenance was SUPER nice and talked to us like we were his daughters in hopes of trying to explain the complex operating nature of the A/C he was so nice that we wanted to LIE and say that it was repaired. Martin was so GREAT that he needs to teach a class on maintenance customer service. Later that evening we went to the front desk and we were LUCKY enough to speak with the hotel Manager Jack I can understand why he is the Manager, customer service AMAZING, mitigation of our situation AMAZING, easy going laid back and pleasant deamenor AMAZING. We didn't feel rushed he allowed us to speak our concerns at great length without interruption, with only a few knods in agreeance. We appreciated his OUTSTANDING level of service. The trip went down hill at 60mph at check out Ileana and Katherine Cabania are culprits to blame, Ileana accused me of removing 3 items from the mini bar and argued the point that the mini bar has sensors and its NEVER wrong... I told her I bought $ 200.00 worth of food for my week at the hotel their was no need to touch the mini bar, when she realized it was her mistake she said "MA'AM HUN" my bad, I thought to myself HUN??? I let it go, but after reapeatedly being refered to as "HUN HUN HUN HUN" I could no longer take it, I asked the young lady PLEASE do NOT refer to me as "HUN" my last name would be fine she became visibly irritated SNATCHED my drivers Lic. and mouthed the words "WHATEVER" I thought seriously? I ended communication right away and asked for the manager, Katherine was unconcerned almost to the point of not wanting to be bothered maybe it was too early for her 6:45 am. Overwhelming unprofessional manner, If not for these 2 ladies I would've titled the review better and gave the property better than average, I did however mark the service EXCELLENT because of Jack, Marina and Martin. Would I go back MAYBE. and thats a BIG MAYBE

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: tracey2586
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in March. Check-in was quite fast and the lady the reception was quite helpful and nice. Our room was big and clean. Although the furnishings weren't brand new, the important thing is that it was clean! For 45 dollars a night it was great value. Located off the strip, there is a shuttle every half hour (or hour I forget) to casinos on the strip. This was our main transportation to and from. Found it was quite convenient as many hotels are much more expensive and you have to pay a resort fee every day, whereas the Rio you don;t. Overall a good stay especially if you are on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay here again!! Awful experience!”
Reviews.Author: DebraA24
Reviews.Content: To summarize every day was a disaster! We asked for a king size bed, got two full beds. Maid (or someone) stole money out of purse. Ordered movie that didn't work, green dots all over the screen. Received text reward for breakfast buffet but rewards center doesn't open until 9am!! Locked out of room, after third trip to front desk to get new key, maintenance discovered the latch on the inside had locked the door after the maid shut the door too hard when she left. The worst of it, no apology or comp from management! Room was not very clean, smoky hallways, and pool area is too small.

Reviews.Title: “WOULDN'T STAY ANYWHERE ELSE IN LAS VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: starflet63
Reviews.Content: We had only a 15 minute wait to check in on Tuesday, July 15th. Got a room on the 20th floor of the Masquerade Village which was clean with a nice, comfortable bed which I absolutely loved. The room was spacious and clean. Check-out by telephone because on Friday morning, July 15th the front desk was mobbed with people trying to check out so we had to go back up to the room and check out by phone, no problem, quick and easy. The room was very quiet at night, no complaints about loud music or loud people. We were a little disappointed with the pool area; the music was WAY TOO LOUD and the pools were not adequately heated on any of the days we were there--ice cold pool water, that is for sure. Ask for the Masquerade Village tower because if you like to play slots its easy to park, go to your room and pop downstairs for the show and the slots. There is free internet available in the Starbucks adjacent to the Sao Paulo Cafe--lots of tables and very quiet in the Starbucks if you need to get some work done. Housekeeping daily was good and we asked for extra towels and some laundry bags which were dispatched to us very quickly, no problems there.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay, and great sandy beach.”
Reviews.Author: Moonlight
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom and 1 and 1/2 bath suite with separate living and dinning area with great floor to ceiling view of Las Vegas in the first weekend of July. Very roomy with good room service, but the television is outdated. You have to travel to the strip for really good food. The food at RIo is a bit too salty and processed for my taste.

Reviews.Title: “We love it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: StephanieHarris
Reviews.Content: I've spent a lot of time in the RIo. I like it because the rooms are very big. The glass wall on one side provides a wonderful view of Las Vegas, especially if you're on a higher floor. It's just hard to stay in a small hotel room after staying at the Rio. I've learned its layout and it's my 'home' in Vegas. My husband and I were there in June of 2011 for the WSOP (World Series of Poker). We'll be back. The slots are decent, especially if you stay in the quieter end of the casino, the Seafood Buffet / escalator end. The only downfall is that one has to pay $13 /day for internet service, which I don't. I go down the road to Starbucks and get it free. There is a small fridge in the room but not a microwave or coffeepot. We travel with a duffel bag that contains a square deep skillet and a few cooking supplies (salt, single cup coffee and tea bags, a couple of plastic plates, cups, bowls, silverware, spatula, pancake turner,etc.). You can heat water for coffee, and just about anything else in a skillet. There is a nice Smith's grocery down Flamingo - so if you drive, you can go do a little shopping there for a few meals to cook in your room - when you don't feel like going out in the morning for breakfast, or lunch - or even a supper or two. If you don't have your own or a rental car, there are shuttles that go to the strip on schedule.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we remembered”
Reviews.Author: Jaxrabbit
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Rio as a nostalgic throwback, as we stayed there on our honeymoon years ago. Our basic suite was beautiful -- even moreso than either of us remembered from last time. Very roomy and open. Loved the decor and functionality of the space. Awesome for the $48 a night we paid! The definite downsides are: 1. The casino. Outdated and tired looking, it was not the Rio of old. 2. The show in the air. Also, not like before. Maybe I'm showing my age here, but the flashy Brazilian costumes and music are gone, replaced by girls in Britney schoolgirl miniskirts, booty shaking and not much else. Extremely loud (which is fine), but soft on the quality. And the girls getting up on top of a platform on a bank of slot machines, grinding unnoticed to canned music, was largely unattractive. I felt sorry for them. It was almost embarrassing to watch. 3. Check-in. People, you have GOT to work on this. Horribly slow, with only two clerks working, and five empty terminals. WSOP or no WSOP, you need to have your act together a bit better on that front. All complaints aside, though, the good outweighed the bad because the hotel room was fantastic. We may pass up the Rio next time, but we will have fond memories of it.

Reviews.Title: “The Seafood Buffet Sucks”
Reviews.Author: ThaWeapon
Reviews.Content: The last time we ate at the Rio in 2002 was a pleasure, but this time we paid $85 for a long line that numerous inconsiderate people kept cutting and forced us to actually eat in line while waiting to move, cold food by the time we finally were able to sit down, and a noise level so loud we had all we could do to talk to each other from across the table.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Trip”
Reviews.Author: inindiana50
Reviews.Content: The suite was very comfortable for 3 of us, very clean and roomy. The living area was well furnished with a sectional sofa, and a nice view of the city from all the windows. Location was great close to the strip but not on it, however they provide shuttle service to other properties on the strip. Great place to stay and good selection of resturants to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Ok place to stay, but I prefer being closer to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: besdogs3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was okay for a business trip if all you have to do is meetings. Our trip was stricktly fun and for that we got a little bored. We did have one night of fun going over to the Palms and checking out all of the clubs. The Rio had most of us in the same area for our group, with the exception of myself. I was at the entire other end from everyone else. No biggy - at least you could find everyones room with ease. The pool area was not as great as I had thought it would be from reviews and the pictures. Very small pools and I believe that only 1 was heated.. my guess was the one we couldn't even get close to or fit one more body into it was so packed. We stayed by the first pool with the waterfall and when we went in it was gross. Not sure if the waterfall creates so much debris or what but is had so much stuff floating around we got out. We then just decided to pay to go into the private area pool. This was much better. Although I didn't see anyone bringing drinks/food for about 2 hours. We just took turns running out to get stuff for everyone. Music was good, pool was comfortable and gogo dancers were a nice addition. Went to dinner at for the seafood buffet... don't waist your money. Go to the actual seafood restaurant at the other end by the pool and get a good meal. The buffet was really not that good. We all agreed (12 of us). We did have dinner up top at the Vodoo and it was one of the very best meals I have ever had. Had the Bone in Ribeye. Amazing service and food! We were not clear on where to enter the place, but figured it out. All in all a very fun trip. Went to see The Beatles show - better than amazing!!! Ended up at Nine Fine Irishmen and as we do every trip - had a blast.

Reviews.Title: “At bit tired...”
Reviews.Author: Line1982
Reviews.Content: The Rio was all in all decent, but the service wasn't very good as we pretty much had to find out everything ourselves. For first-time visitors to Las Vegas and casinos, it would be nice to have some information (like a welcome packet) available. For example, when we the first evening (after driving 6 hours from LA) we wanted dinner and decided to go to the italian restaurant Martorano's, the hostess asked us if we had a Player's Card which we were unaware what was and she didn't tell us that we should go get one (it was free). The result was that our dinner bill had an extra $12 on it because we didn't have this card, which we could go get at the casino. However, service was good, when we asked for information ourselves - it would just be nice to get more information from the beginning, but perhaps it was because of WSOP, as the hotel was completely full. Otherwise we had a great deal for breakfast where we got $9 per person per day to spend at Starbucks or Rio Java. The steakhouse American Bar & Grill was also good. Prices for food and drinks were though very high, but I guess that's Las Vegas for you... The room was very big which is a plus, and the bed was comfortable. TV and other furniture, curtains + paint etc. could really use an update! In general, the hotel and casino felt a bit tired and outdated. Pool area GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “No longer a well managed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Corvair65
Reviews.Content: Check in was fine. About six people working. We were there about noon. But later in the day the line was a mile long, and only about eight people working. The internet was slow when it worked. It would just kick you off, it did it a lot. If you need the internet, you can't stay here. The room was big, and nice. The problem was maid service. There wasn't any. At about 3:45 our roomhadn't been cleaned yet, so my wife aske a maid in the hall for a towel, the maid acted surprised, and said something like , you want the room cleaned? Well the night shift will have to do that. Well, room was never cleaned. This has never happened to me ever. There are just too many bad reviews too ignore. Even the best hotel will have a complaint once in a while, but look at all of them. It's like the casio, sometimes you win, sometimes you don't.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, don't like the location”
Reviews.Author: jpad108
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal so we stayed at the Rio. Our room was quite spacious, but not new. It was however, very clean and a pleasant change from the usual smaller hotel rooms, but a little tired. the bed was comfprtable and I loved the two sinks, one in the bathroom and one outside. The WSOP is going on so maybe that is why it was soooo crowded and smoky. Too much for me. We did not eat at the buffet because the prices were ridiculous. We went next door to the Gold Coast based on a previous review and found the breakfast selection very adequate and well worth the price. It was very clean and bright. I thought the gambling at the Rio was pretty awful, the hotel itself is a little difficult to maneuver, and I got turned around a few times. We ate at the Irish pub and the food there was very good and reasonably priced. The location is great is you take the shuttle or if you just stay there, but we like to go other places, and the proximity to I-15 made it very difficult because you were always in traffic no matter where you went. The strip was no better because unfortunately the Rio is centrally located so traffic for us was a problem.. We like staying outside the perimeter of 15 and the strip so we can tool around, go back to the room, relax, and then go out again. We really did not feel like we could do that easily at the Rio. But for the deal we got, it was definitely worth it. Also, they have a great pool. I am not sure we would go back again unless we gor a screaming deal. And not only that, everybody is charging for the Internet now. Used to be a freebie, now expect to pay $13/ day.

Reviews.Title: “Lung Cancer”
Reviews.Author: akeroo
Reviews.Content: Played in the WSOP and stayed at the Rio. Place was a disaster. Every morning I would wake up and find about 300 cigarette butts between my room door and the elevator. There was a smoky haze in all the halls all the time. People were just hanging out in the hall smoking because the rooms were non-smoking. All of the light fixtures were broken in the hall. It was terrible. I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and staff who go the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: kiwimusume
Reviews.Content: I was extremely impressed with both the room and the service. The room was very spacious and the bed was extremely comfortable. The concierge, Monica, went out of her way to help me, even checking me in for my onward flight from her own home. Having never used an airline with online check-in procedures before, I had no idea how much she had helped me until I got to the airport and saw the first-come, first-served system for myself. The hotel isn't on the Strip, but it has regular free shuttle bus services to and from it. It has all the requisite Vegas stuff – casino in the lobby, crazy exterior and decor etc. It also has an amazing buffet restaurant. I cannot recommend this hotel enough for anyone going to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Diverse and More Adult Option”
Reviews.Author: Wilburys66
Reviews.Content: There is nothing particularly unique about the Rio compared to other casinos except for a few characteristics. First, there is a bit of a PG-13 atmosphere. The waitresses occasionally jump up onto a stage on the casino floor and go-go dance. This is a plus unto itself, but it has another advantage since there is a noticeable lack of children present in the hotel. I have nothing against children per se, it's just the context. Second, the crowd is very diverse. A great cross-section of all types of people. No one classification of people is over-represented. I like that. The only negative is that it's a bit out of the way and there's a large line for cabs. But it moves pretty fast. Also, the pool closes pretty early in the day. The Voodoo lounge at the top of the hotel is a must-see. I enjoyed the presence of an veggie-friendly Indian restaurant. The staff is friendly, efficient, and beautiful where appropriate. I can fully recommend the Rio to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We Always Like the Rio”
Reviews.Author: Sletcha
Reviews.Content: We usually stay here for a few nights and then switch to another hotel for the last few nights of our trip. Staying two places seems to make the trip go slower and you get a different atmosphere each time. We have always liked the Rio because it's off strip but still has a decent selection of video poker machines. The one drawback is the cafe is not open 24 hours; we tried to go for coffee/dessert around 11:00 p.m. one night and could not do so at the Rio. We were in the Masquerade Tower with a great view. The rooms are getting a little dated compared to the newer places, but they are always super clean and very spacious suites. Would like to see a flat screen TV next time vs. a tube TV. One complaint I do have is two different times I was transferred several times when trying to get maintenance to fix our refreshment center (it was warm) and order room service. Since we have status with Total Rewards, of course we are treated better than those who do not. That's to be expected. Those of you complaining about that...Vegas makes most of its money on gambling and rewards gamblers for their play. If you are not a player, you should probably stay at a non-gambling hotel if it bothers you that players are treated better. We like the Rio and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I absolutely hated this hotel. The noisiest hotel with no security at all.”
Reviews.Author: shirley0156
Reviews.Content: I felt so threatened in this hotel with drunks everywhere carrying large bottles of vodka in the elevators. It was the worst trip I took to Las Vegas in all my 84 years.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed at RIO for 4 weeks for WSOP”
Reviews.Author: freepokercash
Reviews.Content: The accomodations at the RIO were perfect for my needs during the WSOP. The room was spacious, had a great view and provided me all the comforts of home including a seating area and "sorta" dining area. The dressing room was great with tons of space. I found that, for me, the best food there was room service. I tried all of the restaurants at least once. Maybe it's me, but the Indian food just was not very good. Buzio's was the best food in the place.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you are playing the WSOP .”
Reviews.Author: guitarman1957
Reviews.Content: If you are playing the WSOP then I would recommend staying at The Rio. The Hotel is older and dated. Rooms are clean but nothing special. The main issue I had was the bed was like a sponge. I have a bad back so I had to sleep on the couch ( it was very firm ) the first night. I requested a replacement bed and hotel services replaced my old mattress with a brand new one that was comfortable. The food selection is ok – the best bargain is the buffet. Location is off strip which is not ideal. Check in and check out was very fast. Poker Room – fair at best There is a huge difference between a 5 star and a 4 star Hotel in Vegas. Spend the extra money for the 5 Star.

Reviews.Title: “Liar liar”
Reviews.Author: bccates
Reviews.Content: This hotel thinks they can tell u one thing and do another... they make up fake charges and fake rates if u want to stay an extra night....wow

Reviews.Title: “Nt very well maintained hotel”
Reviews.Author: Devkul
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was poorly maintained. Everything about it looked old and not maintained. Light fitting broken in many places, used cups and plates from the rooms remained in the corridor all day & was not cleared. Internet not free. No Coffee making machine in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a night”
Reviews.Author: carlyby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night after flying in from Sanfransisco before heading into Arazonia. Decided on the Rio as kept on wanting to visit it when previoyuslty in vegas but never got round to it. Also returning back to Vegas 5 days later and staying on the strip then. Arrived at 3pm, had a wait 5 minuites to chcek in as lots of poeple also checking in, but the Q moved quickly. Got upgraded from a double room to a huge suite on the 19th floor. It was amazing, two bathroom, one with a tv, masive jucissie bath. Bedroom was masive, the biggest bed I have everv slept in, great view of the Palms. A huge lounge area, with huge TV, fridge, mini car, great sofas, table. couldnt belive how great the room was. This is hoe the other half live!!! The Casino was ok, very slot orrintated. Was disapointed that the show in the sky wasnt on that week as that was one of the reasons why we choose the Rio over other off strip hotels. It was clean and not to much smoke, lots of diffrent bars which was good. Didnt get a chance to try out the pool but it looked amazing. Went to the Vodoo lounge, amazing. Got theer before 11pm so didnt have to pay the entrace charge. Had a witch doctor, which has to be the worlds best cocktail, not only looked great also tasted great. Amazing views from the top. Disapointed that the only tables were reserved for table service, though only a few were in use . No were to sit, or even a tabel to put your drinks down. Would have stayed longer if there was tables. Really enjoyed the music, liked that they had two diffrent DJs, one inside one outside.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, lousy service.”
Reviews.Author: MoBlu
Reviews.Content: Used some mileage to stay here for two nights in April. It's in a good location as you can literally "walk across the street" (unlike having to walk for miles between some hotels on the strip) to the Palms and the Gold Coast. The room they gave me was very nice, clean, and large. It overlooked the air conditioning unit and utilities for the hotel, but hey, they have to put them somewhere. The pool area was very nice and very crowded. It got sun all day long. I didn't eat in the hotel at all as their buffet was $25.00 on a weeknight ! I walked across the street and ate at the Gold Coast for $12.00 less.
