I stopped in on Sunday morning and was able to check in but would have to return later to actually get room keys as none were ready at that time.I had an event to attended and wasn't able to return to get my room until 8p.m.. It was a nightmare. Despite being a Sunday night there were at least 30 other people trying to check in. They had three different lines including one for people who had had their check in paperwork done earlier. They were way understaffed. It took twenty minutes for them to check in the guy in front of me as the woman helping him would dissapear into the back repeatedly. Then some guy walked up next to our line and the next receptionist waved him over just ignoring us. They finally put on another receptionist and I just charged right to the desk. I told the guy behind me that he should do the same as they were not paying the least bit of attention to who was on line. I usually stay at The Gold Coast or The Orleans and have NEVER encountered anything like this. I would definitely think twice about staying at The Rio again due to this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fun resort, but not well located”
Reviews.Author: The_Traveller954
Reviews.Content: When you go to Vegas, it is best to stay on the strip. This hotel was off the strip, and even though it had a shuttle bus, it was a pain to get taxis and wait for the shuttle. The room was large and decent but in need of an update. The pool area was also dated. The casino area was lively and fun with good entertainment. The seafood buffet is outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite places in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: mcbarkr
Reviews.Content: Though slightly off strip, RIO is a great place to stay. Large, comfortable rooms with magnificent views, plenty of reasonably priced restaurants, plenty to do. Free shuttle ride to the strip every 30 minutes, or an easy walk. RIO is loud and fun, busy on weekends. If you want peace and quiet, this is not the place to go. Drinks are served by "Bevertainers", male and female, who periodically get up on small stages throughout the casino to either sing or dance. Good service, beautiful pool area, featuring 4 pools, one that is adults only. Don't miss the free Show in the Sky in the Masquerade Village every night. Gaming is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Not a fan - Even for the price”
Reviews.Author: NEohiotraveler
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers, I've stayed just in many places in Vegas. Mirage, TI, Ceasars, Bellagio, MGM, Flamingo (ewwww) and Venetian. I chose Rio for the price more than anything. The elevators for the masquerade tower are open to anyone that wants to roam the Hotel. Wouldn't bother me if I was with other people, but when you're traveling alone, I find that an issue. Several times I felt very uncomfortable with the people getting into the far elevator. The room itself was old, but I've seen worse. I think the worst part was the bed. It was not comfortable at all. I think there are better loactions to stay in vegas for the ease of getting around at similar prices - however, for the specific time that I went no rooms were available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Party”
Reviews.Author: MarlonT
Reviews.Content: The suite is very clean and the room specification request was granted. room service is a little slow but forgiven for the politeness of the server. me and my friends have a great time at the swimming pool during the day and have fun at the voodoo lounge at night. great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay there again”
Reviews.Author: Disapointed2
Reviews.Content: As soon as we got there we waited an hour to check in. The waitresses were wearing really (in my opinion) really sleazy, degrading outfits, compared to other hotels we've stayed at. One day we came back to our room and the door to our room was left open, by the maid I would imagine, luckily , nothing was taken, we didn't get so much as even an apology when we complained to the manager!! Also the beer was $7.00 each at the pool, which my husband thought was very overpriced.I would definitely not stay in the Rio ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Too, Too Loud”
Reviews.Author: NJ-Flem
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a stay at the Rio for 6 nights. My stay was comped but I don't think I would stay here again - free or otherwise. We always check into the Masquerade Tower. Love the convenience to the parking garage as we always have a rental car. The first night we were on the 23rd floor. In the afternoon we could hear the music from the pool blasting in our room. Called the front desk and they said music (if you can call it that) would stop at 7:00PM. Nothing but LOUD LOUD BASE. BOOM, BOOM, BOOM. It did stop at 7:00PM. But at the pool you have two music stations blasting away. Competing against each other. Needed ear plugs. Too loud to have a conversation. We got back to our room around midnight and we could hear the VooDoo Lounge (51st floor) in our room on the 23rd floor. Called down to the front desk and were told that the music goes on every night from the VooDoo until 4:00AM. They were correct. Didn't get to sleep to after 4:00AM then had to listen to the pool music again in our room the next day. We asked to be changed. Were shown a room in the Ip Tower. Was not to our liking, so we took another room in the M Tower but a much lower floor. Room was then satisfactory (no VooDoo noise). Also they keep the casino very, very cold. Also not much in the way of reasonable price food. Drinks were very, very pricey. Our room was outdated but kept very clean. TVs need to be updated. TV also blocked the view from the window. Wall-mounted flat screeens would be a better option.

Reviews.Title: “Great size rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: snowboardingfool
Reviews.Content: My second time @ the Rio in less then a year. Low-Down This hotel is not the newest and not right on the strip but if that is not your focus it is a blast. They have huge room, friendly staff, good prices and Great food. The rooms are so large you can have friends over and relax before going out. Very comfy Beds and a nice views. The pool had plenty of seats and good music. The tables were great with nice dealers and quick waitresses It's an older hotel so don't expect flat screens but it has been great for me (someone who does not stay in the room all day). Getting a cab for going out is always easy and check in was a breeze.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet is the WORST”
Reviews.Author: topgunn_99
Reviews.Content: I read SO many reviews of the World Buffet at the Rio that were positive, as well as experiencing the RIO about 9 years ago. This latest visit was utterly one of the worst ever. First, the lines were out of control TOO long; management had ZERO idea on how best to handle these lines. I heard people talking that they had been in line TWO hours....no buffet is worth that. We decided to pay cash and forgo the discount line...it took us 15 minutes once we decided on that tack. Once inside, the food was nothing close as to what I remember, and certainly not close to any of the reviews. Cooks were slow to refill empty trays; a number of dishes were not labeled, and frankly were unrecognizable. The overall quality of the beef dishes was mediocre,at best. Crab legs were skinny (Mandalay Bay actually had 1000% better crab legs). One positive for the Rio...they now have a bar in the middle...you might need several drinks to stomach this stuff. All in all, it was a HUGE disappointment after remembering how good this place was. The Rio needs to totally redo this in an effort to gain its former glory. Do yourself a favor, save yourself a few bucks and pick another buffet. The Rio is worth skipping.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and service for the price.”
Reviews.Author: Iowa27
Reviews.Content: This is not the Wynn or Venetian, but it is a solid choice for those who don’t want to pay an arm and a leg for a large clean room. I have stayed at the Mirage, TI, Luxor, Mandalay Bay and Trop and the rooms are better than all except Mandalay Bay. Pro – Rooms much larger than average. Housekeeping was efficient with the room cleaned by noon every day. They did a good job and not just a quick make-up of bed. Refrigerator is a definite plus. Our room in the Ipanema tower was well-kept with a clean bathroom. You can get some great rates ($33 per night the week before Memorial Day). Multiple, nice pools that were busy but not packed. The casino was lively at all hours (compared to the Palms down the street which was dead during the day). Gold Coast is right next door so you can walk to other eating options if you like. Check-out was a breeze using the in-room check-out service through the TV, allowing you to skip lines in the lobby. The walls to the rooms next door were well insulated. We could hear the loud TV from the room next door easily from out in the hall, but not from our room. During our 4 day stay, never waited more than a minute for elevators at any hour. Con – Door to hall is thin so loud talking early in AM by people in hall is a bother. In contrast to the walls, the ceiling was not as well-insulated. Could hear walking in the tiled area of bathroom in the room above. TV is old, but functional for the 10 minutes we used it during our stay. We rent a car, so can’t comment on ease of use of the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - and fair price”
Reviews.Author: noapologies
Reviews.Content: Rooms are large and relatively clean. Had a problem with an order and it was addressed quickly and to my satisfaction. I liked that it wasn't right on the strip. What I didn't like was that when you enter and go to reception, it is pandemonium because you are also in the thick of the casino. Several of the hotels is this price range are like this.... so it's a trade-off. I got a great price (more due to the association I was with at a conference) - but several of these hotels are comparable. Hotels NOT in this category are Venetian -exquisite - and having a nearly silent reception area, the Wynn etc. You get what you pay for - and honestly the only time it really bothered me was when I first arrived. Further - a few of the small restaurants near the casino were great for snacking. The main buffet in the hotel - touted by many to be the best in Vegas was, if you are ANY kind of foodie, crap. SO not worth the $27 fee. A total rip off. Lastly - Ruby - the lead concierge ROCKS. She was incredibly helpful,kind, and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Very Nice Pools and Speedy Slot Service, Ready to go back”
Reviews.Author: RetiredIBEW
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the 16th floor in Masquesrade Tower, large room very quite, Pools are nice. There is a kids pool, 2ea other pools and an adult pool with tops optional. Outdoor dining and bar service is speedy. We ate at the All American Sports Grill and McFadden’s both were very good and Carnival World Buffet is amazing (Hint text RIO to 227466 to get coupons) VooDoo Rooftop Nightclub good place to have a drink. Check in & out was very fast and pleasent. The wife used the spa and workout center and truely enjoyed her self there. The property is off the strip but they have free shuttle service to Bally's or Harrah's on the Strip that runs every half hour.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious/Great Service - Great Casino”
Reviews.Author: LinconlnLs8
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Rio on several of my Las Vegas stays and have always had great service. I enjoy having space in the room. The beds are comfy, and I love having a frig in the room for cold drinks. The bars and eateries are great! I also love the Show in the Sky. The only down side is the fact that they have not upgraded the tvs to flat screen. I have my next trip booked at Rio and look forward to the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Rusty002Indiana
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was wonderful. Loved the hotel, food, and live entertainment. Very pleased with the room accomodations. More than what I thought they would be. Variety of pools were fantastic. Will be back to visit in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Suite”
Reviews.Author: BarbaraHB
Reviews.Content: We had a reservation for 2 nights in a deluxe suite. They were sold out of that type suite so they upgraded up to the Hollywood Honeymoon Suite. WOW I seriously didn't want to leave our room - it was huge and beautiful. 4 televisions. A bar, a dining room, 2 living areas and a fabulous jacuzzi. The bathroom was over the top the jacuzzi, a bidet, separate shower - beautiful glass bowl sinks, stone tile. It was so nice and over the top fabulous we called downstairs to make sure there wasn't a mistake - they said "no mistake, we always try to upgrade people who reserve 2 or more nights" this room would easily be over $1000 a night. I love you RIO - we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel...more of a cabana review for anyone interested”
Reviews.Author: stellagirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights during a family road trip. I've been to Vegas many times. Certainly there are much nicer, newer places to stay but for the price of the rooms, really I don't think the Rio can be beat. We booked 2 rooms through Hotels.com. (If you do this, don't spend the extra money for the rooms that include the coupon book or a view, etc...because they will give you one anyway.) I've done this twice now. We paid $56 a night per room. The rooms are quite big compared to the newer hotels. They were adjoining since we had my mom and our 4 year old son. Both rooms had amazing views of the strip. The beds are really comfortable as well as the pillows and linens. They also had updated the furniture since last summer, which was great. I knew the rooms were huge, which is why I chose this hotel so my son would have a blast running around! Yes, the hotel lobby and casino is kinda "80's" but it's fun. It's not a pretentious place. Everyone is really nice. Another reason we picked this hotel was for the pool. I Googled Vegas cabana pics for so long and didn't see anything very detailed, so I thought this review might help others. We rented a cabana since we had my mom and our little boy with us. The cabanas are wonderful! Initially, we were having a hard time choosing to stay between the Rio and Mandalay Bay (because of the pool area). We chose Rio because it's a lot less crowded and the cabanas are a lot less expensive. We had a huge one, with a ceiling fan, flat panel TV, fridge, a huge sectional and 4 lounge chairs. The price for the 4 of us (all day) was $340 which included $340 worth of food and drinks. It was totally worth it! Our cabana server was THE BEST!!! Her name is Angelica. Ask for her. She's so nice and down to earth....really great with my special needs mother and my little son. A lot of the servers at other hotels are snotty and will only "cater" to the higher end clients. When considering Mandalay Bay, I spoke with the concierge. She was really nice...but she mentioned several times to tip the server right away so I would ensure great service. Makes sense, but just the fact hat she offered that advice to me told me a lot about what to expect there. Plus, none of us do that well in big crowds. The room service was fast and efficient. Staff always friendly....but the room service food wasn't good...not even breakfast. That was the only bummer. My husband and I went to the VooDoo bar/restaurant and it was great. Amazing views and the food and drinks were great. They also have this wine cellar. It's really cool if you like wine. You go down these stairs and it feels like you are in a cave. They have these really cool booths, it's pretty quiet and relaxing and they serve you wine and cheese of your choice off their menu. It's a blast. I think this is a great choice for families like ours...where you have another adult with you who can watch the kids while you spend time with your significant other.....especially if you need to book 2 rooms. My son loved the beach pool and we were very close to the shark reef at Mandalay Bay and the Dolphin exhibit at the Mirage. It was a convenient location, for not being right on the strip. If you are a family without a 3rd adult, and only need one room, I might go with another hotel that has more attractions on site for the kids. MGM, New York New York and Mandalay Bay have more to offer the little ones. My husband is a statistician, so he literally doesn't understand how people can enjoy gambling. Point being...there really is a lot to do in Vegas without gambling. (Although I admit, I am slightly addicted to the Wheel of Fortune slots)! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: mmbaker
Reviews.Content: Pros: The hotel room was large and clean. The $25 buffet in the hotel was amazing!! If you like a party atmosphere, then late night at the Rio is the place to be. Cons: Casino was good except there were no $5 table games. We ended up gambling at Fremont Street. Elevators to the hotel rooms were extremely hidden. Checkout was a bit slow. TV was not a flat screen and the picture was sub-standard. I would definatelly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs lots of help”
Reviews.Author: monetkids
Reviews.Content: Don't stay in the Masquerade Tower , any floor below the Voodoo lounge will be treated to the music and pounding from 10 pm until 2 am. You may get a dirt cheap deal to stay there, but they charge you 22 bucks a day for the fitness center which has nothing special in it, they charge you 15 bucks for the internet, they charge you 10 bucks to stay in a room with a view. Toilets don't work, have to flush at least 3 times. Rooms need work,they said they wer remodelled, they don't vaccuum for at least 3 or 4 days in the room. Shuttles to the strip are availbale but almost impossible to get on since they only go every 30 minutes have only 2 vans, lines are very long to wait, just take a cab. Meals way too pricey for the kind of place it is. Pools are just ok, have 4 of them but play different music at each one so it backfires.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome for any kind of traveler”
Reviews.Author: 2muchtravel2007
Reviews.Content: Memorial Weekend stay was excellent and memorable. From the Valet squeezing me in late on Friday, to the less than 10 minutes to check-in with a dozen or so people in front of me, the cleanliness and size of the room, and the gambling and restaurant availability as well as the promptness of the shuttles to the strip. The food at the All American Bar and Grill was incredible. The pool area was nice. The products in the bathroom were well stocked. The shower pressure was very nice (other reviewers need to learn they can adjust adjust the pressure on the head). There was a coffee maker in the room (Other reviewers need to learn to look around). The air conditioning was very good and the cleanliness was impeccable. This hotel is not "family" friendly, though there were many kids around, there is plenty for everyone. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canuckscout
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Rio with my wife. we stayed in the Ipanema tower. The first room we were given had some serious cleanliness issues so we went back to the counter. To the Rio's credit they reacted very fast and upgraded us to the VIP floor. Both the front desk manager and the housekeeping manager were great and very apologetic. They remedied the problem immediately without question. Within one hour we were completely transferred to another room. My wife and I travel a lot so we expect some problems on every trip and try not to get all upset over it. After all it is your holiday. The new room on the VIP floor is pretty much the same as the other rooms. It has a nicer TV. A pay mini bar as well as a small fridge. The small fridges at the Rio only keep things cool NOT cold. But it is nice enough to have a bottle of milk or some oranges. My beer I keep in an ice bucket. The furniture is about the same. The bath room is maybe a little nicer. The rooms at the Rio are very large with plenty of storage. The beds are not bad. Not as good as the Wynn etc. but decent. The air conditioner is noisey but that's normal for Vegas unless you stay at the Wynn etc. The pool area is pretty good but sometimes the music is way too loud and jungle thumping crap. The buffet is no way as good as it used to be when Tony Marnell owned the Rio. If you want a good buffet drive out to Tony's new hotel the M Resort south of the airport. It is the best in Las Vegas bar none!! Location of the Rio is good provided you have a rental car. Don't expect to be able to go for walks outside the hotel. They have a shuttle if you want to waste valuable holiday time waiting. Overall I recommend the Rio. It is good value if you get a deal and get a rental car. Rental cars in Vegas are about $20 a day including everything. I would avoid Thrifty car rental in Las Vegas as they have an incredibily bad attitude, are slow and way too agressive pushing their upsell nonsense.

Reviews.Title: “200 Security Deposit and Full balance at check-in was a bummer, but great swimming under waterfalls!”
Reviews.Author: ShanaMichele
Reviews.Content: At check-in, we were charged full balance and a 200 security deposit (that's not even for ammenities), the deposit was "in case we broke the TV or something". That really got us off on the wrong foot. It almost made us want to do damage to the tube TV that was probably worth less than $50 (but of course we didn't). As we walked toward our room, we noticed that all the hallway shades had been punched in! So, that's why. Our room was very nice, with a great view of the pools (down side: you can hear the pool music through the windows). Swimming under the waterfalls was a highlight! They offer drinks (charged, of course) and there are some great hottubs as well! For us, the slots weren't paying out much. We are back home now, still waiting for our reimbursement of the security deposit, to our credit card. Advise: pay the 200 in cash, you get it back right away at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room, Good Service,...Really Enjoyed the Pools”
Reviews.Author: gotarheels
Reviews.Content: I've visited Vegas many times and took the opportunity to enjoy a complimentary room at the Rio on my latest gambling jaunt. I had never stayed there before because of the off-Strip location. For this visit, I planned to stay on-property and just sit by the pool during the day. It ended up being a very nice two-day getaway and I will likely be a regular Rio customer. The Pros: -front desk service is far superior to other Harrahs properties (with the exception of Caesars which is equally good). The desk was properly staffed, check-in at Diamond was a breeze and the attendant was very friendly. There was some sort of convention going on so the room I requested was not available. Rather than making me wait (like on a former visit to Harrahs), they immediately upgraded me to a better suite and sent me on my way. -the suite I was given was huge and beautiful! Far beyond my needs really, but no complaints from me. I believe it was the "Cariocas" and featured a foyer with guest restroom, full living/dining room (table seated 8 at least), large flat-screen tv, separate bedroom with two comfortable queens and another large flat-screen, bathroom with HUGE jacuzzi tub, separate shower, large granite counter topped vanity (two sinks) and his+hers closet and drawers. Tons of closet and storage space throughout. -The pool area was perfect! There are three pools: two heated, one of which has a small sandy beach, one for lounging and lap swimming, and one that is not heated (so was too cold and sat empty but still nice to gaze out at). They were not too crowded so it was easy to get a lounge chair to soak up some sun. The piped-in music was at a good level...you could still talk easily and doze off if you wanted. -One of the best features at the pool is the professional level of the wait staff. As with all the Vegas pools, the girls are attractive, but here, they actually work too! Food and beverages were served quickly, I was checked on regularly, and my waitress went out of her way to thank me for tipping her on my way out. -Food options are great here. The property is large and good food can be found any time, day or night. I especially loved my steak at the All American Bar and Grill. Perfectly grilled to medium with just the right amount of seasoning. -Gaming is as varied as you could ever want. The Cons: -Off-Stip location is a drag if you like being in the thick of things. The Palms and Gold Coast are both short walks away (although you do have to cross a busy street to the Palms). The cab to Bellagio main entrance was $7. -It seems like Harrahs is still cutting costs to the very last bone as they have eliminated the dancing "Show in the Sky" which was one of the fun things about Rio in the past. I didn't see it run during the entire two days, but perhaps they still do it on the weekends. -Drink service on the gaming floor was spotty. Sometimes a cocktail waitress would be there minutes after I had just been served, sometimes it would be an hour between visits. More consistency is needed. Overall, a good visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but not great”
Reviews.Author: getgoingnow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a quick trip to Vegas and we stayed at the Rio. It was ok. I generally give good reviews to places, but our experience at this hotel really wasn't great. Maybe this hotel is better for a younger crowd (we're in our late 30's)?? Positives: nice, clean room; taxi to the strip is easy to get and inexpensive; seafood buffet is wonderful, lots of restaurants to choose from, three different pools and one has a sandy beach area. Negatives: shower head in our room was broken, fire alarm went off in the middle of the night and we all had to evacuate because someone on our non-smoking floor was smoking, $22 charge for use of the gym, the hotel smells like smoke since it is a smoking hotel, the pool has two blaring speaker systems that boom music from both sides of the pool area. This means that there are two different types of dance music going LOUDLY at all times. There is no place to go to escape the noise (near the waterfall is the best bet if you go since it drowns some of it out). It just wasn't what we were hoping for.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, but decent beds and quiet location”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: Traveled to Vegas for one night business, and thought I'd take advantage of a $60 rate for a large suite at the Rio. I preferred to stay off the strip both for cost and a perceived quality. Here are my thoughts: 1). Pros: facilities are nice, but very large. Be prepared to walk a lot; lots of restaurant and bar choices; convenience shops are right off the casino and a nice benefit. Elevators very vast, and valet friendly. Cheap, and room is larger than your typical hotel rooms. The check in line is painfully long all the time, but I will give them credit for keeping it moving for the most part--I still waited about 30 minutes to check in at 3pm with only two front desk clerks (?). Food and drinks are good varied and decent priced. 2) Cons: lots of cons, unfortunately. Service at the front desk is very very poor if you are not a "VIP". Two clerks kept inviting VIPs that kept walking up to the VIP line for assistance, leaving everyone else waiting and waiting and waiting until I complained out loud to the front desk clerk at the handicapped portion of the desk who was not willing to help anyone, nor could he even make a spare key for me--quite unacceptable. Once I complained out loud, he disappeared and never came back. Room and hotel is very dated. I'm certain there are better Vegas hotels to stay in for similar rates on a Monday night. Oh...and be prepared to pay for just about everything--$.50 minimum just to print out your boarding pass. All and all, I'm glad I tried it but won't be back due to service and the great need for renovation. Also, the mini bar was locked, and I was never given any option to get a key and really didn't know how to open it.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS ! BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: Vida_nk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old and dated. At the end of our trip we saw bed bugs in our bed:( the oncall manager was not helpful and offred 30$ food coupon! Avoid at all cost

Reviews.Title: “Stay at The Rio”
Reviews.Author: zbiegien
Reviews.Content: Our stay was Great! The World buffet at the Rio is excellent, large selection, fantastic food, price is comparable to other good buffets. Our room was huge, the bed excellent, very comfrortable.. I am picky about the beds as I have back problems, no issues here. Large bathroom with a large tub. In room refrigerator. Wonderful pools, we did not use their topless pool area, it is safely concealed from "little" eyes. They have 3 other pool areas, one is a sandy beach entrance, all have waterfalls into them.. Do not miss the hidden spa pools. 3 are tucked away amongst trees with waterfalls and jetted! OUr favorite spot. I felt for the rate we got ( $49) is was fantastic place. The have a free shuttle that takes you back and forth to the strip ( They are about 1 mile off it). We used that service and left our car in the covered parking garage. The grounds and hotel are clean, the only negative I found was that all the tile around all the pools needed to be replaced, and I was told that is planned. So Stay at The Rio in Vegas, you will like it.

Reviews.Title: “I really enjoyed myself”
Reviews.Author: banderson220
Reviews.Content: The Rio is a great place to stay. The rooms were terriffic and the view was great. It had every thing you need except a microwave. We had to throw away a lot of food because we didn't have a way to reheat it. Put in a microwave and the place would be perfect. The pools, casino, and resturants were on the money. We were able to get to the Strip, the outlet and Fremont Street without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is Showing Its Age!”
Reviews.Author: marivi90804
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rio during our Spring Break in late April, 2011. We had stayed at Rio a few years earlier and had a very pleasant stay. This time, we noticed the hotel, as well as other hotels in Vegas, are beginning to show its age. When you walk in, you immediately noticed that nothing has changed or been updated in years. The room, which is considered a suite, has a worn out, tired look that a good remodeling could fix. It was clean and definitely liveable. We were paying a discounted rate. But, if were being charged full price, I definitely would have been upset! I have yet to understand why there's a window in the bathroom that overlooks the bedroom portion of the suite! The service continues to be excellent. On our last night, the people next door had their TV set on full blast at 2:00 AM! We called downstairs and they immediately responded and took care of the situation. On of the biggest drawbacks of the Rio is its location. It is quite a distance away from the strip. They do run a shuttle every 30 minutes between the hotel and the strip. It's prompt. The drivers are polite and helpful. However, during busy, peak times, one shuttle isn't enough. A couple of times, we ended up paying for a taxi because the shuttle was full. Overall, our stay at the Rio was average.

Reviews.Title: “Handicapped beware!”
Reviews.Author: pawsmom
Reviews.Content: My mother, who is handicapped, and I stayed one night at the Rio. It took about a half hour of waiting in line to check in on a Friday afternoon (around 4pm which was check in time). The parking garages are on either side of the hotel with VERY limited handicapped parking spots. The hotel elevators are pretty much in the middle of the casino. My mother prefers to walk, although it is slow going and painful for her, rather than lug her wheelchair out of the trunk and try to get through the crowded casino floor but there was no where to park close enough that she could do this. When brought up to the front desk, their only suggestion was vallet parking, which we are not comfortable with. I had to drop her off and pick her up at the front doors (which the lanes were always blocked by taxis) and she still had to walk the width of the casino floor to the elevators to get to our room. It is not very handicapped friendly just by design. On the other hand, our room was very nice, surprisingly spacious, and very quiet. I'm a light sleeper but had no problems sleeping here. If we had neighbors, I didn't hear them once, no drunken laughter in the hallways, or slamming doors. It is close to the Strip but not on it and has shuttles to other casinos but we didn't use them. I would recommend this hotel, but not to those who are handicapped, or those who have a hard time walking long distances.

Reviews.Title: “Very good "except"”
Reviews.Author: ivanb1945
Reviews.Content: The stay at the Rio in early May was very good. The check in went quick-10 minutes. Staff very helpful. Servers very quick also sang or danced. The room clean and had a good view. The only problem I had was -The shuttle bus to the strip did not start until 10 AM. and ended at 1AM. I was there a week and enjoyed myself totally.The show in the sky was something to see also. Will stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Hyepockets
Reviews.Content: The "suites" in this hotel are nothing more than an average hotel room a little bit larger than any other hotel room- with a couch. The rooms are very old and not updated. The towels and sheets are average. The temperature control in the room does not work, the temperature is the same no matter where you set it. There is no air circulation. The TV's are from the 90's. We could hear the people in the room above us moving chairs around in the middle of the night. For the money, one can do much better right on the strip and not have to ride a shuttle to get there. The famous seafood buffet was just average and not worth the $39 each. The minifridge had no controls and was barely cool. This room was not a good value, I would expect much more for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Vegas...”
Reviews.Author: edhones
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the Rio at least three times a year since 2004 and would not think of staying anywhere else. The people who run it and the people who work at the front desk are the best in Las Vegas... Looking forward to our next visit...

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly, not a good place to play poker.”
Reviews.Author: JB1981-30
Reviews.Content: Given that they host the biggest event in poker EVERY YEAR I went there under the false pretense that they would have a reasonably sized poker room and good tournament turnout. I played in several tournaments there this last week, only to show up when the tournament started and find out we didnt have enough players for more than ONE (1) table. Plus their poker room is the smallest of any I've played at in Vegas. All in all if you cant afford a "large" buy-in like they have at the Bellagio you may want to stay/play at the MGM (they have a daily $60 buy-in, which I played in the last time I went to Vegas... and they always had a good turnout, 80-120 people.) All that being said, if you want a cheap, but good room this place is still a nice choice. they have shuttles to the strip every 30 minutes (from 10am-1am daily), they are within walking distance to the Palms (which has excellent video poker/slots/comps), and you always have the option of catching a $8 cab to just about anywhere on the strip you would want to go.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay at The Rio ever again. Way better hotels in Vegas for the price!”
Reviews.Author: CandyCaneCA
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. I had previously stayed at this hotel three years ago and was pleased with the room. This time, the room was not so nice. Although I love the size of the room, every room is a suite. We stayed in the Ipanema tower on the 8th floor with a view of the pool and strip. The furniture was dirty, as was the carpet. The shower curtain smelled of mildew which is just so disgusting. There were two sinks in the bathroom. One of the sink's wreaked so bad whenever you ran it, just really grose. The beds weren't so comfortable and I woke up with a sore back unless I slept on my side. I am only 40 so it wasn't back problems that were an issue, it was the cheap mattress. The casino and property are kind of hokey, not up to Vegas standards for such a large resort. They do offer a free shuttle to the strip. Going into Paris Hotel and Planet Hollywood resorts just made me realize how dumpy The Rio really is for Vegas. The pool area was nice for the kids as they had a beach entry pool with waterfalls. They have about 4 pools total. The loud dance music that they have pumping all day was fun for a while, but after a few hours it was a bit annoying. I love loud music! But when the pool music is so loud like when you're in a club, it makes it hard to have any kind of conversation by the pool and not so relaxing. Three years ago they did not have the pumpin loud dance music all day by the pools, the sounds of the waterfalls were relaxing, well you can't hear the relaxing waterfalls anymore! Like I said, I don't mind the loud music, but not so loud where you have to shout in someone's ear to talk, like when you're in a club. All in all I would not stay here again. There are way too many other nicer resorts to stay in Vegas for the money..This resort is hokey..I gambled every night for two or more hours on the roulette and blackjack tables and seriously got one cocktail every two hours. Come on, the Venetian never let me go dry. Then again, Rio vs. Venetian, you get the idea..If you want a dark, hokey, drab casino and resort with stinky rooms then stay here. The only thing I really like about this place is the size of the rooms. If only they weren't so worn out and DIRTY..

Reviews.Title: “About to book another stay at the Rio in two weeks”
Reviews.Author: PBOSWAG
Reviews.Content: I just spent three nights at the Rio beginning May 5th. The overall hotel stay was nice. I usually stay at the South Point which is very nice but not close to the strip either. i prefer the South Point but I choose to save money on the room to allow for more spending out in town. Didn't wait to use the free shuttle service. The check in was terribly long. I believe it took about an hour. DO NOT PAY for the round trip shuttle service from the airport unless you have time to spare. Took about an hour and a half and of course the Rio was the last stop. I was impressed with the size of the room and the full sectional. Perfect for a group trying to save money. Not impressed with the tube television. but who watches TV in Vegas anyway?

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative to The Strip”
Reviews.Author: Chrissytank
Reviews.Content: Love the mini-fridge in every room. Great pool area, buffets and night life!

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory Stay with Kids”
Reviews.Author: rbsolo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four days and an additional night prior to departure with a two year old and nine year as a part of an trip to Las Vegas and Utah national and state parks. We were in the Ipanema tower for the beginning part and the Masquerade Tower for the last night. The rooms were comped, although we are not big time gamblers. We simply put in my wife's and my Total Rewards Cards while booking. We usually go to Atlantic City, NJ about once a year and had not been to Las Vegas for about 10 years. There was virtually no wait for check in at about 4:30 on a Saturday afternoon. Both rooms were clean, although the Masquerade Tower Room had a better view, it had that awkward bathroom window onto the bedroom that lets tons of light into the room while others are trying to sleep. Ipanema Tower especially was very quiet. We purchased an inexpensive coffee maker at Walmart before we checked in as well as staples for breakfast and occasional lunches. There is a medium sized fridge that was empty as well as a stocked mini bar we did not use. We ate a couple of times at the Gold Coast Port of Call Buffet next door, breakfast is an especially good deal and they have children's prices and made to order omelletes. Additionally we did an early morning bowling trip there too, since it is $1 a game before 8 AM during the week. We did trips to Death Valley and Rhyolite ghost town as well as Red Rocks Canyon. We also discovered a cool playground, Exploration Park on S. Buffalo Drive. The park has a short hike to a good view of the Las Vegas Valley. My wife, mother and 9 year old enjoyed seeing the Matsuri Show.Our only complaint is that we asked for adjoining rooms with my mother, who joined us for a few days, but they could not accomodate that request, but she was on the same floor. Pool area was satisfactory, with kids gravitating towards the pool with the imported sand. Music was somewhat loud at pool area, almost too loud to have a conversation. The walk from any self parking area to the rooms is always very far. We didn't do valet parking but would recommend it. We ate at the Texas Station and Aliente Station as well which were all very family friendly and reasonably priced buffets where there was something to please everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good luck getting any sleep”
Reviews.Author: heretotellyou
Reviews.Content: The bass coming from the Voodoo club and the bar in the casino makes it almost impossible to get any sleep. The beds are hard and not remotely comparable to what I've experienced at your basic Best Western. I travel extensively and this hotel, based on expressing my concerns with this management, cares more about the loud noise at the club than you being able to get any sleep. This hotel is for people that prefer to party and hit the clubs rather than get any sleep required for business.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel-beautiful room, great service, wonderful dining... terrible shower!”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasjunkie
Reviews.Content: Very satisfied with The Rio! Beautiful suite, over 600 square feet. Lots of room to spread out. Hotel was very up to date, modern decorations, everything was very clean. Only complaint about the room was the shower,terrible shower head produced NO water pressure and sprayed in every direction, ended up having to rinse my hair out in the sink! Casino offers lots of tables and slots. Table limits never dropped below $10, even during the morning, so not the place for your average casual gambler. I don't mind playing $10 but prefer to have the option to play $5. Sports book is focused on horse/dog races, so not alot of space to sit and watch games. Lots of dining options on the property. Buzios seafood is wonderful! Try the Miso Chilean Sea Bass, it's amazing! Great value for your money, 2 of us with soups, entrees, desserts, and beer/wine was $85. Service was wonderful as well. Wish I remembered our servers name, She was great. The buffet is good but offerings seem to be the same everyday. Lots of variety but wish we could have seen some different items from day to day. The All American Bar and Grille serves up delicious steaks! The filet was cooked to an absolutely perfect medium rare, the mashed yukon pototoes and green beans were the perfect compliment. Wish we'd had more than one meal here! Penn and Teller was a can't miss! Loved it. Penn delivers his trademark brand of witty conservative political humor. This show is highly recommended! We also went to the "Free show in the sky" over the casino, but don't go out of your way. It was mediocre at best. The Voodoo lounge on the 51st floor offers a view of the strip that is completely unbeatable! I've been to Vegas more times than I can remember, but seeing this view for the first time still took my breath away. Don't forget your camera, you're gonna want pictures of this view! If you're looking for a little variety, it's an easy walk to Gold Coast next door, or the Palms.

Reviews.Title: “LUV THE RIO”
Reviews.Author: rnphatpat
Reviews.Content: I Am A Frequent flyer to LAS VEGAS, and a huge fan of HARRAH'S NOW CESAR'S ENTERTAINMENT. I have stayed at all of HARRRAH'S properties in LAS VEAGS, and I LUV the RIO. I usualy stay in IMPANENA TOWERS which is close to all the action the casino , resturants, the shuttle,and shopping.The rooms are very nice and spacious you will not feel as if you are in a hotel . The service is great, the staff very helpful .You do not need to be on the strip to have a great time. It is located across the street from the Gold coast which I find very useful their gift shop has liquor, snacks , and personel items for half the cost. This works for me, I like to save my bank roll for gaming . All the rooms come with a mini fridge so you can save some leftover food items. Bring a travel coffee maker all of the rooms are not equipped with them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Time at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: big80sfun
Reviews.Content: I visit the Rio at least once or twice a year. This time, I was lucky enough to get a complimentary free upgrade to a 20th floor Impamena suite with a 50" flat screen tv and jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. The bed was amazingly comfortable and the tv in the bathroom mirror was a nice touch. The service at the hotel and casino is top notch. All of the dealers and staff were very friendly and it added to a great time! Surprisinlgy, they did not seem very busy at all, and table minimums were low ($5 to $10 depending on the game). Did pretty well on slots which was a nice plus! The only negative was that the Carnival World Buffet was not quite as good as its been in the past. The quality has gone down each year! All-American Bar and Grill was great!

Reviews.Title: “would go back, convenient and classy!”
Reviews.Author: lillyssa
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed here for 4 nights and we were happy with the location from the strip. Our room had a beautiful view and it was a huge suite. The bed and linens were super comfy. If you are active and like to walk, then stay at the Rio. It is perfect distance and the view from the hotel is gorgeous! I would recommend renting a car, which we did right from the lobby! It was so easy manuevering in and out of the Vegas traffic to get to and from the hotel. I personally loved the pool area, the service was great overall and scenary very entertaining. We were told that the seafood buffet was the best, but I think it was just average. There are other a la carte restaurants at the resort better worth trying. We would walk next door to TGIF for brekkie or brunch. The location is convenient for food and entertainment and the atmosphere classy for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Another "Pet Stay"”
Reviews.Author: SoCalBeachCitiesUSA
Reviews.Content: I've lost track of the number of times we've stayed at the Rio, perhaps 10 times. This was the second trip with the dog in the room. Unlike the first visit with the dog in the room this time there were treats and food and water bowls presented at check in and clean up bags were present in the "relief" area. I read a previous review complaining that the distance to the pet relief area is too far. It is a hike but the shortest route is to take a right turn from the elevator lobby and walk on the tile walkway on the perimeter of the casino to the escalator up to the second level, walk around the new Burger King Bar to the sky walkway out to the 4th level of the Masquerade parking structure and then take the stairway down four flights to the ground level. The pet relief area is on the North side of the Masquerade parking structure. From what I know the Rio has the only grass pet relief area, the other Caesars Entertainment properties use astro turf over concrete. As in my first Pet Stay review I recommend the even numbered rooms on the South side of the 4th floor of the Masquerade Towere. The odd numbered rooms on the 4th floor have the roof of the casino at the level of the window sills. (Floor 5 and above have floor to ceiling windows.) At check in I requested a South facing room and the desk clerk gave me the floor plan and explained that the hotel has only an East and a West side. She gave us a choice of an odd numbered room and an even numbered room. I just picked the even numbered room and didn't pursue her perceived lack of North and South sides to the Masquerade Tower. Now, this is the most important part of this review....the pet stay rooms have two thick plastic cards hanging on the door handle, the DND sign and a Dog In Room sign. The first time I left the room I noticed that the signs catch in the door jam and the door did not close. I casually moved the signs and closed the door again and thought nothing of it. The next day I left the room before my wife. She apparently did not notice the problem with the DND and Dog In Room signs catching in the jam but when I came back to the room the door was ajar. Packing up to leave the next morning we realized that we were missing a few small but expensive personal items. I suggest that all hanging signs be removed from the door handle as soon as you enter the room the first time or at least stand there in the hall each time while the door closes to make sure it actually closes. I reported the missing items to security and someone came up to take a report. The security officer called up maintenance to check the door lock. It was fine, I only recalled the DND and Dog In Room cards jamming the door open when maintenance said the lock was fine. CET contracts with a third party adjuster who determined that the theft wasn't their responsibility. I'm not overly pleased with that decision but the incident will not affect our future Las Vegas choices, we'll be back to the Rio again. Some more details about this stay. The staff was friendly, the room was clean and in good condition. The bed was comfy! There was a bleached out stain on the couch, that was the only flaw (aside from the DND and Dog In Room sign glitch) and totally inconsequential. We ate dinner Saturday evening at the Seafood Village Buffet. The bill was $78 for the two of us plus we left a fat tip. The food was good with the exception of what looked like tiny lobster tails cut in half, those were not good. The rest of the fish dishes and the crab legs were fine. The sides were fine. We'll do that again sometime, just maybe not the next visit though. Considering the room was comp'ed (we are Diamond Card level) and the Seafood Village Buffet was courtesy of Total Rewards points I'm awarding an over all grade of B.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!!”
Reviews.Author: davethegambler
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at the Rio, I don't know what some people are complaining about!! The room was great the staff was great and the food was awsome. The only thing I could complain about would be that it's not on the strip but I new that when I booked it.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Trip, and a Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcr0ss
Reviews.Content: I recently went for a conference at the hotel. The room was 600 square feet, and was comfortable and clean. It was a smoking room, and from past experience at other hotels, I brought some Febreze to freshen the room. I didn't need it. The room was wonderful, and the nighttime view was stunning and allowed me to see most of the strip. Remember to bring a kettle as the rooms don't have coffee makers. The staff (including the front desk, maids and waitresses) were all very accomodating and friendly. I was a little disappointed that the hotel didn't include free Internet, but this seems pretty common in Vegas. The hotel is off the strip, but there are free shuttles every 15 minutes or so to the Strip from 10am - 1 am. The Voodoo Bar on the top floor is the best view I could imagine of Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room”
Reviews.Author: mawdooms
Reviews.Content: We stay here because I get comped or pay a small fee. i have been staying here for 15 years. The rooms are huge, the biggest I have ever stayed in. Each room has a refrigerator, which is helpful because of the length of stay to keep beverages cold instead of messing with ice everyday. Sometimes the carpet seems nasty, but I always wear shoes in any hotel. But mostly the rooms are clean. The bed never agrees with my back because they are too soft. I always rent a car and like being off the strip because of all of the available back roads I use too get anywhere quick. They have the shuttle service to Harrah's which is convenient for easy access to the strip. As for the casino. I have never won any surmountalbe money on machines, too me seem far outdated. For the past 5-6 years I don't mess around too much on the machines, mostly tables. Drink service is below average.Pool area large, but music selection for younger people who don't care about their hearing. Not impressed with restaraunts, not into buffets.

Reviews.Title: “Don't bring your pet”
Reviews.Author: tacchino
Reviews.Content: We were surprised to find that there were several Vegas hotels that are listed as pet friendly. We ended up choosing the Rio and couldn't have regretted it more. True to advertising they did have treats and pet bowls in the room which was a nice touch but the big problem was the "pet relief" area. On their map they show that area just outside the casino doors, in reality it was at least another 1/4 mile down a long concrete path and across the street to a corner by the parking garage. All told, when the long walk through the casino is added in the trip was far to much to be done conveniently.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back in july !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoTonya
Reviews.Content: My very first time going to the Rio I thought that it was very beautiful. The food was great and the casino was awsome. My fiance and I came for an overnight trip, but ended up booking another trip for july. I am sooo excited. I am not really sure about the rooms because we were barely in them that remains to be seen. Anyway RIO here we come !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: _princeszskye_
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just recently got back from Vegas. We went from April 12-17 for a vacation and my birthday. All the employees we met were very professional and very polite, didn't have any issues with them. The room was HUGE I knew it would be a suite but I didn't think it would be that big. The bathroom had two sinks one in that actual bathroom and one in area I guess you would call the "make up" area which was nice when getting ready. We chose this hotel for the cheap price we got and we did know that it was off the strip so for the price it wasn't bad at all, especially that there is a free shuttle to two different parts of the strip, Bally's hotel and Harrah's hotel so it saved money on taking taxi's. We never walked to the strip so I'm not sure how long it would take, we did walk to the Palm hotel and that was about 10 minute walk not too far. The hotel had four pools in the one area which was nice. One was like a beach, actually had sand where the sun chairs were and a waterfall which was more for younger kids, the other three were where most of the adults hung out in, there were tons of seats. The only negatives I have was the hair dryer in the room while using it would stop working then start work about 5-10 minutes later so getting ready was kind of annoying and sometimes you could hear people flushing the toilet since it was kind of loud even in your own room and the whole hotel does smell of smoke and it was a little overwhelming at times when sitting at a table gambling. Besides those negatives I would recommend this hotel if you want cheap and don't care if your off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “No better view of The Strip !”
Reviews.Author: EuroCaliGuy
Reviews.Content: I remember staying at the Rio during business meetings and conventions right after it opened up. IT WAS A NON SMOKING HOTEL THEN ..... BUT NO LONGER ...... so it's best to bring a breathing guard with you if you plan to spend any time in the casino. I remembered that only the rooms ending in ODD NUMBERS face the Las Vegas Skyline, and my stay on the 15th floor was as good as always, now that I am enjoying retirement ... and the numerous times I watched the now deceased Danny Gans Show. I keep telling everyone I meet not to miss getting up on the deck (51st floor) of the VOODOO LOUNGE if for no other reason than to take in the BREATHTAKING VIEW OF THE LAS VEGAS BOULEVARD HOTEL ROW. SPECTACULAR. The front desk people are exceptional ... that is, as long as you treat them like human beings willing to assist you and make your stay comfortable. Jerry Menlo Park, CA

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed - Visit Vegas Regularly Too”
Reviews.Author: Happy25thAnniversary
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Vegas almost 20 times and have stayed in a variety of hotels. We were very disappointed with some of the aspects of the Rio. When we arrived, we did get upgraded to a "new room" in the Impanada tour. When we walked down the hall to our room (last room on left of hall), a bag of towels and a room service tray were sitting the hall. When we opened our door, we could smell cigarette smoke. Room was nice though and very large. My husband went to use the safe and it was not working. Called down and maintenance arrived within 10 minutes and fixed it! Went to the Whopper Bar for dinner and were very disappointed. Thought it was a "put your own fixing on burger" type bar. Next morning I went straight to check in to let them know about the stuff in hall and smell in room. Front desk clerk was very nice and accommodating. Since hotel full couldn't move us right away and we weren't going to be there anyway so she said she would have the room "sprayed" so the smell out be removed. Also she would make sure stuff in hall taken care of. Return later that night to a great smelling room. Next day, same 2 situations-room service trays in hall and cigarette smell. We are sure the people in the room adjoining ours (had the adjoining door) were smoking. Let the front desk know again up check out and they gave us a $30 credit on our room (was only paid $90 for the entire stay). Also very disappointed in table game selection. Howevver, can't say enough about all the staff from front desk clerk, maintenance guy and dealers, all very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: “I liked this place”
Reviews.Author: ChecinskiM
Reviews.Content: At first I was a little skeptical to stay off of the strip, but I was pleasantly surprised. They provide a free shuttle, which runs every 30 minutes from the hotel to the strip. It's a short 5-10 minute ride. The pools were great and there are plenty of restaurants to select from. We had a standard room, but found it to be larger than your typical room size. The room was clean and comfortable. One problem...not free internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Manager Bad Attitude”
Reviews.Author: gasgoelzer
Reviews.Content: Upon check out we told the checkout person that our rooms were never cleaned the day before. This after we were told two times by a woman cleaning other rooms on our floor that they would be getting to our rooms soon. After waiting almost two hours we finally had to ask for towels just to shower for dinner. Not quite an hour later we left our rooms and again were assured that our rooms would be cleaned. Needless to say, when we returned hours later, not cleaned. When front desk clerk went to charge us ($44 insignificant amount) we asked her to waive that since we had to shower with towels we gathered from the floor, since no time because of early flight. She said she couldn't. Asked for her manager purely for the principle. We waited over 15 minutes and when Kathrine (Manager) came out she made us repeat the entire story even though the other gal had already told her. Then she said that Housekeeping notes said that we 'refused service'. Told her that was a lie, 100%. She said she agreed that it was unacceptable that our rooms were not cleaned but that she could only take $30 of the $44 off. Maximum amount she was allowed???? When we were completely confused, she got major attitude and asked if we wanted the $30 or not, etc. We told her we were now late for our flight so we would take it up later. As if we care about the $14. We'd spent thousands in the three days prior on gambling, food and drinks. It was just the principle and her attitude. I've written a couple of these same explanations but so far no one has bothered to acknowledge them. Result is that we'll never stay at Rio again. Not that anyone at the Rio cares. P.S. All those descriptions below don't include tacky and tasteless (degrading dancers in g-strings).

Reviews.Title: “what a gong show!”
Reviews.Author: angelsinmygarden_88
Reviews.Content: if you like thieves and cheats stay and play at the RIO! omg the poker room is a #%& show .. doesn't matter what kind of abuse you what to take they'll dish it all out. Players that coluld with others or take their chips off the table. verbal and physical abuse is another sweet treat these idiots dish serve up for your playing pleasure. Really I felt like I could be involved in a hiest or gun battle from the side entrance at any given moment. With all the good places to stay and play in Vegas people DON'T get sucked into any of their advertizing of wsop because no one of integirty would play under those conditions. WORST VACTION EVER

Reviews.Title: “Great Front Desk Staff. Good Balance for Mid Level Gamblers. Ok Rooms - No complaints”
Reviews.Author: BlueBirdDay
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Death Valley tired and walked in to the Rio (after a 10 min walk through the Casino of course from the parking garage as all casinos do) to find a winding line that looked like it would take 2 hours. Oh My. I was unhappy. But then again, I got a $49 room rate in the height of spring break. Thankfully, all of the front desk was staffed. At my guess it had to be 10 or so front desk staff and the line went quickly (30 minutes). The hotel recognizes when they are going to be popular and prepared for it. Good for them - and this was a Sunday night too. Furthermore, they had employees walking around to offer bottles of water for free and the dancers dancing to different songs/ on various areas around the casinos at 15 min intervals which I have never seen before at any other casino. That went on all night.. Ok it might have been a little cheesy, but I say that b/c I am a girl so I don't necessarily care about that stuff, but it added some energy to the check in time and made you look forward to your night ahead and reminded you, that YES, you are in Vegas. And these are their employees so perhaps they are getting to do something extra which they love, on top of serving drinks. How employers treat their employees makes a huge difference on the client's experience IMO. As far as the casino/bars/restaurants, the hotel doesn't come across as a depressing get drunk/lose your money hotel with a bunch of depressed people. All of the staff and clients seemed to be having fun. The room was ok. Very dated. I didn't care. It was my gateway to home the next day. Would I book this as a romantic outing. Probably not. And they call it suites, but its basically a big room. The one thing I found odd was the window from the shower to the living room? Wierd. Backtracking - when I got to the front, I could not have been more happy w/the front desk girl. Really - after staying at the top of line to the bottom (Four Seasons to Sahara), I have never had better service and that's tough to say after waiting in line for 30 minutes. The girl asked me if I had any special requests. I told her (not thinking she would accomodate), that I just wanted to be close to the elevator and close to my garage b/c I had a very early flight the next day. WOW! She accomodated both. She asked where I was parked, and I didn't know there were two garages, so that was important. And I was given a room two doors down from the elevator. I was out the next morning in 10 minutes! That is huge given how HUGE these are hotels are. So thank you RIO for staffing good people. I had so much fun that night gambling. Met a great balance of people at the $15 tables. Fun, Energy - Good times. Bottom Line, if you have been to Vegas and value, gambling and service is important to you versus proximity to the strip - stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, too loud, slow $14 internet.”
Reviews.Author: Aseries
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas but we are veterans of Native American Casinos in several states. Like all casinos it was too loud. The All-American Bar & Grill "background music" (horrible) was so loud conversation was difficult at best. All we could hear was the bartenders yelling at each other. Food/service was OK. NCAA Final Four game came on TV and sound level went to health-threatening. Back in the Queen of Nightlife corner the background music is so bad as to be laughable as well as too loud. After All-American we didn't want to chance the other venues. We had breakfast at the BK or Marie Callander's down Flamingo Blvd. Our room was outstanding for 3 days. For $14 a day the "highspeed internet" was slow when it worked at all. The gaming was typical...no problem there. I liked the location off "the strip" and found parking to be convenient. We thoroughly enjoyed the Penn and Teller show. The theater is very nice. All the services were very convenient and professional. We would consider a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!”
Reviews.Author: newyorkmeth
Reviews.Content: I hadn't been to Vegas in almost 20 years and really didn't know what to expect. Staying at the Rio was the best part of this experience. It may not be on the strip, but I really didn't have to be there to enjoy this trip. The Rio had all of the amenities needed to make it seem as though it was a resort just shy of the hustle and bustle and crazyness on the strip. If I felt that I need that, there were accessible shuttles to the strip that left every half hour. Everyone was friendly and it was extremely clean and quiet. The bed was way more comfortable than my own. I can't wait to experience the Rio again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: AGentlRose
Reviews.Content: Our vacation at the Rio was unexpected--- We had been booked for 5 nights at the Monte Carlo (see review), but the Monte Carlo was so disgusting, that we checked out after one night. I was able to secure this last minute reservation at the Rio. We checked in and were immediately given a room at 10:30 AM. The room/suite was beautiful. Since we had previously stayed at The Rio, I knew the furnishings were new. The room/suite had a king bed, with a living area (couch/coffee table) as well as a desk with both wireless and wired internet -- which worked, unlike the Monte Carlo. There was even a mini-fridge in the room for no extra charge. Everything worked fine (A/C, internet, TV), and my only suggestion would be that the Rio invest in new large screen TVs with more selection of channels. The room was a good size and most importantly, the beds were comfortable. Housekeeping was always prompt and everything was impeccable. We ate several times at the hotel and everything was good, we gambled a little at their casino and for the first time I won at the Rio. There weren't too many cocktail servers servicing the slot areas and I guess it is because like everywhere else, they are cutting down on employees. We saw the free Masquerade in the Sky show on Friday and Saturday, however there were no shows on Sunday or Monday, so I'm guessing their cutting back on that too. I would definitely stay at the Rio and recommend it as long as you have a car since it is off the Strip. However, they do have shuttles that go to Harrah"s and Caesar's Palace, which I cannot comment on because we didn't use them, but they are available. Also another nicety is that they have Pet Suites if you want to bring a pet with you. We didn't have our pets with us, but it is nice to know that they would be welcomed here.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk was a total nightmare, and I get the impression this is constant at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: connorkl
Reviews.Content: The hotel "lost" my priceline reservation, so it took over an hour and a half to get my room. The room smelled like an ash tray and was really dingy with old furniture, fixtures, and stained carpet. The bathroom had a tacky 1970s window surrounded by a mirror into the room which meant if you used the restroom in the night the light would shine in on your sleeping spouse. The view of the mountains was nice though. Automatic checkout was broken in the morning, so the line for the front desk took 35 minutes. Then because they still hadn't figured things out with priceline they took another hour to figure things out. When we left we were assured that our card would not be charged, but then I get home from the vacation and found that I was charged anyway. I wasted 3 good hours of my vacation on these folks, when I could have just stayed over at the Flamingo which was three times nicer without the headache.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Blues”
Reviews.Author: NotYourUsualJAP
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio back in 2004 and was very happy, but this trip wasn't so great. The room was on the 17th floor in the Masquerade Tower. When we walked to the room there were garbage bags and bags with soiled linen lining the hallway. They were still there 4 hours later after dinner. The bed was awful...so bad..the springs could be felt underneath the bedding. The carpeting and sofa looked dingy and dirty, the make-up mirror wouldn't work, the fridge made an awful noise. I was also surprised that there was no free Wi-Fi, and no free fitness room. Most hotels offer these. They wanted $22 per day for the fitness room, and $14 for Wi-Fi. Sorry, but it's Vegas - we're placing hundreds in the machines...give your customers some courtesy. Go stay at the Southpointe instead for a lovely room, comfy bed, and reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: mbberven
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a 4 day, 3 night stay at the Rio. I was there for a conference, overall great stay: The good: Service-Check in was smooth, friendly staff at the desk. Cocktail waitresses were attentive and friendly. I gambled in multiple locations that week, the waitstaff on the casino floor of the Rio were the best! Room-Your standard room or "suite" was fairly roomy and clean. Ample counter space in the bathrooms, couch and chairs, table. Housekeeping did a great job, my room was cleaned and restocked by the time I returned from the conference each day. A big plus for me was there is an actual fridge in the rooms that you can use! Unheard of so far for me in Vegas. Shuttles-The Rio has shuttles that travel between Rio/Ballys and Rio/Harrahs about every 15-30 minutes until 1am. This went very smoothly, we never had to wait more than 5 minutes! Dining- I only ate at the Rio twice, once at Gaylord India Restaurant, the food and service was great. My husband and I returned to the Rio after the conference (we stayed in Vegas a few more nights) and ate at the Seafood Buffet, again food and service was great! Overall I had a great time at the Rio. The atmosphere was lively, we saw the "Show in the Sky" on Friday night, this is free and fun entertainment! The only drawback would be the location as it's not in the strip and really not within walking distance. The Palms is fairly close, however I did not get a chance to venture over there. Shuttles run until 1am, otherwise a cab to the strip is about $10. We would definately stay at the Rio again for part of our trip. It's kind of fun to move around and try out different hotel/casinos, but thus far the Rio rooms are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Was worth the wait”
Reviews.Author: retrosingle
Reviews.Content: I have waited 20 years to stay at the Rio and it was worth the wait. Check in was easy and quick although my room wasnt ready and i didnt think it would be i got there at 10 am. It was ready in about an hour though i went and picked up my key . There was a line for that they were having a convention there but the wait was worth it to me. My room was nice had a retro feel to it as far as furniture went. Bed was comfy bathroom was nice and big. My only complaint is the casino is too dark i think it needs more light. Other than that the food at the Carnival Buffet was good lots to choose from. The staff was wonderful and friendly. I would stay here again and i recommend it to anyone. They also have a shuttle that goes to the strip they run every 15 minutes to half hour .

Reviews.Title: “Great help from the front desk”
Reviews.Author: Bookstore_11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Vegas frequently and stay on the strip. This time we decided to save a few $$ and try off strip and enjoy the luxury of a suite. We checked in real late and had lots of extra luggage. The front desk agents were real busy and the Supervisor "Chris" waved us over and checked us in himself. This young guy was so nice and efficient it made the start of a "very pleasant stay" even more enjoyable. We stayed on property the whole 4 days and had a grand time. We will come back when the pool is open for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Neat huge room but with old furniture”
Reviews.Author: starnite000
Reviews.Content: We spent a long time in the queue waiting to check in. They only had 1 person at the counter doing check in stuffs while there were about 20 people queuing up. After a long time, thankfully 2 other staffs joined in and sped up the process. It was St Patrick day, I suppose this explains why there are more people celebrating in Vegas. The room is big with a sofa and coffee table, but it is not like a real suite with full kitchen facilities. It has ironing board and fridge though. The dressing area is also big with lots of lighting, so doing your makeup there is really easy. Bed is comfortable and clean. However, tv is old and non-flat screen. Loved the full length window which gives us nice night views from our bed. Overall feeling is that, it is an old hotel but clean place to stay in. We tried the seafood buffet from the hotel. Worth a try! Car is really needed as this hotel is far from the strip. I wouldn't feel like walking back to hotel alone after I'm done with shopping while my husband is still in the casino somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MelissaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for a conference last week. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Although the hotel and casino is a bit dated you can tell its an older casino the rooms were very large and our view was amazing half was the strip and half was the mountains! We stayed in the masquere tower where one wall was all windows!! We finally went to Voodoo Lounge on the last night and had a great time really good DJ that played a lot of kinda old school with new hip-hop also an awesome outdoor patio with a great view of the strip!! Not sure we will stay here again just because it is off the strip and we want to check out the newer resorts. The shuttle comes and goes every 30mins and its free the drivers very friendly aswell.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star”
Reviews.Author: carlbsnyder
Reviews.Content: Stayed Mar 20-23 ,2011 on a vacation package deal. Was very dissapointed in room and location. I got a room in the Ipanema tower, 11th floor. Very old room, frayed carpet, old tv , no coffee pot (only for VIP rooms). Food options were average food but very expensive, i.e Seafood Buffet $42 pp Breakfast buffet $15 pp. Hotel located way away from any other resturant options. Internet was extra $14/day, local calls $1.25. ...... $15 minimun was the lowest blackjack table I saw. Carl S.

Reviews.Title: “Best During Weekdays”
Reviews.Author: mab313
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Rio for a combined Trade Show and mini vacation in Mid-March. First off, this would not be my hotel of choice if not for the fact our room was part of the trade show package. Rio's location really is a pain in the neck if you like to get out and explore other casinos or resturants. It is just far enough off the strip, on the other side of I-15, that walking is really not a good idea. So, you are left with either a cab or the Harrah's Shuttle-free, but be prepared to wait. We were there on March Madness Weekend, and the shuttle would often fill-up before you can get on. And, of course, no standing! We also made the mistake of checking in on a Friday night. Sorry to the residents of the Golden State, but Friday night is Calif. Invasion night in Las Vegas. A fine crowd-I must have counted at least 10 kids under 5, and 4 coolers-on-wheels in the check-in line. What is with parents bringing young kids and babies to a casino? The Rio, in great preparation for the big bump in weekend check-ins, had 3-count em-3 positions open for check-ins! Of course, each check-in seemed to take 20 minutes. The rooms are one of Rio's strengths. The are big, much bigger than most standard Strip rooms. I recommend the older Ipanema Tower-I think it is quieter and smaller. Besides, there is a great store and a Starbucks right by the elevators. You will need the Starbucks because in keeping with LV Hotel un-written rules, NO Coffemakers in rooms! The rooms were clean, the beds nice. I am not a big fan of watching TV in the room while in Vegas, so I didn't mind the 10 yr. old fashioned TV in the console thing. Guess Harrahs Corp. has not been clued in on flatscreens yet. Internet connection in the room was fast, and expensive at $13.95/day. They do have mini bars and refrigerators. Two bathroom sinks also. The property has a lot of eating options-we only ate at the All-American Grill-pretty good burger type joint. The do have a great pool area, although too cold to use this time. If you want to work out, be ready to shell out $22 for use of the Fitness Ctr. Now, the casino. I have to say it is in serious need of renovation/expansion. It is small to other place's standards, and is lacking in a lot of games you may like. For example, we could not find one 5¢ Video Poker machine(yea we are real high-rollers)-very common in other Harrahs places. After the Sunday night exodus by the weekend crowd, the Rio became more livable, more a business hotel the rest of the week. So, although this is not a dump like the Riviera, I would say try the Flamingo, Ballys or Monte Carlo for a nicer mid-level priced hotel in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely!, Better Hotels Than This One!”
Reviews.Author: mineandthree
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, needs updating, (also, towels and wash rags were not up to par, with cleaning system they use) Stayed at Rio because of pool and bowling lanes. Upon arriving, Pool/Bowling Lanes both closed. (Did not state closures anywhere on their site. (Even if they were open, we would have bowled at other hotels.) While there, explored same priced hotels, which were new or newer, with pool/bowling lanes, ALL open. Nothing teenager friendly comparable to many others in the area! Too smokey….Not that most aren’t….The Rio more so! Will not be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Got a great room with 800 sq. ft.”
Reviews.Author: Woodpecker48
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation in December and got a great $50/night rate. When I checked in I was offered the opportunity to upgrade to a suite for an additional $75/night. Needless to say, I declined the upgrade offer. The room was great! King bed, large sectional sofa, great view, clean as a whistle, quiet as a mouse!
