Great place to stay, great food, shopping, wild nightly free entertainment. On my last visit to Las Vegas, I stayed at the Luxor and this was much, much nicer. I'll look for more of their great rates for a future stay!

Reviews.Title: “Worst exsperiance ever”
Reviews.Author: LeahWynn
Reviews.Content: I had hair in my food and they served me the wrong breakfast all together. The waitress had a horrible attitude and didn't check on us so she didn't know she gave me the wrong thing for over a half an hour and was completely rude about it. We went to the palms for the play boy club and were treated very nicely only to end the night at voodoo and I was assaulted by a bouncer... I returned to St. Louis with bruises wear he grabbed me. I wasn't even drinking I was taking pictures of the view, he should have never laid a finger on me. I will never return to a Harrah's, Rio, Caesars palace again. When I e-mailed about my bruises I got a generic e-mail back from corporate... Wow thanks

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, large room”
Reviews.Author: Fusebuddy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here Feb 23-25 for a convention. The room was very large, a nice surprise. Full couch, chair, coffee table. I think most will be pleased with this place. If you can wait until the week prior to your arrival as I did, the price of the rooms drop fast. Although each night was billed at a different rate, I averaged $90 for the three nights. Far below the quoted price 3 months prior to the event. Only a couple of complaints. No in-room coffee, which sucked. You must ride the elevator to the ground floor, where conveniently, there is a coffee vendor... Very obvious that this was a setup for the rental of that space to the coffee purveyor. My other complaint was the 250 lb TV. Old style behemoth. They need to get some flat screens in there, if so, it would have really been a top notch experience. So not much to complain about here, very nice rooms with great views. Although I never like the big casino hotels, you have to walk a mile to get to your car or the restaurants, they're all the same that way. Lastly, I would like to say the service at all the resaurants was very good. I had three meals, very prompt wait staff.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are very old and raggedy, feeling dirty”
Reviews.Author: trav_tur
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was extremely outdated - ancient furniture, wallpaper covered in suspicious stains, filthy looking and stretched out carpet.. The shower was really outdated too - with cheap shower head and old style glass doors that looked unclean. As I pulled the door by the handle, the frame separated from the glass. The bed had a very uncomfortable, lumpy mattress, cheap uncomfy pillows and comforter. The only suite-like thing about that room was its decent size. In addition, at night, the music noise from the downstairs bar was unbearable, despite the fact that our room was on 38 floor. The promised "high speed" internet was extremely slow and unusable The casino was overpriced for an off-strip location, the restaurants and bars gave us the same raggedy feeling as the room

Reviews.Title: “would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: johnrtn
Reviews.Content: spent too much time getting shuttled back and forth, no atmosphere unless you are crusising for a one night stand! the food is way too expensive, 24.00 for 2 drinks, our room was not very clean-no security in sight, kids all over, and we were charged a fee by the rio everytime I used my bank card-incurred 28.00 in fees, way better off to use cash here-if you can afford the 15.00 for 2 starbucks every morning-will never stay there again-way different from 15 years ago!!! found 1.00 margaritas at casino royale near Harrah's on the strip and 1.50 beer at Hooters, both with a much funner atmosphere and fun people! just a matter of time before the Rio is gone too---

Reviews.Title: “This will be my 4th consecutive stay!”
Reviews.Author: Gizzie11
Reviews.Content: I have reservations in April. It will be my 4th consecutive stay. The rooms are spacious. They have a mini fridge in the room which is a great convenience. I enjoy going to the casinos off of the strip. Access to I-15 is easy. Convenient to great shopping. I have stayed at many Vegas hotels. I enjoy Rio. I am low maintenance so I do not require much. Give me a comfy, spacious room and a nice pool and I am happy. The service is very good too. I recommend this hotel to all.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CRNBRY3
Reviews.Content: I recently spent 6 nights at the RIO. I was pleasantly surprised with the size of the rooms. Very large, sofa, refrigerator, desk with two chairs, two benches to sit luggage on, dressing area, large closet and dresser, two sinks, plenty of sink counter space. My bathroom was cleaned very well every day. Beds were comfortable as well as a variety of pillows to chose from. Shuttle is a nice convenience, had to wait sometimes but not more than maybe 15 minutes. Food was OVERPRICED and the quality nothing great. If you want water or soda for your room get it on the strip at the CVS or Walgrens and take back with you. I went into the 97 cent store and it was 2 btls for $2 vs $3 for one bottle at the hotel. Conference area was very nice. Make sure you go to the VOO DOO bar on the 51st floor and check out the view, it's incredible and I'm certain it's the best view in Vegas! Swimming pool looked great however, it wasn't opened yet when I was there. I've stayed at Ceasar's in the past and while the RIO is not on the same level as that I would still consider it doable for a stay in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Maintenance & front desk supervisor didn't care”
Reviews.Author: Smores423
Reviews.Content: We checked in & got our suite on the 28th floor. Only stayed 1 night. the roon security door latch was so bent up it was useless, Honor bar door latch broken so cabinet wouldn't stay closed, lighted makeup mirror wouldn't work, an access wall panel kept falling off the wall unless we proped it up with the ice bucket, Stains on carpet, Hairs in tub, Honor bar frig not working, On the up side nice view. When I checked out the next morning I mentioned the room problems to the front desk supervisor & he didn't bother to write doen any of it to be repaired, How Very SAD! I was there on 2/22/2011 in room 28014. NEVER AGAIN. Sams Town is leaps & bounds above the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend to Everyone”
Reviews.Author: flaminglildevil
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas was 4 years ago for a conference and fell in love with the hotel. 3 years later and it's at the Rio again and I still love it!!!! I even flew my family up to stay with me for a longer trip. Im even going back for Spring Break i didn't mind taking the shuttle to the other casinos. I also like that you can purchase a 24 hour buffet bracelet and can be used at 7 other casinos. It saved us a lot of money. I wasn't looking for a high fancy hotel due to the fact we were hardly there but all the surroundings and the rooms were great and spacious. I will recommend to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “It was what it was”
Reviews.Author: ckrystek
Reviews.Content: Okay stay, arrived right at 4, check in time, took about 10 minutes to get through line, no complaints, requested non smoking, 2 queens, strip facing thats what i was told what we had, but room smelt like last person had. even ash trash were in the room, which seems strange for a non smoking room. Called down to confirm it was non smoking, no other rooms available do to nascar weekend....they said they could de-otorize our room, yeah right, im sure theyll get right on that. No one ever showed to do anything about it. Room was also facing palms, thats not the strip, but no big deal, just not what we reserved. Anyways, we just let it go, wasnt going to let that ruin our good time. Old TV's in room, couldnt even read bottom line on ESPN, they need to be upgraded. Fridge, Mini Bar, Coffee Pot, Burnt out light bulbs, all were present in our room. No problems with shuttle, both times we went to take it, it was on site, and had no waiting time. Have no real complaints, nothing special here, checking it off of list of hotels stayed at, and thats about it. Probably won't be back unless free.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate accommodations, fair price”
Reviews.Author: Swandling
Reviews.Content: The king-size suite at the Rio is a nice size room. Cleanliness leaves something to be desired. I didn't feel good walking barefoot on the carpet after stepping on what turned out to be a gummy wet spot near the bathroom. Could have been spilled nailpolish, but how did this get missed by housekeeping? I tried 2 dining spots here -- Gaylord India and the all American burger joint. Both had decent vegetarian selections. The Gaylord was exquisite. The hotel grand areas, like hallways to convention areas, are beautifully crafted and maintained well. The front desk staff are impatient, like they're overwhelmed by the volumes of people they deal with. Efficient, yes, but speak a mile a minute and seem impatient with repeating information. Rio is off-the-strip, with a free shuttle to the strip. I did not take advantage of the shuttle, was too busy with the conference, but I heard it was a nice convenience. I know this is Vegas so I understand the adult entertainment atmosphere is a big draw for many, but it seemed very 'in your face' at this hotel with the monitors and posters displayed in the monitor. Oh, the fitness center costs $22/day!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY”
Reviews.Author: jac1822
Reviews.Content: Room was smelly and the furniture old; the picture on the main page does not represent the room we were given. The mattress was hard as a rock as were the pillows. But I really got upset on the last day my mom was bit by something and was bleeding slightly on her leg. I looked at the bed to see if there were any bed bugs and saw tiny blood smears, even on places she did not sit. I called houskeeping, who refered it ito security. Security took a report but that was about it. I wish I took a photo but I just wanted to get out.

Reviews.Title: “very disappointed Fairfield”
Reviews.Author: ajali
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed. The food was way to expensive in the restaurants for what you got. The food was not as good as it should have been. When we checked in they did not let us know where to sign in to get the coupon book, we had to find it out on our own they just said we do not have any at this time. I tried to take a hot bath in the evening and could not get the water hot, just luke warm. Then they tried to charge me for some of the items in the mini bar which was totaly way to much money. I would not recommend this place. And then they want to charge you for internet access NO WAY

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel - No Real Complaints”
Reviews.Author: sdballer25
Reviews.Content: It was the host hotel for a softball tournament. Thought it was a pretty standard hotel--the room was big but not super nice. Had to take cabs everywhere since it was a little bit off the strip, but it wasn't too much of an issue. No major issues with the check in or service. The casino was pretty nice-friendly employees and a good layout, but again nothing that fancy.

Reviews.Title: “very disapointing place for a family with children”
Reviews.Author: Pogue0
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our daughter, her husband and two daughters ages 8 and 12 stayed four nights. The rooms were dusty. the carpet stained. Upon arrival I dropped a small piece of broken plastic on the floor. Due to a bad back I did not bend over to pick it up. Four days later it was still there. The carpet in the elevator waiting area was stained and loosely bunched inviting someone to trip. One evening my daughter and family went out returning about midnight. Housekeeping never attended to their room, the beds were still not made. They were out of toilet paper and called for some. She advised about the room situation and was told they just didnt get to it, then was asked if she wanted the room cleaned the following day. When they came she asked for a light bulb around the bathroom mirror be replaced as it had burned out. The bulb was removed but no replacement leaving a vacant electric hole for the 8 year old to explore. The coffee shop closes at one pm and serves only breakfast. The only lunch option is the deli sports bar. All the other restaurants only open for dinner and the menus are not family (kids) oriented. When I checked in I was offered an upgrade to a diamond suite for an additional tweny dollars a night which I accepted. I just happened to speak to a lady who was staying in the same tower, a few floors below me who said they didnt have a coffee maker. I guess thats what my extra twenty paid for. The buffet was ok but not near the advertising it was given. Anyone who has dined at the Belaggio buffet can attest to that. All in all we were very disapointed with our experience which we will definetly not repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Meh.”
Reviews.Author: inklover
Reviews.Content: On the positive side, the room was very spacious and had great floor-to-ceiling windows. My room was very quiet, in the Masquerade tower, and far from the elevators. On the negative side, there was no coffee maker in the room. The pool was closed for the season and to use the fitness center was going to coast $22.50! The hotel is not on the strip and the walk to get to the strip though not that far, is along an 8 lane highway and not at all pleasant (yes, I tried it one day). Also, as it is an older hotel/casino it does not the same effective air filtering systems that the newer places have. A walk through the lobby/casino from my room to get to the convention center meant that I always smelled like smoke. Overall, it was fine...but I would not choose to stay here again (and in fact did not choose it - was there for a trade show).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and casino...off the Las Vegas Strip”
Reviews.Author: NYCtravelboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed just one night at the Rio. Haven't stayed there for over ten years. Was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed it. Arrived at 10am and immediately got into a nice suite with a good strip view. Room was very spacious and was remodeled from my last trip. (Unlike Paris, which still is holding onto its 1999 decor). The room had two big beds; a desk; sofa; a kitchenette; a big closet; sink/vanity; plenty of drawer space; a nice lockbox and a decent size bathroom. Only real downfalls: It is off the strip. Have to drive to other strip attractions And the walls were thin. We heard a lot of conversations. For one weekend night, at a cheap rate we got on Hotwire, I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Bedbugged
Reviews.Content: Very large rooms and comfortable beds, but no coffee makers in the rooms (I suspect to make sure that you spend lots of money at Starbucks in the lobby), and annoyingly the valuables safe was not big enough to take a laptop. There is a wide choice of restaurants in the casino/lobby area on the ground floor, but I thought that they were all very expensive for what they offered.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio offers beautiful and comfortable rooms, but too far away from the downtown area where we prefer to stay and play”
Reviews.Author: Bigbill69
Reviews.Content: My wife and I go to Vegas every fall with friends and usually stay in one of the downtown hotels (the Four Queens or the Golden Nugget). For a change, we decided to try one of the off-strip and away from downtown hotels and got a good deal at the Rio. The Rio is an all suites hotel and, as far as comfort goes, is top notch. The rooms are spacious and the beds are comfortable. Luxury is not a consideration for us when we go to Vegas, but we felt the rooms were comparable to one stay at the Bellagio. If you like con- vience to the other casinos though, I wouldn't recommend the Rio because of the loca-tion. We decided that be would rent a car and visit some of the casinos in Henderson and also have transportation to downtown. I judge a casino by the kind of slot machines that I like to play on, and the Rio really didn't offer me anything. My wife and friends loved the Rio Buffet, but I thought that it was way over priced. I prefer the buffet at the Main Street Station for the food quality and the price. My favorite place to eat though is the steak special at Ellis Island. It's really a small, redneck casino, but like Jeff Foxworthy says about rednecks, "I are one!"

Reviews.Title: “My most horrible hotel experience, ever.”
Reviews.Author: Kiwigirl59
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the hotel at 7PM to check-in. The guy gave me a card for my room on the 32nd floor (I had requested a quiet room). After walking through the hotel"maze" to my assigned room, there was a sign on the door saying "Do Not Enter, WET FLOOR". Went back down again through the "maze" to tell them that I couldn't stay in a room with a wet carpet. A girl (Maria) came over, claiming to be the supervisor. I told her about the wet carpet. Her response was " Sooo.. that's not my fault, housekeeping doesn't tell us that kind of stuff" I get a new room card and head off again through the "maze" to the 30th floor. As I come out of the elevator, I can hear a tv blasting away down the hall and I think to myself " I sure hope that's not anywhere near my room". It's the room next to mine but there is also a connecting door, and the noise is comming straight into the room through the door. Back down again through the "maze", with my bags. I tell the alleged supervisor Maria, about the loud tv and the connecting door. She rolls her eyes at me and says " It's Superbowl night, you've arrived too late (I had booked ahead with a 6PM arrival time) and besides you didn't pay full price for the room, it's a package rate". I booked through their web site and paid the price stated and now I was expected to accept either a wet room or a noisy one. I was pretty angry at this point, mainly with her stroopy, arrogant and indifferent attitude. She than offers me another shot at a room on the 19th, but got really annoyed when I asked if it was a Non-Smoking room. Her response was " If you don't like the room on the 19th floor, you're welcome to leave". By this time I'd had enough, so I left. Rio has the customer service equivalant of a cheap budget airline. It's not bad for everyone, but when there's a problem, their worst attitude comes through. This Maria, seems to have got all her hospitality industry training from watching re-runs of John Cleese in "Fawlty Towers". She did him proud!! One final point, don't stay there unless you are planning on catching a taxi every time you want to go out. It's NOT pedestrian friendly, their shuttle is unreliable and they make you walk all over the place to get from the entrance to the bus stop.

Reviews.Title: “Terrorist not tourist!.........”
Reviews.Author: albrazier
Reviews.Content: I arrived off the red eye & was impressed with my suite...the next morning i woke jet lagged & as the sun was up i thought i'd take a few holiday snaps of the hotel......I was outside taking the pix when a security man accosted me & told me to stop...when i asked why he said "Terrorism." I told him that he was a little over zealous but put my camera away.....As i walked away he came running back & said "They want some ID now!" By now i'd had enough & told him what i thought & thanked him for the warm welcome.........Coupled with the $14 per day internet & the $44 charge they stiffed me for a long distance call to my wife for a few minutes i would'nt stay there again......PS.I took lots of snaps up the strip of better looking casinos without any hassle!

Reviews.Title: “So it wasn't built yesterday”
Reviews.Author: misLtoe
Reviews.Content: I think that maybe a little paint and carpet changes would go a long way but the rooms, though older, were kept clean. We had a standard suite and the room was extremely spacious Staff was very courteous and helpful. It is off-strip but the shuttles ran every half hour and we always found them reliable and easy to use. If you are a little more adventurous, there is a bus stop right in front coming from the strip (also very easy to use). Even though the hotel is older and could do with a few modest face lifts, the size and value were well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great suite, plenty of room for grandson to run around.”
Reviews.Author: mela45
Reviews.Content: Very nice hote. Great view. Bring your own coffee maker as they do not provide on in the room. Aside from that I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: im_in_miami_2010
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 5 night stay at the rio in las vegas. i've stayed at the rio before - at least 5 years ago - and got a great deal then for $50/night for a suite. i was looking for a similar deal when returning to vegas this time. rio did not disappoint! i traveled for my birthday - and let the guy at the check in counter know this - he upgraded me to a strip view suite and also only charged my card $100 for a 6 day stay when he could have held $600 - very nice - so i would have more $ to have fun with! the room was updated, large, clean, with an amazing bed and great view of the strip! i was very happy !!! i had booked on travelocity literally the day before traveling - $717 for 6 days hotel, flight, and car (from miami FL) - i priced out the car at $150 and the flight at $290 seperately - so the hotel in actuality only cost $277 or $55/night including tax. for a strip view suite that's a great deal - hard to believe that 5 years later you can still get the same room - but renovated - for ony $5 more a night! the casino was pretty tight - i know i dumped in about $200 and didn't get ahead - a disappointment. the slots at Aria were pretty loose - paying out more than any other hotel - Wynn was good as well. I loved the new cosmopolitan hotel - it is my new favorite - and i had planned on staying there - but it cost $400 more for my trip and they hold $150/night on your credit card - alotta moolah to just stay there - but the hotel is beautiful. however, did not win any $ there either - guess the gaming is paying the exhorbitant debt for the hotel. i've stayed at most of the hotels in vegas or been in the rooms of friends who have stayed there and i can tell you this is a great deal. it is about 1/4 mile off the strip though so if you don't have a rental car consider the transportation. i always reccomend getting a car while in vegas - the walks are long - blocks are huge - and you'll pay $20 for a cab one time when you could spend that all day to have a car to take you wherever you like. trust me - i used to live in vegas - i know what i'm talking about !!! here is my review i submitted before going to vegas - but they would not post a "pre-trip review" - so i'll include it now. have been to the rio many, many times as i have previously lived in vegas. just booked a last minute trip through travelocity the day before travel - and for airfare, hotel for 5 nights, and car was $717 - BARGAIN. i don't care how crappy it is really - will be out enjoying the finer things in vegas and spending my $ there !!! after the breakdown in my trip the hotel will cost a measly $280 - ridiculously cheap! that is $56/night INCLUDING tax - great deal - i've stayed at rio before and the rooms are very large compared to most of vegas - it is also being renovated and i will be requesting a renovated room and an upgrade - FINGERS CROSSED !!! then it would be a ridiculously awesome deal..lol - you can't even stay at motel 6 for $56/night including tax - and the rio has a casino, starbucks, and the best damn buffet in town - believe me - i've eaten at them all - will re-post after my stay when i get the pics off my iphone i'll include those as well happy travels to las vegas !!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Great View of the strip”
Reviews.Author: PrincessR
Reviews.Content: We had a corner room suite which provided us with an amazing view of the strip. The room was spacious but the TV could have been bigger. However why would someone go to LV to watch TV so this was not a problem. The resort had many restaurants to choose from. We dined at the Voodoo lounge and their steak is to die for, so tasty. For breakfast you will be spoilt for choice and may not need to have lunch. We wanted to be slightly away from the strip so this hotel suited us fine. Their shuttle service to the strip was punctual.

Reviews.Title: “Reliable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: themick29
Reviews.Content: The Rio is one of the best values in Vegas. It's not a place I would pick for a honeymoon or special occasion, but you know what you are getting when you stay there. The seafood buffet is probably the best in Vegas, but what I like are the other restaurants. They have a sportsbook Deli and Pizzeria that is good and open till after midnight. The people that say the place is dated are being truthful. No high definition for the flat screens in the bars and sportsbook is a drawback. The bartenders don't hassle you to play the video poker at max bet or at a faster pace, so you basically tip a $1 per drink and you are good to go. The rooms are very big and clean, but dated. I have stayed at the Rio 3 times and little maintenance problems have occurred but all were handled properly. It's easy to get comped rooms on weekdays and I choose it over all the other hotels in the Harrahs group. Free valet parking is a big plus and no resort fees. The access roads make it easy to avoid the busy strip traffic and the people waiving hooker business cards in your face. I make point not to walk anywhere I don't have to so being off-strip is fine with me. If this hotel was on the strip it wouldn't be nearly the value it is. Bottom line it's a great value but it's not the Wynn so don't expect to be dazzled.

Reviews.Title: “If you have no other choice and feel confident in your ability to fight crime”
Reviews.Author: itsascreenname
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in what can only be described as an INCREDIBLY dangerous area. So, be prepared to take a lot of cabs. They do offer a bus service in theory but that is spotty at best from what the people at my convention have found. The casino is clean and sterile however doing what other hotels consider very basic things like getting the expensive wi-fi to work will require and hour and a half on the phone until you get transfered to someone in the US that knows what they are doing. They are quite stingy on the soap etc unlike the other hotels I stay at usually. Frankly, the Circus place is only a slight step down in quality.

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms, but Dated and Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Frank
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for one night on business. The rooms are large and clean, but the facility feels very dated. It seems like an 80's Vegas facility (and I think it was built in the 80's), and the amenities you receive at the strip-located resorts are generally much better. I also don't like the off-strip location - walking to any of the other resorts is a hike (except the Palms.) I also had a loud group of partiers in the room next door - to the point where I had to change rooms. I realize this is Vegas, but given that I was there on business switching rooms at 10 p.m. was a pain. Overall, I don't recommend the Rio - it is a Vegas antique, and better options are available.

Reviews.Title: “Crappy location, dated rooms, but nice stay overall”
Reviews.Author: emceeice
Reviews.Content: Getting to the strip is tedious with the free shuttle. Rooms are dated. Nice stay, just wouldn't recommend for a true Vegas experience. Show in the sky is very tacky.

Reviews.Title: “the management sucks”
Reviews.Author: pitabread523
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a free room, and i must say the room was nice, however the prices in the in room mini bar, were insane, along with a very rude staff member, after we had fun in the casino, we returned to the room, only to find a hallway, lined with trash bags, which we can only assume were full of dirty linens, i called the front desk, and they transferred me to the house keeping dept. the man that spoke to me was very rude, and told me, not to tell him how to do his job, this pissed me off! i then called the front desk back, and spoke to katherine, the so called manager, ha what a joke!, she was rude, and obnoxious, and treated us. the guests, like [-]! i will never stay at the rio again, over priced, and management sucks!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great price until...”
Reviews.Author: Nieva02
Reviews.Content: Hotel is clean and rooms are large. They say no resort fee but charge 13.00 for Internet! Might stay again but not happy about the Internet fee.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, nice view, but I cannot recommend”
Reviews.Author: UFAlum88
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my fiancee and it was our agreement that we'd not come back. Checking in was not difficult, but took surprisingly long when you take into account there was no line. The room itself was fine...spartan, but fine. There was a lot of space, that's for sure. But unless you wanted it for a party, I did not see the purpose. Maybe its a good place to stay if you and a bunch of buddies want to rent roll-aways or bring sleeping bags. But the part that go to me was the common areas. The casino is run down...almost like a bit of downtown brought out to near the strip. And the walk from the elevators to the front felt like an escape. Honestly, every place we went on the strip was nicer.

Reviews.Title: “It is fine if you plan to never leave the Rio while in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: AA7482
Reviews.Content: As i frequent Vegas a few times a year i try and stay at a different hotel each time. The Rio all suite is technically a "suite" but in reality it is just a standard room with a couch and a 15 year old mini-fridge. The bed was uncomfortable, even when i was really drunk. the casino is average and they do have a Masquerade show but only runs Fri to Sun. The location is terrible if you are looking to get into the mix of Vegas and visit the strip. They have a free bus that runs to Harrah's and one to Bally's. They run every 30 min. It's not even friendly to walk to the Gold Coast and Palms as they obviously did not anticipate people leaving the Rio when they built it. For the value it is not worth it. You can get a very nice room at the Flamingo or Bill's Gambling Hall with easy access to the majority of Vegas. so, it is just fine if you plan to never leave the Rio while in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room, beautiful mountain view, full-service property”
Reviews.Author: Here There and Everywhere
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our two-night stay at the Rio. We were in Vegas for an event at the Palms, so this property was a good fit for us. Everything you could want is right there - dining, shopping, casino, sports book, entertainment --- even bananas in the gift shop. Gaylord's Indian Restaurant was great, and we really enjoyed our visit to the Wine Cellar. Our 17th-floor room was huge, and the view of the mountains from the floor-to-ceiling windows was breathtaking. (The long benches at the feet of the beds proved to be tripping hazards at night when you were trying to navigate to the bathroom, so I recommend moving them.) NOTE: If you don't feel like waiting for the free shuttle to the Strip, a cab ride is only about $10-$12 one way.

Reviews.Title: “Fun atmosphere with huge comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ronniegirl55
Reviews.Content: We stayed here New Years Day and it was extremely busy. It took between 2-3 hours to get a room. We walked around and enjoyed some food at their Sports Cafe and caught a glimpse of one of their free shows (too erotic for kids) but great for the grown-ups. When we finally did get a room it took another hour for bell service to get our bags up. I hate to complain about the little things but when you are pressed for time and need to make the most of it, these inconveniences add up. With that said the rooms were very spacious and comfy. I loved the seperate vanity area with double sinks. If it wasn't for the horrible service I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Claimed No Resort Fees”
Reviews.Author: amnoc
Reviews.Content: I chose to stay at this hotel because they claimed there were no resort fees. When I returned home I noticed a $100 charge to my bank account and called my bank only to find out that it was a charge from the Rio. I called the Rio and was told that it was a charge for incidentals and that it would be credited back to my within 5-7 business days. It has been five days, and so far, no money has been credited to my account. In the past, I have only had hotels keep an imprint of my card in case of incidentals but never charge my card for them and hold on to my money, for a week, to gain interest. Customer service was rude to me when I called to question them about the charge, as well. This hotel is not on the strip, has slow turn around for shuttles and only has shuttle service until 1:00 am. They advertise no resort fees but take money from you, anyway. I will not stay there again. Read more: http://www.igougo.com/review-r1382365-Hotel_Claims_No_Resort_Fees.html?NewReview=true#ixzz1AGw4qPJT

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Off-Strip Resort With Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoKlutch
Reviews.Content: Rio Las Vegas is an attractive and clean resort just off “The Strip” offering many dining and shopping options. While I understand the disappointment expressed in other reviews here, isolated problems and misunderstandings are inevitable at such a large hotel and I don’t think it should be judged solely on such incidents. If you expect to spend a lot of time on The Strip, I recommend staying on The Strip rather than at a nearby resort like The Rio as transportation can be inconvenient. If you wish to stay mostly on-property or see area attractions away from The Strip, I think the Rio is a great place to stay. Most importantly, in my experience, the staff are friendly, helpful and even charming. I have found the staff to be the best part of all Harrah’s properties. Every employee I encountered at The Rio offered a cheerful greeting and very good service. The concierge desk was especially helpful and assisted me with booking a flight for my wife for a family emergency. In my online reservation I had requested two non-smoking rooms in Ipanema Tower; one with a king bed and one with two full size beds. Upon check-in, the clerk cheerfully informed me she could easily accommodate these requests. She offered a strip view for an extra fee which I declined. When I informed her the second room was for my adult son and daughter, she asked if I wanted connecting rooms. I informed her adjoining rooms would be fine and this is exactly what I received. Although The Rio is promoted as an all-suite hotel, this is really not the case. I think most people would agree a suite includes a separate bedroom and the basic rooms at The Rio do not. What the basic rooms do offer is much more space than you will find in other basic Las Vegas rooms. There is a wall separating the “bedroom” and bath/closet area. Near the bed or beds is a small couch and upholstered chair with a coffee table and a writing desk. The bathroom includes a shower/tub and one sink. Just outside the bathroom is a closet with a small “dorm” refrigerator and another sink with a large countertop. Basic rooms also feature small details such as crown moldings and quality bedding, which I appreciate. The outside wall is entirely glass which offers very nice views of whatever the room happens to overlook. My room was extremely clean as was the room next door where my son and daughter were staying. These rooms overlooked the Palms resort which is attractive after dark. My parents were also staying at the Rio. Their room was also very clean and offered a “Strip View” which overlooked the hotels on the West side of Las Vegas Blvd. My room had a CRT television which is fine by me since watching TV is the last thing I want to do while on travel. I have heard some rooms have large, flat-panel televisions. If watching TV is a priority for you, be sure to ask the desk clerk for a room with a new, flat-panel television. The Rio offers free shuttle service to Harrah’s and Bally’s which are on The Strip. Since I was visiting in the days leading up to New Year’s, the shuttles were often overcrowded. Although the busses arrive every half-hour, they typically could not accommodate everyone. This forced many people to wait over an hour for the next shuttle. Also consider the stops at Bally’s and Harrah’s are somewhat remote. The Harrah’s shuttle stop is under cover in the parking garage and the Bally’s stop is outside. Especially cold or hot weather could make for an uncomfortable wait. Therefore, if you wish to travel to and from the strip conveniently, I recommend taking a cab. The Rio Casino is large and laid out very well. It has two main areas. Although neither area is especially smoky, one area has a very high ceiling where the smoke is less noticeable. I had hoped to see the “Show in the Sky”. Unfortunately, that show is dark Monday through Wednesday which was during my stay. My family and I dined at the Village Seafood Buffet. Recently renovated, the entire dining area is attractive and well lighted, but somewhat crowded with tables closely spaced. Here again the staff were very friendly and offered outstanding service. Although the menu includes “lobster”, don’t expect a plump tail split open and steaming. The lobster is very tiny tails sliced in half and thrown into a steam pan. I had heard good things about the crab claws and lobster macaroni and cheese. Alas, these items were missing during my visit. I was very pleased with the fish, pasta and gelato selections. Overall, I found the quality of The Village Seafood Buffet to be much better than a typical Las Vegas buffet. But if you’re objective is a quality seafood dinner, you’d probably be better off at the Buzio’s Seafood Restaurant. I also twice had breakfast at the Sao Paulo Café. I found the food to be of good quality and although not cheap, still a good value. I saw many, many families with small children at The Rio. Therefore, I think I should point out if you’re looking for family entertainment, you will not find it at The Rio. In fact, you will not find it at any Las Vegas Casino. Although Las Vegas casinos promoted themselves as a family destinations back in the early 1990’s, they quickly reversed this and are again adult destinations. Therefore, The Rio would serve as a nice place to stay, shop and dine for families seeking entertainment elsewhere in the Las Vegas area.

Reviews.Title: “busy place”
Reviews.Author: bama39
Reviews.Content: stayed 3 days at Rio and was so surprised the place was just packed xmas day from 3pm-midnight I'm guessing. The lines at both buffets were extremely long and guess some people ate at midnight. Just can't stand in line like that myself. The other thing was the cashier cage,only one person there all the time we were there and very long lines for the one girl and did hear a floor supervisor say to another employee they just were not ready for all this and new years eve was coming. The rest of the stay was fine and we will go back but not at a holiday period. The check-in/out was very good and the rooms were great except for the feather pillows, the damn quills kept coming out thru the pillowcase and pokeing both of us (cheap ticking I guess)

Reviews.Title: “PLEASANTLY SURPRISED”
Reviews.Author: mare592
Reviews.Content: We are frequent Vegas travelers; going on golf and gambling trips a couple or more times a year. We have stayed @ the Rio several times many years ago. I was nervous staying here again after reading reviews, but it turned out to be totally unfounded. We got free rooms from Harrahs, and were totally comfortable and pleased with our acccomadations. The rooms (3) were on the 7th floor, Ipenima tower. They were meticulously clean and new. The room is VERY large compared to most LV properties. The TV cabinet has a bar assortment of liquor and water; DON'T TOUCH or you'll be charged. There is a hallway with large mirror, closet, mini fridge, makeup mirror, sink and blowdryer. The bathroom is seperate with combo tub and shower and a sink. Most surfaces are granite in the living room, but man made surface in bath area with a marble floor. The safe worked great. We had floor to ceiling windows with a Stratosphere view; the view is not important to us. We buy our own beer @ walmart (love aluminum bottles) and watch football in our room with our group comfortably seated. The gambling was OK here~ actually better that most places. Didn't win anything big, but let us play awhile. The casino is VERY nice and easy to get around. We parked on the roof and were happy with how easy it was to get a spot. We have eaten @ the buffet several times in the past, but not this time due to time constraints. We ate @ McFaddens Pub and found it to be very good. Also ate by the sports betting area and it was very good. Played VP, lots of slots, and Lord of the Rings~ won a small jackpot in poker for 4 aces. Lots of locals here; always a good sign for gamblers. Lots of girls taking drink orders; didn't have to wait more than 30 minutes. Pets are allowed here. I'm a dog lover, so wasn't a bit bothered. There were A LOT of dogs. My brother did get approached by a hooker. We saw them in every hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cheated!”
Reviews.Author: yumyum_16
Reviews.Content: The hotel has no resort fee but a whole lot of hidden costs! The internet has to be paid by computer, i.e. if you have 3 laptops (for the kids), you'll end up to pay $13.95 x 3 per day! And the phone calls are not included in the price. We had to pay $11/min plus tax! The seafood buffet is the most cheated thing at the Rio! We paid $120 for 3 people and what did we get? Very old food! The oysters were bad, bitter, not fresh at all! There was no lobster as advertised! The limes and lemons were old, brown and dry! The crab legs were not fresh at all. In all, the seafood was definitely like left over, not as advertised and definitely not up to the price at all! We paid $120 for nothing, nothing we could eat and definitely no enjoyable! If you stay at the Rio, it's not convenient to go to other places. There was nothing for the kids to do there and not much they could eat. Definitely a thumb down for the Rio!

Reviews.Title: “First time to Vegas, and very pleased with the Rio overall”
Reviews.Author: spike1342
Reviews.Content: We went down from Dec. 18th to the 25th. Check in was fast, friendly and because of the low period and asking nicely we were given an upgraded suite (one of the newly renovated ones) on the 20th floor (PH) of the Ipanema tower. The room was spacious and had a plasma TV, another TV built into the bathroom mirror, jacuzzi tub and shower, coffee maker and both a bar fridge and another empty fridge for use. Word to the wise--don't touch anything in the bar fridge unless you really want it because the sensor will charge you right there. Fortunately the front desk took off the charge quickly when we told them nothing was taken from the fridge, The only downside of the room was staying during the big rainstorm and having a leak in one of the windows. It eventually covered a portion of the carpet in one corner but we didn't bother changing rooms as it didn't affect our stay at all. Except for someone's thumping party below us on the first night each night was quiet. Room was very clean and maid service was efficient and toiletries were replaced each day. The casino wasn't too smoky and is fairly well laid out. The Masquerade Show was dark for the period we went so we missed out. Restaurants were all expensive and the Carnival World Buffet had a ridiculous lineup each day at almost any time of the day. However, we gave it a try on the last day for brunch and I had to say I was impressed by the selection. Shuttle service was consistent and the trip to the main strip was short. I suppose some might prefer a direct strip location if they're only in Vegas for the glitz and gambling but we were there more for day trips (Grand Canyon, Valley of Fire, Death Valley, Red Rock) so I preferred being off strip with a rental car as it made driving in and out of Vegas a bit less of a headache. Checkout was fast and painless, and can be done using the TV, on the phone or at the front desk. Overall we were pleased with the Rio and would consider it again.

Reviews.Title: “Can I have Lies with that RIO Reservation”
Reviews.Author: clicky53
Reviews.Content: In August we booked 5 days at the rio for Decembers Dead days. It was a Masquerade Suite. After booking we contacted Rio to make sure our reservation was made. in December we called the Rio to again confirm and to see if there was an additional charge for a strip view. Atasha at the Rio said no. At that time I made a room request. I again called the day before our trip to confirm and see if there was a charge for strip rooms they said Melody at the Rio said NO. When we got there they changed there story to be able to have a strip room we would have to pay another 50 dollars per night. We asked to see the manager. She demanded to me that if I do not like the price she would return my money and we could go somewhere else. NO APOLOGIES WHERE EVER MADE. There is a history of us calling. We will never go to vegas again if this is the way they treat people.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value but off the strip”
Reviews.Author: EfficientTraveler
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and painless. The staff was very helpful and courteous. My room was nice; while they call it an 'all-suite' hotel, I have to disagree with what they call a suite. It's just a 'studio' room. As usual, there was no coffee maker so you were forced to buy the Starbucks on the ground floor. The convention center was a long walk, but relatively convenient. Had to pay $25 per package sent to me at the hotel (3 packages=$75) the business center, regardless of size; quite a rip-off, but apparently commonplace in Vegas. The seafood buffet is the best in town, but was closed my first nite there, despite being billed as 'open nightly'. The Rio is off the strip, but we had a $78 hotel rate. Overall, I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: flaviobp
Reviews.Content: Good hotel for the price but out of the strip. The room is big and very good cleanliness. You must have car ou pay taxi.

Reviews.Title: “First Stay ....it was just ok”
Reviews.Author: reillyran
Reviews.Content: The price was around $50 per night, we stayed Sun/Mon/Tues. The rooms are large but need to be updated, they look tired. The headboards need to be washed, they have nasty dark stuff all over them. I thought it was a shadow at first but realized later it was soiled. No coffee maker in room but do like that they send up coffee within 30minutes. Never saw the sky show because it doesn’t operate on the days we were there. Martorano's Restaurant wasn’t open (Mon/Tues), the Sports Deli is just burgers and steak, All-American Bar & Grille was like Denny’s and Búzios Seafood Restaurant was actually good. The slot machines kept us busy but it’s a bummer that the table minimums were $25. All in all we got what we paid for but above $50 forget it. We asked for a strip view and got a view of the Palms. Since the location is off the strip, expect a $10-12 taxi ride each time you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay...”
Reviews.Author: atrivers
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a great time in Las Vegas attending a convention and the sites of the town, however, the hotel provided us with a room that needed maintenance and did not respond to my calls. The view from our room overlooked the top of a parking garage, the shower did not function properly and the television had very bad reception and noisy static. At least one electrical plug did not work. We received no room cleanning on our last day which was disappointing. There are far too many choices in this town to put up with this kind of dissatisfaction. Recommend any of the other area hotels to get the best possible experience.

Reviews.Title: “Last Time We Stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: MeaganLeigh
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times often with comped rooms but this will be our last visit. They advertise that they do not charge a resort fee but what would they be charging you for? Pools and Jacuzzis closed for the season. No free newspaper, no coffee maker in the room, internet and telephone all at any extra charge. The Show in the Sky runs Thurs. - Sun. only. The coffee shop is only open 6am - Noon and prices are not cheap. The Carnival Buffet was average. The Sports Deli was ok but do takeout or the smoke and noise will drive you out. We paid $65 per night for 2 with the buffet pass but it wasn't worth more. The windows weren’t soundproof so outside noises from the street and air were noticeable. The drain in the tub was clogged. My mother was with us for an extra charge of $30 per night, buffet pass would have been $49 so we skipped that as she is a light eater. The sleep sofa had crumpled sheets in it and we stripped the bed and housekeeping had to come with new bedding and towels. The safe was locked so security had to come and open it. The light shades in the corridor were dented from people smacking them. We observed one guy walk down the hall and pound on each door as he went by, must have lost at the tables. Other guests slammed their doors at all hours. Can’t anyone hold a handle? Clientele looked really sketchy and there was no fight in town during our stay (Sun - Tues). The only good thing I have to say is I won $330 on a penny machine betting 45 cents a pull. Went to the new bridge over the Colorado River and also to see the Christmas lights at Ethel M's chocolate factory and to Freemont Street, full of celebrity impersonators and rather poor ones at that.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms - off strip”
Reviews.Author: marieatta_pman
Reviews.Content: the rooms are very large- and very nice, but when i go to vegas i'm not in the room anyway. we had three guys in one room and never felt cramped or bumped into each other. teh checkin was horrendous - way too long of a line and wait, especially for a sunday in august (off season for vegas) casino is nice, but has higher limits than i like to play. property is a bit isolated from strip and other casinos, but has free shuttle. only problem with shuttle - it stops running very early (12 am?) you can walk to ceasars, but it is half a mile or more, and on a busy overpass of interstate no free internet (pretty standard for vegas however) food choices on teh property were not great - although the buffet is one of the best in vegas. no quick food court choices. the one coffee shop ran out of pastries every day and was crazzy crowded b/c it was only choice.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Yankeefan27
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean, food was great, but had 4 adults in the room, with three bath towels and one bar of soap, no coffee maker. and elevators are very very slow

Reviews.Title: “Bring conditioner and an inhaler ;-)”
Reviews.Author: meribor2
Reviews.Content: First - there's a lot of things the Rio did really well. The room was clean, well-maintained, and the bed was very comfortable. The drawers in the vanity were great, the water pressure was sufficient to sandblast the side of a building, and there was plenty of hot water. We requested - and received - a king bed, and slept very well. We ate at the buffet, Buzio's and the VooDoo, and the food in all 3 was top-notch. Things I wish they'd done differently: 1. I'm not sure if it was because of the desert air, the laundry products they used, or what, but the combination of shampoo/conditioner made my hair stick up like a showgirl's headdress. Gilchrist & Soames generally have nice products, but if the Hampton Inn can fork out for separate shampoo and conditioner, I'm thinking you guys can, too. 2. The ventilation system is in dire need of upgrading. It's just not pulling the stale cigarette smoke up and out of the casino area as well as it should. On Thanksgiving when people were literally in line for 3 hours to eat, the smoke in that area was unbelievably bad. 3. Better yet - how about a non-smoking area of the casino?

Reviews.Title: “Used to be better!!”
Reviews.Author: Northcarolinapuppy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Masquerade Suite at the RIO hotel for Nov 29 and 30th for a birthday party for a friend. Save your money if you think you're getting a nice luxurious room. Its not. The website states... "plasma tv's... and upgraded sound system and that room had neither of those things... also, the furnishing are worn, the carpet is nasty and the tile floor in the bathroom is loose. Then to top it off, after writing to the RIO to tell them they have false advertising, they basically accused me of lying and wanted to know WHERE I saw that!! I just went right back on their website and pasted the link and sent it to them. And I think that its nowhere near 1600 sq ft. Another problem I had was the first night I sat down at the bar and put 5.00 in the video poker game and ordered a coke. The bartender told me I had to put 20.00 in the machine if I wanted my coke comped!! Then another waiter came over a little while later and my friend standing behind me ordered a coke. He tried to comp it, but the other bartender saw him and started yelling at him. I called him over and told him I would pay for it. I mean.. its just crazy.. if you sit down at a penny slot machine, they dont tell you that you have to put in 20.00 to get a free drink. So even though I had a fun time.. that will be the last time I stay there. I can get comped rooms all over vegas and the RIO didnt treat me like they value loyalty at all. Also.. be warned.... if you leave the RIO by taxi.. they will try and pad the fare by taking you the long way... two times now they have tried it. One went North and then back south and just yesterday the female cabbie tried taking us thru the tunnel. It adds about 9.00 to the fare.. so tell them to take you down tropicana!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but a little smokey.”
Reviews.Author: Troylt
Reviews.Content: At check-in I was told my king bed suite would not be available for another 4 hours. I did not have time to wait till 8 PM to get my room as my conference was begining at 5 PM and I needed to get cleaned up and change clothes. So I settled for the two queen beds. At night the room smelled of smoke and for a non smoker it was very uncomfortable and hard to sleep. The rooms were very clean and the maid service very good.

Reviews.Title: “NIce and clean, but what about a cup of tea?”
Reviews.Author: skattie22
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, unfortunately a kip in the evening was out of the question because of the go-karting noise from the track down below. Don't be fooled by the nice pictures of the swimming pool, it is closed at this time of the year, even though it was warm enough that we actually wanted to swim in it! And after tramping the strip all day (courtesy of the excellent free shuttle) you come back for a feet-up and a cup of tea,,, well you have an iron and board, a fridge and a hair dryer, but no tea/coffee making facilities, if you want a cuppa you have to call room service. In a hotel like this I would have expected better.

Reviews.Title: “like the hotel but!”
Reviews.Author: seasick
Reviews.Content: i'm a las vegas specialist agent so know vegas very well having been 10 times the experience i just had is frankly not right! i paid just £160 for 4 nights room but upon check in was asked for $800 as a deposit (approx £500) for possible charges against the room, when i told them i weas an agent and would be using cash as the room cost was pre-paid they did not back down so they took $800 offf my credit card as a "hold" yet when i was converted back in uk sterling i ended up losing over £30 for no good reason, this is happening more and more in vegas and should be stopped! the hotel rhough is fantastic and i cannot fault it!

Reviews.Title: “OK place if you're a smoker, otherwise stay far away!”
Reviews.Author: Wearytraveleratlanta
Reviews.Content: Terrible ventilation system. We were putting towels at the base of our doors in our rooms to try and keep the smoke out. I was stuffy and miserable the entire stay due to cigarette smoke. The pools are is pretty lousy too. Dated and rusted lounge chairs. The best thing about this place is the Voodoo bar outside at the top of the hotel. Great views from there. I liked the girls dancing on the slot machines too and the sports book was OK.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Asnellings
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at the RIO three times in the last two years and we have had a comfortable stay each time. The rooms are very large and they include a refrigerator; which is great because we could keep plenty of cold drinks since it's so hot. Also, the rooms are clean and if we ever had a problem, the staff was very nice and quick to fix any problems. The only down side is you are off the strip, but they have a shuttle to take you to the strip that runs every 15 minutes and it's free. We use the shuttle every year and it saves a lot of money on tax rides. They also have lots of entertainment to offer guests, so it's a good place to stay and a lot less expensive than other hotels on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: SHEAMUSToronto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RIO for the sixth time this year. Excellent value and slightly off the strip. Most strip hotels were priced arounf $140 - $200 per night plus taxes and resort fees; the RIO was $32.00 plus taxes and no resort fees The rooms have all been in the Masquerade tower and are approximately 400 sq. feet. Clean, roomy, good room service and house keeping. The VOODOO restaurant and lounge on the roof has one of the best outdoor views in Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Nice big room”
Reviews.Author: sander9t
Reviews.Content: We took my in-laws to Vegas for their first trip there. We stayed in Rio for two nights. The hotel is so-called "all-suites" and the standard room we got from Priceline is indeed very big. The bathroom is a little dated and the cleanness was not up to my highest standard (I am pretty picky though so most people will probably not notice those little details that came to my attention). Generally we were very pleased with our stay. The location is not the best since it is off the strip. However, they do offer plenty in the hotel for you to enjoy. We had to go the strip since it was my inlaws' first trip. And we found that taking the Harrah's (Rio is under Harrah's) shuttle to on-strip hotels owned by Harrah's such as Flamingo, Ceasars Palace, etc. is actually pretty convenient. We also enjoyed what we think the best seafood buffet in Vegas - Village Seafood Buffet (don't confuse it with other buffets in Rio - it is more expensive but trust me it is worth it in every single way).

Reviews.Title: “rooms are large and clean but security was horrible.”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer2010
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at The Rio in Las Vegas. My husband and I went there to watch the final table in the World Series of Poker. Check in was fast. there was basically no wait on the day we arrived which was Saturday afternoon. Front desk staff was nice and pleasant. Our room was large and clean. The bed was average in comfort. The bed was older with older bed linens. Our bathroom was clean and it had an average size tub. Hot water was not always available. The casino is large and was busy. I traveled with my husband, brother and sister in law. The first night we were there, my sister in law was assaulted by a man who was standing behind her and spitting on her back and was attempting to spit down the back of her pants ( this is not a joke). Security was notified and never showed up. The bar tender and a waitress called twice before security showed up. Nothing was done about this situation. The hotel manager and casino manager were not helpful or apologetic. They could have offered a free dinner or laundry service but they did nothing but take a report. They promised to get back to us but never did. That was a shame because everything else was pretty good. There was a great deal of action in the casino especially with the World Series of Poker there. We ate at the seafood buffet that was not good at all for the price. Everything tasted the same and was not tasty at all. We ate at Mcfaddens grill which was good in service and food. I would consider staying there again if the hotel would have done something about the assault as we believe it may have been sexual in nature.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ChrisM130
Reviews.Content: It may not be right on the strip, but it's only about a five minute shuttle ride, so you won't bee too far from all the action. and there is plenty for you to do if you want to stay in one spot. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it to anyone who is going to Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is the best casino not on the strip”
Reviews.Author: Carl_D77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and several friends went to Vegas for a friend's wedding in July. The Rio was great. We had a Strip View and what a view it was! Every room has floor-to-ceiling windows so nothing gets in your way. We could see all the way from Ceasar's Palace to The Luxor. Our room was huge! We had a king size bed, a sitting area with a couch and two chairs, a dressing area near the bathroom, and one whole wall of windows. The bed was huge (maybe a super king?) but it was dwarfed by the shear size of the room. The service and cleanliness was great and the staff were very nice. The pool area was awesome as well. There are 4 pools, each offering a different atmosphere. One has a sand beach with a waterfall. Another one is heated. Another one has a waterfall with an area to sit once you've passed through the falls and the rest of that pool is huge! The fourth pool is roped off and they charge admission (apparently they have dancers in that area). They were selling a bucket of Bud Light (4 bottles) for $20! There's also a restaurant on the roof (52nd floor) ans an open air nightclub called The Voodoo Lounge. They had a live DJ there the night we went and it was hopping! Like I said, it's open-air and on the roof so you can see the entire strip! It was a pretty amazing sight at night!

Reviews.Title: “Adults only and bring plenty of cash”
Reviews.Author: RandRCarsonCity
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference at the Rio. Although the rooms were clean and roomy, the hotel rooms were located a great distance from the conference center. Also, this casino hotel is not a place to bring the children. When I contacted the front desk to request to prolong my check out until 1PM, instead of the noon time check out, I was quite promptly told that check out was at noon with no exception.

Reviews.Title: “Great get-away-Best Buffet in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: johnsolobird
Reviews.Content: Great four night stay. The room was nice but it seemed like overall hotel service has slipped since our last visit. We had to ask for washcloths and hand towels as there were none in the room. Room service trays lined the hallways at all times except when rooms were being cleaned. Shuttle service was spotty with wait times of 30 to 45 minutes. While waiting next in line at the American Grill we were passed over by three seperate groups of Diamond guests proving that rank still has privilege. The stand out feature for Rio is that it is by far the Best Buffet in Las Vegas. The food quality and selections are fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the RIO!”
Reviews.Author: nicoleGoodyear_Az
Reviews.Content: We stayed October 14-17. We have stayed at the Rio 4 or 5 times in the past and once again we were very pleased. Yes, it is a little bit off of the strip. But the shuttle bus is great and its free. Just tip the driver a buck or two if you are pleased with the service. For the rate difference to stay at a comparable hotel that is right on the strip, it is well worth it. The pool is nice. October only two sections were left open, but there were not enough people using it to justify opening all four. I have never encountered a problem at the Rio and will continue to stay there time and time again!

Reviews.Title: “Her name is Rio...”
Reviews.Author: JetsetterOxford
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from a week at the Rio. Check-in was quick, room was huge and best of all, there was a fridge in the room to cool the beers! Excellent view from the hotel ceiling to floor window (25014) and very clean in general. There is a mini bar inside the cupboard under the TV, but go careful as when you take things out to have a look, they are automatacally added to your hotel bill as they are on a sensor and they assume you have had them. A small shampoo sample and lotion are supplied each day but you will need more than one if you have long hair! This wasnt re-stocked for us on one of the mornings so we were on rations! The gambling areas were busy and buzzing and the service for cocktails/drinks was very officient. Most of the time, as soon as we had sat down to play a machine, they would be offering us a drink. Thursday-Sunday they have entertainment with loud music and floats moving around on the ceiling, this is an excellent atmosphere and worth staying to see. The Rio was reasonably close to the strip and walked everyday (sometimes twice) to the other casinos and food places. Overall, the Rio is an excellent place to stay and excellent value. Staff are very friendly and rooms are clean and huge...what more could you want! :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MOJaeger
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night at the Rio and wished we had stayed longer. Parking is in the garage at the end of the building. You have to walk about half way through the casino with luggage if you park your car in the garage to get to the front desk. The front desk was friendly and helpful. Our room was ready when we arrived. It was large and could accomodate a wrap around sofa, large TV and king bed. There is also a separate dressing area with refrigerator and coffee maker. The casino is open and airy. For breakfast we decided to avoid the always busy buffet and ate at the San Paulo Cafe. A good choice. Service and food were excellent. It was not crowded and very quiet which allowed us to have a very enjoyable breakfast. After breakfast we had to pack up and move to the Flamingo for our next two days. I highly recommend the Rio, especially if you have a car to get you around town. The Rio does have a shuttle service to the Strip which stops at the other Harrah's hotels and casinos. it runs until 2 a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the strip, nice hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: we_are_maxi
Reviews.Content: Room was great, we had a rental car so getting around wasn't a problem, without a car it would be harder to get around. Clean rooms and hotel in general was clean. Staff was so so, voodoo lounge was a joke! Workers were rude pricks! It's worth the view but leave when your done with pic's.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but could do better”
Reviews.Author: RobertzRo
Reviews.Content: The rooms are getting old but the entretainment is not bad. If you pay the full price go somewhere else but if you get a discount price, it's ok. DO NOT try the sea food buffet its the worst ever.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: dmac77
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. Extra large rooms and great rates. Very close to the strip. Great attratcions on the inside, all inclusive. Overall great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: TwinklesNJ
Reviews.Content: Enjoyable stay. We were there from Oct 19-23. We arrived early and were able to check in. We had a nice size room, however the tv was a bit outdated (not a flat screen). The housekeeping staff was soo friendly and greeted us in the hallway everyday. The pool was enjoyable but out of the 3 pools that were open, only one was heated or at least felt warmer. The sun is blocked by the buidings often throughout the day this time of year, so you have to catch it when you can. We wished some of the food places were open a bit later too. The shuttle bus was helpful although it would have been nice to have more running. We missed it a few times and had to take a taxi. Also, it would have been nice if the hours ran longer than 10am-1am. We rented a car one day (overnight) and was able to park it at the hotel for free, which was a pleasant surprise! The Rio buffet was quite good and in fact we got the 24 hour buffet pass for $39.99 and used it at various Harrah's owned properties on the strip too. Make sure you check out the Paris buffet, it was also excellent. While this hotel is off the strip, we had an enjoyable stay and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing vacation in Vegas....”
Reviews.Author: Rio101
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio hotel for the first time. I wasn't too excited since I'm used to staying on the strip but took my chances since their rates were really good mid week plus no resort fees. If you're planning on staying make sure you stay in the old tower because the rooms have been remodeled. We got an awesome view of the strip and the pool area. The pool area had good music and was totally chill. Room 1635 if you can request it. News beds.... sooo comfy! The rooms have a mini fridge so you can keep drinks and snacks. The food at the buffet was good and vibe downstairs in the casino area was good too. I went mid week for 5 days and had no problems getting anywhere. Used valet and they were quick. Overall I'd stay there again... where else can you stay in a nice suite for about $35 a day mid-week? Try it out....

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: MMWWOhio
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband while he attended a weeklong conference at the Rio. After reading some of the reviews on this site, I was not expecting much. In fact, I was really concerned about encountering dirt, rudeness and maybe even bedbugs! What I experienced could not have been better! The room was HUGE and SPOTLESSLY CLEAN and very QUIET! The room decor was modern and bed was SO COMFORTABLE! My husband and I both commented that we hadn't had such good nights of sleep in a long time. The pool was very relaxing. All of the staff we encountered were very competent and helpful. The shuttle is convenient, but it doesn't start until 10 AM and sometimes during the busy times, it is crowded and not everyone gets on. BUT the walk to the Strip is less than 15 minutes, and we walked nearly everyday. (Felt good after sitting in meetings all day!). In short...RIO IS A GREAT HOTEL! Now...if we could get the slots a little looser...!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great total, off the strip”
Reviews.Author: fencejumper
Reviews.Content: Was there for a large convention and everything was wonderful. The suite rooms were spacious and comfortable. Did not get the king size bed as requested, but two doubles. Still, the room was a non smoking-more important. The food for the conference of 1150 was all vegan, and absolutely some of the best food ever at a large gathering. Creative, subtantial and excellent choices. All the meeting rooms were well furnished , but a bit too cold. Buses travel their other properties on the strip, but it is a bit inconvenient. However, being at the conference provided me with little time to go elsewhere. Waiting for another superb conference for this group (Best Friends) next year, and hope that they have it back at the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Great conference hotel/casino - now pet friendly!”
Reviews.Author: Morrcoop
Reviews.Content: I didn't miss being on the strip while busy in a conference for 3 full days - enough at the resort to keep me busy at night (on days 4 & 5 I did go to the strip). I traveled solo and enjoyed meals at both asian cafe and sports grill right next to the sports book. Good venue to enjoy a meal while watching some games with other folks doing the same thing - very friendly environment. The coffee shop was at the bottom of the elevators which was very convenient for coffee first thing in the mornings. Shows are fun to watch and I especially enjoyed the flair bartenders. The rooms are large with outdated fabrics/bedspreads, but the bed was comfy and the toiletries a good quality. The tv in my room (not flat screen) went from black and white to color but I didn't complain since I didn't intend to watch tv a lot! Internet was $40 for 3 days - ouch. I enjoyed the pool beach, but one full hour before closing, the staff started stacking the chairs all around me - very loud and annoying - and actually rude. Gave me the message that they wanted me to leave, which I did. Easy garage parking - easy access to main highway. I would come here again for a conference, otherwise, I'd stay on the strip, probably at the Monte Carlo.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value at Rio”
Reviews.Author: Devilgirl08
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Suites Oct 16-19, in town for a family wedding. Staff very helpful and everyone was friendly. Room wasn't available until approx 3 pm so we hung by the pool. Fun pool for kids. Shuttle to the strip worked out well. Food in hotel was fine. A little slow to pick up room service dishes in the hallway. Room was comfy and spacious. Daily housekeeping was very good. Only complaint was no coffemaker in the room...strange!

Reviews.Title: “At the Rio, you get a huge room every time. Worth the bucks.”
Reviews.Author: jenhilt
Reviews.Content: We loved the Rio. It is off the Strip but you get a free shuttle so it wasn't a big deal. The rooms are so big (all suites) so we loved it. It had a cute kitchenette. The Chippendales walking around all the time was nice eye candy. And the VooDoo Lounge on the roof is SWEET. We went to see Anthony Cools, a hypnotist at the Paris and never laughed so hard in my life. We are going back for New Years with 6 friends this year. Guaranteed a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Becoming very average hotel: Consider other options”
Reviews.Author: Sasha_N
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Riu once before a few years ago. In our case, check-in was pretty good in the early evening. However, upon walk bys in the days ahead, the check-in line-ups were very long and slow. I asked if a complimentary upgrade was available and after what seemed a few minutes of silence and keyboarding clunking and a telephone call, we were told that an upgrade to the diamond room was available. It was recently renovated the clerk says, We were grateful to the clerk and wanted just to go to our rooms for some rest and a shower after a long flight. Our room is located on the 18th floor. As soon as I opened the door, I could see this was not the diamond suite, the room was not renovated, the carpet was really worn and run-down. You can see inground black stains. The door sensor was just dangling. The bed sheets were quite dated but clean. I went toward the old 26 inch tube tv and opened up the cabinet doors hiding it. I could smell an odd odour. I opened up the fridge and I seen a carton of milk with an expiry date of August 16. It was October 2!. I then looked further and noticed an old soup was in the fridge and it wasn't stocked. I called up the front desk and told them what happened. They didnt care. They just sent housekeeping up who were very quick and nice. I asked the cleaning lady if this room was remodelled recently and she said, no, it hasn't been remodelled at all. Later that evening I went to look for the clerk who gave us our room and she was really busy. There was a long line and I figured I would catch her the next day. Unfortunately, I never seen her again despite checking several different times every day for three days. The pool are is decent with one area of sand which gets really hot in the vegas sun. There was preparation for a band and the setup started around noon. There was no notice and the sound checks were terribly noisy and hurt my not very sensitive ears. There was no forewarning about the band or show, just a sign hidden away saying the pool will be closing early that day. We did enjoy the Voodoo Lounge and the hotel was giving away VIP passes every night. The Carnival in the sky was good as always and runs from Thursday to Sunday night. The Riu seems to have losts it's appeal in many ways. We did miss the strip and there is no benefit of staying at the Riu other than price, the reason we stayed there. Even then, I kinda wished we paid more and stayed elsewhere, but not at the PH (planet hollywood) since PH does NOT heat their pools for some absurb reason. We likely won't be staying at the Riu again. YMMV.

Reviews.Title: “slow check in.”
Reviews.Author: BigSausage
Reviews.Content: Given a great rate for our one night stay I won't elaborate on the snails pace at check in. The rooms are very large and super clean, not much more you can ask for when traveling. The bedding could use some up grading, thread count seems a little on the sparse side have had better sheets in lower class hotels. Not a deal breaker by any means but please work on some better bedding and perhaps some new flat screen TVs for your great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Just plain Average...”
Reviews.Author: minkewaleveld
Reviews.Content: When we checked into the Rio the staff were very polite and accommodating. I learned from Trip Advisor before we left for the Rio, that I was to ask for an updated room. I did that. They told us that since our rooms had been reserved with a bunch of other for the convention, that we already had an updated room. So, that was nice. No hassle. Be aware every where in Vegas is a walk. That includes INSIDE your hotel as well. It was ridiculous. It took us almost 20 min to find our room. While on the way to finding our room we found tons of empty bottles (mostly corona) and garbage in the hallways. Not cool. Once we got to our room we were pleased. The view was nice. We could see all 3 pools. We were on the 12th floor. The room was clean. The bathroom was okay. It was clean just not really enough room for someone to sit on the toilet and have the door closed. Good luck if your tall. :( There were two refrigerators in our room which was also nice. One that was completely empty. Then one that was filled with food and drinks they want you to pay extremely high prices for. Btw, we learned that bottled water in Vegas is REALLY expensive. So, if you can find a place where you can get it for a reasonable price, then buy a BUNCH and put them in your empty fridge. That saved us some money. The bed was nice. The linens and such were nice linens. It was clean. They never have enough outlets around the bed to, say plug in your phone. For this room the plug was actually BEHIND the bed frame. Annoying. Anyone love moving a bed so you can plug in your phone? It was strange this room hardly had any outlets. I believe there were 3 in the room. Then others in the bathroom and sitting room. The maid service was polite and respected our wishes and never once came into our room, that we know of. They were always approachable and very nice. Now about the pools and the restaurants....
