The main pool which is as big as the other two pools together, is not heated. FYI. My husband did not enjoy that pool as much. The pool that sits in the middle of the big pool and the other waterfall/beach(with sand) pool, is in the shape of a tropical fish which we thought was amusing. However in that pool.. since it was smaller and it was warmer but not clean!! It was kinda gross. You could see the sun block and tanning lotion floating on the top of the pool. :( We never did get to the third pool with the sand. It just looked dirty. Around the pool they had a couple of bars and little food stands.. which were all closed except one. Also, they had music playing over by the big pool. The music system consisted of 2 giant speakers. One which was centered in front of the big pool and then one that was pointing to the smaller pool in the center. Ours ( at the big pool) kept cutting out. They never got it fixed while I was there, it happened every 10 minutes. I was there for 4 days poolside during the day. It was really annoying. As for the "casino" restaurants, go somewhere else to eat!!! We went and had brunch at the sit down brunch cafe, called the Sao Paulo Cafe. I ordered a fresh "oven fresh cinnamon roll" which was 3.95. It was hard as a rock... the frosting on top was crusted over, I pushed my finger into it and it smashed down.. like it had been sitting out for ever. Not to mention they must have made them in muffin tins, cause they were shaped like muffins. It was GROSS! I had also order the Sao Paulo Combo - which was 2 eggs, 2 pancakes, 2 bacon, 2 sausage links, Breakfast potatoes, lightly buttered toast and preserves.. This was $16.99!!!! I was so disappointed. The eggs were overcooked. The pancakes were cold. I don't eat meat, so I asked for extra breakfast potatoes (which just turned out to be hashbrowns) that weren't cooked all the way through. Then their lightly buttered toast didn't actually have any butter on them, and the "preserves", were little plastic tubs of jelly. It was THE worst breakfast I had ever had. My husband ordered the potatoes, egg and cheese wrap. Which included a choice of bacon, sausage or ham. He chose sausage. This wrap shows up and it's HUGE. It was 9.99. It looked like it could be good, so he starts eating it. Within 10 min, he's complaining that he doesn't feel good and he couldn't eat anymore. He was then sick for half of the day and couldn't eat anything else. Coffee was HORRID, and the oj was really watered down. If you love GOOD food this place is not for you. Needless to say.. DON'T EAT HERE EVER!!!!! GROSS!!!! We mostly just stuck with food we knew at that point. Subway. It was cheaper, and WAY BETTER!!! Later on in the week we found out that his company was hosting a dinner party @ the famous Martorano's, which is also at the Rio casino. AMAZING! What a difference dining experience. We had 8 courses. It was amazing. If you are a vegetarian which I am, they really catered to my needs which was awesome. They had flat screen TV's all over the restaurant, playing Ocean's 11, which was cool. One veggie dish that I remember was their Eggplant Stack with mozzarella, tomato and arugula. OMG! OMG! I am drooling just thinking about it. My husband had the Tagliatelli Beef and Veal Bolognese – San Marzano tomatoes, fresh vegetables, touch of cream, finished with ricotta salata. I could recommend this place up and down!!!! It was fabulous! So, all in all the hotel was just okay. We didn't get to see the show in the sky that they offer to see for free cause we were there in the middle of the week and apparently they only have it on the weekends. Fri-Sun. Then we wanted to go to Penn and Teller, cause they do their magic show there and they were on "vacation". So, not shows. A little disappointed but not to much. I hate to say it, but I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone. UNLESS, you want a cheap room, and to take a shuttle to the strip, cause it's on the other side of the freeway... :(

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: russellpr
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in October and could not ask for a better experience. Check in was very quick and easy. Exceptionally clean rooms. Although it is not on the strip it is easy to get on/off the shuttle. The staff, from reservations to wait staff in the restaurants, were very cordial and helpful. Loved the casino. Disappointed that the Show in the Sky was not available because of vacation, but that is the only negative in our stay. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: rioohno
Reviews.Content: The room was not ready at late evening check-in for my friend until 9pm. My room was dirty with long hair all over the bath room floor. I gagged using a towel to wipe it up. The grout between the tiles is black, the carpet turns your socks black. A wild drunk would not leave me alone while waiting in the front lobby for my firends...there was no security around...I had to ask a perfect stranger to pretend he was with me to make the creep go away. Room service had an inordinate wait of 45-an hour almost every time I called. There is LOUD music playing every night that even ear plugs can not drown out. The ATM machine was not working, but offered to print the receipt and take to the cashier to retrieve my cash....but the cashier said a "Rewards Card" was required....had to wait in another line, then go back and wait in the cashier's line again....by the time I got my cash...didn't feel like fun....went back to room to write this review...can't wait to leave in the AM...never coming back.

Reviews.Title: “One word: dump. I can not find a single...”
Reviews.Author: GroverTMuldoon
Reviews.Content: One word: dump. I can not find a single redeeming quality about this hotel... Except for the woman who performed housekeeping was very nice and appreciative of her tip. It's simply a sloppy casino with sloppy guests. The waitress's outfits are terrific, but the very random Nd bizarre strip-like dances every so often on top of the slots was ridiculous and cheap. For $175 a night, youd be insane to stay here. It might be worth $25 a night. At best.

Reviews.Title: “las vegas place that never sleeps”
Reviews.Author: mayrena33
Reviews.Content: we just got back from Las Vegas NV it was great we stay in the rio hotel and casino nice rooms dust free i loved it the buffet was so wonderful we only payed for 2 people only $22 in the buffet. We paid $299 per night for a room on the club level which we thought excellent value. with double bed. we had a great time will go over there in like 3 weeks again this time where going to stay at paris casino

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is an overall nice place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: oakas
Reviews.Content: The Rio is an overall nice place to stay. The only problem that I felt was annoying was how thin the walls were by the adjoing room doors. We were woken up at 7am because our neighbors were getting ready on their side of the door and were talking in an average tone but we could hear then clearly.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: rsoesanto
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in RIO about 6 times already and always come back for the Great service that they provided. The room was roomy and the attendant was very attentive with your needs. Also the location make you easy to go around without having the craziness traffic at the strip. One thing though, they should reduce their daily internet fees for regulars like me at least. Generally, they have great service and surely I will come back and stay with them in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another fun stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: munk67
Reviews.Content: We arrived early on Sep 5th and were able to check-in right away for our room. We had lots of clothes to hang up since we were there for a week so I called house keeping and asked for some extra hangers. They had them there within 5 minutes. Friendly staff and nice rooms, great food, and a nice pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: lilsnshne
Reviews.Content: I had a great time celebrating with family at the Rio. Location isn't great- offthe strip. But thehotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Surly Restaurant Waitstaff mars experience”
Reviews.Author: BeckyFitz
Reviews.Content: The Sao Paulo Restaurant is virtually the only place to get a full breakfast. Although it's the ubiquitous hotel restaurant, the snotty hostess and waitstaff try to put on airs as though it were a 5 star place. Although the place was half empty I had to stand in line 15+ minutes to get a table - hostess doing nothing but standing behind her podium with her nose up in the air. When the hostess realized I was a single, she said, "Ooooh" with attitude, and promptly sat me right next to the kitchen door. This meant that every single waiter carried their large trays right over my head. 10 minutes before anyone asked if I wanted a beverage, and another 5 before I got it. When coffee arrived I quickly ordered, lest the waitress got away. Good food came out quickly, followed 5 minutes later with my check. The waitress actually tried to remove my plate - I had put my fork down to take a drink of coffee. She was perturbed that I wouldn't let her take my food away. She never came back to check on me at all. Tip for management: Let your casino cocktail waitresses run the restaurants - they're pleasant and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Rio”
Reviews.Author: princessmiller
Reviews.Content: We arrived early and were allowed to check in our room. The room was so clean and inviting. We enjoyed every aspect of the Rio, including, the food, casino and shopping. The shuttle they offered to other casinos was greatly appreciated. We would certainly stay at the Rio again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: 0602bird
Reviews.Content: Checked in 2am in the morning. Staff at the front desk was very friendly with welcome smile. Room was nice and comfortable. Seafood was excellent in the buffet. We will be back to stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rio”
Reviews.Author: annie53
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 nights in late September. Casino was packed on a Sunday night. Not as bad during the week. Checkout line was not bad. We got a renovated room in the Masquerade Tower. It was fantastic. Loved the huge dressing area with 2 sinks. Great view of the strip on the 33 floor. Room was very clean and spacious. Our room was very quiet so I guess we had quiet neighbors ! Though I could hear the faint thudding from the music at the Voodoo Lounge but it did not keep me from sleeping. The pool area was nice. One pool was freezing and the other was almost too warm. We used the hotel shuttle to get to the strip. Very professional drivers. We did not eat at their buffet. We did split a burger and fries at the All American Bar and Grill. It was good. Vegas needs to cut down on their portions of food. Too much waste. We will definately go back to the Rio !

Reviews.Title: “Great and inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: all_vegas
Reviews.Content: For the room rates the rio charges it is a good choice. Stayed Sep. 19th and the check-in line was farely long but moved quickly (about 20 min). The room was a standard suite and we were very pleased. Room was large with wall to wall, floor to ceiling windows, bathroom was large and configured very well. The bed itself was VERY comfortable. The room itself was very modern and clean. The casino was pretty good and if you like buffets it's pretty good too. Voodoo lounge located on the roof is worth having a look, the view is outstanding. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The rio is a deal and we will go back.”
Reviews.Author: lasvegasone
Reviews.Content: First time we stayed here and our 9th trip to Las Vegas. Combining the 24 hour buffet pass good at 6 or 7 Harras's properties with two shuttle buses to Bally's or Harrah's made for an economical trip in a very large room. The Rio buffet must be one of the largest in the world and I estimate it is over 100 yards long without duplications. The pool was one of the most user friendly we have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Much Improved”
Reviews.Author: JL0719
Reviews.Content: I hadn't visited Rio for almost ten years. It was beginning to look a little run down, and I didn't feel like much effort was going into maintaining the facility. Out of curiosity, I returned this past summer - twice! It was that nice! Old rooms have been remodeled, food quality has improved, and the people are downright friendly. Not to mention the reasonable table minimums in the casino, compared to the strip. Rio also offers a unique option at their 3 Card Poker tables that no one else has. I made money the first time I sat down to play. Room service was reasonable and the food was good. The grill downstairs serves delicious meals. (I did not try the deli). There are also mall type shops with additional options for grabbing a bite to eat. Not to mention the random entertainers that pop up now and then with a quick song or dance. Some of their bartenders put on a great juggling show using whatever is behind the bar or on the counter. Check out the VooDoo Lounge for a sky high "postcard view" of Vegas. I highly recommend a visit to the Rio Suite Hotel and Casino.

Reviews.Title: “Never again and forget about quality at the SALON and SPA”
Reviews.Author: Philly52
Reviews.Content: The experience of RIO was one of the most inconvenient and unpleasant I have ever encountered. Registration to get my room took over an hour, and it was an off time on a weekday. I had called and confirmed the reservation a number of times and while the telephone staff were the best, the front desk were not. During rush times, checkout and 3 PM there were only 2 clerks working the desk and one was being trained! Train at OFF HOURS and free up someone who can get the guests moving in and out. The door keys DID NOT WORK. I now have a collection of 20 room keys as momentos. every time i went down they recoded the door and gave me two keys. One would work one would not, They even coded my Players card. NO GOOD either. To get the new keys i Would have to wait again, even at 2 AM. Finally a security guard offered to call someone but I was checking out in hours. The room was OKAY the bathroom needed major renovations, big time I hate showering with a trickle. Took me over an hour to find the refrigerator! The safe being a focal point in the room was a bad idea. Looks like it is calling out rob me robe me. After a few times, thinking i had lost my mind I realized the safe would lock when I coded it, but would automatically unlock a few hours later. It was NOT me The view of a roof top was not what was requested or promised with the room either. I went back to complain, and again an hour wait in line, and was told this is the room we have for you PERIOD. The evening NOISE from the pool area drifted, or screamed, to the room, so a quiet nights sleep was a dream not REALITY I am not a mid twenties individual and to have the pool mobbed by this age group with the music blaring at all hours from the pool and functions is more than inconvenient it is unacceptable. The hours are not convenient closing at 7 PM. What resort closes their pool at 7 when guests are off doing activities during the day. Scratch the POOL for children and adults (not post teens) Elevators kept breaking.. Not just one but a whole bank of them, more than once. Dining better save your money for this, not for the gaming. The buffet for dinner one night was horrible. One of us had ot go back three time to get a stir fry without sauce.. How simple is that. Every time the cook put on difference sauces. We ended up walking out with minimal satisfaction and ended up going for sandwiches a few hours later. NOT WORTH IT Breakfast was okay, expensive but at least it did not put us in debt. The Sports Deli was okay in price and quality but the staff turned us, and others around us, off. Abrupt and down right nasty. Could not gt a simple request right (no onions on something). I booked in advance the services at the Salon. The place looks nice, is miles from anything else and I went before the appointment to explain and ask if I can speak with the cosmatalogist.. Due to an unplanned demergency I had to change times and day of the appointmtnsand the yorked with me. The hair stylist was the best and she accomplished the look we discussed . I had to change the day of the make up and when I went the woman was okay, and I explained I needed some discolorations covered for special photos. Afterward I was dressing and did not think to check it out, butevery picture I am in has every mark shining like a bright light. The most imporatant day of my life and i look like a marquee with the discolorations. these pictures will be seen for decades and there i am looking like I have the pox. Mineral makeup is NOT COVERAGE. Then to make it worse--- I was quoted, three times the cost and when I went to pay I was told it was over 20 dollars more and the tip was automatically 10% !!!!!!! I signed, no choice, then asked for a copy of the receipt and i was told it would be on my bill!!!!!! Check out took over an hour as well!!!! The three pluses: the bell man department was great The drivers for the shuttle bus to the other properties The dealers at 7 AM ( the afternoon and evening were very droll at the various tables). I requested on this web site a copy of my bills, and this was a week ago... Still no bill. I am calling in a few minutes to get the General Manager to discuss these issues. I have been a guest at Harrah's properties, in many states, for over 15 years. NEVER AGAIN to RIO and I doubt my next VEGAS trip will be in the near or distant future, all based on this experience

Reviews.Title: “Best LV hotel so far....”
Reviews.Author: LuvsDogsNJ
Reviews.Content: For $60 this was the best hotel deal ever. We have been to the Luxor and to the Mirage. Both too huge and long lines. The Rio is compact, and though it is off strip there is a shuttle to take you to the strip. The valets were very nice. The room, the standard suite, was huge, 2 queen beds, a sofa, chair, coffee tables, nice tv. The view was facing the mountains, and the parking lot, but you are not there to look out your window. The bathroom was the one slight disappointment- the toilet did have some funky flushers, made a weird noise every time, like a trash compactor, and there was no vent/fan...just not there, not that is was not working. it would be a good idea to install that in each bathroom. We liked the room, it was clean, the a/c worked well. The Sundry store was near the elevators an the staff was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the rio”
Reviews.Author: booger6174
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the rio sept 23-30.This was our 6th trip to vegas in the last 3 years. After reading prior trip advisor reviews i was a little worried that we should have stayed on the strip again because of the location but we walked to the strip 5 times during our stay and it only took us 20 minutes.The pool was great and our room was huge! The food was Good .if you need something fast go to the deli next to the sports book.They have everything.My only complaint is that if you have noisy neighbours you can hear them quite easily.The walls seem to be very thin.The rio was a great place and for the price i will be going back in April.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bailey46514
Reviews.Content: stayed monday to saturday lots of space to relax in clean and comfy beds will not stay anywhere but here on future trips, best hotel by far . We have also stayed at stratosphere and sahara strat was ok sahara needs lots of help , dirty and old dingy everything

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: OJulie67
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I recently stayed at the RIO hotel in September 2010. I have stayed at this hotel in the past with my husband, and was happy with our stay. But, I have to say since our last stay about 5 years ago the hotel has gone downhill. The rooms are very dated, and need some upgrades and improvements...the bathrooms are very old and run down. ROOMS~Masqurede tower--Upon walking into our room we realized we had a lovely view of the parking lot...but a side view to the strip-We first noticed that the windows were horribly dirty. Streaks ran down the glass and really was not very appealing at all. In our bathroom, the shower barely worked and the faucet was falling off the tub surround and leaked. The first night we were there we also realized our safe did not work. We called maitenance and they sent someone up who told us the safe was now fixed. Unfortunately, after he left, we went to put our items back in the safe, but the safe still did not work. It was not due to user error either...The safe was BROKEN and the digital reader light was once again off after he had gotten it to work. We had dinner reservations, so we had to leave and were unable to secure our items. We were very upset. No one else ever showed up again to fix the safe and we went all weekend without using it and had to hide our valuables in our locked luggage. POOL~The next afternoon we spent by the pool and although it is a lovely pool area, the service was horrible. Not once did a bar server come by and ask any of us or the other guests around us if we wanted anything. We had to get our own drinks all afternoon. This really needs some attention. The only people getting service were in the bikini beach area where you pay to get in. They really need to take care of their other guests who choose not to hang out in the 20-something party area. MAID SERVICE~We had been by the pool all day Sunday and were ready to come up to the room, relax a bit and take a nice shower to get ready for the evening and upon entering our room at at 4:30 pm our room was still not made up! We were actually shocked. I have traveled extensively with my husband domestically as well as internationally and I have never NOT received maid service. We called the desk, and although they did apologize and bring towels up right away for us, they never did come and clean our room-UNACCEPTABLE! RESTAURANTS~We had the highlight of our stay at the RIO at Cafe Martorano's restaurant -after having horrible service in the hotel, I have to say we had a fantastic dinner here. The friend who invited us used to work for Harrahs and was very familiar with the menu, so we let him choose what we would be having. He chose a nice selection of appetizers and entrees for us to share "family style." Everything we tried was delicious! The eggplant appetizer was just delicious!! The meatballs were great too and I'm not a huge meatball fan. The veal was also great! The wine was delicious and our server was awesome!! The music was fun and upbeat! All American grill~service was good and food was great! Buffet~Had the brunch buffet one morning and the service was really good and the food selection was excellent. Too much food for us, but overall a really nice buffet if your into them! ;) Yummy peel and eat shrimp! VOODOO LOUNGE~Had the oppurtunity to go up to the 51st floor and have a few drinks at voodoo lounge. The night we were there they had a DJ outside and it was pretty packed up there. So many people it was pretty impossible to dance and the music was not very good. The view, however, is amazing!! All in all, I have to say that this...BY FAR....is my worst hotel experience in my life. Like I stated I have traveled alot and I'm not incredibly picky as long as the basics are covered. However, this trip there was way too many mistakes made by the staff in the hotel and the quality of the rooms is really not acceptable for the price they charge a night...especially since it is so far from the strip. I can honestly say this is the first NEGATIVE review I have ever left for a hotel. I mean, there can be things here and there that need improvement, but generally there is not this many problems. Unfortunately, this was the exception. far too many problems, lack of service and due to that my review of the RIO is DO NOT STAY HERE!! Stay on the strip, pay alittle more money and get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “I prefer the RIO”
Reviews.Author: sammybee00
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the rio at least 35 times in the last 10 years, I have also stayed at Paris, flamingo, caesars and the palms - I prefer the rio over all the other hotels - everyone goes to vegas for different reasons, i go there to suntan, party and gamble - if you are going for the first time i wouldn't say this would be my first choice, as it is off the strip & not on top of Vegassy attractions(a whole 5 mins via taxi or free shuttle) but the amount of times i have been there now, i prefer it..I LOVE voodoo beach, its spred out 4 or 5 pools and one pool has sand, i spend my days there..and i like Rio cuz its off the strip so less foot traffic, drink service i find is faster there over everywhere else Especially caesars which is by far the slowest - every staff I have encountered at the rio from housekeeping to casino hosts have been very friendly and helpful - I have gone to the spa a few times and its not my favorite..if you wanna get in some spa action caesars is only good for that in my opinion - I don't know who can actually comment on their "rooms" i mean who goes to vegas to chill in the room the whole time / seriously who cares, its a suite, large roomy, clean & i only use the room to pass out and shower - it works very well for that, I find the beds comfortable -room service has always been fast for me - I love hamadas sushi (even tho its over priced) I have eaten at the american grill several times with no issues, i personally don't do buffets so i can't comment on that - one of my favorite clubs is VooDoo lounge - great music - 2 differnt djs inside and outside - the huge voodoo 45$ dry ice drink is a must - I am all about being at the top of the hotel getting hammered / ghost bar @ palms is also good for that / anyway I will get around to writing other vegas hotel reviews but in the meantime different strokes for different folks - anything bad about rio? honestly no.. I am not a picky uptight person, although palace station is a lil grunge but give me a drink and a slot machine I am mostly happy anywhere, and I have stayed there enough to be satisfied with everything about the rio.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - on the same levbel as the Stratosphere”
Reviews.Author: Mbifive0
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9/19-9/23 in room 517 & 519. What a dump. Heavy cigar smoke from the past guest in a non-smoking room, housekeeping made up the room but ignored the heavy cigar smoke. Was told to leave for an hour while they sprayed the room. Got back to unpack and someone's hair in the bathroom - housekeeping supervisor said "Oh, looks like the housekeeper's hair"....you have to figure, what else is dirty then..... the phone was not working in 517 maintenence came up and found the phone was unplugged behind the bed, 517 had a red type substance on the rug between the beds upon check in...ketsup or blood....wasn't cleaned until a note was left for housekeeping the next afternoon thinking it is so obvious they would have cleaned it but NO, had to tell them to please clean what ever red it was hoping it was not the prior guests blood....the electronic safe wouldn't open and the maintenence man came up again to say"Oh, you have to keep your finger on the door and put pressure on it to make it open"....if they knew it why wasn't it fixed to begin with? Then the Carnival Buffet...ever been to the Golden Corral Buffet by mistake....well the RIo's food has gone down hill so bad that we all had to eat at other resorts to get good food. Oh...don't look at the curtins in the rooms that are torn in places and off the hooks...and of course the small holes in the walls from prior guests.....really a welfare hotel.....no better than the dumpy Strat. There is more but running out of room. There are 2 buildings for rooms and we apparently got the welfare side of the place. Was looking forward to Penn & Teller but they were on a much deserved vacation I am sure at a better place than the Rio!!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not what I was expecting!”
Reviews.Author: 808Warrior
Reviews.Content: Based on friends recommendations, I was expecting a spectacular "suite". That, it was not - just a very large room. The carpet was wet when we checked in and although we should have requested a room change, didn't, since we already started unpacking. TV was very old and started out black and white, would go to color after 5-10 minutes, then revert back to black and white. The desk lamp had no light bulb, and housekeeping DID bring a lightbulb within a few minutes of our request (this was good). There some some trouble flushing the toilet, too, which we were able to remedy on our own.

Reviews.Title: “We were pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry67
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned last night from a 6 night stay at the Rio. Both the check in and check out were very fast. The room was spacious and clean and had a beautiful view. The bed was very comfortable, although the pillows were not. There was a refrigerater, but not a microwave in the suite which would have been very helpful, since restaurants all serve such large portions and it would be nice to reheat leftovers instead of throwing away good food. All staff members from front desk, to valet, to restaurant employees, keno runners and casino workers, housekeeping and security were all friendly and helpful. We only ate at 2 restaurants while we were there, the Sao Paulo Cafe, and the American Grille. I have Celiac Disease and the staff attempted to be very helpful with finding gluten free choices, however, there is some training and education to be done as some waiters and waitresses appeared to have never heard of this fairly common condition. I also became ill immediately after eating the 2nd time at the American Grille. I ate the same meal both times at this restaurant, the Sea Bass, but it was prepared differently and the vegetables were also served differently the 2nd time when I became ill, even though I was assured that the Chef and waiter understood my needs. I was given conflicting information about how somethings were prepared from the first time we ate there. Menu choices in restaurants that would be specifically listed as gluten free on the menu would be extremely helpful and give Celiacs the confidence that the chef really is knowledgeable about this condition.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Deal on a Huge Room, BUT the beds need some upgrading”
Reviews.Author: Figgee
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at the Rio on the 19th floor (Room 19022). We requested a King bed, but upon check in, we were told they were all gone for our first night but we could request a "move" to King for nights 2 and 3. We opted to stay with our room of two queen beds. Regrettably and much to our disappointment the beds were very hard, which made our sleep uncomfortable but bearable. The beds in this room really need upgrading to something like a pillow-top model. Aside from the beds the Rio was a good experience and we would stay again. The rooms are huge and the view was unbelievable. The rooms are very quiet. The Casino is very good too and must have a very good ventilation system to remove the cigarette smoke which made it most pleasant. The pools area i really nice, but we think the loungers are due for replacement as they are old, worn and somewhat dirty. The Carnival Buffet is a must and is rated number 3 on the top then list. Staff are courteous, friendly and informative. Two shuttles from the Rio every thirty minutes, alternating between Harrah's and Bally's. The drivers were very friendly and informative. All-in-all the Rio is a great hotel and a good deal! We stayed from Monday to Wednesday for $52.00 a night! PS: The hotel charges $14 a day for internet which we declined.

Reviews.Title: “a good hotel but not near any of vegas' main attractions”
Reviews.Author: ian_wil
Reviews.Content: our room was huge with a nicely proportioned bathroom and a good view of the mountains - the hotel has a nice range of eating choices and we opted for Indian. the hotel was very clean, valet parking was free, all of the staff were very friendly and check in & out were relatively quick.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday/anniversery”
Reviews.Author: pappa207
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to celebrate both my birthday and our wedding anniversery. From the time we got there to the time we left, everyone was helpful and professional. My wife has celiac, and we normally have issues finding places to eat. The employees of the All- american grill, Bu'zios and the vodoo resturant went out of thier way to find ways to feed her. The nightlife at the vodoo lounge was great! We got great seats at shows and we got a great room. This will be our "resort" from now on!.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, spacioous roomThe room had floor to ceiling windows, with a great view of las vegas”
Reviews.Author: livedalot
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, spacious, and had a great view. The pool area was great. Two pools, at least two hot tubs. The food was good at the buffet and other restaurants. Be fore warned, the buffet price goes up $10.00 on the weekend. Much better to go during the week, if possible. You don't get many bargains in Las Vegas. But if you go durilng the week, you have a much better chance, than the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay...”
Reviews.Author: beleafer22
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas for a hotel owner's conference (Family owns a Super 8 in Sarnia, Ontario). The room rate was excellent (average of about $49 for a double queen room). The bed was the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. The bathroom was EXTREMELY SMALL, barely enough room to turn in a circle. The tub was dirty especially when I pointed the shower head towards the corners, all this dirt came out it was nasty. The restaurants are pretty good, I had breakfast at the Sao Paolo Cafe twice it was excellent both times. Overall a pretty average place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Back Again”
Reviews.Author: kn0xvegas
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Rio. Arrived Sunday before Labor day, got in our room early. Hit the pool…. Everything was clean as could be expected. Deck chairs are showing some age, but place a couple towels over them and know one would know. Room was in the Ipanema section very clean and cleaned every day by 11:00am. No problems. I feel most of the negative reviews are because they to drunk to close door or lost more than they could afford and had to tell someone (wife or mom’s ) they were robbed or “someone broke into room” or they left door open by mistake. Some just complain to see what they can get comp’ed. We never felt worried or nervous in any way, room had a safe and a dead bolt on door. Reviewers that had problems with buffet, didn’t read promotion details. It was very simple keep your wrist band on for free buffet. Just think how easy it would be to remove your wristband and give or sell to someone else. We will stay again. This was our 4th trip to Rio in last 3 years and never had any problems. I would consider room a solid 3 star or about the same level as a Hampton Inn or Springhill Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place..Good Value...Great View...Great Nightlife”
Reviews.Author: Dino T
Reviews.Content: Nice place for the money. Rooms were clean, large, and well appointed. The hotel has some minor shopping, some good clubs, good places to eat, and is across from the Palms. Everything is a Taxi Ride, but not expensive. Good convention rooms. Everyone was friendly. If you want to go to the clubs, just walk through the casino about 7-9pm. They hand out free VIP passes to get in. The palms did this too. Dont pay to get into clubs. Just ask, and you will get free passes. With the strip being overgrown, this was a nice change.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms! AMAZING Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Stangerang
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel for the $$$... We stayed in a room with 1 King bed, HUGE Room - floor to ceiling windows all the way across. Large Bathroom with lots of mirror space. The hotel was clean (a little outdated in the casino, but the rooms were great). It's about a 10-15 minute walk to the strip, but there is a free shuttle bus that goes from Pairs to the Rio and back - but to be honest, if you're in shape, you could walk it faster as the bus waits a little and the traffic on the strip is always really busy. The Pool - AMAZIMNG, best that I've been too in Las Vegas. Make sure you check out the Club at the top of the Rio - amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: AverageTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Flight arrived at 10:00 am with check in at 4:00 pm. I called the hotel the week before and requested early check in. I was told that it shouldn't be a problem, but if it was, the hotel would hold are bags. Arrived at hotel at 11:30 am and we were headed up to our room after about 15 minutes. Rooms were nice - 2 queens beds with a pull out couch. Everything was clean (the tub could have used a good scrub and bleach). There is a seperate dressing area outside the bathroom which was good as there were 3 ladies in our room trying to get dressed at the same time! Shuttle was good - never had to wait more than 30 mins. A good hotel for people who don't want to be right in the middle of everything. The pool was okay. One was really cold, one was really hot, and the other was full of kids. The sand beach area wasn't great - full of cigg butts. The best seats always seemed to be reserved with no one in them. I didn't get a chance to check out the VIP pool. Drinks were very pricy. $10 for a cocktail. Food was good at the American Bar and at the Voodoo Steak Lounge. Voodoo club was vey nice - mix of all ages and UNREAL view! If you get a chance, go see the Chippendales show. Most fun I have ever had! All and all, this hotel is a good place to rest your head at night. I'm not a high roller so I don't need a fancy hotel. This was just what I was looking for with a little more!

Reviews.Title: “An Honest Review”
Reviews.Author: BLJETAN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio from August 23-28. Let me begin by saying that we were compted the 5 nights. We had stayed there many years ago and I read many reviews before we went. We had recently been staying at Mandalay Bay the last few years. There were many negative reviews about the Rio so I didn't know what to expect. We were pleasantly surprised. It is an older hotel but our room was on the 8th floor and spacious and very clean. We did not wait at check-in and our room was ready and we were there at 11 am. The refridgerater in the room is a plus. We never waited long for the shuttle to or back from the Strip. The buffet lines were usually long but we didn't care beause we are not buffet people. Reviewers claimed that the casino was dark but we found the Mirage to be darker. We did OK gambling there and the service was good. The pool area was a good size and clean. There were quite a few families with children there also. If you're looking for a decent place at a low price the Rio is a good bet. I say that you get what you pay for, so if you want more and willing to pay then go to TheHotel, Mandalay Bay, Venetian, or Ceasars. Please don't compare the Rio to them. Would I go back?? If I was compted or wanted an inexpensive stay = YES!

Reviews.Title: “Dumpy and outdated. Suites WAY overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: fratspin
Reviews.Content: I booked a Masquerade Suite at the Rio, partially because it stated that it had an "upgraded sound system." The "sound system" was literally a $20 boombox that had a tape player and CD player, and it DIDN"T EVEN WORK in the first place. What a piece of [-]. The TVs in all the rooms were at least 10 years old, I haven't stayed in a place with TVs that crappy in years. The restaurants were all disgusting EXCEPT for the Indian restaurant that was excellent but also very pricey. I didn't even gamble in the casino, because it was so rundown and just overall crummy. Don't ever stay here. If you're looking for a cheap room, at least stay somewhere on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Ishabirthday
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Rio. The casino is a blast, the cocktail waitresses perform on stages throughtout the hotel every 15 minutes. This make for a fun casino environment. The buffet was The best buffet I have ever been to. The room was nice, there was a refreshment center and a mini-fridge in the room. Had lunch at the All American Bar & Grill it was VERY good. I had the cajun chicken quesadilla and my husband had a burger. The burger is served with their signature fries, which are thick cut french fries and season waffles fries.....YUMMY. I did not like the rapid roulette station it was cheap gambling, but my numbers never came and the actual roulette table was $10 per play and that is not for me. My husband said it did not WOW me, but I was satisfied.....

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money you save”
Reviews.Author: DSM305
Reviews.Content: We're pretty laid-back travelers. Having both worked in the hospitality industry, we're more than polite and patient with most hotel and restaurant staff we encounter. We usually overlook the minor problems and just go with the flow, choosing instead to relax and enjoy our vacation. But our most recent visit to the Rio tested us to the limit. Having stayed for a long weekend several months before, we knew not to expect luxury or 5-star service. Upon checking in for a four-night stay, we stepped into the well-worn room we expected but were immediately overcome with the overwhelming stench of cigar smoke. We called the front desk right away to report the problem and requested a new room. The indifferent clerk told us there was nothing else available. (Hard to believe in a mega resort during the off season.) He did send housekeeping to "deodorize" the room, which resulted in the even more unbearable stench of cleaner masking smoke. After spending the night in one of the single most uncomfortable hotel beds I've ever experienced (every spring made its presence known), we stopped by the front desk the next morning to again request a new room. When we were again told that wasn't possible, we asked if we could pay for a room upgrade. We just wanted to enjoy our stay. Not particularly concerned, the front desk told us to check back in three hours after they were sure all VIPs were accommodated for the evening. (We are well aware we're not VIPs, but it was still rather odd to have that pointed out by the staff.) We proceeded to check with the front desk four more times over the next 24 hours, each time being told to come back several hours later. After spending a second night in this subpar room and being turned away again by the front desk, I went back to the room, called guest relations, and insisted that we be moved. I didn't want to be THAT guest, but the Rio's staff didn't leave us much choice. We were finally moved from our king room to a newer double-double -- disappointing, but at least the beds allowed for a decent night's sleep. We've had some OK times at the Rio, and I really do want to like this place. It's not without its good points. The casino is fun, and the Show in the Sky is entertaining the first time or two. The buffet is decent, and the iBar makes a good spot to meet traveling companions. The free shuttle bus to the Strip helps mitigate the remote location (although it doesn't run late). And, of course, Harrah's no-resort-fee policy is a plus. But the Rio's rooms need a major renovation, no matter where you are in the hotel something always seems to be broken, and the staff, while not rude, are among the most unhelpful and indifferent we've experienced in Las Vegas. Saving a few bucks is nice, but where the Rio is concerned, it's just not worth it. Spend a little more -- even if it means paying those MGM-Mirage resort fees -- and choose your favorite 4-star on the Strip. You'll have a far better experience and enjoy more of the fun that Vegas has to offer. Final tip, though, if you do stay at the Rio: Gaylord Indian Restaurant was a fantastic lunch choice one day. Wonderful service, charming atmosphere, and far better-than-expected food for a decent price. It's well-worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and over good Vegas experience”
Reviews.Author: argonauts52
Reviews.Content: Rio is off the strip, but it is a 20 min walk, $12 cab ride, or 1/2 hour free shuttle to the strip. Not that big of a problem. I had 4 nights comped here, so it was a fantastic deal for me. Front desk takes forever to process through. I had to wait 1/2 hour to check in at 1 AM. Ipanama tour is where we were with a view of the mountains. Not too far of walk through the casino to get to the elevators. Room was nice but rug, couch, and TV could be updated. Safe in room for valuables. Beds were soft and AC worked well. Shower and sink area were extremely nice. Internet is expensive and should be free. One morning the fire alarm went off for about 2 hours at 6 AM. Rough start for a day with a false alarm. Food in casino restaurants was expensive but tasty. Next time I will eat next door at Gold Coast Casino for under $10 buffets that locals love. The pool was nice but get there early to get a chair. First pool is filled with kids, hot tubs needed a good cleaning, second pool feels like bathwater with nothing special in it, third pool was the best, but cold and the 4th pool you have to pay to get into. It was in the back secluded for free female entrance but males had to pay $20 to get in. Water tasted funny as well like it was salty or something. They played loud club music, but I did not mind but others who are older would definitely complain. Food/drinks expensive by pool. Casino is average with good looking waitresses. Sportsbook is just average. This is a huge casino with alot of area to cover. Club Voodoo on top floor is a must and you can get in free before midnight if you look for people handing out free VIP cards near escalators. Voodoo has great indoor/outdoor view of vegas 51 stories up. Nicely decorated and nice dancers. Overall my experience at Rio was good and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay with the upgrade”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio for two nights while attending a conference in July. I arrived late on a Tuesday night and stood in line behind several other people. There were two clerks working check in but it seemed to be a slow process. While checking in, I was advised that my room was being upgraded, which I did not expect at a $49 per night rate. Anyway, I received directions to the room and found that I had a 1600 sq. foot suite with 180 degrees of floor to ceiling windows. It was a huge room with a dining room, living room, bedroom, and two bathrooms. The master bath had two vanities, a whirlpool, and a separate shower all done in marble. Needless to say, I’m satisfied with the room. I was surprised, however, that the TVs were old style tube models as opposed to flat screens. Since I don’t gamble, I didn’t use the casino although you have to walk through it to get to everything. The Rio has a good sized pool area but it was crowded during the day and closes at 6 pm. Most hotels in Vegas close the pools at night to get people in the casino, given the hot weather, I believe they should be open much later. There are a variety of restaurants on the property. They tend to be crowded at lunch when conventions are on-site. I didn’t have time to wait in line so I bought a wrap from a take out counter near the casino. It had been sitting awhile and was pretty soggy. I ate one night at the seafood buffet, which is supposed to be highly acclaimed. I found it to be mediocre. The crab legs were snow crab instead of king crab, the shrimp were small, and I didn’t see any lobster. The gelato, however, was very good. The Rio doesn’t deliver a bill to your room so you have to wait for check out if you want a receipt. This seems like a waste of time. Luggage storage is available. Overall, I enjoyed the stay. I got a great rate and a huge room. I don’t know if I’d pay full price.

Reviews.Title: “Tradeshow Trip”
Reviews.Author: LeahBelle22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio for a week for a tradeshow. The rooms are big but very outdated (but I was told by my boss, who was in another tower, that her room was more modern). The pillows are so small and flat that I had to pile them on top of each other to be comfortable. My room came with a mini refrigerator but no coffee maker (I called the front desk and they said they do not carry them). Some of the restaurants in the hotel were not very good (All American Bar & Grill, Seafood Buffet). I did have a nice lunch at the indian restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: djskip
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at the Rio Hotel in Las Vegas, so I booked a room on line using my players club card. The room that I booked for Sept. 6th was $30.00 for deluxe and for $10.00 more, I could upgrade to a premium room with a view. I booked the premium room and when we arrived at the Rio, the clerk said that we would not be getting a view of the strip. I explained to her, my confirmation paper shows a premium. The clerk told me only the studio suites have the views. After complaining, the so called supervisor came over and told me for $20.00 more, I could upgrade with a strip view. Well, according to their website, a premium room does state view rooms and deluxe rooms have mountain views. I told her no, give me the room, I will not pay the $20.00 extra. The next day, I spoke with the manager and he gave me the same story. How can they advertise on their internet that the premium rooms have a strip view and management tells me they do not, it is the deluxe rooms? I think Harrah's better get someone in management that knows what they are doing. By the way, the room was very clean, no problems there, just poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed because room was comped, but really pleased with the RIO!”
Reviews.Author: rhinoman7
Reviews.Content: The reason for staying at the Rio was because we were able to get our room comped. However, we ended up really enjoying our stay. We stayed in the basic Suite, but it was a very large room, and very clean. The bed was very comfortable, and the in-room safe and refrigerator were a nice touch! Stayed for 4 days/3 nights, and the housekeeping did a great job of cleaning and replacing all of the toiletries. Even honored our request to leave extra towels on the 2nd day. Since we weren't willing to pay the extra for a strip view, we were surprised to open the curtains and see that we had a strip view anyway! Even though we were only on the 7th floor, it was still a very good view of the strip. The only complaint I have about the room is that the A/C unit is right by the window, which is quite a ways from the bathroom area, so that area was a little warmer that we would have liked. All things considered, an extremely small complaint. Overall, the room was fantastic, and we would definitely stay there again! We ate at the Sao Paulo Cafe for breakfast twice, and the food was excellent! The servers were a little slow and not very personable, but we were there to eat, not to make friends. LOL! We also ate at the Carnival World Buffet as part of the Buffet of Buffets package. Ate there for dinner, and the selections are vast! Especially liked the dessert counter in the middle. Nice selection of gelato! The casino area is huge, and there is something for everyone. Blackjack table minimums were a little higher than I would have liked, but had fun at every table I played at. There is also just about every slot machine that you can imagine! (Except I couldn't fine the Lucky Penny Bright Diamonds machine!) We made use of valet parking, and the self-parking garage. At first, it seems somewhat confusing getting around the property with the car, but it didn't take long to figure out. Compared to some other properties, the walk from the parking garage to our room was not that bad. We were always able to find a parking spot close to the elevators. All in all, the Rio is a great value, and and excellent place to stay if you are on a budget and want to spend more of your money gambling. After all, why else would you go to Vegas?

Reviews.Title: “Don't understand the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: luvvegas1198
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 7 day stay at the Rio in Las Vegas. We had a room on the 30th floor of the Masquerade tower. The room was great. Had an awesome view of the Mountains and the Strip. Check in was a breeze, we were several hours early and they didn't mind at all. We had a great rate using Harrah's Total Rewards website. The Casino and Pool area was clean. All the staff were helpful. We have eaten here at both buffets prior to our stay. This time we just visited the Carnival Buffet which was pretty good. We won some and lost some breaking even for the trip. We would highly recommend the Rio and would stay here again for a similar price. We recommend getting a rental car when in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Best time Ever”
Reviews.Author: msevans32
Reviews.Content: My husband took me to Vegas for my 40th birthday. We stayed at the Rio once before and swore we never stay again. We are platinum players at Harrah’s and he booked a room from Friday September 3 to Monday September 6. Friday and Sunday were comp’d but he paid $90 for Saturday. We stayed in room 2611 in the masquerade tower. It had a wonderful view of the pool, I-15, Trump Tower, Wynn and Stratosphere. The room had a king bed, sofa, refrigerator and two sinks in the bathroom. Most importantly the room was clean and near the elevator. This was a non-smoking room. The only down side was that we could hear the thumps of the music from either the pool or inside the casino. But it was not distracting. The room does not have a coffee maker and the coffee shop down stairs charges $3.23 for a 16 oz regular coffee. The valet, security and bellmen were nice a courteous. The cocktail servers always came around to take our order but it seemed like forever before we received our drinks. I had ABSOLUTELY no luck at the casino, but my husband had some. I never had any luck gambling at the Rio. We gamble at the Orleans, Gold Coast and Palace Station. Since it was Labor Day weekend, we decided to stay away from the Strip. I don’t think this is a place for kids. After hours, the partiers come out. My husband and I are not prudes and we partied in our day. The girls wore skimpy clothes and the men are usually drunk. Everyone one is having a good time. They don’t do any gambling but are having fun. The best thing about the Rio is that it is right off the Freeway and easier to get in and out of. Normally, we stay at Paris but our next trip we will definitely stay here.

Reviews.Title: “a great off the strip hotel”
Reviews.Author: judogayle
Reviews.Content: the rooms were large and clean. the staff were very friendly and helpful. had a wonderful buffet, Carnival World Buffet. great for breakfast, lunch & dinner. great pools and free shuttle service to the strip. very convenient to all Las Vegas has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Honeymoon Stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: sparkyclubmed
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rio for 5 nights in September on our honeymoon and had a great time. We wanted a quiet/relax vacation and that's exactly what we got. We never waited more than 10 minutes for the free Strip shuttle. The Strip was always very crowded and we were very happy staying off the Strip. We spent most of our time at the Rio pools and hot tubs. It was not crowded and we enjoyed ourselves. We also went bowling at the Gold Coast Casino (right across the street) which we really enjoyed. We also ate most of our meals at the Gold Coast Casino. The buffets were much cheaper than the Rio and we really like the Gold Coast food. We also went to Friday's at the Gold Coast which was very good. Harrah's buffet was excellent and we enjoyed the all-you-can-eat crab legs. We got free show tickets to Jubilee (a must see) and food vouchers from a Wyndham timeshare presentation. The free stuff was great but the presentation was more than 3 hours. We did not purchase a timeshare and found out once we got home that we could buy the same timeshare on Ebay for $1,200 vs. the $26,000 that Wyndham wanted. We purchased tickets to KÀ by Cirque du Soleil which was excellent. We would go back to the Rio in a heartbeat but would still use the Gold Coast facilities which were excellent and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but off the strip”
Reviews.Author: berry1601
Reviews.Content: Our room , and the resort, was very clean and spacious. All of the staff were accomodating and friendly. The pool area is fabulous. They have 3 pools - 2 of them with great water falls. There is a sandy beach entry on one and the kids tend to stay in that area. The resort provides a free shuttle that runs either to Ballys/Paris Paris or to Harrahs. The shuttle runs until 1 AM, and we didn't ever have to wait long for the ride. The shuttle drivers were some of the nicest people!

Reviews.Title: “Needs quality training and management.”
Reviews.Author: Only4RFYI
Reviews.Content: We have been to Vegas many times. I stayed this time around at the new Marriott Springhills Suites for the first night in Vegas. It was just perfect in every way. Clean is the first thing that I look for along with a good use of space and colors in the room. Marriott Springhill Suites had it all and a free breakfast buffet to start your busy day. I have stayed in Paris on the strip and Bally's. Paris is much cleaner of course. Bally's was not that bad either. I must say that I was rather unhappy with the service at Rio period. I am not much for rooms with a connecting door so we had to change it. The next room was one floor below on the 31st floor. The room was not all that it seems on the advertising. This is something that made me want to leave right away. The room needed a serious make cover remodeling the room curtains and carpet yuck. The bed was clean and comfortable. But no coffee pot in the room WTF. I am never staying there again. Marriott is the best for the needs I have and standards in quality perfection. Durning the week day we went down to the pool only to see the girl putting up the white link chain to close it off because they did not have enough life guards. It was the sandy beach pool one of the nicest one of the three connected in the same area. So packed right next to each other in the next pool that was so cold. It must have been 45 degrees in there. It was painful to get it and everyone complained about it. NEVER AGAIN!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, view, shopping, courtious staff”
Reviews.Author: WYKingkat
Reviews.Content: Room had great view, especially at night of the city lights! Blue windows let in a lot of heat, whereas, the red windows stayed cool. We just kept the curtains pulled during the day. The room was large and roomy, and beds were comfy. Thought the little window in the bathroom was neat to view the city and ledge was handy for toiletries. Didn't care for the placement of the bed because when the bathroom light was on, it shined right on the bed from the little window. Fridge was handy. For an "all suite hotel", a microwave would have been nice. We just ate our pasta leftovers cold. Room was a little dirty - needed edge vacuumed and vents dusted. Staff very accommodating. We asked for a room near our other party and they gave us adjoining rooms! Shops on 2nd floor were great. Friendly staff there and good prices. Next time, we'll shop there first. Buffet food was excellent! Only real disappointment was the sky show wasn't performed during our stay Monday - Wednesday. Not impressed with the VooDoo Lounge. Better view at the Palms because you can get to the edge. Loved the pools and the beach. Very family friendly with the white sand near the water. Not crowded at all. Shuttle to the strip was handy but too hot to wait for in the Harrah's garage, so we walked back at 11:45PM. Not a bad walk with the improved sidewalks.

Reviews.Title: “Do not buy into the Buffet of Buffet deal!”
Reviews.Author: pab_10
Reviews.Content: The rooms here are not "suites" but are large hotel rooms, the furniture a little saggy and shabby. There is no in-room coffee maker, I suppose that's to encourage you to use the Starbucks downstairs. We had to track down and ask the maid in the hallway for soap, lotion and shampoo. Worst of all, we had booked a special "package" for our three-day stay, pre-paying nearly double the normal room rate in order to get what sounded in the description like full access, 24 hours, to seven buffets, at the Rio and 6 other affiliated hotels. We'd figured that we wouldn't have to budget for food during our stay, having paid in advance for access to all these buffets. Problem was, nobody knew how this was supposed to work. We asked the clerk at check-in how it worked and he vaguely showed us a coupon that printed out with our check-in papers, and said we needed to show that to the cashier. We tried using that at Caesar's (one of the affiliated hotels) and were greeted with puzzled looks but after a consultation with another employee, we were given bright blue paper wrist bands and ushered into the buffet. The buffet itself was nice, but after eating, we didn't want to wear those paper wrist bands and so we took them off (nobody had told us otherwise). Next morning, we tried to get in to the breakfast buffet at Rio and were told that without the wrist bands they wouldn't let us in. The cashier pointed to the small print on the wrist band that said "void if removed," which nobody had told us before. We protested, showing our coupon and the "charging privileges" card, telling her we'd pre-paid for this privilege, but the cashier was firm--we had to talk to the manager at the guest registration desk to work it out, she said. So we did, and he basically told us it was too bad but we were only allowed one 24-hour access period to the buffets during our 3-day stay, and to use it we had to keep wearing those paper wrist bands, even to shower. I mentioned that our reservation had cost us nearly twice as much because the advertising sounded as if we paid the extra amount in order to get buffet access during our entire stay, and he said, sorry, but it's only one 24 hour period. He did finally agree to let us go to the buffet that morning without the magic paper wristband (after I pointed out that even if what he said was right, we were still within the 24-hour period that apparently had begun the day before at Caesar's). When we went back to the cashier for the buffet, she said we would not believe the number of people who had complained about that very same thing, all of us mislead in the same way. By the way, you can buy that 24-hour access to the buffets once you arrive there, for only $39.99. We paid roughly 4 times that. Buyer, beware!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR A SUITE”
Reviews.Author: dgiese
Reviews.Content: room was nice just as advertised beds are a little worn other than that i can't complain for 25 dollars for a suite the rio is a great place to stay with a family large rooms , also they have a free shuttle that goes to bally's on the strip every half hour, we ate at mcfadden's at the rio excellent food at good prices .

Reviews.Title: “Husband played in WSOP”
Reviews.Author: MrsmacGardencity
Reviews.Content: On our last stay in Las Vegas we decided to stay at the Rio, since my husband was playing in the WSOP. We really did like it there, but we came home with bug bites. We stayed in room 9026. When we came home and I researched the bug bites I found that they were bed bug bites. The bites were all 3 bites in a row and so itchy that I had to take Benydryl to help stop the itching. I used some steroid cream to get rid of them. I have not found any bedbugs at home, so I am very thankful that I did not bring them home with me. I would have a very hard time staying in any hotel at this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms - Lousy Staff”
Reviews.Author: agates3429
Reviews.Content: The room was kept nice, huge and roomy. BUT.... We checked in on Sunday and there were glasses from the casino littering the halls, when we checked out on Wednesday, the same classes were ther and more. Upon check-in we were given a rather pushy up-sale for an additional $75/night to upgrade our room. We were told that without an upgrade we were not going to get a good view. Didn't find any hotel staff to be friendly or helpful. Areas of the hotel SMELLED really bad, like sewage or dead fish.

Reviews.Title: “A mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: lkmccall
Reviews.Content: Being locals, we occasionally will go stay at a hotel just to get away, have dinner and drinks and not have to drive. We had a standard suite which was larger than some of the deluxe suites at more expensive hotels. The bedroom area had a couch, coffee table, table and chairs for 2, TV with more channels than most casino hotels and the king bed. The bed was firm, but not being fans of feather pillows it was hard to sleep. The sheets weren't as soft as other Harrahs properties. The mini fridge is a nice touch. Toiletries were minimum. The weird thing was the little window between the shower and bedroom area. Random.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: kadmit
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we thought, wow, all suites! How exciting. But, when we opened the door and saw how dirty the room was, we were horrified. The room was comped, so we knew we wouldn't get a remodeled room, but they hadn't dusted the room in so long, we could draw pictures in it! There was a huge spot on the ceiling where we THINK someone had opened up a shaken can of soda (we aren't sure, though) - it was a brown, dried up blobby mess. the carpets didn't look like they'd been cleaned for years, and there wasn't a TV remote. We complained, and they didn't offer any solution, so we requested that they come in and do a more thorough cleaning job...all they did was to wipe off the ceiling. No vacuuming, or dusting. We attempted to check-out using the TV, and found that they had charged us for 3 drinks (from the mini bar) that we hadn't used, so we had to go talk to them about getting that removed. Overall, it was a crazy mess. I would not recommend this hotel to even my worst enemy!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Canuckscout
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights at the Rio. As usual I have both good and bad comments but overall we enjoyed the experience and will go back. My wife and I have been to Las vegas over 40 times and have stayed at many hotels. The GOOD: We enjoyed the pools. They are salt water so no strong chemicals. The pools were clean. We had no problem finding lounge chairs (unlike the Mirage) and there were many shady and private spots. I wish they would stay open past 6:00 PM. I also find the pools a little shallow at 4 ft. maximum. The music was a little loud and occaisionally jungle thumping rap crap but overall not bad. GOOD: The room was spacious, clean and the beds were comfortable. We had a mini fridge which was great to keep beer, milk and oranges cool. The room had floor to ceiling windows which needed cleaning but I know in Vegas that would have to be done daily to keep all the sand off them. Just live with it. The view of the strip was great. GOOD: The location is actually very easy to get to and from the strip. We always rent a car but they had a shuttle available which runs you to Bill's (corner Flamingo and Las Vegas Blvd.). It seemed to run frequently. It is too far to walk to the strip especially in the heat. POOR: The buffet used to be good years ago when Tony Marnell owned the Rio but it has really slipped in quality. A good deal is the $39.95 24 hour pass which allows you to use Ceasars, Paris, Flamingo etc. We found the buffet at Caesars very good. If you buy it late one day you can go for dinner, breakfast and again for dinner the next day. POOR: We found most dealers were good but there is always one with attitude. This trip we ran into one who I won't name here but have communicated to the casino manager. She is from Yugoslavia and you will definitely notice her if you play the table games. She not only made mistakes but was bad attitude and agressive the whole time. Just nasty. She very quickly cleared the table which was too bad because everyone was having fun until she arrived. If they don't like their job they should quit. There are THOUSANDS of people waiting to take their job. How the casinos don't screen them out better I don't understand since this is a tough market for them. We made lots of money and left immediately when she arrived so RIO never got a chance to make their money back and I sure don't feel sorry for them!! Sweet revenge!! Overall I like the RIO and would recommend it. You'll enjoy it more if you have a car but that's a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Usually Love staying at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: kitten81360
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Rio for 15 yrs. They didn't have the mountain view I normally get when we arrived and I booked our trip in January. The breakfast buffet is good. Tight slots.

Reviews.Title: “Busy place”
Reviews.Author: RDB1964
Reviews.Content: Arrived Wednesday. Nice room facing mountains. Ate supper at Seafood buffet, great. next day bought pass for buffet, good also. Casino was busy biut not too bad until Friday night, then it seemed like a high school tour group was wet loose in the casino. I have never seen that many children in a casino ever. There were a bunch of rowdy 16-20 yr olds, running up and down our hallway. In the casino there were kids in strollers and some that were 5-10 yrs old. I understand that the parents may have been in Vegas on vacation but a casino is not the place for kids. There were shows that the Rio put on each night that were adult oriented, and there were the youngsters standing there watching. Can't blame them, I was watching too. I prefer a little quiter place to throw my money away. JMO

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It! Waste of time and Money”
Reviews.Author: cacohen3
Reviews.Content: I've always wanted to stay at the Rio. What a dissappointment. The rooms were old and dingie! We felt we like stepped back in the 80"s Rio you really need to upgrade,update immediately! Will tell everyone not to stay there unless they like the 80's. Waste of time and money! Staff was even RUDE!

Reviews.Title: “SECURITY IS TERRIBLE NO HELP”
Reviews.Author: horselover03
Reviews.Content: Some one took my wallet and I went to get help and security just looks at you and will not help you. He just sat and said I cant do anything about it. All casinos will check cameras and try to help you. He just sat looking stupid and said we cant do that. No sorry no help they have a thief and they dont care. Who ever it was dropped a remote in my purse, so they have a problem and could care less. To many casinos in vegas that care stay away. I talked to several differ casino security and they do alot to help. BEWARE OF RIO.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: careyes45
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at Caesar's, MGM, Gold Coast, and Bellagio over the course of about 10 years and decided on Rio after reading all the reviews. The room decor is dated, but the size, full wall of windows, comfy bed, and fridge make up for it. Yes, it's located off the strip, but you can always take a shuttle or cab. Tables are just as spendy as on the strip, but you can walk to Gold Coast for cheaper tables. The buffet's reputation for being the biggest and best in Las Vegas is true. Pool area is beautiful. Customer service is the best I've ever experienced - from the lady in the sundries shop, to the waiter at American Grille, to our server at Voodoo Steaks and Chops. All made you feel like they were happy to serve you. Also felt like they didn't want to make you drop more money - for example at Voodoo, you could order 3 petit desserts for $8, we couldn't decide so the server said he'd pick 5 of his favorites and still charge us the $8. The meal here was excellent: porterhouse and Chilean sea bass. Expensive entrees and everything a la carte, but we had 2-for-1 coupons so it was a good deal. The view is gorgeous. I recommend dining here. I would definitely stay at Rio again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JumpstartMichigan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our 10 best friends July 1-August 2, and decided to try something "new" The Rio was it!! We all had a fabulous time some friends had never been to Vegas and were thrilled with the Hotel and the amenities. We all loved the pools and the casino was beautiful. The room itself was like a New York style apartment. Perfect for our "pre" parties held nightly in our room. We all were smart and rented cars, which got us around town, Red Rock Canyon and downtown, too! (online for $17 a day) Good Job Rio!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas blew my mind!!!”
Reviews.Author: seashell83
Reviews.Content: I visited vegas this year for the first time and it was absolutely everything i hoped and more! We stayed in the Rio and in my opinion it was awesome. Granted it isn't in the hustle and bustle of the strip, its 10 mins away but with a free bus from the hotel door every half hour what more do you need. The Rio was clean, good sized comfortable rooms, busy casino and bars, great pool and very good value for money. It was insanely hot in july so the room was a cool relief at night due to the aircon. We ordered room service once and it was a great price and arrived at our door in 15 minutes flat! There are a couple of cool bars in the Rio like I.Bar and Voodoo but if you want full on night clubs head to the strip. I.Bar is on the casino floor and Voodoo is on the roof with one of the best views across the whole of vegas...spectacular at night. The last bus back to the Rio is at 1am and a taxi costs $20 from the strip. All in all i have nothing negative to say about the Rio, i really enjoyed my stay and would definately stay again. I will be returning to Vegas again next year...i can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “I'll never stay at the Rio again”
Reviews.Author: Mack78
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio in August with some friends. The "adventure" began as I was checking in - an obviously distraught woman came up to the desk in tears because her room had been broken into and security wasn't responding. Not a pleasant way to begin a vacation! My first room had a great view of the Strip but it also had a connecting door to the adjacent room where some noisy people were staying. Every sound they made came right through the door, making it impossible to sleep. After the first night I asked to switch rooms. I was given a lesser quality room at the back of the hotel with no view, but at least it was quieter. The worst thing about the Rio is the pool area. They advertise 4 pools, but don't be fooled! The first pool is for little kids (it has a small sandy beach). The 2nd and 3rd pools are available for adults but they are crowded and the water is filthy. I'm not sure if their filtration system was broken or maybe they don't even have one, but there was all kinds of stuff floating in the water and it was never cleaned out the entire week I was there. The 4th pool, the really nice one, has a big bamboo fence all around it and you have to pay an entrance fee to use it, even if you're already a hotel guest...unbelievable! But the worst thing is the music. The 4th pool plays incredibly loud, ugly rap music all day long and it booms throughout the entire pool complex. It was like being caught in an artillery bombardment. I tried sitting in different areas but it was impossible to escape the noise. Also, the Rio is located off the Strip. They offer free shuttle service to Harrah's and Bally's but you may have to wait 25-30 minutes for the shuttle to show up. And if it's busy you may not be able to get on the first shuttle, which means waiting another 25-30 minutes. The walk from the Rio to the Strip isn't bad - only about 20 minutes - but it's along a busy highway with no shade, making it a miserable experience in August. Highly doubtful that I will ever stay at the Rio again, esp. with so many great hotels right on the Strip.

Reviews.Title: “It's a C, but for service it's an F.”
Reviews.Author: evilrio
Reviews.Content: The room I got was pretty good. We told the desk guy to give us a room with a view and all we got was a view of the gold coast. Seriously? And when we went to eat at the carnival buffet it took us 30 minutes just to be seated. We already paid, we just needed for the seating. And awhile looking at the buffet there were TONS of seats. People were complaining and yelling because in the morning you gotta go places right? Well, you cant if you're going to eat at Rio. So I say if you want an average hotel room and horrible service. Stay at Rio's. Oh and also, if you're planning to swim there. DON'T. Because the water they have tastes salty REALLY SALTY. Not full of chlorine. But full of salt.

Reviews.Title: “TAKE YOUR VALUABLES WITH YOU”
Reviews.Author: f0xy36
Reviews.Content: The hotel was comfortable enough, but i was their on business. The 3rd day into my stay my roommate and I arrived back to our room after dinner to find that we had been burgularized. Brand new laptop(Mac), cash, jewlery, and various items that we had picked up at the Outlet Mall were all gone. After waiting an hour for hotel sercurity to show up, LV police showed. The hotel said due to privacy they don't have camera's in the hallways. But we did overhear the police and sercurity saying how someone could hit the door and pop the lock, without the key card. We were then treated like we had brought this upon ourselves, we were moved to a small room with a broken couch, and no towles at 3:30a.m. only to have to be in class at 7:00a.m. We were never offered a compe meal or movies or anything to say " I'm sorry that this happended in our hotel." Needless to say that ruined the rest of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JUSTINTIMETWO
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed @ RIO in July and had a great stay. The room was older, but clean and well maintained. From the minute we walked up to check in we had great service. We were early and being that we were comped we expected to be placed on hold as check in wasn't until a few hours later. The desk staff found us a room immediately and we were in our room in minutes. We dropped off our luggage and went to get something to eat. We went to the burger bar which was a little pricey but the food was OK. The buffet is still the best thing going @ Rio. Gambling was OK the staff @ the craps table was fantastic They gave us other options to see then just gambling, a hike in the mountains, shopping in the area, etc. They were friendly and helpful. The housekeeping staff took great care of our room, we had great service and no complaints. Our last stay at Caesar's Palace, another Harrah's property, was a nightmare we would never stay there again. The Rio is off strip but we always rent a car so it isn't really noticed. The swimming pool area was very nice but get out there early it fills up fast. Overall we would stay at the Rio again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun place to stay for a great price”
