Reviews.Author: GermzC
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a conference at the Rio and really enjoyed it. Our room in the Ipanema Tower was clean, nice, comfortable and roomy. Everything in our room was in working condition and nothing was damaged or worn out. It was nice that we had a refrigerator in our room to keep water and food. Great view of the strip from our room. The food at the restaurants and internet charges were a little expensive. The shuttle service to the strip was great but be warned that the stop at the Paris has been moved to the Bally hotel. We found out the hard way and had a nice long walk. Show in the Sky runs only from Thursday through Sunday while we were there. We had a great stay and would recommend this hotel to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “We Got Fooled By Rio "Free Buffet With Room" Scam!!! DO NOT AT RIO!!!”
Reviews.Author: DouginPortland
Reviews.Content: Me and my five sisters booked three rooms at the Rio, celebrating one sisters so far successful fight with breast cancer. We made reservations, checking in on July 21st and out today, on the 26th. With the rooms came two free passes per room to the Rio buffet. Sounds like a great deal, right? WRONG!!!! When going to check out last evening, the Rio would not honor the free buffet they offered, even though it was in writing, right on the reservation printout! This cost us an incredible $900 extra. What should have been a great trip endied in tears. UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCES STAY AT THE RIO-THIS PLACE RIPPED US OFF, AND THEY WILL RIP YOU OFF TOO! BEWARE OF THIS BLATANT SCAM BY RIO!! We are also filing a formal complaint with the Las Vegas Convention and Vistors Bureau, and with the BBB.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Trip to the Rio”
Reviews.Author: big80sfun
Reviews.Content: I just got back from 4 nights at the Rio. The room was cleaned and recently remodeled. The service everywhere was excellent--dealers, restaurants, front desk, spa, etc. If you enjoy being away from the craziness of The Strip, but close enough to take a quick, free shuttle there, the Rio is ideal. Harrah's has not done a great job promoting the Rio and keeping it top notch on its own (some cutbacks were noticeable), but the employees provide outstanding service and it makes a difference!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to hang for a week in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: SamandTaylor
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for 5 nights, including the last two nights of the WSOP (a Fri & Sat night). Got a very good deal for the stay - under $400. The standard room was very large, with a separated shower/toilet combo from the duel sink / closet area. It had a fridge. Some of the decor is showing it's age, but not enough to be off-putting. No safe, no coffee maker (we bring our own - once housekeeping saw this, they brought us coffee cups to use with it - kudos to them). Amenities are simple - shampoo, lotion, and bar soap. We had a vehicle, and utilized Valet frequently - they were friendly and efficient. I would not stay at this hotel without my own transportation, as it is off strip. (they have free shuttle, but be prepared to wait). All in all, a good place to use as home-base for the week.

Reviews.Title: “great time loved it”
Reviews.Author: lwdlcds00
Reviews.Content: Me, my daughers, my mom, and my great aunt stayed at the rio to visit other family that lives in Vegas. My daughters first time in vegas of age and we all had a ball. The show is the sky was awesome and TED made our trip great. We will definetly stay at the rio again.

Reviews.Title: “The Sisters Getaway”
Reviews.Author: SheilaghR
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, super size rooms, clean and most of all COOL! High 113 and even 105 @ 11pm!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: texasredtop
Reviews.Content: We had a huge room that was quiet and had a fabulous view. The only thing I can think of that was at all negative was that the parking was a long walk. Harrah's was more than accommodating in every way. We ate the buffet there and weren't terribly impressed. Next time I would try one of the other restaurants. We took the shuttle over to Paris one night and ate at Le Cafe which was pretty good food but our waiter was so rude and arrogant. We paid $3.50 each for a small glass of ice tea and never once got a refill. We had to find him every time we needed something - like silverware, etc. We would have to ask him a minimum of twice for everything. It was just too frustrating. They weren't even crowded.

Reviews.Title: “The room was cheap but WOW everything else wasnt!”
Reviews.Author: JJLEN11
Reviews.Content: Getting to brass tacks-we received an offer to stay their for $99.00 for the week! Great deal The room was dated but in nice shape. Nice views. Pool was great. The only problem was we couldnt afford to eat or drink there and the gaming was lousy.....$8 for a beer? $25 for breakfast buffet per person? $60 for two burgers? $25 for a six pack in a bucket by the pool......found a place with dollar margaritas and it was never opened!! Didnt venture to the upstairs bars---the puking kid in the elevator informed me that two drinks were $34 plus admission--oh and the car rental place sucked! Overpaid for a dirty car withn no gas...had to rent a wheel chair for my wife--they screwed that up too....Would I stay there again YES---EAT NO---DRINK NO---walk to the Gold Coast way cheaper and better

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Choice but Strip Is Better”
Reviews.Author: Hawkbacker
Reviews.Content: The Rio is a nice enough property. It is about 1 mile west of the Bellagio but seems farther. You have to cab to the strip as otherwise you are walking over a freeway overpass in a high traffic area. Cab ride costs about $12 to pretty much anywhere on the strip. There are free separate shuttles to and from the Rio to Harrah's and Bally's. However, sometimes you may have to wait up to a half hour so not really worth it. If you are playing in multiple world series of poker events this is a great place to stay. I otherwise would not recommend it. In my opinion, the strip is a better place to stay and the price at the Rio isn't much different than a comparable strip hotel. The pool is nice however and it has a wading pool with sand for kids. I've heard good things about the voodoo lounge on top of the rio but did not get up there. The restaurant options are decent and the sports book is good. The Rio has kind of a party atmosphere. However, I was disappointed in the cost of table games. They had no $5 tables and even $10 was hard to find at times. The rooms are large and fairly modern but nothing special. The mattress was comfortable. The rooms are fairly close to the main lobby unlike many strip hotels. If you want to use the fitness center, it costs $22 per day. In terms of tips, ask for a room with a strip view. Not much to see out to the west. If you player poker, ask for the poker rate. You may be able to get a room for as little as $25 a night or less on weekdays. If you want to get away from the strip, Red Rocks Canyon and the Hoover dam are both great places to visit. ------------------------------------- http://www.hooverdamtours.org

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel off the strip”
Reviews.Author: adz1983
Reviews.Content: I was really impressed with the hotel and the Casino. The room had everything that you would want/need from a Vegas hotel for a very good price. Great views from the floor to ceiling windows, even though we were facing away from the strip. The Pool looked great and the Casino/bars were very lively. The Hotel supply free shuttle buses from the hotel to the strip (Harrah's) every half hour, but it's about a 20minute walk if you fancy it.

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: FunL0vers
Reviews.Content: We upgraded to the Mascarade Penthouse suite and had a great view with hottub overlooking the strip room service was great the Voodoo club was Hot. The show was not on with the beads that was the only downfall. The spa was great we had 1600 sq feet and enjoyed the veiws from every angle.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is the best place to stay”
Reviews.Author: beingjaneausten
Reviews.Content: Its been more then 12 years when we first stayed at the Rio, and i still think its the best place for my family to visit. We enjoy the food, shopping, entertainment, and most of all the rooms and friendly service, I have recommended the Rio to family and friends and always will. I would like to thank the staff at the Rio for all there hard work to make us feel welcome from the time we make our reservations, and check in there friendly and helpful. Did i mention the room service WOW!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Bet”
Reviews.Author: Imua50
Reviews.Content: The Rio is a good bet in all respect. It's not a 5 star so don't have high expectations. The Buffets are the best based on choice and various selections. Shuttles to the Strip are Free and always on time. Gambling is better than most Casinos on the strip. Entertainment is limited but like I said you can go to the Strip for free and book a show somewhere else. The beverage service is good. Everyone was friendly. The only thing I could not understand was a choice of a Coffee Maker or a Smoking room when we checked in. They would not give us a room with both. I have no clue for this assignment. We enjoyed our stay and would come back.

Reviews.Title: “It's doable”
Reviews.Author: kittyflames
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and spacious. Comparing the casino to the other: the Rio was dark and drab. I didn't like gambling there. I went to the Bellagio, Paris, Harrahs, Casino Royale and even Bill's Gambiln was was better. Yes, I would go back. But I prefer the Paris - Lovely. The shuttle was so convenient. The service was great!

Reviews.Title: “Long time to check in”
Reviews.Author: gaillaven
Reviews.Content: We had to go to reservation desk 3 times to finally get a room. Each time we dealt with a different person and got a different answer. We wasted more time trying to check in. They kept telling us to come back to see if a room was available. We have been to Vegas at least twice a yr. for numberous yrs. and have stayed at alot of different hotels and have never run into this situation. The bathroom was small. You get out of the shower and almost fall into the toilet. The toilet paper holder is way behind the toilet also.

Reviews.Title: “A classic casino/hotel - But needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: woodlandsman
Reviews.Content: Though I have some issues with the hotel, I still liked it. The top issue is safety - And I say this because, as mentioned elsewhere, during our stay the alarm went off several times, including 5:30 AM one morning. So, how reliable is the alarm system?. Also, on our floor I had the occasion to try to use the house phones near the elevators - Both phones were not working - What happens in an emergency? Even though we had an older room, and the carpet was a little frayed - Overall it was a nice room - Especially for the price. It was clean, and was mostly in great shape. The size was great, the sofa and 2 chair desk/table were really useful for relaxing and eating. It was nice to spend time in the room. We were on a lower floor, but the view of the strip was fantastic. The beach/pool was nice and big - Great place to hang out and relax. The staff were all great over the 5 days we were there - All of them. The restaurants left much to be desired - We rented a car, and traveled to local restaurants, The car paid for itself in this respect. Though we did eat in the hotel. I think the best for the buck was the American Grill - We had a couple of great burgers and BLT's there. The fast food Chinese place near check-in was a disaster (people were even throwing out their meals). The Sao Paulo was OK for breakfast (though pricey). I liked the fridge in the room - It was in addition to the wet bar, and was big enough for drinks and snacks. There is a grocery store two blocks down Valley Rd (Called Greengrocers if I recall). It was a nice place to stock up on sodas, juices, milk and snack foods.. The casino was (to me) the classic casino - Big, fair returns even on the slots - We liked it even better than the Palms (that was puny is size compared to the Rio). And it was a laid-back type of place - nice people there . This is really the middle-America working class type of people - A nice mixed group (ethnically), all pleasant people. Not the wannabe celebrities you would find at some of the places on the strip, nor the seedy types in some of the lower-end casinos. Everyone seemed happy here. And the floor shows were nice - With the boats floating around the ceiling - Everyone enjoyed that. The VooDoo lounge was a great suprise - That is a must-do. We went there about sundown, before it got crowded, and it was a spectacular view (it has an outdoor patio on the 51st floor). Though the drinks were expensive, the staff there was so hospitable and the view so great, we did not mind. This hotel is a good value all around. Renting a car is a good idea - The aprking was easy and convenient here. Another gripe though is the Business Center, and Internet access. The charges wee a little steep at the business center - So avoid this service if you can. I can understand charging for the Internet - To discourage people from hanging around all day on it. But, they should at least offer a few minutes accomodation to allow the guests to check in with their airlines.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: leticiateliz
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit weary of staying at this hotel after reading the reviews, but as always, we had nothing to worry about! Check in was quick, requested a room on a higher floor with a view of the strip and we got it. We found the hotel very clean and not nearly as smokey as some people have commented on. The room was quite large, actually larger than I expected it would be. The room decor was dated, but we didn't have too much of a problem with this, all we really did was get ready and sleep in the room afterall! Bed was comfortable. Loved the area by the bathroom to get ready! We didn't try too many of the restaurants or other amenities so can't really comment too much on those. Our friends went to the pool and they loved it. I loved the fact that there were two Starbucks in the hotel! The Sau Paulo Cafe was good. All in all we had a great holiday and would definitely recommend this hotel to friends. Would we stay here again....if we got an awesome deal, yes, if not, we would try one of the many other hotels, just for something different!

Reviews.Title: “The Rio still Rocks”
Reviews.Author: LTfromCbus
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rio May 15th -19th, 2010. We were both very leery of the bad reviews we read online in the months leading up to our trip. I'm glad we ignored the negative reviews and elected to not change our reservation. We stayed in room 1763 in the Ipanema Tower, non smoking room, king bed. Clean, roomy, comfortable bed, quiet, all items in room worked, including internet service. We both liked the idea of having a refrigerator and have noted how much it would suck to not have that at other properties. We just like to have water, pop and juice close by and not pay vending machine prices for those kinds of items. We had a car and bought items for the room at Wal-Mart. The Rio has plenty of restarant chioices, we ate at the Buffet, you will be stuffed, we ate at All American Grill, that was average but ok. Room service for breakfast was very good and reasonably priced. Breakfast at San Paulo Cafe was good as well. Had a lunch at McFaddens, again nothing to write home about but we are not food critics, we just wanted a bite to eat and that's what we got. I read too many reveiws about food, is that what people go to Las Vegas for, food ? Go to France if you want food and if you want really good food, then expect to pay for it. Our room was $109 a night for Sat, Sun, Mon, Tue, I think given the great rate we had exceptional value. I booked the room via the phone 6 months in advance. Rio has a great pool area and really tasty food and drinks served to you. Table games were good, slots were a little on the tight side, we are not big time gamblers. I would recommed using the text system they employ for some good discounts, send your text 48 hours before you depart, go to Total Rewards Center in the Rio to redeem. Again, I don't know there are so many negative reviews on here, the Rio is still a really nice property with good service and in a good location, the place is 20 years old and in places looks a little worn but for the most part it's what it has been for all these years a really fun experience. I think for the money you won't be disappointed. My wife and I will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Cheaper and Bigger than Other Vegas Rooms”
Reviews.Author: andrealena
Reviews.Content: If you want to save a little money in Las Vegas, the Rio is the way to go. Our room was significantly cheaper than those on the strip and it was much larger than any of the rooms I've stayed in on previous Las Vegas trips. Our "suite" room consisted of a comfy kind bed within a spacious living area with couch, chairs, coffee table, TV. The bathroom and connecting vanity area were around the corner. The room itself was very clean, although the hallways were frequently littered with room service leftovers that still needed to be cleaned up. One con to our our room was that it was overlooking the trash pickup section in the back of the hotel. All night long we could hear workers seperating trash and recycling (glass bottles breaking and smashing all night long). And trucks would come in and park there for pickups/deliveries starting at about 3-4 in the morning and not turn their engines off. (We stayed in the Ipanema section.) There is a shuttle that takes you to the strip (to Paris/Ballys and another one that I believe went to Caesar's) that runs every half an hour. The lines are always very long for the shuttle, but convenient if you do not have a car or don't want to spend the money on a taxi. We had a car on this trip and had no problem getting around and finding parking spots at other casinos/hotels. If I stayed at the Rio again, I would get a car and not mess with the shuttles. The casino is lacking in game variety. And the "Show in the Sky" was cheesy. It was also rather racy - don't let your kids see it! I had a hot stone massage in the spa and it was so relaxing, although much more expensive than I'd spend on a similar experience back at home. The Carnival Buffet is the biggest buffet in Las Vegas and absolutely delicious! Such a huge variety of food will certainly please everyone. Look for the little hot pretzel balls, and the fresh sorbets!

Reviews.Title: “Rio is still nice, but Masquerade Tower rooms need attention”
Reviews.Author: Colorado_Rick
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for 3 nights in early June with some friends. Although we had requested rooms in the Masquerade Tower, we were initially given rooms in the Ipanema Tower. These rooms, while recently redecorated, were in a terrible location, with views of only rooftops. We then asked to be moved to the Masquerade Tower, and our request was granted. But, we were told that these rooms had NOT been redecorated--an understatement for sure. The rooms are truly in need of a detailed cleaning if they are not to be redecorated soon. Accumulated dirt was everywhere you looked, especially where the carpet meets the walls and on the big couch. The shower head was almost falling off and the toilet had to be flushed twice each time it was used. Definitely a lack of maintenance here. We went down to the pool once, to find that one pool was closed and the others were seriously overcrowded. The waterfalls were all shut off, and one pool was very cloudy with lots of junk floating in it. Not too attractive. Glad we didn't catch anything. On the flip side, the towels and sheets were always clean and the maid seemed to do an above-average job each day. The BIG plus was that we were able to get the rooms at only $40 per night. Maybe we shouldn't be so picky at that price, but I'm sure the Rio can do better. We have stayed there before and the rooms were in much better condition. I can only recommend the Rio if you are willing to put up with a bit of dirt for a very low price, or stay in the Ipanema Tower--smaller rooms but cleaner.

Reviews.Title: “Total Rewards Member Beware”
Reviews.Author: arant
Reviews.Content: I booked my rooms on line one for myself and husband the other for my mother. We scheduled two rooms for a week. I used the total reward reservation site then after making my reservation I phoned to confirm everything was good. My room was to be comped for the week my mothers room was to be $110.00 for the week. Had reservation receipts from internet with me. Well when we went to check in we were told they did not have to honor what was done on the internet and the room charge was going to be more than what was quoted. Speaking with a manager was useless. They are rude and ignorant! Well getting past this issue there was then as everyone has complained about was the $100.00 deposit. Well folks it is not just $100.00---- it is $100.00 for each night you are staying which for us equals 2 rooms for one week $1400.00 deposit, Have you ever heard of anything so ridiculous. So after much frustration we got room keys. We were on an upper floor in Masquerade tower with great view of the strip. Rooms were very large but outdated. Furnishings were skimpy and shabby for the size room. The room does have a mini bar and a seperate refrigerator which is handy. Dressing area was very nice had vanity sitting area and has a nice large closet. The bath had a tub/bath combination with one of those old timey sliding glass doors on it. Needs some upgrading they have a lot of room to do it. The room was very clean. It was nice just to take an elevator ride down and be in the casino area. The adult entertainment is great nightly shows were nice with parade floats suspended from the ceiling. Has nice pastry coffee shop by the elevator. Irish pub food was so so. The all day dining restaurant had good food. The VooDoo steak house was excellent. I had italian food via room service and it was great! Overall the Rio was nice had everything you need right there, short trip to strip has free shuttle which we did not use. Taxi fees are cheap. We always use Las Vegas Transportation for airport tranfers they are wonderful. They meet you at baggage claim and assist with luggage you get a limo for a very reasonable cost. When coming out of shows and taxi lines are long always look for the limos does not cost much more you don't have to wait in line and get very nice transportation and service. I would stay here again. Just bring extra money for check in.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I would have paid extra to be on the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Britishinmyheart
Reviews.Content: My friends and I were on a serious budget when planning our Vegas trip. We had to decide whether to go cheap and off strip or spend a little more to be right in the action. The Rio seemed like a good compromise. Not on the Strip, but there is a free shuttle, and it has all the amenities of the Strip casinos: shows, restaurants, pool ,etc. Well, we just got home from our trip and I can safely say that next time we'll splurge for something more central. I have no idea if check in went well, since I waited in the car. The room was very nice, but we were disappointed to be in the older Ipanema tower that faces the suburbs instead of the Strip. The buffet ... was a buffet. We were excited at the prospect of so many different kinds of cuisine, but you couldn't eat enough to justify the price. Not that you'd want to eat that much - the food was luke warm and mediocre. I'd rather pay for a little good food than a lot of bad food. But many people feel differently - there was a half-hour wait just to get in the door. We got a great coupon book at check in, so we used it for 2-for-1 tickets to that night's Penn and Teller show. The show was great and we got to meet the magicians afterward. Our P&T tickets also got us free admission to th VooDoo Lounge. The view from the Lounge is incredible - 51 stories up looking out over the Strip. There was a flair bartender and he gave a generous pour, so it made up for the jaw-dropping prices. The Lounge would have been amazing except that there was a private party going on. Every single table and chair was reserved, as well as the entire lower deck of the balcony. There was nowhere to sit and standing in heels gets tiresome after an hour or so. Why wouldn't they just close the club if every single table is reserved? We ate at the Sao Paulo Cafe for breakfast. The food was amazing, the service was not. The little basket of jam on our table was empty, so I reached over to an empty table and snagged a few packets of strawberry. The server arrived to check us just then and demanded to know what I was doing. When I said "Getting some jam," she walked over to another table, grabbed a full basket, slammed it down on our table and said, "There - was that so hard?" When we got the check, we didn't know if (since we were charging it to the room) if we needed to wait or we could just leave our room info. When the server returned, we asked politely how to handle the check. She gave a disgusted sigh and snatched it up and said, "I'll just do it myself." Turns out we just had to hand it to the hostess on the way out the door. She could have just told us that without the drama. We didn't eat any other meals at the Rio, but I did have a similar experience with a cocktail waitress. The policy I've adopted in casinos is to tip the waitress if I ordered more than one drink, or if the service was exceptional. My friend and I had been gambling about forty minutes before we were approached about drinks. She returned with my drink, which took another half-hour and was extremely watered down. I said thank you, but she just stood there and stared at me. I thought she was cleaning up a spill on the tray, but after she finished she just kept staring. I again said, "thank you," to which she rolled her eyes and said, "Fine then" and stormed off. I have worked in food service for years, so I am typically a very good tipper. But the service was slow and the drink was terrible. And standing there expectantly while you sigh and roll your eyes is in no way professional. When we returned home, we discovered that we had been overcharged nearly $200 for the Penn and Teller tickets, and about $75 at the iBar in the lobby. When I called the Rio, I was told that no one in customer service was available. I demanded to talk to someone in charge and was connected with a front desk manager, who apologized and refunded the tickets immediately. However, when I spoke to someone in food and beverage services about the bar charges, they gave me excuse after excuse and said that someone would call me the next day. It has been three days and I have still been unable to get a hold of anyone and we have not been refunded. On top of this, the "Show in the Sky" was closed, we were ignored for half an hour at the Irish bar before we finally just left, and arrived at Caesar's for the Rio shuttle (which they are still advertising) only to be told they don't offer the service any more. We had wonderful experiences at Planet Hollywood and the Luxor, so we'll definitely give our business to one of these hotels next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: nevtraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the price mainly, but then got an upgrade to a better room(high room) with views over the whole strip day & nite(spectacular). The shuttle service is great to connect to the strip & my recommendation for this hotel is because you are close enough to strip, but yet can get away also when it gets a bit much.

Reviews.Title: “Awoken by false fire alarm 3 mornings out of 4 days!! All at around 8AM!”
Reviews.Author: BackDoc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here May 19-23, 2010. When we first arrived, we knew that the Rio was not the newest hotel. We knew it was an old hotel/casino but had large rooms. We actually were happy that the rooms were 600 plus square feet as we were travelling with a 3 year old and a 4 month old. Our experience turned sour when on the first morning of our stay, we were all awoken by the in-room emergency intercom blaring a warning of a possible emergency. This would repeat for a minute, then a follow-up message saying it was a false alarm. Not exactly how you want to wake up the kids or parents! But I didn't think much of it. The next morning, it did not happen. However, it happened again on the 3rd morning, around the same time. And then again on the final morning of our stay, around the same time! And the worst part of this was when I complained to management, they said it was unavoidable and they were not willing to do anything about it. How about a "We're sorry this disturbed your vacation. Here's a breakfast on us." Nope. They obviously could care less about their customers.

Reviews.Title: “Getting Long in the Tooth”
Reviews.Author: tractorii
Reviews.Content: Been going here off and on for 10 years. Getting a bit long in the tooth and a little dingey in the casino areas. Not so sure I'd stay here again. Really liked Mandalay Bay. Restaurants are pretty so-so.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: ujxl002
Reviews.Content: I checked in on a Wednesday after booking 7 days earlier by phone to the hotel. Using my AAA discount is worked out to $48 for each night I was there, a Wednesday and Thursday. It was about a 20 minute wait to check at noon on that Wednesday mostly due to all the people checking out at the same time. When I got up to checkin the person next to me got a 6th floor room so I tried the $20 sandwich trick and got a corner room in the IP tower (room 1223) with a full view of the strip and of the pool. The room was a very good size with the king bed. I read complaints about the TV and I also had a 27" CRT but I was not there to watch TV anyway so no big deal. The casio was not as smokey as other people claimed too. But after coming to Vegas every couple of years for the last 20, the town in general seemed much better than years ago. I was concerned about the walk to the strip but from the sports book at Rio to the sports book at Caesear's it took me only 23 minutes which was not bad at all. I used the shuttle to and from Harrahs many times which worked out great. Some notes: The liquor store at the Gold Coast was not as expensive as most other places around. Having a fridge in the room kicked butt!!!! I stayed with friends at Harrahs the Friday night of my stay and their room was like a closet compared to the room at the Rio. I found it funny that you can not make bets on the Celtics at the Rio family of casinos as the owner has a vested interest in the casino. I am glad I was able to get a bet on the Celtics over Cleveland as it almost paid for my entire trip. :) The new buffet deal they have for $35 for all you can eat in 24 hours is a good deal but I think the food quality has went down since the last time I had the buffets at the Rio, Caesars and Harrah's buffets. The new rides at the top of the Stratosphere are a lot of fun, especially at night!

Reviews.Title: “Do Yourself a Favor Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: trippy89
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a conference that was held at this hotel this last week. The words, cheesey, smokey, dumpy all come to mind. If you are looking for a not so pleasant return to the eighties, this is the hotel for you. Read the other recent reviews and believe them. You can find much better hotels on the Strip for the same room rate. Business is down in Vegas now, why would you stay here when you could stay on the Strip? One more thing, the hotel is not really walkable to the Strip. Although the hotel claims to have a shuttle to Caesars and Ballys, I never saw it and made up for the cheap room rate by paying cab fare.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: nicoleGoodyear_Az
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Rio and each and every time I have been completely satisfied! They have wonderful customer service. The rooms are amazing!! The food/resturants are good. Not one complaint! We had stayed one night at the Fitz downtown, before arriving for 2 nights at the Rio and what a difference! It is a little off the strip, but they offer their free shuttle service to several strip hotels and back. We have ordered room service several times and always rec'd exactly what we ordered, on time and service with a smile! As I said, no complaints once so ever. I highly recommend the Rio!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay/Play.....”
Reviews.Author: psl6978
Reviews.Content: well i planned a last minute trip to vegas for some R&R.......... The room was comped since I play at many total rewards casinos....I went on a Monday and left on Thursday.... The hotel was really nice... I was skeptical at first from the bad reviews but it was really nice...... the sportsbook was nice, the staff were extra nice ( give the cleaners a small tip and they will keep your room spotless and will give extra towels etc...) The room was spacious and clean( although the hallways sometimes had used room service dishes etc that became an eye sore after a few days). The rio has shuttles that call to all major total rewards casinos which is free and cna take u to the strip ( ballys, paris, flamingo, harrahs) but the rio is located pretty far from the strip... Taxis will be costly... i spent a good bit in 3 days there just on taxis.... the palms is directly across the street( about a 5 minute walk) and they have great clubs for the younger crowd ( i am mid 20s)..... the pool at the rio was nice and super clean but closes at 5 (they will keep it open for about an extra hour if its busy). this was a let down for me.... anyway the rio is a nice place to stay ( esp. if you can get it comped for free). I dont think i would spend alot to stay here but the price was right ( free lol)

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal”
Reviews.Author: SHEAMUSToronto
Reviews.Content: Check in was longer than it should be...especially on a Sunday morning...25 minutes and only two ppl checking in guests. Room was spacious, clean, but a liitle old. Carpet inside front door obviously had a recent flood. cable TV kept losing its signal sometimes for 18 - 20 hours at a time. Room service was efficient and friendly, food was of average quality. Shuttle buses to strip and there are two of them, one to Harrahs and one to Ballys were frequent walking to strip is approximately 12 minutes at a leisure pace

Reviews.Title: “Should have stayed at Paris”
Reviews.Author: WindsorCanada91
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights at the Paris hotel then moved to Rio, we were thinking of watching Penn and Teller. Can't say much about the Rio this time around as the experience was far from the one we got when we stayed there in October. The one thing that turned me off was I we were treated at the Total Rewards center at the RIO. Antonio the Total Rewards rep for Diamond and 7 Stars Members was the most unhelpful person I have ever dealt with. I was inquiring what shows were playing and which ones I get free and he just pointed at the brochure to me and said have a great day. I had to walk to the Diamond check in counter to get show coupons and advise as to what show is worth seeing. I am not going back to the Rio only because the way Antonio treated us. Coming back to Vegas in February and staying at Harrahs for 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: fredbn2008
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 1pm Sunday, waited 20 mins in line for check-in. Tried the $20 trick, we were upgraded to a high floor, 30th pool view in the masquerade tower. We needed two rooms on the same floor and there was a eco convention so I think that is why we received a limited up-grade. The rooms were spacious and clean but nothing special. Maid service was good and very friendly. All four of us found the beds to be very comfortable.Their was a tray left out in the hall one room down for the first 12 hours were were there. The casino is dark but ok, nothing special. Comments about the smoke, not much more then any other casino and I was with 3 sensitive non-smokers we were not bothered by it. There was a long line for the buffet when we arrived. We only ate at the buffet once and that was for breakfast-once again it was ok. The deal at most LV buffet's is, all you can eat, all day for $40. We did have a lunch buffet at Mandalay bay for $20, it was excellent and I highly recommend it. Great food, service and atmosphere my adult step-daughter called it classy, almost like you were in a movie. If you like Mexican food, go to Diablos, it is right on the strip, next to the Monte carlo-best steak burrito. Pool is very nice, didn't get to enjoy too much as it was really windy. Went to see Penn and teller, I am not a big fan but it was a good show and worth seeing. Also saw Peepshow, I thought it was really good I liked it. A word of warning, a lot of topless dancing, ok with me but maybe not with everyone. Ask for complementary passes to Voddoo lounge at check-in they have a bunch, it is a fantastic view and cool club. They had 2 dj's one inside and the other outside. Show in the sky is cool, but it is more of a sing and dance on a stage. TH-Sun, on the hr every hr starting at 7pm to midnight. The 7 and 8pm show is crowded then after that not much people. IBAR at the center of the casino is cool they have these touch screen flat video table games which my wife and step-daughter really enjoyed, drinks are expensive though. The elevators were fast and not crowded. Hotel is off the strip but we had a rental car so that was no problem, there is a shuttle to harrahs and ballys on the strip. My recommendation of this hotel is just ok-nothing special. I have only stayed at a couple of hotels in LV. The Rio is better then Circus Circus but not as good as Planet Hollywood. If you get a really cheap deal on a price and want to see LV maybe for the 1st time this would be a good hotel. For me there are so many other hotels I would like to try and this one did not overly impress me.

Reviews.Title: “Everything Great expect...”
Reviews.Author: Mnqhrt
Reviews.Content: Check-in had a very long line and it seemed to move very slow compared to other hotel/casinos we have stayed in Vegas. Also when we reserved the room we were not told that there is a $100 hold on your credit card for the room. I have stayed in other Vegas casinos and it usually is $0-$50. Depending if you want to charge stuff to your room or if you block all charges. The room was nice and we had a nice view of the Strip. We didn't mind that there really is no other casinos around the area expect for 2 that would still be quite a walk to get to them. There was plenty to do and we were able to enjoy ourselves there. We would stay at the Rio again just next time we know about the $100 hold they fail to tell you when you reserve the room even if your room is Comped or you have to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: CariBelle
Reviews.Content: We arrive at 7:30 PM on Thursday night and had a quick check in, got an "upgrade" because of a birthday and headed to the Masquerade Tower. We loved the room, but I say "upgrade" in quotes because the strip view room was actually smaller than the rooms we had in the Ipanema Tower before. The amenities were slightly better though, or at least newer. We stayed for 3 nights and had great service by all of the Rio staff every day and night. The valet and bellmen were always prompt, the taxi line always quick, and the servers and dealers always fun to be around. The only food we frequent is sandwiches from the gift shop late at night because their restaurant selection just doesn't appeal to us, but I will say that whatever premade sandwich company they use is just as good as any subway! I can't even count how many times I've traveled to the Rio as a couple and my boyfriend and his friends always stay at the Rio for their trips because of the large rooms and I have no reason to stray from this location as our home base! I would rather pay taxi fare than stay at some of the similarly priced hotels on the strip because I know we get quality at the Rio. Only cons this trip- Room Service was a bit slow on a Friday morning, but the food was good, though our tray stayed outside of our room nearly all day and night and started to smell. TVs in the room could use an upgrade, our was a tube set that would go from red to green after watching it for about 10 minutes. Had to repeatedly turn it on and off to get through golf coverage on Friday and Saturday mornings.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: JasontheMason
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rio in the past throughout the years several times and loved it. I am VERY disappointed in what the RIO has become. The casino is very smokey, all the rooms I have stayed in at the Rio in the past all had a Jacuzzi tubs(suites) in them, this time we were asked to pay $140 extra a night I thought it was an all Suite hotel as I was told in the past. It took 3 hours and 3 room changes to get a room that we finally had to settle on (we were tired). The room we finally did settle into had blood and feces in the toilet, dirty glasses and I can not believe the hotel did not accommodate an in room coffee maker as we would find in a lower class MOTEL. The buffet was an award winning buffet, after this weekend not really sure how they are still open, food was bland and the chocolate cake tasted like they used unsweetened chocolate or forgot to put sugar in the bowl????? Really the only thing I liked about the Rio was the Starbucks inside, but Starbucks are everywhere. So to sum it up I will never stay at the Rio again nor will I refer the Rio to a friend. I would actually really like to see when they do a demolition of the Rio, unless they do something it WILL happen.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ito411
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! We usually stay on the stip because we can't afford the Rio. But this year we got a deal. The check in was a breeze. We were offered an upgrade for $25 a night without even asking. When we declined because it wasn't in our budget, the desk clerk stated that she made a not in the computer as to what was offered and if at anytime during our stay we wished to upgrade, the price she quoted would be honored. I thought that was really nice. The rooms are large and we love the floor to ceiling windows. We would definitly stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “It's a Great Place to stay, We love the rooms,it's loud but it's Vegas,”
Reviews.Author: countrygal_529
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Rio many times over the last 7-10 years. The rooms are big and very clean, view at strip at night is Great. We always get checked in within minutes. We had our friends meet us there in Feb, and they stayed 2 nights thought it was lots cleaner than previous hotel they had stayed in Vegas. The food is wonderful at any of the Restaurants at the Rio. The show in the sky is a plus. Yes it gets loud but remember its Vegas. You can put up with loud for a while. Free internet would of been appreciated. We recommend it to all of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “BIG SUITE. BIG HOTEL. BIG POOLS. EMPTY FEELING.”
Reviews.Author: rollingstone66
Reviews.Content: Rio is very impressive from afar and up close. Huge property with four huge pools. Suite was huge too. In room safe was helpful. The suite had floor to ceiling glass so I had a great view of Vegas. Property is meant more for young singles (below 30). I felt old. Lots of younger women waiting for the Chippendales show to start... Def not a family oriented property. No real dining options there other than for the World Buffet (better sign up for the $29.99 "7 buffets at 7 hotels" deal)... If U like Chinese food, try the Chinese buffet down the road at Gold Coast... Hotel has no soul... The name is Rio but it doesnt take me away to Rio... The Show in the Sky took a week off when I was there... Too bad... Long long walk to my room... Desert Rose or Holiday Inn Express next time for me....

Reviews.Title: “Smoke, smoke and more smoke”
Reviews.Author: laguna72
Reviews.Content: I would never stay at Rio again even if it was at no cost to me. With such great values around town, I suggest to just skip it if you can't get a room here for under 100. For the same amount of money or a little more, you can find a much nicer hotel with updated linens, flat screens, and a separate living space. This was by far the smokiest lobby, smokiest room and smokiest casino. My eyes are still burning. We stayed one night and moved to a new hotel. Look for the deals at nicer places such as THEhotel, Mandalay Bay, Wynn, Venetian and Bellagio before you book this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Rio casino the place to burn your money would get a better value!”
Reviews.Author: grnecountrygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have not taken a trip in 2 yrs and i was looking for a good time. I had always wanted to visit the Rio. On one visit several yrs ago we had dinner there at the mexican restaurant and the floor show. Got to Rio and knew we would have to wait to register at 6 pm. Sea food buffet, not a sea food eater, but my husband ate his 40 dollars worth of crab! Then we went to register and was told they do not except debit cards, unless we paid them upfront 100.00 a night security deposit! I had paid with this same debit card on line to purchase the rooms. Very upset as i had budgeted so much for room and entertainment, i was going to leave, even though i would have to forfeit a nights room fee. The young lady spoke to the manager, he would discount to 50.00 a night, we would have to pay this fee so we could charge food or drink to our room. I was not planning to charge anything to the room! So in the end, i had to pay cash for the next night, and would have it returned and they then would take the debit card!!!! Lets see, no cable in the rooms, because the wind supposedly knocked down the satellite . No coffee maker in the room because that was only for VIP rooms! There was a breeze coming thru the window, had to turn up the heat to warm the room up. The prices were so high for room service 10.00 for two eggs and toast, with a 2.50 charge per order! And the slots, i have always enjoyed nickel and penny machines as i can play for hours with 20 or 30 dollars, you had to put in 2 to 3 dollars a spin to cover all the lines, in order to win anything worth winning. Didn't see many winning anything. And the choice of slots majority were dollar machines and none of the old classic slots like Betty boo machines. Service well lets see, of all the services provided the valet and the house keeping were all very nice, cannot say that about the servers very rushed and at times rude. Buffets were good, over priced. Went to Fremont street and the first slot i played i won 200.00 dollars, So was very disappointed in the Rio, and will never go back there. I guess my expectations were to high and i guess being on a budget is not appropriate in this so called 4 star hotel and casino, should have stayed at the golden nugget!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: KimAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We stayed over Easter break and took our 8-year old with us. We were pleased with the Rio. I asked for an upgrade to the new Ipanema tower and got it. The room was very large and updated in modern decor, almost like something you'd find at the 'W'. The pool area was great, with tropical landscaping and upbeat music playing. It had a resort feel. You could order food or drinks by the pool. Inside the hotel, we enjoyed the Rio buffet , and even got a buffet coupon at check-in. There was a Starbucks right by the elevators to the Ipanema tower. I waited 10-15 mins to check into the hotel and used the express check-out to avoid waiting to check-out. We had no problems at all at the Rio and thought it was a fabulous value at $45 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Smoky...hope you don't overpay”
Reviews.Author: Seajax
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio for 3 nights with my colleagues. We got a rate of $60 per night, so for the price I wasn't upset at what we got. If you have problems with cigarette smoke, this isn't the best choice for you. Unlike the new hotels with fantastic ventilation and fragrances, the Rio smells of cigarette smoke which gave many of us headaches after awhile. However, for the price, the rooms are big and can be found at a great price. I had two queen beds and a pull out couch for $60 a night! The housekeeping was one of the worst I've experienced. I saw room service trays and glasses sitting outside guest's rooms at 7:30 in the morning and they were still sitting there at 6pm at night. This wasn't just one day, but during the entire trip I saw trays, food and glasses sitting out all day. In addition, the room wasn't cleaned that well when I arrived. The alarm clock and desk lamps had dust built up on them, there were stray hairs around the room and the sink fixtures had water spots on them -a sign then hadn't been wiped down between the last guest. Glad I brought my sanitizer wipes with me... Also, the Rio doesn't provide you with hair conditioner. Just bar soap and shampoo. Again...since this place is so cheap, I wasn't surprised. If you want a comfortable hotel with nice amenities to enjoy what Vegas has to offer, I would not recommend the Rio. It is smoky, way off the strip and doesn't have the amenities other Vegas hotels offer. If you are 21 and want to stay in a cheap place with your friends that has a club (Voodoo lounge) and are willing to take a cab/shuttle to the strip, the Rio is your place.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Rio”
Reviews.Author: sparxtraveler
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay here after reading some of the reviews. But I got a great last minute rate so I booked the Rio and we were glad we stayed here! We have been to Vegas many times and have stayed at many hotels/casinos and even time share units. This was one of our best experiences. I will try to tell as much as I can here: We stayed 4/19 - 4/23 on the 12th floor of the Impanema building. Our room faced the rear of the hotel looking towards the moutains and the Gold Coast and Plams casinos. The room was much bigger than most casino hotel rooms. The view was awesome! The bathroom had seperate sinks, one in the toilet/shower area and one outside of it. It did have a mini fridge and the mini bar. It also had a fold out couch, desk and chair and 2 benches by the foot of the beds (we had 2 queens). The beds were very comfortable as were the pillows. The windows were floor to ceiling and covered the whole outside wall! They had really good drapes that close tight for a good dark room at night, or the daytime. That is real important for me because I am a light sleeper. We both slept really well at the Rio. The room was very clean and the maid did a great job. I did tip her$4-$5/day. The only negs were, no coffee maker, no free wireless, we booked a king room but they were sold out so we got 2 queens...no big deal. The pool: Awesome and very clean. We only had good weather 1 day so my wife loved it. It has like 4 pools and some water falls, sand beach area, palm trees, bar and food service area. It was a great pool but too bad we could only enjoy it 1 day. The weather turned into the 40's and 50's the next 2 days with rain and even hail. So we hit the casinos and did other touristy stuff. The casino: Very friendly dealers and service people. The waitresses are very talented and break into song or dance at these small stage areas throught the casino. Cute too!! Drinks came around pretty frequently, not like the recommended Gold Coast next door. The Food: We only ate at the Carnival World buffet and it was outstanding. I don't know what the other reviews are talking about. We both loved this buffet. Talk to the locals, it is one of the best buffets in Vegas. We did the buffet pass for $29. You get 7 different buffets to eat at 7 casinos and you can try them as many times as tou can handle in 24 hours. Well, we can't eat that much, but think about it......we had our first dinner at 7 PM, then breakfast at 8:30 AM, then lunch at 1PM and then dinner again at 6:30 PM. All at the Rio, but we had 4 great meals for $29 each! Dinner buffet had great Asian, Mexican, sushi, sliced beef, sliced roast pork, sald bar, soups, pastas, pizza, chicken, fish, veggies, potatoes, fish, pell and eat and fried shrimp, all you can eat crab legs, ice cream/gellato bar, deserts and much much more. The buffet is huge and there wasn't much that we didn't enjoy. Breakfast has the omelet bar and all kinds of cereals, pancakes and anything that even kids would love. In fact, we plan to bring ours here the next time! The only other time we ate at the Rio was for a late night sandwich at the sports betting area. It was pretty good but like I said, it was only late night bar grub so how can you screw that up? VooDoo lounge: We didn't party there or eat at the VooDoo steakhouse, we just went up to check out the view. INCREDIBLE!! You gotta see this at night! Recommendations: Rental car, Compact 4 door for $23/day on carrentals.com. Last year we got a cool mustang for $10/day. We drive to other casinos on our own. Park at the valet and tip a couple bucks when you come out! Simple and easy too. Freemont St.: One of our favs. Souveneer shops, bars, older cool casinos, cheap gambling ($2 & $3 tables at Fitzgeralds and others). Neat covered street that does a light show on the canopy at night. Millions of light bulbs dance around to loud music playing. They do it like every hour or so. $1.99 shrimp cocktail at one of the places. Just like the old days at the Dunes! It was good too! Pawn Star shop: Right off Freemont street is the Pawn store that has the TV show on the histroy channel. We went in there and got pics and souvineers for the kids (and me)! Shopping Malls: The wife likes the Town square south of the strip and then the mall right at Planet Hollywood casino. I could give a crap about shopping but she can shop and I can play at PH (I love that casino, I seem to do well there and drinks come around often) Eats: Many places but this time we tried Cabo Wabo at the mall by Planet Hollywood (really good especially the coconut margarita). The steak house at NewYorkNewYork (name escape me, famous place out east) was outstanding. Pricey but really good. Emirils at MGM, sushi place at MGM, House of Hash, a few miles off strip for a great breakfast and bloodies, Todai Aisain buffet is pretty good, and almost any sandwich place at NYNY. Casinos: Check out Bellagio for the beauty, flowers, gardens, blown glass (sounds kinds femmy I know, but pretty cool) NYNY is awesome, we love that place. They make the shop/bar area look like streets in old New York city. It's pretty neat. Mandalay Bay: House of Blues!!, Shark tank, the best pool area. Stratosphere: Older and not too flashy but great drink service (while playing) and for some reason we seem to do well plaiying here. Scary rides at the top for kids or daredevils (not me!) Freemont St.: Golden Nugget is older but pretty cool. Many older casinos but chraper to play. Slots O Fun Casino: It's real small and next to CircusCircus. Nothing special but just a fun place! $2 Heinekin bottles if you just wanna have a few! I did well at roulette there. The Asian lady dealer with short hair is a riot! Day drives/trips: We did the Grand Canyon airplane tour a few years back for like $400/person. It was expensive for us but really worth it! Hoover Dam: Neat once or twice, take the rental car! Valley of Fire: Not too far away, awesome colored mountains, we really liked it. Ski resort: the name escapes me.(charelston?) but maybe 11/2 hour drive up in the mountains. It was a lot cooler up there when it was about 95 on the strip a few years back. Food and bar up there with nice views. Websites: Check out cheapovegas.com, as recommended on this webite earlier. I booked the Rio there for $53/night avg, for the time we stayed. It was last minute so I guess that is why it was so cheap, they directed me to I4vegas.com to book it. Carrentals.com if you plan on renting one. I like thrifty rental although they show you choices for many companies. alligiantair.com They're hub is Vegas. We fly from the midwest either out of Rockford IL, or Appleton, WI. This time we got a $69 to Vegas and $129 return. Not too bad! Check flight prices often because they do change. People watch!! There are all kinds walking around the strip, especially at night! All kinds of weirdos!! Elvis and Michael Jackson impersonators letting you take pics with them for a buck or two. Shows: Go to the booth either on Freemont St. of at the Hawaiin market next to Planet Hollywood. It is called something like 1/2 price tickets, or something like that. They have last minute ticket deals for many shows and events, if you don't have tickets to anything. The help there knows what shows are good too. We are mid forties and love comedy. But the Cirque du Solie are outstanding (except Chris angel) We relly liked Love, KA, O, Terry Fator, and Michael Johns hypnotist show at the Tropicana. (dirty fun, cheaper than most shows, use the 2for1 coupon in coupon books). Blue Man group and other shows I may as well not name because they are no longer there. Just OK shows were: Chris Angel, Amazing Jonathon (he seems bored), Jubilee, and Menopause (we heard it was fantastic. there are only 4 ladies in the whole show and they really are good, but it just wasn't for me. My wife liked it better but it still seemed like it was for a 50's plus crowd). We liked the Rio so much, we plan to take our 3 kids (13-19 yrs old) the next time for a family vacation. We will stay at the Rio (if the price is decent) for a few days and then drive to LA to check that out. If you have smaller kids, you may consider Circus Circus. I talked to many people staying there and they loved it. I hope this review helped!!!

Reviews.Title: “All My Favorites Put Together”
Reviews.Author: Cervantez
Reviews.Content: It’s been awhile since I’ve written one of these. The lady and I visit Las Vegas quite often, driving up from Phoenix, and we’re continuing our endless pursuit to stay in every hotel on the strip. This time, it was the lady’s birthday so she got to choose. Away we go to the Rio. We had frequented the Rio because they have the best dinner buffet in the entire town in my opinion, but this was the first time we had actually stayed there. This further ensured that we wouldn’t be getting away from the hotel much…after you’re that full, what else is there to do but sleep? Parking at the Rio isn’t bad if you’re driving, they have the standard parking garage as you’ll find with most hotels on the strip. The elevator from the parking garage will take you to the main floor where the check in counter in right in the middle between the front door and rear entrance. Check-in was swift and very friendly. The gentleman at the counter offered a room upgrade, as they usually will to squeeze some more dough out of you, we declined the upgrade but the gentleman was nice enough to offer a corner room. The corner room was not only a bit larger than the standard room, but there were two walls with floor to ceiling windows instead of only one. This set us up with a virtually panoramic view of the Las Vegas strip at about 200 degrees around, too cool! We had room 955 if you want to see for yourself... The room was very comfortable: not a great TV set (but who cares?), the bed was among the best, the bathroom was nothing special and the towels were huge! No complaints at all about the room. The hotel itself was very high spirited. They do a good job of giving the impression that there’s a lot going on around you. There were plenty of bars, one or two nice shops, all the usual Las Vegas jive. I was really excited about seeing the famous Carnival in the Sky show. I had heard it was lots of fun and very inclusive, kind of a big party. It didn’t turn out to be quite like what I thought. It started out as a sexy girly type dance with singing, then it became more of a hip-hop, high energy dance show. Still lots of fun, even if it’s not your thing, the big floats in the sky are still worth seeing at least once. There’s a lot of gyrating and skin involved with this show, not an illegal amount, but you might want to think twice about bringing your children to see it if you’re a little conservative. If you want culture, go see the Venetian Trio instead. The Rio also offers complimentary shuttle service to Harrah’s and to Paris, making the central strip area very accessible. Of course the buffet is the best all around. The best price and variety, hands down! Bare in mind that I’m talking about the Carnival World Buffet, not the Seafood Buffet. I haven’t tried the Seafood Buffet, but the World Buffet is unbeatable. As mentioned in the name, it features cuisine from around the world. Everything from steaks and chops to Chinese, Italian, Vegetarian, Hispanic foods and of course food gear specifically to children. You’ll be spending about 27 dollars a head, extra if you want more than just a fountain drink. If you have a healthy appetite, or invite me along, you’ll get you money’s worth. The Rio hasn’t taken the number one spot on my list of favorite Las Vegas hotels, but it delivers in all major areas. Save a little money and don’t skip out on quality, that’s why I’ll revisit the Rio, great food and a lively atmosphere all under one roof.

Reviews.Title: “First Vegas trip”
Reviews.Author: north-ok-bc
Reviews.Content: The Rio was very nice. It is not on the strip, but they have a shuttle that runs every 30 minutes or so to Ballys or Harrahs. This was great except if you are not a gambler and don't have a 7 star or platinum card you got bumped! Luckily this only happen to us once. The rooms were huge, comfortable and clean. We had a partial city view. The bathroom for such a huge room was small. There was a second sink out side the bathroom which was very handy. The room had a safe, a mini bar and an extra fridge for snacks and drinks. Ours froze our water and pops. No coffee maker, but there is a Starbucks by the elevator on the Casino level. Show in the Sky was good but not good for kids! The Seafood buffet is terrible. The only good thing was the crab legs which are served ice cold and the lobster mac & cheese. $38.00 per person not worth it!!!!! The Carnival Buffet is huge and fabulous. The prime rib melted in my mouth and there are crab legs there too all for $25.00!! If I ever go back to Vegas I would consider the Rio again, but Vegas is not my cup of tea! Too smokey, Too expensive and definitely not relaxing! Fascinating; true but been there, done that, bought the t-shirt!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, couple of surprises though”
Reviews.Author: ken_wied
Reviews.Content: Well, to start it off, it was a very nice hotel. Rooms were large and spacious. Now, here is the twist. We live in the information age. Internet was available, but not free like it would be in almost EVERY other hotel. They also charged .50 cents a minute, which I thought was a little high. Also, the pool was only open from 9a-5p. After a night on the town, or gambling, the last thing I wanted to do was to get up early to go to the pool before it closes. I thought that 5pm was a little early, seeing as every other hotel I've ever stayed at was open until at least 8pm, some 10pm. There was also an issue with the trip booking. The trip was payed for in the beginning of January. I used a debit card - paid in full. I don't have credit cards, so when we got there, they wanted $100.00 PER NIGHT extra for a security deposit. No where in the booking, contract or front desk did they have this in fine print or anything that forewarned us of this before the trip. The money is returned at the end of the trip (5-7 business days), but still, it was unavailable funds that was counted on being available to us. They could just do a hold on the funds, but they actually charge the account.

Reviews.Title: “The rooms and staff-wonderful- the food - HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: jeki118
Reviews.Content: We just completed an 8 day stay at the RIO. The room was great and comfortable, the staff was so friendly - we had a wonderful time, especially with the Keno ladies. So I am not complaining about any of that - just a great stay..EXCEPT, the food. Really? The first night we got in late, and did the buffet. HORRIBLE. we blamed it on the late arrival - tried the sports grill over the next few days hoping for better...and the american grill and Sao Pallo...All horrible. All the food was under cooked or over cooked - we gave all of them 2 or more chances, hoping our first experience was just a bad food choice. NO. We didnt want to leave the casino because we were playing Keno for hrs - 9 to 12 a day - and were stuck eating horrible food or leaving our game. I got physically sick 3 times out of the 9 times we ate there. We ended up leaving to go to the mirage buffet - same price. The RIO food was consistantly low quality. The last night we decided to give the buffet on last shot - not one thing I took wasnt over cooked or horrible tasting - and im not kidding - I spit out the pasta salad, couldnt cut the ribs, the shrimp in garlic sauce was so overcooked it was mealy and GROSS, rolls stale, just everything..and then realized all of the forks at our table had food stuck between the tines- all dirty. $60 dollars, and we left hungry. The only thing I ate was salad- and I got horrible diarrhea from it within an hr. I am so disapointed - we wont be returning to the RIO- to gamble again - although its sad because we so enjoyed the staff and the games and the room. I actually went to bed hungry after 5 nights every night because I couldnt stand the food - especially because it why pay $10+ bucks for a burger that has a stale bun and the meat is over cooked? I just felt I had to let you know just how UNPLEASANT the dinning experience was during our stay. Very sad. I only recomend this hotel if you dont plan to eat there...at all. -JPope

Reviews.Title: “Go there for the entertainment, not for the rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Hagrinas
Reviews.Content: After spending several days in a nearby 4.5 star hotel, I found myself unable to fly out the day I had expected. I figured that a night in the Rio All Suite should be satisfactory, given its four star rating, but did not expect it to be such a step down. The room was not unlike the one that I saw in an on line picture provided by the hotel, which gives a 360 degree view. The difference is that without the fish eye lens, it no longer appears so grand. But the main difference between the on line picture and the actual room is that the one on line is pristine and the one I stayed in was far beyond its prime. Although the room served my purpose for the night, I would not want to stay there for any extended length of time. I call it a room, not a suite, because it's a room, not a suite. I checked the dictionary to be sure, and it told me that a suite is a "connected set of rooms." By that definition, it was a suite, but so is any room in Motel 6 with a separate bathroom. I stayed in a large bedroom with two queen beds, a separate sofa area, and an old fashioned low definition television. To be fair, the bathroom was somewhat nice, if not very memorable. It did have granite counter tops sinks with good lighting (12 bulbs surrounding the mirrors) and came across as above average. But overall, the list of amenities was pretty small for the "suite." It came with a phone, and you could get Internet access if you pay for it. Aside from the coffee table in front of the sofa, there was another small table with two plain chairs. It did have large windows with a good view, and drapes to block it off completely, but nothing to block outside noise completely. I would not go so far as to call it noisy. The room was carpeted, but the dirty carpeting is perhaps what gave the room such a lack of character. It had a small refrigerator, in addition to one that was presumably filled with snacks and beverages priced for your convenience. There was no coffee maker. On arrival, the service was courteous and professional. I was given a sincere apology for the long wait to check in. Perhaps they have more of a problem on some days or when there are conventions. I can't say what might be typical, but in my case, the wait was not comfortable. The reception area is right off the casino, making the smoky and moderately noisy wait stand out in sharp contrast to that in typical hotel lobbies. In contrast, the service I got when leaving was indifferent at best. I needed a cab to the airport, and there was no line. The only other guests there were still assembling and told the attendant that they were not ready. Since I had a family of five, others in his position would routinely wave a minivan sized taxi forward. In this case, I had to explicitly point out that there were five of us, to which he responded that the cab would fit five, as if to say "what are you complaining about?" If you go to Las Vegas to gamble, the overall room might not be such an issue. If you plan to spend a lot of time in the casino, the reception area might not be an issue. There are good shows to see there (Penn and Teller were there that night, and presumably many other nights) and the casino itself seems to have a lot to offer to gamblers. There are many other things on the premises that I did not get a chance to experience, but from what I saw, I would expect that if you go there for the casino, you will get a lot more. It's not the type of place I would recommend for a family trip, but if you are going for the gambling and the night life, it might still be a bargain. At the time of this writing, the economy is such that there are lots of hotel rooms at bargain prices. If I had been told nothing about the room except that it was a room in the price range that I paid, I probably would have considered it relatively good. If you can get a reservation at a low three star price, you will get a good room for the money. But what I expect in a four star hotel is far more than what I found.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base!”
Reviews.Author: dborm1
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy a trip to Vegas and try to get the biggest bang for the buck with regards to lodging and food. I had never stayed at the Rio before, but as a Harrah’s Club member I got a great rate on our 4 night stay. Our room was in the Ipanema Tower, which worked out great. Although we did have a great view of the dumpsters, we were able to look past that and get a partial view of some of the strip and the mountains in the background. There are 10 elevators serving the tower, we rarely had to wait which was nice. The rooms were very large and the furnishings were all adequate. I had read some reviews about the Rio not being very clean, but I thought the place was pretty clean. The staff was amazing and friendly. By far the staff of the Rio, and Vegas in general, was the most friendly and helpful of any trip I have ever taken to Las Vegas. We were able to eat very well on the cheap. The Sports Deli had a variety of choices for a fair price, we never had to wait long to eat. The Gold Coast across the street has a great breakfast buffet for 6 or 7 bucks. We had a car, so we could buzz around the area and check out some of the local casinos. We really liked The Orleans, which is only about 3 or 4 miles from the Rio. They had $5 tables, even on the weekends, and was a really a happening place. It finally warmed up on our last day and we were able to spend some time out in the pool area, which is one of the better pools we’ve seen in Vegas. A couple of cons… Walking to the strip along a very busy road is a little hairy. To say the slots were tight would be an understatement. Casino and air quality in general seemed less than in other casinos. All in all good home base, excellent service, and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “7 Star treatment?? Never Again...UGH!!!”
Reviews.Author: 1SlotMama
Reviews.Content: The WORSE experience we've had at a Harrahs' property!! And since we're 7 star status, we were booked in a suite...right under the Voo Doo Lounge!! Non stop noise until the bar closed at 3 am. The walls shook! We were told at check in there were no other rooms available, yet when I mentioned this at check out, they wanted to know why we didn't request another room. The bathroom was a JOKE! No hot water in the shower...although maitenance did come right up and fix it when I complained. BUT...the bathtub was in the middle of the bedroom with no way to close the bathroom off. My husband had a conference and had to get up at 7AM...there was no way he could get ready without waking me! The food at the buffet was horrible! Waited at the VIP entrance for our turn, then told by the hostess we should have just pushed ahead of the other non 7 Star customers waiting. Really? Not my place to do that! The casino was OK...nothing too great. Security was at a minimum though and there were SEVERAL drunk kids hanging outside of the bar entrances. The security that *was* there took no interest. I did not feel safe. We won't stay there again....

Reviews.Title: “Long Live the Rio”
Reviews.Author: Sweetguy36
Reviews.Content: I visited the Rio to explore it for our group function. From the time I parked my own car to driving off the property I have never had as an enjoyable experience in Las Vegas then at the Rio. For 2 days the only time we left the property was to get an In-N-Out burger. The Vodoo Steakhouse, American Grill and SauPaulo for breakfast was all above par food. The staff was always friendly helpful and even though a "blue collar" customer I was treated like a high roller. Will be taking my 62 year old mom back for a fun time for her in a few months! Our group will be booking at the RIo for many years! Just minutes off the strip, it was PERFECT to get in and our of the hotel, no long waits in traffic to get around town!!

Reviews.Title: “has gotten sleezy”
Reviews.Author: disappointedTahoe
Reviews.Content: We were anxious to return to see the Show in the Sky but were very disappointed by how sleezy they tried to be. There was a definite lack of talent and enthusiasm by the dancers in the floats. Too bad that this unique experience has taken this turn.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay....We'll Be Back !!”
Reviews.Author: swiebke
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights in one of the Premiere Rooms at the Rio as part of a free Total Rewards promotion. A corner room on the 16th floor....what a view. A couple of blocks off the strip but a view of the strip that's spectacular. We used the free shuttle to the Paris and Harrahs...worked out fine. The food at the Carnival Buffet was wonderful and a gastronomic adventure that must be experienced. The dealers are friendly and make you feel welcome and wanted. Check-in and out went flawlessly. We've stayed recently at the Monte Carlo and Residence Inn and the Rio blows them away. Big rooms, friendly staff and oh what a buffet. Our only negative, and no fault of the Rio, was that we bought passes for Las Vegas' "The Deuce' bus transportation on the strip...that was a disaster. The cabbies must be paying the bus drivers off not to drive. A huge waste of time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for your dollars”
Reviews.Author: EdmontonRhino
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, everything worked, staff very friendly,good bar service and ok food. If you go ask for Ipanema or Masquerade tower they are newer and nicer. We saved alot of money staying here and would rather spend money on shows and restaurants. We had a car so cant comment on getting to the strip but there was a shuttle. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ckayej
Reviews.Content: First time to Vegas, won a lot, partied a lot, had a great time and lots of great deals!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: mydaddysSugar
Reviews.Content: As a diamond player I selected the Rio Hotel for it's value. I wasn't made aware that there is a VIP signin and service until after I was checked in at the main hotel location. That said, I was very happy with the room I was assigned and the hotel as a whole. It isn't the newest but it is very comfortable and I was contacted by several employees from various function areas to ask if there was anything they could do to make my stay with them more enjoyable. I believe that this is the treatment all guests are given. Special thanks to Jodi who is just an example of the great quality of the hotel staff. I was there at the beginning of "spring break" and even though the hotel was full of the younger generation, I as a senior, was very relaxed. The champagne bunch was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Ipanema Tower not the greatest...”
Reviews.Author: BobnIdaho
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Rio. I actually had reservations the next day at a different hotel, but ended up in Vegas a day early and through my Total Rewards card I logged on and found I had a free room at the Rio. I contacted the Rio and they were happy to give me my comped room. I have stayed at the Rio off and on over the last six or seven years and have always had a wonderful room with a wonderful view. This time would be different. I got there on a Thursday morning, had a very short check in line and was in my room within 20 minutes of arriving, which was pretty quick. Kudos to the check in staff. I have always stayed in the Masquerade Tower, which has wonderful views of either the Mandalay Bay end of the strip or the pool area. This time would be different, as I was assigned a room in the Ipanema Tower. I never even knew the Ipanema Tower existed. It is tucked down a hallway between the cashier cages and the All American Bar and Grille. The room was the same size as the ones in the Masquerade Tower, but the view was of the dumpsters, power units and parking garage on the Gold Coast side of the building. Of course, this was a free room, so I can't really complain, but I can say that the room did not make me want to stay longer than the night I was booked for. The television is not the updated flat screens like the better towers, instead being an old school behemoth tucked into a wooden cabinet. The bathroom had a bathtub/shower unit. Everything in the room just looked old and out dated, as if they had locked this tower up about five years ago and just reopened it recently. You kind of wondered how clean things really were. The bathtub had some water stains, etc. Overall the room was ok for one night, and especially since it was a comp room, but it seemed old and tired. If this had been my only experience at the Rio I would not go back. Fortunately I have seen the nicer rooms at the Rio and know that they offer a much better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Worst 2 nights I have had at any Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: nolimits74
Reviews.Content: Where do I start...We were supposed to have a strip view but we got put on the opposite side. No big deal until the winds came at night and there was a crack in the window that made a high pitched sound that kept us up all night. The internet didn't work so we were out of luck that day.
