We finally moved rooms but I left my phone charger in the first room and never got it back. The new room had a nice view but the internet still didn't work for the first 2 hours and they still charged us $17. Also the hot water took a half hour to get warm. They gave us a free movie and a $30 food and beverage credit for the hassle but the damage was already done. My girlfriend was attending a convention at the Rio but my advice is if you are doing the same, stay across the street at the Palms and spend $5 catching a cab and closing your eyes until you reach the convention area of the Rio.. The place is outdated very smoky and frankly more like the twilight zone than a casino. Due I hear a wrecking ball in the future Rio? We all can only hope so!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Kat&John
Reviews.Content: Vegas hotels due to their size and the general weirdness of the city need to compared to each other rather than to places outside of Nevada. Rio rooms are very large, clean and comfortable. I stayed in the ipanema tower (the older shorter one) which was recently remodeled and they did a nice job. Jetted tub and a very large bathroom. The public areas are getting a bit worn, but my room was modernized. I would rate this place among TI, Mirage, Paris. Above Luxor, NYNY, Flamingo Planet Hollywood & Monte Carlo. Below Mandelay, Ceasars & Venetian. The property is off the strip but they offer a free shuttle to the other Harrahs properties. The whole place is manageable and a nice size The Voodoo lounge at the top of the other tower has a stunning view and good food in the Steak house. What makes this place unusual among Vegas hotels is that the staff has somehow maintained a friendly attitude that is service oriented. In most Vegas hotels, you are a number, a dollar sign and little attempt is made to gain repeat business other than through the gambling loyalty programs. Rio is different in that they magically seem to treat guests like guests. Weird for this town...

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: DOC00
Reviews.Content: I’ve been a Rio guest many times over the last 12 years and a Harrah’s Diamond customer for 5 years. So I’m a pretty good customer who frequents the fine dining restaurants and uses the Spa etc. Obviously I could choose any upscale hotel in Las Vegas. I’m very sorry to report the decline of a once great place to stay and be entertained. The place has definitely seen better times. The check in, even on the Diamond line was very slow, the clerk acted as he was indifferent with the entire process. They closed one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas and replaced it with a weak imitation of a South Philly dive. The Show in the Sky was “on vacation” and dark. The room was very worn out and the plumbing was a problem with stopped up sinks and tub. To add insult to injury at check out the casino host was actually rude when asked about a meal comp at the steak house in the Voodoo Lounge. I will definitely take my business elsewhere on my next Vegas trip. Farewell Rio. Is the wrecking ball in your future?

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Surprise”
Reviews.Author: terracne
Reviews.Content: Took my oldest daughter to Las Vegas on her 21st birthday. Stayed at the RIO. A beautiful hotel with several swimming pools and lots to do. The food was great and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. It was reasonably priced and well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the way and out of date!”
Reviews.Author: shophappy36
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Rio with my sister. When we got there, our room smelled like there was a dead mouse in there. When we called them, they did not seem concerned but moved us anyway. We got there around 11pm and they made us come down to the Lobby to exchange our keys. Then when my sister left something behind, they made her come down again to get the keys and go get the item herself. When asked if a bellman could do it, they told us they only had 2 on so they couldn't help us! Most of the restaurants were closed half of the time and the ones that were open were terrible. The dealers were fantastic which made the hotel. Our new room was beautiul, clean, and updated. The staff was all very polite but the lack of service in the late hours was a disappointment. It's too out of the way from the strip and too much of a hassle to go back and forth if that's where you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay at the Rio again.....”
Reviews.Author: stephanie572
Reviews.Content: All in all, our stay at the RIO was below par. The show in the sky was dark the entire weekend - which is why we chose to stay there. The afterhour food availability is non-existent except for the American Bar & Grille which is way too overpriced and the service was terrible. We wanted a piece of pizza or a cheap hot dog and could not find anything to eat late at night so were forced to order room serivce. Most other hotels have an all-night deli or fast food stop available but the RIO had nothing. The check-in line was outrageously long and we spent over an hour waiting to check in. I was not happy with the overall experience of the RIO - when I was really excited to stay there. We will shoot for an "on the strip" hotel next time as this was too far out of the way and not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great host and great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: dladda
Reviews.Content: Brought a group of 44 golfers and gamblers to the Rio. Check-in process took about 10 minutes for the whole group. Everything was set up and ready for us. Stayed five nights with superb accomodations. Host was very accessible and took care of minor issues quickly to everyone's satisfaction. Had a great time and will return next year with the same bunch of old coots for golf and gambling. Restaurants and entertainment were excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed spacious room”
Reviews.Author: TravelAdviceCA
Reviews.Content: The hotel's decor is decidedly garish, but the name sort of gives that away. The room is large, less a suite and more of a loft space. A large sofa dominated one side of the room with a large flat screen TV. Analog cable and no adjustment for aspect ratio (so everyone is stretched wide). The usual amenities for the bathroom (soap, shampoo/conditioner and body lotion). Three sets of towels for a room with two queen sized beds (what if you were four to the room?) The room was clean and ready when we arrived. The front desk was quick and attentive. Both WiFi and cabled Internet was available, though overpriced. (No hidden resort fee!)

Reviews.Title: “Always a fun, clean place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: DLfan74
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here earlier this month (03/01 thru 03/03). I won two free nights in a deluxe room (all rooms are considered suites). I have stayed here before and found the experience the same: fun; clean, nice rooms; and great food! The room: The room was clean and comfy. The bed was too firm for me, but good for the hubby. The fridge is in the closet, NOT the TV cabinet like other places so make sure you look there. That's because there's a snack bar in the TV cabinet instead. Bathroom contains a small vanity, toilet and tub. There's a large vanity on the outside of the bathroom. The restuarants: We ate at the American Bar & Grill. Great food and comfy booths. Awesome fries! You get a mix of regular, curly and waffle fries. Portions were large and the prices were reasonable, about the same as an Applebees or TGI Fridays. I really like the wall of fire at the rear of the restaurant. We also ate at the buffet (World, Carnival...can't remember the name). Breakfast was AWESOME! LOTS to choose from, including some lunch items, Chinese and Mexican. The food was fresh, the place was clean and service was fast. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here. I have nothing bad to say about it. Didn't even run into any timeshare people.

Reviews.Title: “PRO's And CON's”
Reviews.Author: Canoodle
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights-cant say a bad word about the rooms (upgraded to strip view in Masquerade Tower for extra $20 a night) Room was clean-room service did a great job tidying up every day.View of strip ok-not sure if worth the upgrade though-didnt exactly spend too much time looking out the window. Was looking for a "quieter" Vegas experience this time round and certainly found it at the Rio.No night time noise at all,being off strip. However....found the off strip location to be a hassle...lets face it you are going to want to hit the strip sooner or later-shuttle hours are 10.00am to 1.00 am-so if you're an early riser,you have to hang around until 10am to catch the shuttle....or pay for a cab. Or spend $100 at the slots/tables,whiling away the hours...realised nothing in Vegas happens randomly-everything designed around getting you to part with your hard earned cash !! The casino is terribly smokey-as a non smoker, smoke doesnt usually bug me- but found myself running for the exits every time, to get some fresh air.Didnt feel the same in other casino's. In summary ,I definately would not recommend this hotel to a Vegas first timer-keep to the strip ( second time you visit,stay downtown-excellent experience) A word on Penn & Teller ( At the Rio) -this was by far the most boring "magic' show I have ever experienced-I think Messrs.Penn & Teller are bored to,with the whole thing. Seemingly, their Vegas sell by date has expired-dont be fooled by TIX4less discounting their show tickets- not worth the $53 I paid.Spend it elsewhere (recommend Diva's at the Imperial Palace for only $35) In conclusion, the Rio is a solid hotel and will provide a decent Vegas experience-if you dont mind waiting for shuttles and working around schedules etc.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for massive overcharges!!!”
Reviews.Author: JonesPeak
Reviews.Content: I stayed here, and would rate them well except for one thing, they charged me over $50 for mini bar items I merely touched, but never consumed. When I asked for the bill to be corrected they refused, saying that since I had removed items from the mini bar I would be charged for them. Funny, I just took some beers out to store water for 5 mins until I realized there was another fridge, but to them that is sufficent to charge you for them. There is no seal on the bar, or anything else that tells you this can occur. So be warned, there are sensors in the bar and if you touch something, even to just read the ingrediants, you will be charged. Then if you try to get the charges reversed tthe Rio's parent company, Harrah's, will refuse and tell you to dispute it with your credit card if you want it corrected. This is a huge scam, and if it happened to you, please contact your State's Attorney General to file a complaint. Otherwise this deceptive business practice will continue.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, 15 min off strip”
Reviews.Author: creekj
Reviews.Content: Reviewer: early 30's, no children, low-rolling gamblers, foodies, visit Vegas 4 times a year Room: Ipanema towers (the most recently renovated tower) 1003 Pro's: Rio has to have the largest standard rooms in Vegas. I'd guess about 600 sq ft. My room was about mid level, but it still had a great view of the strip. Clean bathroom, excellent water pressure. A separate sink and make-up counter for the wife and a free room safe. Elevators were fast, never waited more than 1 minute. Quiet rooms no outside noise affected our sleep. Carnival buffet has an all day, all you can eat pass for $24. Great for addicted gamblers who just want something to eat to keep them from dying of malnutrition. Con's: I didn't care for their pillows. There 3 square pillows that just don't seem to work for me. They have support and they work, but it's really the only con of the rooms. If you want to explore the strip or plan on making frequent visits to the strip, I'd recommend staying on the strip. Shuttles leave every 15 minutes from the Rio, and walking is an option, I just would not want to do it. It appears to be a straight shot, but it isn't really foot friendly. Casino: Trendy, up beat casino. In the morning there are $5 tables, which go up to $10 at night. Drinks were stiff and service was prompt. Slots weren't loose for me on WoF, I had better luck across the street at Gold Coast. The Coast is literally across the street a 10 min walk at most. You have to cross a 4-6 lane street, but it was never busy and completely safe. Coast has $5 tables all day. Drinks had no alcohol, I'd recommend ordering shots with chasers. Otherwise your tipping on mixers. My wife get's drunk off half a beer (literally, her body doesn't metabolize alcohol normally) and she drank for 12 hours without getting drunk.

Reviews.Title: “Large room, loose slot machines, text discounts”
Reviews.Author: Gaffer2010
Reviews.Content: Room was clean and very spacious. Casino had text discounts (e.g. buffet, coffee, free play). Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChadK4
Reviews.Content: even though located off the strip, we had a wonderful time and cant wait to get back

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Melissalynn19
Reviews.Content: This hotel and casino has everything you could want. Gambling, shopping and great food. I especially loved the sushi restaurant. The only thing I did not like about the Rio was that it was off of the strip a little ways. I probably would not have cared if the weather had been a little warmer though.

Reviews.Title: “RIO for ME”
Reviews.Author: jearruda
Reviews.Content: Stayed at RIO many Times and have always been treated very well

Reviews.Title: “RIO”
Reviews.Author: Susanrnc123
Reviews.Content: Spacious, clean rooms, loved having a fridge in the room. Shuttle makes it easy to go back and forth to the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for a free stay!”
Reviews.Author: rinthecutie
Reviews.Content: Arrived there at about 3:00pm. Surprisingly the line wasn't as long as I thought it would be. It was about a 20 minute wait. The check-in clerk wasn't all that friendly, but we didn't ask for anything too demanding. I was a little upset they needed a Credit Card on file even though I had won the stay through a contest on Twitter. I had spoke with hotel staff several times over the phone and read from people on the TA Forums that it wasn't needed and I could decline. I told her I didn't have one, but she still insisted it was mandatory. Luckily, my friend I was traveling with had her card with her. It was $200 hold for 2 nights. We received a room on the 10th floor in the Ipanema Tower. I wasn't excited about it, but once we got to the room... I was... content. We had 2 queen beds, couch, vanity mirror, safe, closet with several hangers and bathroom with a rather large tub and vanity mirror as well. I was with 2 other girls, so the extra mirror was great to have when we were getting ready. We immediately called downstairs for our bags and Housekeeping for extra towels. Everybody arrived promptly. We went to the Voodoo Lounge each night we were there and it was a great view. Music was a little bit old school for my taste. Didn't play anything that I was currently listening to. They played the songs that I had on my playlist like.. 2 to 3 years ago LOL. We received free passes literally everytime we went downstairs so that was good. The food at the American Bar & Grill was terrific as well. I wasn't expecting much since it wasn't very crowded. Overall, my experience there was pretty good. I was a little upset because I left my wall charger for my iPhone there. I called security and they said they would give me a call once Housekeeping turned it in... never happened. It's my own fault for forgetting though. Other than that, I would probably go back again, only if the price was right. Didn't get a chance to go into the Buffet as it was EXTREMELY crowded each time I walked pass. Shuttles also ran on time and service was great, I just wouldn't pay what they are currently charging for a weekend stay!

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: KristinHowell
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel to be very accomodating and spacious! The hotel was nice and the ammenities were nicer!

Reviews.Title: “Rio has really gone downhill”
Reviews.Author: jraindc
Reviews.Content: I'm a diamond player and took a group of friends to RIO (2 rooms) February 13-16. We hadn't stayed there in a few years, and wow it has gone down hill. The rooms haven't been updated/upgraded in any way. The casino floor is very tired looking. Unbelievably, despite it being a holiday weekend, the show in the sky wasn't running. The spa is TIRED and really out of place for Vegas. We mostly gambled elsewhere as so many of the blackjack tables pay 6/5. Stay away from these. According to various people who work at the property, Harrahs is not investing any money in this hotel. It really shows.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DjuroC
Reviews.Content: You're spoiled the minute you get there especially when you drive in. Valet parking, bell hop service, and nice check-in people. Got deals for the Carnival Buffet. That buffet was the best buffet I've ever eaten. They have food from A to Z, American food to food from Zimbobway (sp). Awesome experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Vegas semi frequent traveler”
Reviews.Author: CharliV
Reviews.Content: We often stay at the RIO, The rooms are clean and large, in room safes are nice, toilet and shower are in separate room and there are two sinks so it makes getting ready easier, the dealers are always proffesional, we like it because we go to vegas twice a year and we rent a car so because it is "off the strip" you don't have to fight the traffic quite so much. All of the restaurants are very good too!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schoonermon
Reviews.Content: Very nice all all suite hotel to stay at when you want to be off of the strip. The shows are great and the buffet is voted the best in Vagas.

Reviews.Title: “Buffet Overrated”
Reviews.Author: theresa1970
Reviews.Content: We decided to eat at the buffet, and was very disappointed. The ribs were tough and cold. The desserts were too sweet, but did offer a wide selection. I would not recommend this place especially for the price. Lower your price Rio the food is not that good.

Reviews.Title: “I liked it...”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Lucky_987
Reviews.Content: I didn't really stay much in the room (Sleeping in Vegas is like telling people to shut up... Do it only when necessary)... We had a room in the old tower, so it wasn't as nice as the newer rooms, but then again we only got it to have a place to sleep and keep our clothes and souvenirs... Gaming floor is decent size (Not very many table games and decent amount of slots and video poker)... There are 2 restaurants, 1 Bar, 1 nightclub, and a Buffet. The food at the sports restaurant is pretty good and the buffet is okay... Overall I liked it for the affordability and location near the strip (it's only a 15 minute walk from the strip)...

Reviews.Title: “Rio All-Suites Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DelTillman
Reviews.Content: It's off the strip so if you're there to site see or walk along strip, I'd advise against staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Nissian Award Ceremony”
Reviews.Author: AmyR14
Reviews.Content: Food was great, shows were great, a ton of walking, but we'd do it again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible View of Garbage and Loud Trucks All Night”
Reviews.Author: NMF
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent visitor to Vegas, probably 7 times a year for work and pleasure. I have stayed in numerous condos and resorts . I chose the Rio because of the rates and wanted to try something different. We checked in and the room they gave us in the tower was so outdated it looked like a 80's funeral home and had not been cleaned well. We called downstairs and they said they could transfer us to the other building. We went down and had to wait at the desk for a 1/2 for the customer service rep to find out "who we talked to" before she could move us. The new room itself was very well appointed and had allot of room for Vegas standard rooms. But the view was awful, we looked at the loading dock and a trash pile. I cannot believe that a establishment would not cover a pile of trash of this magnitude, there were old mattresses, furniture, hundreds of bags of garbage piled high. All night the trucks came and went to the loading dock loud and could not sleep. One night they had the sewer pump truck out there at 2 am pumping and the whole room smelled like sewer gas!! We called they did apologize to us. Over all not a bad place to stay ... make sure you do not stay on the side with the garbage dump. Our room was 442 and 1452 had the same views!!

Reviews.Title: “Very mixed - but overall good”
Reviews.Author: acw38
Reviews.Content: Ok, I followed reviews on this site for three weeks before my trip and I got pretty nervous after reading the complaints and problems that people had. I actually emailed the hotel with my concerns, also asking them if they could tell me if there were any construction or current "issues" that I should be aware of before traveling due to reading these reviews. Never got an email back. Oh well, stil kept the reservation. We reserved the Masquerade Suite for a great deal through Orbitz, but when we got there to check in (which was a breeze, no line at all) they upgraded us (by request) to the Cariocas Suite. NO XTRA CHARGE! A little smaller but much nicer. Check in staff were extremely polite, and welcoming, bell service was top notch....the most polite "dept" at the hotel. Got to the room, it was great. Very clean, no smoke smell, and just very pleasing all around. We had a spa in our bedroom which was wonderful (and clean), but I have to say that bed and those pillows were probably the worst I have ever slept on - period. I almost just wanted to sleep in the tub. I bring my own pillow case w/me, just a habit and that didn't even help. So two nights of uncomfortable semi-sleep...not fun. Ordered room service, very fast, and extremely polite. Now, this Carnival World Buffet that everyone talks about is and I mean this whole heartedly....HORRIBLE! Yes, there was a lot of different variety, but nothing tasted good. My husband can eat anything and believe me he tried so for him not to even take more than one bite of the prime rib or other items says a lot to me. We were really looking forward to it and walked away extremely disappointed. I would much rather prefer quality over quantity. Gambling was fun, won quite a bit actually; just on slots alone. The iBar was nice, but seemed expensive even for a "vegas bar". The server girls that are wrapped in tissue paper for an outfit weren't very attentive and my hubby and I ended up going up to the bar to order our drinks 3x because we got tired of waiting. It wasn't overly packed either. There is a shuttle that goes to other Harrah's hotels on the strip, this is very convenient and so the location of this hotel wasn't an issue at all. Another thing about this Hotel is that there is a number that you can text when you get there and they send you free offers via texts to your phone for 3 days while you're there. Like buffet discounts, drink discounts, and other nice offers. However, it's a little lame because you have to continuously take your phone to the Rewarde desk show it to them, delete it in front of them, get a voucher and THEN go where you want to go. It would be easier ot just show the text to the buffet person or bartender...kinda ruins the buzz. Oh well. Now, the Seafood Buffet was pretty good, best service I've ever had! Our waiter was Angel and he was attentive, friendly, and geuinely seemed to want to make people happy. The food was worth the money, and I recommend it. Overall, it was an ok experience. I didn't leave with the "I can't wait to come back" feeling, which I had when I stayed at the Monte Carlo and other hotels, but it was a decent trip and something I can say "yes I've stayed there". Unless I get comped, I probably won't stay there again, just due to the horribly uncomfortable bed we had. Maybe our expectations were too high, as we have heard our friends rave about it, but that was years ago and I think this hotel could use an facelift. Oh! And the Carnival in the Sky show only runs Thurs - Sun. We didn't get to see it and were bummed, it might have perked the place up a little.

Reviews.Title: “Big Rooms; Great Views”
Reviews.Author: LaurettaE
Reviews.Content: Shuttle service makes the off-strip location a non-issue.

Reviews.Title: “Rio and New Year's Eve in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: BrigitteI
Reviews.Content: I had to see for myself what it was really like to spend New Year's Eve in Las Vegas. It was fantastic, the hotel and staff were outstanding as was our suite. The traffic going home on the2nd Jan, was horrendous. We will fly the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: JeanineB3
Reviews.Content: The suite was nice and roomy, even with an added single bed for our 3 year old. The pools were great, even having a sand area for the little guy to play in. Bowling alley was great! Nice selection of different foods. I loved the shops and the shows right in the lobby. Unlike any hotel I have ever been to before.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Thornell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rio between Christmas and New Years in 2009. We found a dirt-cheap rate on lasvegas.com and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The hotel is modern and our room was clean. The WiFi worked well and was not included in the price of our room. I think it was $13 a day. There is a wonderful buffet downstairs, and we received a booklet of Las Vegas coupons upon checking in. Our room was huge and had a large TV. The fridge was convenient for holding leftovers from eating out. The self parking garage that they first pointed us to was full, but we soon found the other one and there was ample parking. We enjoyed being off the strip, but conveniently close to everything. The Rio has a free shuttle to 3-4 other casinos on the strip. I would easily recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a large, clean, and cheap room.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: diveshade
Reviews.Content: pretty good hotel! awesome swimming pool with a cascade inside!

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed for the whole trip”
Reviews.Author: lifeidesire
Reviews.Content: The Rio was great. Nice, big, clean rooms. I just wish I could have stayed whole week like I planned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: cbrent1982
Reviews.Content: Nice place, friendly servers. Good gambling. Good shows.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid! Not the best place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: kizmazok
Reviews.Content: The best example of poor customer service you will ever see! The best parts of the trip was the Carnival Buffet and the beds. Best advice is don't touch anything in the refreshment center in your room. We were overcharged $20 for just looking. There are sensors in it. I am still waiting on my drink server to bring a bottled water. Passed by me two times, but still no water. Ice machine did not work the whole week we were there. Even though your room might be comped, have a $200 deposit. (I have paid cheaper deposits for apartment rental.) Check your vehicle before accepting from valet.

Reviews.Title: “The experience was better than the reviews...”
Reviews.Author: nate1879
Reviews.Content: I was not sure what to expect from the reviews, but I wasn't terribly worried. I had a conference in Vegas for a 6 days, and found that Harrah's would comp my entire stay at the Rio...so, I didn't have very high expectations. I will say that the casino needs a little update, i.e. filthy carpets are the first thing you notice. The staff was exceptionally nice: check-in, pit boss, craps/roulette dealers, bellhops, and the maids. I stayed in the Ipanema Tower in room 652, which was at the end of the hall...again, filthy carpets. I opened the door to the room, and I was pleasantly surprised with the updated, renovated room. I appreciated the space, especially when staying a week. Every morning it was very noisy, as the room is near the shipment receiving area and the dumpsters...request a higher floor. The food choices were mediocre, the Starbucks is fast, and VooDoo was fun (but overpriced). There is a free shuttle near the seafood buffet that takes you to either Paris or Harrah's on the strip, which helps with the biggest drawback to this casino...LOCATION. I generally took a taxi to my conference at the Palazzo, which costs around $8.75-10 depending on route and traffic...and it only took about 5-8 minutes. Likes: The staff, the views from the top of VooDoo, the 'price' of the room Dislikes: Location, Dingy carpets, noisy room around 8-10am Overall: The location is an issue if you want to walk from one casino to the next, but taxi rides aren't that expensive...although it can add up, if you're out there for a week. I enjoyed the nice staff at the hotel, and if I receive another comp the next time I am out, I would gladly stay at Rio...I just wouldn't pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel stay ever! Dont stay here! Bad service, bad everything!!”
Reviews.Author: emily123CharlotteNC
Reviews.Content: This was the worst trip ever taken!! We prepaid so we were stuck! We changed rooms4 times in the first 3 days. One, due to construction they did not tell us about at 6am and the next room we went to had a clogged toilet in which maintance, when they did arrive, removed the toitet from the floor and that spead bowel movement all over the bathroom floor and all over our unpack belongings. This is only a fraction of the misery we experienced at thr "Rio". Please take my advice, never, ever stay there, you will regret it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Seafood Buffet”
Reviews.Author: ajcam2004
Reviews.Content: Did not stay at the Rio stayed at Harrahs, but on each trip we looked forward to the seafood buffet. Would not return again, first the price is now $40, which is not a problem if the quality of food remained the same, but the quality is now gone. Uncooked lobster, chicken hard as a rock, stuffed clams you are unable to eat etc., etc., etc. While the deserts were many, all parfaits were in shot glasses, no pies, and no sugar free deserts. I understand the economy is bad, but lessen the choices, but don't lessen the quality. We always looked forward to a trip to this buffet, but will not go again

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, updated suite!! We stay at the Rio several times a year.”
Reviews.Author: larsfromars
Reviews.Content: Only one suggestion for improvement: For an upscale hotel, the toilet paper is not fit for an outhouse. It's the only item that injures the high rating. I hope the purchasing agentt changes this item and the hotel will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: davelip
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights, was upgraded to a "Masquerade Suite" (1600 SF!!!) for $20 because it's the Rio's 20th Anniversary. Unbelievable room with amazing views, although only complaint about the room would be decor is a little out of date, and the huge ugly 32" TV in front of beautiful bedroom view. Other than that, this room would've been amazing to hold a cocktail party with a large group of people. Overall a great stay, very enjoyable, just wish I hadn't lost so much money. :( Steakhouse at the VooDoo lounge is top notch, excellent. Ordered a 20oz NY Strip steak, one of the best steaks I've ever had! The buffet's are mediocre at the Rio, including the All you can eat Seafood Buffet ($38). The shrimp were cheap and small, oysters had no flavor, lobster was dried out and bland. Take a drive over to the Mirage for their buffet, or the Paris, which are both terrific and about the same price as the Rio's $25.

Reviews.Title: “this place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: mezamwendy
Reviews.Content: This place is very outdated and runned down. The room itself felt really dirty. The bathroom doors had rust and it would run down to the bathtub as we took a shower! The water in the bathtub and sinks would not drain well, and the toilet handle broke. I was very dissapointed. I'm in the hotel business and my family expects great hotel choices from me on every trip, boy did i hear it with this one!

Reviews.Title: “Was just ok”
Reviews.Author: vmillard
Reviews.Content: Our stay wasn't bad but honestly we weren't in the room too much. Food at the buffet was good. The room is nothing special, ours was comp'd by Harrah's/Total Rewards. We always use our players card when we gamble. Rio's table games are pretty expensive and we ended up going next door to Gold Coast most of the time. Rio is off the strip but the shuttle runs to the strip regularly. I wouldn't recommend trying to walk to it.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamtrip”
Reviews.Author: CharlotteM2
Reviews.Content: It's very nice and great hotel ..there is the biggest and best buffe...the best view from the top off the hotel over the hole strip...the best male dance grupe the Chippendales there has there oven teather and lounge and shop ..so go in and see it. It has the great show call" show in the sky" with a lot of dance and singing and very little clothes on..The rooms are very big and there is a big sofa and table to the laptop and two sinks and big closet. And even when the hotel not is on the strip is it very easy to go there whit the free shuttle there are goimg to two diffrent places one in the north and one in the south of the strip.

Reviews.Title: “a little worn”
Reviews.Author: ken240
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at Rio was about 6~7 yrs ago, I still remember the room was big, and so was the TV. But today, the room still looks about the same (of course it's much older), the old TV takes me back to the old days. The bed was not very comfortable, the mattress need to be replaced, indeed the room needs a facelift. The hotel is not on the strip, but I drove so the location wasn't that big of deal. Nobody broke in our room, and I felt very safe there. Btw, I stayed at Masquerade Tower, and booked the room directly from Rio for $55+tax a night, very cheap for Friday night. I likely won't stay there if not because of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: dragonlem
Reviews.Content: I called to the hotel and asked if it is within walking distance from the strip to the hotel, the clerk said it is certainly the case. I had 2 big luggage and that took me half an hour to get there from the strip! The clerk should have told me about the free shuttle from Paris instead! Ok, after check-in at the hotel, the room has a very strong odor and we requested to change the room. We have a deluxe room, and seriously, even after changing the room, I don't think the room is clean at all. My girl friend got drunk on the last night and needed to puke. What happened was the elevators were locked and we can't get back to the room. The employee walked slowly like a snail to unlock the elevators. When we got back to the room, we could not open the door. What kind of hotel is this? I was so mad, and called to complain to the manager. The manager said he is sending someone up. 15 minutes have gone and I saw nobody. I kept trying swiping the key and the door finally opened, and my girl friend get to eventually puke inside the restroom. It took us 45 minutes to get back to our room... I was really mad and asked the supervisor to send some hot water to the room and that also took another 45 minutes. I will not come back to this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Double Lock Your Doors”
Reviews.Author: Hollyhannah
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Rio for 4 days to attend a trade show at the convention center located at the Rio. The entire stay was horrible. We were in the Masquerade Tower, our room was just OK, my feet stuck to the carpet when I was barefoot and there was mold/mildew in the bathtub/shower. That was only the start..... Our close friends room in the Ipanema Tower was broken into in the middle of the night with them sleeping in the bed!!!!! The thieves took their laptop, cell phone and all their cash from the desk less than 3 feet from their bed. No one could believe it but they had not double locked the door when they went to bed. The Rio only changed the key locks and nothing else! I guess, business as usual. I had to make 4 phone calls to finally get our drycleaning picked up. I was told the computer system was screwed up so they didn't know I had called to place an order. We could not connect to their internet provider without spending a half hour on the phone with their tech support to get the thing working. And last but not least, on our final morning when we had to be out of the hotel by 6 a.m. There was no hot water! Cold showers were not pleasant at this hour. When I got down to the lobby to check out, a young women was hanging around the lobby (wondered about her profession if you know what I mean). She asked to borrow my cell phone as her battery died. I did and now I am receiving phone calls in the middle of the night from whomever it was she called. We will NEVER return to the Rio under any circumstances. PS - On a good note, the room service was prompt and the employees that delivered the food were courteous and professsional.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kkorus86
Reviews.Content: First time ever to Vegas; best hotel, amazing stay!! Definetly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely miss the target this time, will not stay again”
Reviews.Author: AvidT21
Reviews.Content: We came to vegas to join a large group of friends, we decided within a few weeks to go to vegas so didn't have much time. Rio rates were very reasonable and we jumped on it. The check in: It was a lite night I guess, but there were only 2 people helping guests. After about 15-20 twenty minute wait we were given keys to one of the bottom floor rooms with TWO queen beds (we had requested one king). The employee try get us to upgrade to the suite and said those were only one with king beds. To our unpleasant surprise when we went to our room, the maids were still in their room. Had my partner wait while I went back down to sort out the mess. We were quite tired at the time and our hopes of checking into the room quick and hot shower did not go as planned. Luckily, the manager was nice enough, and we were able to get another room, even higher up, with a nicer view of the strip. The room was nothing to write home aboutThe manager also called us once we checked into the room to make sure we were satisfied. The nightmarish stay, LITERALLY: The first night after changing rooms, we got into bed around midnight...thinking the night was done we were mistakened, at around 3:17am in the morning the fire alarm was triggered and A REALLY LOUD blaring alarm woke us both us. Anxiety ridden my partner was unable to sleep for the entire night. When we reported the incidence the facilities said they never heard about anything and treated us like we made up the whole thing :( Nightmarish stay II Deja Vu, this time at 2:05am the same annoying shocking alarm interrupted our restful sleep...it was active for more than 3 mins. This time I completely woke up and call the frontdesk to confirm, it was stated that someone had been smoking in elevator area of our floor. We ask if there was anything the staff could do and was only given the generic "Fire alarms are there for your safety...". I check in with the manager the next day and he told me, they only thing they can offer was another switch of rooms. We were only in town for 4 days, and this being the last 2 nights I politely declined, in all honesty it's a decent hotel...however, the hotel staff could be friendlier and the managers more accomodating. When I compare this trip to my others vegas trip, the hotel should not be more memorable and everyone should expect to get some sleep. I've stayed in the MGM, Venetian and Planet Hollywood, Westin in the past and all of these hotels/Casino trumped Rio. We will not be staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: scsuperman
Reviews.Content: I love staying at the RIO, simply because it is off the strip and away from all the hustle and bustle of everyone coming in and out. Check In was a breeze, even for a saturday afternoon. There was a long line but it went rather quickly. We got Comped and upgraded to strip view suite and it was great. Never had an problems with the room whatsoever. it was cleaned everyday very nicely. The casino wasnt nearly as smokey as I remember in the past. It was never crowded or loud as usual except for on Monday and even then it wasn't that bad, not like the strip hotels. The show in the sky was dark so we didn't get to see it but I have seen it before, so this wasn't a big deal. We hit the slot machines for a few hundred dollars and actually came home with money unlike the other trips. Great trip and can't wait to go back to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal...highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Downtown80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awesome. Lots of perks with the package we got. Very good deal on the price. Cool night club. It's a little bit of a distance from the strip but they have revolving shuttles so they take good care of you. The absolute best is the spa. If you ever stay there and decide to get a massage ask for Skipper...she is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Just Great!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jadatisha
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and very clean many activeties and not fare from everything. I am booking my date as i speak. Be back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: campinmomma
Reviews.Content: First time traveling to Las Vegas and the entire stay was fabulous. Went with two other couples and even though we spent very little time at the hotel we were all very satisfied with our stay. The rooms were very spacious and clean, staff was friendly and efficient. The Carnival Buffet was awesome to say the least. Valet parking was extremely fast, friendly and courteous. Don't usually leave a review because it is only a matter of opinion, but our stay was so enjoyable that I decided it was worth leaving my personal opinion. Would definitely come back and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mchidms3
Reviews.Content: It has spacious room with easy transportation available for free to city centre and other casinos. Many attractions available inside hotel. We love to come back again someday and stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “30th bday”
Reviews.Author: emydee23
Reviews.Content: Had stayed here twice before, like it a lot, rooms are very nice, very clean, had a lot of fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in Vegas!”
Reviews.Author: 1937olds
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel with large suite rooms. Sink in bathroom and one in dressing area. Large floor to ceiling windows with incredable views. Refrigerator, safe and large closet area. Nice sitting area. Good buffets! Great Room rate! 95% oriental clientele---not sure why. Sky show was closed for Christmas. Christmas decorations were non-exhistant except for one tree and dradle in main entrance. Casino is very smoky. Long walk to parking garage. Would prefer to stay on strip even though Rio has very nice rooms. Best Christmas decoartions are at Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “A Different "Side" of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Weston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I vacation in Vegas two or three times a year. We chose the Rio for part of this trip because, being off the Strip, we thought that we could enjoy casinos that we don't usually see. We liked the casino at the Rio, although the Mardi Gras show was closed the entire time that we were there (judging by other reviews here as well, one might conclude that it's permanently dark). We especially liked that the Rio is the only casino in Vegas that has male cocktail servers (probably because of the Chippendales show). Our room was in the Masquerade Tower and was huge, clean and in decent shape. The room was also very sparsely furnished though (bed at one end, one small sofa at the other, desk and television on opposite sides in the middle), giving it an unfortunately cheap feel to it. The slots were loose early in the day and tight in the evening and at night, but that was true of every casino that we visited (by the third day, I had given up on gambling past the afternoon). We spent a lot of time at the Gold Coast (five minute walk) and had a champagne brunch at the Palms (ten minute walk), the best value for money champagne brunch in Vegas. And because we are both enthusiastic walkers, the fifteen minute walk to the strip is nothing for us (and, happily, you no longer have to walk along the road because a new sidewalk has been constructed). We would stay at the Rio again because we go so frequently and liked experiencing a different part of Vegas, but we both agreed that two nights there was enough.

Reviews.Title: “"PRICELESS VIEW OF THE CITY"”
Reviews.Author: Range815
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Rio hotel for one night after staying at the MGM grand. I was in vegas for the weekend and I have to be honest about the Rio. First off, the room was big and spacious. The view from my room alone was "ridiculous". The room we had at the MGM had no view of the city. If you are a person who enjoys views you will love this place. Housekeeping needs to step it up as far as makng their rounds throughout the day. However, whether you are staying at the Rio or not, this is definitely a place you need to visit. The Voodoo Lounge was beautiful. I was soooo scared to go up there because of the name but when I opened the door and stepped out, I never saw something that beautiful in my life. Its on the 50th floor. I am from Brooklyn, NY "Bed- Stuy " so I never get the chance to see anything like that. Their view of the city was amazing. It seemed never-ending. I'm surprised I didn't pass out. My friend and I had plans to check the city out again before we left but we actually stayed in the hotel the entire time. Never left, we stayed in the room for the day looking through the window. The buffet was great and the entertainment in the hotel was funny and good as well. Very Important Advice!!!! Please have transportation to the hotel. DO NOT, I repeat DO NOT try to save getting on the bus. It was ridiculous with the baggage on those stupid escalators. The bus is the best though if you want to see the city and the strip. Seemed like Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cbax31
Reviews.Content: The room and the view were spectacular...what time we spent in the room. My favorite part about this hotel was the lagoon style pool. It's off the strip but a very short taxi ride away. I would stay there again. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Rio 'Rita”
Reviews.Author: GypsyKatt
Reviews.Content: Great buffets, both regular AND seafood...entertaining 'in casino' free shows... convenient shuttle access to the Vegas strip, allowing you an 'off the strip' stay with all the benefits of being ON the strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: adventures60
Reviews.Content: The Rio has excellent rooms (or suites) that have more space than the majority of hotels. It's an exceptionally comfortable room with a very convenient separate area with sink and vanity. The hotel's free show is always entertaining and it's fun to try catching the beads the performers toss out during the show. The casino is not too overcrowded with machines and there are several nice shops. The buffet has slipped since my last visit a few years ago and isn't really special anymore. It's "off the strip" location is a little inconvenient if you want to walk the strip, but they do provide a shuttle to get you there.

Reviews.Title: “Slow check-in but good value”
Reviews.Author: BluDragonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nts/3 days at Rio--conducting a training program. It has all the featrues of the large hotel/casinos in Vegas. I like the variety of resurants (food and price points) that and the 2 Starbucks with easy access. The rooms are updated and in good condition. Regular rooms do not have a coffee maker or flat-screen TVs. The Rio charges $18 (according to meeting attendee) for express coffee to be delivered to your room. The bathrooms have plenty of counter space, good lighting, are quiet, and good quality bedding and pillows. The breakfast and lunch items provided for the conference were all very good and the conference staff were attentive. The first morning of my stay the electricity went out for about 15 minutes and the water in the shower would not warm up. So I took a cold shower and used my iPhone to find my way around the bathroom with the lights went out. I was moved to a suite for the second night--it is very large with 2 rooms with two flat-screen TVs plus a coffee maker. The free Sky party show in the evenings is cheesy at best--very low rent but with enough skin to attract a a crowd but not too much. The Voo Doo lounge has one of the best views of the strip around--great perspective. Go early--before the dancers start, enjoy the view and lack of crowds--or stay and enjoy the dancing. Biggest complaint--be prepared to stand in line when checking in. There was not a time after 4:00pm when there was not at least a 20 minute wait to check-in. This is way too long! Works as advertised--They have easy shuttle service to & from the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: sleighp
Reviews.Content: We had a great time staying at the Rio. I was originally apprehensive about staying at a hotel off the strip, but we really didn't have a problem with the location. We did, however, have a car, so it made getting around easier. When we went out at night the cab rides everywhere were pretty cheap and pretty short in duration. The rooms are HUGE. We were really surprised at the size. Beds were comfortable. Didn't hear any of our neighbors at all. We stayed here for an event and really enjoyed the food/atmosphere. We went to the buffet as well. It wasn't that great. The buffet at the Paris is much better. I didn't have any problems with the cleanliness of the hotel, and I'm usually very finicky when it comes to things being clean. Staff was friendly enough and gambling here was fun. One gripe was the elevators to our rooms ended up being REALLY slow the night of our event. Not sure if they had most of the elevators turned off but it was frustrating to have 15+ people all waiting for one elevator. Other than that though, our stay was great :).

Reviews.Title: “rude and dirty!!”
Reviews.Author: disappointedOhio
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the rio for three days. When arriving to our room it was dirty, Moved to another room same floor and the second room DIRTY!!! Instead of moving rooms again we just asked housekeeping to come amd clean. Most of the emplyes that work there we rude and not helpful at all. They offered special but did not honor them they offered 5.99 breakfast bar during my stay, only the buffett was closed for breakfast during my stay. I can honestly say it was prolbably the worst hotel stay ever!!!

Reviews.Title: “Too far off the Strip for early morning risers.”
Reviews.Author: TitaNui
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the Rio, and we checked in for four nights. The Rio seems intent on getting just a little more money out of you when they can. The very friendly check-in receptionist tried many tricks of the trade to get us to agree to an upgrade: first asking us if a room on an upper floor with a view of the Strip would be o.k., and only later mentioning that it would cost more; engaging us in personal conversation and presenting a document for signature stating that we agreed to an upgrade (even though we had already said, "no"). We had an evening departure flight and they offered a late checkout 4 pm for $40. We declined and were offered a noon checkout time for no additional fees. We were very happy with the "lower floor" room. It was HUGE! While there was no view of the Strip, the view of the mountains and a few lights at night were sufficient. The room was very clean. It was surprisingly quiet at night even though the Rio focuses on entertainment for young adults who are looking for a "good time". (Think Brazil, Rio de Janeiro and Mardi Gras.) There was no in-room coffee maker. When I called to ask why, I was told that the "lower floors" do not have coffee makers - only the "higher floors". We arriived at noon on Thanksgiving Day and found only the buffet open. There were no other options except the very pricey champagne buffet dinner since all of the other restaurants in the hotel were closed. Even on days that other restaurants are open, there are few options for cheaper fare. The cafe is only open until noon or 1 pm, depending on the day of the week. Starbucks seems to be the least expensive dining option available. (They don't accept Starbucks gift cards!) The Rio is located quite a distance from the Strip. Unless you want a good hike, have a car or take the Rio's shuttles (which don't start until 10 am) to their sister hotels/casinos on the Strip, you're stuck. There is no easy way to go Downtown without hiring a taxi. If you are looking for "adult-centered" entertainment and bars, the Rio is for you. There are many more reasonable options for gaming, meals, and entertainment on the Strip. We'll stay there next time.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel equivalent of Wallmart.”
Reviews.Author: CalifJ0e
Reviews.Content: If you like noise in a Casino, and I'm not talking about the usual casino hub-bub, you will love the Rio. If you enjoy hauling your luggage up and down escalators and long distances through crowded gaming areas, the Rio is the place for you. If you don't mind washing your hands with cold water in a rest room (men's at least), no gripe here. The "huevos rancheros" in the breakfast café bore little resemblance to any that you have eaten anywhere. In fairness, the room was large and clean, the staff friendly, and the bed reasonably comfortable. Recognizing that there are always "different strokes for different folks", the Rio was a major disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little dated”
Reviews.Author: Eveleigh
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RIO for 5 days. Rooms are looking a little worn. Room almost clean. Huge Room. Decent for the price we payed. Don't expect top notch. Wasn't as nice as what we heard about it. Noisy (Go car racing in the parking lot started at 8AM daily.) Good Buffet. After staying at the Signature @ MGM it's hard to stay anywhere else. Decent value for your $$$.

Reviews.Title: “good times!”
Reviews.Author: MargueriteR
Reviews.Content: Mmmm A big comfy soft king size bed with no kids..... Anything better? Oh and the gaming is good too and the food was awesome!

Reviews.Title: “The RIO is the best Hotel and Casino”
Reviews.Author: Marmar523
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been coming to the RIO for many years and never had a bad experience. My husband passed away recently and before he passed we were planning our next trip to Vegas and staying at the RIO. In his honor I came out to Vegas and stayed at the RIO by myself. My experience was a wonderful one as always. I felt very safe. I want to thank everyone, especially the woman at the VIP check-in for making my trip a memorable one. The room was outstanding and the service and staff were great. Thank you so very much for everything. I will do this trip every year in honor of my husband. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: chantelgWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend booked a trip through an online company to stay at the rio. Knowing it was off strip we were skeptical but once we went to there site realized that they had shuttles for free so it wasn't a big deal. Well, we tried taking them 3 times. all of which they were full and we had to wait for the next one 30 mins. so total an hour. so we just ended up taking cabs which was alot of extra money. The restaurants were constantly full on the main floor and the food was over priced. If you get the chance to spend alittle bit more money and stay on strip i would suggest that. We will not be going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Viva las vegas”
Reviews.Author: rockabillybetty
Reviews.Content: I went to vegas for the anual rockabilly festival and i love the rio. its clean cheap and has great pools and food. the rooms are big so when you have had enough of whom ever you went with you have space to cool off!!! i love it and when i go next year i will be sure to stay again

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service, Horrible Smell of Smoke throughout”
Reviews.Author: card170
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio for a conference and was very disappointed to say the least! You walk into the hotel and the first thing that hits is you is the smell of smoke. When I checked, they did not have the room that I ordered and didn't care about it either. The entire hotel stunk from smoke! I would definitely NOT recommend this hotel. It was very seedy and low class.

Reviews.Title: “best casino I have stayed at in vegas”
Reviews.Author: danaej
Reviews.Content: The sports book and staff were the best .WAS there for the world series .THE STAFF were excellent ,buffet ok,casino jumping.The dealers were friendly and the voodoo lounge is a must see.THIS IS A ADULT CASINO ONLY.ROOMS were clean and large.This casino is now my casino in vegas

Reviews.Title: “We will be back,but please wash the windows...”
Reviews.Author: orlando3cardpoker
Reviews.Content: We just had our 3rd visit to the Rio. We had a comp 5 days and chose to spend $20 a night for strip view. Room was remodeled and clean inside,but our upgraded strip view was ruined by FILTHY windows on the outside. But we had a great time, very lucky in the casino. As always, we were treated well and felt very appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Wasn't Bad; Wasn't ALL THAT either”
Reviews.Author: chavilicious
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio on 10/29/09. I got one complimentary night. I am not one of those travelers that pick things apart; or will give a horrible review because I had to wait in line at the bathroom; or have an issue with a chip of paint missing from the ceiling. - But for the sake of those who are; I will give my account as accurate as possible. I usually stay in a 5 star hotel, but I wanted to try the Rio because I unterstood it to be a 4 star (and it was free). The first thing I noticed when I walked through the door was the smell of smoke. My snobby review meter went off. I know it is a casino, but when I stay at the Venetian the first thing I smell is Pine sol and invisible people constantly cleaning. Check in: smooth no complaints Room: Shortage in lamp Other than that the room was HUGE and Clean. Loved the sheets. The decor was older, but it would have been worth $60 had I paid for it. Bathroom: Huge, Fabulous, plenty of mirrors, sit down vanity. Loved the mirrors througout the room -a plus. No frills or extras- Dont expect them unless you upgrade of whatever. Some of the people were not very warm and friendly (dealers, staff) but that was just a person or two that I encountered. I am sure there nice people. Front desk people were nice. Overall, It was a decent experence, If you have never been anywhere or have nothing to compare it to; you would problably think it was awesome. If you usually do higher end properties; it is about average. I think its great for the price. If your looking for good accomodations on a budget try the Rio!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Harrah's Service”
Reviews.Author: HarrahsSevenStar
Reviews.Content: Rooms are getting older, staff appear hostile to any question. Harrah's has become like Walmart. Low price, but try to find someone for service good luck

Reviews.Title: “Had a Fabulous Time, Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: garnetca
Reviews.Content: My conference got changed from Caesar's to the Rio and I almost considered not going. Big suprise ! The Rio had the friendlist personnel working there. From the front desk to the maids. The hotel rooms were clean, quite and had very comfortable beds. The slot machines even paid off some. If you go, don't miss the seafood buffet. $40 is steep, but worth every penny. Who ever heard of creme brulee on a buffet line that was the real thing. I only got to eat at 3 other places, but none disappointed. The Rio in the Sky show is a litte risque, but so much fun. The drink people (waiters & waitresses) were around every 10 minutes, so I was never without. The only downside, and it's minor, is the taxi fairs. It's $20 to downtown and $14 to the airport. I will be going back and soon..

Reviews.Title: “conference spot”
Reviews.Author: thetravelinggrandma
Reviews.Content: My husband travelled there to speak. He said that his conference room and the food was very nice for his students. I have read reviews about what others have said on trip advisor, when they said that the Rio's only problem is that it sits far away from the main strip. This is basically true. The rooms are older, but nicely kept up and the added space that you get there simply gives you a feeling of more relaxation. We have seen the shows that they have there with the Las Vegas Gray Line Tours, so we skipped watching their shows at night. We enjoyed playing the slot machines there, as you do with Las Vegas anyway. We simply took a taxi to the strip, though that is probably not the most economical way to do it. It would be very difficult to walk to the strip, because you would have to walk over a very busy highway area. If you are looking for a good spacious room for a nice price, then this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is the Holiday Inn of Vegas”
Reviews.Author: riceland
Reviews.Content: Above average size rooms but with basic ammenties and an off the strip location makes for an ok experience. The pools are not heated and half of them were closed. The resturants were ok but nothing special. If the price is right it is an ok deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: SoCal262
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Rio, we visit Vegas two or three times a year and belong to the Harrah's players club so we chose to stay at the Rio with our comps this time around. I was very pleasantly surprised with the room. We were in the Ipanema tower on the 19th floor and the room was clean and much bigger than we expected, and the fridge is awesome (So many places in Vegas make you jump through hoops to get a fridge in your room or flat out refuse...the fact that it is apparently the standard at the Rio gets a thumbs up from me - gotta have my cold water!) The room we had either had been meticulously cared for over the years or was remodeled at some point because everything seemed new and clean, no spots on the carpet, nice flat screen tv and big closet. Bathroom had vanity area with sink and a mirrored sink by the toilet so my husband and I could get dressed without being in each others way. The Voodoo Lounge on the Roof was pretty much the most awesome thing ever - you take a glass elevator 50 stories up and the bar is half inside and half outside. Unlike other indoor/outdoor clubs the outside portion is really part of the club with the dj, an outside bar and go go dancers, not just a smoking patio like other clubs. Dancing in the open air 50 stories up with a 360 degree view is not to be missed! We ate at the Cafe and the Sports Deli which both had excellent food and service. Remember if you are staying at the Rio it isn't on the strip!! We were aware of this and took the tram with no problem and never had to wait - although on previous trips we have waited for the tram up to 20 mins. The tram runs from the Rio to several locations on the strip until 1 am. The show in the sky is fun and happens pretty frequently in the Masquerade Village area of the casino. One tip I have is if you are planning to stay at the Rio text "rio" to 227466 three days before you go - this gets you discounts like 5.99 buffet, half off penn and teller, etc. They have it advertised there but you get the texts over the course of a 72 hour period and they don't expire for a week so you might as well have them all ready before you go so you can plan accordingly - we received the text about penn and teller about 5 mins before the show started but we were already down at the strip and were kind of bummed because we would have gone if we knew ahead of time we could get half off! You just show your phone to the total rewards booth and they give you the promotion. All in all we had a great time at the Rio - friendly service and great accomodations!

Reviews.Title: “The room was nicer than expected.”
Reviews.Author: sun2kid
Reviews.Content: I didn't realize how off the strip we were. It was approximately 30 mins to walk. They provide a shuttle to Harrah's hotel every 30 minutes but that is still not always convenient. We ended up taking a cab most of the time. This gets costly about $10.00 each way. Just fyi if looking for an inexpensive stay the transportation may be costly to the strip. The swimming pool was adequate but the spa or hot tub services were left to be desired. They need a good cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “All Suites”
Reviews.Author: carrueluvsandiego
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Rio for a weekend in September. We truly enjoy this hotel as all the rooms are suites. You also have a refrigerator in your room which makes it nice as you can bring in items from the convenience store. If you stay on the upper levels you have a great view of the strip at night. Head to the top of the hotel to enjoy a drink with an incredible view. The hotel is located off the strip - but not too worry - it is a short cab ride OR they have shuttles to numerous hotels on the strip. The staff is always very helpful and friendly. There is a pub in the hotel which is a great place to watch football on Sat or Sun. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel will forever be known as the crappy hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcr0132
Reviews.Content: Having been to Vegas many times in the past and having stayed at all different price levels of hotels I was honestly surprised just how bad the Rio was. First of all it needs a major room renovation in order for it to compete with other hotels. YES, these are suite rooms but when the bathroom has mold on the shower curtain and on the tile, the bedroom curtains won't shut completely, and you have to fiddle with the light bulbs every time you try to turn on the lamp it just puts a sour note in your stomach. This would possibly be worth it if the hotel was on the strip, but since you can't even really walk to the strip safely from the hotel (you have to walk over a busy interstate on a narrow sidewalk) it's a disappointment. If you plan to stay over a weekend and honestly don't plan to party all night be planned to be awake anyway as the rooms aren't sound proof and you can hear the Show in the Sky into all hours of the night. The one good thing I found about the hotel is the spa. The receptionist was lovely and gave me a comp to use the workout facilities since I had not used it the day before with my spa treatment. However, $22 dollars seems a little overpriced for the size of the facility (only 2 ellipticals, 2 bikes). Thank god I did not pay for it! It was so windy while I was there that I was unable to use the pool but it looked ok, as did some of the restaurants. For your money there are much better options on the strip especially if you do some research.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is still great”
Reviews.Author: fellowtraveler5852
Reviews.Content: The friendly staff at the Rio makes it stand out. The over sized rooms (suites) make the hotel a better value. It's location off the strip is compensated for by the convenient shuttles and the close walking proximity to Caesars- Bellagio - Paris. The pool area is great and its a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: island_traveler21
Reviews.Content: The Rio is a great hotel that is off strip. My husband and I traveled for a bowling tournament in Las Vegas. We decided to stay at the Rio as a group. This was one of the best decisions we made. Since the Rio is off strip it makes travel so much easier than if you were to be on strip. We rented a car for the week and used it to visit the Hoover Dam, Red Rock Canyon, and the Grand Canyon - as well as to get to the bowling center. For the long trips the rental was great. We decided that since we split the rental with another couple we would be able to go to the strip via a taxi. Also a great decision! Do not attempt to drive on the strip. Spend the few dollars that it takes to get from the Rio to the Strip or even cheaper take the bus that goes back and forth all day and night. Rio Suites: We had a fabulous room with an amazing view (floor to ceiling windows). It has a very large with a separate bathroom / bedroom and a separate living area. Rio Casino: A very large and nicely laid out. The tables and machines are not on top of each other so it is a comfortable setting. Rio Spa: One of the best I have ever been to!! Amazing!!! Rio Buffet: HUGE! This is a must when in Vegas even if you are not staying here. It is expensive so be prepared but it is worth every penny. Rio Rooftop Lounge: Again even if you are not staying at this hotel GO and see the views of the Strip. It is breathtaking!! And they mix a mean drink. Overall this is an amazing off the strip hotel. It has all the flair of Las Vegas without the hassle of being on the Strip. But defiantly go to the Strip and walk up and down the streets to see the amazing buildings! The Rio has everything and more to offer defiantly do not over look this one because it is off the strip!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Seen from Start to Finish”
Reviews.Author: ssambsnk
Reviews.Content: Started with a 45 minute wait to check in...this at 7:00 at night with only 15 or so folks in line in front of me--only three open windows. Room was poor--old, shabby, looked the same as the room I had 15 years ago on a previous visit--right down to the carpet. Service was average, location is the worst of both worlds...too far from the Strip to be an easy and fun walk, close enough to get all the traffic and noise issues. Even leaving is painfull. At checkout I was told the system was down but a copy of my bill would be e-mailed to me. E-mail never came so I called. You can't talk to the RIO directly, they are part of the Harrah's combined accounting center. THis center will not talk to you (only e-mail) and requires 3-5 DAYS to respond to any inquiry. ANYWHERE but the RIO next time.

Reviews.Title: “The biggest rooms in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: shasta714
Reviews.Content: Beautiful large rooms with couch and table. 27 inch tv. we counted with our feet 18 x 18 foot room. Refrigerator in room a vegas rarity. double sinks with toilet and tub in another room. no fogged up mirrors. fun show in sky free. I didn't like that was no food court for late night treats. Great pools-four of them with sand and a waterfall in one.There is a free shuttle that takes you to the strip and Harrahs casino. Can walk across the street to Gold Coast Casino and the Palms casino.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Wolfluver
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the worst service in the area! I was injured and unable to walk more than a few steps at a time. My husband was there on business so I was to meet him at the hotel. I was ignored by all staff, refused access to a wheelchair and could not get assistance getting my luggage to my room. We finally found a place to rent a wheelchair (with NO assistance from hotel staff) and decided to visit the casino. Children were running around on the casino floor, not one waitress offered to take our drink order the entire time we were there and when my husband called a slot attendent to watch his machine so he could help me his money and the attendant disappeared! Managment did not give a hoot when we reported this so the Rio and any other Harrah's owned property will never see a dime of my money again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great views, close to strip”
Reviews.Author: Hidishere
Reviews.Content: We stay at Harrah's properties quite often and our favorite, in Las Vegas, is the RIO. The suites are spacious and the beds very comfortable. The Ipanema Tower is newer and more spacious but we like the Masquerade Tower also. We haven't had the problem with shuttle service because we either drive or rent a car but check out the limo service from the airport, it isn't that much more than a cab and no hassles. The RIO is within walking distance to the strip but you find out that staying at a strip hotel is very hectic to say the least. The RIO is also noted for having one of the BEST seafood buffet's in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “great steaks”
Reviews.Author: neondetroit
Reviews.Content: rio is a really nice place to stay and is very affordable the room is really big. if you buy an upgrade you can get a really nice view of the strip or if you're too low to the ground you might have a view of the airconditioners so just ask to be moved up a few floors for the regular price. theres a shuttle to the strip that runs till 1am for free to paris and harrahs. the steaks at the all american are the best and not too expensive.there a nicer dining room in the back to relax. i'm returning in november

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Okay Location”
Reviews.Author: drjones5212
Reviews.Content: The rooms of the Rio All Suite hotel were very large and easily slept 3 large adults. The finishes in the room were a bit dated, but were acceptable for the price. The off strip location was a slight negative, but the free shutle to the Paris/Harrah's made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, staff not that friendly”
Reviews.Author: quickwonc
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the rio several times. This trip we did not have as nice of room, same requested but was older style in the room. We switched rooms the next day and it was worse. Later during our week long stay, security stopped my husband, and told him he was being held to check his id, he looked suspicious. I went to security and asked what it was all about and they found the security person who stopped him and said he looked like someone they previously threw out. My husband said when they held him they wouldnt tell him why and came back and said, ok you can go. Iwas very upset they never even said to him, sorry mistaken for someone else. The lady security who was with the male guard who stopped him stood there laughing at him when he asked them why they stopped him. Will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sleepowers
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the RIo when it was brand new, and then a second time a few years later. We loved it then, and loved it now. The food at the Voodoo restaurant was outstanding, pricey, but outstanding. The food at the World Buffet was outstanding also. We also dined at the All American Grill - had hamburgers, and they again were outstanding. The bars were very attractive however also a bit pricey. We received a 2 for 1 coupon book which helped greatly on the costx of food and beverages. The room was really great, we had an end suite which had a view of the north and the strip. It was amazing. Loved every minute of it and would go back in an instant. We also went to the Stratosphere to see what it was like and we were very well surprised by the cleanliness and total appearance, great shops and cool restaurants. Didn't go up to the top as it was a very windy couple of days, but would go back again to do that.

Reviews.Title: “The Masquarde suite is AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: RhondaSue57
Reviews.Content: I booked a regular suite and then asked to upgrade to the Masquarde suite. 1600 sq ft of wall to wall windows from floor to ceiling!! 180 deg view of Vegas!!! At night while laying in the fabulous jacquizzi I had a view of the Vegas strip at night!! In the dining room, seated at the 5 seat dining room table I had a view of the mountains and could watch the planes take off! The suite had a coffee maker and refrig and wet bar. (The regular suites dont have coffee makers) If you stay in the Masquarde Towers, as soon as you get out of the elevator area, to the left there is a coffee/pastry shop. VERY reasonable prices too. The sandy beach pool with waterfalls was incredible! However be forewarned, that the unheated pools are freezing!! Even on 101 deg day, no one could stay in the unheated pools!! At the pool snack area, a fountain drink was less then 3 bucks and you could get FREE refills!!! My only negative about the Rio is that they still have the big, old tube type TV's. In my suite I only had 2 TV's, but then again I never watched them. Flat screens would have been nice, but it would make the prices go up! Taxi fare to the strip was only 7 bucks (WITHOUT TIP!) But their free shuttle would take you to Bally/Paris or Harrah's for free every 30 minutes. The Masquarde suites are also VERY QUIET!! Only the dining room connects to the next room. And the bed was soooooooo wonderfully comfortable!! ALSO, there is a large half bath area in living room.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nanyourtravelman
Reviews.Content: Rio rooms were very large and had a sitting area to watch televisons, staff were friendly and there were lots of shows offered and lots of restaurant choices

Reviews.Title: “NOT GOING BACK”
Reviews.Author: cinwise
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 years ago and enjoyed it enough to return. It just seemed not to hit the spot for us this time. Our favorite pub the Tilted Kilt was gone.. and replaced with load music and chairs I didn't feel safe in. We were not informed on one night of 2 that the power was going to be shut off. We were going to get up very early and had set our alarm clock to get up...so besides it being dangerously dark to try to find your way to the bathroom, were woke up again with a start when the power came back on and the radio was blasting us awake!! We were not very happy to have the toilet break and quit flushing one morning also. It seemed like there was no place to eat after 11 pm. The prices for the buffet meals seemed always higher then many others around town. We had some credit to use on Sat. and were just going to get the regular breakfast buffet (which their info packet said would be available) but now they only serve the expensive champagne brunch instead which is $10 more per head. We were sat at the most far end...butter was not next to the rolls, the gravy was thinner then the syrup, the hostest did not tell up about the omelet bar being clear at the other end...anyway we were not downing any champagne at 8 in the morning to make up for it. We rented a car this time. If you can it makes it easier and less expensive to get around. The first thing we did the next day was go out and buy water. they really gouge you for the water...2.50 or $4 for one bottle. MAYBE THE RIO IS FOR THE YOUNGER ONES THAT LIKE ALL THE NOICE, SMOKE AND VOO DOO LOUNGE...but this is one couple who will not be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Had A Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: GerrySteele
Reviews.Content: I loved this Hotel room! It was large and spacious! I was disturbed by next door neighbors who partied all night, but other than that I loved it and highly recomment a stay at the RIo!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Rocks”
Reviews.Author: granstar53
Reviews.Content: My feeling is that you could stay at Rio for a week or two and not run out of things to do because there is so much variety in entertainment,food, fun and leisure!
