All American Bar & Grill – You can either sit in the bar area or in the restaurant (where the prices are more expensive). We chose the restaurant each time – very nice. Fabulous food and service. The steaks are out of this world! You are also given fresh bread and butter before your meal and this is gorgeous too – though does fill you up!! Lots of people were taking doggy bags away with them. Each steak is served with fresh veg and choice of potato – all delicious. Carnival World Buffet - Tried this for breakfast, brunch and dinner. Breakfast is by far the best time to visit. Fresh fruit, smoked salmon, tea/coffee, freshly made to order omlettes, bacon and eggs –gorgeous. There is everything you could wish for and some items that are a bit strange for brekkie – such as tacos (?) and oodles of deserts & icecream. Brunch (after 11am) was a bit disappointing as all the breakfast items disappear to be replaced with Chinese and Mexican etc. Dinner was much of the same – with everything you could wish for. I loved this buffet. I miss it like mad!! Sao Paulo Café – Had the two egg breakfast here and was disappointed. I ended up thinking that I should have gone to the buffet instead. Ate lunch here twice – both times excellent. The chicken noodle soup is gorgeous. They do freshly fired spit roasted chickens, which are lovely. Big portions, but not outfacing. Room service -Had this once due to my hangover from the Voodoo Lounge. Very nice. Food delivered in 45 minutes and was nicely presented and hot. Had the chicken noodle soup again and a club sandwich. No complaints. Voodoo Lounge Unbelievable. If you are staying at the Rio then visit here at least once. The views are unrivalled. We arrived at 7pm so were lucky enough to see the view in the daylight and after dark. The atmosphere is amazing. I would definitely go back here. We were lucky enough not to have to pay for drinks (free bar) so I can’t comment on the price of drinks I’m afraid. It is an amazing place. You get in a lift and you go so high – its exhilarating. Casino Yes, it is noisy and smoky. The free show gets tired pretty quickly – not too much to do here really. The gaming floor is always busy. We didn’t gamble much – I learnt to play Craps over at the Gold Coast (which is just over the road to the Rio) $5 minimum verses $25 at Rio – I know which I prefer! It’s a terrific game and we made so much money! They should definitely start this up in the UK! What I did think was amusing at the Rio is the “bevertainers” ie the waiters/waitresses who have to sing on podiums scattered around at intervals. Its very embarrassing for them – their outfits are also very scant – they must be freezing as the air con is pretty strong! Shuttle Excellent. Never waited more than 10 minutes. There are three different shuttles to Caesars, Ballys and Paris I think. Very good service. The hotels distance from the main strip wasn’t an issue at any time as these shuttles were fantastic and saved us a fortune in taxis. Overall the Rio was a lot better than I expected after reading these reviews. If our view had been of the Strip then I would have loved my stay. It is never going to be comparable to the likes of the Wynn – it is too old and dated, but the price is very reasonable as the rooms are huge – with the exception of the bathroom! Having visited MGM & Mandalay Bay & Bellagio etc – at least the Rio isn’t as busy as these hotels, it would drive me mad having to wade through crowds all the time. Enjoy your trip – I’m very jealous - and bet hard eight for me! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good Times at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: trip14
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Rio Suite Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas. Even with a line of people at check in, we were in our room with very little wait time. The room was clean and well maintained. The maid service was all that we would expect. The food selections was as good as any we have had in Las Vegas with lots of choices to chose from. This is the first time we stayed at a hotel off the Las Vegas Strip. We had no problems moving about, getting to and from the major strip locations. The Rio is a fun spot with alots of different things going on. I would recommend this hotel for it price and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Listen to the Others!”
Reviews.Author: travelchic91
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what the other reviewers' trips were like, as I wasn't there, but MY STAY WAS INCREDIBLE! The rooms were huge, clean and we had an awesome view over the strip which just added to the overall "True Vegas" ambience of the Rio. As it was a very popular casino, I didn't personally have much interaction with the staff, but when we arrived (there were dozens of us) thye greeted us warmly and made sure that we knew EXACTLY where we were going. Although, I admit, my trip was 2 years ago, I am SURE that nothing could have changed that much. The pools are amazing and the nightly shows were lots of fun. Despite what people say about it being a fair way off the Strip, true it isn't directly ON it, but seriously, 10 minute Taxi ride (at the MOOOOOST) and you're in the heart of it. I recommend it 100% Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel none off-strip better”
Reviews.Author: mgmfan
Reviews.Content: Once I saw the hotel on the website I thought it looked kind of junky due to the red and purple lights but this would have been better than the palms. So I checked out their rooms theyr'e nice suites so then I booked. When I got there parking was OK I had to park at the top. When I got in the check-in line was empty only three people stood in line.After I checked in I decided to check out the casino but I barely missed the free show in the sky. I went up to my room it was nice but it wasn't really a suite to me I thought it would have two TV's but who cares it's just me in the room. For dinner I went to try the Buffet there was a huge line waiting outside but Iv'e heard good things about it so I stood in line. This buffet wasn't what I expected it to be. I think people like it because of the lobster. Anyways, I think the buffet is overrated.Woke up next morninggot ready and went down for some breakfast at the cafe. It was good just like any other breakfast cafe. I went over to the strip I checked out the Venetian Gorgeous I have never any hotel like this in my life. Next, I went over to Bellagio to see the fountains its better to watch it night cause the fountains are a lot more visible at night.So I went back to the hotel to take a rest in my room. When I woke up I went to see Mystere that show is a must-see. After the show I wanted to see Sirens of TI but there was a huge crowd and you could not even see the performers in sight. After, I went next door to eat at the mirage's cafe it was good again just like any other cafe. I checked out of the hotel and drove back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Hate the Rio”
Reviews.Author: RoomNotReady
Reviews.Content: I advised reservation that I going to arrive around 10 pm, however, due to the lateness of the flight I arrived at 2 am on the following morning. When I arrived at the hotel the room was not ready and the staff including the manager on duty could not provide a reasonable explanation as to why. There were also other customers complaining about their rooms. I was told I could wait for about 1 hour and a half until the room was ready or go to another hotel. I was finally able to get in the room at ten minutes after 4 am. There were several large conventions in town and they knew there were no other rooms available. Further, who would want to go looking for a room at 2am when the room you reserve should have been ready. I attempted to contact the general manager and was told he would give me a call. I am still waiting for that call. I wrote a letter to corporate management and I am still waiting to get a response. I have been waiting for about two months now. Poor customer service was just the beginng of my bad experience at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelingduo01
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 6/17 thru 6/21, booked thru U.S. Airways vacations, standard room, everything went smooth with flights Arrived at the Rio around 11am, we had the valet park the car and bellman store the bags, both were super friendly and made us feel welcome, A GOOD SIGN FROM THE GET GO We went to the front desk to try and check in, we were met by a nice woman who informed us that our room was not ready and to check back around 1pm, not a problem, she took all the required info and asked if we had any requests, i asked for a king bed, strip view, smoking and a high floor, she entered this into the computer and we were off to explore this huge resort. We returned about 12:45 and dealt with the same woman who remembered my name and informed us that all our requests were honored and we were off to the 30th floor masquerade tower. ( I did tip her after all was said and done) and she was very appreciative. The room was awesome and everything was in great shape, we were thrilled. The view was quite impressive and the room was huge We are not buffet fans so no comment there. We ate at the All American Bar and Grille three times, very happy all three times, I had the King Prime Rib one night, it was huge and cooked to perfection, one of the best I have ever had The pool area was huge and one of the nicest i have seen, NEVER a problem finding a lounge chair no matter what time we arrived. Casino slots were not the loosest, The show in the sky was fun but got old after three or fout times but it livens the place up. We went to the VooDoo Lounge for drinks and had a blast, great views and worth checking out I have concluded that after reading reviews here that you can't please all the people all the time but i will state that we were treated like royalty from everyone at the RIO from maids, valets, bellmen, front desk and waitstaff, a job well done by all WE WILL RETURN

Reviews.Title: “A shadow of its former self...”
Reviews.Author: orac2
Reviews.Content: The last time I stayed at the Rio in 2002 I was quite impressed with the rooms and the service; for a long time the Rio was struggling in its off-strip location and they made up for it with a friendly, can-do attitude and extra perks. Unfortunately it looks like the Rio has abandoned this strategy and treats you like any other strip hotel which is a really dumb thing to do since they are not on the strip. Where should I start: 1) The casino is unbelievably loud. Having to practically yell while checking in/out at the front desk (and having the front desk persons yelling back at you) is not exactly a good first & last impression. There is not necessarily good music blaring from every direction. 2) We initially had a 5th floor room in the Masquerade Tower. The casino was so loud we could hear the thump-thump of the music all night long which kept us awake. We had to switch to a new room on the 31st floor to get away from the noise. 3) The LodgeNet Internet access (which costs $10/day) was on-again, off-again the whole time we were there. My day job is a network engineer and is was NOT my laptop or my network setup. 4) One of the best things the Rio ever did for itself was establish a free shuttle between the Rio and a couple of strip hotels. The drivers now ask to scan your players card if you ride it. Why? One of the drivers said that the Rio is contemplating discontinuing the free shuttle service. DUMB MOVE. Also the shuttle is not 24x7 anymore, it only runs from 10:00am to 1:00am. If you're still on the strip after 1:00am it is time to pay for a cab back to the Rio, I found this one out the hard way. 5) The rooms are big but most of the space in the room is empty with few furnishings. The decor of the rooms and hotel common areas are definitely starting to show their age and are in desperate need of an update. The 3 pools are nice but sometimes 1 or more are roped off. People were going in the closed pools anyway and getting yelled at by the hotel staff. 6) My wife and I gamed for an average of 6 hours a day for 3 days with our players cards at the Rio-affiliated hotels Paris and Bally's. We didn't play at the Rio at all due to the noise and obnoxious minimum bet levels. When it came time to check out and redeem our points we got a whopping $28 off our hotel bill. Gee thanks. Also finding a $10 table for any game is a chore, $15 is the norm and I didn't see a $5 table the whole time I was there. Stay somewhere on the strip for the same price or less as the Rio is not worth it anymore. I'm sure they will continue to profit off their past reputation for awhile (hey it worked with me), but they are definitely going downhill fast...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: Amaker1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel on a golf trip to Vegas in February. I liked everythign about it. It is a little older of a hotel and not on the main strip but that is okay with me. The bar on the 50th floor , Voo-Doo Lounge, was exciting too. I am a big city guy so the excitement of the hotel and Vegas were good for me. I recommend this hotel to stay in Vegas. You have all the amenities you need.

Reviews.Title: “Not good”
Reviews.Author: granny2oregon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from Las Vegas yesterday. We had reservations for 4 nites at the Rio. We picked the Rio as my girlfriend and her husband had stayed there many times and loved it. However, it was a number of years ago. We hated it! It was very loud in the casino. The room that we were given was in the old tower. It was large and clean however ,very, very out dated. The beds need to be replaced and there was black tape wrapped around the window to prevent the air from coming in. We go to Vegas to gamble and was very distracted by the noise and the above show that seemed to go constantly. We picked up the phone that very nite and moved to Ceasers the next morning. In all fairness, the staff was nice and polite, the pool area looked nice (we don't do water ) and the buffet was very good. If you want a young, loud party atmosphere and don't really care about your room it would be okay. We'll stick with Ceasers.

Reviews.Title: “Old outdated over-rated rooms, poor rest. service”
Reviews.Author: GQue
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for three nights in May27-30. -Pd for Stripview,. More like mt other bldging view. -Stayed in newest tower but felt like room was 20 yrs old. Same as other trip comments. Old furniture, stained carpets, decor very odd and mix matched. Didn't feel clean. Broken toilet , blown out light bulbs when first got to rm. So much for quality checks. - They had the nerve to have some pools closed. claimed not enough lifeguards. Jaccuzi's didn't wk. at the pool they steered you to. - Buffets very disorganized and overpriced for wait and service. -60min+ Many food items bland or just room temp, not hot. - Was going to stay at Bellagio fountainview rm, passed up for this. OUCH...

Reviews.Title: “Good experience, great pool”
Reviews.Author: travelreviewer023
Reviews.Content: My favorite thing about this hotel was the awesome pool. I am very picky about pools and how clean they are before I get in. I couldn't wait to get into this pool each day. We were in Vegas for a conference for work and the conference was at the Rio. The only complaint I had was that they nickle and dime you for everything you need for the conference (for example, internet service, fees to move equipment into conference rooms, etc.). I am not sure if this is the hotel's fault or the conference's fault. The Rio is located off the strip which is the only possible negative I can think of, but they have a shuttle that will take you to the strip so that wasn't a problem. The restaurant in the hotel had great food at prices better than I expected. The VooDoo lounge on the roof was awesome. Although we were charged a $20 cover and then found out that friends that went up right before us didn't have to pay the cover. The rooms were larger than a standard hotel room, very clean, and nicely decorated. If I ever go back to Vegas, I will probably stay at this hotel. We got a conference rate of $149 per night for the room...this is a great price, but I have a feeling that it is normally more. See review for Luxor, which we were not pleased with.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: LtColBuckRobley
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Rio Sunday night May 27. We weren't able to do airport check-in because we flew into terminal 2 at McCarran. The hotel was booked solid, so we were given a room on the fifth floor of the Masquerade Tower. Not real happy with the limited view, but all 4 nights were comped so I wasn't complaining. The rooms are huge, ours was clean and I loved the separate vanity and toilet areas. Maid service was more than satisfactory. Rooms having a fridge were nice. Shuttle service to the strip was excellent and I found the casino easy to navigate. Bell service was excellent and it was easy to get a cab to the airport and when we went downtown. Be aware table limits are VERY HIGH. I saw very few tables with as low as a 15 dollar minimum and 25 dollars was the rule at night. Gold Coast across the street has low limits. My wife and I enjoyed the huge pool area and it was not difficult to get a chair. We ate at the Sports Kitchen (Grade C), Sao Paulo Cafe (A-), Tilted Kilt (B-), and All American Grill (A). The cocktail service at the poker bars and on the floor was generally excellent. And those cocktail waitresses are, shall we say, easy on the eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Weary_Traveler_LA
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Rio because my husband was attending a small orthopaedic conference held in their meeting space. I booked through the hotel itself about four months ago to capitalize on the conference rate of $142/night. Over the seven nights we stayed the rate ranged from $109-$299/night. I asked for my standard "non-smoking King bed on a quiet floor." When we arrived we were put in a room with two double beds because we were told no King Rooms were available but they would move us the following morning. We essentially "checked out" the following morning and were moved to a room on the third floor overlooking the dumpsters which were emptied at 3 AM. My husband who was attending the conference from 7 AM-6 PM asked again for a room on a quieter floor. We were told "the hotel is full." (The shopping center convention was in town with 60,000 people filling up most of the rooms in town). However, they did let us "check out" again and after 1 PM assigned us to another room without so much as an apology. The new room was not an upgrade either, it was just 11 floors up. The rooms were not particularly outstanding although they are large (the all-suite hotel), the neon lighting of the outside of the building is downright scary at night. Housekeeping is spotty as they seemed to only vacuum every couple of days despite obvious crumbs (is this to protect the environment somehow?) and they were very stingy with the towels. There were a lot of extra expenses at the Rio including $10 for the first ten minutes of internet use, $22/day for a small crowded fitness room. The valet service, however, was prompt and always asked if we needed directions. And like all of Vegas it was free. (Except for tipping which is expected). The shuttle service to the Strip (rest of civilization) was prompt and reliable and a relief for putzing around town when I didn't want to get the car out. Also, it was free. The seafood buffet was tasty but the Sushi restaurant was subpar and you got a lot of the smoke and noise from the casino area. The "Masquerade in the Sky" was downright cheesy. The casino areas were exceptionally smoky day and night. When these areas were full they were quite loud as well. Overall, as a not gambling, non-clubbing visitor to Vegas I would not recommend the Rio if you want a quiet tasteful luxury hotel. With all of the great properties in Vegas the Rio doesn't compete. Stay somewhere else if you don't want to be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: GulfCoastFilly
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Rio for two nights (May 2nd & 3rd) as one of our stops on a cross-country car trip. While checking in, we were asked if we had stayed at the hotel before. We responded that we had not, but that we had selected the Rio because of high recommendations we had received from several friends who had and were very pleasantly surprised to be told we were being upgraded from the standard suite we had booked to a premium suite in the Masquerade Tower on the 38th floor with a great view and parking in the covered garage. The spacious, spotlessly clean and tastefully decorated accommodations were sooo nice; two queen beds with the most comfortable mattresses, a selection of four different fluffy pillows (including down) for each bed, high quality sheets and duvets, a full living-room area with a large TV, fridge, coffeemaker, separate dressing area and in-room safe. The real coffee mugs (as opposed to foam cups) and real glasses for drinks (as opposed to the usual thin plastic) were appreciated, right down to the napkins and coasters, which were a nice touch. We were slightly disappointed with the seafood buffet only as concerned the "lobster" offered. The quantity available was sufficient, but the quality was lacking. All were soft shelled, which resulted in the claws containing mostly liquid with a miniscule amount of meat; and the tails contained a small sliver of dry meat. There was, however, an otherwise excellent selection and supply of offerings that were nicely prepared and presented. To a person, every employee with whom we had contact was pleasant, cheerful and gracious with their assistance. We would definitely stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: AusTwo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Rio's with some friends. The rooms are huge, and I mean huge. I have never seen rooms of this size before, nor could I get over the price we paid, it was only around $70. We were up on the 32nd floor, and the windows could certainly do with a wash and scrub, they were filthy. Yes, it is definitely one of the older hotels, but it was still a comfortable place to stay. The free shuttle buses to Caesar's were fantastic, as they ran until the small hours of the morning. The checkin area was loud, as it was literally in the middle of the casino. The cigarette smoke was not pleasant either. Thank goodness we had non smoking rooms. The breakfast was a everything and anything you wanted. Would I stay here again? Probably not, I would stay somewhere on the strip itself next time, as Rio's is just off the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Gone Downhill--disappointing and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: nred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIo a couple of times several years ago, and loved it. Now, a once great buffet has skyrocketed in price and gotten mediocre, everything is extra ($10 to use the Business Center for a few minutes and $30 to use the fitness center for a day) and the service has gone downhill. The Rio is not as well located as the other hotels on the strip (they run a shuttle bus to the strip), so with the downgrades the place is no longer worth it. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is just OK”
Reviews.Author: Ukiahdds
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked into the Rio on May 2 for a conference and some relaxation. My first impression was good. It is a fine looking structure and although not on the strip, close enough to insure a little less congestion. The check in process, however, gave me a different slant on where our stay was going. The Valet parking attendant (just this one, fortunately) was rude and not much help. I was instantly recognized inside as not a heavy gambler, which is the kind of clientel these hotels naturally prefer, and given what I believe was a substandard suite. The room was large, but not a suite at all, just one large room with no seperate bedroom. We had an outstanding view of some mountains 20 miles away and the roof of the casino. I called to inquire about upgrading my room, and was told it would cost another $150 to $250 a night to do so, so we decided to stay put. The bathroom is quite small for a modern hotel, and the bed also not up to modern standards. In fact, the whole hotel seemed a bit run down, making me wonder if Harrah`s is thinking of selling it. After our first bad experience, the hotel staff was very nice. The food in the restaurants was good, especially the buffet. Check-out was easy and our room was kept very clean. In conclusion, it seems to me that the Rio, as with most Vegas hotels, charges too much for what you get. If attracting gamblers is their objective, perhaps they should leave them a little more money to do it with. A solid C for the Rio, and only that good because after looking around town, it`s not so bad.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is SOOOO tired”
Reviews.Author: computerdeals
Reviews.Content: Just stay at one of the newer properties - the rooms at the RIO are huge but the decor and style is so 80's they also have 2 of those awful buffet's where the only thing missing is serving the food in troughs

Reviews.Title: “An OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: dc_gooner
Reviews.Content: The Rio is average. I only stayed there because I attended a conference in the hotel. It's cheaper than other places, but you get what you pay for. If you're on a budget I guess it's alright. Room was huge, but I don't necessarily need all that space for one person. I had a great view of the desert mountains. Food at the seafood buffet was good. '$35 good' I'm not sure, but it was good.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: sykesy116
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio with friends during the first week of April. Check-in was easy and we were able to get into the room before 11 am. We were given a room on the 19th floor of the Ipanema tower, which was huge (2 queen beds, and a sofa and chairs) and more than we expected for $100/night. The shuttle to the strip was really helpful if you don't mind waiting a bit. The pool area was great and there were tons of waitresses to bring you drinks. We also enjoyed the wold buffett at lunchtime the day we checked out - great selection for the price and there were even $5 off coupons in the magazine in the room. I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: winniway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I expected a big room, nice pool area and a fairly nice hotel - we got a really good bargain deal so it didn't have to be that fantastic to meet my expectations, however it really did - and more, the bed was very comfortable, tub was big for soaking, big TV and the service was actually very good - polite and helpful. Close to getting an excellent from us, but just a couple of annoyances - refridgerator was barely cold, at 3:30am the first night loud banging/knocking woke us up and went on for several min. what the heck it was I have no idea, sounded like someone bouncing a golf ball on the floor above us, it never happened again. Too many loud and splashing kids, jumping into the hot tub from the rocks - come on they aren't even supposed to be in the hot tub under 12 and don't bring them in when they are 3! This one 3 year old almost puked right in the jaccuzi. It is too hot for them. OK, so you can tell we don't have kids, but if you do, this is probably a good place they will like with 5 pools, 5 spas and a very tolerant atmosphere. Plenty of nice towels and chairs. Decent food. Not too smoky in the casino, but didn't win in slots. Attentive drink getters/ wait staff. We would go back again for sure because we did have a good time and it was clean and comfortable - if you get a bargain it is totally worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time!!”
Reviews.Author: Navilla
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for a Convention and also vacation. We loved our stay!! Pros: *Pretty Hotel *Free shuttle to Cesars Palace, Harrah's, and Bally's *Lots of shops *Friendly staff. Everyone we encountered was very nice and helpful *Safe in the room *Large rooms, comfy beds, big bathroom, great water preassure, mini-fridge *Lots of food choices in various price ranges *Great pools *Very nice convention facilites Cons: *Off strip *Very smokey in the lobby *Pool and hot tubs close at 5pm *Workout room is in the Spa, which requires a $22/day pass to use ******The hotel will authorize the ENTIRE amount due when you check in, PLUS a $100/night security deposit. If you are using your credit card, they will authorize it, but not charge it until you check out. If you use a debit card, that amount is charged and the security deposit refunded once you check out, bu may take a few days. This is important to note if you are using all one card at the hotel and for expenses.****** Note: You can check in at the Harrah's desk at the airport. It is near the baggage claim. We walked right up to the desk and had a hassle free check in. When we got to the hotel, there was a huge line at the check in desk. We waved to all the people waiting as we went right to our room!!!! If you check in at the airport, they will offer you a shuttle to the hotel for $8.00/person. Don't buy tickets from them. You just need to walk out the door to the shuttle and it will only be $5.50/person at the Showtime Shuttle window. (It is the same shuttle.) You may want to consider a cab, though, as long as it's not rush hour. The shuttle ride will take about an hour. There are many stops to make, and the Rio is the last one. The cab ride is about 15 minutes and will cost maybe $15. We liked the Rio very much and will certainly stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal and awesome pool!”
Reviews.Author: healingfeeling
Reviews.Content: We stayed here memorial day monday and tuesday night into wednesday. We payed only $49 per night, it was a "hot deal" on their website. We really enjoyed the pool during the day, there are like 4 different pools and the hot tubs were nice too, one of them had a waterfall. There are cocktail waitresses every where you look by the pool and we really enjoyed quite a few pina coladas! The pool grill is also great and not over priced. The rooms at the rio are not posh like at Mandalay Bay or the Venetian, but they are HUGE! There is shuttle service to Ceasar's and Harrah's so that pretty much gets to onto the strip and you can walk right across to the Palms or Gold Coast if you're just in it for the gambling. The voodoo lounge is at the top of the casino and we saw an episode some dating show that is on MTV being filmed, so that was cool and the view from the outdoor portion of the Voodoo lounge was fantastic. Beware of the glass elevator though if you're afraid of heights, it took me by suprise.

Reviews.Title: “An okay place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: joeyelbows
Reviews.Content: The Rio is an okay place to stay, but it is in the shadows of the Palms. I found most of their free shows corny and in the end unnecessary. I stayed in the Ipanema tower and the rooms were not quite as spacious as I had suspected. The water was also out on the first night. We never really seemed to get maid service in the 4 days we were there either. The pool service an cabana rentals were great. The Prince show was unbeatable. The food selection was just mediocre and the Bar's could definitely be better. The voodoo lounge is a fun club but IBar needs to be open after hours. My friend got our room comped so the price was right, but there are some places in vegas that can literally blow you away, but this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “RIO is the Way to Go in VEGAS”
Reviews.Author: blondGirlConnecticut
Reviews.Content: I love the Rio, it is the only Hotel i will stay at in Vegas. I have been to vegas more then 10 times and have stayed at a couple others on the strip, like Tropicana, MGM, Mirage and none compare to the Rio. The service is excellent, the rooms are clean and spacious and you cant beat the view!!! The pool area is clean and very pretty, there are 4 pools to chose from (one even islike sitting on the beach) and like 6 or so hot tubs scattered throughout, You have to go up to the Voodoo Lounge and have a "witch doctor" best cocktail in Vegas for sure and again you cant beat the view while sipping in a witch doctor. Next there is a spectcular show in the sky that happens once an hour throughout the day and you have to check all of them as they do i think 3 different ones, the costumes, music and bead throwing is really a site to see. The Rio has many different places to eat, it all depends on your taste but you will be sure to find sometime you like! Then they provide a shuttle service to other Harrah Properties in Vegas, its very convient. I would suggest the Rio for anyone regardless of age who likes to have a good time, if you are looking for quiet this is not the place to stay....I will be going back again soon

Reviews.Title: “Displeased”
Reviews.Author: okamatrav
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we gave the agent a tip and asked if he could secure something high and with a strip view. I would think they would be more incline to help since tips are slim at the front desk. The agent was a supervisor and gave us a room on the 4th floor looking atop the roof and having the kitchen exhaust coming up and what a horrible smell that was. Being that close to the room sent a horrible aroma into the room. It smelled nasty and a quick call down to complain about the smell and they said leave the room for a hour and they would send someone to the room and air it out. WHAT A LIE!!! The Room smelled worst. The agent was just full of it. He told us that he is setting us up in a VIP wing and that we would love the room. Man if this is room is the VIP wing I wonder how the other wings look and smell like. I would advise not to try tipping your way to a good room here. The agent was nice but obviously had it in for us even when we tipped him before he started checking us in. After a full night of complaining they finally moved us to another room which was way nicer. It looked like to was newly remodeled and had a strip view. Be sure to not accept a room on the low floors here the smell from the exhaust is horrible

Reviews.Title: “What a great room”
Reviews.Author: bothofusluv2travel
Reviews.Content: The Rio Hotel and Casino in Las Vegas has all large suits. Our suit was beautifuly decoratedl. It had two comfortable large queen size beds, a couch, two very comfortable stuffed chairs, a coffee table, end table, dresser and a desk. It had a huge closet that went almost the width of the room. It also had a large flat screen TV that could be adjusted to be viewed from any position in the room. Natrually it had cable and PPV as well. This room was very large with a large bathroom and a foyer leading to the bathroom with another sink. You would think that with all the furniture the room would be cramped, but it is not. There is still plenty of space to walk around in without bumping into anything. I estimate that it is easily the size of at least two normal size hotel rooms. t also had a very extensive mini bar chock full of sweets, wine, beer, soda, nuts, chips, crackers, cheese and pretzels. Of course name brand spirts and mixers were avaiable. It had a giant floor to ceiling, wall to wall window with a nice viw. There was a posh club on the top floor of the hotel. The main casino floor is what you would expect in a top Las Vegas casino. The seafood buffet is amazing and if you love buffets and seafood it the place to be dine at least once. The Rio was a wonderful Las Vegas experience.

Reviews.Title: “I got an renovated room and it was GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Bananz
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for 2 days on business and I got an upgraded standard room and it was great. Cool decor, great shower and huge flatscreen. Very cool. The hotel was good for our conference but never really ate/partied there since I was on business. Next time I will go to the Voo Doo Lounge and see Prince play....thanks Rio for a good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Sensory Overload”
Reviews.Author: ndfan01
Reviews.Content: I had been a "frequent flyer" at the Rio practically since it opened many moons ago. After Harrah's took over, the friendly atmosphere has changed to a frenetically loud assault on the senses. There was a noticeable decline in service and a noticeable increase in kitsch. I will not return. The Good: The rooms. For the price, the rooms are hard to beat. They are huge with floor to ceiling windows and at least some have nice views. They are attractively decorated. The TV has always been a little too small for the room, and the sofa is a nice touch but not all that comfortable. Beds are ok but not the luxury models of some high end LV hotels. The coffee maker and refrigerator in the room is convenient although not all rooms are so equipped anymore. Service: Unlike a lot of other hotels, the Rio housekeeping is top notch, as is the bell service and valet if it isn't super busy. Can't say the same for the front desk. I actually think the personnel at the regular check in desk tends to be better than the surly incompetent losers who work at the Platinum check in desk. I have rarely had a good experience with that group. On at least 3 occasions I had to return at least once when a key didn't work for example. I've had desk employees who were unable to check a guest in or out of a room in less than 20 minutes and who either refuse to ask for help or argue with whoever is trying to help them get it right. I've never had one try to accommodate a special room request. No matter when I check in, whether I'm early, whether it is checkin time, after checkin time or late evening, my room is never ready. This wasn't one occasion. This was true on my last three visits. If using a comp or a casino rate, about 50% of the time I have to argue with them to get what was promised on the phone. I used to love the personnel at the Rio. I now find that most people who work there are not customer friendly, from the casino floor, to security to front desk to restaurants and bars. The last time my key wouldn't work, I waited literally 45 minutes for security to show, and then he got off the elevator, said he'd be with me in a minute, went to a courtesy phone and made dinner plans while I stood outside my room with my bags waiting. When he finally got around to assisting me, he opened the door with his master key, announced 'it works' and was going to leave me without checking my key. My key of course didn't work. (after I'd gone down to the desk three different times to have it activated properly) I headed down to the desk for a fourth time. No apology. Just treated as if I was being unreasonable to expect that someone there could activate my key after three tries. Restaurants: The steakhouse has fine food and the service is attentive--almost to the point of annoyance. I haven't found any other restaurant there that is particularly good. Antonios used to be a favorite of mine, but their prices are up and the quality of food and service is down. The Voodoo Cafe is worth trying for the view, but the food is just average. The bartender there the last time I visited was unfriendly to the point of rudeness. Likewise the staff at the wine cellar bar is somewhat chilly. I think the Rio Buffet is highly overrated (always has been). There is a lot to choose from but it isn't very tasty food. The seafood buffet has some great choices but is crowded and noisy at all times. The All-American gives you huge portions of tasteless or overly salted food. The mexican place used to be good, but now is just so so. The cafe has a nice ambience but the food is barely average. It has a great looking cappucino machine that never works. Buzio's is ok, but overpriced and nothing special. The decibel level in the casino has become intolerable. With the constant and frequently unwelcome "entertainment"--singing cocktail waiters and waitresses, the parade in the sky, the parade on the floor, the show on the stage, the show on the bar, the show on top of your slot machine, the blasting music, the loud drunks, the annoying penny slots--I thought I would lose my mind after a few hours. You can't even traverse Masquerade Village to your room in the late afternoons and evenings when the once an hour "parade" is going on. The table limits are high, and the slots and poker choices tend toward the newfangled rather than the old favorites. My last visit to the spa was not worth the money and a strange odor permeated the place. The staff was unhelpful there. The pool is inviting but is packed wall to wall. Lots of screaming kids. I don't begrudge the kids having fun, but Vegas is an adult playground, not a family destination and I don't want to endure some kid whining in my ear, hitting me with his wet nerf ball or peeing in the pool when I'm on a getaway weekend vacation. I guess the Rio must be making money because the place is always packed, but I doubt they have too many loyal return customers anymore. It seems to largely cater to the bachelor/bachelorette party crowd. I'll leave the place to the families with kids and the drunk 20 somethings.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic views!”
Reviews.Author: chelskiBucks
Reviews.Content: Just got back from LV Great time visiting the Voodoo Lounge and seeing the strip lit up at night some 51 floors up in the air. Went there twice, second time was packed with people, but still managed to get towards the outside, as everyone seems to want to do. Music not too my taste It took almost 10 mins to get into the rest rooms, so be sure and plan ahead! Going back in May, and can't wait see the place again! Try it...what a view!

Reviews.Title: “Rio great stay”
Reviews.Author: vegasdragon
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Rio but since we were given a Masquerade suite it was hard not to have a good time. This was an end suite with a 180 degree view. It was wonderful. The suite had a Jacuzzi facing the window with a view of the strip. Room service was fast and fresh. I was lucky enough to get tickets to see the opening night of the Producers and had a great time. We have been to Rio in the past and it remains one of our favorite hotels. The shuttle to the strip is very useful and reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Great”
Reviews.Author: beliblis
Reviews.Content: I wanted to stay at the Rio because they have large rooms and great views. When I went to check in I had three requests non smoking, King bed, and a high floor. I am told all they have is a smoking room with two Queen on the fourth floor. While I am standing waiting to finish my check-in the line next to me opens up and they give him a room on the 18th floor. When I get to my room the won't work I go back to the front desk they give me a new key still does not work they send someone up with a master key to let me in still does not work they have a maint guy come he gets the door open. I go into the room and unpack while the guy works on the door. After an hour he say the door is working I try my key still does not work. the guy tells me I need a new key they send up a Bell Hop with a new key does not work. The Bell Hop says he will send back up Maintenance guy back up never shows up I wait an hour and call the front desk they say they have to move me to a new room so I pack up my things and move. I try get a Elton John ticket from a host but didn,t have the play to get it free no big deal so I tell her I will pay for it and I give her a credit card they charge my card twice for the show the tried to charge me a thrid time when I checked out. Not a great time Jamie Tampa, FL

Reviews.Title: “As good as the strip”
Reviews.Author: er9804
Reviews.Content: We booked a room for 2 nights at the rio. Ive always wanted to stayed here since its an all suite resort. I loved my stay. The rooms were really spacious. The service was awsome. The buffet is the best one in vegas. Theres no need to leave the Rio for entertainment since it has alot @ the Rio. The only bad thing about it its the location. But it doesnt really matter its like 3-5 mins from the strip. I will always stay here when I have a chance. love the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Super experience at the RIO!!”
Reviews.Author: ndvegasguy
Reviews.Content: This is our 2nd annual February trip to see Las Vegas. Last year we stayed at Caesars Palace and our goal each year is to stay at a new Hotel each year. This year we decide on the Rio. There were a couple of reason: 1. We had never been to this property, and have heard some great things about it. 2. We got a great rate thru the [--] website in there hot deals section. Once we arrived in Las Vegas, the first thing we did was drive straight to the Rio and check in. We are ‘VIEW” people and get a big kick out of a great view of the strip. Last year we were lucky enough to be in the Augustus Tower in Caesars and had a great view of the south strip. This year we got a room facing south in the masquerade tower at the Rio. It was a King non smoking room and we could not have been happier. It was clean and fresh, had a big comfortable bed and a great bathroom. It even had a cool window in the shower that looked out over the strip, that was fun. All in all we were very pleased with the Rio, I probably won’t stay there again just because it is off the strip, and of course our goal is to always stay in a different hotel each visit. But the price was great, it was $49.99 for Wednesday and Thursday and $169.99 for Friday, which being on Super Bowl weekend was not too bad. Everything in the room was clean and in good order. The housekeeping was outstanding. Basically it was a perfect stay. Don't hesitate to give this hotel a try. The only tip I would have is that we had a car, so that made getting to and from the strip much easier. But if you don't have a car you will have to take the many shuttles that come and go every 1/2 hour.

Reviews.Title: “This is a Great place”
Reviews.Author: MissMelly
Reviews.Content: We did a timeshare and the Rio was an option for us to stay at. What a great choice that was! Huge rooms with everything you need, really fun shows,bars,casino and, a great FREE show. The "worlds largest buffet" is very large,and costly yet very so-so on the food meter. There is a shuttle that takes you back and forth to the strip so you don't need to rent a car. I would stay here again. From Michigan

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay Enhanced By Wonderful Employees”
Reviews.Author: themac
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully helpful staff. Had a request at checkin that was handled professionally and courteously which set the tone for each employee that I encountered over the four days. Someone has done an excellent job of hiring and developing a superb group of employees.

Reviews.Title: “Lousy Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: hiker-guyKy
Reviews.Content: If you stay at the Rio, do not use the concierge. I asked for a ticket to see Blue Man Group. The concierge told me that they had Premium seats in the 10th row, and showed me the location on the seating chart by putting his finger in the center of the front section. When I picked up my ticket for the show, my seat was on the 10th row, but was against the right side wall with a restricted view (probably about 20% not viewable) of the stage. When I returned to the Rio, I attempted to resolve their error, I got the run around for three days. I finally had a response the next week, which was basicly, the computer picks the tickets, so it wasn't their problem. I pointed out that I would never had paid $135 for a show when I couldn't see all of it and the concierge that sold me the ticket had misrepresented the location. That was six weeks ago and I am still waiting for a response. I also attempted to go though the Rio front desk, but was told it was not their problem. An additional attempt to get a response from them has also been ignored. The way I was treated, I wouldn't stay at the Rio again if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than other reviews indicated”
Reviews.Author: eldoradolady
Reviews.Content: When we recieved an offer for a 4 day, 3 night comp stay at Rio, I checked the reviews and was very hesitant about taking it. We've never stayed at Rio before and had only visited once. We've stayed at Bally's, Bellagio and Harrahs in the past. I'm not sure the reviewers on this site stayed at the same hotel we did. It was GREAT! The staff was incredibly helpful, our room was wonderful (Masquerade Tower), and the food was delicious. The room was huge, well appointed and clean with a magnificent view. They even cut out a window in the shower wall so you can actually see the mountains when you take your shower. As for hot water, ours was TOO hot! We asked for early check in and late check out - no problem. We ate at Antonio's - delicious. We ate twice at the American Grill, also excellent.. Bottom line is we will deinitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place”
Reviews.Author: Craziamien
Reviews.Content: Well we went over christmas from saturday(23)-monday(25). we dont celebrate and we were all off, so why not go to vegas. sunday was comped, and sat was $60. thats a bargain. well its pretty close to the strip, it has the free shuttle, and when getting there i requested 2 queens they ran out and said they only had 2 smoking queens, so the manager came and found us a room with 2 queens, it was in the older tower lookin at palms. well the curtain thing was broken called 3 times to get it fixed no one did. well it was a clean hotel, clean casino, great location, the service wasnt that good. not too crowded, a great place. if your having a problem with them just get the manager. and book online, b.c then your prefrences are saved there, otherwise on the telephone youll tell them but they wont record it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice visit”
Reviews.Author: MIKE-TRIP
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a comped masquerade suite for 4 nights. The room was very nice and had a great bathroom. The only problem in the bathroom was we couldnt get hot water in the stall shower unless we filled up the jacuzzi tub how my wife figured it out I dont know. We called downstairs but they never did anything about it. I laughed because the desk person asked if I ran the shower for 15 minutes first. I never in my life needed to run a shower for 15 minutes to get hot water and this was a premiun rio suite that goes for 600 plus a night. The casino was never really crowded at the slots but the tables got very crowded. I dont think you can have a bad time at the rio but I prefer a little more upscale hotel. I usually stay at the mgm skylofts or the mirage. I stayed at the rio because I was comped the masquerade suite for the stay from my Atlantic City host.

Reviews.Title: “Love Rio, great stay & beautiful room !!”
Reviews.Author: BADEXPERIENCES
Reviews.Content: I just got back yesterday from RIO. We had a wonderful stay at RIO. The reception was very nice and acommodated any thing I want. My room was huge and beautiful. It was at Ipanema Tower. And this tower is a new renowvated tower, (if you book you should request room on this side, most of the room are new ly upgraded)... My room faced to LasVegas trip and swimming pool side. At night we can see a whole las vegas city through all glass window wall. We feel like we are living in a millionare's house or something.... It's worth it at a cheap price $75/per night for a suite like this....that I booked through //www.harrahs.com. It was beautiful and romantic room. My husband & my daughter love the room a lot too... Mable bathroom, funiture is a highend quality .... We like every things there.... and difinitely we will be back there next time.. I am highly recommend you this hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Watch those extra charges”
Reviews.Author: PhineasJFog
Reviews.Content: Overall, I would say our stay was very good. We had a nice suite on the 18th floor looking toward the strip. The room was big and very clean with a fridge, ironing board, safe, couch and table. No problem with maid service. The door key was a constant problem though. At least 3 times I had to go back to the front desk to get another key. This is not fun when you've been out on the and all you want to do is fall into bed and pass out. One thing you must do even if not staying there is take the glass elevator up to the Voodoo Lounge on the 51st floor. There is a 2 level outdoor deck with an amazing view of all Las Vegas. No cover charge before 9pm, I believe. The problem came upon checkout. We were in a rush to get to the airport and our bill was wrong. I booked the hotel at a good rate of $49. but we were charged $119. He said he would fix it but when i got home only part had been refunded. Also I had made a 20 min call back to Vancouver and the charge was $55. When I told the desk I thought this was a bit excessive, their response was, " Its never cheap to use hotel phones." They also charge for local calls. Our bill was also full of charges at the hotel bar and restaurant which is hard to verify. Next time its cash only, no charges to the room. I did not mind the location. Easy walk , shuttle or city bus to the strip. Cabs won't be any more than $5 - $10 to the strip. Across the street from the Gold Coast which has the best little store for beer, wine , and liquor purchases. We go there to buy our booze to take back to Canada and use for our room . Not sure if I'll stay there again. We'll see how they deal with the checkout and room rate issue.

Reviews.Title: “Suites not all that great but provides a roof”
Reviews.Author: BrassBryan
Reviews.Content: Booked using their Hot deals. I enjoy their casino and their buffet. I must say their seafood buffet is overrated tho but their carnavel buffet has a good standard despite having a fantastic wide spread. I got to stay in the Masquerade Towers but it must be noted this hotel doesnt provide the best "view" since it is away from the strip. The room was decent although the safe was spoilt. The staff was great although I got assigned a room which haven't got made up. It provides shuttles to the strip with 3 stops harrahs/caesars/ballys each about 20mins each. Cab from the airport will cost $15-$20. This hotel does provide a good nights rest though.The (free)shows aren't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “not that great”
Reviews.Author: ChrisZegers
Reviews.Content: The worst thing about this hotel is the poor internet availability. There is basic internet available on your TV screen, but there is no WIFI or broadband in the rooms. There is a small WIFI area downstairs, but no place to sit other than at the Starbucks. The TV is also terrible; only a couple of channels and my TV had terrible picture quality. And no way to adjust contrast/brightness and colour.

Reviews.Title: “RIO was fun!”
Reviews.Author: poopsyhop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RIO from Nov 27th-Dec 2nd and loved the RIO. Nice big rooms. Nice comfortable casino, good restauraunts and friendly service. The atmosphere at the RIO is fun, kind of carnival like. Maid service was excellent too. We would definitely stay there again. It's affordable right in the heart of Vegas. They offer shuttles to their sister hotels on the strip and you can walk from there.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Rio ”
Reviews.Author: Loud
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Rio from 11/8/2006 to 11/16/2006. We had also stayed in 3/2006 for a week. The comps. available are generous and everyone in the hotel was very cordial and helpful. A maintenance man even arranged to get my morning coffee for my while I was playing a slot machine. Our room was older and rather tired looking but the beds were extremely comfortable. Maid service was good except for one day that they forgot to change the towels. The Rio has excellent restaurants plus the large buffet and seafood buffet. They have the best selection of sugar free deserts that we have seen on the strip. As the Rio is beyond an easy walk to the strip we always rent a car and find it to be an excellent means of transportation. With a car you can utilize valet parking at all of the hotels plus visit other areas such as Henderson and Lake Mead. Why utilize all your energy walking from one hotel to another (they are a lot further than they appear)? Save your energy for the inside of the resorts - you did not come here to exercise - if so stay home and walk all day. My wife had good luck at the table games. I had my usual bad luck at video slots. My sister - in - law visited the Rio three days after we left and hit a royal flush. If you have a car, a fun place to visit is Sam's Town which is near the corner of East Flamingo Road and Boulder Highway. They have a free show inside at night that is enjoyable. Will we return to the Rio - of course

Reviews.Title: “The Rio: a fine place to stay”
Reviews.Author: zamg9
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rio from 11/10-/11/14/06 for the first time after many other trips to Vegas. It was a really busy weekend and the place was packed. Our room was large, but I have stayed in many other rooms in Vegas that were better-appointed. The accommodations weren't awful, just surprsingly average for a room of that size. The shower was underwhelming, and the bath was not very inviting. Being off the strip, cabs and shuttles are necessary. Cabs were readily available and while there was some wait for the shuttle, it was easy to take. While at the Rio, I utilized the spa and beauty salon facilities. Both my spa and beauty salon experiences were adequate. One of my favorite dining experiences occurred at the Wine Cellar in the Rio. Although a little pricey, they have a good selection of wines and interesting flights to choose from. Staff there was very knowledgable. My husband really liked the Seafood Buffet: good seafood, lobster and crab legs; $25 with coupon. Neither me nor my husband are very motivated to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is good”
Reviews.Author: DubbleDiamond
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rio a number of times and always find it to be a fun place with good rooms. This was my wife's first stay there and she really liked it a lot. Didn't mind being off the strip a bit, as the shuttles to other Harrah's properties are free and easy to take. The room was very nice, clean and spacious. It's the only Rio room I've ever seen, I'm assuming it was a Standard Suite (with shower window!) and it fulfilled all of our needs. Once again, the buffet proved to be the best, if expensive. The American Grill (back room) had great food. We were less than impressed with the Tilted Kilt. Pools can't be beat with all the choices of sand and water temperature. The Pina Colada at pool bar with dark rum was the best.

Reviews.Title: “All Suites offering Non-smoking rooms”
Reviews.Author: WeTryItOnce
Reviews.Content: For personal health reasons we only stay in hotels who guarantee a non-smoking room. We learned the hard way that NO hotel/casino on the Las Vegas Strip will do this so this off strip Hotel was arranged for us by a Casino Host. As is often the case, the first room was not just right. A request from the smoked in room yielded us a perfect second room with everything we needed provided by a bellman. The rooms were actually obscenely huge and almost a waste of space, but new and comfortable. There was nothing particularly of interest regarding shows at this Hotel/Casino so we spent most of our time away. There was a free, highly advertised show above the casino floor that involved dancers suspended in various vehicles, which we later learned could be ridden in for a fee. The accompanying stage show was very basic and choreographically speaking definitely off strip, but as they say: you get what you pay for. If you are looking for more glitz and glamor, you cannot help but look down the street at the Palms.

Reviews.Title: “I Love The RIO”
Reviews.Author: Jennybean25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio in August. Our whole stay was comped, 4 nights. I think that is a great deal. They have the best rewards program. Be sure to sign up asap. I love the rooms. The beds are very very soft. The best part is the pool. Or should I say 5 pools and 5 hot tubs. It was 104 when we were there. I swear we layed out for 2 hours and had the best tan. The carnival buffet is great. I can usually find coupons and never have to pay full price. Ebay is a good way to find vegas coupons. I heard the seafood buffet is not worth it. My fiance went and he said the lobster was tiny and the crab was cold. I am sure you can find better. The tilted kilt is a great little bar over by the mardi gras area. They have really cheap drink specials. As far as the gambling it could be better. The dollar machines are great. Top dollar and double top dollar are the best. They hit great. I also like the quarter machines with the wheels on top. I cant remember the name. They are in the mardi gras section. Anyway, The Rio is great. I usually use my comps to pay for all my food and coffee in the morning. I even have enough left over to buy a few things from the gift shop. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Rio is a ripp off”
Reviews.Author: kobrien
Reviews.Content: We have booked Rio through Harrah's. The suites are lovely and the view is nice. But we only had been seeing it for half an hour every night before we dropped dead on our bed, therefore it is not worth to stay off The Srtip. The sheets were dirty and the ice machine broken. They charged me for everyithing so obnoxuiously we eventualy got to hate the whole place. They charge 10 dollar for a day internet, 34 dollar (yes it is right!!!!) for a night video rental and an absolute fortune for phonecalls. They also charge their own guest to use the Woodo lounge which is about the only high thing in the hotel. Anything else is a big Yawn...(other hotels give discount to their guest or rather they can use facilities for free). They also forgot to display their minibar prices (we had been requesting a price list every day while there but we had never seen one) but you guaranteed a heart attack when you see your bill. Very dissapointing and disturbing when you go there to have fun. Their Bufett nice but unless you spend your day hounting for a 5 off coupon is expensive too compare to other buffetts. I recomendd to stay out of the Rio experience.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my trip, but a tad disappointed in the room”
Reviews.Author: NJdudette
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Rio as I had such a wonderful time the first time around. Needless to say I didn't quite receive the same service as the last time. Upon my arrival at McCarran Airport I quickly headed for the Harrah properties check-in. I figured I’d at least kill some time waiting for my luggage. The last time I visited the Rio I was given a nice room, high up, with a view of the pool – I hoped for the same this visit. There was no line and I quickly received service. The check-in clerk was friendly and I was hopeful for a room with a nice view – much to my chagrin this was not going to happen. I was told that because I required internet service, rooms were only available in the Ipanema Tower. On my previous visit to the Rio I stayed in the Masquerade Tower and I can’t recall if the room had internet service as I did not have my laptop with me. It sounds odd to me that only some of their rooms have high speed internet service (I’m not counting the web TV). Anyway, she told me the only room available was on the third floor. Maybe I misunderstood her, but I thought that still included a view of the pool – I was wrong. It’s had a view of Palms & Gold Coast Casinos, and the air conditioning/duct system. My room also had a constant food odor which probably meant my room was near the restaurant ventilation unit. The room was nice, clean, had an appealing décor, and was recently upgraded in comparison to the room I had on my last visit, but it was a tad bit smaller (not a big deal). Don’t get me wrong, I’m not a Wendy Whiner and a fabulous view isn’t extremely necessary, but a view of something other than the air conditioning/ducts would have been nicer. For me it’s not a real issue, but it was rather noisy with all the air conditioning units outside my window. For the most part my room was clean, but I was a bit annoyed about the cigarette burn hole in the blanket. I left the blanket in full view hoping the maid would see it and change the blanket, but that did not happen. All but one day my room was cleaned by a reasonable hour. All in all I'd stay here again, but I probably won't simply because there are so many other hotel choices in Vegas that I would like to try something else.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Rio”
Reviews.Author: SenoraSofia
Reviews.Content: Harrah's is a welcoming host. We love the Rio and have returned several times. We especially enjoyed the six casino crawl, in which we won tons of free meals and food vouchers. We loved the room. We were on the 21st floor overlooking the strip. It was nice to see the July fireworks being rocketed from Caesars Palace. No complains. It is large and very comfy. The cleaning services were fine. We received an upgrade in our player status, so the seperate check in was speedy. But, regular check in had never been an issue. I could not win at the slots at the Rio, but during the six casino crawl, I did better at Caesars and Bally's. In all, the gambling was great fun despite the losing streak. Maybe next summer will be my turn to hit the big one. I felt badly that we did not see any shows. Usually we see 5 - 7 shows during our two week stay, but this trip we just gambled all the time. I long to return to the Rio and expect that I will be there again real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Masquerade”
Reviews.Author: dkekitalo
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 3 days at Rio. Got a room in Masquerade tower that still had the old decor...which I like better than the new decor...even still had the window in the shower. Room was well maintained and looked like new The Rio is as clean or cleaner than any hotel I have been in, and the large size of the rooms is a great feeling. the refrigerator is convenient. They have tightened up the slots..I did not do well, though I saw some people winning. The buffet and other restaurants are top notch

Reviews.Title: “Rooms @ Rio in Law vegas”
Reviews.Author: sheiladerrick
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large but furniture and carpets were stained and outdated and lower quality than we are used to. Baths are small and nothing special. Pools are crowded and loud music does not make for a relaxing day.

Reviews.Title: “Rio was ok”
Reviews.Author: black_dobe
Reviews.Content: Rio Hotel- We stayed here our last 2 nites, what a change from the other 2 places! Much more like the strip, busy and high energy. We had a nice room in the Masquarade Tower. This was the biggest room of our trip and included a fridge and safe, large chesterfield, table and chairs. There was a funny smell in the room when we first went in, but by the time we left, we didn't notice it anymore. The maids hadn't picked up the last guy's grape stems off the carpet, and they were still there when we left. They also didn't replace our used drinking glasses on the 2nd day. However, the rest was well looked after, the bed comfy. We really enjoyed the masquarade shows at nite, we saw 4 different ones. Ladies..At the end of each masq. show, 2 Chippendale boys come out and you can have your pix taken w/them. Cost was $20.00. Well worth it, just to touch those boys:))) The slots were so tight we gave up playing them. I can't say enough for the Carnival Buffet..it was huge. I'm sure they had every kind of food available. Only complaint was that some of the food was cold by the time we walked from one end of the buffet back to our table at the other end of the room! The hotel has $5.00 off tickets in all the magazines. They also gave us cheap tickets for a couple of shows, which we just didn't have time to see. We really wanted to try dancing at one of their clubs. So Wed. nite after paying $10.00ea, we go up to Voodoo lounge. Of course the guy didn't tell us that 3/4 of it was roped off for a private party. It looked like you went down some stairs where it sounded pretty wild/noisy. Of course it was roped off. Everywhere else, was just people standing around looking bored and drinking. So we left. This was about 11:30pm. Someone told us to come back @1:30am-4am, it would be open and rocking by then. Yeah right, we were sound to sleep by then. Club Rio didn't open til 11pm on Thursday and we'd just walked 6 miles up and down the strip, and gone riding that afternoon. All we saw were 20 year olds heading to the club, so again we didn't even bother. You can print off your boarding pass at the business centre for $1.00 each. Glad we did, cause we found out our flight was delayed. I'd have to say although it was a nice hotel, unless you get it for under $100US a nite, in our opinion South Coast was nicer. the Rio was less than 5minutes to the Strip by car, we didn't get to try the shuttle. -Erocktica at the Rio was an interesting show. We just walked up and got tickets 5min before the show started. There are 2 for 1 tickets available in the hotel magazines, use them. The show was 54.00US before the discount. We enjoyed the show, its not the highest class production, but it was fun. Nice loud rock n roll, lots of bare --. Oh to be that young and supple again:)

Reviews.Title: “It's all about expectations, people!”
Reviews.Author: stratton
Reviews.Content: My buddy and I (single guys late 20s/early 30s) stayed at the Rio for five nights at the end of September/beginning of October. I am amazed at some of the negative reviews I've been reading lately, so let me give you the straight dope on the Rio. First of all, some people complained that it was not worth paying $150 bucks a night. Well, no kidding! My stay cost less than half that. If you're paying those rates you either didn't do your homework or you insisted on staying during one of the major weekends when everything in Vegas is overpriced. Second, people have complained about their rooms in the Masquerade Tower. A brief review of this web site before I left was enough for me to know that the Ipanema Tower rooms are much nicer, so that's what we got. Again, do your homework. The rooms at the Rio are big and clean. The furniture and bathroom fixtures, for those who care, were all very nice. The beds were comfy (firm but soft.) Our room was on the third floor and had a terrible view of the roof below, but we didn't care - who spends their time gazing out the window when there is so much to do and see? We did have some difficulties with our in-room safe. Maintenance was not speedy, but when they did come they resolved the issues to our satisfaction. I would describe the service staff as businesslike but friendly. I was underwhelmed by the pools. One was closed, and the others were being sparsely used. The waterfalls were interesting, but standing under them was more like being sprayed with a high pressure hose than a jacuzzi jet. Overall, we thought it was a nice hotel. The off-strip location may be less than ideal for some. We made good use of the free shuttles and didn't have to wait a long time for them to arrive, though they can get stuck in traffic just like a cab. The Rio is within walking distance of Gold Coast and Palms, so it's certainly not isolated. The only place we ate at the Rio was the Carnival World buffet. I can honestly say I think it's the best buffet in Vegas - it has the biggest variety and the best desserts. Definitely go for lunch. I would recommend the Rio for those planning to sleep 3 or more to a room since the rooms are quite spacious. One tip: keep your drapes drawn during the day or the sun will bake your room to a toasty temperature. If having a nicely appointed room is important to you, Rio is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, OK service, very large hotel!”
Reviews.Author: minibargrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for three weeks during the WSOP, so I feel like I know this hotel inside and out! The first room they put us in was in the unremodeled tower, and it was pretty awful. The room was very large, but very out of date and dark. The next night they moved us to the remodeled tower, and it was very nice. The same room configuration, but better decor, more modern. The rooms are very large, you could very comfortably sleep four people in this room and even another on the couch! The bathrooms are huge. Room service is nice, although they often took over an hour from ordering to delivery. We ate at the mexican restaurant, which was OK. the fast food laces are downstairs are quite good - especially the chinese food. The breakfast diner downstairs really hits the spot - try the granola and fruit! The restaurant at the top of the Rio is nice, but the Voodoo lounge is a rip-off and the manager is very rude and a cheat! He had bottles sent to our table that we didn't order and then attempted to charge us $800 for them! We spoke to mgmt and they had the charges removed. They did lost our laundry once when we sent it out, claiming they had thrown it away, but in the end, it was delivered clean! Housekeeping staff is great and willing to work around you. Internet access is quite good and reliable as well. They also have a great selection of on-demand movies for those of you in extended stay situations like we were. Be sure to have a drink at the chic iBar downstairs!

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: GWTWgirl
Reviews.Content: The off-the-Strip location worked well for us. Parking was very convenient and we fully utilized the shuttle service to the Strip. Our room was very spacious. Only complaint I had was that it is now a non-smoking room, BUT was formerly a smoking one as the tell-tale burn marks on the table and bench at the foot of the bed gave away. Also, there was still a strong smell of smoke in the closet. Still, it was large and very clean and we loved the view (we were on the 16th floor of the Masquerade Tower). Previous comments about all the smoke in the casino area did not bother me--casinos by nature are smoky places, but I don't want my room to be. We enjoyed the pool area, although it did take us a little while to find the doors leading to the pool. The relatively early closing time didn't bother us either as once the sun went down, the pool was pretty chilly. We enjoyed several meals at the restaurants (the breakfast buffet is incredible; however, the one across at the street was just as good and much cheaper) and we enjoyed the Mexican restaurant, finding it to be pretty reasonable. Food was good at the All-American grill, but just average menu items and a bit pricey. It was also great to see Penn&Teller at our location. We would certainly come back to the Rio in the future.

Reviews.Title: “OK - but basically overpriced”
Reviews.Author: jillellen80
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Rio from Sep 14-18, 2006. This was my mom's first time in Vegas and I wanted her to have a really good time, which would include a very nice hotel. I have been to Vegas many times (this was actually my 7th trip) and have stayed at some nice places, as well as some terrible ones. When my travel agent told me we could stay at the Rio for the same amount as Mandalay Bay (which I stayed at in Oct. 05 and loved) I decided to try something new. However, the Rio doesn't even begin to compare to Mandalay Bay. The rooms were my gibbest complaint. The plumbing is marginal at best, and the amenities were only average. The room was quite large (thus "suite") but besides size, offerred nothing else all that special. I have also stayed at the Golden Nugget downtown, which is significantly less expensive and has more attention to detail. This is by no means a "bad" place to stay. It is simply not on par with other hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Needs some attention”
Reviews.Author: redjet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Rio for 3 nights in September. We were originally booked into the Impanema Tower, I believe this is the oldest part of the hotel. As there was no internet and very few channels, we requested to move to the Masquarade Villiage Tower and were nicely accomodated. The rooms were clean and spacious, however, our beds were very uncomfortable and had alot of sag. Our room was on the 25th floor and faced to the south (Flamingo Blvd) right above the entrance to the hotel...needless to say the traffic was very loud. Service didn't seem up to par, we ate at the Buffet for breakfast one morning and the hostess was rude, the food was fair for the price. Next time, we will choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the RIO”
Reviews.Author: danbot32162
Reviews.Content: A wonderful stay at The Rio Hotel. Very easy access off the main freeway, either North or South bound. Even though I arrived on Labor Day there were plenty of staff at the check in desk to handle the busy crowd. I usually do self parking and wheel my luggage in. Temps were in the high 90s. From the parking garage it was a brief elevator ride and walk. Luckily there was an enclosed walkway leading into the property. Outside I can see fans blowing spray mist onto waiting passengers for the free shuttle rides to all sister properties on the Las Vegas Strip. My suite on the 9th floor of the Ipanema Tower has a Southern view with the Palms and Gold Coast Casino Hotels near by. Very spacious with two Queen beds (firm & comfortable, the bed spread pattern and colors were different form the exterior property colors & neon lighting I'm used to seeing at night, coffee table, sofa, desk (with phone & ethernet connector) has two chairs, floor to ceiling wall to wall window (with excellent blackout drapery meaning no sun light at sunrise, the room climate controls were simple and effective, standard dual sliding door closet (with iron & board, mini fridge - top shelf will freeze water bottles and the ice in ice-bucket, if put, there will not melt), electronic digital coded safe...very useful). Dual sinks in bathroom entryway also have the drawers for your clothing. Bathroom itself was has standard amenities with sink, toilet, shower/tub combo with curtain, very good supply of towels. The full armoire had large 32" TV and mini bar on the bottom. Another property with Starbucks close to the elevators. Over all a relaxing and nice stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “VIP Treatment”
Reviews.Author: tsaiware
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at the Rio, after we were "walked over" by Bally's due to a computer issue they had, on September 4th. From the moment we arrived at the Rio, we were treated with incredible service. It was after 2am when we got there, but regardless of the time, the customer service was excellent the entire two days. I was exhausted after the flight and long wait at Bally's. So I didn't hear that we were given a VIP room on the top floor until we got into the elevator and couldn't press any buttons without inserting the keycard! The room was as awesome as the view. We could see the entire strip from the Stratosphere to Mandalay Bay. From sunrise to sunset the view was incredible. In the morning we discovered that we were missing remote control for the tv, and within 5 min of our phonecall someone was knocking on our door with a new one. Regardless of having the two nights comped (by Bally's), it was well worth being at the Rio. We ate at the Carnival Buffet twice, look in the magazine for a $5 off coupon, we didn't see it the first time we went (it was good for upto 4 people).
