Someone suggested we try the Seafood Buffet, which was a feast for any seafood lover, well worth the price. The casino floor was nice and big with lots of selection of slots and gaming, plus there was a free show a few times a day in the afternoons which was quite lively. Overall we enjoyed our two days at the Rio and if we ever decide not to stay on the strip, we'd definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Bizz69
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Rio from Friday to Monday. We had so much fun. It was our first time staying at the Rio and it will definitely not be our last. We’ve stayed at Bally’s and Monte Carlo in the past but the Rio kicks but compared to them. The pools are fantastic. Put’s the Monte Carlo pool to shame. The staff was incredible. From the ladies at the Keno outlet to the security guards, they treated us with value. We enjoyed the pool everyday and ate lunch by the pool twice. Big portions. The casino always seemed busy. The room was wonderful. Full bath, double beds, huge floor to ceiling windows. We ate at the buffet one afternoon and we thought for the money it was decent. We went up to the Voodoo Lounge for drinks one evening and the view was spectacular. We loved the Rio and would definitely stay there again. Great staff. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Rockin' Rio”
Reviews.Author: DMaldon762
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Rio Suites for Labor Day weekend and we had big fun. We started off our trip as we always do whenever we get our rental car, by going to Carl's Jr. for a burger!!! Once we ate, we checked in at Rio. It was very late (around 11:00 PM) so there was no line to speak of. We were a little disapointed we were in the Ipanema Tower but the room was still very nice and the elevators was close to things at th resort we liked (stores, Starbucks, the pool). Our room was HUGE and I liked the layout of it with the big 31" TV that swivels around. The bed was very comfy. Since we slept on the plane we stayed up all night and hasd fun. The hotel was very full for the holiday but we still had fun. The next day we had breakfast across the street at The Palms (very cheap). We even walked through the Gold Coast Casino to check it out and we were impressed with it. When we got back, we hit the pool. Rio has one of the best pools. We had buckets of beer and the food at the pool was very good. After the pool we took a nap before we went downstairs to the Wine Cellar for a bottle and some tasty cheese. We were so full after the cheese and bread and wine we did not even need dinner. We went to se Erocticat after this and it was a cool show for something different. We loved the Rio and would deffinatly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: arstrobelt
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio All Suites Hotel for one night in August 2006. Got a great rate at $ 49 via the hotel's website which included an upgrade to a stripview suite. All rooms are acutally suites at this place. The suites are quite big and are equipped with a 31 inch TV which can be turned to either the bed or the fullsize sitting area. The bathroom has a good size as well and is equipped with two sinks. One outside and one inside the bathroom. The suites come with a small refrigerator as well, which is quite unusual in Vegas. The rooms themselves were spotless and without much wear and tear even though the Rio is not the newest Hotel Resort in Las Vegas. Check-in was quite easy and quick. In order to avoid standing in line at checkout, go ahead and use the convenient video check out service. The buffet at the Rio is known to be one of the best in Vegas. And it is not as expensive as some upscale buffets on the Strip. The pool area with several pools is quite nice and even has a sand beach. There are plenty of chairs. The Rio is not located on the Vegas Strip, but they do have a shuttle service to Ceasars and Harrahs which runs until 1 a.m. during the week and until 4 a.m. on the weekends. Very convenient. If you are looking for low table limits try the new rapid roulette ($2.50) where you can place your bets on a touchscreen display. All in all I will defenitely stay at the Rio again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “overall quite satisfied...”
Reviews.Author: Wander54
Reviews.Content: My husband, son and myself stayed at the Rio for the WSOP tournaments. The room was very comfortable for the three of us. The entire staff was very friendly and helpful. We got a poker rate for our room which was quite substantial since we stayed there for ten nights. The beds were the most comfortable I have ever slept in besides my own. And the towels were big and soft. Room service was very prompt. All the restaurants were quite expensive but the food was good. We will be staying there again next year for the WSOP and hope it will be just as nice as this time. By the way, my 22 year old son was in the money for two of the poker tournaments. Am very proud of him..

Reviews.Title: “How Suite It Was”
Reviews.Author: putangie67
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay at the Rio just a couple days ago. Check in was pretty fast and i found out that i had been upgraded to a masquerade suite. WOW. This is the biggest suite that hotel has for people that arent high rollers. 1600 square feet and i only paid 59 a night (weds-fri). The room was very clean and was obviously more than we expected. The bed wasnt too comfortable, but the view was amazing. We had a complete 180 degree view of the entire strip. We visited the VooDoo lounge and that was amazing too. A must visit for the younger crowd. I didnt try the food at the Rio because the gold coast is next door and offers much cheaper food. Shuttle service to the strip was also fast and reliable. The pool are is decent when putting it into a las vegas context. I highly reccomend a visit to the Rio especially when you can get the rooms cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Needs service improvement”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveller2005
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the 5-day trip in Vegas. The first 3 days stayed at Rio for business conference. We arrived at 11am, check-in was fast, originally assigned to a 3rd floor room, requested to change to a room higher up, and got 27th floor. The room was big with floor to ceiling windows looking at south side of the strip. The hotel got 3 swiming pools but operating hour is 9am-7pm, only managed to go there once during the conference. "show in the sky" allow audience's participation, however, you are sitting there with seat belt because of the safty concern, and not allowed to carry camera, so it spoiled all the fun. The room furnishing was very plain, and water pressure was low. Thursday night, they shut the water down for repairs, we asked to have some bottled water delivered to the room but never got it, we have to take the $3.5/bottle from the fridge and got charged to the bill. The money is nothing, but the fact that they don't provide water to the guests during this water outage indicates insufficient customer service. BTW, shuttle runs from Rio to Caesar palace, Harrahs, Paris every half an hour until 3am (or 4am can't remember), which is convenient. However I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio was great!”
Reviews.Author: ravens1
Reviews.Content: The Rio is just a cool hotel. Not being gamblers, we put more stock into everything else the hotel has to offer...shows, shops and restaurants. All of which the Rio has plenty of and a nice selection. Our room, however, was in the non-renovated side and was showing some wear... The carpet was stained, as well as the sofa. But everything was very clean, and the bathroom was well appointed. The view was spectacular as well. We also took the shuttle service to the other properties. Getting over was quick and easy, but afternoon traffic and delays meant waiting for the shuttle very lengthy at best. Still, not a big deal. We ate lunch at the Rio and went to one of the shows. Both experiences were great. Overall, we would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: boojums
Reviews.Content: The best thing I can say about this hotel is that the staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help. Well, that and the pool waitresses in their thong bikinis. Our room in the Ipanema tower was large, clean and comfortable, if a bit dated. The pools are clean and uncrowded, but there is very little shade. Pools open at 9am and there is no great rush to reserve chairs, at least during the 4 days we spent there. What makes this review only average is the overall service and condition of the hotel. The comode barely worked. The overhead light in the bathtub didn't work. The coffee machine makes only one cup at a time, and until you can ask the maid to leave more, the four styrofoam cups won't help you much. When we arrived, the previous guests' room service stuff was sitting outside the room and stayed there until the next evening. The ice machine on our floor didn't work. Our room was never cleaned before 4pm, despite calls to housekeeping and their assurance that the room would be cleaned earlier. And the bartending staff out at the pool got one day's worth of drinks totally confused, trying to charge us double. Cleared up without much effort, but still an indication of the general confusion we found here. The casino play is ok, but the casino feels cramped. In addition, there are sets of slot machines that have a small stage over them and every 10 minutes or so, one of the waitresses gets up and sings or dances. Think cheap cabaret. Really annoying. Food at Buzios was good, but of course, expensive. Food at the pool was a better deal and not half bad. Drinks are the typical lv cost, but they were made pretty good. Overall, an average hotel that's ok if you get a good deal on the room. However, for my money, I'll avoid the Harrah's properties for now on and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Jamicafool
Reviews.Content: My husband I have been to Vegas a few time before so we thought we would try a place off the strip since we didn't need to go see all of them on the strip any more. We found the Rio to be wonderful. There are so many resturants to choose from and the ones we tried were great. The pools are perfect since we like ones with some personalities. The staff was always there with the drinks when we needed them. Being that it was over a hundered degrees out we needed them often. Our suite was great. We were in the remodeled one (can't remember name with 20 floors). The room was cleaned by the time we came back from the pool (around noon) each day. The shuttle ran about every 30 minutes. We never waited more that about 15 minutes sometime less and it worked well for getting around. We recomend it and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid The Rio”
Reviews.Author: aliciaz
Reviews.Content: Ok so as part of my vacation in Vegas, we went to The Rio to check it out and go to its Buffet. (since it was voted "the best" in 2005). My only opinion is to KEEP OUT! The buffet was not all that great and for the money you are much better off at The Mirage. The food was not that fresh and the service did not rank with the others. The hotel itself is not in a good location , and walking thru the casino and shops it was not asthetically pleasing to the eye. I honestly thought it seemed dirty. For the money that these rooms cost, get a room on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “RIO A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lasvegasnewlyweds
Reviews.Content: We spent a fantastic week at the RIO the week of July 4. The staff was wonderful, friendly and helpful and couldn't have been nicer to their guests, not to mention the amazing shows and overhead floats in the casino We enjoyed the food at numerous restaurants there and the swimmming pool complex was excellent with some sand beaches, waterfalls, and plenty of lounge chairs even in the busiest of times. I requested and got a beautiful view of the strip from the window of our 37th floor suite. The room was kept clean by the friendly cleaning staff who had no problem leaving us extra coffee or creamer. We were married that week and we hope to return every year to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Expensive Vacation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Went to Rio with my husband, who was on a business trip. Played tournament poker -hold em. Cheap tables and buy-ins. Nice atmosphere to play at since most players are tourists, and not locals looking to take advantage of the crowd. Hotel was beautiful, and plenty to do - but expensive. Food expensive. Didn't leave the hotel for the 4 day trip since I was there to rest and my husband was working. The pools were beautiful, but had to keep moving to stay out of the direct sun - it was 105 degrees. We walked across the street to find a cheaper meal at the Outback - but we spent $28 each for a meal that would have cost us half of that at home. The room was spacious and clean - which is very important to me. The rooms seemed soundproofed pretty well, so I didn't get annoyed by people going to or from their rooms. Except for the sports bar, I couldn't find a reasonably priced meal. I wanted to have a bowl of pasta, but the only place was the Italian restaurant, and I didn't want to pay the prices. The atmosphere was very hedonistic, which is not my thing. Half naked 19-year old girls serve you at the pool, poker tables, and most restaurants. It got tired. Everything is geared to the young or male travelor. They have a Chippendale club, but that is really it for the women. I would stay at the hotel again if the rates were more reasonable. I would pay their price if they were on the strip. I emailed them rates of other hotels on the strip that I would stay at and they didn't want to meet those rates, so we will be staying at a more reasonably priced hotel in November.

Reviews.Title: “Poor remodel”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne_Charles
Reviews.Content: Visited the Rio in Las Vegas June 2006. The hotel was OK for the money. The rooms and hallways had a terrible odor that was hard to ignore. The remodel was poorly done. The wallpaper in the bathroom was peeling off, bathtubs had moldy grime, lamps were broke and pillows were small like sofa pillows. The staff however was very professional, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “STAYERS BEWARE, NO CUSTOMER SERVICE......”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter danced in a National Dance competition at the rio in las vegas. The dancing went off without a hitch, but the rest of the hotel hospitality was a nightmare. Our reservations were booked 6 months in advance. Our group of five families requested rooms together, on a smoking floor, with 2 queen beds because each family had 2 adults and children. Before arrival My reservations were confirmed 3x. Upon arrival, all five rooms were split up, some being 16 floors apart. We were all in non smoking rooms, which the reo gave us ashtrays and allowed smoking in these rooms. We were all also given 1 bed for our families of 4 or more. The hotel was overbooked so some had to spend a night at a different hotel, even though they had made a reservation. Some were also charged higher rates then quoted on the phone. The rooms were nice. Quite large, with very big windows overlooking the strip. However, the pay per view movies did not work. We spent 1 hour on 3 different occasions with maintenance in our room trying to fix for us, but too bad its broken. Let me also tell you we were charged for movies all 3 times we never seen. I was able to get the rio to remove these from our bill but it took a battle. The first night I called the front desk in re: to movies not working they told me they would have someone up in 10-15 minutes. I waited 30 + minutes and called back they said again they would get someone right up. Nobody came, so we went to bed. 1am knock at the door, 2 hours later. We did not answer and then the front desk called the room. I requested that they come back tomarrow to fix because we were in bed. The next day they never showed up, had to call again. The pools are nice, with lots of lounge chairs. If you want a drink have no women in your party because it seems the waitresses only serve to single men. However, you can just walk up to 1 of the 2 pool bars to get your own. Pricing... This hotel is extremely overpriced. Other hotels on the strip have compareable pricing and much more to offer. The rio is not even located on the strip. Meals in the hotel for a family of 4 cost between $50-$100. None of the restraunts offer childrens menu's.

Reviews.Title: “The worst expirens of hotel in my life”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I live in USA just 2 years, I travel a lot of Europe, but I always think the best service I find in USA. We was last year in Belagio, really good hotel. This year we want stay in onother hotel but here is Pocker Tournoment (my husbend in). So we diside to stay here. Everyday something hapen bad, but it's to small and we are so happy waiting baby so we didn't see it. But last day when we go to have a lanch in Voodoo Louge it was must terrible day in my life. I was so scared and I am cray I fill like baby inside me move I think It's most bad expirians in my life. I never belive that it can happen in USA. Somewere in Chinise or Soviet Union but not so great country how USA. We have a dinner in restorant. After we go out and sit down on the big couches outside, it too eary for dance so was just couple people. My husbend have problem with legs. So he poot leg down but not toch couch with legs. Come security and try to put stuff before a party come. They boss come to my husbend and say that he need sit down right. Timmy don't understend what he want. When he understend he do it. But he go and come back, and say that he change his mind and he need to go with him. I didn't understend nothing. I think they talk about dinner or somethink. They took my husbend from me 3 big mans. And poot him in onother room. I was scary, really scary ask what happand. And this manager guy just say that Timmy don't listen him (Dennis Carvalho). I want to go to my husband. Couple people outside was scarry too, they don't know what to think they stay from couch and go in restorant. I was ask what happend they talk with me badly, one security man just lauph on me. Manager say that he is BOSS her and I can't do nothink he diside what to do here, and I can't report of him. I think personal try to help me to find husbend outside but they scared this gay. I can't belive it happend. We try to told about this in front desk, but they don't want to here us or notice about this acident. I can't belive that in USA can be somethink like this, I think it's mistakes or bad joke. But this man Dennis Carvalho talk with me really badly. Some security gay help me go out and find my husband. It's what my husbend told, if my English bad and you don't understend this. The management is rude, unfriendly and unocomadating. Voddo loune manager Dennis Carvalho, macho man, rude. I try to talk to him and he kicks me and my pregnant wife out of lounge after we ate dinner. Simply because i was outside and had relaxing after dinner. He is an embarrasment to this organization. The were rude to my pregnant wife. They took me away from her and really scared here. This all took place early in evening, completely ruined our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Okay”
Reviews.Author: DiabloDeb
Reviews.Content: Just came back last night from staying at the Rio in Las Vegas. We go to Vegas several times a year but had never stayed at the Rio before. The rooms were good size and had everything that you could possibly want in them. The maid service was quick and efficient. They have an array of restaurants which are all pretty good. I really enjoy Bamboleo's which is a Mexican style restaurant. Even though we have never stayed there before we have several times driven across town to go there to eat. If you haven't seen their Masquerade Show in the Sky above the casino - it's quite a sight (young or old) Although some people get a little out of hand trying to catch the beads they are throwing. There is a night club there called The Voodoo Lounge, although loud like a regular night club it has great views of all of Las Vegas. Couple of disappointing factors: Being off of the Strip you are not in walking distance to some of the major attractions. There is a shuttle service that leaves every half hour and takes you to their sister casinos or you can take a cab for under $10. It tends to get pretty crowded - I have never been there and it NOT be crowded except for first thing in the mornng. The one thing that really annoyed me were these few stands that they have up with people approaching you everytime you walked by trying to sell you on show tickets and things like that. It reminded me of telemarketers or the people selling things outside of stores. I haven't been in any other casino that does that. All-in-all, it's a nice place to stay . . . but if you are superstitious be sure they don't put you on the 13th. floor. Yes, they actually have 13 in the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the shows!”
Reviews.Author: xgirlrogue
Reviews.Content: The Rio is a constant party, one of the best we went to was the Chippendales show! Just amazing! Had such a great birthday party there. Went to to Voodoo club afterwards and finished out our morning dancing on the rooftop with a great view of the strip!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Alternative to the Strip”
Reviews.Author: LADWhitePlains
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Rio Suites was quite large and included a couch with a coffee table and a table and chair to go with a super king sized bed. Its not called " All Suites" for nothing. Although the room was not brand new and was somewhat worn around the edges, it was still way above average and the views from the higher floors are terrific. The hallways are long so be prepared for a five minute journey down to the lobby. The pool areas, complete with palm trees, will make you think you took the plane to Ochio Rios instead of Las Vegas. Quite nice. The days of the bargain buffet in LV are mostly over. The Rio charges about $14 plus tip for a breakfast buffet. Look for a coupon included with your check-in material for $5 off each member of your family. You can also order a la carte at the restaurant or pick up some pastries and coffee at either of two Starbucks in the hotel. The hotel has a free shuttle over to Harrahs, Caesar's and Bally's which are within walking distance during normal weather, but not in 100 degree summer temperatures. Be sure to see the free Carnival Show which begins everyday at 3Pm and repeats during the course of the evening.

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is a fun place!”
Reviews.Author: Charlene4329
Reviews.Content: I went to Las Vegas to catch Jonny Lang at the House of Blues on Thursday June 22nd. Since I was only going to be there one night, I didn't want to spend alot of $$$ for a room, . The Rio just happened to send me an offer for the same time I would be in Vegas for a 2 day free stay as long as I gambled for 4 hours total. So I took them up on it for just one night and I'm glad I did! I had a beautiful suite with floor to ceiling windows, a mini bar, small refridgerator, and a large sofa and a really nice TV. The bathroom wa gorgeous with a sink, shower & stool by itself with a separate dressing area with another sink, hair dryer, make up mirror and full length double mirrors on the closet doors. The front desk clerk let me check in early at 11AM, even though the official check in time is 4PM. Since I was alone, I used room service twice, even though it was a little pricey. The servers were friendly and laid out a tablecloth and the set the table for me on both occasions. The food was better than I expected. The casino is large with lots of my favorite penny & nickel slot machines; so it was no trouble to meet the hotel's requirement of 4 hours of play. I was able to check out of my room via the TV, which eliminated standing in line at the front desk. I had a great time and I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mizthing
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio. Had a large nice room. Didn't get the room we requested King bed. Service was slacking as far as drink service and getting help finding out information. Maid service and pool service and buffet service was excellent. The pool was very nice. The shuttle to the strip was free and enjoyed the drivers.

Reviews.Title: “Rio...rooms OK and have great views!”
Reviews.Author: compassquest
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Suites June 9 and 10th. The rooms were comped, so I guess I can't complain too much. We checked in very quickly at the airport! There was no line at all. Although our reservation said premier view, the check-in clerk said there were none available facing the strip. After a couple of minutes of chatting she "looked again?"...and yes we could get a strip view. We stayed here five years ago and not much has changed. Our stay was in the Masquerade Tower. The first thing we noticed was a bad musty odor in the halls as we got off the elevator, however the smell did not seem present in the room. The room was large and had a nice dressing area. The bedspread was a bit worn, and the bed was not the most comfortable I have slept in. All was clean though. Nice L-shaped sofa at other end of room. The entire room has floor to ceiling windows, so that is the best part of the room. Cute etched glass between bathroom and bedroom....light shines through when you have light on in bath. I don't think there have been any renovations to this room, so if I returned to the Rio, I would surely ask for an updated room.

Reviews.Title: “Room too Hot!!! No security”
Reviews.Author: jcrego
Reviews.Content: The reason I rated the Rio terrible is because of their attempt to save a buck on air conditioning at the customer's expense. They have installed a "motion control" device on the thermostat that senses when you are in the room. This device allows you to adjust the thermostat only when it senses motion (only when you are in the room). When it doesn't sense motion for a while (when you leave), it automatically goes intio "energy saving mode" which is a preset 80 degrees or so. The result is you always come back to a hot room. The day we stayed at the Rio it was 110 during the day and 97 for the low at night. Our room never cooled down to where we were comfortable. I'm sure this was some accountant's bright idea to pad the bottom line and to heck with the customer. Another issue is security. The only time I saw security checking guests going to the elevators/rooms was at 1:00 AM. We never saw them during the morning/afternoon. Neither was there a security check going into the pool area. The only plus I have was the Concierge. I had a problem printing my boarding pass and they spent about 30 minutes helping me get it straightned out with the airline. Even though I got a pretty good deal ($49/night), I don't think I would stay here again, at least not during the summer months.

Reviews.Title: “A More Down to Earth Resort”
Reviews.Author: MillenniManny
Reviews.Content: I spent four weekday nights at the Rio, on my fifth trip to Las Vegas after previous stays at Luxor, The Venetian, MGM Grand and Mandalay Bay. I chose Rio because I read it had a good pool area, and I was not disappointed. Although Mandalay Bay's pool area is incomparable, I thoroughly enjoyed the four pools at Rio for a few reasons. First, the pool area was not crowded--no catty encounters with other guests to get a chair to lay on. Second, at least one of the pools was not heated so I could get a cool blast to relieve the heat of the sun. Third, a good music mix was played that made the environment upbeat--although on one day there was a DJ who played the music too loud for my taste. Fourth, the grill by the pool served pretty good food (pricey and a limited menu, but they served the food in man-sized portions so I didn't feel I was being ripped off). The Rio is smaller than some of the other Las Vegas megaresorts, and this has its plusses and minuses. On the plus side, you won't get lost and you won't feel you have to walk a mile to get to your room. On the other hand, the casino is smaller and there are fewer restaurant and bar choices. The Rio is also a bit older than some of the other resorts and it is noticeable in some places like the elevators. Another thing I noticed is that the Rio has very low ceilings--I am maybe 5'8" and could reach up and touch the ceilings. My room was in the Ipanema Tower and seemed to have been recently renovated. The room itself was comfortable--they call it a "suite" but it is really just an ordinary room that is big enough to fit a couch and a small cocktail table. The decor was unimaginative and generic, mostly purple and gold fabrics and a beige carpet and walls. No flat panel T.V. or giant bath either. But I certainly can't complain about the value I got--my room rate ranged from $59 to $89 a night, which is a great deal considering that I could have paid $100 a night more at another Las Vegas resort without really getting much more for my money. On the down side, I will say that the front desk was unbelievably slow in checking people in, and the housekeeping staff seemed to do a fairly minimal job in tidying up the room. The Rio is also not the place for high society types who might prefer Bellagio or the Wynn--it is suitable for people who are looking for a more down to earth, unpretentious spot--for me it really hit the spot, because all I wanted to do was relax without a lot of fuss.

Reviews.Title: “Rotten Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rotten Rio - Car valets steal chunks of guests' cars. Casino management then gives guests the run-around. After staying three days at the Rio, when I got my car back from the valets, the whole chunk of my dashboard with the air conditioner and radio had been ripped out. It had to have been an inside job. There was no evidence of forced entry like a broken window or hacked car locks. The valets were the only one’s with the keys for 72 hours. I was obviously a little upset, but the staff did all they could to not allow me to speak to the hotel manager. They gave me the run around, and shoved me in the back of Sports Grill with some complimentary meal tickets. Needless to say, I was not hungry. When an hour had passed and I went to find out what the status was from the Rio’s "investigation" of the parking lot security tapes, I was led by the security supervisor to a back room where I was detained for half an hour with another Rio security member standing guard. The security supervisor then told me there was no tape, gave me a lot of canned answers about how sorry they were, finally took the report (now 3 hours later), then told me I would have to go down to the police station to personally fill out the report. In effect, the Rio did everything they could to scoot me out the door. I filed the report mostly for insurance reasons since I knew that the police clerk would tell me there was not much they could do, which she did. The thing that really makes the Rio look shady is that even as a paying registered guest of the hotel, not only did they not take care of my car, not only did they give me the run around and try to suggest that I was responsible for what happened, they did everything they could to get rid of me.

Reviews.Title: “May 17 & 18 - Would Visit Again!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at Rio All Suites (Wed/Thurs). Arrived 12:30am and the first room assigned to us still had wet carpets (they had been steam cleaned). Contacted front desk and moved up to the 17th floor in the Ipanema Tower with no problems. Room was spacious, clean, and with a great view of The Strip. We booked via expedia last minute and feel we got great value for our dollar. The shuttles between Rio and its sister casinos was great! We ate at the Village Seafood Buffet one night ... also good (make sure you look thru the room magazines to get a coupon for $10off). Visit Voodoo Bar for a drink and get the best view of the Strip in the City. The Masquerade in the Sky show is free and fun. Didn't use the pool area at all but it looked great. Would visit Rio again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room”
Reviews.Author: LaraF
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Rio often and this time was the best. Our room was unbelivable. For 79.00 a night we got a brand new refurbished room in the Impanema Tower. You could smell the new carpet and furniture. When you check in ask for a room in the Impanema tower and not the Masqurade. They are going to re-do those too but haven't started yet. Great value and beautiful room guaranteed!

Reviews.Title: “Rio May4-9”
Reviews.Author: lilchrissie
Reviews.Content: Booked a stay at the Rio for 5 nights. 2 adults and our three children (14, 8, 6). Even though the hotel caters to adult crowd the kids had a great time at the pool and catching beads during the parade. Kids even were in the parade. Fun. Kids had to stay along the outside of the casino floor when catching beads cause they could not be among the machines. But they still manage to catch a ton. The bead throwers usually found the kids! Room was great. Read several reviews that cleanliness was much to be desired so I really inspected the heck out of the place. Found no complaints. I did pack two bedsheets to use on the pull out cause I had also read in reviews it was difficult to get bedding for the pull out. Pillow were supplied in closet. No complaints about the room except NO TISSUE. A beautiful suite and we had to blow our nose with TP. However, the restrooms at the pool complex had 7-8 boxes laying around so we just stole one from their until we saw our maid the next day. Restaurants: Titled Kilt-great menu, good food, good service. Room Service-good food, fast, and the pizza hut pizza we ordered the kids was the best pizza hut pizza I've ever had! I know that's not saying much, but it was delish! Pool Grill-good food but very pricey (of course) American Bar-extremely loud, can't even hear yourself think. Food wasn't anything special and the service was slow and we wanted to get out of there, we all had headaches when we left there. entire vacation grade: B- I'm glad I stumbled upon this web site a year or so ago-it has really helped me in vacation planning and prep!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Rio”
Reviews.Author: jenna2345
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, with our teenage son, just spent 4 nights at the Rio. Overall it was a great experience. I'd looked at some of the other postings and started getting nervous about dirty rooms, noise and construction but we found none of those. Check-in was fast, our room was ready early, beds were comfortable and it was beautiful. Although it's a bit off the strip, there were shuttles that took people to Caeser's Palace, Bally's and Harrah's free of charge. After one day of walking the North Strip and totally exhausting our feet we learned a VITT - very important travel tip!! For $5, one can get a 24-hour bus pass for the Duece Bus. It's a double decker bus system that goes up and down the strip and into town and, I believe, connections can be made to other areas as well. Distances are great along the strip and that saved us hours of walking! They come along every five minutes or so and are wonderfully air-conditioned. We talked to people who had tried the monorail system and said this was much more convenient. Just catch them at any bus stop. The pool area at the Rio was incredible!!! After our first day of walking, we headed right to the pools and waded in the small sandy pool and it was like a foot massage. I got up early in the mornings and went to the pools then - before it got too hot! At first, there was just the noise of the birds, then about 9ish, the waterfalls would start and about 9:20 the music would come on - what a way to start the day! We didn't go for the fancy restaurants, the Sao Paulo was fine for us. My only complaint? Probably the $5 orange juice!!!! We went to the Sports Kitchen too because my son and I loved the Chicken Caeser Wrap! There were lots of small shops - nothing like the Venetian or Palace Forum but enough for us. the masquerade parade was fun to watch once. All in all, a great experience!

Reviews.Title: “The $9.00 tea bag.”
Reviews.Author: riccopalermo
Reviews.Content: The have coffee in room. I drink tea. Called down for a couple of tea bags. Was told they would charge me $9.00 per bag for two bags. We were staying in a $800.00 a night suite, which we paid for (not comp'd). I worked my way up through management. Not one of them budged. Never did get my tea. Nice place, but I will never stay nor gamble there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bachelor Party at the RIO”
Reviews.Author: T-bruin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio April 7 and 8 for a bachelor party with 7 other late 20's guys and it was great. If you are into the young vibe and don't want to be at Palms or Hard Rock, Rio is your place to be... The pool is great with many pools and great people... Gambling is great also with many tables and slots... Many younger people walking around but all in the wealthier class, not the trash you see at lesser strip hotels... I would recommend if you are younger looking for a good time with a great atmosphere and younger good looking people walking around all the time...

Reviews.Title: “Wont bother Staying Here Again”
Reviews.Author: gcrown22
Reviews.Content: I am curently in my hotel room at the rio while writing this. My second time to the rio, First time was a bad experience had to make a room switch late at night due to real noisy rooms that join walls, these walls and doors that go between the rooms are not even close to being a private situation its almost like you are staying with the other room right next door, usually can here everything, it was so bad i had to wake and move at 1:00 am while here on business, got to the next room and was really dirty carpet and the smell was bad but just lived with it. I also dont like all 25 min. blackjack evenduring the day no low tables. I left last year with a lot of complaints to management, I wrote them a letter the minute I got home and they responded with a 50.00 comp to my account for next stay??? I decided to come back and try rio again and thats where we are now in my room the second room already, when checking in i was real early like 9am, I explained i wanted a nice room clean, upgraded to a suite also and was willing to pay for it, last trip I lost 5k on the tables but I still have to pay for my rooms this stay with them at a discount but still will cost me several hundred, thats pretty cheap considering I brought another 5k to lose this time. They would not guarantee me an upgraded room even paying for it, I have been asking for a month prior to get a suite and pay and not 1 person would get me a better room even paying???? They tracked all my play and dont even care wether they get my business. Anyhow I tried as hard as I can to not get a standard dirty room and the desk person assured me I would love my suite strip view, I continued to try to get a better suite but no luck, I got to my room in the masquerade tower I think #30015 right next to the elevator, I walked in and was hit with an very strong odor of deodarizing spray so heavy i was getting that sick feeling in my gut. I checked the bed and found hairs on both pillows, the tv remote was missing, the mini bar was not stocked, the windows were so dirty I honestly could not see hardly anything outside, the unit was large but not a clean one all they did was cover up a big nasty party room with smell spray and sent me in. even if i was comped I would not expect this type of room, but i was paying 150.00 on a sat and 85.00 for a sunday. I went to the desk and asked to switch rooms they put me in the older tower that had been remolded smaller room but was cleaner and a little nicer still not worth what i was paing in my mind. that room had no privacy door hanger, no book that has all the numbers and extensions of all the hotel depts, the room has some kind of wierd sink problem that makes loud noises. the elevators in this tower must be broken at least some of them cause everyone is complaining. I will say the employees and dealers have been very nice, but Not a good experience, Oh yeah I lost all my room comps from last stay that management gave me due to my problems last time, the comp is gone and all my player data from last stay is reset back to zero because i havenot returned in 6 months since my last visit????? Why collect points if they are going to just steal them back. save yourself the trouble and find a property thats wants your play and provides a clean room to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Great - don't what others are complaining about”
Reviews.Author: bedrockboy
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay at the Rio with the entire family (I'm a 31 year old male). We had 3 rooms and all of them were just fine. My room in particular was a 2 double non-smoking room, good size (it's an all-suite hotel) and very clean. The maid service was just fine. No complaints at all. We ate at the following restaurants: Carnival World Buffet - had breakfast there a couple of times, was very good. Not as good as a couple in town (I think Paris has the best breakfast buffet) but certainly in the top 10. I think it was $13.99 Village Seafood Buffet - went there twice, I loved it. You obviously need to really like seafood to justify the 35-40 bucks this will set you back, but if you do you'll certainly be happy. All American Bar & Grill - went there a few times and was happy with everything I had. It serves lunch and dinner weekdays and breakfasts as well on weekends. I kept it simple, had burgers and quesadilla and was happy everytime. Antonio's - other members of our party went there and liked it. Our background is Italian so if we thought it was good you probably will too. Sports Kitchen - beside the Race and Sport Book. It's bar food and it's good for bar food. Entertainment Tony and Tina's - a few people in our party saw it and thought it was ok. Food was terrible, show was pretty funny. Don't bother paying full price for the tickets (85 bucks) you can get them for about 60 and the half price places on the strip (Tix4tonight - 2-4-1 tickets) - it's not completely half price since the buffet portion on the ticket isn't discounted. Scinta's - was pleasantly surprised. This was one of the better shows I've seen in Vegas and I've seen a couple dozen of them. Nice mixture of comedy and singing. I think you'll like it. Don't bother paying full price as well on this one (half price tickets usually available) but it'll be worth it if u do. Other shows avaiblable: Penn & Teller (funny magic men), Ronn Lucas (daytime comedy), Erocktika (for male pervs), Chippendales (for females pervs.) Casino Casino layout is very good, it's basically 2 different casinos. The Masquerade part where they have the show in the sky is kind of a stand alone. Limits on the table games are a minimum of $10 and sometimes $15. The race and sports book is a good size and not real busy unless it's a big event. The day we left was a zoo since March Madness had begun. Poker Room is beside the sportsbook. There's a daily tournament ($40 buy-in) at noon, and games basically going all day (4-8 limit, and 2-5 no limit). The one drawback with this hotel in the past was that you were a cab ride to the strip - they've fixed that. They have 3 seperate shuttles going to Bally's, Harrah's and Caesars. Takes about 25 minutes to make the route there and back. If you're just looking for a ride to the strip you won't be waiting more than a few minutes. On the way back you may have to wait longer since you'll be waiting for one specific bus as opposed to jumping on the first one that shows up. Don't know what other people were complaining about in previous posts but let me defend the Rio (no I don't work for the company). 1) It's too loud in the casino - it's a freakin casino people - they tend to be loud. 2) food is expensive - Not really. The Bar and Grill is comparable to most Vegas cafe type places - bacon cheese burger with fries was $11 I think. The buffet was 13.99 for breakfast, like 23 or so for dinner. If you can't afford 20-25 bucks for dinner, you may want to stay out of Vegas. 3) it's a long walk to the strip - Don't walk to the strip. It's a 6 cab ride or if you're broke or cheap take the shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before going to the Rio”
Reviews.Author: jfkadlec
Reviews.Content: We were at the Rio this past week. We went there to attend a meeting, and would probably stay there again if another meeting is located there, but otherwise would bypass this place altogether. The check in was okay. The clerk was pleasant. Although we had requested a king size non-smoking room when we made reservations months earlier, none was available when we checked in unless it was at the low tower. Since the other people we knew were at the high tower we took the double queen suite they offered at check in. Although the bathroom of the king size bed room our friends were in was very generous, the two queen size suite we were in had a bathroom the size you get when staying at a Motel 8. You had to back away from the bathroom door by the toilet to get out. The bathroom door is also very thin, and certainly not sound proof. Cleanliness left a lot to be desired, not only in our room but also in the rooms occupied by friends. It was okay for a two star hotel, but we had expected more from what we thought would be luxury accomodations. Even the cheap little tray for the soap was stained. There were also marks on the wall under the towel rack which could have been removed with some 409 and a little elbow grease. The tub and shower had mold growing in the corners, something we control at home, and don't expect in an expensive hotel. There was no soap or soap dish in the bathroom, only at the basin outside the bath. No shower cap, mouthwash, conditioner or other amenity was offered. Although we were in a non-smoking room we could periodically smell cigarette smoke in the room. I don't know if the entire floor is non-smoking or only individual rooms. The lobby and casino are extremely noisy. You have to search for someplace quiet enough to eat if you are planning to have a conversation. The food is pretty good even though expensive. Although there is a small refrigerator in the room, there is no coffee maker or complimentary coffee in the rooms. My wife always likes the coffee upon awakening, and in order to have it, she had to wait until showered and dressed. Although an internet connection is available, it is not complimentary. If you want to pick up your e-mail at their business center, it is 10 dollars for 10 minutes. To go to their workout center, even as a guest it is an additional 20 dollars. Although the brouchures and internet pictures suggest that there is lavish entertainment in the casino, it is hardly that. It is extremely loud though. The meeting facility or convention center is good. The sound system and projection facilities were good. Unfortunately, to get from the hotel tower to where the meetings are held it is about three or four blocks. If you are attending a meeting there, plan enough time for a long walk. On the map, it seems that the Rio is located close to the strip. It isn't. It is a long walk. If you take the free shuttle from the Rio to Harrahs, figure that it will take a half hour. They run the shuttle every 15 minutes, but the shuttle buses are small and can't take all the crowd. It takes about the same time to walk the distance. All in all, we were in Las Vegas for three and a half days. The Rio doesn't compare with the nicer places on the strip. It is awkward to get to, offers little, and the facility comes off as a tired old place. With the exception of their convention facility it is no more than a three star place and off the beaten path. We paid big bucks to stay there because our meeting was there, but wouldn't recommend it at more than seventy or eighty dollars. If you can stay on the strip for close to the same price you would be well off doing so.

Reviews.Title: “We usually stay at The Rio”
Reviews.Author: joolz425
Reviews.Content: We visit Vegas frequently. We usually stay at the Rio because of the spaciousness of the rooms and that it's somewhat away from the traffic of The Strip. The rooms are clean and we have never had problems. I also like that it has a safe and fridge in the room. I always feel very comfortable there. We get some good rates on off season months. It's worth while to join the Total Rewards as they sometimes send special rates by mail.

Reviews.Title: “nice rooms and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back and wanted let everyone know that we had a great stay at the rio. The rooms are better then the other hotels we have stayed at. We did have some problems but the staff more then compensated us for our problems. The gambling is just average compared to the other places, but getting to the other casinos from the rio is no problem. We will stay here again because of the rooms and the staff. We thought the beds were comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Eroticka Show Las Vegas Tittilating!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First trip to Vegas, hubby and I bought tickets in advance via Vegas for about $60 each. Should have waited and bought them at Tix2nite, they would have been half price. Being in the music industry ourselves, we were looking forward to having someone else entertain us for a change. We chose one show for our 3 day trip, Erocktica! A perfect blend of rock music, bare chested hotties, and sexy dancing. We weren't disapointed. When we arrived at the Rio Hotel, we went first to the VooDoo Lounge and weren't impressed at all, (see review on VooDoo Lounge by searching for VooDoo Lounge) that all changed once we set foot in the Erocktica show. A quick glance around we saw a couple hundred people all cramped together in little seats. Looked like a school assembly with everyone on banquet chairs. Ugh, not for us. There was a roped off area with nice booths that weren't being used. We asked the usher/security guy what that seating was for. He replied that it was reserved seating. Okaaaay, it was obvious that this situation called for a bit more finesse. A quick discreet tip to the "GUY" got the rope removed and a nice booth for us to enjoy the show. Things just seem to work like that in Vegas. The show was amazing, the music pumping and the girls beautiful. Gabriella, Sasha and RJ were clearly the stars, incredible vocals and big ups to RJ for his rockin Hip Hop MC style. There were quite a few moments during the show where he had to carry the show while the girls changed outfits. He did so with relative ease. The tunes took us all back and made us smile. Loved the pussycat doll segment. We definatly recommend this show. Gabriella and RJ come out after the show to meet their fans, a nice touch. We would see it again. Very Worth the $.

Reviews.Title: “Hardly any issues with the Rio”
Reviews.Author: sierrameadow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (both in our 30's) stayed at the Rio for 3 nights in January (9th Floor, Impenema Tower). We usually stay at Mirage and TI, but Rio out-comp'd them. Pros: Room was modern, comfortable, clean and totally spacious. We both liked the extra space and larger-sized TV. Good/friendly service at check-in, the Avis car rental counter and the craps table. Very good dealers. Room service was also very good. Hallways were mostly quiet. Almost every Rio employee we came across was helpful and courteous. Cons: Not enough towels in the bathroom (had to ask for more), dancers near the slot machines were distracting (not so bad at night, but out of place during late morning), and the cab line is annoying to get to (especially when it's windy and cold). All-in-all, we both enjoyed the Rio and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel and Casino in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: MeccaDog
Reviews.Content: The Rio offers a large casino, good entertainment (world famous Penn and Teller), a nice buffet, and friendly service. What makes it average is the decor and location. To be fair, it was cold so we didn't use the large tropically designed pool area. This may be a big selling point. As far as the rooms are concerned, they are spacious, but the interior is drab. Even worse, this hotel is not on the main strip. This means your shuttle from the hotel (if even available) will cost more, and you will pay for taxis every day to get 'into the action' on the strip. The hotel offers two alternatives, a shuttle to Harrah's (wasn't available when I wanted to leave so I didn't use it) or you could walk into the strip. Walking, however, means about one mile on foot through busy traffic, on the overpass of a major interstate, which is a deal killer for most. Overall, not bad, would recommend for the right price -- but if you don't get a significant break off the competitors on the strip, don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “nice place to stay, but off strip”
Reviews.Author: ginka7
Reviews.Content: stayed there the first part of november 2005. Was there on business but stayed one night on my own and got it for a very reasonable 109.00/night. I had a beatiful room on the 18th floor which over looked the pool. The room was quite large, with plenty of sitting space and sleeping space. The floor to ceiling windows really added to the ambiance of the room. The bathroom is not as nice as some of the other places in las Vegas, but the little window in the shower so that you can see outside is really cool. there are 2 sinks, one inside the bathroom and one outside the bathroom in the 'changing area', which makes it nice if 2 people need to get ready at the same time. I ordered desert from room service one night that was delivered in a timely matter and had a very nice presentation. The place is large and lots to do with in the hotel and casino. The only thing that i did that i would do different next time, was dinner in the seafood buffet. I wasnt aware at the time that there are two different buffets in the casino, and went to the first (only, I thought) buffet. It was very good, but was like 38.00. (per person) I found out later that the other one was only like 24.00. granted, the first one had lobster, shrimp, crawfish adn everything imaginable. I dont know to what extend the dinner buffet at the other one was, but I did eat breakfast there (it was free with the room, be sure to ask about this option when checking in), and it was VERY bountiful! I dont gamble a lot, just nickel and penny slots, but did not win a SINGLE time (never was even ahead), and since I have never had this happen before (where I never even got ahead), I dont know if it was just bad luck or if the slots are very tight. There is a shuttle to the strip (takes you to Harrah's) that some reviews stated was a hassle. I did not find that to be true. Yes, there is a little bit of a walk from pick up and drop off, but where ISNT there in vegas? I found it to be very easy, efficient and safe. I was alone when I did this and didnt have any problems, even at night. The only 'problems' I encountered during the stay was, number one, it seemed like every time I left my room and came back, my key card didnt work. This happened AT LEAST 5 different times. although this was inconvient, it was handled quickly by calling security and having them let me in, instead of having to walk all the way back to the lobby each time (a long walk). Then the next time I was down there, I had a new key made. The ohter problem (or disappointment i guess) was the 'carnival in the sky' was closed the entire time I was there so they could decorate and get ready for the Christmas rendition. I understand the need, just would have been nice to see. Overall, it was a nice hotel, nice staff and a great stay. The pool looked nice, but it was too cold while i was there to check out.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Going Down Hill”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th stay at the Rio for a conference. It has been going steadily down hill. The room I had in the Ipanema Tower can only be described as shabby with the carpet in dire need of replacement and stains on the arm of the chair. The Rio provides high speed internet access (for $12.95/day compared to free in a place like the Comfort Inn) which I needed for business but I could never access it even at 6:00 AM. Their video checkout did not work either. They also closed Toscano's Deli to be replaced with a noodle restaurant. It was the only place you could get something to eat like a snack or a quick inexpensive lunch. They force you to go to their sit down restaurants. We went to Outback Steakhouse across the street and got a great meal at a great price. On the positive side, the people were all very freindly and helpful and the casino was fun. If I go back to Las Vegas, I will not be staying at the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been to RIO many times. Its the only place I stay. Let me expalin to you what the deal is here. If you are a total rewards member and play here and there, they will comp you. other than that the room prices are high. if you dont mind paying then you will get more moneys worth. the suite rooms are BIG. 600sq feet. very clean and very nice. they have 2 all you can eat places thats the best. one sea food and the other is normal food. the only bad thing is that they are away from the strip. other than that very friendlt ppl and easy to work with.

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Rio!”
Reviews.Author: kelz50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on the 18th floor of the Masquerade Tower. The suite was large and quite clean. Had a king bed, large couch, fridge, blow dryer, iron and ironing board. Not one thing to complain about and it was all comped after 1 previous stay with my sister-in-law after gambling with a Rewards Card in February. The shuttle to Harrah's to get to the strip was great, so no problem not being right on the strip. Ate at both the World Carnival Buffet and the Voodoo Cafe. Great food and variety at the buffet and the view was spectacular at the Voodoo Cafe and the food delicious and unique. Everyone treated us wonderfully! Enjoyed our free tickets to see the Scintas and also the HEART fundraiser for Harrah's employees affected by the hurricanes this year. Got a sampling of so many good Harrah's acts. Just love Clint Holmes and look forward to seeing Ronn Lucas, George Wallace and Max Alexander soon.

Reviews.Title: “Really terrible experience - bed bugs and bad service”
Reviews.Author: happydoc
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at several places in Vegas and will not be staying at the Rio again. Firstly, our King size room was not available and we got two queens...that wasn't too bad till we started getting bed bug bites! The hallway leading to our room was being renovated and there was dust everywhere as they were laying down tile and it was terribly noisy. The floor was filthy from all the renovation and I didn't understand why they didn't just put us in a different tower (we were in the ipenema tower.) When I tried to tell the management about the bed bugs I got the run around. As a physician it really grossed me out and I consider it a health issue and just wanted to tell someone so they could do something about it. Well, after waiting more than half an hour to talk to someone, they eventually said go talk to security. I waited there for another half hour and by this time I was getting rather annoyed. So I returned to the front desk to let them know (thinking maybe I was again in the wrong place) and I couldn't believe it! They told me the reason I had to go to security was so that someone could take photos of my body where I had been bit! I promptly left...no one is taking photos of my body! Goodness knows where those photos might end up! Ate at the buffet - ok but the worst meal I had was the congee (a chinese dish) - at over $10 for a small bowl it had to the most expensive bowl of congee I have ever had in my life! Service truly was poor considering the type of hotel it is...and the smoke was everywhere. Do yourself a favor and stay at the Renaissance....way better!

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service..average at best”
Reviews.Author: tomandkaren245
Reviews.Content: There was absolutely no advantage making online reservations. We requested a king-size bed, smoking suite with the strip view. We arrived to discover that there weren't any king smoking rooms available on the strip side and were offered a two queen bed, smoking room on the strip side. The room was nice but we couldn't find any ashtrays. We called the front desk and were told it didn't matter, if you want to smoke, go ahead. They offered to move us the next day based on availability but without promise. We decided not to pursue the offer because we thought it would be a waste of our time. Not very good customer service for non-comped first-timers in Vegas. We went down to the casino for a drink that night. The first bar we waited 15 minutes while the bartender talked at the other end of the bar, not once noticing us, so we left and went to another bar. The same-type service was rendered at the second bar. What type of place is this anyway? Finally we sat at a bar that had video poker. The bar tender immediately offered free drinks if we spent $20 on play. The two drinks would've been cheaper if we hadn't played. Oh well. We thought it would get better and we were wrong. Time after time we had to wait excessively to get a drink. Upon check-out you would think they would ask you how everything was. Not! Maybe they would act as if they wanted you to comeback again. Not! And we won't be coming back. Just as well that they didn't ask.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is not the same - got worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: - MOVED FROM ROOM TO ROOM 3 TIMES IN 3 DAYS :( We stayed at Rio many times. Just came back and this time was a disaster. Booked Premium (strip view) room online. When came to the Hotel at front desk they told us it's a Strip view room. When we opened the room (11 fl) it was totally not what we paid for, dirty carpet, the room smelled and of course NO STRIP view. Went back (at 1am) and they only were able to offer another room (3rd fl) very noisy room (view on Rio's air conditioning system) But we were so tired so we agreed. Next morning they moved us again to a higher floor (15 fl) Strip view. Room was ok yet internet connection didn't work properly. Elevators - dirty. It's not the same RIO we used to visit and enjoy. Terrible experience this time. They just lost a faithful customer...oh well

Reviews.Title: “Rio is great”
Reviews.Author: waspkiller
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights at the Rio and it was great. This is not a place for kids and that is one thing I like about it. The pools are nice and easy to get too. Service is great. The only thing I did not like is that they seem to have only single deck blackjack and remove the doubling down, spliting and backjack 3 to 2 pay. This is now common for strip hotels with single decks but I would prefer a shoe and normal rules. Other than that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fun with our Grandkids at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: fendifendi
Reviews.Content: We had 3 rooms at the Rio early in October 2005 - Hint: Keep checking for their best Hot Deals on room rates...they fluctuate alot - we saved alot by doing this - we paid $59 a night for the week nights. The front desk staff is very friendly and they will honor your requests - Ask for more towels, soap, etc, - they are at first skimpy with these items - but will make adjustments. Make sure to go up to the Voodoo Lounge and see the fabulous view - at night it's excellent. The decor of the Voodoo Lounge restaurant was unique - We sampled the buffets which worked out well for the grandkids...the food was OK - Las Vegas has more exciting buffets...alternate with the Paris, the Luxor and the Bellagio. Check the Internet for special discounts on their 2 different buffets - we saved $10 PP on the Seafood buffet - and $5 PP on the other buffet. The kids loved the Masquerade in the Sky show - especially getting the beads that were thrown to them. They also enjoyed the many lagoon style swimming pools and beautifully landscaped hot tubs. They have a sandy beach with palm trees. The kids also loved jumping on the big beds in their oversized room. In the casinos they have "Bevertainers" - very attractive beverage staff dancing and singing on raised platforms. The shuttle worked out fine - but this hotel is across a highway and separated from the strip - some of the shuttle drivers took a longer route to get to Harrah's. Watch out for the Time Share sellers located all over the lobby and also at Harrah's - they are very aggressive and are to be avoided!!! Don't confuse them for the Rio hotel staff when they offer free shows... We went to the Fairfield Resorts Time Share presentation - it was a horrible experience. As for other discounts on food and shows...there are many LV magazines in the rooms which contain discounts and 2 for 1 show offers. I called the front desk to comment that the kid's room were not as fresh looking as ours - there were stains on the sofa and carpet - The manager immediately sent up a $100 gift certificate to our room as an apology as well as extra towels, soap,etc. Hotels do need constant renovation and the Rio is doing a good job keeping up. We really liked the Rio and felt that with the pool environment it was as good as being in Mexico or the Carib.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is th hottest in Vegas!!”
Reviews.Author: sdecker77
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many nice places in Vegas over the years. But, the trip we took mid-September at the Rio is definitely the best!! The Rio provided the largest and most beautiful suite we ever imagined. The view was superb and the service at the Rio cannot be beat. Fantastic restaurants, clubs and gambling was all at the Rio overall in comparison to all other places we visited during this trip and in the past. We cannot say enough great things about the RIO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews on RIO I was VERY NERVOUS regarding our long weekend in Aug. However, once we arrived, things were much better than expected. (We are regulars to Las Vegas - but had never stayed here) We were comped our stay and decided since they were off the strip, we would rent a car. (Hotels don't usually charge for parking) In reading the reviews everyone complained about the distance from the parking garage to the front desk (and having to walk thru the masquarade area). HELPFUL HINT: UPON ARRIVAL DO NOT PARK IN THE MASQUARADE PARKING....park in the lots closer to the Carnival Buffet - they are closer to the front desk and the Impan. Tower. We made that mistake ONLY ONCE. Since we are now Platnium members, check in was very smooth. Orig. we had requested 2 queen beds and our friends decided to not show up so we asked for a change to a king and the room we got had an INCREDIBLE VIEW. If you get the chance - ask for a CORNER ROOM. We had two walls of windows and overlooked the pools and the strip. It was very nice. The DOWNFALL to a corner room is the location of the bed, there is an echo from the hallway due to the layout of the doorway - so be prepared for the echo but the view when the sun comes up is well worth it. As for the cleanliness, it was what I expected for a highly-popular hotel. Everything was clean, but there were minor stains on a couch but again, every stain doesn't always come out when you clean it. The Seafood buffet was OK - not my favorite - and the Carnival Buffet was still good. They even have a seperate dining area for Platnium members which was very nice. I would highly recommend getting the players card since they are very loose on COMPS and offer some nice touches for the members. I don't consider us big-time gamblers and we have gotten some very nice offers from them for our level of play. The staff was all very helpful including a woman at the Total Rewards desk who worked some magic for us to get the best REWARDS possible during our stay. Don't be afraid to ask for something - you may get it. As for the gaming - we had both good and bad runs on video poker, 3-card and blackjack. The dealers were friendly - and IT GETS VERY CROWDED ON THE WEEKENDS. If you are only going for a quick trip and don't mind being off the strip - it is a nice place to stay. GOOD LUCK!!!

Reviews.Title: “VERY RASPY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from hotel today. At checkin I requested a renovated room, after walking in room I didnt mean renovated 10 years ago. Floors, walls, lampshades were stained. Blood on side of toilet tank. Curtains were nasty and torn. Bathtub was not clean. I decided to live with it because I has already unpacked and was very tired. Between average food, the old casino, and their hand out every second for money, I will not stay again. We even checked out a day early and they wanted to charge me for leaving early.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed with the Rio”
Reviews.Author: kal27
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Rio. Our room was comped in advance. We've been going to Vegas for 20 years and have stayed at several other hotels, primarily the Mirage but this was our first time at the Rio. Check in was smooth. Requested a renovated room in the Impenema Tower (good choice-thanks to advice from other trip advisor users). Although the room was spacious and clean it smelled like drywall and saw dust probably due to the extensive remodeling going on on the same floor. Hallways were dirty, light fixtures in the halls were damaged and not once during our stay did the cleaning people take out the dirty glasses or coffee mugs from our room which was very odd. Some positive things were-Voodoo lounge-awesome view (free cover in most of their clubs if you print VIP coupons off the Rio web-site). Good food at buffet, Voodoo Cafe, Sao Paulo and the Mexican Restaurant there. Pools were pretty-but shallow. Chaise lounges were battered but plentiful and poolside cocktail service was non existent. Dealers were friendly. Lots of good night clubs (I-Bar, Club Rio). On the bad side we felt very landlocked. There is a free shuttle that runs roundtrip from Harrahs on the strip but it was so busy in the evening you'd have to wait for a long time. Cab fare is $12-$15 to the strip and close to $20 to go downtown. Best cab fare were from Ace-worst were Yellow -Checker co. Our biggest complaint is this. We had an emergency at home and both our babysitter and the local police dept. called to try to reach us or leave us a message at the Rio. They couldn't even leave us a message. The Rio said we hadn't activated our voice mail service! What the heck does that mean??? Thank God they finally reached us by cell phone. Weighing both the good and the bad I would not stay at the Rio again even for free. The Mirage is far cleaner and has a better location.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the rio”
Reviews.Author: simon8748038
Reviews.Content: we only had one night but the rio was a nice hotel. the suite size rooms are the best part of the hotel. you cannot believe the room you have and it is a nicely decorated suite. we had a couple of minor things that needed fixed but since we only had one night we did not want to get maintenance. the casino is okay. the pool looked fun. they have some nice restaurants. all in all we enjoyed the rio.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: RedHead13
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the TripAdvisor reviews about the Rio, I have to admit, I was a little leery about our impending reservations there. Through the Harrah's Total Rewards program, my husband and I were offered the first night for free, $65 for the second night, and $50 for the third. I was *hoping* that the discounted suites wouldn't be as horrible as some of the reviews indicated. I held my breath and hoped that our $115 accommodations were going to be decent! After taking a short taxi ride from the airport we arrived at the Rio around 9:30pm on a Friday night. We were expecting check-in to be a little hectic, but we were processed very quickly, and were given a "renovated" suite at our request. Our suite was located on the 16th floor of the Ipanema Tower (which is the older of the 2 towers, but seems to have more recently renovated rooms). The Ipanema Tower was very easy to access from the main lobby and taxis, and the elevators were conveniently located right next to Starbucks. If we had decided to stay in the Masquerade Tower, we would have had to trek across the length of the casino, and through the Masquerade Village, just to get to the elevators! When we arrived to our suite, we were very surprised at the size and cleanliness of the room. The decor wasn't fancy by any means, but everything looked new and neat. The room came equipped with a King size bed, a desk, a sofabed, a minibar, a refrigerator, a huge bathroom with 2 sinks, and a dressing area. We had a mountain view location, which looked out onto the Palms Casino. It wasn't the most scenic view, but with the 110 Vegas heat, you don't want to open the curtains very often anyhow! We couldn't believe how quiet the room was, even in the wee hours of the morning, when we knew folks were returning from a late evening out. The Rio casino itself seemed very outdated and a bit cheesy, but that didn't seem to stop the crowds from rolling in. We played a bit of Roulette and Pai Gow Poker, and didn't have much luck. The slot machines looked a bit worn, and I couldn't find any of my favorite games. Since Harrah's owns the Rio, there was a continuous shuttle service that ran between the two hotels, which was a free and easy way to get to the strip if you didn't want to have to take a cab. The Rio pools (all 4 of them) were very nice, and had a good vibe. We headed out at 11am two days in a row, and were able to find some nice chaise lounges in the shade without too much trouble. The pool was comprised of a mix of families and young partygoers, and everyone got along very nicely. The pool area offers 2 bars, and a walk-up stand that serves sandwiches and burgers. Be prepared to spend a bit of cash if you plan on having lunch or snacks while poolside. Out of the 10 eateries that the Rio features, we only sampled the food at the All-American Bar and Grill. The Grill features aged meats, International spirits and a nice selection of appetizers and burgers. We found the food to be very tasty, and quite reasonable compared to most of the meals we ate while in Vegas. A hearty-sized lunch cost about $20 for the both of us. If you're looking for some nightlife, the Voodoo Lounge atop the 51st floor of the Masquerade Tower is an excellent place to start. With views of the entire strip, and a DJ spinning on Friday and Saturday nights, the Lounge draws in a 20/30-something crowd. The cover charge is $20 per person, but you may be able to find some discount vouchers if you check in with the local cabbie. We had a great time overlooking the city, and enjoyed the fresh air of the outdoor deck. We even met Jared (of Subway Sandwiches fame) in the elevator on the way up! I took a picture of him on my cameraphone, and have included it for your viewing pleasure. As our stay was coming to an end, we were actually sad to leave the Rio! The suite and the pools were really enough to convince us that this was a destination that we would make an effort to visit again. This was a very affordable option that exceeded our expectations!

Reviews.Title: “The Rio is a solid performer”
Reviews.Author: Cloverleaf1978
Reviews.Content: I have been to Las Vegas many times and have stayed at a variety of hotels. The Rio is a solid performer. We arrived on a Friday afternoon and left on Monday morning. We stayed on the 9th floor of the Impanena (sp?) tower. There was construction on one of the hallways but it did not cause us any problems. They had nicely placed a curtain to cover the mess. The room was very large and modern. It was decorated in modern browns, cafe au lait and cream colors. The bed was comfortable, but not luxury (no down comforters, no excessive pillows, no fabulous bedding). The bathroom was acceptable and had a sink/vanity. Outside the bathroom was a long counter/vanity with another sink. The closet/storage was adequate. There is a large (36") television, and a foldout full size couch, a comfortable chair, a small table with 2 table chairs. The windows take up an enitre wall and are floor to ceiling. We faced the back of the hotel away from the strip, but did have a nice view of the mountains. There is a minibar, which is well stocked. The casino is ok. It is not classy and glamorous like the Bellagio or the Wynn but it is nice. The weird Mardi Gras boats that go around on the tracks on the ceiling seemed to be inop. Personally, I thought this was better. There is a large mask hanging from the ceiling with television screen eyes. One of the eyes was not working and I thought this looked rather cheap. The nightlife is also ok. We only went to the VooDoo Lounge one night. The cover charge at $20 was WAY WAY WAY too much. It is a pretty nice bar/club with an outside area with an AMAZING view of the Strip. (The club is on the 50th floor). They had a live band, which did a decent job playing a variety of hits. There are girls dancing in "cages" and a nice sized crowd built up. The drinks were astronomically priced, but I do recommend the drink in the large glass that they drop dry ice in to make it smoke. It was very tasty! The restaurants are ok as well. Both buffets are ok. The seafood buffet is pretty good but entirely overpriced for what you get, and if you don't like seafood then you are not going to find much to eat. The American Bar and Grille is pretty good, but do not order any chicken dish (besides wings) as they were very very dry. There is no good shopping to speak of. Just tacky tourist shops. The pool area is very nice. We went down everyday at about 11am and had no problem at all finding lounge chairs wherever we wanted to sit. There are four pools and none of them were too crowded. We were waited on very well. The drinks are very very pricy. The frozen drinks were good though and perfect for outside. The hot tubs were not very hot either in location or temperature. There are some fancy looking tent things which were mostly empty. I don't know how you get access to these tents nor how much they cost. We went and saw Penn and Teller. This show is very funny, and we got really great seats (fourth row, center). The staff booking the show was very helpful. All in all, I had a nice time at the Rio. Its location is off the strip slightly, but really that was ok with me. The staff was nice to me at every location. The rooms are great. The pool is great. The casino is like any other casino. The nightlife was good, but entirely overpriced. The shopping is non-existant. In conclusion, I would go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unreasonably Slammed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
