Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio for 3 nights first week of August. We were a little nervous since we had read the TripAdvisor reviews and they weren't glowing. We needn't have worried!! The Rio was outstanding and @ $59.00/night, a steal of a deal! ALL staff bent over backwards to be helpful, the buffet was great and the room was absolutely outstanding and positively HUGE !! The pools were great and the Strip shuttle a breeze. The close proximity to The Palms and The Gold Coast also provided some fantastic buffets that cost next to nothing which we wouldn't have explored if we had been on the Strip. We will absolutely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading all the good reviews about the Rio I was really disappointed with my stay at the Rio. The room was terrible. It was on the 8th floor which is under construction, so you had to pass by a big mess every time you went to the elevator. The carpeting was the dirtiest I have ever seen in a hotel. The windows were also really dirty. One of the bath towels reeked of men's aftershave - so it must have been reused without washing (neither my 15 year old granddaughter or I use aftershave). Water gurgled up in the sink drain in the vanity area every time water was run in the bathroom sink. Even though the pool area is very nice, it closes at 7PM. There were no signs anywhere to let guests know this. My granddaughter had just gotten into the pool at 6:45 PM and then was told at 7:00PM that everyone had to leave. This was August, it was 99 degrees. I arrived at the gym, ready to excersise, only to be informed that there was a $20 per day per person charge to use the gym equipment, again, no information provided to guests about this fee ahead of time. I stayed at the Rio for two nights. I paid full price the second night and the first night was slightly discounted. I'm sure I could have gotten better for less or would have paid more for a quality room.

Reviews.Title: “Viva Las Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was quite possibly the best hotel I have ever stayed in. The suite was absolutely beautiful, modern but comfortable furniture, full bar in both living room and bedroom, hot tub, gorgeous floor to ceiling view of the strip, and a very thoughtful staff that provided an excellent atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Rio can be a diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: livingnindy
Reviews.Content: We planned a mid July Las Vegas trip when we received a voucher for 2 nights/3 days free at the Rio All Suite Hotel and Casino. The temperature during the day was hot (100-106 degrees F.), however it was without the humidity that we are used to at home. So, we actually found it to be more tolerable than the hot and humid summer days that we are used to. Because we were using a free voucher for our hotel we had to check in to Harrah’s, which owns the Rio. So, from the airport we took a shuttle bus to Harrah’s. The shuttles are $5 to hotels on the strip, a little more to hotels downtown. Or, you can take care of your return trip to the airport by buying a round-trip shuttle bus ticket for $7. The shuttles tend to wait until they are full with riders before they will depart the airport. So, when picking a shuttle to board, it might be best to find one that is close to capacity, decreasing the time that you might be waiting. After checking in at Harrah’s we made our way over to the Rio. Check-in there went extremely smooth and did not take much time at all. In order to get to our room in the Masquerade Tower, we had to walk through the casino and through the very busy Masquerade Village. However, once on the elevators, the noise along with the hustle and bustle of the casino was completely gone. We were rather pleased with our room. Our room was extremely large, with a spacious bathroom and changing area with vanity. There was a sitting area with an L-shaped couch and television. There was also a small table for two, a small refrigerator, and a giant king sized bed. The windows took up pretty much the entire wall and were from floor to ceiling. We had a beautiful view of the mountains and the pool by day. During the night we could see the beautiful lights of the strip, from the Mirage, up to the Stratosphere and beyond. There are rooms available that have better views of the Strip, however we enjoyed having both the mountain and Strip view. Although, the room could have definitely used some updating, we still found it to be comfortable and clean. I was not overly impressed by the Masquerade in the Sky show. I found it more of an annoyance trying to make my way through the crowd gathered to watch, while I tried to get to and from my room. I could see how the show could be entertaining if you or someone you knew were in the show. Beyond that I felt that it was a bit ‘hyped’ in advertisements as one of the best free things to do in Vegas. As for the rest of the hotel, we found the Carnival Buffet to be satisfactory considering we had received free vouchers for attending a timeshare talk at Harrah’s. It was absolutely the biggest buffet that I’ve ever seen. The selection of different types of food was amazing. The food quality was high for ‘buffet standards’, which in my book buffets are not highly marked when it comes to quality. I’m not big on buffet food but this did seem to be overall a good one. Although we ate for free with our vouchers, we still found the normal price of about $22/person, would have been reasonable. I felt that the atmosphere in the Rio Casino was a bit more on the sleazy side. Compared to casinos like the one’s at the Bellagio, Mandalay Bay, Venetian, etc…the Rio did not seem to make any attempt at having any class. I was kind of taken aback by the barely clad women that were often seen in the casino, dancing erotically or just ‘advertising’ the various clubs. I thought that they would be more in the areas of the clubs themselves and could possibly be avoided but they were spread all throughout the main level. A reminder to me that Vegas is not exactly the family friendly place that it has been trying to portray itself as. Or, at least the Rio is definitely not a place that I would want to take my own children. I wouldn’t appreciate having to walk my children by a woman doing a strip tease, just to get to our room. The pool area at the Rio was definitely a plus. There were four pool areas that you could chose from. One was a sand bottom pool with a beach and palm tree area. There were also hot tubs and waterfalls found around one of the other pools. They had cabanas that could be rented or plenty of regular lounge chairs that could be used. We found it to be very relaxing. We also ordered food from the poolside grill and found it to be very good, although, a bit pricey. Using the free shuttle that runs between Harrah’s and the Rio, we were able to get to and from the Strip easily. The pick-up times for the shuttle are approximately every 15 minutes. Although, note that the hours for the shuttle are 10am-1am, Mon.-Wed. and 10am-4am, Thurs.-Sun. We noticed that during the evening hours when people would be heading out for dinner, the shuttle lines could get long. So, you may want to take these things into consideration when wanting to use it for your mode of transportation. Overall, our stay at the Rio was very satisfactory. Definitely not one of the classier joints in Vegas and I wouldn’t recommend it for families with children, because of the seediness seen throughout the establishment. It definitely is showing some wear however it seems as though they are trying to update in various places. These things along with it being an off-Strip hotel are probably some of the reasons why you can find such great deals when reserving there. So, if none of the ‘negative’ aspects that I mentioned are a problem for you, I’d say definitely go for the great bargain that can be found in staying at the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Need to work a little harder”
Reviews.Author: churchmouse
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the positive. We arrived at the Rio @ 9:30 am and they allowed us to check into our room which we really appreciated. Our room was in the Masquerade Tower and was spacious with a great view of the strip. The bathroom was a little on the small side and the tub had some dicoloration, but all in all it was clean. In the evenings a security guard checks your room key before allowing you to enter the elevator which gives you a secure feeling. My review has the "need to work a little harder" title because let's face it the Rio is not on the strip and although a shuttle leaves for the strip every 15 min.it's location is still somewhat inconvenient. We have stayed at the Rio prior to Harrah's buying them and the changes we have seen aren't for the better... They no longer have coffee pots in the rooms, but Starbucks Kiosk are throughout the hotel. They now charge a 10.00 per person cover charge to the VooDoo Lounge - it used to be free. You have to rent pool floats @10:00 a day per float. They wanted to charge me 2:00 for a empty wine glass which used to be provided for free in your room. Conclusion...unless you get a great room rate, stay on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Rio, too many problems, although staff was courteous...”
Reviews.Author: chungrn
Reviews.Content: We usually go to vegas about 6 times a year. Normally we stay at the Venetian, Bellagio or Four Seasons/Mandalay Bay hotels! We like to gamble a little, shop and occasionally see a good show! Our last visit, we went to the Wynn hotel, you can read my review if you like! But on to the Rio... My husband got a great online rate for 3 nights at the Rio so we decided to try it! When we got there, check-in was smooth. However once we got to the room, our key wouldn't work! My husband went down (trip #1) to the front desk to straighten it out...came back with a working key, but when we entered our room there was graffiti on our bed's headboard! We called downstairs and the staff was apologetic but asked that my husband come down to change rooms, so he went down again (trip #2)to the front desk. Second room..the key doesn't work again(trip #3), so down again he went to the front desk to change keys! We were a little tired and cranky at this point, however we were delighted to find the room to be beautiful! But unfortunately, no interenet access...apparantly the first and last room of each floor is the biggest but for some reason have no internet access. Anyways, my husband had specifically asked for internet access.... So down again he goes to the front desk to change our room (trip #4). We finally got into a room that met our needs. The decorations were a bit outdated, but the room is spacious! The first night was fine, but the next morning I woke up to a cockroach in the sink!!!! This time, my husband did not go down, but we asked them to send up someone with a new key to anew room and to help us move our luggage to yet another room! As you can tell, our trip was very eventful..but through it all, the staff was courteous and we did receive a $100 credit towards anything in the hotel. But overall, I don't think we'll be staying again at this hotel! It's a fun hotel for 30 somethings and younger, lots of good looking people, but overall the quality of rooms and lack of service leaves alot to be desired!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...!!”
Reviews.Author: Ping Golf
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 5 nights in the Ipanema Tower. Yes, this is the original tower, but they are rennovating all the rooms. I stayed on the 16th Floor which they were just completing and I must say these rooms are very nice. I've been staying at the RIO for the past 7 years, 4-5 trips per year. I also have stayed in the Masquerade Tower recently since it begun it's rennovation and I now prefer the Ipanema Tower. Quality and colors seem to be better along with workmanship. Pools and restaurants are excellent. Lots of action in the casinos and bars you won't get bored. The only drawback to the RIO is the table limits, if your looking for $5 & $10 blackjack tables, go elsewhere. There are a few $15 tables, mostly $25 & up however. Will certainly continue to stay at the RIO!

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied with the accommodations at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: travelfamily4
Reviews.Content: After reading a few of the negative reviews in this forum, my husband and I were a little leary about staying at the Rio. However because we were taking advantage of a free nights offer, we decided to take our chances. After arriving at 9:30 am on a Monday, we were pleasantly surprised to learn our room was available, so up to the 10th floor of the Ipanema Tower we went. The moment of truth arrived when we opened the door.....would we find worn carpet, disguisting bedding, or peeling paint? The answer is no to all of the above. The room was very clean and very tastefully decorated. Our traveling companions stayed in the Masquerade Tower and their rooms, although slightly different in decor, were equally as nice. Rest assured to all that are considering staying here, you should expect to have very nice luxury accommodations. It just doesn't make sense to me that this hotel could have a section or floor of rooms with poor conditions described in previous reviews, but I suppose it could happen. I'm just saying that I saw rooms in both towers, and they were all very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel and plan to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful booking shows here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This past July my husband and I stayed at the Rio after reading such good reviews. We were very unhappy with the hotel and hotel staff. We booked the hotel room directly through their front desk and while booking the trip asked if there were hotel guest discounts to see the in house shows. We were told no there were never any specials for guests. Which we were fine with and so we called the Rio box office to get tickets to one of the shows. One the internet it says that you will receive 2 free drinks with admission to the show so I called the number listed on the Rio website and purchased the tickets. What I didn't realize is that the hotel has a roll over line that connects you with an outsourced ticket agent when the main line is busy and that when you book through that agent you do not receive the advertised drink special. We did not realize that I had called until we checked in at the front desk when we arrived at the Rio. Not only did we not get to redeem Buy 1 Get 1 ticket free that was given at room check-in but we did not get the drinks that we paid for with our show admission because they said they couldn't honor their outside vendor's ticket sale! It was so insane because we called the Rio box office and it wasn't made clear that we were connected to outside vendor not the hotel itself. How misleading! The customer service was very rude and I can't believe that they can get away with lying like that.

Reviews.Title: “Much better stay here than last summer”
Reviews.Author: slags68
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Rio. We had stayed last summer the same week and had several problems with billing and other concerns. We had said we wouldn't return but when they sent us an offer for $29 a night we decided to give it a second chance. We are so glad we did. The room was outstanding again. Yes it isn't a true suite with separate rooms but it is an enormous size room and we had a great view of both the pool and the strip. We love the large tv, the sitting area, the free safe (large enough to put your laptop in) and the fridge. The only problems we had in our room was the air conditioner didn't seem to be cooling the room enough. They sent someone up to take a look at it and he changed the furnace filter and the room cooled off dramatically (there was a large amount of dust on it). Also about 3am our smoke detector started beeping due to a low battery. They came up in less than 5 minutes to replace the battery and were very apologetic for the disturbance. The food at the Rio buffet is great, but a little pricey compared to some of the other local buffets. The buffet over at the Palms was pretty good and the price was a lot cheaper. Parking is a bit difficult if you have a car. It is always a long walk to your room. Our suggestion is to use Valet parking on arrival and again on departure so you won't have to drag your luggage as far thru the casino. We used the shuttle to Harrah's once so we could visit Toby Keith's new restaurant there(good food but a little overpriced). It saved us a lot of parking hassles. Just be sure you check what time the last shuttle leaves Harrah's to come back to the Rio. Gambling was the same as last time. High minimum bets! Try the Gold Coast next door for better minimums. The pool was great as usual. There are 4 pools and several hot tubs. At least one of the pools was heated, which even in 105 degree weather was great. The drinks around the pool were pricier than we were willing to pay. A 32 ounce drink was $16. Maybe I am cheap but I just couldn't see paying that much when I can get free drinks while gambling. We just brought drinks from our room instead. Speaking of the drinks in the casino. The margarita's we had there were awesome! They do have some great bartenders there. Sit at the bar to play video poker and you have it made when it comes to drinks! All in all if we could get a deal for $60 to 80 a night we would stay there again. Would we pay $200-300 a night....No way!

Reviews.Title: “I don't usually complain, but.........”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We gamble all the time, and we were really looking forward to our stay at the RIO for the 4th of July week. Thought it would be a nice place to stay away from the strip for a change - especially during the 4th. We were scheduled to stay at the RIO for 4 nights - we could only handle one! Don't get me wrong - the rooms are large, but the air conditioner did not work properly from the time we arrived, and the blanket had stuff on it that did not get there from us! The Seafood buffet was really good, but they did not have a smoking section at all - this is a casino for crying out loud! In fact, the waitress brought a saucer as we were standing in line and had us put out our cigarette. If you are a gambler, stay away from the RIO - you will be run over with kids everywhere!! Needless to say, we were lucky enough to change our hotel accommodations the next day - went back to the strip (Flamingo - wonderful!). If you bring your kids to Las Vegas, then the Rio is for you - if you are a gambler who leaves the kids at home, Stay Away!!

Reviews.Title: “An Honest review...Read if you are thinking of styaing there!”
Reviews.Author: angelsgurl949
Reviews.Content: If not for the pool and the buffet, we would permanently write the rio off of our list... I went to Vegas Spring Break 2005 with my boyfriend and decided to stay at the Rio because it was cheaper and we heard the pool was really nice. I booked the room online from the rio hotel site and there were no problems there. Upon check in we were told we had to wait for them to clean a room which was fine with us because that usually is the case but after about a half an hour of waiting, they sent us up to a DIRTY room - the bed was not made and there were alcohol bottles everywhere. Clearly, housekeeping had not been there yet. When I called the front desk to tell them that, they informed me that it would be at least another hour to clean a room so instead they sent someone up right away. They also offered us a dining credit, i dont remember for how much but I will talk about the buffet later! The room - the rooms are excellent! It is very large with a large couch as well. The hotel is an all suite hotel so I think all the rooms are bigger than what you would usually get from a standard vegas room. The windows are floor to ceiling so ask for a room that faces the strip - the hotel is off the strip but there is an awesome view at night! Bathroom is nice and our room also had a vanity area, closet, and mini fridge (loved it!) The decor is not modern or luxorious but again, the room is huge! The casino and lobby are nothing to awe at, but its decent. The pool is really nice. It has a sand beach with waterfalls and plenty of pool benches. There are cocktail waitresses going around in bikinis and a pool bar. I ordered a pina colada from the bar and when I got it, it tasted really fowl. So i went back up and told the bartender and he said "ya I think the milk is bad, people keep telling me that" He did replace my drink with something else, but it worries me that a bartender would keep serving a drink if he thought the milk in it had gone bad. Anyways, you will love the pool.. Its great for families with children too because there are lots of shallow areas. The Rio World Carnival buffet is hands down the best buffet in Vegas! Anyone who has eaten there will probably tell you that. The selection is the best - it has different buffet stations all the way around the eating area and every one of them represents a different kind of food. So whatever you like - japanese, mexican, italian, american, etc. It's all there! Try the mongolian station and a little bit of everything from the desert bar :) It is not expensive at all and for all the variety it has, the quality is still top notch! Definitely my favorite part about the hotel. My trip went sour the next morning, when I turned over my pillow and there was blood on the pillow. It was not mine because Im sure I didnt have a bloody nose or anything like that. My boyfriend took the pillow down to the front desk to show them and instead of being apologetic, they insisted that we had to have done that because they would not have overlooked that in cleaning the room. Obviously this aggravated us and everyone from the manager down was really snobby and rude about it. They blew us off and just wanted us to leave. We are not big complainers, we are young and usually not very picky. But we do travel a lot and expect certain standards and courtesys to be upheld. I ended up writing them a letter expressing my concerns and all the little unfortunate things that happened while we were there. The only response I got back was an apology from the pool manager for the drink! It wasnt even a mean letter; it was more like a suggestive letter - some feedback to help them improve their customer service. But no response at all from management - I think that says a lot about their service TACKY! Overall, the Rio would have been very much worth the amount of money we spent if we were treated better as a guest. I wouldnt say that I DONT recomend it but I dont think I'll be going back there any time soon! Hope this info helps...

Reviews.Title: “Happy to disagree with the disgruntled!”
Reviews.Author: tamrasue68
Reviews.Content: I must say, after reading the reviews on this website I was a little nervous that we had booked our six-night vacation at the Rio. My husband and I had honeymooned there back in 1997, when the Rio was the new, hip hotel in town, and from these reviews, I was scared to death to be returning with children. I was pleasantly surprised by everything! Check-in was efficient and the clerk was friendly and helpful. Our room (Ipanema Tower - 12th Floor) was much larger than an average hotel room -- it had two Queen beds and a pull-out sofa, so there was room to accommodate our whole family. The room had a refrigerator and a coffee maker which made it convenient to have breakfast in the room (important when traveling with small children!) The pools were unbeatable for kids - four fish-shaped pools, a sandy "beach," and many hot tubs around the premises. The food was a little pricey, but upon check-out, we learned that our casino play was high enough for them to comp everything, even the show. And in my opinion we didn't really play that much -- a couple of hours on a quarter slot machine. I won't argue with the people that had bad experiences there -- I'm sure they're telling the truth. So much depends on the room you get and the employees you encounter on your trip. I just wanted to let people know that our experience was a great one, and encourage people to check it out, despite the negative reviews here.

Reviews.Title: “Careful, craps table shotchanged me twice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Careful craps players, when I played craps at Rio they short changed me twice. I dropped 10 $100 bills on the table and they counted it and gave me my chips, after maybe 2 $10 bets I counted my chips and they had shorted me out of $200, they gave me $800 in chips for $1,000 in cash, I protested, the other players moaned at the stoppage in the game, the dealer gave me $100, I complained that I was STILL short and they finally gave me the right amount. I shortly went to another craps table at Rio and played awhile, was going to leave so asked to color-up, I counted my chips beforhand, gave them $1,100 in chips, they counted them and gave me a $1,000 chip back, they shorted me again, this time for $100. I told them I gave them $1100 in chips and they should count it again and told them I just was shorted when I got chips at the other craps table careful at the rio, my experience was an eye opener

Reviews.Title: “Very poor quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: smilingeyes2000
Reviews.Content: We were given a room in the Ipenema Tower on the 12th floor. When the bell hop who had our luggage said that we should check out our room and see if it was to our liking before having our luggage brought to our room, we should have turned and run then. The room was very old and worn looking. The bathroom had peeling paint on the walls and the tub looked like it had been there for 20 years. It had gray stains on it that I could not figure out. Because the beds looked clean, we decided to not make a fuss because we were there with many family members. About two hours after checking in, we returned to the room. The pathway to the non-smoking room was full of cigarette smoke and the air conditioner in the hall was making loud noises. I thought that it would get better once I was inside the room. Upon entering our room, I smelled something burning. Maintenance came and changed the filter to the air conditioner and told me it was just coming in from the halls. After getting ready for the night, I found the smell was worse not better. I called maintenance again. I asked them to check my smoke detector. The maintenance person told me that it was working because he saw a red spot where the light should be. I insisted that he check the smoke detector. When it did not work, he called to get a new one. He then found out that it had been removed from the wall and was not connected to the system at all. All along the smell was getting worse and the maintenance man was noticing it too. I asked what made him think that the smell was going to go away. After all, he noticed it getting worse. I was concerned about my safety and a possible fire. They finally moved us to an upgraded room on the 14th floor which had a coffee maker and a refrigerator. We could not sit on the couch because we were not sure if the stain on the couch was blood or just lipstick. The rug was worn and frayed. The room was at least free of a burning odor. The upgraded room was not very clean and I wondered what people have come to expect from this hotel. When I have been to suites, they have been so much nicer at such places as Candlewood. The shower was slow and the toilet was hard to flush. The bathroom wall still had hair on it from the prior person. I wondered if this is the quality of the hotel. The front desk was not very happy with me. I mentioned to my brother, a Diamond member, about it and he just shrugged. When visiting my sister's room in the Masquerade area, I was surprised to find that her room was not very clean either. Not sure if they are slipping or if they just do not care. I will never stay there again. I would much rather take a cab to visit family that are staying there than be tortured again.

Reviews.Title: “The Hades hotel”
Reviews.Author: wolfluver9
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune to stay at the Rio for one night. I suffered a back injury on the day I arrived in Las Vegas and had to be taken off the plane in a wheelchair. At the airport they were wonderful (except they lost one of my bags)and helped me get my luggage & a taxi. The taxi driver was very helpful and when he dropped me off at the Rio he told the attendant I needed a wheelchair. The attendant assured him one would be brought out immediately. I sat on my luggage for 30 minutes waiting and was totally ignored. I could only take about 3 steps before I would have to stop so needless to say it took awhile to get to the front desk of the hotel. When I finally made it I was told it would be 2 hours before a wheelchair was available. My room was on the 13th floor and took me a solid 40 minutes to get to it. Not one person even offered to help me with my luggage, just stared at me as I tried to make my way across the lobby. I waited the two hours and called for the chair, there was not one available yet. Upon trying to call again not one soul would answer the phones. The airline found my luggage and sent it to the hotel and they did not even bother to let me know it was there much less deliver it to the room. My boyfriend rented a chair for me and we went down to the casino. While there we were totally ignored by every waitress on the floor. My boyfriend wanted to help me to a machine and asked a slot attendant to watch his machine for a minute as he had money in it. Of course she was more than happy to do it. He was gone about 2 minutes and went back to his machine to find the slot attendant gone as well as his money. The staff was uncaring and totally rude, the room was nice but could have been cleaner and food was terrible and overpriced. That was enough for us, we left the following morning and will never return.

Reviews.Title: “Rio took our money 2 monts in advance and kicked us out”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a birthday/engagement gift my fiance surprised me with a trip Vegas hoping to stay at the Rio just after we got engaged on Mother's day of 2005. He wanted not only to be the 1st to take me to Vegas, but for us to stay at the Rio because of the romantic, suite-like atmosphere. He had stayed at the Rio 2 years prior on a business trip. By this being my first trip he wanted it to be very romantic & speical. We arrived on Tuesday, June 21 and booked through the Travelocity site (which he has used several times). He paid cash for the trip, around $488 pp for the 3 nights stay. Upon arrival we were told that although they had our reservation, they oversold the hotel and we had to take their "free" offer to put us up in the Paris Hotel. We had already paid in advance by 2 months. They blamed it in part on the 3rd party agent that go over their allotted rooms. they also confessed in the same breath that it was their fault for overselling because they offer the rooms to their comp paying guests. They offered us cab fare, ($20) and a voucher to eat for $50.00. I told her that they were foul and that there was no way they could do this to us because legally we had our confirmation. She said that was tough, that because we booked thru a 3rd party, we had to take what they were giving us. I asked why were we not informed about this prior to our leaving because we only came there because of suite were like spacious rooms, and the pools. They switched us to the Paris hotel which in my opinion were average small rooms. (it sucked) They were not even as nice as Niagara Falls hotel rooms. Our vacation was ruined because of the Rio, Travelocity and also the Paris Hotel. We called Travelocity the same day and got no help from them. We will never travel to the Rio again, nor book through Travolocity! The cab driver told us the Rio does this all the time. Be warned, they look after their "free" comp guests and disregard the paying guest.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Rio was OK ie. room was clean etc. but thats it For what they want you to pay it just doesn't add up. We went down the strip and to Fremont Street and were insulted by store clerks ignored by waitresses and cab drivers everyone just seemed miserable. Will not go back. I hated all the prostutue cards being passed out everywhere they were cutting in front of me to pass my husband a card! We walked from Harrahs to New York New York stopped at three places and their shows were cancled but they still want $8.00 for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Rio will lie, cheat and steal”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed there at the Rio for seven days in May. Five days were compted in advance.At check in I was told they had no information that rooms were compted. Had to tell Japanese_ American lady(Kathy) at the counter to call my host, and she quickly found that the rooms were in fact compted. Then I was given a room that was dark and odorous, and with a sticky, smelly bedspread. I complained and was shown two rooms that were even worse.THe maids showed me much better rooms that were available. BY the way there are no suites, just large rooms. The food is just average and overpriced. It is almost impossible to win at table games, and the slots are too tight. SEcurity stinks as pickpockets run free, as well as drug dealers and working "Girls". I will never stay there again. Beware. I feel that I was lied to, cheated and that my money was stolen.Even the slot machine were dirty, and we are not even using coins anymore. Wear a moneybelt, and do not let anyone distract you and and take the money ticket from your pocket or slot machine. You have been warned. I left feeling I was bite by a rat.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays ever!”
Reviews.Author: linahad
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just superb. We were assigned to our room, but when we went up the cleaner was there and she needed another half hour to finish. We called reception and they were very apologetic and courteous. They gave us a free upgrade to a better room and a $50 voucher to spend anywhere in the hotel. Our room was on the 33rd floor, which had an excellent view of the Strip, it was big with a luxurious bed with curtains at the head of the bed, a huge, "U-shaped" sofa, a top-quality coffee maker, a big TV, lots of little bath accessories, a great bath/shower and two basins (one outside the bathroom). Everything was immaculate and staff were very helpful and friendly. I would definitely stay here again! And considering the price ($110 for the two of us) for all this luxury, it was a bargain! Furtherore, the hotel had lots of nice restaurants (gambling as well, of course) and a fancy bar, where bartenders entertain with stunts (and make nice cocktails too). I definitely recommend the Rio to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Rio is sliding downhill, fast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in May and found the rooms to be average, at best. Have stayed at this hotel three times in the past five years and the look of the rooms show quite a bit of aging. Housekeeping was terrific and should be complimented on their daily cleaning. Chose to eat at other restaurants each day outside the hotel mainly because -- being off-strip -- we found ourselves elsewhere during the day. As a Diamond Club member, I saw no obvious perks except for fast valet service, which was great. In particular, the casino is noisy and congested, and seemingly appears to cater to a younger crowd. Will not likely to stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “2nd time around at the Rio was great stay for the WSOP”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived for a late check in on Tuesday night the 31st and went straight to the front desk with only 1 or 2 people in front of us and the line moved quickly. The front desk staff was very courteous and efficient. Our reservation was just as we asked for(king, non-smoking room). We were on the 15th floor with a wonderful view and a very clean and spacious suite. For some reason or another they gave us a hanicapped room but everything worked the same as a regular suite. We never had any problem during our stay and everything work out wonderfully. I look forward to being back at the Rio for the start of the WSOP for next year as well.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Rio”
Reviews.Author: vegasmamma
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the Rio on May 28. Stayed for 6 days and 5 nights. This was my 4th time there. I have stayed at Harrahs and the Mirage in the past but prefer the Rio. We had a room overlooking the pool and the strip on the 31st floor in the masqarade tower. The rooms are very big with a L shaped sofa at one end and the bed at the other. Windows are floor to ceiling. There was a separate dressing area with frig. coffee maker, double sinks and a area to do make up. Plus the bathroom was a nice size. I feel it may be time update these rooms though. Some rooms at the Rio have been renovated but mine was not. Still in all it was comfortable, clean and had all the ammenities one needed. The show Erocktica was excellent. Seen a lot of shows in Vegas but this was unique. It had a live rock band which was very good and exotic dancers and videos around the stage. Even if you don't like rock you will find it exhilarating. Saw The show Scintas for the 3rd time. They just keep getting better. Both the seafood and carnivale court buffets are very good. Seafood $35.00 per person but you would spend that easily for a one plate seafood dinner at a seafood rest. Shuttle to Harrahs and the strip, never had to wait longer than 5 min. It runs till 4:00 a.m. No need to take a cab. As for the casino I have gambled in better. I play slots and find the machines are tight at the Rio. I don't think there is a large enough variety of slots. Only a few progressives.Not that I plan on hitting one but enjoy playing them.The casino however is filled with energy from the cocktail waitresses that dance and sing to the show in the sky. It is a very happy atmosphere. The pool (4) of them are very tropical and never a problem getting a chair.The view from the Voo Doo Lounge is the best. Worth the $20.00 cover to enjoy a drink and marvel at fabulous LV.

Reviews.Title: “Rio - It Depends on You!”
Reviews.Author: RJ_CruisePlanner
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a six night stay at the Rio and, all in all, it was a very enjoyable week. We had stayed at the Rio during our last trip tp Vegas, about four years ago. We have also stayed at 6 or 7 other properties in Las Vegas in the last 10 years or so. The Rio is a great place for some but certainly not for everyone. The same is true for all properties as is evident in the wide variety of reviews and ratingd for all hotels. Our rooms were standard suites and there is a lot to be said for a room that is over 600 square feet. We thought the rooms and the entire property overall were in very good condition although the suites we were in had not been renovated yet. Although I had read some negative reviews regarding cleanliness, we found housekeeping to be very good and very accomodating. Overall level of service in the hotel was OK, not great and not terrible. The buffet was good but not what it had been some years ago prior to Harrah's taking over the property. The Seafood Buffet was a disappointment as the quality has gone down since the last time we were there while the price has gone up to almost $35 per person! The mexican restaurant (Bamboleos) was as good, if not better, than almost all of the reviews suggested. Not only was the food excellent but the prices were an incredible value! We chose the Rio because of our 5 yaer old loving the pools at the hotel and we were completely comped during our stay. The hotel is a great choice for people in their 20s and 30s and the crowd at the Rio tends to be a bit younger. The Voodoo lounge is a great club and the casino is filled with entertainment, music and noise! If you are older and are interested in a quieter more upscale experience then this is definitely not the hotel for you. A better choice would be Ceasars, the Bellagio, the Venetian, the new Wynn, Mandalay Bay, etc. All in all the value of the Rio is very good with suites midweek going for $89 per night. Weekend nights are pricey at about $300 to $350 per night and for that price I would definitely choose a different hotel. All that being said, the Rio has a lot to offer but knowing what your expectations are in a property and what different properties have to offer will help you to avoid a disappointing experience in Las Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Sleezy, Dark & Gloomy”
Reviews.Author: opalclover_ny
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for an upscale casino hotel, this is not one of them. The "suites" (which are just small rooms) don't resemble the pictures on their website. Even if you're a diamond player w/ Harrah's the rooms they have are old and outdated. The casino is louder than a boombox. Even if you're wearing earplugs, you'll still need aspirin every 4 hours because its that loud. Its important to note that while you're playing at a slot machine suddenly a 21 year old girl in high heels and wearing less than a bathing suit will get on top of your machine and bump and grind to almost porno music. I believe that went on all over the casino around 2 times every hour. Its a draining place to be. Their restaurants are mediocre. The only thing thats great there is the pool. I was comped those rooms in advance -- but it wasn't worth it. Would have preferred to pay money and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Room wasn't clean. Too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: touristas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Suites Hotel May 16, 2005. The bathroom had black hair in the tub and on the floor. When I cleaned the floor up with a paper towel, the towel was very dirty and gray which made me believe that the floor doesn't get cleaned very often. The tub drain would not seal so we were only able to shower, not bathe. One of the sinks would not seal and since I wear contacs, I had to use a washcloth to seal the drain. We paid $279.00 per night for the room and expected a nice clean room for the money. The room was nice and large, but everything just looked used. The Luxor is a much nicer place and cheaper. The rooms aren't much smaller, either.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and value for the money”
Reviews.Author: kipabelson
Reviews.Content: The Rio gives great value for the money. I am a Harrah's gold card member, and was offered a great deal for a five night stay. At first my wife was worried about the remote location, but them realized that in addition to the shuttle to Harrah's on the Strip, we could walk to Caesars in 15 minutes. The hotel was pretty lively at all hours of the day and night. Service was extremely courteous and accommodating. We arrived at around 10:30am, and we expected to have to wait until 3pm to check in. To our surprise, we were offered our room upon our arrival (and this was before I tipped the desk clerk.) The room was nice; nothing special. But all the hotel personnel were pleasant and accommodating. Because we booked our room through the hotel website, we got VIP passes to the Voodoo Lounge. My wife and I are in our 50's, but this was a great place for us to hang out, as people of all ages were there to listen to the music. The outside terrace has a spectacular view, and the drinks and service (again) were great. The Rio is clearly not top of the line, but it offers an awful lot for the money and I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Surprise at Rio”
Reviews.Author: BPartyGuy
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying off the Strip, I primarily chose Rio based on some good group rates (12 of us made the trip) and some of the reviews here. I figured the rooms would be fair, the casino fair and food fair, essentially a cheap home base for a cost-conscious group. I was definitely surprised. The rooms were clean, huge and had great views of the Strip. The sectional sofas were great for our group to watch the NBA games, as were the refrigerators. Outside the rooms, the service we received was very good. Drinks came to the tables quickly, usually 1-3 minutes after ordered. Dealers were usually very friendly. The concierge (Dale) was terrific, he booked us a great round of golf at a reasonable price as well as a fantastic steak/lobster restaurant that is not typically heard about but was really amazing (Rosewood Grille across from Monte Carlo). Valet parking was quick, and we had easy access to Voodoo Lounge. I would have like comps to be more generous, but that will be the case anywhere. Overall I really liked the Rio, the vibe is good, more relaxed with less attitude than strip properties and the best value I have had in 10-12 trips to Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful suites”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just had an awesome experience staying at the Rio in Las Vegas. Rio is one of Harrah's hotels. Although it is off the strip, it makes up for it by its unbelievably huge suites. Our suite had two queen beds, and and enormous sectional sofa. There is a spacious closet with a large dressing area complete with sink and sufficient lighting. A hair dryer and iron with ironing board are provided. There is also a refrigerator. The bathroom has a SECOND sink, with full tub shower. Plenty of towels and extra fluffy pillows were provided. The hotel staff is superb. Housekeeping promptly brought requested extra towels. Maintenance was able to solve a small problem within 1 hour. The hotel gave us a coupon for a free breakfast fuffet to compensate us for the inconvenience. Chekin/checkout very smooth. There is a shuttle to the Harrahs on the strip that runs every 10 minutes or so. The pool area is clean and like paradise. There are 3 pools. You can rent a cabana with an overstuffed bed and lots of throw pillows. Many of the lounge chairs have canopies to protect you from the hot desert sun. There is a delightful show similar to a Mardi Gras Parade. Frequent free entertainment throughout the casino. Shops are well kept and reasonably priced. Food at the buffets was above average with an incredible variety of choices. I would rate the Bombaleo restaurant as one of the best Mexican restaurants I have ever been to. I am highly likely to return.

Reviews.Title: “Rio exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: fendi31575
Reviews.Content: I'm going to try and keep this short. We stayed at the Rio for two nights in the Ipanema tower (which is the original tower). My expectations were a bit low, so I was quite impressed when we arrived at our room. It was quite spacious w/ more than enough seating. And to the naked eye, our room was very clean. The bathroom was also very large. The only problem I had with the room was the toilet. It was VERY uncomforable, and I'm not exactly sure why. The seafood buffet in the hotel is very good, a bit pricey, but I think it's well worth it. I really don't think the table games here are any different than those on the strip (aside from the limits). The free entertainment in the hotel is a bit cheesy though. The free shuttle service the hotel offers to Harrahs (on the strip) is terriffic! If you can, utilize it. All in all I would stay at the Rio again.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is great!!!”
Reviews.Author: happi207
Reviews.Content: The Rio is the best place to stay in Vegas. Was there for a week this March into April. Was invited to attend a slot tournament--which was great fun. The awards dinner was a wonderful meal and also received free coupon for $50. worth of food in any resturant at the Rio. Along with the free tournament and goodies I was comped for 3 hotel nights. Weather was great and the pools were great. Rio is very clean and handicapped accessible. They have a free shuttle that takes you to Harrahs on the strip.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic deal”
Reviews.Author: Wendy H
Reviews.Content: great room, huge suite. fantastic, clean bathroom. i think i got it for $60, definitely a great deal. fast check in. the only drawback is it's a long walk from the strip, and in the summer you can get a heatstroke from the walk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, wow, huge rooms, loved the Masquerade Party, would love to stay again”
Reviews.Author: littlelulu64
Reviews.Content: Too much hussle and bussle to stay on the strip, stay off and shuttle in for free......great buffet.......love the shopping

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: zododie
Reviews.Content: This is definetly not the place for those expecting something that has a degree of class or sophistication. Loud and garish. Contemporay decor bordering on stark and close to shabby. It's huge (as most Vegas hotels) and poorly laid out.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Solid place”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoKid23
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio 3/16-3/21, and after a nice Sedan ride from the airport, was greeted by a very friendly check-in service. I was told our suite was just renovated, and much to my delight, the room was everything we needed (for 3 guys). We had two nice sized queen beds and a couch, big enough for the 3rd guy to bunk on. The room was clean, nice size (as was the bathroom)- what else can you need in Vegas? We found the casino atmosphere to be very 'busy' (so much so tables were impossible to get on), but considering the time of year (spring break, NCAA and conventions), it was like that in most places. Sadly, we didn't gamble here, but it looked fun (by the way, we did drop some $ at the sports book, which is pretty nice- good space, lots of TV's and good atmosphere). Taxi service is well run. With lots of great clubs at the Rio, cabs are always dropping people off, so your ability to grab a cab doesn't take too long. Unless you're really ambitious, I suggest taking a cab to most any hotel on the strip, so bring a little extra $$ to take care of this minor issue. The Seafood buffet is pricy ($35 each), but it was all very fresh and quite outstanding. It's worth a look once... In all, I give this 'above average' just because the casino was maybe too small to accommodate all the people that stay and visit here. Anywhere else we went, we were at least able to get on and not pay $100 / hand at Blackjack, like here at the Rio. I'd certainly warrant giving the Rio another look, just perhaps in a slightly 'off' time.

Reviews.Title: “Ghastly food at Rio”
Reviews.Author: herewegoagain
Reviews.Content: Circus Circus, February 14th 2005. Regular at this casino. We are 58 years old. Stayed at this casino several times. Good time of year to avoid kids. Stayed in Skyrise high up, good view. Clean rooms and bedding. Good for budget conscious. We tried the breakfast buffet first day, no queue, just as good as I remember. Thought we would try a different buffet next day, Mirage. A bit dearer, only difference is you can get Italian, Chinese, Mexican food as well. Also waitered service. Personally prefer to serve myself. Next day tried Rio across the road. Oh my God, what have we done. We are campers and are used to living it rough, but this was the pits. Badly displayed buffet, poor selection, poor dark and dismal surroundings, food tasted yuk, couldn't wait to get out AND it was a dollar more than circus circus. It made us feel like circus circus was the Ritz. If like us all you want is a large good choice of breakfast items that look good,taste good, nice surroundings, good price, I recommend circus circus. We are not gamblers so can't recommend any. We go to look around. A good tip, a $5 day bus ticket takes you anywhere in Las Vegas for 24hrs. Get a bus time-table from the depot or sometimes on their buses. Even if you stay on the strip you can go one stop or from MGM to Downtown as many times as you want. Good for saving the old legs. It is worth it as I think just one trip costs $2. You can get to the Beltz Factory Outlet South Vegas using your $5 day ticket by a strip bus to the depot and then transfer It really is great for getting around. Depending on how much time you have, we like adventure so we looked at the bus map and went to different locations outside the strip - very interesting. We saved £££££'s on bus travel. When we arrived there are booths just outside the airport doors selling tickets to take you to your hotel. I think it cost $8 RETURN each. The price is printed on the plastic windows. The person in the booth gave us a disc. It had a phone number to ring the day before we were leaving to arrange pick up time at our hotel. When you phone they ask what time you need to be at the airport (remember checking in time) and they will give you a pick up time. We got into a people carrier, about 8. America seems to give discount for their elderly (called seniors) after the age of 55, so ask if you have to pay for anything. We got a reduction up the Stratosphere, etc., Wow, that view is something else, also for dinner at Denny's restaurants. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay in Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: rlkahler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Rio three times, once on business and twice for pleasure. I love the location because it is close enough to the strip that you can be there in a couple minutes but it is off the strip enough that you are away from the noise and traffic of the strip. The rooms are great and very large. We stayed on a Thursday night for $69 but couldn't afford the Friday and Saturday night rate. If the price isn't over what you want to spend, the Rio is the place to stay. The free Masquerade show is definitely worth seeing and the Scintas show is awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms! Disappointing Buffet!”
Reviews.Author: twoshoes4u
Reviews.Content: The room was huge with a panoramic view of the strip. We went during the week and the room was $76.00. The buffet was expensive at $22.00/ea for dinner. It was the largest offering I'd ever seen. However, most of the, very attractive, foods tasted like cardboard. The San Paulo cafe ripped us off for breakfast at $33.00 for two. Orange juice (NOT fresh squeezed) cost $5.00 a glass!

Reviews.Title: “Great accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't compare Tropicana to Rio as previous writer did, but;Stayed @ the Rio before it changed hands. Got a great deal(flight and room for 5 days) through American Air. Understand their rates have gone up since but if you want or need room to spread out, you can't beat these suites. Staff, service, casino ,shows are also excellent. The buffets however are GREAT! //

Reviews.Title: “Spacious Rooms”
Reviews.Author: beducky
Reviews.Content: I don't really have anything bad to say about the Rio. The rooms were large, clean and spacious. The beds were comfortable and the overall hotel was a lot of fun. You are not on the strip where the "action is" however the Palms and the Gold Coast are near by. The Rio had a really fun theme and I had no problems at all. The buffet was excellent (not sure about the seafood)!! Best ever!!! If you are a guest in the hotel you get to use the "special entrance" and head to the front of the line (a big plus). The pools were great and the hot tubs were wonderful. Entertainment at the Rio was not bad. All in all this is a great place to stay if the time you are staying is not overly expensive and you have your own transportation to head down to the strip during the day. If you want to be where the action is I would recommend staying at a hotel on the strip, but if you are looking for quality for a fraction of the cost then Rio is probably for you.

Reviews.Title: “Mexican restaurant @ the Rio - Rude horrible service and staff!”
Reviews.Author: jbland123
Reviews.Content: We were here about 10:30, Feb 26th 05. We visited the Rio for a party that was held at the VoodDoo lounge. As far as I could tell the Rio itself was nice. The floor show was crazy and fairly extravegant being it was free. Immpressive. The VooDoo lounge was more relaxed than the other bars with an amazing view and would definetly go back to that place again - but don't fall for the band screaming about "go back to the bar for free shots!". Turns out you'll only get that "free shot" if you throw at least five bucks at the bartenders. On top of that the "free shots" were some kind of punch with absolutly NO "punch". However, my major beef here is with the horrible demeanor of the staff at the Mexican restaurant on the second floor next to the entrance to the Voodoo lounge. We sat at the bar and asked for a plain Margarita. The waiter/bartender behind the bar didn't even look up...was busy writing/reading something...no idea, but under his breath said "we're all out". We sat there for a second and thought he was kidding as he didn't offer up any alternatives or even seemed to give a crap. As we sat there in silence and confusion, we asked the top of his head if he was kidding. Still staring at the ground of whatever, he replied "no". I confirmed and said "so...are you out of everything or.....?" as I continued to stare at his scalp, it mumbled "yeah, won't get anymore in till tomorrow." So we sat there wondering if this guy was either trying to get rid of us, hated us, hated his job...no idea...all the while noting other waiters and bartenders making and retrieving other cocktails, daquri's and such. Since we were starving and were'nt familiar with the rest of the hotel, we reluctantly ordered a beer from now the the back of his head, wondering if he even heard us until they came...but we really wanted to leave after that. Food was good and came out quickly, but that server was the biggest jerk I've ever had the displeaure of meeting at a restaurant. Just when we thought we were getting past the service, a female bartender and some other male bartender start screaming at eachother behind the bar "get out of my face!" and " you're driving me crazy!". The other replied with "I'll quit right now, I'm serious! I'll walk" and other things about "being sick of this" bla bla bla. All the staff there just seemed really pissed off and it wasn't even that busy. Salsa was runny and weak...was more like tomato juice. The decor of the place was nice but ONE BATHROOM STALL FOR THE WOMEN'S BATHROOM! It's a big place too. About 5-6 girls were waiting for the toilet so I was forced to use the men's bathroom. I said "sorry man" as I passed some guy at the urinal as I headed for the stall. I would NOT come back to this restaurant here EVER AGAIN. Since crap rolls downhill I'm assuming they either don't pay staff well or are treated badly for everyone to act so outwardly unhappy to customers. Since I've never stayed at the Rio, this left a bad taste in my mouth and feel unwelcome to come back in general.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: sniperman
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at the Rio, February 11. 12 and 13. Very spacious rooms and lots of restaurants to choose from. We had breakfest every morning in the caferia and it was very good, above everage. The casino itself is too smoky, they need to get better ventilation. The clothing smelled smoke for days afterwards. Overall a positive eperience, and I will come back. I hope for the health of the people working there, that Las Vegas will prohibit smoking in the casinos for everybodys enjoyment.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We visit Las Vegas at least twice a year. We always stay at the Rio. It is a fun place and always entertaining with the free show in the sky and performers. They are great and worth the trip to the Rio to see them perform. It is such a lively place to stay. It also has great food and many places to dine whether it be casual or fine dining. WE JUST LOVE IT THERE!

Reviews.Title: “Rio-Great Rooms, Fun Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Lindymagoo
Reviews.Content: After passing through the Rio on previous visits to Vegas, I have always wanted to actually stay there. Got my wish in September, 2004, when we stayed two of our six nights at the Rio. There were no problems with check-in, or the room itself. In fact, the room was large, nicely appointed, and had a great view. The bathroom was equally nice, and we found it all to be quite clean. We spent a lot of time down by the pool, (bar), and our first experience there almost had us running for the door. We walked into the pool bar area, which was empty but for a couple of ladies sitting and talking with one of the two bartenders. We sat down next to these ladies, (and the bartender was a few feet away from us) and waited to be served. We waited, and waited, and waited. The bartender who was talking with the ladies was more interested in the conversation than in serving us. In fact, Several people who came in after us were promptly served, (by the other bartender) and at one point I asked my husband if we were invisible. Normally, I do not become annoyed with issues regarding service....cause, hey, you're on vacation, right? But after we sat there for 10-12 minutes, and no one waited on us, I was forced to ask the bartender if there was a reason we were not being served. He apologized, said he didn't "see us", and we had no further problems. In spite of this first impression, the whole pool area is a great place to relax and the surroundings are quite beautiful. In the past, I have enjoyed the casino atmosphere at the Rio, the Masquerade in the Sky, and the general ambience. However, after staying there a couple of days, I did find the show to be distracting, especially while playing video poker. It was hard to concentrate on VP with all the music, noise, and people justling for beads! (Great people watching, though) So, if you are into serious gambling, I would recommend the gaming areas away from the Masquerde Village. We found the Titlted Kilt Pub to have great food and service; and it is a great place to sit and watch the shows. My husband particularly enjoyed having a Guiness on tap there. We tried the Mexican restaurant here (sorry, can't remember the name), although it was so dead the evening we stopped by, that when we first walked by, we thought it was closed. The food was good and the margaritas hit the spot. All in all, we really enjoyed the Rio. If the price is right, we would consider staying here again. In researching hotels for our next visit in May, I am finding that Rio's pricing is more in line with Ceasars or Mandalay Bay. If I am going to spend that kind of money for a room, then I would choose Mandalay over the Rio. The Rio is very nice, but the location does not justify the high rents they are trying to charge lately. Super place, though.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the Rio”
Reviews.Author: Cobyslady
Reviews.Content: We spent January 16th through the 20th at the Rio in a very nice room in the Masquerade tower. We had a nice view of the strip through the floor to ceiling windows. The rooms were updated and clean, and the bed was really comfortable. As always the Carnival World Buffet was wonderful. All of the staff we had interaction with were very nice people, helpful and courteous. We didn't do much good at either the tables, or the slots here, but went downtown to the 4 Queens and had a great time playing $2 blackjack. One more thing to note, for a great sandwich/burger and beer for a really affordable price there is a small local resturant called the Blue Ox West ($2.50 for MGD), easy access from the Rio on Valley View Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Surprise!”
Reviews.Author: kksummergirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night back in May because the Hard Rock was sold out for the first night we were in town. Being on vacation with three 27-year-old girls, I was fearful that it really wouldn’t be our scene. We wound up having a blast. The pool was a little overcrowded, but we met some great people. There were some families and a slightly older crowd overall, but it was just a fun and festive atmosphere all the way around. Drinks were strong and free-flowing! The pool area itself is beautiful. Waterfalls, lush landscape, multiple hot tubs. We found the rear pool to be the best spot. Rooms are large, great for sharing with multiple people. They’re a little older and the décor is somewhat tacky, but they work. Try Buzio’s seafood restaurant, it is delicious! Overall, we had a great experience and the only reason I wouldn’t return is because I’m addicted to the Hard Rock!

Reviews.Title: “finally made my trip..”
Reviews.Author: LAKESIDE32
Reviews.Content: finally made my trip out to vegas!! i was comped a suite for 2 nites, but fri was full so i had to settle for sat & sun.. i didnt need a sun. stay so i just checked out sun morn. they didnt have a problem with that and they never needed any type of deposit for the room so i was happy with that. the check-in process was fairly easy we got there at 5 pm and it was a breeze.. im a platinum player so i could have used the platinum check-in but there was no reason to. the registration and check-in staff were the absolute best and they answered every question; however a trick i learned from watchin others is to demand the very best rooms that are newly remodeled, ask for rooms closest to the elevators and a must is to ask for the masquerade tower. if i would have known those goin in i would been better off. so if u plan on goin please remember to ask for exactly that!!! but overall the room was excellent, i stayed on the 5th floor of the ipanema tower, we had problems parkin the car and finding our room at first tho. as with the rest of vegas the hotel is huge! we kept parkin on the backside of the hotel and ended up havin to take a sidestreet just to find the front/entrance to the casino. you have to establish some landmarks inside the casino to avoid gettin lost!! nevertheless the trip from the car to your room could be a potential adventure in itself! in particular i didnt like the overall atmosphere of the casino. there werent many gamblers just a bunch of wannabe-hollywood types lookin for attention. keep in mind that its a younger crowd but there was no indication that this was a singles crowd. personally i grew tired of the skinny, silicon-implanted variety of women that hung-out and worked here.. being from atlanta i just grew tired of the types of women that were there. i tried striking up convo. with several women but they were very superficial and just needed a break from the l.a./vegas scene. there were some unusual minimums on some games however.. i normally play roulette and there were some with $10 mins. and some had $25 mins(which i thought was kinda strange because that would discourage play) but i did win good money playin and i did manage to put some away.. after walkin around if found nothing better to do than gamble so i started again, i returned to roulette and continued to win. i got highly upset when i wasnt comped a simple cigar.. even though i toted away alot their money they should have been professional enough to comp me a simple cigar. so i cashed in and stormed away after this incident.. my advice would be to steer clear away from the slot machines, consequently i didnt see a soul win a red cent playin slots.. i never got the party vibe while at this casino/hotel everything just seemed so rehearsed and mechanical.. there were alot of couples and the single people didnt seem comfortable in meeting others. i should have used the rio as simply a place to rest my head for the nite because there are hundreds of much better partys and spots in vegas.. overall the room was excellent and service excellent as well i must say. being that there are hundreds of hotels/casinos in vegas, unless comped a full stay i would probably never pay to stay in my lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “RIO OKAY CASINO NEEDS HELP”
Reviews.Author: lwag725
Reviews.Content: I just got back from Las Vegas Jan2-6,2005. I stayed at the Rio for 2 nights. The room was spacious. It was clean and comfortable and the bed was great for sleeping if you are able to sleep in Vegas. The bathroom was alittle disappointing when researching this hotel I saw that it was to a have a jacuzzi tub. It did not have that. It did have a separate vanity and dressing area but the bathroom was small. Service was good but I was on a Travel Agent rate so they know who I am and want to service me so I will refer people them. The Casino is small with alot of tables ( black jack, poker and craps.... ) Many the lowest bts are at $15. I did eat twice there and have to say food was great and service was okay not the best but okay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rio”
Reviews.Author: Mootsie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio Dec. 26 through the 30th. The room could not have been better. We were on the 11th floor of the Mascarade Tower. It was clean, spacy and nicely appointed. The staff was courteous, and were very efficient. I am so surprised to read other reviews about how they were disappointed. We certainly were not! We are not big gamblers but received two free nights, one at $19 and one at $60. We mostly play 2 and 5 cent slots, so this was an amazing deal for us. Again, great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service at the Rio”
Reviews.Author: Puppeylove
Reviews.Content: We just got back from spending a few days in Las Vegas. We were there 3 nights, and stayed at a different hotel each night. Our last night was at the Rio. It was by far the worst hotel with the worst service we have ever encountered in Las Vegas. First of all, we got there at 6pm at night, and all 4 floors of their parking garage were full. We had to park in an area where semi truicks park, and walk about 1/2 mile in the cold. When we got inside to check in for our $130 a night room with a king size bed and a strip view, we found out instead that we got 2 queens with a view of Outback Steakhouse. When I called the front desk to discuss the situation, I was told that the strip view rooms were reserved for the VIPs for the holiday and that none were available. I guess the first time guests just get the lousy 4th floor street view. Since I had paid $30 more for a strip view, I wanted something to be done. The clerk put me on hold, and apparantly hung up on me. After 5 minutes of silence, and realizing I was not actually on hold, I called back. I was then told that I could ether be put into a strip view room since I was only staying one night (gee, why didn't they just give me that room to begin with?), or get the credit. I decided to take the credit. Since I had already paid for the room I asked how I would be credited. I was told the credit would go back on my debit card when I checked out. Low and behold, I checked out on the 30th, and today is the 2nd, and no credit has yet to be applied to my debit card. Yet the $50 buffet charge is definately there. I also found out that since I had paid for the room with a debit card, there seems to be some type of difference with that versus a credit card. I'm not sure what it is, but the check in person asked if we were planning on charging anything to our room. We said "probably not", not realizing that we would not even have the chance to do it. When we got in the room, we found a mini bar that was locked and unaccessable due to the lack of having a credit card hold on the room. That should have been explained to us when checking in, since I could have given him an actual credit card, versus the debit card I had paid with. As far as the room was concerned, it was very spacious. However, there were hairs on the toilet seat and in the shower, which just added to my disgust of the whole situation. We ate dinner at the Rio buffet which has been completely remodeled. The food was excellent. Now, whether it was worth waiting in line over an hour and $65 (including the automatic tip) for two people, that I'm still not sure of. But we did go back for breakfast the next morning and there was no line at all, so that made up for the painfull wait the night before. I had never realized before how smokey the casino was. When I got back to the room I noticed that what I was wearing completely smelled like smoke. That has never happened at any of the other hotels I have stayed at, such as Hard Rock, MGM Grand, Bellagio and The Mirage. My last bad experience here was when I tried to check out via the tv. The system was down, and I could not check out that way. I left a message on the automated phone check out service, but did not feel very comfortable with that at all. I'm very sad that my stay at the Rio was such a bad experience, because other visits to the Casino and buffet have always been great. In fact, my husband and I rode on one of the floates in the past, and also got engaged there on one of our visists over 4 years ago. Unfortunately, we will NOT be going back to stay at the Rio, but MAY possibly continue to visit the Casino. As far as spending the night, we will be sticking to the Mirage, where we go every summer, where the service and atmosphere are great! I would suggest to anyone that is not a "VIP" to stay at a hotel on the strip. For the same price (or cheaper) you can be closer to the action, and get better service.

Reviews.Title: “Riolly disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: There were some problems with the room at first It seemed to have been used and not cleaned when we first arrived so we asked for a differant room. Much better, vary nice but we were told there were no Queen beds available but when we complained about the room we were given they then gave us a nice clean room with queen beds. When check out day came I called down to ask about shuttle service to the airport and was told there was no shuttle service to the airport without reservations and we were to late, and would have to hire a taxi. When we went down to hire a taxi there were several shuttles lined up just waiting to take people to the airport. and were told by the shuttle drivers they came by every 10 min. This misinformation is the vary reason I would never stay at the Rio again, its just not the service I would expect from a hotel that charges two hundred a night for two. We were vary disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Do Not Gamble !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just read a review that confirmed my suspicions. We were at the Rio in October for a business meet. Four of us dropped more our first night than we planned for the week long stay! I played slots and Roulette and friends played cards. The following nights I just observed and winnings seemed few and far between. Other business assoc had same quick and brutal loosing experiences. Will not gamble here on next trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Rio Surprised-Riolly Dissapointed!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon check in we found out all Suites W/2 Queen beds were occupied, so we were given a 4th floor smoking room! Our Reservations were made in October for Xmas Eve & X-mas Day. The room we found was a disaster, Ghetto like sheer curtains, the Beautiflul view of Rio's Mega-plex air-conditioning unit was sickening, Coffee stained carpet and , a bed that looked like a 5 year-old made! We called the Staff to report our displeasure, and were give a room 15 floors abve that unit ,With 2"QUEEN BEDS", the room was an improve ment but not worth the $$ . Room Service was great and the Food -3 Stars for breakfast! the slots were a lot of fun and every one there was having a blast. the location was not so good and the Shuttle was a little hassle to cut time on a short Holiday. The Staff and Management were really not orginized, and all our questions and help we needed was not recognized ,maybe because we were just John-Q Citizen and not the High-Rollers they pamper. We will never return to Rio again as it was poorly orginized staff wth no Idea what was going on, or how to please a customer, My advise is to find a place closer to the Strip and get a Guarentee on what room you are to stay in and not be Decieved by your Travel Agent or Pictures you see on the Web!!

Reviews.Title: “Rio is just "ok"”
Reviews.Author: WindowPlease
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Rio Suites from 12/19/04 to 12/23/04. We had an upgraded Cariocas Suite which was 1100 sq. feet and had 1.5 baths, & a supposed jacuzzi, with a 180 deg. panoramic view of the strip. We had been looking forward to this for awhile. But was quite dissappointed with the "jacuzzi". At best it was a small tub with some holes that spat luke-warm water out. I was very dismayed and called the front desk several times about the jaccuzi not working and the lack of hot water in our huge bathroom. For an upgraded suite, the room was mediocre and there was a big off-white ugly couch in the living room which appeared to be from the 1960s. The room was hardly updated. But the view was amazing! From our bed it was like flying-- at night seeing the whole strip and all the lights-- and in the mornings seeing the sun rise in over the mountains in the desert. I guess for that it was worth it. It kinda sucked being off the strip, but we were close enough to drive there, or take the 24 hr. shuttle to Harrah's. The Holiday Masquerade show in the sky was at first interesting, but it got old fast-- and it really sucked being caught amidst the "carnival" when trying to go to one's room in the Masquerade tower. The Carnival World buffet was OK-- and there were huge lines always. A tip is if you are a hotel guest or have a coupon (of which there are several circulating on the net) you can go in a diff. line which is much faster. The dessert is EXCELLENT, there is Gelato and a wide variety of cakes and goodies. Since we're vegetarian, most buffets in Vegas are catered to meat eaters so its a bit tough. But if tons of Sea creatures and a Carving station with the flesh of big dead animals are your thing, then the Rio Buffet is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for the price, can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Las Vegas. Picked the Rio, for $45 internet room rate, which for the size of room, 600 st. ft. could not be beat anywhere. Checked in around 11pm, not problem, took only 2 minutes, front desk clerk, was from the Phillipines, and went out of her way to find us a very nice room on the 10th Floor, with a view of the strip. Rooms are not Suites, but probably the largest rooms in Vegas, for the least money. 36 inch TV's nice King Bed, leather padded Headboard, in room Safe, large vanity area, in room refriderator, which is handy if you want to some food from room service to eat later, very nice large and compfy L Shaped sofa. Room was very clean, and housekeeping very good. Casino was realtively quite, ceiling low, and a bit smoky for my liking. Breakfast in restaurant done the hall from the main showroom, where Penn + Teller perform, was very nice food terrific and fast, but expensive. Free Shuttle service to Harrah's very efficient, came every 5 minutes, and a great service!Went to Bellagio, this is the place to play blackjack you can get $5 or $10 tables, without too much trouble, dealers really nice and friendly, Hotel is the nicest in Vegas, as far as the Casino and Public areas Xmas decorations concerned, they just opened their new tower, the day we were there the TV crews were all over filming.
