Ceasars nice, but way too long to walk everywhere, got last minute tickets front row, dead center stage at MGM for David Copperfield, he was standing 6 inches from us for most of the show and shook hands with us at the end of the show, he had his parents in the theatre, nice looking older couple, it was his very first show of his stay there, worth the $200.00 for 2 tickets, for sure! I still can't figure out how he actually made it to the beach in Phucket, Thailand and back, in less than 4 minutes, live right in front of our eyes! with satellite feed live from Thailand, hard to fake, with polaroid taken on stage in Vegas, and felt pen markings on his forearm by audience member to ensure same time/day can't be faked!Fashion Show Mall on the strip worth the visit, and nice break from all the Casinos! Imperial Palace a dump, would never go back there, shows it's age, but Legends in Concert Show, worth the 1/2 price tickets we got from the Tickets 1/2 price outlet down the strip for $19.99 very good show, tight band, 10 dancers, great performers, Aretha Franlkin loook a like had the best voice, was a knockout singer worth the admission, Elton John, Look alike was dead ringer, even the gap in front teeth!The drawback of going Christmas week is many of the headliner shows are dark, as performers are off for Christmas.Prime Rib dinner at Prime Rib Loft at Orleans Hotel, for $11.95 best bargain in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Totally unprofessional”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Rio has always been a fantastic establishment, and recently when we stayed there it was service on a 1st class basis. However, then the unthinkable occured! On the morning of our checkout there is a knock on the door at 8:15 am, and as I look through the peephole in the door, there is a security guard out front. So, I open the door and all of a sudden get the Wyatt Earp reception from the security guard who simply states there is a problem with your hotel bill. And then proceeds to tell me he is there to "lock out the room" and proceeds to enter all the while mantaining a demanor which was not necessary. Too top it off my wife is in the shower and has just gotten out and cannot egress to get her clothes! All the while the security guard tells me to call the front desk which I then proceeded to do and find out the manager has sent a security guard up to our room for a $200.00 bill issue which is not warrented. I mean we have not even checked out yet! So after advising the manager we now have a problem as this was upsetting to my wife in the most demeaning way, the manager then proceeds to advise me of The Rio's hotel policy (which based upon this situation occuring is seriously flawed) and all the while being indifferent to the situation. This was unacceptable to me, and then during the conversation once again I advise her why is there a security guard in my room? She then makes a connection and states "there is a secuirty guard in your room" of which I reply after several minutes of previous conversation with this "manager" yes! At that point I handed the phone to the security guard who proceeds to discuss a 419 code issue which who knows what it means. Subsequently seconds later he hands me the phone after speaking with the manager and proceeds to apologize for the error in the most emphatic way. I dont blame him I blame the management. Once we get down to the front desk to check out, I request to speak with the "manager " I had previously spoken too, and proceed to advise her that conversation with her was not necessary as given the severity of the situation we now need to speak withe the Executive Hotel Manager for the entire complex, which we subsequently did and have since been offered two free nights stay. Had they performed a courtsey call regarding this issue all of this would have been avoided and my wife would have truly enjoyed her stay. Whether we stay at the Rio again even for free is something we need to seriously consider! The Rio was totally unprofessioinal in the handling of this matter, and for management not to be aware of what its other departments are doing shows serious flaws as far as professional customer service. This is unacceptable!

Reviews.Title: “Win at Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I won a $50,000 jackpot on the $5 10 Times Slot. Had put in $30. While I was there, someone won the $5 Wheel of Fortune Mega Jackpot. Lots of winners. Lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “I'd go again in a heartbeat - but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Near the top of my list - Just checked out. It's slow out here this week and the rates were good at the Rio so I tried it. I come out here every week to work, so I've been at several of the hotels out here. I thought the Rio was a great hotel with nice views, pleasant staff, and very large, well decorated huge rooms with king bed, wall to wall floor to cieling windows, large sectional sofa, marble and glass coffee table, seperate closet area, two sinks, fridge, safe. I visited the Voodoo lounge at about 12:30 am on a Tuesday night and the place was pretty lively which is more than I can say for club Ra at Luxor. The bartender (Kenny) introduced me to a 60 year old Tequila (rare out here) that really impressed me. Did not have time this trip for any of the restaurants but trusted that they would be what I expected. To cold for the pool, and the one down side of the place is that the exercise room is connected to the Spa which they want $20/day (each person) - that's what lost them the final star on my rating. Overall, I really liked the place and when I get a chance I will check in again, but the workout charge will keep me from making it a regular stay. The casino wasn't nearly as noisey or smokey as many I've had to walk through. I seldom gamble so that's all I can say. If you get a premium room (strip view) try to get above the 20th floor (or at either end of the hallway or you may have the big RIO neon sign to look at. It's not distracting at all when you're awake, but I had to close the curtains before trying to sleep. Still, it was a great view. You'll need a taxi or the shuttle to get back and forth to the strip, it's not far, but I wouldn't walk it. If you like blues, Rio is only about a mile from the Sandollar Lounge - in my opinion, Vegas' best blues bar. I was there Monday night for their open Jam session (a very unique experience). Got really good after midnight. Be aware though that the Sandollar is not a general tourist oriented bar, it's a local place with some of everybody there, bikers, old, young, etc - It was a nice mix of people. I was there in a suit and was comfortable - the show was great, the drinks were cheap. Rio is a very cool place, but they gotta kill the workout charge.

Reviews.Title: “Loud and smelly.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's the Rio, and I for one will not be returning. As soon as we walked in the door I knew I'd be glad to leave. The music was turned up too loud and (early in the evening) the place was already permeated with smoke. They didn't have the room I reserved. I booked a kingsize, they gave me 2 queens (though why someone would want 2 queens in a room for 2 people is beyond me). Apparantly the website indicates they don't actually hold the room but neither the person taking my reservation on the phone, or the receipt had any such information. The room was somewhere south of acceptable. A jar of rancid milk was left sitting outside our room (presumably from the last guests, or just a nearby room who no longer wanted it near their door?) for our entire two day stay. For it's "suite" nature, the whole bathroom area was pretty cramped, though having the two sinks was admittedly a nice touch. Downstairs, no matter how much others rave about the "masquerade in the sky" it's just a bunch of carts on wheels filled with folks who, when it's dark, do something that almost passes for dancing. Not enough to impress me, and definitely not enough to warrant the very optimistic "best free show" label that is so lavishly applied to the spectacle. The breakfast buffet was reasonable, but having been greated with "welcome to the best buffet in vegas" I quickly discovered the untruth which had just been spoken. It was good but definitely not the best. Perhaps things improve later in the day? The desserts were the saving grace of the place (the tiramasu in particular was quite delicious), but really -- how many can you eat for breakfast? The casino felt like it was filled with a bunch of middle-aged folks wanting desperately to relive their boozy college days. If that's your scene then by all means flock on over; if it's not (as I quickly assertained for myself) then stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Try the Rio”
Reviews.Author: 1Spats
Reviews.Content: After reading all 96 reviews in Trip Advisor for the Rio, we left for a friend's wedding with our fingers crossed and some concern. There was no need for the concern. The room was spotless, the furniture was in great condition. The front desk staff were great, housekeeping was friendly and professional: they took care of small details that meant alot. There was no problem with the room in terms of any odors, other guest's garbage and hair, etc., as some of the reviews we read had indicated we could expect. All the parts of the Rio I saw were in great shape! The food at the Carnaval Buffet, the Mexican restaurant and the Japanese/Chinese Restuarant were tasty and the service attentive. The shrimp tempura at Hamada's was incredibly tender - the best I have ever had. Gambling - I don't, but my husband does. Because we had read the reviews, he headed over to the Gold Coast early on and won -- then returned to the Rio and won twice!! I enjoyed the variety of stores at the Rio. We both enjoyed the free show in the Masquerade area - it passes over your head and is really fun. I read that for a fee, you can be part of this show and we may try it next time. When you arrive, try to join the Total Rewards program. You get a good coupon book and beads. Remember to have fun! And remember, what energy you put into something is what you get out of something - so if you expect good, you can find good. And if you don't know what to expect, you can still find good! My husband also visited Harrahs, and then went to the car exhibit at the Imperial Palace, and just totally enjoyed his adventure. The friends' wedding took place on the terrace outside the VooDoo Lounge on the 51st Floor of the Rio. We had a view of most of the valley - and were 50 storeys closer to heaven than usual. It was a memorable wedding. Would we return to the Rio? Yes. But we are more likely to go to Reno - being train buffs we can get to Reno by train from here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Rio!”
Reviews.Author: pdawg88
Reviews.Content: Shuttle running every 15 minutes to Harrah's saved us a fortune in Cab fare, never a long line & never waited more than 5 minutes for shuttle. My wife attended a conference here & the Customer Service by the convention staff was wonderful, made sure everyone was comfortable & the meeting rooms were spotless. The Carnival buffet is a must, great food/selection/staff, eat a light lunch if heading here for dinner. The masquerade in the sky show was awesome, and be sure and stay until the end for the free beads. We had requested a high floor room with 1 king, and arrived at our room to find 2 doubles, the desk staff found us another room in the masquerade tower on the 18th floor with a King, and a breathtaking view. We arrived at the Hotel before 10 a.m. & rooms were not available, the bellhop held our bags & delivered them upon arrival in our suite, and gave us nearly a 10 minute list of the shows & hotels to visit. The management at the Rio is to be commended on their Customer Service training they give to their staff. Looking for a hotel with no service, bad food, and a lousy atmosphere, then don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great cafe and buffet”
Reviews.Author: rich53
Reviews.Content: We just stayed five nights at the Rio and attended the AARP convention in Las Vegas. The rooms were extremely clean and spacious. The caffe provided large portions of delicious food (even late in the evening) The Buffet has one of the largest variety of foods and was excellent. We really enjoyed watching the Scinta's Show that is appearing at the RIO. While gambling, they did have waitresses walking by to provide beverages and even bottled water to those at the tables or machines which was a nice convenience. The pool was clean, well maintained, and provided an amble supply of towels. There is a shuttle between the RIO and Harrahs giving us a great opportunity to visit the strip. We had a great time - would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay but don't gamble”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We recnetly stayed 2 free nights at the Rio. The room was fabulous. We had a great view of the strip from the Masqerade Tower. The only problem we experienced was that the refrigerator in the room hardly kept things cold. We received free tickets to see Ron Lucas. However, Ron was out that day and he was replced by comedian/magician James Hobson? He was lame at best. Thank goodness it was free. The Rio has high limits on all of their table games and their slots seem extremely tight. We have never won here and this trip was no different. We walked across the street to the Gold Coast and our luck quickly changed. The Rio's pool area is fabulous. The only downfall is that you have to walk through a large part of the casino to get there. Overall, the stay was okay, but the gambling here stinks.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for an extended Labor day vacation. The roomy suites are nice and, even though we weren't in the room all that much, there was no "claustraphobic" feel at all. The room was nice and clean, however the housekeeper did miss us one day. For the most part, the employees of the Hotel were very friendly and helpful. Now, for a few complaints......the pools and jacuzzis close at 7:00 pm!!! This is Las Vegas, not the Holiday Inn in Omaha! It would have been real nice, after a night of gambling, music, etc to relax in the jacuzzi. The temperature is hovering around 100 degrees up until 7:00---who in their right mind wants to get into a jacuzzi during the day? Also, although we were quite happy with the service in general, it was a different story at the All American Grill. The first time we tried to enter it (while nicely dressed) we were told that it was closed except for employees and "invited guests". This was Thursday around 8:15 pm. There were around 20 people or so in there at the time. We thought it was a bit odd, but went elsewhere. We ended up back at this restaurant on Monday around 1:00 pm, starving and ready for lunch. We were told there would be a 15-20 minute wait. We agreed and waited out front for 35 minutes. During that time, several people were allowed in before us. We figured they were heavy gamblers and we figured that that was part of the Vegas way of life. When we finally got into the restaurant, however, we were somewhat shocked to see that, at most, HALF of the tables and booths were being used. I have no idea why we were kept waiting for so long. I should also metnion that, during the time we were waiting at least 10-20 other people approached and were told of the wait and decided to leave---it would appear that the manager isn't doing his business any favors with this absurd seating policy. One final complaint------it strikes me as being VERY cheesey to refuse to give a glass of water to a customer. At all of the clubs and bars they will only sell bottled water ($6). I can certainly understand why a club would not want a table taken up by 5 deadbeats drinking (free) ice water, but if there are 5 people ordering expensive drinks and one of the individuals asks for a glass of water in addition to his drink...be a sport and give it to him, for Godsakes. One other complaint---the housekeepers tended to enter, or try to enter, the room despite the "privacy" sign and the door being bolted. I don't mean for this to be too negative-----overall, it was a good vacation. I just wish that the appropriate people would see our complaints and act accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Village Seafood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio for the Labor Day weekend and I've got to say that the quality of the rooms have gone downhill since the last time (May 2002) we stayed there. The sofa had numerous stains on them, plus it had a wet feeling on it, the room had a FUNKY smell, which I tried to air it out by opening the fresh air vent on the windows, the bathroom stalls were broken, the mini-refrigirator was not cold at all, but the mini-refrigirator that the hotel had THEIR drinks in were COOOLLLDDD, which means they wanted you to drink their cold drinks and not yours, therefore i took some of their drinks out and store mine in it, until we checked out, and there were no in room coffee inside the rooms. If this is an ALL-SUITE hotel, it should come with all the great amenities of an ALL-SUITE hotel. At the same time, we ate at the seafood buffet and gosh, the quality of food vs. the price is definitely NOT WORTH THE $$$$$ BLING-BLING/CA-CHING-CA-CHONG... It is now costing $34.99 to $27.99 (May 2002)... the lobster tail is a BIG JOKE! I would say the largest HALF TAIL (REMEMBER THIS AND DON'T BE SHOCK) was about 2 1/2 inches to 3 inches long and about 3/4 inch wide. Previously, they were about 5 inches long and 2 1/2 inches wide. The amount of seafood available has gone down the drain also... plus the sashimi.. ARRR.. it was overall a waste of $$$$. The good thing that I did enjoy at the buffet was the oysters... mmm.. but not at $34.99... I'm sorry, this buffet is not worth it. I was bragging about the buffet to my girlfriend, about how good it is... well, she was not impress with it at all.. Overall, I enjoyed the free show, but the hotel and food had to get an overhaul. Hopefully your experience will be a lot better than mine. Good luck! =)

Reviews.Title: “The Rio was Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Trip to Las Vegas. I have been a rewards member for sometime and decided to stay at the Rio instead of Harrahs. We were impressed from the moment we drove up. Valet was quick, and registration was a complete breeze (3-4 minutes top). They even had a limo ride available for us over to the Rum Jungle but we ended up just staying at Rio for the night. I was leary about the rooms since we heard some negative feedback. Wow! We where surprised! We got the bed and room preference we wanted (even though the hotel was completely booked) and the room was awesome! Large and very comfortable. The mountain view is actually beautiful especially at night. So don't be disappointed with the mountain view. It seemed that the crowd during the day was 28-45. At night, the younger crowd came in (20-30) because of the Voodoo lounge, Club Rio, and Bikinis. The slots where hitting and we recovered what we spent for the entire trip. There was no major construction going on (outside, but never bothered us one bit). It was a great and awesome trip!! Thanks Rio!!!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Rio Suites. The cafe there has wonderful food. The Rio is definitely for the younger crowd. The casino is dark and has very loud music. The casino had a large variety of slots none of which were paying. We really had no problems until the last morning - they had shut the water off at midnight and turned it back on at 5:30 but someone forgot to turn the hot back on - when we got up there was no hot water - I waited a while thinking it would come on soon - but check out time was 11. When I called the front desk they would not extend the check out time because they did not know when the hot water would be back on. Yuk - no shower in the morning is not good.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mantaray15
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Rio in January 2003 (little late with this - I know). I was immediately disappointed that the Rio had "overbooked" itself and did not have a room for us for the first night of our stay, but offered us a free room at Harrah's and taxi fare to get there. Okay - at least they were willing to compensate us, but it was Saturday and the day before the Superbowl and we didn't feel like having to wait around all day on Super Bowl Sunday to check in where we had the original reservation. When we did get back to the Rio on Sunday we had to check our bags because of course the room was not ready - big surprise, but I have to say that once we actually got to the room the stay was perfect. The room was wonderful with a great view, very large, exceptionally clean and well appointed. Room service was very good and hotel staff were friendly and helpful at all times. Despite the intitial problems I would have to say that this is a very nice hotel. The only gambling I did was in the sports book which I think is one of the better in Las Vegas. Plenty of good options for food, but I would not recommend the breaksfast buffet - it was horrible. The only real problem, which may not be a problem for some, is that you have to walk quite a distance (dimly lit in some places) to get to the rest of the strip. We did make the trek once and then took a taxi for all other trips. I'm not sure if I would stay at the Rio again solely based on the location...

Reviews.Title: “Tony & Tina's Wedding at the Rio is a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: alwaysalice
Reviews.Content: We were in Las Vegas from 8-8-04 until 8-12-04, we stayed at the Tropicana and it was fantastic. I have wanted to see Tony & Tina's wedding from the time we started planning this trip which was a celebration of our 15th anniversary. $150. is a lot of money for us but it was a special occasion, and I really wanted to see this production, so that's what we spent for the tickets to this show. The cast spent more time entertaining one another than they did the guest, there was one or two tables that received allot of attention, but most of us was basically ignored. When we were seated there was 2 pitchers of water on the table for about 10 people, I which I'd realized that that would be the only beverage offered throughout the entire dinner and show, we never even were asked if we would like more water that was it, 2 pitchers of water for 10 people period! There was nothing funny about the show most of the time you couldn't even tell what if anything was going on. The meal consisted of wilted lettuce salad with some sort of oily dressing, day old dry broken up Italian bread that was not edible it was so hard, Lasagna that I never saw any meat in, meatless spagetti smothered in garlic to the point it was bitter and the sauce that was on the noodles had soaked into the noodles causing a very dry effect like it had been reheated several times, some type of chicken breast that was the only edible thing in the whole meal if you don't mind cold baked chicken. Everything was so dry and garlicy that my husband nearly chocked without anything to drink so he went to the bar to get a beer which they charged him over $4.00 for, I tried to drink the champagne that a very rude server had passed around elbowing me in the back to get my attention, but it was in a dirty glass, so we got up and left. We spent a very much wasted and expensive hour and a half of our trip on this horrible show, if it got better in the last half hour it wouldn't have begun to make up for the first hour and a half, and the wedding cake was most likely no better than the rest of the garbage they served us.

Reviews.Title: “Olé Rí”
Reviews.Author: Sofia
Reviews.Content: We LOVE the Rio. We stayed on the 27th floor of the Masquerade Tower. Our room overlooked the four pools, but we could see so much of the city. We could see downtown, the Stratosphere to the Mirage, the valley and the mountain ranges. The room was absolutely perfect! The furniture was very elegant and comfortable. The large TV set in front of a window provided us with good shows and an awesome view in the background. Everything was very clean. The maid service was great. The room was beyond excellent. I was in the Masquerade in the sky parade. Be warned, they dress you in a velvet cap and cape to cover you up. I had put on a very nice dress and did my hair, etc but they want that all covered up. And, no cameras are allowed in the parade, so give your camara to your spouse or family. The young people working in this parade and in the dances on stage are very vibrant and alive. They love their work, and it shows. The young man working the helium ballon float was especially friendly to all the participants. He chatted and took interest in each person, asking "where are you from?", "where are you staying?", "are you having a good vacation?", etc. The casino was fun. The Total Rewards booth was VERY BAD! First we had a problem trying to cash out our credits. I went to the supervisor, Susie C. with a survey form and my complaint. Maybe I didn't present myself well, but she was horrible. Bottom line, she called me back the next day and let me know there was nothing she could do unless she had a video tape of us at the Total Rewards booth. Her only interest was to reprimand an employee. No customer service approach. From there, we decided to not go near the Total Rewards booth, and that we would use our reward credit later at Harrah's. But, the front desk staff asked us upon departure if we wish to apply the reward credit to our bill, for which we were grateful. Our check in and check out was prompt. The staff at the front desk made us feel welcomed. I enjoyed the beverage servers and their entertainment. We recognized one server who had spoken to us kindly last year. She had said, "come back and stay at the Rio. Every room is a suite." She was so nice last year, that we did return. She was a tall, slender blond who wore a cute long ponytail. Regarding the restaurants, Bamboleo was great! I would recommend that they play Spanish music, like the Gipsy King song they use in their advertisement. The price was good and the food and ambience was great. We had several meals at the Toscano's deli. All were good. We left the Rio and proceded to the Imperial Palace, then the Riviera and then the Paris, Paris. Rio was a perfect beginning to our wedding anniversary vacation. Thank you Rio, you are awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel but please go in with an Open Mind!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Rio for the full week of 7/19/2004. The Rio is a very very nice hotel/casino. It is HUGE and that's a good thing because you have alot of variety. We stayed in the Masequrade Towers on the 29th flr. The view of the strip at night was breathtaking at night. The view during the day is really nice because we were overlooking the 4 pool areas (we were so busy in Vegas we didn't even get a chance to go to the pool - but I will NEXT TIME....hint, hint). The Seafood Buffet is $34.99 + your drink but it is well worth it if you are a seafood lover; the dessert station is incredible, they serve gourmet desserts so you get your money's worth. The parade in the sky at The Rio is very entertaining and interactive. The parades are for the most part on time nightly, so you can't miss it. The shops and vendors are VERY PRICEY but you can find some really nice deals on some of the sale items if you look hard enough. One late/early morning (however you want to look at it), I was starving but didn't want to eat anything heavy, so I stopped by the Tilted Kilt and ordered cheesesticks. Very good but alittle pricey, they were $8.95 for about 8 of them w/dipping sauce. But they were good so I didn't complain. As for gambling, well The Rio table games min. are set at $10. Pretty high for non-gamblers but if you think that's ok...go for it (we personally liked The Gold Coast casino tables, which is located across from The Rio - their tables are a min. $1 on non-peak hours and $5 on peak hours)...the slots really weren't paying off at The Rio but I was winning big at The Gold Coast. So take a trip to The Gold Coast if you feel adventurous. My hubby & I were Vegas Virgins and had a wonderful time while there but there are some things that alot of these reports don't tell VV so here are my tips/observations: 1) casinos in Vegas are a SMOKERS heaven; non-smokers beware!! (I didn't factor this in and it was very irritating to stand next to a smoker in a casino or walking by a smoker or eating because there's no such thing as a non-smoking area in a casino the whole place is open) 2) smaller casinos pay out quicker and faster than the larger casinos (try Gold Coast; Fremont St. - 4 Queens, Golden Nugget; Barbary Coast). Make sure you always get a membership card - it's free and that's how you collect points to get items for free from the casino (i.e. - comp) 3) for the best buffets at a good price for a couple, once again try smaller casinos (for example The Rio all-u-can-eat lunch buffet at World Carnival Cafe was $14.95 pp but at Gold Coast it was only $6.95 pp includes drink too!) 4) Harrah's dinner buffet is roughly $35 for a couple but it is HORRIBLE, don't waste your time 5) Harrah's show "SKINTIGHT" is cheesy at best, you see better performance on Cinemax, not worth $49.95 pp 6) The Monorail System isn't worth the $2 pp because the monorail is not convenient to the strip; you have to walk thru the major casinos to get back to the strip 7) Using the CAT bus system is very convenient but the buses are always crowded; recommend getting a day pass for $4 pp if you think you are going to be out and about on the strip for a full day 8) Everyone must try the Fresh Fruit Tray $12.95 at Peppermill Restrauant (across from Stardust Casino and on the same side as Riveria) = it's HUGE, delicious and very refreshing after traveling on the strip during 113 degree weather 9) Every VV must visit the Fremont St. casinos, it's located in Downtown Vegas away from the strip (take the 301 or 302 Express CAT bus directly to it) - you're winnings will double here than on the strip 10) HAVE FUN and GO WITH AN OPEN MIND, IT'S VEGAS...Everyone's experience is different but if you go to have fun other stuff won't bother you as much.... hope the above help others going to The Rio and Vegas in general....

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I received a coupon via email for 2 FREE nights and was able to book it July 21st and July 22nd after my stay at the Flamingo. The pool is excellent! The area is very spacious and comfortable unlike the Flamingo where the lounge chairs are literally touching each other. I especially enjoyed the hot tubs with waterfalls and the artificial beach. The one negative is that it is so far from the strip. The distance is very deceptive especially in 100+ degree heat. However, they do provide a FREE shuttle to Harrah's every 15 minutes. I won $500 bucks and was able to play for hours. At night, it definitely turns into a nightclub atmosphere with lots of good looking women and vibrant music. A word of warning...they stock the fridge with liquor, soda, bottled water and snacks. If any of these items are removed from its original position, the sensor underneath the item will charge an outrageous amount to your bill. ($2.75 for a snickers bar)

Reviews.Title: “Food Review”
Reviews.Author: Lemon1
Reviews.Content: We went to the Rio one evening, to eat at their buffet. The line was very long so we started looking around for another place to eat. We ended up at the steak place (I don't remember the name, but the big casinos all have at least one steak place). We were casually dressed and when my husband asked if we were dressed ok, the hostess said absolutely and if we would come back in 15 min. she would seat us. We did and she did and the food and the service were fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Had a good time at Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I thought that Rio was going to be a Motel 6 after all the negative reviews that I read. We requested a higher floor room in the Masquerade tower, but were given a 9th floor room in the Ipenima tower instead. We were able to check in at 11:30am. The room was absolutely beautiful. The view was average. Looked out at the Gold Coast & Palms. We really enjoyed the pool area, and the Masquerade in the Sky show was really cool. Some of the people watching the show were trying to kill people to get 1 cent beads, which I thought was a little outrageous. All in all, the staff was friendly, and the hotel is undergoing a renevation that will make it top notch when finishedl. I would probably not stay here again just because of the inconvience of getting to the strip. The lines were long waiting for the free shuttle, and cabs were very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Rio is fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a two week trip to Las Vegas recently (6/30-7/13/04). Two of these days, we stayed for free at the Rio all suites hotel and Casino. We had rec'd a coupon for this prior to our trip, and it was easy to set these days up to fit nicely into our stay. Well, the Rio made our other days pale in comparison! The Flamingo where we stayed for the first week, and the Lady luck for the last few days, can't hold a candle to the Rio, room wise at least. The suite was huge and gorgeous - with many amenities like a fridge, FREE in room safe (note my Flamingo review where our safe cost to use!), huge tv, and two sinks (one inside and one just outside of the large bathroom). There was also a large couch, floor to ceiling windows w/ a nice view, and nice touches like a real bath mat (not just a towel like thing, like in our other places) and shower doors (not a curtain). Another unrelated plus, was the Rio's excellent buffet (there are two, both w/ great reputations, but we only managed to eat at the Carnaval World Buffet). The food was great, the buffet HUGE, and it even had some neat choices on it like wrapped burgers as you would find at McDonalds! (This shouldn't excite me, but it did!) Overall we were very pleased w/ our stay, and proximity to some cool free entertainment (the Rio's masquerade in the sky show, performing drink girls, and the incredible view in their 51st floor bar/lounge). The only problem we experienced was a comping/room charge related one which required a lot of time and energy to resolve.....and then we came home and got charged on our credit card anyway! (When I called to complain though, they readily remedied it). Well, enough glowing news about the Rio (on to a review of the Lady Luck....)

Reviews.Title: “Can't Believe Everything You Read !!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews before we went to the Rio 7/6 - 7/11/2004. Our 4th floor room was nice but it DIDN'T have the floor to ceiling windows and the coffee maker as expected. We requested a room on a higher floor, (twice), prior to arrival but when we arrived were told that our request for a higher floor was only available for a $350.00 UPGRADE due to the fact we booked through a third party, (Expedia). The hotel employees WERE on the most part very friendly and courteous contrary to the reviews we read. The waitresses were GREAT ! The "Parade in The Sky" was always different and entertaining and the "Bevertainers" were too. There was always something going on. It was the liveliest hotel/casino we visited.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Great for Kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very skeptical about the Rio after reading other reviews, but we were most pleasanly surprised. I brought my children who are 1 and 3 and they had a great time. The rooms were clean, quiet and spacious. The staff could not have been more accomodating. I called down to get a crib and it was in the room within a half hour. The kids loved the pool area, epecially the sand beach. The shuttle is great for getting to the strip for free and the taxis were also inexepensive if you wanted to be dropped off a specific location. There is a refrigerator in the room which was great for storing breakfast and lunch food. The show Masquerade in the sky was very entertaining! My daughter would have watched every show if we would have let her. There is even a small arcade to spend and hour or two. I highly recommend the Rio if you are going to Las Vegas with children. We all had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great food”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio June 25 through June29 2004 and had a great time. Room was spacious and clean, everyone was great from the Diamond member check in to the housekeeping staff. No request was too small, they treated us like royalty. Will definately make plans to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the 3rd floor of the Ipanema Tower!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Rio (June 28-July 1). The hotel is undergoing renovations, and I'm sure it will be a wondeful place to stay at some point, but not now! We were assigned a room in the Ipanema Tower at the very end of the 3rd floor. The room was very badly in need of an extreme makeover - very worn and uncomfortable. We heard a loud clanging noise that we assumed was from the construction taking place down below. We weren't overly concerned because we figured it would go away at the end of the work day - WRONG! The clanging continued all through the night and at 4am, I called the front desk demanding to be moved as I had not slept all night. Their computer systems were being upgraded so they informed me that I could not be moved until the morning. At 9am, they reassigned us to the 9th floor of the Ipanema Tower. What a difference! It was like a totally different hotel. The view still sucked, but the room had been updated, and was much nicer looking. I asked the front desk if they had had many complaints about the noise. The clerk said, "Oh yeah - lots!" I asked if they were giving any sort of compensation for the inconvenience, and she sheepishly gave me a voucher for $30 to be used at the hotel. We bought our package through expedia at a really good rate so it makes me wonder if these packages are being assigned bad rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Rio needs renovation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Took my kids to spend 3 nights at the Rio. Stayed in the Ipanema tower. Spacious rooms, but in desparate need of renovation. Will stay again with the kids because they had a great time. Make sure you stay in the newer tower.

Reviews.Title: “Room was ransacked by cleaners.”
Reviews.Author: Disco_Supafly
Reviews.Content: We had reservations for one week at the Rio. On the day of check-in we arrived early but were allowed to go to our room. I noticed that all of the rooms surrounding ours had the doors open and there were about 10 cleaning women doing their thing. We dropped our stuff off in the room and left. Two hours later we returned to our room only to find we had been robbed. My husband was lucky, he only had cologne stolen, but everything I owned was pretty much gone. My make-up, shoes, cell phone, clothes, a Louis Vuitton handbag, even a suitcase (which is probably what they used to hide the loot). We contacted the front desk and they were extremely rude and refused to help us. They said it was because we had not closed the door properly (the doors slam shut behind, so this was a complete lie). The management also refused to give us a copy of the lock report. Since you use electronic key cards, a report is registered every time a key is used to enter your room, as well as when you leave. Since there was no sign of forced entry, it was obviously staff who had robbed us. The Rio never offered to give us a new room and they never even apologized. I hate this place! Don't give these ******* your money!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I think the RIO is a very exciting place to be. The whole place is as Las Vegas as anyone from outside Vegas could imagine. The rooms are huge and Very good view from the 43rd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Get your jogging shoes on!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Rio during Easter vacation. We stayed two nights. Check in was okay because I checked in at the wrong desk, the vip check in. But she let me check in anyways. The prices were discounted because we were there on a Sunday. The rooms were nice and good size and very clean. My husband was dissappionted to find out that internet was only available in the older tower so we had to change rooms. but the rooms were nice there also. Our complaints were the long walks to get around, just to go eat felt like eternity! Not to mention the 15.00 minimums and 10.00 minimums to play most of their table games. We may have saved money going to a nice hotel but you spend it on the food and the casino very quickly. If you are a big spender and like to hike this casino hotel is for you, but if you are average joe financially as well as physically, prepare to put your jogging shoes and your wallet out because you pay one way or another.

Reviews.Title: “Rio Casino Hotel off the Strip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon entering Rio Hotel Lobby it is Very Dark and Dreary along with the smell of Stale Old Smoke. Front Desk is Rude and Condesending. Buffet is very old nothing is fresh for the price they are asking. A very disappointing experience will never ever return there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great view from Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: but this hotel is a VERY LONG block from the strip and not a very pleasant walk because of the construction.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: From the minute we walked in the door, I knew we made a mistake b/c we were also considering Ceasars. For the money we spent to stay at the Rio, we could have had the grandure Vegas is known for. If your coming to Vegas to party and don't care about worn out rooms, dark smoky low-ceiling casinos w/ higher munimums, and a very crowded pool area the Rio is a good place to stay. It was so unappealling, we all canceled our spa treatments b/c it just wasn't that kind of place. My wife and I as well as the friends we went with like elegance you might get at other places on the strip. Don't get me wrong we had a super fun trip, but basically only slept at the Rio. We gambled at Gold Coast and The Palms and ate almost every meal somewhere else. (i.e. Champagne Brunch @ the Rio 23.99, Champagne Brunch @ the Palms 12.99) much cooler as well. We had a great trip, but almost none ofit is because of the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best places to party in vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Rio for the fourth time, so if you want a good review, look no further. I will preface this by stating that I have also stayed at the MGM Grand, and the Mirage, and have been to Vegas about nine times in six years. First off, the Rio is definitely trying to cater to a specific crowd, although all are welcome here, including families with small children. If you are between the ages of 21-40 something, and are traveling with friends or family members, or good company in general, this is the ONLY place to stay in Vegas. The Rio is for peolple who want to party, have fun and let loose. If you are looking to impress your signifigant other, stay at a more upscale resort. Don't get me wrong, I love this place, but the rooms, while very large, are looking a bit worn down as of late, and the pool area can't really stack up against other properties in Vegas like Mirage or Mandalay Bay. Those points aside, this place is a party from check in to check out. With all of the new bars, resturants and clubs in here, it is hands down the easiest place in Vegas to get a drink. The Voo Doo Lounge is one of my favorite places on the planet, and the views at sunset absolutely can not be beat here. There is nothing like being 55 floors high on an outdoor deck, watching the sun go down, then watching Vegas come to life at night. The Voo Doo is truly a heavenly place for those who appreciate such moments. The food in the hotel is very good, so you could spend your whole stay here without leaving the grounds, but there are so many superb places to eat in this city that I would suggest getting the Zagat's Las Vegas book and choosing your dinner plans in that manner. As far as the gambling goes, I will only place sports wagers in this hotel. The slots are tight and the table limits are always high. Take the shuttle bus which runs every fifteen minutes to Harrah's and try your luck there. Also, if you are a serious gambler, you may find the bevertainers and the sky show a bit annoying, but hey this is the Rio, and the PARTY is the most important thing here. I would highly recommend this hotel to those who come to Vegas with good company and the intent on having a blast no matter what your age is. For the very hard to please, and those who expect a luxury resort, stay at the Four Seasons, the Venetian or another high end place.

Reviews.Title: “always returned”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: have stayed at the rio many times, the stays generally are what you make them to be. tried caesars etc., etc. and always returned to the rio.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: Trinity68
Reviews.Content: My family was very excited to stay at the Rio but, was very disappointed with our stay. I choose hotels due to the amenities offered and I wanted to experience the wonderful Ipanema Beach area that I had seen on the travel channel. I emailed the hotel ahead of time to make sure that the pool and Jacuzzi facilities would be open and I was emailed a response that they would be. When we got there we found out that the pool area closed at 4PM during our stay. When we finally got enough time to go to the pool area, we were met at the entrance by several young men stating that the pool area was closed without any additional information. I live in a cold climate and was looking forward to the pool and Jacuzzi and was obviously let down. Besides that, the check in was quick and the room was large, 600 sq ft, but desperately in need of renovation and our supposed view of the mountains was a view of nothing good to see. Luckily we found a great deal to stay at this property and were not out a whole lot of money. The table limits at the Rio were too high for me so I had to go next door to the Gold Coast to gamble. I was expecting 5 star accommodations and service and was very very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Comped in January”
Reviews.Author: trookie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Rio in January with Platinum Level friends and the suites were comped!! Had very nice rooms and the staff were extremely courteous and friendly. Loved the little extra shops and stations for necessities, wine, and coffee. I ran up as many points as possible but still fall way below Platinum level. Have not received any mailings from them and now it is April. I wonder if they only mail to those who actually registered?? If you are going to Vegas be sure and try the Rio. It is a party atmosphere 24 hrs per day!!

Reviews.Title: “Great comps for new Player's Card Holders”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I normally try to travel to Las Vegas once a year. We normally stay downtown for convenience and price. On our last trip (mid Feb 2004), we stayed at an off-strip, not downtown location. On one day we visited the Rio. We had been there before, but I enjoy the "parade-in-the-sky" show. (I have heard that they have fantastic rooms [suites] at the Rio, but it has always seemed too costly to stay there.) We got there too early for the show, so we did a little gambling on the machines. I signed up for their player's club card, and played a little. We couldn't have been there more than 3 hours. I believe I have somewhere around 300 points on my card. I have now gotten offers from the Rio for 2 midweek nights free for each of the months of May, June and July, another offer for two free nights anytime between april and september, another for one (I think Midweek) night and $20 cash if I put 50 more credits on my card. (All of these offers are for any of the Harrah's properties, of which Rio is one) I am amazed at the generosity of the offers for the little I played in their casino. I have already made my reservations, I will be going in May, June and July. It is definately worth signing up for the player's cards at each property you visit, and I usually do. But none has been as generous as the Rio with the rewards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay...not so great to Play!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hey Guys! Just got back from the Rio tonight. I must say it really is a nice hotel. I arrived on a Sunday and it was literally PACKED. We were not able to check in early, but we could check our bags. THis was my first trip to Vegas and the Rio was a treat. The Casino was bright, though the slots were tight. We really had a nice time. You can not hear any of the hustle and bustle when you are in your room. There are plenty of places to eat...but they are a bit on the pricey side. Plus, there really are no other options if you don't have a car. You can catch the free shuttle to Harrah's and go to the Strip, but if you want a quick inexpensive bite to eat you are pretty much out of luck. I can tell you that I ate the Sao Paulo and the Carnival World Buffett. I heard the seafood buffet was great...but didn't make it. Carnival World is wonderful...I couldn't even make it tothe other side of the buffet..they had almost any food that you could desire and the desserts were awesome. WARNING...BE PREPARED (AT EVERY CASINO IT SEEMS) TO BE TREATED LIKE A SECOND CLASS CITIZEN IF YOU ARE NOT A DIAMOND OR PLATINUM LEVEL GAMBLER!!! This means longer lines and longer wait times. All in all I really enjoyed my stay at the Rio, it was bright and airy and the staff was pleasant. Since this was my first time in Vegas and I am not much of a gambler, next time I would prefer to stay on Strip...but the Rio was a wonderful first time hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Love it! Great for return visitors.”
Reviews.Author: HunterMissy
Reviews.Content: The Rio is a class A fabulous hotel - especially for return visitors and/or people driving into town. I recently stayed at the Rio after previously choosing to stay directly on the strip. The Rio's rooms are among the best I've stayed in, the check-in and check-out process was the fastest, and the pool was by far one of the best. If you're coming to Vegas for the first time, don't know your way around, or are going there to be with a group that's staying on the strip - your best bet is to stay on the strip. The Rio has the shuttle to Harrahs - but it can be a long wait and it stops running at 1:00 am. But if you've got your own car or are just going to get away - it's perfect. The drink service is fast - the entertainment in the main casino is upbeat and the selection of games is fabulous. The restaurants are pretty good, too. I'm planning to go back again for a 4-day stay in July and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “rooms great, service stunk”
Reviews.Author: mtkitchn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Rio last year with some friends. I got a $15 room for two nights since I play Harrah's Laughlin a lot. Check in was smooth, and our room was fantastic. Great view, nice suite. However, when we went to the casino bars, nobody seemed interested in helping us at all. No matter where we went in the hotel and casino, the service was poor. The machines were very tight as well. We finally went over to the Gold Coast and the Palms for gambling and meals. The Rio is too far away from the strip if you don't have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Fun-1st Class-Penn & Teller(The Pits)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 Nights for a Convention. They accommodated 3000 of us. We have been to alot of Conventions, Hotels over the 39yrs we have been in business... This was by far the BEST! The rooms are all Suite and Large...Very nice. The meals, Concierge, Employees were excellent... No waiting...Food Great...On time...Everything went like clockwork... I'm sure next year we will be back.Went to See Penn & Teller...Tickets around $70 Don't waste your time or money... I'm not super,super religious, but the word Jesus Christ was used a little too much (around 10-15 times in the first 30min) and at times a little Blastphemus.Was not very funny... more sarcastic... talked too much... more like a monologue! I would have been VERY UPSET if I had paid for the tickets, instead they were paid for by our company.Masquerade Village with the Mardi Gras Floats are nice to watch... Free Shuttle to Harrahs on the StripTaxi's cost around $9.00 each way... to/from strip about 1mile... clocks by time... with traffic, traffic lights and stop signs. We spent $36.00 in one afternoon, the cost of a rental car... Shuttles to and from the airport are $6.00 per person and UpMarket Buffet Great...Restaurant Sau Paulo Great. I Hope this Info is Helpful

Reviews.Title: “rio is great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: rio is great,called them on 2/13/04 hoping to get room(busy valentines weekend)got the room compt based only on my diamond players card,also received the masquerade tower as requested good job rio

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Terrible Valet”
Reviews.Author: mjskre
Reviews.Content: Love the hotel, am a diamond player usually comped for everything. Have stayed at Rio 10+ times this past year. Valet continues to be terrible, when dropping off car, have waited fifteen minutes to leave vehicle. When picking up car, valet could care less when I gave him my slip that I was a diamond club member even though the sign asked to show the card. He appeared to want a tip to extend the diamond courtesy. If the hotel was not as nice as it is I would have been gone a long time ago, FIX THE VALET ISSUE. It appears thet the online survey does no good.

Reviews.Title: “Great room.......and that's it!!”
Reviews.Author: sunfun1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Rio over New Year's - the room we were assigned was fantastic! Very large, nicely decorated, great view. However, once you step out of the room, everything is different. The casino seems dank, and dreary. The air is thick (I know, I know, it's Vegas - but many of the other casino's seem to have a solution for this) There are no coffee makers in the rooms. You have to hoof it to the coffee cart (?) and wait in line for thin, tepid pseudo-coffee (at $2/cup). Ick. The much talked about buffet was completely mediocre - at best. Totally not worth the $20 we paid. Since the Rio is not on the strip we had to either take a taxi or wait for a valet to bring our car. I estimate that we wasted at least 1-2 hours a day (in total) waiting for either our car or a taxi. Totally not the way you want to spend your hard earned vacation time. I would never choose to stay at The Rio again. Had a great first trip to Vegas - am returning at the beginning of May. I will STAY ON THE STRIP!!The only reason I gave a "neutral/average" rating was because the rooms were very nice.

Reviews.Title: “slot players beware!!”
Reviews.Author: jungle
Reviews.Content: Visited the Rio during the week of Jan. 11th to the 16th...was very disappointed...don't ever plan on hitting any jackpots on their slots..In fact, I never saw anyone even close to winning anything.....14.95 is ridiculous for a very average lunch buffet...good shuttle service to Harrahs, every 15 minutes...recommend the short walk to the Gold Coast or The Palms for buffet or slots...Since they are with Harrahs, one has to try and avoid the annoying sales pitches for a time share at both locations...one excellent advantage is that you don't have to continuously pass thru the illegals handing out porn materials as you do on the strip..

Reviews.Title: “The best deal in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were in Vegas for a week, friends were checked into the Gold Coast so we stayed there first and hated it. We moved to Treasure Island liked it but pricey, we then moved to the Rio and loved it. Huge rooms, great staff, awesome buffett. It's a little off the strip but you can take the shuttle or splurge on a limo for $55.

Reviews.Title: “Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Rio is a great place to eat ,party,or sleep. If you go to gamble stay away,they added single deck blackjack, If you thought 6/5 on the strip was bad,try even money on blackjacks for that reason stay away , instead get a car and go to the locals casinos where you get more bang for your buck

Reviews.Title: “I Love Rio!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just returned from 3 days/nights at Rio. This was the 3rd time I'd stayed there...it was his first. I'd never had a bad experience before, so when I read some of the bad reviews here, I thought maybe the place had gone downhill since I was there a couple of years ago. I need not have worried! Check in was a breeze, even at 3:00 in the afternoon. We didn't even have to wait in a line. We asked for a room in the Masquerade Tower on a high floor and got exactly what we asked for. Our room overlooked the pool area, and the view was fantastic. The only thing I don't like about the rooms at Rio is that quirky little window they have in the bathtub/shower that looks into the sleeping area. Being in our 50s (LOW 50s!), it has become necessary for me to leave a bathroom light on in hotel rooms so I can see where I'm going in the middle of the night. But with that stupid window there, you can't do that because the light will shine thru to the sleeping area. Well, my brilliant boyfriend came up with a solution. (Older people take note!) He unscrewed (but didn't take out) all of the lightbulbs around the vanity except for one. Voila! Just enough light to find the bathroom, but not keep you awake all night! (I know, I know...but it's the small pleasures in life, right?) Anyway, we had pretty good luck on the slots and the video poker machines there; didn't care much for the intrusive singing and dancing of the "Bevertainers"; and enjoyed the food at the Sao Paulo Restaurant, The American Grill, and especially at Buzio's! Fabulous food and desserts! We ate at the seafood buffet and found it to be satisfactory. There's plenty to choose from, but let's face it....it's a buffet. Buffets just aren't for everyone. But if you like trying new things, this is the place to do it. The desserts were to die for. Oh, and there are plenty of cocktail waitresses in the casino. At some of the casinos we went to, you could sit all day and not have anyone ask you if you'd like a drink. I love the atmosphere at Rio and I love the Scintas! See them if you can! All in all, I say pppffftttt to the people who didn't like Rio. We'll definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Will absolutely go back to the Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: where to begin? the room was totally awesome, spacious, great decor (retro shiek). HUGE tub. very clean. staff friendly and helpful. very happenin' place! even saw a couple of celebs. slots a little tight, but we ran into that everywhere. food there is to die for! if you love deserts, just about every place there has anything you can imagine! the floor show is beautiful! the dancing and singing on the casino floor we thought would be annoying, but completely wrong. very upbeat and fun! view from our floor to ceiling window was nothing short of breathtaking. same with the view from the VOODOO lounge. go to RIO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Considering I was scared to get to the hotel because of negative reviews, the Rio was more than I expected. I went on all kinds of web-sites before arriving on Aug 11, but now I feel they did not do the hotel justice. I traveled with my boyfriend and his three children (age 12,9,7) for our first real vacation together. Anyone who says that Vegas is not for kids is lying!!!! His kids enjoyed Las Vegas more than San Diego and The Grand Canyon!!!! They really enjoyed the pool and the awsome bartenders with the super-soakers!!!!! If anyone is looking for a vacation to go with kids(besides Disney) consider Vegas, and stay in the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Raving Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at Rio July 2003. I've gambled here several times and slots are always stingy, but I go there for the entertainment. The rooms were much bigger than the average vegas room, and got a great internet deal for $59. The rooms have a mini fridge, which is more than the mega resorts offer, decent bathroom with a peek window in the shower, which we thought was romantic (if needed), wall to wall windows that give you a nice view, ours was facing Tropicana Blvd, so we could see the strip hotels. This was my sisters "40th" birthday and we did massages at the spa, where everyone was very nice, and friendly. We wanted to go to the pool during the evenings since it was over 100 degrees during the day, but it closed at 7pm, guess that's so they can get you to spend your money in the hotel. We didn't have any problems with ajoining rooms, hallways seem quiet, but we usually didn't come in until 2am most mornings, after driving to the strip, having a few drinks and tired anyway. The Valet was quick and friendly, my check out was a breeze but then again I left at 3am... The seafood buffet was pricy, but good. The 24 hr restaurant has good food and reasonable prices, service was OK for the most part. Overall, the Rio is a great place to stay if your an adventurer and don't mind it's location off the strip. I wouldn't consider this a place for the kids, it can get kinda 'riske'. They have a good mardi gras thing going with shows from the sky. If your looking for somewhat inclusive stays stick with Ramada, Residence Inn, Hilton Grand Vacations or some of those places. I've stayed at Luxor, Aladdin, Tropicana, MGM and none offer coffee pots, but then again I've had to realize and research they want you to spend your money in their establishments. So do like myself & invest in a little coffee pot, to give you that jolt in the mornings. Once I've had the opportunity to stay at all the resort hotels in Vegas, I will return to the Rio.

Reviews.Title: “Tell the critics to stay Home”
Reviews.Author: courcyb
Reviews.Content: I've traveled all over the world and stayed at 100's of hotels. I've had a few bad experiences, but it is my fault when I have had a bad stay because I didn't research ahead of time. I've stayed in Vegas numerous times and this last time my wife and I stayed at the Rio and had a great time. We stayed at the Masquerade Tower 32nd floor and had a spectacular view of the strip. We stayed for four nights. There were some minor inconviences, but all were taken care of promptly when asked to do so. We ate at two of the finer-dining restaurants at the Rio, and my wife was very pleased with there service and especially impressed with the little stool they placed next to our table to rest her pocketbook on. We used all the Rio's amenities and had no problems. After going out all day and night in Vegas,it was nice coming HOME to the Rio.My only complaint(even though I know Vegas caters to the weekend crowds) is that I wish more of the clubs had more entertainment during the week nights, as my wife and I are dancers, of rather high quality if I do say so myself. I find it irritating when people complain about the Rio, EVEN when they have comp. rooms. When we are on vacation, we know ahead of time what to expect because WE Plan. Tell the critics to stay home if they want all the comforts of home. Once again thank you very much Rio, we will see you all again soon!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Dinner and a Show...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While in Vegas (July 20) we ventured over to the Rio for dinner and a show. We were staying on the strip so we caught the free shuttle over from Harrah's. However it was slow, hot and crowded so on the way back we took a cab. We went over to see Chippendales. I had a 2 for 1 coupon. Show was good, but I do not think it would have been worth full price. Everyone in the room seem to be enjoying theirselves. Before the show we had dinner at the Voodoo Cafe. It was at the top of the hotel and we got a seat by the window. The view was spectacular. We ordered a cocktail that was made for 2. The name was something like Witch Doctors Brew. It was in a huge glass that came to the table smoking (from dry ice.) We got a lot of comments from others in the restaurant and 2 other couples ended up ordering the drink. It was served in a HUGE glass with straws that were about 3 feet long. It was fun to drink and one of those must do things in vegas. As for the drink itself, it was very good and strong. It cost about $20 but it was enough of a drink for 2 and we never needed to order another cocktail. For dinner I got the special of the evening which was a salmon filet, with crab salad topping and fingerling potatoes. I am from the east coast and eat seafood all the time. I did not have high hopes for seafood in the middle of the desert, but I was surprised. It was fresh, tasty and expertly prepared. My husband had a crab and scallop plate. He also thought it was good and well prepared. The service was exceptional. We had a team of 2 waiters who took very good care of us. They were very attentive, but not intrusive. We were seated at a candlelit table overlooking the city. It was really a romantic setting and we both really enjoyed it. It wasn't cheap, but we really do not mind paying for good food and service. The bill came to $126.33 with the tip. Now don't forget this included a $20 cocktail and $12 worth of water. I was really dehydrated and we ordered 2 bottle of spring water. You had the option of tap water for no charge, but I am a water snob and really needed a good glass of water. So if you subtract water, cocktail and tip the charge was only $53 for dinner and dessert. Which was well worth it. You should give the place a try. It was a real surprise and delight for us.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Time at The Rio”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Masquerade tower,on the 21st fl.facing the pools,Simply Beautiful Views,of the best Vegas has to offer,the room was splendid,clean,large.The hotel staff,of the finest found,resilient,witty,and extremely friendly.The pool area,shade was in short supply,we brought our own umbrellas,attached them to the lounge chairs & spent many hours poolside,the pools,all very clean,and I rate them better than all the rest in vegas,except:Mandalay bay,which is a beach w /waves.The seafood buffet the finest this side of the "Moon"!!! Very loose slots in the morning,very tight in the night,Xlnt "Carnival"daily,The Tilted Kilt-an Xlnt Pub for Black&Tans and "Killer Pretzels,Live Music nightly,xlnt coffee/donuts in the Morning,We Love Rio Hotel/Casino,off the strip,away from hustle n' bustle,Outback Steakhouse across the street w/xlnt cuisine & professional staff,We will return again to the RioHotel,Highly Recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place if 'location optional'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This might be the best value off the strip. With all the regular rooms being suite sized, it was a very roomy and comfortable place to stay. Service was very good even though the casino floor wasnt as big as some of the mega hotels. There really isnt anything bad you can say about the Rio if you judge it as a stand alone property...a nice vegas hotel. The one thing you CAN say about it is, if you know how the vegas strip is as far as activity this place sucks. With the Palm as a comparison, at least it has two major clubs and great resturants to help soften its location whoas. The Rio is about a mile of very busy traffic away from the strip, and thus if have plans to go somewhere on the strip, especially at night, you had better plan ahead to get there. You will also be bored with the Rio's own in-hotel entertainment within a couple of days. All in all, it is a very good value for what you are given, just understand if you want to move around you will have to handle that with planning

HotelInfo.Name: Rio All-Suite Hotel & Casino
HotelInfo.Address: 3700 West Flamingo Rd., Las Vegas, NV 89103
